content_units.text: The men and women of the nationalist generation who had sought the political unity of the Arab people must have cast weary eyes at one another when they heard their acknowledged leader call a truce with those they considered to be anti-unionists; they must have dropped their heads and thrown their hands in the air when he announced the onset of a new era where solidarity among Arab states would replace the quest for a comprehensive political unity. Had Gamal Abd al-Nasir, the President of Egypt and the hero of Arab nationalism, reneged on the principles of the Arab nationalist creed when in 1963 he declared that it was Arab solidarity which constituted the .rm basis upon which Arab na­tionalism could be built,1 and that Arab solidarity would make the Arab states stronger through their cooperation in the eco­nomic, military and cultural .elds, and in the sphere of foreign policy?2 The nationalist generation must have hoped and prayed that Nasir would reconsider, come to his senses, and retread the path of revolutionary Arab nationalism with its unequivocal com­mitment to organic Arab unity.
content_units.azure_translation: 寻求阿拉伯人民政治团结的民族主义一代的男男女女，当他们听到他们公认的领导人呼吁与他们认为是反工会主义者的人休战时，一定互相投来疲惫的目光;当他宣布一个新时代的开始时，他们一定低下了头，双手举向空中，在这个时代，阿拉伯国家之间的团结将取代对全面政治团结的追求。如果埃及总统、阿拉伯民族主义英雄贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔在1963年宣布阿拉伯民族主义信条的原则背弃了阿拉伯民族主义信条的原则，1 阿拉伯的团结构成了阿拉伯民族主义的.rm基础，阿拉伯的团结将通过阿拉伯国家在经济方面的合作而变得更加强大， 军事和文化领域，以及外交政策领域？2 民族主义一代一定希望并祈祷纳西尔能够重新考虑，清醒过来，重走革命性阿拉伯民族主义的道路，明确致力于阿拉伯有机团结。

But their heros intent was different, more complex, and more subtle. Nasir, after all, was both an ideologue and a politician. To him the path to Arab unity was fraught with both opportunities and constraints, and an organic unity of all the Arabs in one uni­.ed state would be the ultimate aim of a long and dialectical pro­cess consisting of several stages.3 Arab solidarity constituted one of these stages; it was a step toward unity.4 Solidarity was a pragmatic course of action when political constraints made im­practical the aggressive pursuit of comprehensive Arab unity. But even when bending to political realities, the Egyptian president would reiterate the belief, shared by all Arab nationalists, that without the goal (or at a minimum, the aspiration) of Arab political unity, Arab nationalism would be a creed without a purpose, in­deed without a meaning.5
content_units.azure_translation: 但他们的英雄意图不同，更复杂，更微妙。毕竟，纳西尔既是理论家又是政治家。对他来说，通往阿拉伯统一的道路既充满了机遇，也充满了限制，所有阿拉伯人在一个统一国家中的有机统一将是一个由几个阶段组成的漫长而辩证的过程的最终目标。3 阿拉伯的团结是这些阶段之一;这是迈向团结的一步。4 当政治限制使积极追求阿拉伯全面团结变得不切实际时，团结是一种务实的行动方针。但即使屈服于政治现实，埃及总统也会重申所有阿拉伯民族主义者的共同信念，即如果没有阿拉伯政治团结的目标（或至少是愿望），阿拉伯民族主义将是一种没有目的的信条，实际上没有意义。

content_units.text: To this, Satial-Husri, who, as we shall see later, was the fore­most theoretician of Arab nationalism, would say, Amen. Throughout his numerous writings on Arab nationalism, Husri never lost sight of the ultimate goal of the ideology he so vigorously propagated, namely the political unity of the Arabic-speaking peo­ple. People who spoke a unitary language, Husri maintained, have one heart and a common soul. As such, they constitute one nation, and so they have to have a uni.ed state.6 In another in­stance, he wrote that the happiest of nations were the ones in which political and national boundaries were fused into one another.7
content_units.azure_translation: 对此，正如我们稍后将看到的，萨蒂亚尔-胡斯里是阿拉伯民族主义最重要的理论家，他会说，阿门。在他关于阿拉伯民族主义的众多著作中，胡斯里从未忘记他如此大力宣传的意识形态的最终目标，即阿拉伯语人民的政治团结。胡斯里坚持认为，说统一语言的人有着一颗心和共同的灵魂。因此，他们构成了一个国家，因此他们必须有一个统一的国家。6 在另一个例子中，他写道，最幸福的国家是那些政治和国家边界相互融合的国家。

Husri considered the Arab states to be arti.cial creations of the imperialist powers. Driven by their imperial interests, these powers proceeded to carve up what essentially was a natural cultural entity with an inalienable right to political sovereignty. An intended con­sequence of this per.dious parceling of the Arab nation was to keep the Arabs politically ineffectual and militarily feeble. In one of his writings, Husri says that he is constantly asked how was it that the Arabs lost the 19481949 war over Palestine when they were seven states and Israel was only one? His answer is unequivo­cal: The Arabs lost the war precisely because they were seven states.8 The conclusion is unambiguous: To avoid losing future wars, the Arabs had to unite into one Arab state.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里认为阿拉伯国家是帝国主义列强的人工创造物。在帝国利益的驱使下，这些列强开始瓜分本质上是一个自然的文化实体，拥有不可剥夺的政治主权权。这种对阿拉伯民族的这种自暴自弃的瓜分的预期后果是使阿拉伯人在政治上无效，在军事上软弱无力。胡斯里在他的一篇著作中说，他经常被问到，当阿拉伯人只有七个国家而以色列只有一个国家时，他们是如何输掉19481949巴勒斯坦战争的？他的回答是明确的：阿拉伯人输掉了这场战争，正是因为他们是七个国家。8 结论是明确的：为了避免输掉未来的战争，阿拉伯人必须联合成一个阿拉伯国家。

content_units.text: The founders of the Bath Party, the prominent Arab nationalist organization, felt the same about the connection between national­ism and organic political unity. The opening article of the party constitution promulgated in 1947 unequivocally declares: The Arabs form one nation. This nation has the natural right to live in a single state. [As such] the Arab Fatherland constitutes an indivisi­ble political and economic unity. No Arab country can live apart from the others.9 The partys founder and philosopher, Michel A.aq, in his most important canonical document, posited the par­tys Arab nationalist creed as a mission to resurrect the Arab peo­ple, to revive their intrinsic humanity and creativity, which lay dor­mant because of the political divisions in the Arab world. And how was this to be accomplished? A.aqs remedy was clear: by uniting these arti.cial and counterfeit countries and statelets into one Arab nation-state. Only then could the Arabs return to their true selves their upstanding spirit, clear ideas and upright morality,
content_units.azure_translation: 著名的阿拉伯民族主义组织巴斯党的创始人对民族主义与有机政治团结之间的联系也有同样的看法。1947年颁布的党章开篇明确宣称：阿拉伯人组成一个国家。这个国家拥有生活在单一国家的自然权利。[因此]阿拉伯祖国构成了一个不可分割的政治和经济统一体。没有一个阿拉伯国家可以与其他国家分开生活。9 该党的创始人和哲学家米歇尔·A.aq 在其最重要的规范文件中将该党的阿拉伯民族主义信条视为复兴阿拉伯人民的使命，复兴他们内在的人性和创造力，而这些人性和创造力因阿拉伯世界的政治分裂而处于休眠状态。这是如何实现的？A.aqs 的补救措施很明确：将这些伪造和假冒的国家和国家联合成一个阿拉伯民族国家。只有这样，阿拉伯人才能恢复他们正直的精神、清晰的思想和正直的道德。

content_units.text: once told Iraqi historian, Majid Khadduri, that public attention should focus on the prob­lem of unity: it is the national duty of every Arab to support the leader who is capable of achieving Arab unity. Majid Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World:The Role of Ideas and Ideals in Politics (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins Press, 1970), p. 201. and only then would their minds be able to create.10 To A.aq, therefore, Arab unity is not only an intrinsic element of Arab na­tionalism; it is also a necessary precondition for the revival of the Arab spirit and Arab intellect.
content_units.azure_translation: 曾对伊拉克历史学家马吉德·哈杜里（Majid Khadduri）说，公众的注意力应该集中在团结问题上：支持有能力实现阿拉伯团结的领导人是每个阿拉伯人的国家责任。Majid Khadduri，《阿拉伯世界的政治趋势：思想和理想在政治中的作用》（巴尔的摩：约翰·霍普金斯出版社，1970 年），第 201 页。只有这样，他们的思想才能创造。10 因此，A.aq 认为，阿拉伯统一不仅是阿拉伯民族主义的内在要素，而且是阿拉伯民族主义的内在要素。它也是复兴阿拉伯精神和阿拉伯智慧的必要前提。

An English translation of the Bath Party Constitution can be found in Sylvia Haim, ed., Arab Nationalism:An Anthology (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1962), pp. 233241. This particular quote is on p. 233.

As the membership of the party grew in the years to follow, and as its ideas spread throughout the Arab world, members would squabble over the meaning and role of such fundamental Bathist principles as freedom, socialism, and religion. Yet not until the eclipse of the Arab nationalist idea itself was there ever any ques­tioning of unity as an absolutely essential component of the par­tys Arab nationalist doctrine.11 Thus, whether Arab nationalism was expressed through Nasirist or Bathist discourse,12 or through the writings of Satial-Husri, it was inexorably linked to Arab po­litical unity. In short, to the thinkers and activists who made up the nationalist generation, Arab nationalism would be a hollow and meaningless concept if it did not strive to gather its children under one roof in one uni.ed and sovereign Arab state. And it is this de.nition of Arab nationalism, with its necessary goal of Arab po­litical unity, that will be used in this study.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着该党在随后几年中成员人数的增加，以及其思想在整个阿拉伯世界的传播，成员们将就自由、社会主义和宗教等巴斯主义基本原则的意义和作用争论不休。然而，直到阿拉伯民族主义思想本身黯然失色，人们才对团结作为各党派阿拉伯民族主义学说的绝对重要组成部分提出质疑。11 因此，无论阿拉伯民族主义是通过纳西尔主义或巴斯主义的话语表达的，12 还是通过萨蒂亚尔-胡斯里的著作表达的，它都与阿拉伯政治统一密不可分。简而言之，对于构成民族主义一代的思想家和活动家来说，如果阿拉伯民族主义不努力将其子孙聚集在一个统一和主权的阿拉伯国家的屋檐下，那么它将是一个空洞且毫无意义的概念。本研究将使用阿拉伯民族主义的这种定义，以及阿拉伯政治团结的必要目标。

content_units.text: But why this detailed and deliberate emphasis on the seemingly abiding link between Arab nationalism and Arab political unity? Can this link be anything other than self-evident? Well, not neces­sarily. In fact, an ongoing debate among specialists on Arab and Middle Eastern politics over the nature of nationalism has centered on whether achieving or desiring statehood was by necessity a core element of nationalism. Hence, the argument has predicated on whether the concept of nationalism is one of culture or one of poli­ tics. A spirited and instructive dialogue on the subject occurred on the pages of the International Journal of Middle East Studies.In their book, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, 19301945,13 Israel Gershoni and James Jankowski argue that the Egyptians senti­ments of af.liation and loyalty which had centered on Egypt alone were gradually shifted in the 1930s and 1940s to Arab and Islamic referents,14 a claim that was vigorously contested by Charles D. Smith.15 The relevant debate for our purposes was a difference in the interpretation of one of the central theses of Benedict Ander­sons in.uential book, Imagined Communities:Re.ections on the Origins and Spread of nationalism.16 Anderson de.nes the nation as an imagined community:
content_units.azure_translation: 但为什么如此详细而刻意地强调阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯政治团结之间看似持久的联系呢？这种联系除了不言而易见之外还能有什么吗？嗯，不一定。事实上，阿拉伯和中东政治专家之间关于民族主义本质的持续辩论一直集中在实现或渴望建国是否必然是民族主义的核心要素。因此，该论点的前提是民族主义的概念是文化概念还是政治概念。在《国际中 Studies.In 东杂志》的书《Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation， 19301945》中，13 就这一主题进行了激烈而富有启发性的对话，13 Israel Gershoni 和 James Jankowski 认为，埃及人的亲和和忠诚情绪仅以埃及为中心，在 1930 年代和 1940 年代逐渐转移到阿拉伯和伊斯兰的指称上，14 查尔斯·史密斯 （Charles D. Smith） 对这一主张提出了强烈的质疑。15 就我们的目的而言，相关的辩论是对本尼迪克特·安德森 （Benedict Anderson） 的著作《想象的社区：民族主义的起源和传播的解释》的中心论点之一的解释不同。16 安德森将国家视为一个想象的社区：

There were, of course, other Arab nationalist groups and organizations, most notably, Harakat al-Qawmiyeen al-Arab (the Arab nationalists movement), but none was as conse­quential or as resilient as Nasirism or Bathism, and in any case, all shared in the belief that Arab unity could not be intellectually separated from Arab nationalism. See, for exam­ple, Abdallah Saloom al-Samarai, Harakat al-Qawmiyeen al-Arab wa Dawruha . al­Wai al-Qawmi (The Arab Nationalists Movement and its role in the national conscious­ness), al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi (Beirut), no. 84 (February 1986): 7599.

It is imagined because the members of even the smallest nation will never know most of their fellow members, meet them, or even hear of them, yet in the minds of each lives the image of their commu­nion.... [It] is imagined as a community, because regardless of the actual inequality and exploitation that may prevail in each, the na­tion is always conceived as a deep, horizontal comradeship.17
content_units.azure_translation: 这是想象的，因为即使是最小的国家的成员也永远不会认识他们的大多数成员，见到他们，甚至听说过他们，但在每个人的脑海中，他们共融的形象却活着......[它]被想象成一个社区，因为无论每个社区可能普遍存在的实际不平等和剥削，国家总是被认为是一种深厚的、横向的同志情谊。

content_units.text: Using this de.nition and relying on another assertion by Anderson that nationness and nationalism are cultural artifacts of a par­ticular kind,18 Gershoni and Jankowski conceive of the nation as a cultural construct, existing without the necessary addendum of the state. Indeed, to them, Andersons great insight and chief con­tribution to the study of nationalism is precisely his emphasis on its cultural-semiotic nature, its imagined character.19 Smith, on the other hand, insists that Anderson posited his imagined com­munities as linked to political boundaries. After all, he argues, Anderson does specify that the imagined community (the nation) inhabits territorial and social space, and that it is inherently limited and sovereign. It is limited, Anderson explains, because it has .nite if elastic boundaries beyond which lie other nations, and it is sovereign because the gage and emblem of [a free nation] is the sovereign state.20 Smith concludes that Anderson cannot be more adamant in postulating a statal referent to nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 使用这种定义并依赖于安德森的另一种断言，即民族性和民族主义是某种特定类型的文化产物，18 格尔肖尼和扬科夫斯基将民族视为一种文化建构，在没有国家必要的附录的情况下存在。事实上，对他们来说，安德森对民族主义研究的深刻洞察力和主要贡献恰恰是他对民族主义文化符号学性质及其想象特征的强调。19 另一方面，史密斯坚持认为安德森认为他想象的社区与政治边界有关。毕竟，他认为，安德森确实明确指出，想象中的社区（国家）居住在领土和社会空间中，并且它本质上是有限的和主权的。安德森解释说，它是有限的，因为它有弹性边界，其他国家越过这个边界，它是主权的，因为[一个自由国家]的等级和标志是主权国家。20 史密斯的结论是，安德森在假设民族主义的统计参考对象方面再坚定不过了。

Gershoni and Jankowski are undoubtedly right in arguing that historically the absence of a state has not been a barrier to national­ist imaginings. They point to the many groups, Palestinians, Basques, Kurds, etc., that have existed and continue to exist that claim to be a nation even though they lack a state, and they further argue that to insist on positing the state as the essential criterion for nationalism would deny these groups their claims for nation­hood.21 The crucial point here, however, is that while lacking a state, all these groups are in fact adamantly and vociferously desir­ous of a state.22 And it is perhaps in this context, in the need for a sovereign state whether it exists or not, that Andersons imagined community could best be understood.
content_units.azure_translation: 格尔肖尼和扬科夫斯基无疑是正确的，他们认为从历史上看，国家的缺席并不是民族主义想象的障碍。他们指出，许多已经存在并将继续存在的群体，巴勒斯坦人、巴斯克人、库尔德人等，尽管他们没有国家，但他们声称自己是一个民族，他们进一步认为，坚持将国家作为民族主义的基本标准，将否认这些群体的民族地位。21 这里的关键点， 然而，虽然没有国家，但所有这些群体实际上都坚定而强烈地渴望一个国家。22 也许正是在这种背景下，在需要一个主权国家的情况下，无论它是否存在，安德森想象的共同体才能得到最好的理解。

content_units.text: These criteria are evident in the way Bernard Lewis, the notable historian of the Middle East, de.nes the nation. To Lewis, a nation denotes a group of people held together by a common language, belief in a common descent and in a shared history and destiny. They usually but do not necessarily inhabit a contiguous territory; they often enjoy, and if they do not enjoy they commonly seek, sovereign independence in their own name.23 Lewis acknowledges the importance of the cultural elements, but goes beyond cultural proximity by incorporating the notion of sovereign indepen­dence into the de.nition.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些标准在中东著名历史学家伯纳德·刘易斯（Bernard Lewis）对这个国家的评价中显而易见。对刘易斯来说，一个国家意味着一群人通过共同的语言、对共同血统的信仰以及共同的历史和命运而团结在一起。它们通常但不一定居住在连续的领土上;他们经常以自己的名义享受主权独立，如果他们不享受，他们也经常寻求主权独立。23 刘易斯承认文化元素的重要性，但超越了文化接近性，将主权独立的概念纳入了该概念中。

It is in this sense, in the explicit distinction between the cultural and the political that an ethnic group could most pro.tably be dis­tinguished from a nation. Adrian Hastings identi.es the crucial ele­ments that transform a culturally bonded ethnic group into a na­tion as its claim to political identity and autonomy, together with the control of speci.c territory24 [italics added]. In this de.nition Hastings echoes the emphasis on a nations desire for political sepa­rateness voiced a century earlier by John Stuart Mill: Where the sentiment of a nationality exists in any force, there is a prima facie case for uniting all members of the nationality under the same gov­ernment, and a government to themselves apart.25 He then tell­ingly adds that the the strongest of all identity is that of political antecedents.26 Max Weber concurs: If one believes that it is at all expedient to distinguish national sentiment as something homo­geneous and speci.cally set apart, one can do so only by referring to a tendency toward an autonomous state. [Hence] a nation is a community of sentiment which would adequately manifest itself in a state of its own.27 In other words, what distinguishes a nation from an ethnic group or any other collectivity has to be the nations self-derived desire to achieve political sovereignty within a recog­ nized territory. Lacking such a desire, a group can be a number of things but not a nation. That is precisely why Canada is, and the old Yugoslavia was, a multinational society, since signi.cant ethnic groups within these two countries agitated for political indepen­dence, hence constituting nations. The United States, on the other hand, with its profusion of culturally based ethnicities, is not a multinational society, but rather a multiethnic society, since none of its ethnic groups desires political separation and sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是从这个意义上说，在文化和政治之间的明确区别中，一个民族群体最能与一个民族区分开来。阿德里安·黑斯廷斯 （Adrian Hastings） identi.es 将一个文化纽带的民族群体转变为一个国家的关键要素，作为其对政治身份和自治的主张，以及对特定领土的控制24 [斜体添加]。在这段论述中，黑斯廷斯呼应了约翰·斯图尔特·密尔（John Stuart Mill）在一个世纪前所表达的对国家政治分离愿望的强调：如果一个民族的情绪存在于任何力量中，就有表面证据将该民族的所有成员团结在同一个政府之下，而一个独立的政府。25 然后，他很有说服力地补充说，所有身份中最强烈的是政治先例。26 马克斯·韦伯（Max Weber）也同意：如果一个人认为将民族情感区分为同质的和特殊区分的东西是权宜之计，那么只有通过提及一种趋向自治国家的倾向来做到这一点。[因此]一个民族是一个情感共同体，它会在自己的状态中充分表现出来。27 换句话说，一个民族与一个民族群体或任何其他集体的区别必须是民族在公认的领土内实现政治主权的自我愿望。缺乏这样的愿望，一个群体可以是多种东西，但不能是一个国家。这正是为什么加拿大和旧南斯拉夫是一个多民族社会，因为这两个国家内的少数民族都鼓动政治独立，从而组成了国家。另一方面，美国拥有丰富的文化种族，不是一个多民族社会，而是一个多民族社会，因为它没有一个族裔群体渴望政治分离和主权。

content_units.text: Bernard Lewis, The Multiple Identities of the Middle East (New York: Schocken Books, 1998), p. 81.
Adrian Hastings, The Construction of Nationhood:Ethnicity, Religion, and National­ism. (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1997), p. 3.

Alan Ryan, J. S. Mill (London: Routledge and Kegan Paul, 1974), p. 214; see also Lynn Williams, National Identity and the Nation State: Construction, Reconstruction and Contradiction, in National Identity, ed. Keith Cameron. (Exeter, England: Intellect, 1999), p. 7.

John Stuart Mill, Considerations on Representative Government, in The National­ism Reader. eds. Omar Dahbour and Micheline R. Ishay. (Atlantic Heights, New Jersey: Humanities Press, 1995), p. 98. Quoted also in Ilya Prizel, National Identity and Foreign Policy:Nationalism and Leadership in Poland, Russia, and Ukraine (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1998), p. 12.
H. H. Gerth and C. Wright Mills, eds., From Max Weber:Essays in Sociology (London: Routledge and Kegan Paul, 1948), p. 179.

It is the recognition of the political element, centered on the ulti­mate goal of Arab political unity and the desire for a unitary Arab state, that anchors the de.nition of Arab nationalism to be used in this study. This would also help us avoid the conceptual overlap, at times harboring on confusion, in the use of the term Arab nation­alism. As a concept, Arab nationalism has tended to be used in the literature of Middle Eastern politics and history interchange­ably with other terms such as Arabism, Pan-Arabism, and even sometimes Arab radicalism, thus blending the sentiment of cultural proximity with the desire for political action. To say one is an Arab should denote a different connotation from saying one is an Arab nationalist. The former concedes ones cultural heritage, expressed best in the term Arabism,  whereas the latter, as we have seen, imbues this cultural oneness with the added ingredient of political recognition.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是对以阿拉伯政治统一的最终目标和对单一阿拉伯国家的渴望为中心的政治因素的认识，奠定了本研究中使用的阿拉伯民族主义的定义。这也将有助于我们避免在使用阿拉伯民族主义一词时出现概念重叠，有时甚至会造成混淆。作为一个概念，阿拉伯民族主义倾向于在中东政治和历史文学中与阿拉伯主义、泛阿拉伯主义，有时甚至阿拉伯激进主义等其他术语互换使用，从而将文化接近的情绪与政治行动的愿望融为一体。说一个人是阿拉伯人应该表示与说一个人是阿拉伯民族主义者不同的含义。前者承认自己的文化遗产，用阿拉伯主义一词表达得最好，而后者，正如我们所见，为这种文化一体性注入了政治承认的附加成分。

content_units.text: If this seems a reasonable distinction, it certainly has not been re.ected in the literature. The present author himself, in a book published in 1976, follows the practice of other analysts of the Middle East by ascribing to Arabism properties best af.xed to Arab nationalism then declaring the two terms interchange­able.28 Shibley Telhami concludes an excellent study, subtitled The New Arabism, by trying to differentiate this new phenomenon from Nasirs Arabism of the 1950s and 1960s.29 Telhami tells us that this new Arabism, which emerged toward the latter part of the twentieth century, was centered on intellectual elites and driven by a small sector of the media that was relatively free of govern­mental control. It facilitated expressions of political concern that were Arabist, in the sense that they transcended state bound­aries, and were independent of state governments. This was espe­cially true in the effort to maintain a political focus on the issue of Palestine and Arab relations with Israel.30 Illuminating as Telhamis analysis undoubtedly is, nevertheless, to af.x the same term, that of Arabism, to the Nasir-led movement of the 1950s and 1960s is to so stretch the term as to attenuate its de.nitional clarity. Nasir, after all, led an army of vocal and activist Arab nationalists throughout the length and breadth of the Arab world who believed fervently that the overriding purpose of their political struggle was to return the Arab people to their natural condition, united into one sovereign Arab state. One wonders how many of the new Arabists would take seriously even the remote possibility of such an outcome?
content_units.azure_translation: 如果这似乎是一个合理的区别，那么它肯定没有在文献中得到描述。本文作者本人在 1976 年出版的一本书中，效仿了其他中东分析家的做法，将阿拉伯主义的属性与阿拉伯民族主义最相吻合，然后宣布这两个术语可以互换。28 Shibley Telhami 总结了一项出色的研究，副标题为“新阿拉伯主义”，试图将这种新现象与 1950 年代和 1960 年代的纳西尔阿拉伯主义区分开来。29 泰尔哈米告诉我们，这种新阿拉伯主义出现在 20 世纪后半叶，以知识精英为中心，并由相对不受政府控制的一小部分媒体推动。它促进了阿拉伯主义的政治关切表达，从某种意义上说，它们超越了国家边界，并且独立于国家政府。30 然而，正如特尔哈米斯的分析所揭示的那样，将阿拉伯主义的同一术语与 1950 年代和 1960 年代纳西尔领导的运动联系起来，却是将该术语拉长到削弱其定义的清晰度。毕竟，纳西尔领导了一支由直言不讳的积极分子阿拉伯民族主义者组成的军队，他们遍布阿拉伯世界，他们热切地相信，他们政治斗争的首要目的是让阿拉伯人民恢复到他们的自然状态，统一成一个主权的阿拉伯国家。人们想知道，有多少新阿拉伯主义者会认真对待这种结果的微小可能性？

content_units.text: A. I. Dawisha, Egypt in the Arab World:The Elements of Foreign Policy (London: Macmillan, 1976), p. 129.

Shibley Telhami, Power, Legitimacy, and Peace-Making in Arab Countries: The New Arabism, in Ethnic Con.icts and International Politics in the Middle East, ed. Leonard Binder. (Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 1999), p. 56.

R. Stephen Humphreys, in an erudite and meticulous study of Middle Eastern history,31 treads a similar path of conceptual tres­passing. In a chapter entitled The Strange Career of Pan-Arab­ism, he traces, in an admirably concise analysis, the growth and the decline of the Arab nationalist movement. Here again though, Humphreys sees little need for a conceptual distinction among the terms Arab nationalism, Arabism, and Pan-Arabism, and as such uses the three terms interchangeably.32 In one section, he concludes an analysis of the withering fortunes of the Arab nation­alist movement in the last three decades of the twentieth century by asking the question: Where is Pan-Arabism or Arab National­ism in any form?33 Similarly, in a study of the changes that oc­curred in the Arab world during the 1970s, the dean of Egyptian
content_units.azure_translation: R. 斯蒂芬·汉弗莱斯 （R. Stephen Humphreys） 在对中东历史的博学而细致的研究中，31 走上了类似的概念性侵入之路。在题为“泛阿拉伯主义的奇怪生涯”的一章中，他以令人钦佩的简洁分析追溯了阿拉伯民族主义运动的成长和衰落。不过，汉弗莱斯再次认为阿拉伯民族主义、阿拉伯主义和泛阿拉伯主义这两个术语在概念上没有必要进行区分，因此可以互换使用这三个术语。32 在一节中，他通过提出以下问题来结束对阿拉伯民族主义运动在 20 世纪最后三十年凋零的命运的分析： 任何形式的泛阿拉伯主义或阿拉伯民族主义在哪里？33 同样，在对 1970 年代阿拉伯世界发生的变化的研究中，埃及学院院长

content_units.text: Ibid., pp. 5657. 31 R. Stephen Humphreys, Between Memory and Desire:The Middle East in a Troubled

Age (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1999). political science, Ali Hillal Dessouki, employed pan-Arabism and Arabism essentially to describe sentiments of political alle­giance that transcended the Arab state to a larger human and so­cial body.34 Dessouki did not endeavor to conceptually separate one term from the other, because, one presumes, they meant more or less the same thing to him.
content_units.azure_translation: 年龄（伯克利：加州大学出版社，1999 年）。政治学阿里·希拉尔·德苏基 （Ali Hillal Dessouki） 使用泛阿拉伯主义和阿拉伯主义本质上描述超越阿拉伯国家到更大的人类和社会机构的政治忠诚情绪。34 德苏基并没有试图在概念上将一个术语与另一个术语分开，因为人们认为，它们对他来说或多或少意味着同样的东西。

Ibid., pp. 6364.

In all this de.nitional overlap, there indeed was unanimity over the meaning of pan-Arabism, which was generally understood to be the drive, or at a minimum the desire, for Arab political unity. Here is how the distinguished scholar, Walid Khalidi, expounded on the doctrine of pan-Arabism in the late 1970s:
content_units.azure_translation: 在所有这些不同的重叠中，确实对泛阿拉伯主义的含义存在一致意见，泛阿拉伯主义通常被理解为阿拉伯政治统一的动力，或者至少是愿望。以下是杰出学者瓦利德·哈利迪 （Walid Khalidi） 对 1970 年代后期泛阿拉伯主义学说的阐述：

content_units.text: The Arab states system is .rst and foremost a Pan system. It postulates the existence of a single Arab Nation behind the facade of a multiplicity of sovereign states.... From this perspective, the individual Arab states are deviant and transient entities: their fron­tiers illusory and permeable; their rulers interim caretakers, or ob­stacles to be removed.... Before such super-legitimacy, the legiti­macy of the individual state shrinks into irrelevance.35
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯国家体系首先是泛体系。它假设在众多主权国家的外表背后存在一个单一的阿拉伯国家......从这个角度来看，各个阿拉伯国家是离经叛道的、短暂的实体：它们的边界是虚幻的、渗透的;他们的统治者、临时看守者，或要消除的障碍......在这种超级合法性之前，个别国家的合法性缩小到无关紧要的地步35。

content_units.text: Of interest, in a later issue of the same journal, another distin­guished scholar and commentator, Fouad Ajami, took issue with Khalidis depiction of the potency of pan-Arabism. Ajami argued that pan-Arabism which had dominated the political conscious­ness of modern Arabs [was by the end of the 1970s] nearing its end, if it [was] not already a thing of the past. Ajami agreed that in an earlier era Arab states that resisted the claims of pan-Arab­ism were at a disadvantagetheir populations a fair target for pan-Arabist appeals, their leaders to be overthrown and replaced by others more committed to the transcendent goal. In contrast to Khalidi, however, Ajami argued that by the end of the 1970s raison detat was gaining ground, and a normal state system [in the Arab world was] becoming a fact of life.36 Writing twenty years later, Bernard Lewis agreed with Ajamis conclusions:
content_units.azure_translation: 有趣的是，在同一期杂志的后期中，另一位杰出的学者和评论家福阿德·阿贾米 （Fouad Ajami） 对哈利迪斯对泛阿拉伯主义效力的描述提出了异议。阿贾米认为，主导现代阿拉伯人政治意识的泛阿拉伯主义[到1970年代末]已经接近尾声，如果它还不是过去的话。阿贾米同意，在早期，抵制泛阿拉伯主义主张的阿拉伯国家处于不利地位，他们的人民是泛阿拉伯主义呼吁的公平目标，他们的领导人将被推翻，取而代之的是其他更致力于超然目标的人。然而，与哈利迪相反，阿贾米认为，到 1970 年代末，存在理由正在取得进展，[阿拉伯世界]正常的国家制度正在成为现实。36 二十年后，伯纳德·刘易斯（Bernard Lewis）写道，同意阿贾米斯的结论：

content_units.text: Ali E. Hillal Dessouki, The New Arab Political Order: Implications for the 1980s, in Rich and Poor States in the Middle East:Egypt and the New Arab Order, eds. Malcolm H. Kerr and El-Sayed Yassin (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1982), pp. 326327.
Walid Khalidi, Thinking the Unthinkable: A Sovereign Palestinian State, Foreign Affairs, vol. 56, no. 4 (July 1978): 695.

Pan-Arabism . . . for long was a sacrosanct ideological principle in all the Arab countries, some of which even incorporated it in their constitution. But as the various Arab states established themselves more .rmly and de.ned and pursued their various national interests with growing clarity, their commitment to pan-Arabism became more and more perfunctory. At the present time, after a series of bitter inter-Arab con.icts, even the customary lip service is often lacking.37
content_units.azure_translation: 泛阿拉伯主义。。。长期以来，它一直是所有阿拉伯国家神圣不可侵犯的意识形态原则，其中一些国家甚至将其纳入其宪法。但是，随着各个阿拉伯国家越来越稳固地建立自己的地位，越来越明确地追求自己的各种国家利益，它们对泛阿拉伯主义的承诺变得越来越敷衍了事。目前，在经历了一系列阿拉伯之间的激烈争吵之后，甚至连习惯的口头服务也常常缺乏37。

content_units.text: Notice, however, that while Ajami and Lewis disagree with Khalidi on the relative potency of pan-Arabism, they accept the basic de.­nition of pan-Arabism as a movement and a doctrine of Arab politi­cal unity. So do a score of other historians, political scientists, and commentators of the Middle East.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，请注意，虽然阿贾米和刘易斯在泛阿拉伯主义的相对效力上不同意哈利迪的观点，但他们接受泛阿拉伯主义作为一种运动和阿拉伯政治统一的学说的基本定义。许多其他中东历史学家、政治学家和评论员也是如此。

content_units.text: What is rather baf.ing about all this is the glaring paucity in the use of the term pan-Arabism in Arabic texts. There are authentic Arabic equivalents for a number of terms that are of signi.cance for our subject: al-qawmiya al-Arabiya (Arab nationalism), al­Uruba (Arabism), al-Wuhda al-Arabiya (Arab unity), al-Ittihad al-Arabi (Arab union), al-Iqlimiya (regionalism), and al-Wataniya (state patriotism). These terms appear constantly in Arabic texts as speeches of leaders, radio and newspaper editorials, and political books and pamphlets. But one is hard put to .nd the literal Arabic translation of pan-Arabism (presumably, al-Uruba al-Shamila) in any of these texts.
content_units.azure_translation: 这一切的更令人毛骨悚然的是，在阿拉伯文本中，泛阿拉伯主义一词的使用明显不足。对于我们的主题来说，许多具有重要意义的术语都有真正的阿拉伯语对应词：al-qawmiya al-Arabiya（阿拉伯民族主义）、alUruba（阿拉伯主义）、al-Wuhda al-Arabiya（阿拉伯统一）、al-Ittihad al-Arabi（阿拉伯联盟）、al-Iqlimiya（地区主义）和 al-Wataniya（国家爱国主义）。这些术语经常出现在阿拉伯文本中，作为领导人的演讲、广播和报纸的社论以及政治书籍和小册子。但是，在这些文本中，人们很难找到泛阿拉伯主义（大概是 al-Uruba al-Shamila）的阿拉伯语直译。

content_units.text: The reason is self-evident: the desire for, as well as the pursuit of, political unity for the Arabs, which is how Western literature has de.ned and portrayed pan-Arabism, is incorporated, in the minds and discourse of the Arab nationalists themselves, in the very de.nition of Arab nationalism itself. To those who thought of themselves as Arab nationaliststhe men and women who were consumed by the idea, who were prepared to endure hardships on its behalf, who drew courage from its promise, who celebrated its triumphs and mourned its setbacksto all those people, Arab na­tionalism was meaningless without its ultimate goal of Arab unity. After all, what would be so distinctive about an Arab world that was nothing more than a region with a multiplicity of states, the vast majority of whose population were Muslim and happened to speak Arabic and share in Arabic culture? How would that be any different from, for example, Catholic and (Brazil-less) Spanish-speaking Latin America? At some point, the cultural bond that pre­sumably tied citizens of the various Arab countries together under the banner of Arabism would have to acquire geographic and polit­ical rationalization. We have already seen that in contrast to an ethnic group, a nation desires and seeks a sovereign political iden­tity, and those who identi.ed themselves as Arab nationalists fer­vently believed that the Arab nation could not continue to allow its children to be scattered among different Arab states.
content_units.azure_translation: 原因不言而喻：阿拉伯人对政治团结的渴望和追求，这就是西方文学对泛阿拉伯主义的描述和描绘方式，在阿拉伯民族主义者自己的思想和话语中，融入了阿拉伯民族主义本身的定义中。对于那些自认为是阿拉伯民族主义者的人来说，那些被这个想法所吞噬的男人和女人，他们准备为它忍受苦难，他们从它的承诺中汲取勇气，庆祝它的胜利，哀悼它的挫折对所有这些人来说，阿拉伯民族主义没有阿拉伯团结的最终目标，就毫无意义。毕竟，一个阿拉伯世界只不过是一个拥有众多国家的地区，其绝大多数人口是穆斯林，并且恰好会说阿拉伯语并分享阿拉伯文化，这有什么特别之处呢？例如，这与天主教和（不包括巴西的）讲西班牙语的拉丁美洲有什么不同？在某个时候，可能将各个阿拉伯国家的公民在阿拉伯主义的旗帜下联系在一起的文化纽带将不得不获得地理和政治合理化。我们已经看到，与一个民族群体相反，一个民族渴望并寻求一种主权政治身份，而那些自称为阿拉伯民族主义者的人热切地认为，阿拉伯民族不能继续允许其子孙分散在不同的阿拉伯国家中。

content_units.text: Fouad Ajami, The End of Pan-Arabism, Foreign Affairs, vol. 57, no.2 (Winter 1978 / 1979): 355.
Lewis, The Multiple Identities of the Middle East, p. 140.

In his introduction to an edited volume on the origins of Arab nationalism, the noted historian Rashid Khalidi, in setting out the arguments of the various chapters, contends that there was a clear difference before 1914 between the majority of Arabists, whose emphasis on Arab identity was linked to continued loyalty to the Ottoman Empire, and the tiny minority of extreme Arab nationalists who called for secession from the empire.38 In this account, those who Khalidi calls Arabists are aware of their cul­tural separateness from the Ottoman Turks, but have no aspira­tions for political sovereignty, yet Khalidis Arab nationalists go beyond the cultural domain to demand political separation. And this trait need not be reserved only to the extreme elements, but, as has been argued here, it should constitute the characteristic of all true nationalists.
content_units.azure_translation: 著名历史学家拉希德·哈利迪（Rashid Khalidi）在介绍一本关于阿拉伯民族主义起源的编辑卷的序言中，在阐述各章的论点时认为，1914年之前，大多数阿拉伯主义者与极少数呼吁脱离帝国的极端阿拉伯民族主义者之间存在明显的差异，他们强调阿拉伯身份与对奥斯曼帝国的持续忠诚有关。38 在这篇叙述中，那些被哈利迪称为阿拉伯主义者的人意识到他们在文化上与奥斯曼土耳其人分离，但对政治主权没有渴望，但哈利迪阿拉伯民族主义者却超越了文化领域，要求政治分离。这种特质不必只限于极端分子，而且，正如这里所论证的那样，它应该构成所有真正的民族主义者的特征。

content_units.text: The desire for political separateness, therefore, will be a constit­uent element in the de.nition of nation and nationalism used in this book. The nation thus de.ned is: a human solidarity, whose members believe that they form a coherent cultural whole, and who manifest a strong desire for political separateness and sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，对政治分离的渴望将成为本书所用的民族和民族主义定义的一个组成要素。这样定义的国家是：一个人类团结，其成员相信他们形成了一个连贯的文化整体，并表现出对政治分离和主权的强烈渴望。

content_units.text: Rashid Khalidi, Lisa Anderson, Muhammad Muslih, and Reeva S. Simon, The Origins of Arab Nationalism. (New York: Columbia University Press, 1991), p. ix.

Applied to the Arab world, this de.nition goes beyond the lin­guistic, religious, historical, and emotional bonds that tie the Ara­bic-speaking people to each other. For the purpose of conceptual precision, this cultural uniformity would be termed Arabism. But Arabism with the added element of a strong desire (and preferably articulated demands) for political unity in a speci.ed demarcated territorythat is what will be termed Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 应用于阿拉伯世界，这种定义超越了将阿拉伯语民族相互联系在一起的语言、宗教、历史和情感纽带。为了概念的精确性，这种文化统一性将被称为阿拉伯主义。但阿拉伯主义增加了一种强烈的愿望（最好是明确的要求）的元素，即在一个特定的划定领土上实现政治统一，这就是所谓的阿拉伯民族主义。

title: EARLY STIRRINGS: THE NINETEENTH AND EARLY TWENTIETH CENTURIES

content_units.text: The area that stretches from the Atlantic Coast in North Africa all the way east to the Persian Gulf in Asia, terminating at the frontiers of Farsi Iran to the east and Turkey to the north, and excluding Jewish Israel, is usually referred to by its inhabitants, as well as by outsiders, as the Arab world. This concept is of course a cultural rather than a political construct, and consequently, there has been considerable shift over time in the conceptual delineation of the land mass inhabited by Arabs. By the middle of the twenti­eth century, most of these inhabitants had accepted a de.nition of Arabness which emphasized their historical bonds under early Islamic rule, the proximity of their manners and traditions, and above all their ability to claim Arabic as their mother tongue. The nationalist narrators might have disagreed over the relative merits of the other elements, but they all agreed on the centrality of the Arabic language as a unifying force.
content_units.azure_translation: 从北非的大西洋沿岸一直向东延伸到亚洲的波斯湾，东至波斯伊朗和北至土耳其边境，不包括犹太以色列，通常被其居民和外人称为阿拉伯世界。当然，这个概念是一种文化结构，而不是一种政治结构，因此，随着时间的推移，阿拉伯人居住的土地的概念划定发生了相当大的转变。到20世纪中叶，这些居民中的大多数已经接受了阿拉伯人的定义，强调他们在早期伊斯兰统治下的历史纽带，他们的举止和传统的接近性，最重要的是他们声称阿拉伯语为母语的能力。民族主义叙述者可能对其他元素的相对优点存在分歧，但他们都同意阿拉伯语作为统一力量的中心地位。

content_units.text: To be sure the Arabness of the people of this area does not exclude other forms of national and subnational identities. An Arab living along the banks of the Tigris River may identify him­self also as an Iraqi (his state), a Sunni (his religious sect), and / or a Dulaimi (his tribe). Multiple identities need not necessarily be mutually exclusive. For instance, in his study of Palestinian iden­tity, Rashid Khalidi maintains that intellectuals and politicians in late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries identi.ed with the Ottoman Empire, their religion, Arabism, their homeland Pales­tine, their city or region, and their family, without feeling any con­tradiction, or sense of con.icting loyalties.1 However, the narra­tors of the various identities have tended to project their own as the most deserving of paramount loyalty. The power of the narrative is aided or impeded by purposeful environmental changes, events, and accidents of historythe packaging of a nationalist school cur­riculum, a war won or lost, the emergence of a charismatic leader. Over time, and depending on the circumstances, a speci.c identify can become the focus of peoples loyalties, while other identities are marginalized, even excluded. As we shall see, during the 1950s and 1960s Arab nationalism became the peoples focus of loyalty to such an extent that other identities were not only marginalized, but indeed were turned into negative, even derogatory, notions.2 This was no longer the case by the end of the twentieth century, when Arab nationalism seemed to have been eclipsed not only by strong Islamic sentiment, but also by state and substate identities; still, throughout the second half of the century, people continued to cling to their Arabness, albeit with varying degrees of intensity.
content_units.azure_translation: 可以肯定的是，该地区人民的阿拉伯性并不排除其他形式的民族和次国家身份。居住在底格里斯河沿岸的阿拉伯人也可以将自己认定为伊拉克人（他的国家）、逊尼派（他的宗教教派）和/或杜莱米人（他的部落）。多重身份不一定是相互排斥的。例如，拉希德·哈利迪（Rashid Khalidi）在对巴勒斯坦身份的研究中认为，19世纪末和20世纪初的知识分子和政治家认同奥斯曼帝国、他们的宗教、阿拉伯主义、他们的祖国巴勒斯坦、他们的城市或地区以及他们的家庭，没有感到任何矛盾，也没有感到忠诚感。1 然而，各种身份的叙述者倾向于将自己的身份投射为最值得最高忠诚的人。叙事的力量受到有目的的环境变化、事件和历史事故的帮助或阻碍民族主义学校课程的包装，一场战争的胜利或失败，一位有魅力的领导者的出现。随着时间的推移，根据具体情况，一个特定的身份可以成为人们忠诚度的焦点，而其他身份则被边缘化，甚至被排除在外。正如我们将看到的，在 1950 年代和 1960 年代，阿拉伯民族主义成为人民忠诚的焦点，以至于其他身份不仅被边缘化，而且确实变成了消极的、甚至贬义的观念。2 到了 20 世纪末，情况已不再如此，当时阿拉伯民族主义似乎不仅被强烈的伊斯兰情绪所掩盖， 但也按州和次州身份;尽管如此，在整个本世纪下半叶，人们仍然坚持他们的阿拉伯性，尽管强度不同。

content_units.text: To call the area the Arab world, therefore, need not raise any eyebrows. To say someone is an Arab should not be a point of controversy. And on the whole it was not. What was vigorously debated was the question pertaining to the origins and political manifestations of this identity: when was it that the inhabitants of the area began to feel that they constituted (or should constitute) a nation; when was it, to use the terminology of Ernest Renan and Benedict Anderson, that they imagined themselves to consti­ tute a deep, horizontal solidarity deserving of political recogni­tion?3 This is not an esoteric debate conducted within the annals of historiography, with no relevance to our understanding of con­temporary Arab politics. If national identity emerges as a result of purposeful narrative, then it is essential to comprehend accurately when the narrative began, for its later development and contempo­rary impact has to have something to do with the intellectual, ideo­logical, and political in.uence under which it emerged.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，称该地区为阿拉伯世界，无需引起任何关注。说某人是阿拉伯人不应该成为争议的焦点。总的来说，事实并非如此。激烈争论的是与这种身份的起源和政治表现有关的问题：该地区的居民何时开始觉得他们构成（或应该构成）一个国家;用欧内斯特·雷南（Ernest Renan）和本尼迪克特·安德森（Benedict Anderson）的术语来说，他们是什么时候想象自己组成了一个值得政治认可的深刻的、横向的团结？3 这不是在史学史册中进行的一场深奥的辩论，与我们对当代阿拉伯政治的理解无关。如果民族认同是有目的的叙事的结果，那么就必须准确理解叙事的开始时间，因为它后来的发展和当代影响必须与它出现的知识、意识形态和政治因素有关。

content_units.text: Rashid Khalidi, Palestinian Identity: The Construction of Modern National Conscious­ness (New York: Columbia University Press, 1997), p. 19.

See, for example, Selim Mattar, al-Dhat al-Jariha: Ishkalat al-Hawiya . al-Iraq wa al-Alam al-Aabi al-Shirqani, (Wounded essence: problems of identity in Iraq and the Eastern Arab world) (Beirut: al-Muasasa al-Arabiya li al-Dirasat wa al-Nashr, 1997).

Of course, some form of Arab consciousness has existed throughout the history of the Arabs. Albert Hourani sees in the life of Ibn Khaldun, the great fourteenth century Arab philosopher, an allegory for the cultural space that was the domain of the Arabs. Ibn Khalduns life, Hourani tells us, says something about the world to which he belonged:
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，某种形式的阿拉伯意识在阿拉伯人的历史中一直存在。阿尔伯特·胡拉尼 （Albert Hourani） 在 14 世纪伟大的阿拉伯哲学家伊本·哈勒敦 （Ibn Khaldun） 的生活中看到了阿拉伯人领地的文化空间的寓言。胡拉尼告诉我们，伊本·哈勒敦的一生谈到了他所属的世界：

content_units.text: A world where a family from southern Arabia could move to Spain, and after six centuries return nearer to its place of origin and still .nd itself in familiar surroundings, had a unity which transcended divisions of time and space; the Arabic language could open the door to of.ce and in.uence throughout that world; a body of knowledge, transmitted over the centuries by a known chain of teachers, preserved a moral community even when rules changed; places of pilgrimage, Mecca and Jerusalem, were unchanging poles of the human world even if power shifted from one city to another; and belief in a God who created and sustained the world could give meaning to the blows of fate.4
content_units.azure_translation: 一个来自阿拉伯南部的家庭可以搬到西班牙，并在六个世纪后回到更靠近其原籍地的地方，并且仍然在熟悉的环境中，有一个超越时间和空间划分的统一;阿拉伯语可以打开通往整个世界的 of.ce 和 in.uence 的大门;几个世纪以来，由一群已知的教师传播的知识体系，即使规则发生了变化，也保留了一个道德共同体;朝圣地麦加和耶路撒冷是人类世界的两极，即使权力从一个城市转移到另一个城市;相信创造和维持世界的上帝可以赋予命运的打击意义4。

content_units.text: So it was Islam and the Arabic language that preserved this sense of belonging through the ages, a process that gained vast impetus with the magni.cent .owering of culture in the Arab Islamic em­pires that grew out of the Muslim conquests. It was then that Bagh­dad of the Abbasids, Cairo of the Fatimids, Qairawan of the North
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，正是伊斯兰教和阿拉伯语历代保存了这种归属感，这一过程随着阿拉伯伊斯兰帝国因穆斯林征服而发展起来的文化的壮丽发展而获得了巨大的推动力。就在那时，阿拔斯王朝的巴格达、法蒂玛王朝的开罗、北方的盖拉万

content_units.text: Ernest Renan, What is a Nation? in Nation and Narration, ed. Homi K. Bhabha. (London: Routledge, 1990); Benedict Anderson, Imagined Communities: Re.ections on the Origin and Spread of Nationalism (New York: Verso, 1990).
Albert Hourani, A History of the Arab Peoples (New York: Warner Books, 1991), p. 4.
African Aghlabids, and Cordoba of the Spanish Ummayads were the centers of dazzling civilizations at a time when Europe was mired in illiteracy, poverty, and disease.
content_units.azure_translation: 非洲阿格拉比德人和西班牙乌玛亚德人的科尔多瓦是令人眼花缭乱的文明中心，当时欧洲深陷文盲、贫困和疾病的泥潭。

content_units.text: But by the dawn of the sixteenth century, the Arabs were no longer the primary bearers of power and culture. Their empires and civilizations had disintegrated and they lay ready to be de­voured by new and aggressive social solidarities eager to expand their power and domain. It was one such group, the Turkish Otto­mans, that was destined to rule over the Arabs for the next .ve centuries. Very soon, Constantinople, not the famed Arab cities, would become Islams center of gravity, and in the Friday prayers, the voice of Muazzins in Arab cities and towns would invoke the blessings of Allah not for Arab rulers, but for the Turkish sultan. At times, the political and military reach of the Ottoman Turks seemed limitless. The great sixteenth century Ottoman sultan, Su­layman, known as the Magni.cent, would address a letter to the King of France which began, I who am Sultan of Sultans, Sovereign of Sovereigns . . . the shadow of God on earth, the Sul­tan and Sovereign Lord of the White Sea and the Black Sea, of Rumelia, Azerbaijan, Persia, Damascus, Aleppo, Cairo, Mecca, Medina, Jerusalem, Arabia, Yemen and many other lands . . . which my August Majesty has made subject to my .aming sword and my victorious blade. I, Sultan [Sulayman] Khan . . . to thee, who art Francis, King of the land of France.5
content_units.azure_translation: 但到了16世纪初，阿拉伯人不再是权力和文化的主要承载者。他们的帝国和文明已经解体，他们随时准备被渴望扩大其权力和领土的新的侵略性社会团结所吞噬。土耳其奥斯曼帝国就是这样一个群体，注定要在接下来的几个世纪里统治阿拉伯人。很快，君士坦丁堡，而不是著名的阿拉伯城市，将成为伊斯兰教的重心，在周五的祈祷中，阿拉伯城镇穆阿津的声音将祈求真主的祝福，而不是为阿拉伯统治者，而是为土耳其苏丹祈求。有时，奥斯曼土耳其人的政治和军事影响力似乎是无限的。16世纪伟大的奥斯曼苏丹苏莱曼，被称为“大帝”，会写一封信给法国国王，信的开头是，我是苏丹中的苏丹，君主中的君主......上帝在地上的影子，白海和黑海的苏丹和至高无上的领主，鲁米利亚、阿塞拜疆、波斯、大马士革、阿勒颇、开罗、麦加、麦地那、耶路撒冷、阿拉伯、也门和许多其他土地......我的奥古斯特陛下已经服从了我的剑和我胜利的剑。我，苏丹[苏莱曼]汗......献给你，他是法兰西国王弗朗西斯。5

content_units.text: What is interesting, however, is that this pervasive power of the Turks over Arab lands and populations in no way diminished the place of the Arabic language. In fact, the Ottomans, Muslims them­selves, regarded Arabic as the sacred language, according it due respect and deference,6 and so while Turkish became the language of government and bureaucracy, Arabic retained its elevated status as the medium for law and religious studies and more often than not for history and biography.7 So it was the Arabic language, and its unrivaled status as the language of the Quran, which nourished and sustained a sense of cultural proximity in the Arab lands of the empire throughout the centuries of Ottoman rule.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，有趣的是，土耳其人对阿拉伯土地和人口的这种普遍力量丝毫没有削弱阿拉伯语的地位。事实上，奥斯曼帝国，穆斯林本身，将阿拉伯语视为神圣的语言，给予应有的尊重和尊重，6 因此，当土耳其语成为政府和官僚机构的语言时，阿拉伯语仍然保留了其作为法律和宗教研究媒介的崇高地位，而且往往是历史和传记的媒介。 以及它作为《古兰经》语言的无与伦比的地位，在奥斯曼帝国统治的几个世纪里，它滋养并维持了帝国阿拉伯土地上的文化亲近感。

content_units.text: Anthony Nutting, The Arabs: A Narrative History from Muhammed to the Present (New York: New American Library, 1964), p. 212.
H.A.R. Gibb, Islamic Society and the West: A Study of the Impact of Western Civiliza­tion on Moslem Culture (London: Oxford University Press, 1950), p. 160.

Instrumental in this process, paradoxically enough, was the West. As early as the sixteenth century, the Rome papacy began to establish colleges for training priests of the eastern churches, a number of which incorporated the study of Arabic into their theo­logical and historical explorations and commentaries. This pro­cess was accelerated in the nineteenth century in the Levant under the enlightened rule of Ibrahim Pasha who encouraged Western missionaries and educationists to open schools and other educa­tional institutions. To remedy the shortage of Arabic texts these institutions imported their own printing presses. All this led to an Arabic literary revival, which was to become the basis for the early nationalist stirrings in the Arabic-speaking provinces of the Otto­man Empire.
content_units.azure_translation: 矛盾的是，西方在这一过程中发挥了重要作用。早在16世纪，罗马教皇就开始建立学院来培训东方教会的神父，其中一些学院将阿拉伯语的研究纳入其神学和历史探索和评论中。19世纪，在黎凡特，易卜拉欣·帕夏（Ibrahim Pasha）开明的统治下，这一进程加速了，他鼓励西方传教士和教育家开办学校和其他教育机构。为了弥补阿拉伯语文本的短缺，这些机构进口了自己的印刷机。所有这一切都导致了阿拉伯文学的复兴，这成为奥斯曼帝国阿拉伯语省份早期民族主义骚动的基础。

content_units.text: It is thus hardly surprising that the intellectual seeds of twentieth century Arab nationalism should be traced to the ideas and endeav­ors of a number of nineteenth century thinkers and activists. Mus­lims and Christians, their central focus was the contemporary con­dition and future aspirations of the Arabic-speaking citizens of the Ottoman Empire. Their eyes opened by the expansion of education to the growing nationalist movements in the Balkan lands of the Empire, these early Arab writers and political agitators tended to focus on the ethnic and linguistic differences that separated the Arabs from their Turkish rulers. As we shall see, this ethnic sepa­rateness was much stronger among the Christians than the Mus­lims; the latter being tied to Istanbul by the bond of religious belief, and therefore just as much, perhaps more, concerned with the creeping cultural and political domination of Christian Europe.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，20世纪阿拉伯民族主义的知识种子可以追溯到一些19世纪思想家和活动家的思想和努力也就不足为奇了。穆斯林和基督徒，他们的中心关注点是奥斯曼帝国讲阿拉伯语的公民的当代状况和未来愿望。这些早期的阿拉伯作家和政治煽动者因教育扩展到帝国巴尔干地区日益增长的民族主义运动而大开眼界，他们倾向于关注将阿拉伯人与土耳其统治者分开的种族和语言差异。正如我们将要看到的，这种种族分离在基督徒中比穆斯林要强烈得多;后者通过宗教信仰的纽带与伊斯坦布尔联系在一起，因此同样，也许更关心基督教欧洲逐渐蔓延的文化和政治统治。

content_units.text: Perhaps the earliest of these thinkers and political agitators, whose writings and activities were held in great reverence by the
content_units.azure_translation: 也许是这些思想家和政治煽动者中最早的一位，他们的著作和活动受到

content_units.text: Albert Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age. 17981939 (London: Oxford Uni­versity Press, 1970), p. 239.

Arab nationalists of the twentieth century, were Jamal al-Din al-Afghani (18391897) and his pupil Muhamed Abdu (1849 1905). Admittedly, neither spoke directly to Arabism, for Afghani and Abdu were essentially Islamic reformers who recognized and feared the cultural threat of the Christian West, and sought to con­front this threat through advocating Islamic reform, resurgence, and unity. Their purpose was to regenerate the stagnant Muslim society, and to educate it into adapting to the ideas and institutions of the modern world. They argued that the arsenal of the Wests undoubted contemporary superiorityphilosophy, reason, and sciencewere not only compatible with Islam, they in fact were imbedded in the very essence of the Muslim faith. To Afghani, Islam was in harmony with the principles discovered by scienti.c reason, was indeed the religion demanded by reason.8 Thus, it was not Islam per se, but the Muslims intellectual backwardness, brought about by centuries of subjugation and neglect, as well as the disunity of the Islamic Umma, that was responsible for the infe­rior status of the Muslim world.9 Time and again the two reformers would enjoin Muslims not to blindly imitate the West, but to delve into the real meaning of their religion, study it well, and model their lives on its teachings. If that were to happen, the world of Islam would be strong again.10 It was this determined declaration of authenticity, this unambiguous reiteration of cultural indepen­dence, even superiority, that later would spur twentieth century nationalists to consider Afghani and Abdu as having contributed to the Arab nationalist cause.11
content_units.azure_translation: 20 世纪的阿拉伯民族主义者是贾迈勒·丁·阿富汗尼（Jamal al-Din al-Afghani，18391897 年）和他的学生穆罕默德·阿卜杜（Muhamed Abdu，1849 年至 1905 年）。诚然，两人都没有直接与阿拉伯主义对话，因为阿富汗尼和阿卜杜本质上是伊斯兰改革者，他们认识到并害怕基督教西方的文化威胁，并试图通过倡导伊斯兰改革、复兴和团结来对抗这种威胁。他们的目的是重振停滞不前的穆斯林社会，并教育它适应现代世界的思想和制度。他们认为，西方的武器库无疑在当代的优越性哲学、理性和科学不仅与伊斯兰教兼容，而且实际上它们植根于穆斯林信仰的本质中。对阿富汗人来说，伊斯兰教与科学发现的原则是一致的。理性确实是理性所要求的宗教。8 因此，不是伊斯兰教本身，而是穆斯林知识落后，这是由几个世纪的征服和忽视以及伊斯兰乌玛的不团结造成的，导致了穆斯林世界的低等地位。9 这两位改革者一次又一次地告诫穆斯林不要盲目效仿西方， 而是深入研究他们宗教的真正含义，好好研究它，并以它的教义为榜样他们的生活。如果这种情况发生，伊斯兰世界将再次强大。10 正是这种对真实性的坚定宣言，这种对文化独立甚至优越性的明确重申，后来促使 20 世纪的民族主义者认为阿富汗尼和阿卜杜为阿拉伯民族主义事业做出了贡献。

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 123.

For analyses of the ideas of Afghani and Abdu, see Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, pp. 103160; Majid Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World: The Role of Ideas and Ideals in Politics (Baltimore,: Johns Hopkins Press, 1970), pp. 5665; Nadav Safran, Egypt in Search of Political Community: An Analysis of the Intellectual and Political Evolution of Egypt, 18041952 (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1961), pp. 4346, 6275; Sylvia Haim, ed. Arab Nationalism: An Anthology (Berkeley: California University Press, 1962), pp. 620.
Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, p. 113.

See the thorough summary of such opinions by Elie Chalala, Arab Nationalism: A Bibliographical Essay, in Pan Arabism and Arab Nationalism: The Continuing Debate. ed. Taw.c E. Farah. (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1987), pp. 2425.

If this is to be the case, however, the most that could be said about Afghani and Abdu is that they were Arab nationalists by implication, and even that is tenuous at best. According to the emi­nent Arab historian, Nicola Ziadeh, Afgahni single-mindedly advo­cated the concept of the Islamic Umma (Islamic community) at the expense of the national state. The Umma, according to Afghani, constituted all Muslims, regardless of their countries, nationalities, and languages.12 Abdu, too, always spoke of and to the Ummah in the traditional sense of the community of all Muslims.13 As for Arab national and linguistic bonds, these were dismissed by Afghani, who insisted that Muslims had but one nationality: their religion.14 To Afghani and Abdu, the religion of Islam is the one bond which unites Muslims of all countries and obliterates all traces of race or nationality.15 Indeed, they were adamant that it was the foreigners who touted secular nationalism in order to divide the Muslim Umma. Nationalism thus was conceived as a divisive rather than a unifying spirita cover, in fact, for tyranny and injustice.16 Moreover, neither Afghani nor Abdu was particu­larly hostile to Ottoman rule over Arab lands.17 Indeed, Afghani was Persian by birth, and if any nationalism, beyond Muslim unity, is to be implied from Abdus writings, it would be Egyptian rather than Arab.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，如果真是这样，关于阿富汗尼和阿卜杜，最多只能说他们是暗示的阿拉伯民族主义者，即使这样充其量也是微不足道的。根据著名的阿拉伯历史学家尼古拉·齐亚德 （Nicola Ziadeh） 的说法，阿富汗人一心一意地倡导伊斯兰乌玛（伊斯兰社区）的概念，而牺牲了民族国家的利益。根据阿富汗尼的说法，乌玛构成了所有穆斯林，无论他们的国家、国籍和语言如何。12 阿卜杜也总是在所有穆斯林社区的传统意义上谈论乌玛。13 至于阿拉伯民族和语言纽带，阿富汗人驳斥了这些纽带，他坚持认为穆斯林只有一个国籍：他们的宗教。14 对阿富汗尼人和阿卜杜来说，伊斯兰教是将所有国家的穆斯林团结在一起并消除所有种族或国籍痕迹的唯一纽带。15 事实上，他们坚持认为，是外国人吹捧世俗民族主义，以分裂穆斯林乌玛。因此，民族主义被认为是一种分裂的而不是统一的精神，事实上，它是暴政和不公正的掩护。16 此外，阿富汗人和阿卜杜都对奥斯曼帝国对阿拉伯土地的统治并不特别敌视。17 事实上，阿富汗人出生时就是波斯人，如果从阿卜杜勒的著作中暗示出任何超越穆斯林统一的民族主义，那就是埃及人而不是阿拉伯人。

content_units.text: More perceptible Arabist proclivities are found in the writings of another leading Islamist, Rashid Rida (18651935). Ridas writ­ings on the structure and reform of the Islamic world tended to give Arabs pride of place. To Rida, the Arabic language was the only language in which the doctrines and laws of Islam could be thought about.18 Accordingly, to invest the of.ce of the Khalifa with the Ottoman rulers in Istanbul was a travesty. Indeed, Rida goes even further by insisting that Islam, in fact, had been under­mined by the Ottoman rulers.19 After all, was it not the Turks who tyrannized the community, killing even the Khalifas? Worst of all, in Ridas eyes, the Turks usurped the [of.ce of the Khalifa] from the Abbasids and so took it out from the hands of the Quraysh clan which had been chosen by God to spread the Quran over the world, after it had given Islam its prophet, its language, and its adherents.20 And while the Ottomans had certainly built a great empire, it is dwarfed by the early Arab conquests. In an article Rida wrote in 1900, in which he evaluates Arab and Ottoman conquests, he is adamant in preferring the former: I want to say that the greatest glory in the Muslim conquests goes to the Arabs, and that religion grew, and became great through them; their foundation is the strongest, their light is the brightest, and they are indeed the best Umma.21 In these and other writings, there is no mistaking the conscious ethnic distinction between the Arabs and the Otto­man Turks, in which the pride of place goes to the Arabs. Indeed, later on, in the wake of the 1916 Arab revolt, Rida advocated polit­ical separation and statehood for the Arabs, which, he argued, would be of bene.t to all Muslims.22
content_units.azure_translation: 在另一位主要伊斯兰主义者拉希德·里达（Rashid Rida，18651935）的著作中可以发现更明显的阿拉伯主义倾向。里达斯关于伊斯兰世界结构和改革的著作往往让阿拉伯人感到自豪。对里达来说，阿拉伯语是唯一可以思考伊斯兰教教义和法律的语言。18 因此，将哈利法的领地与伊斯坦布尔的奥斯曼统治者投资是一种讽刺。事实上，里达更进一步，坚持认为伊斯兰教实际上已经被奥斯曼统治者破坏了。19 毕竟，难道不是土耳其人暴虐了社区，甚至杀害了哈利法人吗？最糟糕的是，在里达斯眼中，土耳其人从阿拔斯王朝手中夺走了哈利法的领地，从而从古莱什氏族手中夺走了它，古莱什氏族是真主选择的，在古莱什氏族赋予了伊斯兰教先知、语言和信徒之后，古莱什氏族将《古兰经》传播到世界各地。20 虽然奥斯曼帝国确实建立了一个伟大的帝国，但与早期的阿拉伯征服相比，它就相形见绌了。在里达 1900 年写的一篇文章中，他评价了阿拉伯和奥斯曼帝国的征服，他坚持更倾向于前者：我想说，穆斯林征服中最大的荣耀属于阿拉伯人，宗教通过他们成长并变得伟大;他们的根基最坚固，他们的光芒最亮，他们确实是最好的乌玛。21 在这些和其他著作中，阿拉伯人和奥斯曼土耳其人之间有意识的种族区分是毫无疑问的，其中阿拉伯人的地位是骄傲的。事实上，后来，在 1916 年阿拉伯起义之后，里达主张阿拉伯人进行政治分离和建国，他认为这将对所有穆斯林都有好处22。

The cause of Arabism was in no way meant to supercede that of

content_units.text: the wider Islamic solidarity, and so his antagonism toward the Turkish usurpers was not meant to undermine the Ottoman Em­pire, for he saw the continued health of the Empire as a strength for Islam.23 Consequently, Rida remained committed to his Ottoman nationality until the last years of World War I when Ottoman de­feat loomed in the horizon. Indeed, Rida was proud that in a na­tionalist age, the Arabs were the last ethnic group to feel its stirrings because the vast majority of them are Muslims feeling almost nothing but their religious identity.24 Rida, in fact, was very much against doctrinal nationalism, seeing it as a Western-inspired as­sault against the solidarity of the Islamic Umma. To Rida, national­ism was not only a new source of dissension among Muslims, but something close to apostasy.25 In 1911, he submitted a memoran­dum to the Ottoman authorities recommending the establishment of a Madrasat al-Dawa wa al-Irshad (School of Religious Persua­sion and Instruction), in which students would be selected from promising candidates in the Muslim countries, especially those in need of Islamic knowledge, such as Java, China and North Africa. The [school] would emphasize morals, manners and a spirit of unity, eschewing both racial nationalism and politics.26 An attach­ment to a homeland was permissible only if it served the interest of the broader Muslim community. A Muslim, Rida told his co­religionists, is a member of a body bigger than his people, his own personal homeland is only a part of his religious homeland, and he must therefore seek to make the progress of the part a means to­ward the progress of the whole.27 In Ridas scheme of things, eth­nic nationalism, including Arab nationalism, in no way would be advocated as an autonomous ideological formulation; it would be tolerated only when it was put at the service of a higher purpose, namely, the bringing together of global Islamic solidarity.
content_units.azure_translation: 更广泛的伊斯兰团结，因此他对土耳其篡位者的敌意并不意味着破坏奥斯曼帝国，因为他认为帝国的持续健康是伊斯兰教的力量。23 因此，里达一直致力于他的奥斯曼国籍，直到第一次世界大战的最后几年，奥斯曼帝国的失败迫在眉睫。事实上，里达感到自豪的是，在民族主义时代，阿拉伯人是最后一个感受到民族主义激荡的民族，因为他们中的绝大多数是穆斯林，除了他们的宗教身份之外几乎什么都没有感觉。24 事实上，里达非常反对教义民族主义，认为这是西方启发的对伊斯兰乌玛团结的攻击。对里达来说，民族主义不仅是穆斯林之间分歧的新根源，而且是接近叛教的东西。25 1911 年，他向奥斯曼当局提交了一份备忘录，建议建立一所宗教劝说和教学学校，学生将从穆斯林国家的有前途的候选人中选出，特别是那些需要伊斯兰知识的候选人，如爪哇、中国和北非。[学校]将强调道德、礼仪和团结精神，避开种族民族主义和政治。26 只有当它符合更广泛的穆斯林社区的利益时，才允许对祖国的依恋。里达告诉他的同教者，穆斯林是一个比他的人民更大的团体的成员，他自己的个人家园只是他宗教家园的一部分，因此他必须寻求使部分的进步成为整体进步的手段。27 在里达斯的计划中，民族民族主义，包括阿拉伯民族主义，绝不会被提倡为一种自主的意识形态表述;只有当它服务于一个更高的目标，即将全球伊斯兰团结团结起来时，它才会被容忍。

A more forthright and politically conscious ethnic separation of Arab from Turk can be discerned from the writing of the Syrian Abd al-Rahman al-Kawakibi (18491903). In his book, Umm al-Qura (Mother of the Cities), a traditional name for Mecca, Kawa­kibi berates the Turks for introducing practices into the Umma which led to the decadence of Islam, adding that the abode of Islam would have been better off had the Turks not embraced the faith.28 He then goes so far as to advocate a shift in the balance of power from the Turks to the Arabs by bringing back the caliphate to al-Hejaz, where an Arab from the line of Quraish would be elected by representatives of the Islamic community. Kawakibi rationalizes what amounts to an incendiary proposal by reference to the central position of the Arabs, and especially their language, in Islam.29 He adds that, unlike other Muslims, the Arabs of the Arabian Penin­sula, not having been weakened by racial and sectarian divisions, continued to constitute a true solidarity, and were the most zealous in preserving their religion. The Arabs, Kawakibi maintained, are of all nations the most suitable to be an authority in religion and an example to the Muslims; the other nations have followed their guidance at the start and will not refuse to follow them now.30 In advocating placing religious authority in the hands of the Arabs, Kawakibi, more so than Rida, infuses a quasi-political dimension to his anti-Turkish sentiment, which is crystallized by his insistence on the transfer of the caliphate to al-Hejaz.
content_units.azure_translation: 从叙利亚人阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼·卡瓦基比（Abd al-Rahman al-Kawakibi，18491903）的著作中可以看出阿拉伯人与土耳其人之间更直接、更具有政治意识的种族分离。在他的著作《城市之母》（Umm al-Qura）（麦加的传统名称）中，卡瓦基比斥责土耳其人将习俗引入乌玛，导致伊斯兰教的颓废，并补充说，如果土耳其人不接受伊斯兰教的信仰，伊斯兰教的居所会过得更好。28 然后，他甚至主张通过恢复哈里发制来将权力平衡从土耳其人转移到阿拉伯人手中到汉志，古莱什血统的阿拉伯人将由伊斯兰社区的代表选举产生。卡瓦基比通过提及阿拉伯人，尤其是他们的语言在伊斯兰教中的中心地位，将相当于煽动性的提议合理化。29 他补充说，与其他穆斯林不同，阿拉伯半岛的阿拉伯人没有因种族和宗派分裂而削弱，继续构成真正的团结，并且最热衷于维护他们的宗教。卡瓦基比坚持认为，阿拉伯人是所有国家中最适合成为宗教权威和穆斯林榜样的人;其他国家一开始就遵循了他们的指导，现在也不会拒绝遵循它们。30 在主张将宗教权威交到阿拉伯人手中时，川基比比里达更主张为他的反土耳其情绪注入了准政治层面，这在他坚持将哈里发移交给汉志的坚持中得到了体现。

content_units.text: Yet this is hardly a clearly enunciated nationalist doctrine, rather it is more an articulated sentiment against Turkish political domi­nation, fueled possibly by a political grudge against Istanbul for furthering the political ambitions of the head of a rival family in Kawakibis own town of Aleppo.31 More generally, Hanna Batatu argues that the centralizing efforts of the reformist Ottoman sul­tans of the nineteenth century increasingly encroached upon all the elements of power hitherto diffused among a crowd of landed families, tribal shaykhs, and privileged corporate orders.... The ashraf (the class to which Kawakibi belonged) found themselves being slowly and gradually edged out of their former power.32 In terms of doctrine, Kawakibis overriding intellectual concern, not unlike Afghani, Abdu, and Rida, related .rst and foremost to the condition of Islam and the Islamic community.33 After all, the bulk of Umm al-Quras discourse centers on the decay of the Muslim world, brought about by despotic rulers supporting false religion.34 Thus, the shift in religious authority from the Turks to the Arabs was proposed for the sole purpose of Islamic regeneration, and the Arabian khalifa was projected to be not a revolutionary national­ist, but a symbol of Islamic unity. Note that the proposed khalifa would have only religious authority over the Umma35, and the only temporal authority he was granted by Kawakibi was over al-Hejaz. Indeed, Kawakibi made sure not to call for a break in Ottoman unity.36 Nor did the notion of Arab political separation .gure much in Kawakibis second book, Tabaial-Istibdad (Characteris­tics of Tyranny),37 which focused on the evils of repressive authori­tarian rule and the many virtues of representative government. The book, by implication, was an attack on the tyranny of the Ottoman sultan, Abd al-Hamid, but did not advocate Arab sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，这并不是一个明确阐明的民族主义学说，而更像是一种对土耳其政治统治的明确情绪，可能是由于对伊斯坦布尔的政治怨恨，因为伊斯坦布尔在卡瓦基比斯自己的阿勒颇镇促进了一个敌对家族的族长的政治野心。31 更广泛地说，汉娜·巴塔图认为，19 世纪改革主义奥斯曼苏丹的中央集权努力日益蚕食迄今为止的所有权力要素在一群有地家庭、部落谢赫和特权企业秩序中扩散......阿什拉夫（川木比所属的阶级）发现自己正在缓慢地逐渐摆脱了以前的权力。32 就教义而言，卡瓦基比压倒一切的知识关注，与阿富汗尼、阿卜杜和里达不同，首先与伊斯兰教和伊斯兰社区的状况有关。33 毕竟，乌姆古拉斯的大部分话语都集中在穆斯林世界的衰败上，这是由支持虚假宗教的专制统治者带来的。34 因此，宗教权威从土耳其人转移到阿拉伯人的唯一目的是伊斯兰复兴， 阿拉伯哈利法被预测为不是一个革命的民族主义者，而是伊斯兰团结的象征。请注意，拟议的哈利法将仅对乌玛35拥有宗教权威，而卡瓦基比授予他的唯一世俗权威是对汉志。事实上，川木比确保不呼吁奥斯曼帝国的统一中断。36 在卡瓦基比斯的第二本书《Tabaial-Istibbad》（暴政的特征）37 中，阿拉伯政治分离的概念也没有太多体现，该书着重于专制专制统治的罪恶和代议制政府的许多美德。这本书言外之意是对奥斯曼苏丹阿卜杜勒·哈米德暴政的攻击，但并不主张阿拉伯主权。
