The reluctance of Afghani, Abdu, Rida, and Kawakibi to cham­pion political independence for the Arabs re.ected the general in­tellectual disposition of Muslim thinkers of the time. Their overrid­ing concern was for the close cooperation between the two national communities: the Turks and the Arabs.38 That, however, was not good enough for Christian thinkers and writers. These individuals had no qualms about breaking Ottoman unity, promot­ing a separate Arab identity, and advocating an independent politi­cal realm for those whose mother language was Arabic. Perhaps the earliest to advocate the break-up of the Ottoman empire and the creation of an independent Arab state was the Syrian Christian, Negib Azoury (d.1916). Azoury echoed Ridas and Kawakibis contempt for the Turks, but whereas the hostility of Rida and Ka­wakibi lay in what the Turks allegedly did to Islam and the Muslim world, Azoury blamed the Turks for having ruined the Arabs. Without them, the Arabs would have been among the most civi­lized nations in the world.39 To Azouri, the Arabs are not just Muslims, but also Arabic-speaking Christians, and together they constitute the same nation that had to be politically independent of the Ottoman Turks.40 The frontiers of this nation-state would stretch from the Tigris and the Euphrates to the Suez Isthmus, and from the Mediterranean to the Arabian Sea. Obvious from this designation is the exclusion of Egypt, because Egyptians do not belong to the Arab race; they are of African Berber family and the language which they spoke before Islam bears no similarity to Ara­bic.41 This Arab state was to be a secular, liberal, and constitu­tional sultanate, following in the path of England and France.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿富汗尼、阿卜杜、里达和卡瓦基比不愿为阿拉伯人倡导政治独立，这重新改变了当时穆斯林思想家的普遍知识倾向。他们最关心的是土耳其人和阿拉伯人这两个民族社区之间的密切合作。38 然而，这对基督教思想家和作家来说还不够好。这些人毫不犹豫地破坏奥斯曼帝国的统一，促进独立的阿拉伯身份，并为那些以阿拉伯语为母语的人倡导一个独立的政治领域。也许最早主张解体奥斯曼帝国并建立独立的阿拉伯国家的是叙利亚基督徒内吉布·阿祖里（Negib Azoury，卒于 1916 年）。阿祖里呼应了里达斯和卡瓦基比人对土耳其人的蔑视，但里达和卡瓦基比的敌意在于土耳其人据称对伊斯兰教和穆斯林世界的所作所为，而阿祖里则指责土耳其人毁了阿拉伯人。没有他们，阿拉伯人就会成为世界上最文明的国家之一。39 对阿祖里来说，阿拉伯人不仅是穆斯林，也是讲阿拉伯语的基督徒，他们共同构成了一个在政治上必须独立于奥斯曼土耳其人的民族。40 这个民族国家的边界将从底格里斯河和幼发拉底河延伸到苏伊士地峡，从地中海延伸到阿拉伯海。从这个名称中可以明显看出埃及被排除在外，因为埃及人不属于阿拉伯种族;他们是非洲柏柏尔语系，他们在伊斯兰教之前所说的语言与阿拉伯语没有相似之处。41 这个阿拉伯国家将成为一个世俗的、自由的和立宪的苏丹国，追随英国和法国的道路。

content_units.text: Another Christian from Syria, Ibrahim al-Yaziji (18471906) went even further in his advocacy of an Arab nation, for not only did the Arabs constitute a nation, they were the most remarkable of nations.42 Their achievements spoke for themselves, and only when foreigners, particularly the Turks, came to dominate them, did Arab civilization begin to decline. Thus in order for the Arabs to reclaim their past glories, they needed to expel the Turks from their midst. Then, the old vigor of the Arab nation would return and the Arabs would resume their former progress in civiliza­tion.43 Of course, in Yazijis words, there is an unambiguous ap­peal to the Muslim majority to join with the Christians in their Arab nationalism and rise against the admittedly Muslim, yet ethnically distinct, Ottoman Turks.
content_units.azure_translation: 另一位来自叙利亚的基督徒易卜拉欣·亚齐吉（Ibrahim al-Yaziji，18471906）在倡导阿拉伯民族方面走得更远，因为阿拉伯人不仅构成了一个民族，而且是最杰出的民族。42 他们的成就不言而喻，只有当外国人，特别是土耳其人开始统治他们时，阿拉伯文明才开始衰落。因此，为了让阿拉伯人重拾过去的辉煌，他们需要将土耳其人从他们中间驱逐出去。然后，阿拉伯民族的旧活力将恢复，阿拉伯人将恢复他们以前的文明进步。43 当然，用亚兹吉人的话来说，这是对穆斯林占多数的明确呼吁，与基督徒一起加入他们的阿拉伯民族主义，并起来反对公认的穆斯林但种族独特的奥斯曼土耳其人。

content_units.text: Youssef M. Choueiri, Arab Nationalism: A History (Oxford: Blackwell Publishers, 2000), p. 79.
Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, p. 278.
Ziadeh, Shamiyat, p. 293.
Negib Azoury, Program of the League of the Arab Fatherland, in Haim, Arab Na­tionalism: An Anthology,p.81.

While slight variations in points of emphases, nuances, and ideo­logical direction could be found in the writings of other Christian intellectuals of the period,44 the primary focus of these writers in­variably was on the national distinctiveness of the Arabs, Muslims, and Christians alike, and their membership of one indivisible Arab nation that would .nd its true expression and would ful.ll its promise only through a secular and liberal nation-state.
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然在这一时期其他基督教知识分子的著作中可以找到重点、细微差别和意识形态方向的细微差异，44 但这些作家的主要关注点总是放在阿拉伯人、穆斯林和基督徒的民族独特性上，以及他们作为一个不可分割的阿拉伯国家的成员身份，只有通过一个世俗和自由的民族国家才能真正表达并实现其承诺。

content_units.text: But theirs were isolated and lonely voices. The problem for the Christian propagators of Arab nationalism was that, on the whole, their message fell on deaf ears among the intellectual elite of Arab Muslims. Many Muslims resented the secularist orientation of the Christians, believing it to be a spurious effort at dividing the Is­lamic Umma. They further were angered by the spectacle of Chris­tians assuming the air of masters of Arab learning, [thus adopting] the battle cry, Arabic shall not be Christianized.45 The truth is that, as we have seen, the concept of an Arab nation striving for political sovereignty and independence was truly marginal to the concerns of the nineteenth century Arab Muslim intelligentsia, who undoubtedly put greater store in the rejuvenation of the Islamic
content_units.azure_translation: 但他们的声音是孤立而孤独的声音。阿拉伯民族主义的基督教传播者面临的问题在于，总的来说，他们的信息在阿拉伯穆斯林的知识精英中被置若罔闻。许多穆斯林对基督徒的世俗主义取向感到不满，认为这是分裂伊斯兰乌玛的虚假努力。他们进一步对基督徒装出阿拉伯学问大师的姿态感到愤怒，[从而采用]战斗口号，阿拉伯语不得被基督教化。45 事实是，正如我们所看到的，一个阿拉伯民族争取政治主权和独立的概念对于 19 世纪阿拉伯穆斯林知识分子的关切来说确实是边缘的，他们无疑更加重视伊斯兰教的复兴

content_units.text: C. Ernest Dawn, From Ottomanism to Arabism: Essays on the Origins of Arab Nation­alism (Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1973), p. 132.
Ibid.

Succinct analyses of the ideas of such intellectuals as Jurji Zaidan, Francis Marash, Shibli Shumayyil, Farah Antun, Salama Musa, and others can be found in Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, pp. 245259 and in Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World, pp. 8994.
Dawn, From Ottomanism to Arabism, pp. 132133.

Umma than in fashioning a secular Arab nation-state. Indeed, doubts over the advisability of an Arab nation seemed even to have crossed Christian minds, for as Albert Hourani tells us, they could not be certain that Arab nationalism would not turn out to be a new form of Islamic self-assertion.46 Squeezed, therefore, between Muslim obsession with the abode of Islam and Christian advocacy that had no resonance among the majority, Arab nationalism as an intellectual construct could hardly be said to have jelled, let alone .owered, in the nineteenth century.
content_units.azure_translation: 乌玛，而不是建立一个世俗的阿拉伯民族国家。事实上，对阿拉伯国家是否可取的怀疑似乎甚至已经在基督徒的脑海中闪过，因为正如阿尔伯特·胡拉尼告诉我们的那样，他们无法确定阿拉伯民族主义不会成为一种新的伊斯兰自我主张形式。46 因此，在穆斯林对伊斯兰教居所的痴迷和在大多数人中没有共鸣的基督教倡导之间，阿拉伯民族主义作为一种知识建构，很难说在 19 世纪流行起来，更不用说了。

content_units.text: Yet, the argument that the roots of the Arab nationalist move­ment were to be found in the nineteenth century does not rest solely on the intellectual output of the few Christian and Muslim thinkers of the time. Later nationalists also would point to the anti-Otto­man activities of a number of public and clandestine Arab political organizations, seeing these as manifestations of Arab nationalist fervor that was sweeping the Arabic-speaking parts of the Ottoman empire in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, culmi­nating in the Great Arab Revolt in 1916.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，阿拉伯民族主义运动的根源在于十九世纪的论点并不仅仅建立在当时少数基督教和穆斯林思想家的智力产出上。后来的民族主义者还指出一些公共和秘密阿拉伯政治组织的反奥斯曼活动，认为这些是阿拉伯民族主义热情的表现，这种热情在 19 世纪末和 20 世纪初席卷了奥斯曼帝国的阿拉伯语地区，最终导致了 1916 年的阿拉伯大起义。

content_units.text: Until recent historiography rendered a number of its central con­clusions questionable, George Antoniuss book, The Arab Awaken­ing, was the standard work that traced the inception and develop­ment of these nationalist manifestations and activities.47 The thrust of Antoniuss thesis is that on the eve of the First World War, the masses as well as the thinkers had been moved by the Arab will to freedom.48 According to Antonius, the genesis of the Arab na­tionalist movement could be traced back to the early nineteenth century to the political ambition of Muhamed Ali, the Albanian-born governor of Egypt, to establish an Arab kingdom independent of the Ottoman Empire. Ali and his son Ibrahim Pasha, who con­quered Syria and became its governor in 1833, appealed to the Arabs sense of separateness and to their ethnic and national differ­ences from the Turkish Ottomans. Ibrahim Pasha, during his years in Syria tried hard to stimulate an Arab national consciousness. After more than three centuries of being part of an all-inclusive Ottoman empire, the Arabs for the .rst time could ponder their separateness from those who ruled over them. Antonius relates that these initial national stirrings came to nothing primarily because of British opposition. In 1833, the British prime minister, Lord Palmerston, explained his antipathy to an Arab kingdom under Muhamed Ali: There might be no harm in such a thing in itself; but as it would imply the dismemberment of Turkey, we could not agree to it. Besides, Turkey is as good an occupier of the road to India as an active Arabian sovereign would be.49
content_units.azure_translation: 在最近的史学使其一些核心结论受到质疑之前，乔治·安东尼乌斯的著作《阿拉伯觉醒》是追溯这些民族主义表现和活动的起源和发展的标准著作。47 安东尼乌斯论点的主旨是，在第一次世界大战前夕，群众和思想家都被阿拉伯人的自由意志所感动。48 根据安东尼乌斯的说法，阿拉伯民族主义运动的起源可以追溯到 19 世纪初，阿尔巴尼亚出生的埃及总督穆罕默德·阿里 （Muhamed Ali） 的政治野心，即建立一个独立于奥斯曼帝国的阿拉伯王国。阿里和他的儿子易卜拉欣帕夏于 1833 年征服了叙利亚并成为总督，他们诉诸于阿拉伯人的分离感以及他们与土耳其奥斯曼帝国的种族和民族差异。易卜拉欣·帕夏在叙利亚的岁月里，努力激发阿拉伯民族意识。在成为包罗万象的奥斯曼帝国的一部分三个多世纪之后，阿拉伯人第一次可以思考他们与统治他们的人的分离。安东尼乌斯说，这些最初的全国骚动主要由于英国的反对而化为泡影。1833年，英国首相帕默斯顿勋爵解释了他对穆罕默德·阿里领导下的阿拉伯王国的反感：这样的事情本身可能没有坏处;但由于这意味着土耳其的肢解，我们不能同意。此外，土耳其是通往印度之路的好占领者，就像一个活跃的阿拉伯主权国家一样。49

content_units.text: Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, p. 277.
George Antonius, The Arab Awakening: The Story of the Arab National Movement (Beirut: Khayats, 1938).
Ibid., p. 121; see also Kirk, The Arab Awakening Reconsidered, p. 162.

But the Per.dious Albion was not the only reason for the proj­ects failure. The Arabs themselves, as Antonius readily admits, were not yet ready for it. To say that at the time there was nothing approaching an awareness of a national identity among the Arabs is perhaps to understate the obstacles faced by Muhamed Ali and his son. Peoples loyalties were particularistic, primarily regional and sectarian, according to the district, clan or creed to which they belonged.... Patriotism in the national sense was un­known.50 The very term Arab was bereft of national symbol­ism; in general it was used to describe the desert bedouin.51 Given the opposition of Great Britain and the formidable cultural obsta­cles it encountered, it was no wonder that the .rst real efforts to construct an Arab nation and give it a political manifestation came to very little.
content_units.azure_translation: 但 Per.dious Albion 并不是项目失败的唯一原因。正如安东尼乌斯欣然承认的那样，阿拉伯人自己还没有准备好。如果说当时阿拉伯人对民族认同的认识还没有达到，也许是低估了穆罕默德·阿里和他的儿子所面临的障碍。人们的忠诚是特殊的，主要是地区和宗派，根据他们所属的地区、氏族或信仰......民族意义上的爱国主义是未知的。50 阿拉伯人这个词本身就没有民族象征意义;一般来说，它被用来描述沙漠贝都因人。51 鉴于英国的反对和它遇到的巨大文化障碍，难怪第一次真正努力建设一个阿拉伯国家并赋予其政治表现，但收效甚微也就不足为奇了。

content_units.text: Antonius insists, however, that the failure was not total. The seeds had been sown. The new ideas encouraged by Ibrahim Pasha in Syria, in addition to his relatively tolerant rule which opened the country to Western education through missionary schools, contrib­uted to the growth of nationalist sentiment in the generations that followed. During the second half of the nineteenth century, and al-Turkiya (The emergence of Arab nationalism with a historical study of Arab-Turkish relations), p. 43.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，安东尼乌斯坚持认为失败并不是完全的。种子已经播下。易卜拉欣帕夏在叙利亚鼓励的新思想，加上他相对宽容的统治，通过传教士学校向西方教育开放，促进了后来几代民族主义情绪的增长。在 19 世纪下半叶，和 al-Turkiya（阿拉伯民族主义的出现与阿拉伯-土耳其关系的历史研究），第 43 页。

content_units.text: Quoted in Antonius, The Arab Awakening,p.31. 50 Ibid., pp. 3233. 51 Zeine, Nushu al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya maa Dirasa Tarikhiya . al-Ilaqat al-Arabiya

especially in its later years, Antonius would characterize the stir­rings of nationalism among the Arabic-speaking populations of the Ottoman Empire as an infant national movement. To Antonius, this was clearly discernible from the growth of overt and covert Arab societies and organizations. The earliest of these was the ini­tially clandestine al-Jimiya al-Ilmiya al-Suriya (the Syrian Scien­ti.c Society), formed in 1857,52 to be followed in 1875 by another secret association headquartered in Beirut,53 and then later on in the early twentieth century by two public societies, al-Muntada al-Adabi (the Literary Club) and the Ottoman Decentralization Party, as well as three clandestine organizations, al-Qahtaniya, al-Fatat, and al-Ahd.54 It was these organizations and their activities, Anto­nius tells us emphatically, that carried the Arab nationalist torch, spreading its sparks among the Arab masses.
content_units.azure_translation: 特别是在晚年，安东尼乌斯将奥斯曼帝国阿拉伯语人口中民族主义的煽动描述为一场新生的民族运动。对安东尼乌斯来说，这从公开和隐蔽的阿拉伯社会和组织的发展中可以清楚地看出。其中最早的组织是最初秘密的 al-Jimiya al-Ilmiya al-Suriya（叙利亚科学协会），成立于 1857 年，52 随后于 1875 年成立了另一个总部位于贝鲁特的秘密协会，53 然后在 20 世纪初成立了两个公共社团，al-Muntada al-Adabi（文学俱乐部）和奥斯曼帝国权力下放党， 以及三个秘密组织，al-Qahtaniya、al-Fatat 和 al-Ahd。54 安东尼乌斯强调告诉我们，正是这些组织及其活动传递了阿拉伯民族主义的火炬，在阿拉伯群众中传播了火花。

content_units.text: The effect of Antoniuss analysis and conclusions was to create a historiographic tradition that projected an almost idealized his­torical period, stretching from about the middle of the nineteenth century to the First World War, as the era in which a national identity took roots among the Arabic-speaking populations of the Ottoman Empire. For some time into the twentieth century, the Antonius thesis was not seriously challenged, and not until the post-World War II period did new scholarship begin to question the methods and conclusions of Antoniuss work.
content_units.azure_translation: 安东尼乌斯的分析和结论的效果是创造了一种史学传统，该传统投射了一个几乎理想化的历史时期，从大约 19 世纪中叶一直延伸到第一次世界大战，作为民族认同在奥斯曼帝国讲阿拉伯语的人群中扎根的时代。进入二十世纪的一段时间里，安东尼乌斯的论点并没有受到严重的挑战，直到二战后时期，新的学术界才开始质疑安东尼乌斯工作的方法和结论。

content_units.text: In a seminal work, C. Ernest Dawn asserts that prior to October 1914, only 126 men were known to have been public advocates of Arab nationalism, or members of Arab nationalist societies.... Using the only available population estimates for 1915, there were
content_units.azure_translation: C. Ernest Dawn 在一部开创性的著作中断言，在 1914 年 10 月之前，已知只有 126 名男性是阿拉伯民族主义的公开倡导者或阿拉伯民族主义社团的成员。使用 1915 年唯一可用的人口估计值，有

content_units.text: 3.5 Arab nationalist leaders per 100,000 of total population in Syria . . . 3.1 in Palestine and 2.4 in Lebanon.55 In a later study, Eliezer Tauber identi.es 180 activists56an in.nitesimally tiny number, hardly indicative of a widespread swell of nationalist emo­tions among the Arab populations of the Ottoman Empire. Indeed, Tauber further shows that those who agitated against Ottoman control prior to World War I were more likely to form societies promoting regional interests, such as independence for Syria, Leba­non, or Iraq, than demanding political separation under an all-inclusive Arab identity.57 In the case of Syria, for instance, Hassan Kayali, using extensive Ottoman archives, as well as Arabic and European sources, argues that it would be more appropriate to refer to Syrianism rather than Arab nationalism in the period be­fore the world war. Both the decentralists in the major towns of Syria and the Arab voices calling (mostly from Europe or Egypt) for a political existence independent of Istanbul thought in terms of Syria when espousing Arab group consciousness as a political idiom.58 And in this, these societies simply re.ected the general proclivities of the masses, the vast majority of whom were indiffer­ent to Arab nationalist concerns.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚每10万人口中有3.5名阿拉伯民族主义领导人......巴勒斯坦3.1，黎巴嫩2.4。55 在后来的一项研究中，埃利泽·陶伯 （Eliezer Tauber） identi.es 180 名活动家56 这个数字极小，这几乎不表明奥斯曼帝国的阿拉伯人口中民族主义情绪的广泛膨胀。事实上，陶伯进一步表明，那些在第一次世界大战前鼓动反对奥斯曼帝国控制的人更有可能组建促进地区利益的社会，例如叙利亚、黎巴嫩或伊拉克的独立，而不是要求在包罗万象的阿拉伯身份下进行政治分离。57 例如，就叙利亚而言，哈桑·卡亚利 （Hassan Kayali） 使用了大量的奥斯曼档案以及阿拉伯语和欧洲资料， 认为在世界大战前时期，提及叙利亚主义而不是阿拉伯民族主义更合适。叙利亚主要城镇的权力下放主义者和呼吁（主要来自欧洲或埃及）的阿拉伯人在拥护阿拉伯群体意识作为一种政治习语时，都以叙利亚的角度考虑了独立于伊斯坦布尔的政治存在。58 在这一点上，这些社会只是重新反映了群众的普遍倾向，其中绝大多数人对阿拉伯民族主义的关切漠不关心。

content_units.text: Antonius, The Arab Awakening, pp. 5355.
Ibid., pp. 7989.
Dawn, From Ottomanism to Arabism, pp. 152153.
Eliezer Tauber, The Emergence of the Arab Movements (London: Frank Cass, 1993), p. 289.

Indeed, even those supposedly Arab nationalist societies inter­mittently felt the strains of regional loyalties. After World War I al­Ahd disintegrated into a Syrian faction, al-Ahd al-Suri, and an Iraqi faction, al-Ahd al-Iraqi.59 And in any case, those Arabist societies seemed more concerned with promoting the growth of the political and cultural standing of the Arab citizens of the Ottoman Empire vis-a`-vis their Turkish compatriots, than with advocating outright Arab political independence and sovereignty. Their politi­cal demands generally were for some form of autonomy within the Ottoman Empire. For instance, the .rst article of al-Ahds pro­gram, enunciated in 1913, stated that the societys goal was to work for internal independence for the Arab countries, so that they will remain united with the Istanbul government, and the second article pledged the society to the Islamic caliphate remaining as a consecrated trust in the hands of the Ottoman dynasty.60
content_units.azure_translation: 事实上，即使是那些所谓的阿拉伯民族主义社会也间歇性地感受到了地区忠诚的压力。第一次世界大战后，阿赫德解体为叙利亚派系阿赫德·苏里和伊拉克派系阿赫德·伊拉克。59 无论如何，这些阿拉伯社会似乎更关心促进奥斯曼帝国阿拉伯公民相对于土耳其同胞的政治和文化地位的提高，而不是倡导彻底的阿拉伯政治独立和主权。他们的政治要求通常是在奥斯曼帝国内部实现某种形式的自治。例如，1913 年宣布的 al-Ahds 计划的第一条指出，该协会的目标是为阿拉伯国家争取内部独立，以便它们与伊斯坦布尔政府保持团结，第二条则向伊斯兰哈里发保证该协会继续作为奥斯曼王朝手中的神圣信托。60

content_units.text: Ibid., Tauber identi.es 207 such regionalist activists. See also Efraim and Inari Karsh, Re.ections on Arab Nationalism, in Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 32, no. 4 (October 1996): 373.
Hasan Kayali, Arabs and Young Turks: Ottomanism, Arabism and Islamism in the Ottoman Empire, 19081918 (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1997), p. 212.
Tauber, The Emergence of the Arab Movements, p. 333.

As a general rule, it was, as has already been shown, the Arab Christians who tended to favor complete independence. This was to be expected since the Christians had the inferior standing of a religious minority in an Islamic state, and independence leading to a secular Arab state would grant them equal footing with the Muslims. Antonius asserts that the Arab national movement may be said to have uttered its .rst cry61 with the poem by the Lebanese Christian, Ibrahim Yaziji, whose .rst line exhorts the Arabs to arise and awaken. In Antoniuss view, the poem did much to foster the national movement in its infancy . . . with its utterance, the movement for political emancipation sang its .rst song.62 Be that as it may, it is interesting that the dramatic nationalist exhortation of the poems .rst line is followed by appeals to the Muslims to forget religious divisions and abjure fanaticism [and to] remember that among the Arabs there are both Christians and Muslims.63 Indeed, the Beirut secret society which was organized in 1875 by Yaziji and four other Christians, and to which Antonius attaches great importance for its impact on the Arab national movement,64 .oundered in 18821883 for lack of Muslim support.65 Moreover, Antoniuss claim that the society was formed to liberate Arab lands from Istanbul, is disputed by Zeine N. Zeine, who tapped the same source used by Antonius. Zeine states that the societys objective was focused on the liberation of Lebanon, not other Arab coun­tries, from Turkish domination.66 And even here, the primary im­pulse would more accurately be described as subnational: it was
content_units.azure_translation: 一般来说，正如已经表明的那样，阿拉伯基督徒倾向于完全独立。这是可以预料的，因为基督徒在伊斯兰国家中处于宗教少数派的劣势地位，而独立导致世俗阿拉伯国家将使他们与穆斯林平等。安东尼乌斯断言，可以说阿拉伯民族运动用黎巴嫩基督徒易卜拉欣·亚齐吉的诗发出了它的第一声呐喊61，他的第一句劝告阿拉伯人起来和觉醒。在安东尼乌斯看来，这首诗在起步阶段对促进民族运动做出了很大贡献......随着它的发言，政治解放运动唱出了它的第一首歌。62 尽管如此，有趣的是，诗歌中戏剧性的民族主义劝告。第一行之后，呼吁穆斯林忘记宗教分歧，摒弃狂热主义，[并]记住，阿拉伯人中既有基督徒，也有穆斯林。63 事实上，贝鲁特秘密社团由亚齐吉和其他四名基督徒于 1875 年组织，安东尼乌斯非常重视它对阿拉伯民族运动的影响，64 18821883 年因缺乏穆斯林支持而失败。65 此外，安东尼乌斯声称该社团的成立是为了从伊斯坦布尔解放阿拉伯土地， Zeine N. Zeine 对此提出异议，他利用了安东尼乌斯使用的相同来源。泽因指出，该协会的目标侧重于将黎巴嫩而不是其他阿拉伯国家从土耳其的统治下解放出来。66 即使在这里，主要冲动也可以更准确地描述为次国家：它是

content_units.text: only the Lebanese Christians, not the other groups within Leba­non, who felt their interests would be served by independence from the Empire.
content_units.azure_translation: 只有黎巴嫩基督徒，而不是黎巴嫩境内的其他群体，他们认为脱离帝国独立将满足他们的利益。

content_units.text: As for the general public, subnational identi.cation with religion or sect, town and village, family and tribe remained the most rele­vant focus of an individuals loyalty. Gertrude Bell, who spent al­most all of her adult life in the Arab world, and who, as the British Colonial Of.ce representative in Baghdad in the 1920s, became the uncrowned queen of Iraq after the latters independence, captures this lack of national bond well: There is little or no terri­torial nationality.... If you ask a (Syrian) to what nationality he belongs he will reply . . . that he is a native of Damascus or AleppoI have already indicated that Syria is merely a geographic term corresponding to no national sentiment in the breasts of the inhabitants.67 In another instance, Bell used stronger language in describing the same phenomenon:
content_units.azure_translation: 对于公众来说，国家以下对宗教或教派、城镇和村庄、家庭和部落的认同仍然是个人忠诚度的最相关关注点。格特鲁德·贝尔 （Gertrude Bell） 几乎在阿拉伯世界度过了她成年后的一生，作为 1920 年代英国殖民地驻巴格达的代表，在伊拉克独立后成为伊拉克的无冕女王，她很好地抓住了这种缺乏民族纽带的问题：很少或根本没有领土国籍......如果你问一个（叙利亚人）他属于哪个国籍，他会回答......他是大马士革或阿勒颇人我已经指出，叙利亚只是一个地理术语，与居民胸中没有民族情绪相对应。67 在另一个例子中，贝尔在描述同一现象时使用了更强烈的语言：

content_units.text: Of what value are the pan-Arabic associations and in.ammatory lea.ets that they issue from foreign printing presses? The answer is easy: they are worth nothing at all. There is no nation of Arabs; the Syrian merchant is separated by a wider gulf from the bedouin than he is from the Osmanli (Ottoman), the Syrian country is inhabited by Arabic-speaking races all eager to be at each others throats, and only prevented from ful.lling their natural desires by the ragged half fed soldier who draws at rare intervals the Sultans pay.68
content_units.azure_translation: 他们从外国印刷机发行的泛阿拉伯语协会和国际证书有什么价值？答案很简单：它们一文不值。没有阿拉伯人的民族;叙利亚商人与贝都因人的隔阂比他与奥斯曼利人（奥斯曼帝国）的隔阂还要宽，叙利亚国家居住着讲阿拉伯语的种族，他们都渴望互相争吵，只有苏丹人罕见地掏钱的衣衫褴褛的半饱士兵才能满足他们的自然欲望68。

content_units.text: The only identity that seemed able to bind this human and com­munal mosaic was Islam. Talib Mushtaq, an Iraqi bureaucrat-politi­cian, reminiscing on the Arab situation in the Ottoman period, was categorical on where his loyalty lay: Were we really subjects of imperialism when Iraq was under Ottoman rule? Never! We were one nation, living under one .ag. The bond of religion bound us in the .rmest of ties. Islam united our hearts and our feelings, and made us one bloc, supporting each other, like a solid building.69 And indeed, with the gradual loss of the Christian Balkans, the Ottoman Empire acquired an increasingly more coherent religious identity that bound Arab and Turk in one Islamic brotherhood.
content_units.azure_translation: 唯一似乎能够将这种人类和社区马赛克联系在一起的身份是伊斯兰教。伊拉克官僚兼政治家塔利布·穆什塔克（Talib Mushtaq）在回忆奥斯曼帝国时期的阿拉伯局势时，明确指出了他的忠诚所在：当伊拉克处于奥斯曼帝国统治之下时，我们真的是帝国主义的臣民吗？从不！我们是一个国家，生活在一个.ag之下。宗教的纽带将我们紧密地联系在一起。伊斯兰教将我们的心和感情团结在一起，使我们成为一个集团，相互支持，就像一座坚固的建筑。69 事实上，随着基督教巴尔干半岛的逐渐丧失，奥斯曼帝国获得了一种越来越连贯的宗教身份，将阿拉伯人和土耳其人联系在一起，成为一个伊斯兰兄弟情谊。

content_units.text: Janet Wallach, Desert Queen: The Extraordinary Life of Gertrude Bell (New York: Doubleday, 1996), pp. 7778.

Quoted in Martin Kramer, Arab Awakening and Islamic Revival: The Politics of Ideas in the Middle East (New Brunswick, New Jersey: Transaction Publishers, 1996), p. 24. Echoing Gertrude Bells observation, the wife of the British Council in Syria commented in late nineteenth century that the Syrians hate one another. The Sunnis excommunicate the Shias and both hate the Druze; all detest the Alawis. . . Quoted in Martha Neff Kessler, Syria: Fragile Mosaic of Power (Washington, D.C.: National Defense University Press, 1987), p. 22.

Prior to World War I, therefore, the majority of the Arab popula­tion were not ready for a break with Istanbul, and the small minor­ity who formed themselves into oppositional groups demanded lit­tle more than an improvement in their social and political conditions within the Empire. This is to be clearly discerned from the proposals formulated by Arab activists who met in Paris in June 1913. The most relevant of these proposals, which were communi­cated to the Ottoman authorities are summed up as follows:70 that political reforms were necessary for all citizens; that Arabs would participate more actively in the Empires government; that a decen­tralized administrative regime would be established in every Arab province; and that Arabic would be the of.cial language in the Arab provinces, and furthermore would be recognized as the sec­ond of.cial language in the Empire.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，在第一次世界大战之前，大多数阿拉伯人还没有准备好与伊斯坦布尔决裂，而少数人组成反对派团体，只要求改善他们在帝国内部的社会和政治条件。这可以从1913年6月在巴黎开会的阿拉伯活动家提出的建议中清楚地看出。这些建议中最相关的建议已传达给奥斯曼当局，总结如下：70 政治改革对所有公民都是必要的;阿拉伯人将更积极地参与帝国政府;将在每个阿拉伯省份建立权力下放的行政制度;阿拉伯语将成为阿拉伯省份的通用语言，并且将被承认为帝国的第二通用语言。

content_units.text: These proposals are an accurate depiction of the political orienta­tions of the activist few.71 They might have considered themselves culturally distinct from their fellow Turkish citizens, and if so they would be called Arabists; but they were hardly Arab national­ists, for they sought neither the separation of the Arab territories from the empire, nor the creation of a distinct Arab nation with de.ned territorial boundaries.72 And even these modest demands never elicited widespread support. As late as the early twentieth century, a Syrian Christian judge, who was later to become a Minis­ter in the post-World War I Arab administration in Damascus under the Hashemite Faysal, remarked that if there were any national sen­timent, it was felt only by a few members of the upper class.73 And there certainly was no serious move to extract the Arab lands of the Empire from Istanbul until the Great Arab Revolt proclaimed by Husayn ibn Ali, the sharif of Mecca, in the spring of 1916.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些建议准确地描述了少数活动家的政治取向。71 他们可能认为自己在文化上与土耳其同胞不同，如果是这样，他们就会被称为阿拉伯主义者;但他们几乎不是阿拉伯民族主义者，因为他们既不寻求将阿拉伯领土与帝国分离，也不寻求建立一个具有固定领土边界的独特阿拉伯国家。72 即使是这些适度的要求也从未引起广泛的支持。直到 20 世纪初，一位叙利亚基督教法官，后来成为第一次世界大战后大马士革哈希姆派费萨尔领导下的阿拉伯政府的部长，他评论说，如果有任何民族情绪，只有少数上层阶级成员才能感受到。73 当然，在阿拉伯大起义之前，肯定没有采取任何认真的行动从伊斯坦布尔夺走帝国的阿拉伯土地侯赛因·伊本·阿里，麦加的谢里夫，1916 年春天。

content_units.text: C. Ernest Dawn, The Origins of Arab Nationalism, in The Origins of Arab National­ism, eds. Rashid Khalidi, Lisa Anderson, Muhamed Muslih, and Reeva S. Simon (New York: Columbia University Press, 1991), p. 23.
Only proposals relevant to our discussion are taken from the full list of proposals as summarized in Majid Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World, pp. 1718.

Walid Kazziha argues that the Ayan (socioeconomic elites) in their efforts to protect their economic and administrative interests against the increasingly intrusive Ottoman state were central to the propagation of decentralization and Arab unity. See his al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Marhalat ma bayn al-Harbayn al-Alamiyatayn (Arab nationalism in the period between the two world wars) al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no. 5 (January 1979): 61.

The Great Arab Revolt came to be enshrined in nationalist mem­ory and historiography as the patriotic spark that would ignite the Arab nationalist movement, gain Arab independence, and launch the Arabs on their quest for political unity in one state under one government. In reality, however, the terms on which the revolt was originally launched had little to do with Arab nationalism. William Cleveland asserts that the revolt was proclaimed in the name of preserving Islam, not in the name of Arabism or the Arab nation.74 Aziz al-Azmeh is more categorical: The Arab Revolt . . . does not belong to the register of . . . Arab nationalism, and it really ought to be excised from the chronicles of Arab nationalism. It was Arab only in the narrow ethnological, pre-nationalist sense. It was an Islamist rebellion, undertaken in the name not of the Arabs, but of a Meccan Caliphate under the Sharif Husayn bin Ali.75 Indeed, Husayn himself felt that the Arabs would unite only under the ban­ner of Islam.76 It was hardly surprising, therefore, that Sharif Hu­ sayn would characterize the Young Turks as impious innovators who had put Islam in danger, thus justifying his call to arms against the Turks as a defense of the faith.77 The sharif and his sons were indeed cognizant of the hostility of the Arab Muslims to their re­volt, which explains, if not wholly, at least partially, why the revolt was couched in Islamic rather than Arab symbolism. The sharifs third son, Prince Faysal, who was to become King of Syria for a short period, and then King of Iraq, con.ded that the position of the Shari.an family had become dif.cult after Muslims accused it of destroying the Islamic (Ottoman) Empire.78 And in any case, the Arab nationalist credentials of Sharif Husayn himself are rather questionable. C. Ernest Dawn has persuasively shown that up to 1914 Husayn was a loyal supporter of the Ottoman Empire, who was not averse to using his Arab forces in support of Turkish troops against the Arabs in the Arabian Peninsula.79 He rebelled against Istanbul only after the Ottomans rejected his demands for a hereditary monarchy in al-Hejaz.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯大起义被载入民族主义记忆和史学中，成为点燃阿拉伯民族主义运动、获得阿拉伯独立并启动阿拉伯人寻求在一个政府下的一个国家的政治统一的爱国火花。然而，实际上，最初发动起义的条款与阿拉伯民族主义关系不大。威廉·克利夫兰断言，起义是以保护伊斯兰教的名义宣布的，而不是以阿拉伯主义或阿拉伯民族的名义宣布的。74 阿齐兹·阿兹梅（Aziz al-Azmeh）则更明确：阿拉伯起义......不属于......阿拉伯民族主义，它确实应该从阿拉伯民族主义的编年史中删除。它只是狭隘的民族学、前民族主义意义上的阿拉伯人。这是一场伊斯兰叛乱，不是以阿拉伯人的名义，而是以谢里夫·侯赛因·本·阿里领导下的麦加哈里发的名义发动的。75 事实上，侯赛因本人认为阿拉伯人只有在伊斯兰教的旗帜下才能团结起来。76 因此，谢里夫·胡赛因将青年土耳其人描述为不虔诚的革新者，他们将伊斯兰教置于危险之中，从而为他号召武装对抗土耳其人以捍卫信仰为由也就不足为奇了。77 谢里夫和他的儿子们确实意识到阿拉伯穆斯林对他们叛乱的敌意， 这解释了为什么起义是伊斯兰而不是阿拉伯的象征意义，即使不是全部，也至少部分地解释了。谢里夫的第三个儿子费萨尔王子将短暂成为叙利亚国王，然后成为伊拉克国王，他承认，在穆斯林指责伊斯兰教法家族摧毁伊斯兰（奥斯曼）帝国后，伊斯兰教法家族的地位已经变得不愉快。78 无论如何，谢里夫·侯赛因本人的阿拉伯民族主义资历是相当值得怀疑的。欧内斯特·道恩 （C. Ernest Dawn） 令人信服地表明，直到 1914 年，侯赛因一直是奥斯曼帝国的忠实支持者，他并不反对使用他的阿拉伯军队支持土耳其军队对抗阿拉伯半岛的阿拉伯人。79 直到奥斯曼帝国拒绝他在汉志实行世袭君主制的要求后，他才反抗伊斯坦布尔。

Not only had the motives of the sharif little to do with Arabism, the support his call for rebellion received from the Arabic-speaking populations of the Ottoman Empire was nowhere near as sponta­neous and enthusiastic as originally portrayed, putting into ques­tion whether the sharifs rebellion was, or should in any way be called, the Great Arab Revolt. The most strident attack, akin to a frontal assault, on the old thesis of widespread Arab support was provided by Efraim and Inari Karsh in two articles published in Middle Eastern Studies in 1996 and 1997.80 Relying mainly on Brit­ ish documents of the period, especially Foreign Of.ce dispatches and intelligence reports, the Karshes paint a picture of, if anything, a prevailing mood of apathy directed against the person of the sha­rif as well as against the general notion of a revolt spurred by a commitment to the extrication of the Arab nation from under the hegemony of the Turks.
content_units.azure_translation: 谢里夫的动机不仅与阿拉伯主义关系不大，而且他呼吁叛乱从奥斯曼帝国的阿拉伯语人口那里得到的支持也远没有最初描述的那么自发和热情，这让人质疑谢里夫的叛乱是否是，或者无论如何都应该被称为阿拉伯大起义。埃夫雷姆和伊纳里·卡什在 1996 年和 1997 年发表在《中东研究》上的两篇文章中提供了对广泛阿拉伯支持的旧论点的最严厉的攻击，类似于正面攻击。80 卡什夫妇主要依靠当时英国的文件，特别是外国通讯和情报报告，描绘了一幅图景： 如果有的话，那就是针对谢里夫个人的普遍冷漠情绪，以及对致力于将阿拉伯民族从土耳其人的霸权统治下解救出来所引发的叛乱的普遍观念。

The Karshes argue that not even in his own backyard, al-Hejaz, did the sharif receive universal or overwhelming support. Medina, and perhaps less so Taif, seem to have been more inclined to the Turks than to the man who crowned himself King of the Arab Countries, and later accepted the British and French designation, King of al-Hejaz. Even in his own seat of power, his hometown of Mecca, things were not that rosy. A British intelligence report, dated December 1916, a full six months after the sharif proclaimed the revolt, found the people of Mecca almost pro-Turk.81
content_units.azure_translation: 卡尔什夫妇认为，即使在他自己的后院汉志，谢里夫也没有得到普遍或压倒性的支持。麦地那，也许不太像塔伊夫，似乎更倾向于土耳其人，而不是那个自封为阿拉伯国家国王的人，后来接受了英国和法国的称号，即汉志国王。即使在他自己的权力宝座，他的家乡麦加，情况也并非如此美好。1916 年 12 月，即谢里夫宣布起义整整六个月后，一份英国情报报告发现麦加人民几乎亲土耳其。81

content_units.text: The tribes, individualistic and divided, had posed a special chal­lenge for the sharif. Here again, the Karshes energetically question the account by George Antonius. According to Antonius, the sha­rifs savviest son, Faysal, tried to convert the tribes to the shari.an cause through the three leversgold, in.uence, and a message.82 But Antonius holds that while money and in.uence were important levers, it was the message, the gospel of Arab emancipation that would .re the minds of the tribes. He continues:
content_units.azure_translation: 这些部落，个人主义和分裂，给谢里夫人带来了特殊的挑战。在这里，卡什夫妇再次强烈质疑乔治·安东尼乌斯的叙述。根据安东尼乌斯的说法，谢里夫精明的长子费萨尔试图通过三个杠杆黄金、in.uence 和一条信息使部落皈依伊斯兰教法事业。82 但安东尼乌斯认为，虽然金钱和财力是重要的杠杆，但阿拉伯解放的信息和福音将影响部落的思想。他继续说：

content_units.text: . . . the gospel which Faysal preached found ears attuned to its music. By his own faith sustained, he worked indefatigably, month after month, until the barriers were removed, the reconciliations ef­fected, and the inveterate enemies of several generations, in.icted with his faith, had taken an oath to serve as brothers in arms under him for the liberation of all Arabs, and to hold independence dearer than family, property or life itself.83
content_units.azure_translation: . . .费萨尔所宣讲的福音找到了与音乐相协调的耳朵。凭借他自己的信仰，他月复一月地不知疲倦地工作，直到障碍被消除，和解实现，几代人的根深蒂固的敌人在他的信仰中宣誓，为解放所有阿拉伯人而成为他手下的战友，并将独立视为比家庭、财产或生命本身更珍贵83。

content_units.text: And indeed, it is this view that most Arabs held for most of the twentieth century. The Karshes hold it to be a romanticized fantasy of a reality that was vastly different. To them, it was the glitter of British gold and the promise of ample bounty that rallied the Hejaz bedouins behind the Sharif.84 Tribal chiefs would negotiate end­lessly over remunerations until military operations were delayed, and once paid, many would withdraw from the sharifs war. If they felt any duty or commitment, it was to the British monetary coin­age. In this part of the world, observed a British military advisor to the shari.an army, gold is now so plentiful that the British sovereign may almost be said to be the unit of coinage.85 And according to T. E. Lawrence, himself a great sympathizer with the shari.an cause, it was the availability of British gold that allowed Faysal to buy off the tribes, for nothing else would have main­tained a nomad force for .ve months in the .eld.86 Contrary to the idealized account of Antonius, British money seems to have been a far more potent weapon in bringing the tribes to the sha­ri.an cause than Faysals message of Arab emancipation from Turkish rule.
content_units.azure_translation: 事实上，大多数阿拉伯人在20世纪的大部分时间里都持有这种观点。卡什夫妇认为这是对现实的浪漫幻想，而现实却截然不同。对他们来说，正是英国黄金的闪闪发光和丰厚赏金的承诺将汉志贝都因人团结在谢里夫后面。84 部落酋长会无休止地就报酬进行谈判，直到军事行动被推迟，一旦支付报酬，许多人就会退出谢里夫战争。如果他们觉得有任何责任或承诺，那就是对英国货币铸币。在世界的这个地区，一位英国伊斯兰教法军事顾问观察到，现在黄金如此丰富，以至于英国君主几乎可以说是铸币单位。85 根据 T. E. Lawrence 本人对伊斯兰教法事业的强烈同情者说，正是英国黄金的供应使 Faysal 能够收买部落，因为没有其他任何东西可以维持一支游牧部队在 .eld 几个月。86 与安东尼乌斯的理想化描述相反，英国的钱似乎比费萨尔关于阿拉伯人从土耳其统治下解放出来的信息更能成为使部落信奉伊斯兰教法的有力武器。

content_units.text: Other parts of the Arabic-speaking lands of the Ottoman Empire exhibited a similar lack of enthusiasm for the revolt. After all, no fewer than 300,000 Arabs fought in the Ottoman army during the war.87 Egypts response to the sharifs revolt was avowedly hostile. The Egyptian newspaper, al-Ahram, rhetorically asked whether the revolt was really a nationalist appeal, and its answer was an em­phatic no, for the Turkish people as a whole have not tried to deprive other races from their birthright.88 Antonius, himself, con­cedes this antipathy within Egypt, describing it as real and scarcely veiled [deriving] its strength from anti-British as much as from pro-Turkish sentiment.89 But Antonius is more charitable to the Syrians and Iraqis who, he claims, responded to the shari.an revolt with universal enthusiasm.90 Later historical studies, how­ever, do not support such a sweeping contention. Hasan Kayali, for instance, maintains that the preponderance of localist and Otto­manist attitudes resulted in Syrian ambivalence about Sharif Hu­sayns revolt.91 Philip Khoury goes even further. He argues that Syrias urban notables, constituting the political leadership, not only did not embrace the revolt, but actually saw it as a treasonous act.92 As we have seen, Faysal, the sharifs son, conceded that Mus­lims generally blamed his family for destroying the Islamic (Otto­man) empire.93 No wonder then that as late as 1918, when the tide of war was clearly turning against the Ottomans, Lawrence in a secret dispatch to London would write that a spontaneous anti-Ottoman rebellion in Syria was an impossibility.94
content_units.azure_translation: 奥斯曼帝国阿拉伯语国家的其他地区也表现出对起义的类似缺乏热情。毕竟，战争期间至少有 300,000 名阿拉伯人在奥斯曼军队中作战。87 埃及对谢里夫起义的反应是公开的敌对。埃及报纸《阿赫拉姆报》反问起义是否真的是民族主义的呼吁，它的回答是坚决否定的，因为整个土耳其人民并没有试图剥夺其他种族与生俱来的权利。88 安东尼乌斯本人也承认埃及国内的这种反感，称其为真实的，几乎不加掩饰，其力量既来自反英情绪，也来自亲土耳其情绪。89 但安东尼乌斯对叙利亚人和伊拉克人更仁慈，他声称，他们以普遍的热情回应了伊斯兰教法的叛乱。90 然而，后来的历史研究并不支持这种笼统的论点。例如，哈桑·卡亚利（Hasan Kayali）坚持认为，地方主义和奥斯曼主义态度占主导地位导致叙利亚人对谢里夫·侯赛因斯起义的矛盾心理。91 菲利普·库里 （Philip Khoury） 走得更远。他认为，构成政治领导层的叙利亚城市名人不仅不接受叛乱，而且实际上将其视为叛国行为。92 正如我们所见，谢里夫的儿子费萨尔承认，穆斯林普遍指责他的家人摧毁了伊斯兰（奥斯曼帝国）。93 难怪直到 1918 年，当战局明显转向对奥斯曼帝国不利时，劳伦斯在一封前往伦敦的秘密电报中写道，叙利亚自发的反奥斯曼叛乱是不可能的。94

Nor was the sentiment any different in Palestine. Two full years after the beginning of the shari.an revolt, a British report stated that the Muslims of Palestine took little interest in the Arab na­tional movement, and in fact were as hostile to it as the Egyptians in Cairo and Alexandria.95 Colonel Richard Meinertzhagen, direc­tor of intelligence in the Egyptian Expeditionary Force, relates an incident that speaks volumes about prevailing attitudes in Palestine at the time. In December 1917, a full eighteen months after the sharifs declaration of his revolt, British forces entered the Palestin­ian town of Ramleh, a few miles south of Jaffa.
content_units.azure_translation: 巴勒斯坦的情绪也没有什么不同。伊斯兰教法起义开始整整两年后，一份英国报告称，巴勒斯坦的穆斯林对阿拉伯民族运动兴趣不大，事实上与开罗和亚历山大的埃及人一样敌视它。95 埃及远征军情报总监理查德·迈纳茨哈根上校讲述了一个事件，它充分说明了当时巴勒斯坦的普遍态度。1917 年 12 月，即谢里夫宣布起义整整 18 个月后，英国军队进入了雅法以南几英里处的巴勒斯坦城镇拉姆莱。

As for the Iraqis of Mesopotamia, it certainly would be a gross exaggeration to describe their reaction to the revolt, as Antonius did, as universally enthusiastic. The majority of the population was Shiite with little af.nity for the Sunni sharif. Indeed, the Shiite clergy were generally hostile to the sharifs alliance with the En­glish in.dels against the Muslim Ottoman state.97 Moreover, both the tribal and urban political leaders, such as Seyyid Taleb, the leading member of Basrahs notables, showed little inclination to give way to the sharif. Indeed, Taleb had his own extensive contacts with the British. He wanted to be the ruler, preferably, of Iraq, but at a minimum of Basrah.98 Nor did the thriving Christian and Jew­ish communities of Iraq .nd palatable their incorporation into a Muslim-dominated kingdom ruled from Mecca. Indeed, the Iraqis generally were so lukewarm to the sharif that the British had great dif.culties in persuading Mesopotamian prisoners of war, detained in India, to join the Sharifs revolt.99 Notwithstanding Antoniuss claims, the people of Mesopotamia seem to have been no more enthusiastic about the sharif than their counterparts in Egypt, Syria, and Palestine.
content_units.azure_translation: 至于美索不达米亚的伊拉克人，如果像安东尼乌斯那样将他们对起义的反应描述为普遍的热情，那肯定是夸张的。大多数人口是什叶派，对逊尼派谢里夫没有什么兴趣。事实上，什叶派神职人员普遍敌视谢里夫与英国 in.dels 的联盟，反对穆斯林奥斯曼帝国。97 此外，部落和城市政治领导人，例如巴士拉名人的主要成员赛义德·塔勒布，都没有表现出让位于谢里夫的倾向。事实上，塔勒布与英国人有着广泛的联系。他想成为伊拉克的统治者，最好是伊拉克的统治者，但至少是巴士拉的统治者。98 伊拉克蓬勃发展的基督教和犹太社区也不愿意将他们纳入一个由麦加统治的穆斯林主导的王国。事实上，伊拉克人通常对谢里夫不冷不热，以至于英国人在说服被拘留在印度的美索不达米亚战俘加入谢里夫起义方面有很大的困难。99 尽管安东尼乌斯声称，美索不达米亚人民对谢里夫的热情似乎并不比埃及、叙利亚和巴勒斯坦的人民更热情。

content_units.text: The intellectual and scholarly debate regarding Antonius and his claims about the genesis of the Arab nationalist movement did not abate by the end of the twentieth century. But by then its focus had shifted. It centered not on whether Antonius was right or wrong, but on whether at least some of his judgments and conclusions were valid.100 On the whole, if a judgment on early Arab national­ ism is to be made, cumulative historical evidence seems to strongly endorse Majid Khadduris view:
content_units.azure_translation: 关于安东尼乌斯及其关于阿拉伯民族主义运动起源的主张的知识和学术辩论在二十世纪末并没有减弱。但那时它的重点已经转移了。它的核心不是安东尼乌斯是对还是错，而是他的至少一些判断和结论是否有效。100 总的来说，如果要对早期阿拉伯民族主义做出判断，累积的历史证据似乎强烈支持马吉德·卡杜里斯的观点：

Before World War I . . . Arab nationalism scarcely aimed beyond the rehabilitation of the Arab race in a multinational empire. Some thinkers called for a restoration of the Arab empire, presumably implying that Arab political leadership should be separated from that of the Turks, but most Arabs were content to remain within the frame of the Ottoman unity, as long as their proper place was recognized by the Turkish rulers.101
content_units.azure_translation: 第一次世界大战之前......阿拉伯民族主义的目标几乎不止于在多民族帝国中恢复阿拉伯种族。一些思想家呼吁恢复阿拉伯帝国，大概意味着阿拉伯的政治领导权应该与土耳其人的政治领导层分开，但大多数阿拉伯人满足于留在奥斯曼帝国统一的框架内，只要土耳其统治者承认他们的适当地位。

content_units.text: As we have seen, the few thinkers who extolled the uniqueness and many virtues of the Arab nation, and most signi.cantly its racial and cultural separateness, were mainly Christians with whom very few, if any, of the Muslim majority concurred. To the Muslim thinkers, the concept of the Arab nation, if they thought about it at all, was completely subsumed within, and subservient to, the vision of the Islamic Umma. And as with the secret and public Arab nationalist societies, and even with the shari.an re­volt, the vast majority of the Arab populations seemed detached from, or at best lukewarm about, any activity that spelled separa­tion from Istanbul.
content_units.azure_translation: 正如我们所见，少数赞美阿拉伯民族的独特性和许多美德，以及最显着的种族和文化分离的思想家主要是基督徒，大多数穆斯林中很少有人同意他们的观点。对于穆斯林思想家来说，阿拉伯民族的概念，如果他们仔细想想的话，就完全被纳入并服从于伊斯兰乌玛的愿景。与秘密和公开的阿拉伯民族主义社团，甚至伊斯兰教法起义一样，绝大多数阿拉伯人似乎对任何意味着与伊斯坦布尔分离的活动都疏远，或者充其量不冷不热。

content_units.text: The debate among the early nationalists as to whether the ethni­cally different Arabs should strive for political independence, or whether they should eschew the ethnic and linguistic divide in favor of Islamic solidarity and remain within the Ottoman framework became irrelevant in the wake of the Ottoman defeat in World War I and the consequent collapse of the Ottoman Empire. The Arabs were now treading new and unfamiliar grounds that, in the words of Albert Hourani, faced everyone, and in particular the members of the ruling elite, with an inescapable choice.102 It was thus only after the end of World War I that the Arab nation emerged as a
content_units.azure_translation: 在奥斯曼帝国在第一次世界大战中战败和随之而来的奥斯曼帝国崩溃之后，早期民族主义者之间关于种族不同阿拉伯人是否应该争取政治独立，或者他们是否应该避开种族和语言分歧，支持伊斯兰团结并留在奥斯曼帝国框架内的争论变得无关紧要。阿拉伯人现在正在踏上新的、陌生的土地，用阿尔伯特·胡拉尼的话来说，每个人都面临着一个不可避免的选择，尤其是统治精英的成员。102 因此，直到第一次世界大战结束后，阿拉伯国家才出现

Beyond the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, Arab participation in World War I on the side of the British yielded a number of bene­.ts for the Arab national movement. At a minimum, it allowed Arab leaders to take part in the post-World War I political debates over the future of the Middle East. Less tangible, but just as crucial, was its psychological impact. Later generations of determined na­tionalists would magnify, even mythologize, the Arab military con­tribution in their efforts to gain and inspire adherents. Most im­portant, the Arab involvement in the war led to the creation, with British help, of an Arab government in Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 除了奥斯曼帝国的崩溃之外，阿拉伯人站在英国一边参与第一次世界大战也为阿拉伯民族运动带来了许多bene.ts。至少，它允许阿拉伯领导人参与第一次世界大战后关于中东未来的政治辩论。不太明显，但同样重要的是它的心理影响。后世坚定的民族主义者在努力获得和激励追随者的过程中，会放大甚至神话阿拉伯的军事贡献。最重要的是，阿拉伯人参与战争导致在英国的帮助下在叙利亚成立了一个阿拉伯政府。

content_units.text: The Ottomans had suffered major military setbacks in 1917, opening the way for British forces under the command of General Allenby to move into Palestine from Egypt, capturing Jerusalem in December of that year. Arab forces led by Emir Faysal, Sharif Husayns son, paralleled Allenbys effort. Encouraged by British Liaison of.cers, particularly Captain T. E. Lawrence, Faysals tribal forces moved from al-Hejaz to capture Aqaba, then contin­ued northward along Allenbys right .ank. Focusing primarily on disrupting Ottoman communications and supply lines, Faysal was able to lead his troops into Damascus on October 1, 1918. He set out immediately to form an Arab administration.
content_units.azure_translation: 奥斯曼帝国在 1917 年遭受了重大军事挫折，为艾伦比将军指挥的英国军队从埃及进入巴勒斯坦开辟了道路，并于当年 12 月占领了耶路撒冷。由谢里夫·侯赛因斯之子埃米尔·费萨尔领导的阿拉伯军队与艾伦比的努力平行。在英国联络员，特别是 T. E. 劳伦斯上尉的鼓励下，费萨尔部落部队从汉志出发占领亚喀巴，然后继续沿着艾伦比斯右边向北行驶。费萨尔主要专注于破坏奥斯曼帝国的通信和补给线，于 1918 年 10 月 1 日率领他的部队进入大马士革。他立即着手组建阿拉伯政府。

content_units.text: Herein was a real opportunity for the idea of Arab nationalism to be institutionalized, for it found a compelling and emphatic spokesman in the person of Faysal. Needing to bestow legitimacy on his rule, which he thought could be tarnished by his Hejazi origins,104 he vigorously extolled the virtues of the larger Arab identity. He reminded the citizens of Syria that he and they be­longed to the same people, the Arabs, who lived in the region which is bounded by the sea in the east, the south, and the west, and by the Taurus mountains to the south.105 Time and time again he would extol the Arabs social unity, belittling the notion that the Arabs of the desert were somehow distinct from the Arabs of the cities. He would place loyalty to the Arab nation above all loyalties, even above allegiance to religious beliefs. The Arabs, he declared in a speech in Aleppo, were Arabs before Moses, Christ and Muhamed.106 Indeed, Muhamed was an Arab before being a prophet.107
content_units.azure_translation: 这是阿拉伯民族主义思想制度化的真正机会，因为它在费萨尔身上找到了一位令人信服和坚定的代言人。他认为自己的统治可能会因他的汉志血统而玷污，104 他需要赋予他的统治合法性，因此他大力赞扬更大的阿拉伯身份的美德。他提醒叙利亚公民，他和他们属于同一个民族，即阿拉伯人，他们生活在东、南、西三面以海为界，南以金牛座山脉为界的地区。105 他一次又一次地赞美阿拉伯人的社会团结，贬低沙漠中的阿拉伯人与城市中的阿拉伯人在某种程度上不同的观念。他将把对阿拉伯民族的忠诚置于一切忠诚之上，甚至高于对宗教信仰的忠诚。他在阿勒颇的一次演讲中宣称，在摩西、基督和穆罕默德之前，阿拉伯人是阿拉伯人。106 事实上，穆罕默德在成为先知之前是阿拉伯人。107

These ideas were put into operation by the national govern­ment.108 The governments policies were consciously and purposely nationalist and secularist. A number of Christians joined Faysals administration, participating actively in the countrys politics. Along with their Muslim colleagues, they generally were national­ists who believed in cementing Syrias Arab nationalist identity. Echoing the European nationalists emphasis on education, they set out to reform the educational system with the purpose of infus­ing future generations with the nationalist spirit. The man who spearheaded this effort was Sati al-Husri, an ex-Ottoman of.cial of Syrian descent, who had been appointed by Faysal to be his minister of education. Husri embarked on a wholesale Arabization of the Syrian school system. Textbooks were translated into Arabic, historical and social studies were expected to re.ect Arab national­ist concerns, and an Arab academy was established to .nd Arabic terms for scienti.c and technological use.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些想法被国家政府付诸实施。108 政府的政策是有意识的、有目的的民族主义和世俗主义的。一些基督徒加入了费萨尔政府，积极参与国家政治。与他们的穆斯林同事一起，他们通常是民族主义者，相信巩固叙利亚阿拉伯民族主义身份。呼应欧洲民族主义者对教育的重视，他们着手改革教育体系，目的是为子孙后代注入民族主义精神。带头这项工作的人是萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri），他是叙利亚血统的前奥斯曼帝国人，他被费萨尔任命为他的教育部长。胡斯里开始对叙利亚学校系统进行大规模的阿拉伯化。教科书被翻译成阿拉伯语，历史和社会研究有望反映阿拉伯民族主义的担忧，并建立了一所阿拉伯学院，以阿拉伯语术语用于科学和技术使用。

content_units.text: The tenure of Faysals Arab government was, however, too short-lived for these reforms to make themselves felt throughout the country. The 1916 Sykes-Picot agreement had parceled off the Arab Middle East into British and French zones of in.uence, an arrangement con.rmed and given legal status at the San Remo Conference of April 1920, which granted France mandatory pow­ers over Syria. A month earlier, however, a Syrian congress had
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，费萨尔阿拉伯政府的任期太短，这些改革无法在全国范围内得到体现。1916 年的赛克斯-皮科协议将阿拉伯中东划分为英国和法国的禁区，这一安排在 1920 年 4 月的圣雷莫会议上达成并赋予了法律地位，该协议授予法国对叙利亚的强制权力。然而，一个月前，叙利亚代表大会

19181970) (Damascus: Dar al Anwar, 1996), p. 26. proclaimed the independence of Greater Syria (including Lebanon and Palestine) with Faysal as its king. France, considering this ac­tion to be a usurpation of its rights, issued an ultimatum de­manding that Faysal accept the French mandate and recognize French control over the country. Faysal had little alternative but to succumb. His acceptance of French conditions however did not reach the French High Command by the speci.ed time. (Some sus­pect that it was deliberately disregarded by the French). General Henri Gouraud, commander of the French forces in the Levant, immediately marched his forces toward Damascus. A small Arab force, disorganized and poorly equipped, under the command of Faysals Minister of Defense Yousif al-Azma, blocked the path of the advancing French at the Maisalun Pass. The Arab units were utterly outnumbered and outgunned by the advancing French. They were soon summarily defeated, and in the process, Azma was killed. Damascus was duly occupied on July 24, 1920, and Faysal was forced into exile. The French then proceeded to divide the country into four separate districts, Greater Lebanon, Aleppo, Latakia, and Damascus, a politico-administrative arrangement that persisted until World War II.
content_units.azure_translation: 19181970）（大马士革：达尔·安瓦尔，1996年），第26页。宣布大叙利亚（包括黎巴嫩和巴勒斯坦）独立，以费萨尔为国王。法国认为这一行动是对其权利的篡夺，因此发出最后通牒，要求费萨尔接受法国的托管，并承认法国对该国的控制。费萨尔别无选择，只能屈服。然而，他对法国条件的接受并没有在指定时间到达法国最高统帅部。（有人怀疑这是法国人故意无视的）。驻黎凡特法军司令亨利·古罗将军立即将他的部队向大马士革进军。一支组织混乱、装备简陋的阿拉伯小部队在费萨尔国防部长优素福·阿兹马的指挥下，在迈萨伦山口阻挡了法军前进的道路。阿拉伯部队在数量和火力上完全不敌前进的法国人。他们很快就被立即击败，在这个过程中，阿兹玛被杀了。1920 年 7 月 24 日，大马士革被正式占领，费萨尔被迫流亡。随后，法国人将该国划分为四个独立的地区，大黎巴嫩、阿勒颇、拉塔基亚和大马士革，这种政治行政安排一直持续到第二次世界大战。

Short-lived and at times chaotic and inef.cient, the Arab na­tional government, nevertheless, was the .rst actual realization of the ideals of Arab nationalism. The purposeful efforts of the gov­ernment to publicly carry the Arab nationalist torch and con­sciously endeavor to instill its sparks in the hearts and minds of the Syrian population would become the blueprint for later nationalist thinkers and activists. And Azmas martyrdom for the national­ist cause would remain imprinted on the collective consciousness of successive nationalist generations. Told and retold, the tale gained in myth and heroic proportions to become the nationalist staple for Syrian youth.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，阿拉伯民族政府是短暂的，有时是混乱和低效的，但它是阿拉伯民族主义理想的第一次实际实现。政府有目的地公开举起阿拉伯民族主义火炬，并有意识地努力在叙利亚民众的心灵和思想中灌输其火花，这将成为后来民族主义思想家和活动家的蓝图。阿兹马斯为民族主义事业殉难，将留在历代民族主义者的集体意识中。这个故事在讲述和重述中获得了神话和英雄的程度，成为叙利亚年轻人的民族主义主食。

content_units.text: Yet here again, as with the circumstances relating to the 1916 Great Arab Revolt, the Arab nationalist character of the Syrian state had been exaggerated in nationalist discourse. It is thus im­portant not to overstate the inroads that Arab nationalism had made into the political consciousness of the Syrian people under Faysals government. While the Syrian population on the whole welcomed the use of Arabic as opposed to Turkish or French, and while many seemed to accept the notion of linguistic and religious proximity with other Arabic-speaking peoples, they were still intel­lectually very distant from Faysal and his nationalist cadres in their understanding of, and susceptibility to, the Arab nationalist proj­ect. The political and social structures of post-World War I Syria created immense cultural and political obstacles to the realization of Arab nationalist aspirations.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，在这里，就像与 1916 年阿拉伯大起义有关的情况一样，叙利亚国家的阿拉伯民族主义特征在民族主义话语中被夸大了。因此，重要的是不要夸大阿拉伯民族主义在费萨尔政府领导下对叙利亚人民政治意识的渗透。虽然叙利亚民众总体上欢迎使用阿拉伯语而不是土耳其语或法语，尽管许多人似乎接受与其他阿拉伯语民族在语言和宗教上接近的概念，但他们在知识上仍然与费萨尔和他的民族主义干部相去甚远，他们对阿拉伯民族主义计划的理解和敏感性。第一次世界大战后叙利亚的政治和社会结构为实现阿拉伯民族主义愿望造成了巨大的文化和政治障碍。

content_units.text: There were to begin with a host of other identities that competed with, and in many instances proved to be stronger than, the Arab nationalist identity. There were strong regional sensitivities that separated Damascus from other parts of Syria. Indeed the rivalry, even mistrust, that existed between Damascus and Aleppo was leg­endary. There were deeply ingrained clannish and tribal loyalties that did not necessarily coincide with the wider national interests of Faysals government. Many in the in.uential Christian commu­nity in Lebanon worked in tandem with the French to frustrate Arab nationalist goals that they considered to be merely a camou­.age for Muslim domination. Indeed, the vast majority of the Christian Maronites of Lebanon were vehemently opposed even to an independent Syrian state.109 Even in Damascus, the politically and economically in.uential al-Ayan (the class of urban notables made up of wealthy landowners and merchants) eyed their own privileged interests far more zealously than any notion of Arab­ism.110 Indeed, even though the battle of Maisalun was bravely fought by the Arab army, the Arab defeat at the hands of the French had been attributed not only to French superiority, but also to Syr­ian divisions and dissensions that were the hallmark of an inade­ quate sense of national identity.111 A promise to Faysal of 10,000 fully armed men by a tribal leader never materialized. Bands of men from various Syrian clans fought with the French, attacking the right and left .anks of the Arab army, as well as its rear, which allowed the French army to concentrate on the middle core. A num­ber of al-Ayan from Damascus cut the telegraph lines between Maisalun and the capital, leaving the nationalist circles in Damas­cus without news of the battle. And when the victorious French army arrived in Damascus, the same al-Ayan, accompanied by prominent religious leaders, received the French as conquerors.112
content_units.azure_translation: 首先还有许多其他身份，它们与阿拉伯民族主义身份竞争，并且在许多情况下被证明比阿拉伯民族主义身份更强大。大马士革与叙利亚其他地区之间存在着强烈的区域敏感性。事实上，大马士革和阿勒颇之间存在的竞争，甚至不信任是传奇的。存在根深蒂固的氏族和部落忠诚，这不一定与费萨尔政府更广泛的国家利益相一致。黎巴嫩基督教社区中的许多人与法国人合作，挫败了阿拉伯民族主义的目标，他们认为这些目标只是穆斯林统治的伪装。事实上，黎巴嫩的绝大多数基督教马龙派教徒甚至强烈反对建立一个独立的叙利亚国家。109 即使在大马士革，在政治和经济上都处于领先地位的阿扬（由富有的地主和商人组成的城市名流阶层）比任何阿拉伯主义观念都更热衷于关注自己的特权利益。110 事实上，尽管迈萨伦战役是由阿拉伯军队勇敢地打的， 阿拉伯人在法国人之手的失败不仅归因于法国的优势，还归因于叙利亚的分裂和分歧，这些分裂和分歧是民族认同感的标志。111 部落首领向费萨尔承诺提供 10,000 名全副武装的人，但从未实现。来自叙利亚各个氏族的一群人与法国人作战，攻击阿拉伯军队的左右两侧以及其后方，这使得法国军队能够集中精力在中部核心。来自大马士革的一些阿扬切断了迈萨伦和首都之间的电报线，使大马士革的民族主义圈子没有战斗的消息。当胜利的法国军队抵达大马士革时，同样的阿扬在著名宗教领袖的陪同下，将法国人视为征服者。

Moreover, even among the nationalist circles, the concept of na­tionalism was perhaps more likely to refer to Syrian rather than Arab nationalism. Faysal seems to have quickly grasped this, since in a memorandum submitted to the Paris Peace Conference in January 1919, he advocated different solutions for the various parts of the Arab world, including some form of sovereignty for Syria.113 And, when later in the year he negotiated on behalf of his father with the Europeans for a more encompassing Arab king­dom, some of Syrias political elites decided to open their own inde­pendent channel to the British asking only for Syrian administra­tive rule.114 The British must have leaked these Syrian unof.cial contacts to Faysal, since on his return to Damascus, he quickly and publicly proclaimed that he had told the European powers that the Syrians desired independence for their own country, and that Syria should be considered autonomous from the rest of the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 此外，即使在民族主义圈子中，民族主义的概念也可能更有可能指叙利亚而不是阿拉伯民族主义。费萨尔似乎很快就意识到了这一点，因为在 1919 年 1 月提交给巴黎和会的一份备忘录中，他主张为阿拉伯世界的各个地区采取不同的解决方案，包括叙利亚某种形式的主权。113 当年晚些时候，当他代表他的父亲与欧洲人就建立一个更全面的阿拉伯王国进行谈判时， 一些叙利亚政治精英决定向英国人开放他们自己的独立渠道，只要求叙利亚的行政统治。114 英国人一定是向费萨尔泄露了这些叙利亚人的不知情联系，因为他在返回大马士革后迅速公开宣称，他已经告诉欧洲列强，叙利亚人希望他们自己的国家独立， 叙利亚应该被视为独立于阿拉伯世界其他地区。

Iraqi ex-Ottoman of.cers had formed the backbone of the of.cer corps of Faysals northern army that marched into Damas­cus in October 1918, and consequently ended up claiming high-ranking positions in the new Syrian government and army, hence the .rst commander of the newly formed Syrian army was the Iraqi, Yassin al-Hashimi. Syrian of.cers, who had served in the Ottoman army returned to Syria after the Ottoman defeat to dis­cover that many senior positions were occupied by Iraqis. There was little sense of Arab nationalism, even of Arabism, in the Syrian response. They complained bitterly that they had become strangers in their own country.115 Indeed by 1919, such headlines as Syria for the Syrians began to appear in the Syrian press. Anti-Iraqi organizations, such as al-Shabiba al-Suriya (the Syrian Youth) and Hizb al-Watani al-Suri (the Syrian National Party), were founded, the main purpose of which was to protect Syrian rights against the non-Syrian strangers. 116 Anti-Iraqi propaganda spread throughout the Syrian cities to such an extent that a number of prominent Iraqis were compelled to go to Faysal and complain that they felt like unwanted foreigners.117 A British of.cer relates a conversation in August 1919 which he had with Nuri al-Said, one of the high-ranking Iraqi of.cers, who later was to follow Fay­sal into Iraq and become that countrys most powerful politician:
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚。伊拉克前奥斯曼帝国是 1918 年 10 月进军大马士革的费萨尔北方军队of.cer军团的骨干，因此最终在新的叙利亚政府和军队中担任高级职位，因此新组建的叙利亚军队的第一任指挥官是伊拉克人亚辛·哈希米。曾在奥斯曼军队服役的叙利亚人在奥斯曼帝国战败后返回叙利亚，发现许多高级职位都被伊拉克人占据。在叙利亚的反应中，几乎没有阿拉伯民族主义的感觉，甚至阿拉伯主义的感觉。他们痛苦地抱怨自己在自己的国家变成了陌生人。115 事实上，到 1919 年，叙利亚媒体开始出现诸如叙利亚人的叙利亚等头条新闻。成立了反伊拉克组织，如al-Shabiba al-Suriya（叙利亚青年）和Hizb al-Watani al-Suri（叙利亚民族党），其主要目的是保护叙利亚人的权利免受非叙利亚陌生人的侵害。116 反伊拉克的宣传在叙利亚各城市蔓延开来，以至于一些著名的伊拉克人被迫去费萨尔抱怨他们觉得自己像不受欢迎的外国人。117 一位英国of.cer讲述了 1919 年 8 月他与伊拉克高级官员之一努里·赛义德 （Nuri al-Said） 的一次谈话，努里·赛义德后来跟随费萨尔进入伊拉克，成为该国最有权势的政治家：

content_units.text: Over drinks that evening, Nuri al Said startled me by going off into a long tirade damning the Syrians and all their works. Things were undoubtedly going awry. The trouble arose, in part, from a sort of parochialism. Having supported, in principle, the ideal of a revival of the Arabs as a single nation, it was not long after their liberation that the Syrians resented being ordered about by Hejazis and Iraqis.118
content_units.azure_translation: 那天晚上喝酒时，努里·阿尔·赛义德（Nuri al Said）开始长篇大论，诅咒叙利亚人及其所有作品，这让我大吃一惊。事情无疑出了问题。麻烦部分源于一种狭隘主义。在原则上支持阿拉伯人作为一个单一国家复兴的理想，在他们解放后不久，叙利亚人就对汉志和伊拉克人的命令感到不满。

It was not that the Syrians had no sense of an Arab identity; it was just that local and regional attachments were more potent, and were likely to be the citizens .rst point of reference. Nevertheless, the short-lived Faysal government in Damascus was able to under­take the .rst institutionally organized program to promote Arabist values and sentiment. These early small steps would lay the founda­tion for the giant strides that Arab nationalism would take a few decades later.
content_units.azure_translation: 这并不是说叙利亚人没有阿拉伯身份感;只是地方和区域依恋更有效，并且很可能成为公民的第一个参考点。尽管如此，大马士革短命的费萨尔政府还是能够实施第一个制度性组织的计划，以促进阿拉伯主义的价值观和情感。这些早期的小步骤将为几十年后阿拉伯民族主义取得的巨大进步奠定基础。

content_units.text: Faysals loss of of.ce was as brief as his reign in Syria. Eleven months after his expulsion from Syria, Faysal arrived in Iraq to be crowned, two months later, in August 1921, the King of Iraq under British mandate. The British had assembled the country from three provinces of the defunct Ottoman Empire: Baghdad, Mosul, and Basrah. The assembled state had little ethnic or religious ratio­nale.119 Basrah and the south were overwhelmingly Shiite; Baghdad and the central part were primarily Sunni; and Mosul and the north contained substantial non-Arab populations, the most important of which were the Kurds. Exacerbating these ethnic and sectarian divisions was a vast cultural divide between city and tribe. These schisms made it impossible for a local leader to emerge and be accepted by the population as a whole. The British, therefore, were delighted at the unexpected availability of Faysal.120 They believed that Faysals Arab stature would make him acceptable to the Iraqis, or at the very least minimize opposition to him. More to the point perhaps, the British believed that Faysals experience with the French in Syria, and his malleable, even pliable, character, would make him adopt a pragmatic and nonconfrontational posture to British interests and position in Iraq.
content_units.azure_translation: 费萨尔失去 of.ce 与他在叙利亚的统治一样短暂。在被驱逐出叙利亚 11 个月后，费萨尔抵达伊拉克，两个月后，即 1921 年 8 月，加冕为英国托管下的伊拉克国王。英国人从已解散的奥斯曼帝国的三个省份集结了这个国家：巴格达、摩苏尔和巴士拉。这个集结的国家几乎没有种族或宗教理由。119 巴士拉和南部绝大多数是什叶派;巴格达和中部主要是逊尼派;摩苏尔和北部有大量非阿拉伯人口，其中最重要的是库尔德人。加剧这些种族和宗派分歧的是城市和部落之间巨大的文化鸿沟。这些分裂使得地方领导人无法出现并被全体民众接受。因此，英国人对费萨尔的意外出现感到高兴。120 他们相信费萨尔的阿拉伯地位将使他为伊拉克人所接受，或者至少将对他的反对降到最低。也许更重要的是，英国人认为费萨尔在叙利亚与法国人的经历，以及他可塑性强、甚至柔韧的性格，将使他对英国在伊拉克的利益和地位采取务实和非对抗的姿态。

content_units.text: It was in the infant state of Iraq that a coherent theory of Arab nationalism was .rst launched, then promoted and developed through an extensive national education program. The man re­ sponsible for the effort was Faysals minister of education in Syria, Sati al-Husri, who had followed his patron to Iraq. It was Husri who, through numerous lectures in Iraq and in other Arab cities, gave the concept of Arab nationalism intellectual coherence and sophistication.121 He was also responsible for creating an educa­tional infrastructure, the main purpose of which was to dissemi­nate Arab nationalist ideas and sentiment into the consciousness of future Arab generations.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是在伊拉克这个新生时期，阿拉伯民族主义的连贯理论首次被提出，然后通过广泛的国家教育计划得到推广和发展。负责这项工作的人是费萨尔在叙利亚的教育部长萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri），他跟随他的赞助人前往伊拉克。正是胡斯里通过在伊拉克和其他阿拉伯城市的多次演讲，赋予了阿拉伯民族主义的概念知识上的连贯性和复杂性。121 他还负责创建教育基础设施，其主要目的是将阿拉伯民族主义思想和情感传播到阿拉伯后代的意识中。

content_units.text: Adeed Dawisha, The Assembled State: Communal Con.icts and Governmental Con­trol in Iraq, in Ethnic Con.ict and International Politics in the Middle East, ed. Leonard Binder (Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 1999), p. 61.
Phebe Marr, The Modern History of Iraq (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1985), p. 36.

Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist: Ottomanism and Arab-ism in the Life and Thought of Satial-Husri (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1971) and in Bassam Tibi, Arab Nationalism: A Critical Enquiry (New York: St. Martins Press, 1981), Parts III and IV.

title: SATI AL-HUSRIS THEORY OF ARAB NATIONALISM

content_units.text: Sati al-Husri was born in Yemen in 1882 into a Syrian Muslim family, but spent his formative years in Constantinople. He learned Turkish and French before he studied Arabic, and until the end of his life this intellectual prophet of Arab nationalism would speak Arabic with a slight Turkish accent. He went on to study in Europe where he was exposed to the competing intellec­tual strands of European nationalism. On his return, he joined the Ottoman bureaucracy, where he eventually held senior posts in the Balkan provinces of the empire at a time when the national, anti-Ottoman movements in these provinces were gathering momen­tum. The Balkan experience provided him with much food for thought, and later in his enunciations on Arab nationalism, he would refer time and again to the experiences of various Balkan countries as they strove for national independence. During World War I, Istanbul sent him to Syria as the director general of educa­tion. He held high-ranking and in.uential portfolios in the sector of education during Faysals reign in Syria and in Iraq. Due partly to his voluminous writings and extensive teaching and lecturing, and partly to the immense in.uence he wielded on the educational system in Iraqs .rst two decades, Husri was able to make nation­alist ideas the central thrust of the countrys educational and cul­tural policies. Echoing Fichtes belief that only through education could a nation be reborn, Husri sought to inculcate into the peo­ple, especially the young, a clear and durable sense of Arab na­tional identity that would supercede other prevalent identities, such as tribalism, regionalism, and sectarianism. He saw his mis­sion as promoting national consciousness through the creation of national educational systems.
content_units.azure_translation: 萨蒂·胡斯里 （Sati al-Husri） 1882 年出生于也门的一个叙利亚穆斯林家庭，但在君士坦丁堡度过了他的成长岁月。在学习阿拉伯语之前，他学习了土耳其语和法语，直到他生命的尽头，这位阿拉伯民族主义的知识分子先知都会说带有轻微土耳其口音的阿拉伯语。他继续在欧洲学习，在那里他接触到了欧洲民族主义的相互竞争的知识领域。回国后，他加入了奥斯曼帝国官僚机构，最终在帝国的巴尔干省份担任高级职务，当时这些省份的全国反奥斯曼运动正在蓄势待发。巴尔干的经历为他提供了许多思考，后来在他关于阿拉伯民族主义的阐述中，他一次又一次地提到巴尔干各国争取民族独立的经历。第一次世界大战期间，伊斯坦布尔派他前往叙利亚担任教育局局长。在费萨尔统治叙利亚和伊拉克期间，他在教育领域担任高级和重要职务。部分由于他大量的著作和广泛的教学和演讲，部分由于他在二十年来对伊拉克教育系统施加了巨大的贡献，胡斯里能够将民族主义思想作为国家教育和文化政策的中心推动力。呼应费希特斯的信念，即只有通过教育才能重生一个国家，胡斯里试图向人民，尤其是年轻人灌输一种清晰而持久的阿拉伯民族认同感，这种认同感将取代其他普遍的认同，如部落主义、地区主义和宗派主义。他认为自己的使命是通过创建国家教育体系来提高民族意识。

content_units.text: In the development of the concept of Arab nationalism, there is little doubt that Sati al-Husri, both as thinker and educator, takes pride of place.1 Albert Hourani .nds in Husris writings a pure theory of nationalism with all its assumptions clearly understood and accepted, all its problems faced.2 To Majid Khadduri, Husri developed more clearly and consistently than any other writer a systematic and coherent theory of Arab nationalism,3 Sylvia Haim describes him as the man who did most to popularize the idea of nationalism among the literate classes of the Arab Middle East ...4, and to Aziz al-Azmeh, Husri was the Arab thinker who for­mulated the most important statements of Arab nationalism.5 Writing in the mid-1980s, the Iraqi political scientist, Wamidh Jamal Umar Nadhmi quotes approvingly a statement contending that Husris nationalist ideas continue to dominate the thinking of contemporary generations.6 These sentiments are echoed enthusi­ astically by the Syrian political scientist, Walid Kazziha.7 It is not that Husri was the only Arab nationalist thinker, but in the clarity of his vision, in the single-mindedness of his advocacy of this vi­sion, and in the immense in.uence that his ideas exerted on the thinking of successive Arab generations, Husri has no equal.
content_units.azure_translation: 在阿拉伯民族主义概念的发展中，毫无疑问，萨蒂·胡斯里作为思想家和教育家都占据了一席之地。1 阿尔伯特·胡拉尼 （Albert Hourani） 在《胡斯里斯》中写道，他提出了一种纯粹的民族主义理论，其所有假设都被清楚地理解和接受，它面临的所有问题都得到了明确的理解和接受。2 对马吉德·哈杜里来说，胡斯里比任何其他作家都更清晰、更一致地发展了一种系统和连贯的阿拉伯民族主义理论，3 西尔维娅·海姆将他描述为在阿拉伯中东的识字阶层中普及民族主义思想做出最大贡献的人......4，对阿齐兹·阿兹梅来说，胡斯里是阿拉伯思想家，他提出了阿拉伯民族主义最重要的声明。5 伊拉克政治学家瓦米德·贾迈勒·奥马尔·纳德米 （Wamidh Jamal Umar Nadhmi） 在 1980 年代中期撰文赞同地引用了一篇声明，认为胡斯里民族主义思想继续主导当代人的思想。6 叙利亚政治学家瓦利德·卡齐哈 （Walid Kazziha） 强烈赞同这些观点。7 胡斯里并不是唯一的阿拉伯民族主义思想家，而是从他清晰的视野来看， 胡斯里对这一愿景的倡导的一心一意，以及他的思想对阿拉伯一代人思想的巨大影响，是无与伦比的。

Like other twentieth century nationalisms, Arab nationalism, as formulated by Husri (and by other nationalist thinkers such as Qustantin Zurayq, Edmond Rabath, Zaki al-Arsuzi, Michel A.aq, etc.), was based on the intellectual tenets of European ideas on the subject. This statement, admittedly, would have been assailed mercilessly by Arab nationalists during the peak of the Arab na­tionalist movement in the 1950s and 1960s. These nationalists held jealously to the notion that their nationalism was intellectually authentic. By the end of the century, however, few would contest the statements historical validity. Indeed, with the decline of Arab nationalism and the resurgence of Islamic fundamentalism, nation­alism was being increasingly depicted unkindly as one of the failed imported Western solutions (al-hulul al-mustawrada), or more ve­hemently as Western per.dy designed to divide the Muslims and turn them against one another.8 Even those Arab writers who argue that the Arabs had in fact constituted a nation over a long period of time now accept that as concepts, nation and nationalism origi­nated in the West.9
content_units.azure_translation: 与其他 20 世纪的民族主义一样，胡斯里（以及库斯坦丁·祖拉伊克、埃德蒙·拉巴斯、扎基·阿尔苏齐、米歇尔·A.aq 等其他民族主义思想家）提出的阿拉伯民族主义是基于欧洲思想的思想信条关于这个问题。诚然，在1950年代和1960年代阿拉伯民族主义运动的高峰期，阿拉伯民族主义者会无情地抨击这一说法。这些民族主义者嫉妒地坚持他们的民族主义在理智上是真实的。然而，到本世纪末，很少有人会质疑这些说法的历史有效性。事实上，随着阿拉伯民族主义的衰落和伊斯兰原教旨主义的复兴，民族主义越来越多地被不友善地描述为失败的西方进口解决方案之一（al-hulul al-mustawrada），或者更强烈地被描述为西方旨在分裂穆斯林并使他们相互敌对的 per.dy。8 即使是那些认为阿拉伯人实际上在很长一段时间内构成了一个国家的阿拉伯作家现在也接受它作为概念， 民族主义和民族主义起源于西方9。

content_units.text: From its Latin origin, natio, which the Romans pejoratively used to depict foreigners of lesser social status than Roman citizens, to its grandiose use in Europe after the sixteenth century as the ulti­mate object of peoples loyalty, the intellectual development of the concept of the nation mirrored the political contours of European history.10 By the middle of the nineteenth century, these nationalist ideas were clustered into two main intellectual strands.11 On the one hand, English and French philosophers could not conceive of the nation without its political corollary, the state. Indeed, they tended to see the nation almost as a creation of the statethat nations do not develop arbitrarily, but emerge over time molded and shaped, even though sometimes scarred, by political factors that are the domain of the state.
content_units.azure_translation: 从罗马人贬义地用拉丁语“natio”来描绘社会地位低于罗马公民的外国人，到16世纪后在欧洲将其作为人民忠诚的最终对象的宏伟使用，民族概念的智力发展反映了欧洲历史的政治轮廓。10 到19世纪中叶， 这些民族主义思想被分为两个主要的知识分支。11 一方面，英国和法国的哲学家无法在没有国家政治推论——国家的情况下构想民族。事实上，他们倾向于将国家几乎视为国家的创造国家不是任意发展的，而是随着时间的推移而出现的，尽管有时是伤痕累累的，但这些政治因素是国家的领域。

content_units.text: Walid Kazziha, Al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Marhalat ma bein al-Harbayn al-Alamiya­tayn, (Arab nationalism in the period between the two world wars), al-Mustaqbal al­Arabi, no. 5 (January 1979): 60.

Abed, Islam and Democracy, in Democracy, War and Peace in the Middle East, eds. David Grantham and Mark Tessler. (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1995), pp. 124126; Bassam Tibi, Arab Nationalism: A Critical Enquiry (New York: St. Martins Press, 1990), p. 10; and Bernard Lewis, The Multiple Identities of the Middle East (New York: Scribner, 1998), p. 24.

The other concept of the nation, essentially German, was com­pletely different. In this thinking, nations were not political constructs, but cultural creations. As such, they predate the state, their beginnings implanted in a remote, even immemorial, past in the form of an original tribe or an original linguistic community. The spirit of the nation is thus maintained over time even in the face of harsh political realities, and even if its members at times are not conscious of it. A German is what he is regardless of the political authority under which he conducts his social and com­mercial affairs. Indeed, he is a German even if he professes to be something else.
content_units.azure_translation: 另一个民族概念，本质上是德国的，完全不同。在这种思想中，国家不是政治建构，而是文化创造。因此，它们早于国家，它们的起源以原始部落或原始语言社区的形式植入了遥远的、甚至远古的过去。因此，即使面对严酷的政治现实，即使其成员有时没有意识到这一点，民族精神也会随着时间的推移而保持。德国人就是他自己，无论他处理社会和商业事务的政治权威如何。事实上，即使他自称是别的东西，他也是一个德国人。

content_units.text: It is important to explore these two conceptions of the nation in somewhat greater detail12 since, as we shall see later on, they represented the two alternative models to the emergent genera­tions of Arab intellectuals, among whom Sati al-Husri was at the helm, who found themselves faced with the rapid decline of the Ottoman Empire and the consequent prospect of independence and sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 更详细地探讨这两种国家概念很重要12，因为正如我们稍后将看到的，它们代表了新兴一代阿拉伯知识分子的两种替代模式，其中萨蒂·胡斯里是掌舵人，他们发现自己面临着奥斯曼帝国的迅速衰落以及随之而来的独立和主权的前景。

content_units.text: Liah Greenfeld, Nationalism: Five Roads to Modernity (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1992), pp. 49.

See Rogers Brubaker, Citizenship and Nationhood in France and Germany (Cam­bridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1992); Hans Kohn, Prelude to Nation-States: The French and German Experience, 17891815 (London: D. Van Nostrand Com­pany, Inc., 1967).

It should not come as much of a surprise to learn that to English and French thinkers the concept of a nation was tied .rst and foremost to the notion of state and government. To begin with, neither the English nor the French could claim to historically have been ethnic and/or linguistic homogeneities. Prior to the Roman conquest, England had been invaded by Celts and Danes and later by a variety of Germanic peoples until the French Nor­mans literally colonized the country. Not only is the English race patently mixed, but English as a language emerged from the linguistic in.uences of the various peoples who had invaded and settled the country.
content_units.azure_translation: 得知对英国和法国的思想家来说，国家的概念首先与国家和政府的概念联系在一起，这不足为奇。首先，英国人和法国人都不能声称在历史上是种族和/或语言同质性的。在罗马征服之前，英格兰曾被凯尔特人和丹麦人入侵，后来又被各种日耳曼人入侵，直到法国诺曼人真正殖民了这个国家。不仅英国种族明显混血，而且英语作为一种语言也是从入侵和定居该国的各个民族的语言中产生的。

content_units.text: Similarly, contemporary France, with its French-speaking popu­lation, historically had comprised a number of separate languages, such as Basque, Breton, and Provenc¸al.13 The multiplicity of lan­guages represents an ethnic mix that also includes Vikings, Bel­gians, Germans, Gauls, and Catalans. The Hundred Years War (13371453) added English, Scot, and Irish to the mix.
content_units.azure_translation: 同样，当代法国拥有讲法语的人口，历史上由许多不同的语言组成，例如巴斯克语、布列塔尼语和普罗旺斯语。13 语言的多样性代表了一种种族混合，其中还包括维京人、比利时人、德国人、高卢人和加泰罗尼亚人。百年战争 （13371453） 将英国、苏格兰和爱尔兰加入其中。

content_units.text: While England and France could not claim to have been homo­geneous ethnic and linguistic entities, they certainly had existed for a long time as functioning political units. By the time of the acces­sion to the English throne in 1485 of Henry VII, the .rst Tudor king, the allegiance of the entire country to the crown had been institutionalized.14 Under the Tudors in the sixteenth century, En­gland was ruled through an expanded bureaucratic structure that administered a uniform common law that ran through the length and breadth of the realm.15 Liah Greenfeld is categorical in locat­ing the .rst nation: The birth of the English nation was not the birth of a nation; it was the birth of the nations, the birth of nation­alism. England is where the process originated; its analysis is essen­
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然英国和法国不能声称是同质的种族和语言实体，但它们作为运作的政治单位肯定已经存在了很长时间。到 1485 年都铎王朝第一任国王亨利七世登基时，整个国家对王室的效忠已经制度化。14 在 16 世纪的都铎王朝统治下，英格兰通过扩大的官僚结构进行统治，该结构执行贯穿整个王国的统一普通法。15 利亚·格林菲尔德 （Liah Greenfeld） 明确地定位了第一个国家：英国民族的诞生不是一个民族的诞生;这是国家的诞生，民族主义的诞生。英国是这一进程的发源地;它的分析是埃森
