Ibid., p. 79. For a detailed discussion of the growth and development of Englands common law under Henry VII and the succeeding Tudors, consult G. R. Elton, England Under the Tudors, 2nd ed. (London: Methuen, 1974).

In France, the process of unifying the country was begun in the .fteenth century under Louis XI with the progressive weakening of the great aristocratic and princely houses. By the time of his death in 1483, the houses of Burgundy and Anjou had reverted to the crown, and before the end of the century, the .efs of Orleans and Brittany had followed suit. This process culminated almost a century later with the accession to the throne of Henry IV, the Bour­bon prince. Henry was assassinated in 1610, but not before he had created a strong and uni.ed French state, accepting of monarchical authority, and well on the way to healing the deep national wounds of the French religious wars. The strength of the French state was further cemented throughout the seventeenth century by Louis XIII and Louis XIV,17 two strong kings, supported by able ministers committed to the predominance of the central authority, as it was symbolized by monarchical absolutism, over the centrifugal inter­ests of nobles and princes.
content_units.azure_translation: 在法国，统一国家的进程始于 11 世纪路易十一统治时期，大贵族和王室逐渐衰弱。到 1483 年他去世时，勃艮第和安茹的家族已恢复为王室，在本世纪末之前，奥尔良和布列塔尼的 .efs 也纷纷效仿。这一过程在近一个世纪后随着波旁王子亨利四世的登基而达到顶峰。亨利于 1610 年被暗杀，但在此之前，他创建了一个强大而统一的法国国家，接受君主制权威，并顺利治愈法国宗教战争给民族造成的深深创伤。在整个 17 世纪，路易十三和路易十四 17 这两位强大的国王进一步巩固了法国国家的实力，他们得到了干练的大臣的支持，他们致力于中央权威的主导地位，正如君主专制主义所象征的那样，凌驾于贵族和王子的离心利益之上。

content_units.text: Given this historical legacy, it is hardly surprising that the con­gruence of state and nation was particularly manifest in the ideas of the English and French philosophers and historians of the eigh­teenth and nineteenth centuries. Ernest Renan, Frances eminent nineteenth century historian saw the role of the French monarch as indispensable to the creation of the French nation. In his celebrated essay, What is a Nation?, Renan asserts that the French nation was created by the King of France, partly through his tyranny, partly through his justice.18 This merging of state and nation is evident in Rousseaus writings, in which he uses nation and patrie interchangeably.19 To Rousseau, people did indeed come to speak different languages and to have different customs as a result of their varying developments, but they lacked any self-consciousness about their unity. It is government and the system of laws that cre­ates this necessary sense of national unity, this notion of citizenry.
content_units.azure_translation: 鉴于这一历史遗产，国家和民族的一致性在十八世纪和十九世纪的英国和法国哲学家和历史学家的思想中尤为明显也就不足为奇了。欧内斯特·雷南 （Ernest Renan） 是弗朗西斯 19 世纪著名的历史学家，他认为法国君主的作用对于法兰西民族的建立是不可或缺的。在他著名的文章《什么是国家》中，雷南断言法兰西民族是由法国国王创建的，部分是通过他的暴政，部分是通过他的正义。18 这种国家和民族的融合在卢梭的著作中很明显，他在书中交替使用民族和父权。19 对卢梭来说，由于不同的发展，人们确实会说不同的语言，拥有不同的习俗，但他们对自己的统一缺乏任何自我意识。正是政府和法律体系创造了这种必要的民族团结感，这种公民概念。

content_units.text: Greenfeld, Nationalism,p.23.

For the national development of France under the Bourbons, consult A. Lloyd Moote, Louis XIII, The Just (Berkeley: California University Press, 1989); W. E. Brown, The First Bourbon Century in France (London: University of London Press, 1971); Vincent Buranelli, Louis XIV (New York: Twayne Publishers, Inc., 1966); Maurice Ashley, The Golden Cen­tury: Europe 15981715 (New York: Frederick A. Praeger, 1969).
Ernest Renan, What is a Nation?, in Nation and Narration, ed. Homi K. Bhabha (London: Routledge, 1990), p. 11.

The English philosophers were no less adamant in connecting the nation to the state. Edmund Burke, in his Re.ections on the Revolution in France, for instance, enjoins people to approach to the faults of the state as to the wounds of a father, with pious awe and trembling solicitude. And why such an intimate relationship? Because a state is a partnership [among] those who are living, those who are dead, and those who are to be born. Each contract of each particular state is but a clause in the great primeval contract of eternal society.20 What more vigorous and unequivocal way to subsume the concept of the nation into that of the state.
content_units.azure_translation: 英国哲学家同样坚定地将国家与国家联系起来。例如，埃德蒙·伯克（Edmund Burke）在他的《法国大革命论》中，命令人们以虔诚的敬畏和颤抖的关怀来对待国家的过错，就像对待父亲的伤口一样。为什么会有如此亲密的关系？因为国家是活着的人、死去的人和即将出生的人之间的伙伴关系。每个特定状态的每一个契约都不过是永恒社会伟大的原始契约中的一个条款。20 还有什么比这更有力、更明确的方式将民族的概念纳入国家的概念呢？

content_units.text: Other English philosophers, such as Lock, Bentham, and Mill thought of the nation and state as almost symbiotically tied through the knot of liberty, which is unquestionably a concept of politics. Indeed, John Stuart Mill, was to identify the principle of nationality as a clause of liberalism itself.21 The liberty of the individual and their absolute right to choose a government is indic­ative of the English proclivity to think of the nation less in cultural terms and more in political terms, and to tie the nation .rmly into the political sphere.
content_units.azure_translation: 其他英国哲学家，如洛克、边沁和密尔，认为民族和国家几乎是通过自由的结共生在一起的，这无疑是一个政治概念。事实上，约翰·斯图尔特·密尔（John Stuart Mill）将国籍原则视为自由主义本身的一个条款。21 个人的自由和他们选择政府的绝对权利表明，英国人倾向于从文化角度考虑国家，而更多地从政治角度考虑国家，并将国家与政治领域联系在一起。

content_units.text: In this construct, the notions of the consent of the people, and their free will are essential in the de.nition of a nation. Two conclusions emerge. First, af.liation to the nation cannot be forced on any individual or group, and second, there is nothing that is predetermined or preordained about the concept; nothing that is necessarily permanent. Based on the will of the people, a nation is a malleable thing that exists so long as the people want it to. A nation is a large-scale solidarity, Renan writes in his What is a Nation? He continues: It presupposes a past; it is summarized, however, in the present by a tangible fact, namely, consent, the clearly expressed desire to continue a common life.22 In an often quoted metaphor, Renan characterizes the nation as a daily plebi­scite. Accordingly, the nation can grow through the absorption of new groups, or it can shrink because of secession. Indeed, Renan entertains the visionary idea that the various European nations might at some point in the future join into a single entity.23 In the Anglo-French intellectual tradition, the nation is conceived as al­most dependent on the state, on its values and its institutions.
content_units.azure_translation: 在这种结构中，人民同意和自由意志的概念对于一个国家的定义至关重要。出现了两个结论。首先，不能将对国家的感情强加给任何个人或群体，其次，这个概念没有任何预先确定或预先规定的东西;没有什么是一定永久的。基于人民的意愿，一个国家是一个可塑性强的东西，只要人民愿意，它就会存在。一个国家是一个大规模的团结，雷南在他的《什么是国家？他继续说道：它预设了一个过去;然而，在现在，它被一个有形的事实所概括，即同意，明确表达了继续共同生活的愿望。22 在一个经常被引用的比喻中，雷南将国家描述为每日公民投票。因此，国家可以通过吸收新群体来发展，也可以因为分裂而萎缩。事实上，雷南怀有远见卓识的想法，即各个欧洲国家可能会在未来的某个时候合并为一个单一的实体。23 在英法知识传统中，民族被认为几乎依赖于国家、其价值观和制度。

content_units.text: Minogue, Nationalism,p.41.

Edmund Burke, Re.ections on the Revolution in France, edited with an introduction and notes by J.G.A. Pocock (Indianapolis: Hackett Publishing Co., 1987), pp. 8485. Burke was not strictly English, as he was born in Dublin, Ireland. However, he moved to En­gland at the age of twenty-one, and spent the rest of his life there. A Protestant (even though his mother was Catholic), he later entered parliament and became one of the institutions most avid defenders. So while Irish by virtue of his birth Burkes national attachment, as well as his political ideas, were singularly English.
Minogue, Nationalism, p. 134.

Measured against the Anglo-French structural and institutional argument was the conception of the nation as a cultural creation. In this view, nations are not just political units but organic beings, living personalities, whose individuality must be cherished by their members in all their manifestations. The nation [is founded] not on mere consent or law but on passions implanted by nature and history.24 This school of thought was proposed essentially by German writers and thinkers of the romantic school. Romanticism, a movement begun in the second half of the eighteenth century was primarily an intellectual rebellion against the age of reason, against the principles and ideas of the French Enlightenment. To the romantics, it was not reason, or rational thought, but inner feelings, the exploits of the free spirit, that carved a path to the truth. Emotion was the prime motivator of humans, and should not be sti.ed by reason.
content_units.azure_translation: 与英法结构和制度论点相比，国家是一种文化创造的概念。在这种观点中，国家不仅仅是政治单位，而且是有机的存在，是活生生的人格，其成员必须珍惜其个性，无论其所有表现形式如何。这个国家不是建立在单纯的同意或法律之上的，而是建立在自然和历史植入的激情之上的。24 这一学派基本上是由德国浪漫主义学派的作家和思想家提出的。浪漫主义是一场始于 18 世纪下半叶的运动，主要是对理性时代、对法国启蒙运动原则和思想的知识反抗。对浪漫主义者来说，不是理性，也不是理性思维，而是内心的感受，自由精神的功绩，开辟了一条通往真理的道路。情感是人类的主要动力，不应该被理性所扼杀。

content_units.text: It was German thinkers who .rst incorporated the ideas of the romantic school into their formulation of cultural nationalism, ation of the Irish Nation-State (London: Allen and Unwin, 1989), p. 13.
content_units.azure_translation: 德国思想家首先将浪漫主义学派的思想纳入他们对文化民族主义的表述，爱尔兰民族国家（伦敦：Allen 和 Unwin，1989 年），第 13 页。

content_units.text: Renan, What is a Nation?,p.19. 23 Tibi, Arab Nationalism, p. 150. 24 John Hutchinson, Dynamics of Cultural Nationalism: The Gaelic Revival and the Cre­

whose central focus was the concept of the volk. Originally de­veloped by Johann Gottfried Herder in late eighteenth century, the volk was not simply the people of a country, but a metaphys­ical entity de.ned relationally as that which produces a partic­ular language, art, culture, set of great men, religion and collection of customs. All of these things are taken, not as products of indi­vidual men but as manifestations of the spirit of the people, or volksgeist.25 To the rationalist philosophers of the Enlighten­ment, volksgeist was of little value since humanity was invariable, transcending cultural differences, and therefore the ideas and princi­ples derived from it were universally applicable, regardless of the variations in peoples customs from one locality to another. Here lies the point of departure for Herder and the German romantic nationalists. To them, people are always found in divided groups which have evolved a language and culture in response to their envi­ronment and which express their own national character. In the succession of generations, a people elaborates and develops that culture, and each individual man is what he is because oneoran­other culture has stamped itself upon him.26 (italics added) It is this formulation that shapes the intellectual underpinning for the notion of cultural nationalism. A nation is not a sociopolitical con­struct; it cannot be, since it resides through an immemorial past in the very being of its people, imposing on them a homogeneity and uniformity that separates them from other human groups. The na­tion is not created by the state; it creates the state.
content_units.azure_translation: 其中心焦点是人民的概念。人民最初由约翰·戈特弗里德·赫尔德 （Johann Gottfried Herder） 在 18 世纪末开发，它不仅仅是一个国家的人民，而是一个形而上学的实体，在关系上被描述为产生特定语言、艺术、文化、一系列伟人、宗教和习俗的实体。所有这些东西都被视为不是个人的产物，而是人民精神或人民精神的表现。25 对于启蒙运动的理性主义哲学家来说，人民精神没有什么价值，因为人类是不变的，超越了文化差异，因此，无论人们的习俗如何不同，从中得出的思想和原则都是普遍适用的。这就是赫尔德和德国浪漫民族主义者的出发点。对他们来说，人们总是在分裂的群体中发现，这些群体已经根据环境进化出一种语言和文化，并表达了他们自己的民族性格。在几代人的相继中，一个民族精心设计和发展了这种文化，每个人都是他自己，因为一种或另一种文化在他身上留下了自己的印记。26 （斜体后加）正是这种表述塑造了文化民族主义概念的知识基础。一个国家不是一个社会政治结构;它不可能，因为它存在于其人民的存在中，通过远古的过去，强加给他们一种同质性和统一性，将他们与其他人类群体区分开来。国家不是由国家创造的;它创造了国家。

content_units.text: It is not a coincidence of history that the great prophets of cultural nationalism turned out to be Germans. For unlike the English and French who, having experienced many centuries of statehood, could not but see the nation as symbiotically tied to the state, the Germans did not have a uni.ed state until 1871. When Herder (17441803), the father of German nationalism, was ex­pounding the central ideas of cultural nationalism, Germany was fragmented into almost two thousand separate territories. Some of these were independent states, and, as in the case of Prussia, Euro­pean powers. Most, however, were tiny and inconsequential do­mains. Indeed, it was not until 1871, in the wake of the French defeat at the hand of Prussias Bismarck, that the Prussian-led North German Confederation, itself made up of many states, ab­sorbed the other German states; the kingdoms of Bavaria, Saxony, and Wu¨ rttenberg; .ve grand duchies, thirteen duchies and princi­palities; and the free cities of Hamburg, Bremen, and Lubeck, to form the German state.
content_units.azure_translation: 文化民族主义的伟大先知竟然是德国人，这并非历史的巧合。因为与经历了许多世纪的建国历史的英国人和法国人不同，德国人直到 1871 年才拥有一个统一的国家。当德国民族主义之父赫尔德（17441803）阐述文化民族主义的中心思想时，德国被分裂成近两千个独立的领土。其中一些是独立国家，就像普鲁士一样，是欧洲列强。然而，大多数都是微小且无关紧要的领域。事实上，直到 1871 年，在法国战败于普鲁士俾斯麦之手之后，普鲁士领导的北德意志联邦（本身由许多州组成）才吸收了其他德意志州;巴伐利亚王国、萨克森王国和吴尔滕贝格王国;.ve 大公国、十三个公国和公国;以及汉堡、不来梅和吕贝克等自由城市，组成德国国家。

content_units.text: Minogue, Nationalism,p.57. 26 Ibid., p. 58.

The absence of German statehood until nearly the last quarter of the nineteenth century is probably the best explanation for the German emphasis on the volk and volksgeist. With no uni.ed state, what would the German writers, thinkers, and political agitators extol but the people, their ethnic and linguistic originality, and their excellence. While the English and French could readily point to their nations as de.ned by the uni.ed state, the system of laws, and the long tradition of governance, the Germans only available de.nition of their nation was the existence, as they saw it and vigorously preached it, of an original people, untouched by classical antiquity, representing the purest race, and speaking the purest language.27
content_units.azure_translation: 直到 19 世纪近 25 年，德国才没有建国，这可能是德国强调人民和人民精神的最好解释。如果没有统一的国家，德国作家、思想家和政治鼓动者除了人民、他们的种族和语言独创性以及他们的卓越之外，还能赞美什么呢？虽然英国人和法国人可以很容易地指出他们的民族是由统一的国家、法律制度和悠久的治理传统所决定的，但德国人唯一能理解的民族是，正如他们所看到的，并大力宣扬的，存在一个原始民族，没有受到古典时期的影响，代表着最纯洁的种族， 并说最纯正的语言27。

content_units.text: The intellectual ferment reached its zenith in the aftermath of the Prussian defeat at the hands of Napoleon at Jenna in 1806. Whatever German institutions there were, these were dismantled by the victorious French. King Frederick William hastily left Berlin to live in exile in Ko¨ nigsberg, and a new system of administration, French in its conception, direction, and application, was intro­duced. The Prussian army had been emasculated. Resistance to the occupying French, therefore, could not come from the ruling and political elite, but from the people. The Prussians were especially aggrieved, because while Napoleon treated the South German states cordially, he saved his harshest treatment for the Prussians.28
content_units.azure_translation: 1806 年普鲁士在耶娜被拿破仑击败后，知识发酵达到了顶峰。无论德国有什么机构，这些机构都被胜利的法国人拆除。腓特烈·威廉国王匆忙离开柏林，流亡在尼格斯贝格岛，并引入了一种新的行政制度，其概念、方向和应用都是法国的。普鲁士军队被阉割了。因此，对占领法国的抵抗不能来自统治和政治精英，而是来自人民。普鲁士人尤其委屈，因为拿破仑虽然亲切地对待南德意志国家，但他却保留了对普鲁士人最严厉的待遇28。

content_units.text: Kohn, Prelude to Nation-States, p. 255.
Agatha Ramm, Germany 17891919: A Political History (London: Methuen, 1967), p. 69.

Johann Gottlieb Fichte (17621814), the nationalist thinker and activist, whose ideas proved instrumental in shaping the concept of the German nation, embarked on his nationalist odyssey in the wake of the war of 1806. Prior to that Fichte was a determined cosmopolitan, even a French sympathizer.29 But the war with France changed all that. Faced with the postwar debris that was the Prussian state, Fichte would lay emphasis on the eternal na­tion. The nation, he wrote, arises together out of the divine under a certain, special law of divine development. It is this law that, according to Fichte, determines entirely . . . the national character of a people.30 Fichtes nation is immemorial and sacred; of course it covets a territorial state as an expression of its political will, but it exists independently of the state.
content_units.azure_translation: 约翰·戈特利布·费希特（Johann Gottlieb Fichte，17621814 年）是一位民族主义思想家和活动家，他的思想被证明有助于塑造德意志民族的概念，他在 1806 年战争后开始了他的民族主义之旅。在此之前，费希特是一位坚定的世界主义者，甚至是一位法国的同情者。29 但与法国的战争改变了这一切。面对战后普鲁士国家的废墟，费希特将重点放在永恒的国家上。他写道，这个国家是在神圣发展的某种特殊法则下从神圣中共同产生的。根据费希特的说法，正是这条定律完全决定了......一个民族的民族性格。30 费希特民族是远古而神圣的;当然，它觊觎一个领土国家作为其政治意愿的表达，但它独立于国家而存在。

content_units.text: Central to this endeavor is the spoken and written word. Lan­guage is at the very heart of national formation, since it is the me­dium through which national consciousness spreads. The Euro­pean languages are a case in point. In medieval times, the predominance of the universal concept of Christendom was sus­tained by the status and prestige of Latin. But regional vernaculars were already beginning to compete with the truth language. Through a fusion of Saxon dialects and Norman French, early En­glish became the language of the courts in the fourteenth century, which paved the way for the magni.cent sixteenth century .ow­ering of English literature. The English Bible played a pivotal role in this process. Its mass impact in strengthening a common language, installing in all its hearers and readers the idea of nation­hood and actually shaping the English of all classes into an aware­ness of their own nationhood cannot be overstated.31 Similarly, French became the of.cial language when King Franc¸ois I issued the Ordinance of Villers-Cotteretts in 1539, and by the end of that century the majority of the written works were in French. The ref­ ormation had a similar impact on German. In the two decades 15201540, three times as many books were published in German as in the period 15001520, an astonishing transformation to which Luther was absolutely central.32 These regional (as op­posed to the universal Latin) languages became the most visible manifestations of separate identities,33 making their own contri­bution to the decline of the imagined community of Chris­tendom.34 Thus, the territorialization of Europe predicated not just on physical boundaries, but also on linguistic frontiers.
content_units.azure_translation: 这项工作的核心是口头和书面文字。语言是民族形成的核心，因为它是民族意识传播的媒介。欧洲语言就是一个典型的例子。在中世纪，基督教世界的普遍概念的主导地位是由拉丁语的地位和声望维持的。但地方方言已经开始与真理语言竞争。通过撒克逊方言和诺曼法语的融合，早期英语成为十四世纪宫廷的语言，为十六世纪英国文学的辉煌铺平了道路。英文圣经在这个过程中发挥了举足轻重的作用。它在加强共同语言、向所有听众和读者灌输民族观念以及实际将所有阶层的英语塑造成对自己民族的认识方面产生的巨大影响怎么强调都不为过。31 同样，当国王弗兰克一世于 1539 年颁布《维莱尔-科特雷特法令》时，法语成为主流语言，到该世纪末，大部分书面作品都是法语。ref ormation 对德语也有类似的影响。在15201540的二十年里，德文出版的书籍数量是15001520时期的三倍，这是路德绝对是这一惊人转变的核心。32 这些地区语言（与普遍的拉丁语相反）成为不同身份的最明显表现，33 为想象中的基督教世界社区的衰落做出了自己的贡献。34 因此，欧洲的领土化不仅基于物理边界，还基于语言边界。

content_units.text: Greenfeld, Nationalism, p. 362.
Johann Gottlieb Fichte, Addresses to the German Nation, in The Nationalism Reader, eds. Omar Dahour and Micheline R. Ishay (New York: Humanity Books, 1999), p. 64.
Adrian Hastings, The Construction of Nationhood: Ethnicity, Religion and National­ism (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1997), p. 24.

It should come as no surprise, therefore, that the German nation­alist thinkers and writers would make language the knot that binds the nation together, and the thread that runs through their concept of cultural nationalism. Without a language, Herder argues, a na­tion cannot exist. This is because the most brilliant idea remains a dark sensation until the soul .nds a distinctive label, and embod­ies it through the word into memory, into recollection, into the mind, yes .nally into the mind of man, into tradition.35 Fichte goes even further: Those who speak the same language are linked together, before human intervention takes a hand, by mere nature with a host of invisible ties; they understand each other and are capable of communicating more and more closely with one an­other, they belong together, they are by nature one indivisible whole.36 Fichtes argument is steeped in social anthropology and its conclusion is self-evident: Since people disperse geographically over time, and divide into families, tribes, and nations, their lan­guages become a re.ection of their unique identities and of the circumstances that are peculiar to them. To the cultural nationalist, therefore, language was the expression of a nations spirit, of its conscience.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，德国民族主义思想家和作家将语言作为将民族联系在一起的结，以及贯穿他们文化民族主义概念的线索也就不足为奇了。赫尔德认为，没有语言，一个国家就不可能存在。这是因为最聪明的想法仍然是一种黑暗的感觉，直到灵魂打上一个独特的标签，并通过文字将其体现为记忆、回忆、思想，是的，它体现在人的思想中，融入到传统中。35 费希特更进一步：在人类干预之前，说同一种语言的人通过一系列无形的联系联系在一起;他们相互理解，能够越来越密切地相互交流，他们属于一起，他们本质上是一个不可分割的整体。36 费希特的论点深深植根于社会人类学，其结论是不言而喻的：由于人们随着时间的推移在地理上分散，并分裂成家庭、部落和国家，他们的语言成为他们独特身份和他们特有环境的重新描述。因此，对文化民族主义者来说，语言是民族精神和良知的表达。

content_units.text: Benedict Anderson, Imagined Communities: Re.ections on the Origins and Spread of Nationalism (New York: Verso, 1990), p. 39.

See Anthony D. Smith, The Nation: Invented, Imagined, Reconstructed, in Reimag­ining the Nation, eds. Marjorie Ringrose and Adam J. Lerner. (Buckingham, England: Open University Press, 1993), p. 18.
Anderson, Imagined Communities,p.42.
Quoted in Tibi, Arab Nationalism, p. 129.
Quoted in Minogue, Nationalism,p.64.

The development of national consciousness is aided by another language-based medium: the writing of history. On this there is unanimous agreement among all nationalist thinkers be they of the Anglo-French school or of the German cultural tradition. It is his­tory that constitutes the primary laboratory for the ardent nation­alist. It is from the annals of history that tales of the heroism, great achievements, and unity of purpose of ancestors are resurrected and told and retold as evidence of the excellence of the nations immemorial past. Ancestors have made us what we are, writes Ernest Renan. A heroic past, great men, glory (I mean real glory): here is the social capital upon which to build a national ideology.37 But in fact, it is not just the heroic interludes and the past glories that are the stuff of legend. Even simple stories of everyday life extracted from the history of a peopleof hard work, of commit­ments ful.lled and hardships overcome, can become powerful psy­chological tools depicting the inner strength of a virtuous society.
content_units.azure_translation: 民族意识的发展得到了另一种基于语言的媒介的帮助：历史的书写。在这一点上，所有民族主义思想家，无论是英法学派还是德国文化传统，都达成了一致意见。历史构成了狂热的民族主义者的主要实验室。正是从历史的编年史中，祖先的英雄主义、伟大成就和统一目标的故事被复活、讲述和重述，作为远古国家卓越的证据。祖先造就了我们现在的样子，欧内斯特·雷南写道。英雄的过去，伟人，荣耀（我指的是真正的荣耀）：这是建立国家意识形态的社会资本。37 但事实上，传说中的不仅仅是英雄的插曲和过去的辉煌。即使是从一个民族的历史中提取的日常生活的简单故事辛勤工作、承诺充实和克服困难，也可以成为描绘良性社会内在力量的有力心理工具。

content_units.text: The crucial point here is that this is not the history that is to be found in works of scholarship: the facts and .gures recorded in an objective and detached manner for the purpose of serving some exalted scholarly purpose. It is rather an appeal to gifted myth makers who could construct from the debris of the past a grand and glittering edi.ce to serve as a source of con.dence and inspira­tion for the entire nation.38 The history that the nationalist seeks is not an academic discipline; it is a political tool to be exploited and manipulated for national aims. This was particularly relevant to peoples (such as the Arabs of the twentieth century) whose achievements in the present or in the recent past had been less than laudatory. The need of Arab nationalists to re-create the real and mythical glories that resided in a distant period in their history would become all the more urgent.39 In short, and in the telling words of Elie Keddourie, nationalists make use of the past in order to subvert the present.40 This may sound somewhat fero­cious, but in fact it is not at all far from the truth. In the Arab case, the way history was written and taught was a major concern of those who saw themselves as the guardians of the Arab nation and the custodians of its heritage.41
content_units.azure_translation: 这里的关键点是，这不是在学术著作中可以找到的历史：以客观和超然的方式记录的事实和.gures，目的是服务于某种崇高的学术目的。相反，这是对有天赋的神话创造者的吸引力，他们可以从过去的废墟中构建出一个宏伟而闪闪发光的编辑，作为整个国家的联系和灵感的源泉。38 民族主义者所寻求的历史不是一门学科;它是一种政治工具，可以被利用和纵以达到国家目的。这对那些在现在或最近取得的成就不那么值得称赞的民族（如20世纪的阿拉伯人）尤其重要。阿拉伯民族主义者需要重新创造存在于他们历史上遥远时期的真实和神话般的荣耀，这将变得更加紧迫。39 简而言之，用埃利·凯杜里 （Elie Keddourie） 的话来说，民族主义者利用过去来颠覆现在。40 这听起来可能有些凶猛，但实际上与事实相去甚远。在阿拉伯人的情况下，历史的书写和教学方式是那些将自己视为阿拉伯民族的守护者及其遗产守护者的人的主要关注点41。

content_units.text: Quoted in Lahouari Addi, The Failure of Third World Nationalism, Journal of De­mocracy, vol. 8 (October 1997): 119.
Paul Salem, Bitter Legacy: Ideology and Politics in the Arab World (New York: Syra­cuse University Press, 1994), p. 53.

Hazem Zaki Nuseibeh, The Ideas of Arab Nationalism (London: Kennikat Press, 1972), p. 79; for this general phenomenon, see also Dankwart A. Rustow, A World of Na­tions (Washington D.C.: The Brookings Institution, 1967), pp. 4147.

No wonder then that nationalists of all persuasions have empha­sized, .rst and foremost, education. Jean Jacques Rousseau, him­self a patriot who felt that while the French state was strong the sense of community among Frenchmen was weak, would focus on education as the primary means by which a sense of nationhood is instilled in the hearts and minds of the states citizens. To Rousseau, it was the test of education to give to each human being a national form, and so direct his opinions and tastes, that he should be a patriot by inclination, by passion, by necessity. On .rst opening his eyes, a child must see his country, and until he dies must see nothing else.42 While Rousseaus ideas were the source of lively intellectual debate during his lifetime, it was the French revolution, less than two decades after Rousseaus death, that vigorously put his ideas into practice. The leaders of the French Revolution recog­nized from the very beginning the pivotal role education would play in uniting the people and the fatherland. A comprehensive system of education, the .rst of its kind in Europe, was instituted for the purpose of creating patriotic citizenry, of turning peasants into citizens.43 The teaching of patriotic history replaced the clas­sics, and the arts, especially music, were geared to arousing na­tional pride and passion. Schools adopted an aggressive language curriculum where French was taught as the only national language at the expense of the native idioms formerly taught among Basques, Bretons, Alsatians, Catalans, Flemish, and Provenc¸eaux. Higher education received the same treatment,44 where Latin and classical authors gave way to French and French writers.
content_units.azure_translation: 难怪各种派别的民族主义者都首先强调教育。让·雅克·卢梭本人也是一位爱国者，他认为法国国家虽然强大，但法国人的社区意识却很弱，他将把教育作为向国家公民灌输民族意识的主要手段。对卢梭来说，教育的考验是赋予每个人一种民族形式，并指导他的观点和品味，使他应该通过倾向、激情和必要性成为爱国者。孩子睁开眼睛一看就必须看到他的国家，直到他死去，什么也看不见。42 虽然卢梭的思想在他生前是热烈的知识辩论的源泉，但卢梭死后不到二十年的法国大革命将他的思想大力付诸实践。法国大革命的领导人从一开始就认识到教育在团结人民和祖国方面将发挥关键作用。建立了一个全面的教育体系，这是欧洲第一个此类教育体系，目的是培养爱国公民，将农民变成公民。43 爱国史的教学取代了经典，艺术，尤其是音乐，旨在激发民族自豪感和激情。学校采用了激进的语言课程，其中法语作为唯一的国语教授，而牺牲了以前在巴斯克人、布列塔尼人、阿尔萨斯人、加泰罗尼亚人、佛兰芒人和普罗旺斯人中教授的本土习语。高等教育也得到了同样的待遇，44 拉丁语和古典作家让位于法国和法国作家。

content_units.text: Elie Keddouri, Nationalism (London: Hutchinson University Library, 1961), p. 75.
See Kazziha, al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Marhalat ma bein al-Harbayn al-Alamiya­tayn (Arab nationalism in the period between the two world wars), p. 64.

Quoted in Michael Howard, The Lessons of History (New Haven, Connecticut: Yale University Press, 1991), p. 145; see also Minogue, Nationalism, p. 41; also Ilya Prizel, Na­tional Identity and Foreign Policy: Nationalism and Leadership in Poland, Russia, and Ukraine (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1998), p. 404.
Eugene Weber, Peasants into Frenchmen: The Modernization of Rural France, 1870 1914 (London: Chatto and Windus, 1979).

Education was also the central focus of Fichte, whose Ad­dresses to the German Nation, delivered in Berlin in 18071808, placed him as the pedagogical prophet of German nationalism. To Fichte, the state had to become Kulturstaat,45 a state representing the national culture. Schools, and of course curriculum, would come under the exclusive direction of the state. Again, the purpose here is not so much to transmit knowledge, but to mold the individ­uals identity into that of the state;46 not to make people more knowledgeable or better informed, but to make them better and more determined nationalists. No wonder, therefore, that Ernest Gellner is moved to proclaim that for the state the monopoly of legitimate education is . . . more important, more central than is the monopoly of legitimate violence.47
content_units.azure_translation: 教育也是费希特的中心关注点，他于 18071808 年在柏林发表的《对德意志民族的演说》将他视为德国民族主义的教育先知。对费希特来说，国家必须成为文化国家，45 一个代表民族文化的国家。学校，当然还有课程，都将受到国家的独家指导。同样，这里的目的与其说是传播知识，不如说是将个人身份塑造成国家的身份;46 不是为了让人们更有知识或更见多识广，而是为了使他们成为更好、更坚定的民族主义者。因此，难怪欧内斯特·盖尔纳（Ernest Gellner）感动地宣称，对国家来说，合法教育的垄断是......更重要的是，比合法暴力的垄断更重要。47

content_units.text: Nations, therefore, are nourished and sustained through the tell­ing and retelling of their pastthe myths, the heroism, the unsur­passed achievements; the many obstacles that are confronted and overcome; the .owering of language and literature; the philosophi­cal and artistic genius that has no peer, while conveniently passing over the less than seemly episodesthe self in.icted wounds; the civil wars, massacres, and human atrocities; the ethnic, linguistic, and religious cleavages and dislocations. It is such grand narratives, embodied in purposeful historical and literary representation, passed on to successive generations through directed education, that mold and preserve nations.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，国家通过讲述和重述他们的过去而得到滋养和维持神话、英雄主义、无与伦比的成就;所面对和克服的许多障碍;语言和文学的赋权;无与伦比的哲学和艺术天才，同时方便地忽略了那些不那么看似的情节，自我在创伤中;内战、屠杀和人类暴行;种族、语言和宗教的分裂和错位。正是这种宏大的叙事，体现在有目的的历史和文学表现中，通过定向教育传承给后代，塑造和保护了国家。

content_units.text: And the Arab nation is no exception. Through the determined advocacy of Sati al-Husri and his disciples, and the institution of directed educational programs that told a history molded by the Arab nationalist idea, the concept of the Arab nation was to ac­quire an ever-increasing recognition and acceptance in the post-World I period. These were men who were kindled by the incendi­ary ideas of European nationalism. And from the philosophical battles fought by European nationalist thinkers a century or so be­fore, a nationalist path most suited to the Arab condition was care­fully charted.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族也不例外。通过萨蒂·胡斯里及其门徒的坚定倡导，以及讲述阿拉伯民族主义思想塑造的历史的定向教育计划的制度，阿拉伯民族的概念将在后第一次世界时期获得越来越多的认可和接受。这些人被欧洲民族主义的煽动性思想点燃了。从大约一个世纪前欧洲民族主义思想家的哲学斗争中，一条最适合阿拉伯状况的民族主义道路被仔细规划出来。

content_units.text: Hans Kohn, Nationalism: Its Meaning and History (Princeton, New Jersey: D. Van Nostrand Company, Inc., 1955), p. 26.
Hajo Holborn, A History of Modern Germany, 16481840 (New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1966), p. 342.
Keddourie, Nationalism, pp. 8384.
Ernest Gellner, Nations and Nationalism (Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press, 1983), p. 34.

In his de.nition of the nation, Husri opted categorically for the German idea of cultural nationalism promoted by Herder, Fichte, and Ernest Moritz Arendt. In this formulation, as we have seen, a nation cannot depend on such ephemeral bases as the will of the people; rather, a nation is objectively based through the unity of its linguistic community and the coherence of its history. It is the individuals language and history, regardless of his own prefer­ences, that determine his national identity. Echoing the German romantics de.nition of what constitutes a German, Husri would contend that people who speak Arabic as their mother tongue are Arabs, the very people who recognize the common thread of their long and distinguished history. The Arab nation is therefore predetermined and eternal.
content_units.azure_translation: 在对国家的定义中，胡斯里断然选择了赫尔德、费希特和欧内斯特·莫里茨·阿伦特所倡导的德国文化民族主义思想。正如我们所见，在这种表述中，一个国家不能依赖人民意志等短暂的基础;相反，一个国家的客观基础是通过其语言社区的统一和历史的连贯性。无论他自己的喜好如何，个人的语言和历史决定了他的民族身份。呼应德国浪漫主义者对德国人的定义，胡斯里认为，以阿拉伯语为母语的人是阿拉伯人，正是他们认识到他们悠久而杰出的历史的共同点的人。因此，阿拉伯民族是预先确定的和永恒的。

content_units.text: The reasons for opting for the German, rather than the French, conception are not dif.cult to discern. The Arab political and geo­strategic situation in the 1920s had very little in common with nine­teenth century France. Conversely, there was a strong resemblance to the pre-1871 German condition. Husri would comment that the French had lived for so long in a uni.ed national state that they had forgotten the distinction between the concepts of state and nation, using the term nationalite to depict membership in either or both. However, the Germans, without a uni.ed state until 1871, were very much aware of the difference, naming membership in a state nationalitat and in a nation volkstrum.48 Lacking a uni.ed state, the Arabs could assert their national identity only through a German-like emphasis on cultural authenticity,49 and indeed on several occasions, Husri compares the Arab nation in the post-World War I period with the pre-1871 German lands and domains.
content_units.azure_translation: 选择德国人而不是法国人受孕的原因并不容易辨别。1920 年代的阿拉伯政治和地缘战略局势与 19 世纪的法国几乎没有共同之处。相反，这与 1871 年之前的德国情况非常相似。胡斯里会评论说，法国人在一个单一教育的民族国家中生活了太久，以至于他们忘记了国家和民族概念之间的区别，使用民族主义一词来描述其中一个或两个国家的成员资格。然而，德国人直到 1871 年才建立统一的国家，他们非常清楚其中的区别，将国家民族和民族的成员资格命名为人民。48 由于缺乏统一国家，阿拉伯人只能通过像德国人一样强调文化真实性来维护他们的民族身份，49 事实上，胡斯里曾多次将第一次世界大战后的阿拉伯民族与 1871 年之前的德国土地和领地进行了比较。

content_units.text: Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya (Selected studies on Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1985), p. 66; the same argument also appears in Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Ara wa Ahadith . al-Qaw­miya al-Arabiya (Views and discussions on Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Dar al-Ilm li al­

In his intellectual commitment to the German cultural concep­tion, Husri launched a vigorous attack on the French model as ar­ticulated by Ernest Renan. As we have seen, Renan argued that national attachment is not predetermined, but is based on the free will of the people. It was incumbent on the people to decide whether they wished to live together, a decision that could be re­versed at any point in the future. Indeed, Renan went so far as to call the nation a daily plebiscite. Consequently, a nation cannot be a constant objective entity. Depending on who might want to join or secede, the nation can grow larger or be reduced in size. In terms that are almost sacrilegious to the cultural nationalists, Renan contends that the nation is not eternal; it has a beginning and an end.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里在对德国文化概念的知识承诺中，对欧内斯特·雷南（Ernest Renan）所阐述的法国模式发起了猛烈的攻击。正如我们所见，雷南认为民族依恋不是预先确定的，而是基于人民的自由意志。人民有责任决定他们是否愿意住在一起，这一决定在未来任何时候都可能被推翻。事实上，雷南甚至称全国每天都是公民投票。因此，一个国家不可能是一个恒定的客观实体。根据谁可能想加入或脱离，国家可以变大或缩小。在对文化民族主义者来说几乎是亵渎的术语中，雷南认为国家不是永恒的;它有开始和结束。

content_units.text: Husri not only dismisses Renans theory of the nation, but attaches malicious motivations to the French thinker. He argues that Renan formulated his voluntarist theory of nationalite elective to endow intellectual legitimation to the French annexation of Ger­man-speaking Alsace and to Frances ambitions across the Rhine. To Husri, Renan did not follow the path of a neutral researcher, rather he resembled a lawyer who, in preparing his defense, would eschew clear yet damaging evidence, while clinging to the .imsiest of indications that might help his defense.50 Of Renans idea that the nation is a daily plebiscite, an object of the will of the people, Husri is derisively dismissive. Does Renan imply, Husri asks, that
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里不仅驳斥了雷南的民族理论，而且对这位法国思想家提出了恶意动机。他认为，雷南提出了他的民族主义选举理论，为法国吞并德语区阿尔萨斯和法国在莱茵河对岸的野心赋予了知识上的合法性。对胡斯里来说，雷南并没有走中立研究人员的道路，相反，他就像一个律师，在准备辩护时，会避开明确但具有破坏性的证据，同时坚持可能有助于他辩护的最重要迹象。50 对于雷南认为国家是每日公民投票、人民意志的对象的想法，胡斯里嘲笑地不屑一顾。胡斯里问，雷南是否暗示

content_units.text: Malayeen, 1964), pp. 4142; see also Paul Salem, Bitter Legacy: Ideology and Politics in the Arab World (Syracuse, New York: Syracuse University Press, 1994), p. 57. nations can be equated with political parties which, depending on shifting public opinion, are constantly oscillating between being in and out of vogue? Husri concludes that in de.ning the nation merely as a group of people who wish to live together, Renan should have realized that this happens only because of the unity of language and history. The wish to live together does not in and by itself form a nation; it occurs as a result of nation formation.51 That is why, Husri argues, the only correct de.nition of the nation has to be the German cultural conception.
content_units.azure_translation: Malayeen，1964 年），第 4142 页;另见保罗·塞勒姆，《苦涩的遗产：阿拉伯世界的意识形态和政治》（纽约州锡拉丘兹：锡拉丘兹大学出版社，1994 年），第 57 页。国家可以等同于政党，根据公众舆论的变化，不断在流行和流行之间摇摆不定？胡斯里的结论是，在将国家仅仅视为一群希望共同生活的人时，雷南应该意识到，这只是因为语言和历史的统一而发生的。共同生活的愿望本身并不构成一个国家;它是国家形成的结果。51 这就是为什么胡斯里认为，民族的唯一正确定义必须是德国的文化概念。

content_units.text: But not on racial exclusivity. Husri advocated pride in Arab culture, but was careful not to equate that with notions of racial superiority. See Ilyas Sahab, Sati al-Husri: al-Mufakir wa al-Daiya wa al-Numudhaj, (Sati al-Husri: the thinker, the advocate and the role model), al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no. 1 (May 1978): 83; also Tibi, Arab Nationalism, p. 121.

Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Ma Hiya al-Qawmiya?: Abhath wa Dirasat ala Dhawi al-Ahdath wa al-Nadhariyat (What is nationalism?: enquiries and studies in light of events and theories) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1985), p. 117.

As we have seen, to the German cultural nationalists language sits at the heart of any de.nition of the nation. To Herder and Fichte, it is language that creates the inner cultural frontiers of a nation, regardless of whether or not the nation had yet succeeded in establishing its external geographic boundaries.
content_units.azure_translation: 正如我们所见，对于德国文化民族主义者来说，语言是国家任何国家的核心。对赫尔德和费希特来说，语言创造了一个民族的内在文化边界，无论这个民族是否已经成功地建立了其外部地理边界。

content_units.text: The emphasis of the German Culturalists on language .nds its way into Husris own formulation. To Husri, language is the most important spiritual tie which binds an individual to the rest of man­kind because it is the medium of communication amongst individu­als, in addition to being the means for thinking.... Since languages differ between races, it is natural that we .nd groups of individuals who share the same language drawing nearer to each other than to other groups, thereby forming a nation which is distinct from other nations.52 As examples, Husri points to the Germans and Italians who, through the preservation of their language, were able eventu­ally to turn chronic political fragmentation into uni.ed states. Husri cites too the example of Bulgaria before World War I, which, Husri relates, suffered from two kinds of oppression. There was the intrusion of the Greek Orthodox Church, which sought to spread the Greek language at the expense of Bulgarian, and there was the Ottoman imperial subjugation of Bulgaria, which was po­litical in nature, and thus not particularly opposed to the Bulgarian language. Husris argument was that the Bulgarians could not struggle for political independence from the Ottomans without .rst achieving linguistic and cultural freedom from the Greeks. Indeed, he points out, that only after a revival of the Bulgarian language had taken place, which was due in great measure to the establish­ment of a Bulgarian patriarchate which replaced Greek with Bul­garian as the language of worship and education, could the Bulgari­ans begin their quest for independence from the Ottomans.53 Indeed, Husri discerns similar conclusions from the case of Poland, where he argues that the Polish language played a pivotal role not only in keeping the Polish nation alive after the partitioning of Po­land, but also in later uniting the country again. In the Arab case, Husris lifelong advocacy for the adoption of standard Arabic throughout the Arab world was occasioned by a recognition that Arab dialects were so varied as to make nonsense of the notion of linguistic unity.
content_units.azure_translation: 德国文化主义者对语言的强调融入了胡斯里斯自己的表述中。对胡斯里来说，语言是将个人与人类联系在一起的最重要的精神纽带，因为它除了是思考的手段之外，还是个人之间交流的媒介......由于不同种族的语言不同，我们使用相同语言的群体自然会比与其他群体更亲近，从而形成一个与其他民族不同的国家。52 作为例子，胡斯里指出了德国人和意大利人，他们通过保护他们的语言，最终能够将长期的政治分裂转变为统一的国家。胡斯里还引用了第一次世界大战前保加利亚的例子，胡斯里说，保加利亚遭受了两种压迫。有希腊东正教的入侵，它试图以牺牲保加利亚语为代价传播希腊语，还有奥斯曼帝国对保加利亚的征服，这具有政治性质，因此并不特别反对保加利亚语。胡斯里斯的论点是，保加利亚人无法在政治上从奥斯曼帝国获得政治独立，而首先要从希腊人手中获得语言和文化自由。事实上，他指出，只有在保加利亚语复兴之后，这在很大程度上归功于保加利亚宗主教区的建立，用保加利亚语取代希腊语作为礼拜和教育的语言，保加利亚人才能开始寻求从奥斯曼帝国独立。53 事实上，胡斯里从波兰的案例中发现了类似的结论， 他认为，波兰语不仅在波兰分治后保持波兰民族的生存，而且在后来再次统一国家方面发挥了关键作用。在阿拉伯的案例中，胡斯里终生倡导在整个阿拉伯世界采用标准阿拉伯语，是因为他认识到阿拉伯方言如此多样化，以至于语言统一的概念变得无稽之谈。

al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya, pp. 3536. In another passage, al-Husri writes: The life of a nation is in its language. If [the nation] were to lose its lan­guage. . .then it would no longer exist. al-Husri, Ara wa Ahadith . al-Qawmiya al-Ara­biya, pp. 6970.
Along with language, Husri cites history as the other crucial fac­tor in nationhood. To Husri,
content_units.azure_translation: 除了语言，胡斯里还将历史列为建国的另一个关键因素。致胡斯里，

content_units.text: nationalist feeling depends on historical memories more than any­thing else.... History-related ideas and data play an important role in the life of nations and have a great impact on the direction of historical events.... We do not exaggerate when we say that gener­ally the movements for resurrection and the struggle for indepen­dence and unity begin only by recalling the past and searching for revelation from history.... Love for independence is nourished by memories of the lost independence; the longing for power and glory begins with a lament for the lost power and diminished glory; faith in the future of the nation derives its strength from a belief in the brilliance of the past; and the longing for uni.cation is increased by the renewal of memories of the past unity.54
content_units.azure_translation: 民族主义情绪最依赖于历史记忆......与历史相关的思想和数据在民族生活中发挥着重要作用，对历史事件的走向影响很大。我们毫不夸张地说，一般来说，复活运动以及争取独立和团结的斗争只能从回顾过去和从历史中寻找启示开始......对独立的热爱是由失去的独立的记忆所滋养的;对权力和荣耀的渴望始于对失去的权力和减弱的荣耀的哀叹;对国家未来的信心源于对过去辉煌的信念;对合一的渴望因对过去合一的记忆的更新而增加54。

Much of Husris work in Iraq as its director general of education concerned the teaching of history in Iraqi schools. He emphasized particularly the teaching of nationalist history; the kind of his­tory that would engender among the pupils a sense of primordial attachment to the Arab nation. In this, he echoed Fichtes endorse­ment of history as perhaps only slightly less important than lan­guage in rekindling the nationalist spirit.55 And in any case, these two factors are inexorably linked to, and interwoven with, each other. In Husris scheme of things, a common language and a shared history
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里在伊拉克担任教育总干事的大部分工作都涉及伊拉克学校的历史教学。他特别强调民族主义历史的教学;这种历史会在学生中产生对阿拉伯民族的原始依恋感。在这一点上，他呼应了费希特斯对历史的认可，认为在重新点燃民族主义精神方面，历史的重要性可能仅略低于语言。55 无论如何，这两个因素是不可阻挡地相互联系和交织在一起的。在胡斯里斯的事物计划中，一种共同的语言和共同的历史

content_units.text: form the fundamental bases of nation formation. The union of these two spheres leads to fusion of emotions and aspirations, of suffer­ings and hopes, and of culture. And in this, people see themselves as members of a unitary nation distinct from other nations.... If we want to specify the roles of language and history in the formation of a nation, we can say: language is the soul and the life of the nation; history is its memory and its cognizance.56
content_units.azure_translation: 构成国家形成的基本基础。这两个领域的结合导致了情感和愿望、苦难和希望以及文化的融合。在这方面，人们将自己视为一个不同于其他国家的单一国家的成员......如果我们要具体说明语言和历史在民族形成中的作用，我们可以说：语言是民族的灵魂和生命;历史是它的记忆和认知56。

content_units.text: The originality of the Arabic language, stemming from the early inhabitants of the Arabian Peninsula, who had been protected from external cultural in.uences by the inhospitable Arabian desert, and the long, continuous stretch of Arab history, predating the advent of Islam and the life and times of the Prophet, make up, in Husris formulation, the two essential constitutive elements of the Arabs national identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯语的独创性源于阿拉伯半岛的早期居民，他们受到荒凉的阿拉伯沙漠的保护，免受外部文化的影响，以及在伊斯兰教出现之前以及先知的生平和时代之前的漫长而连续的阿拉伯历史，在胡斯里斯的表述中，构成了阿拉伯民族认同的两个基本构成要素。

content_units.text: Not so with religion. Husris nationalism is emphatically secular and intellectually extricated from Islamic political thought, even
content_units.azure_translation: 宗教则不然。胡斯里民族主义强调世俗化，在理智上脱离了伊斯兰政治思想，甚至

content_units.text: This generally accepted contention is questioned by Walid Kazziha, who argues that, unlike Fichte, Husri gives history an equal importance to language in national formation. See Kazziha, al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Marhalat ma bein al-Harbayn al-Alamitayn (Arab nationalism in the period between the two world wars), pp. 6263.
al-Husri, Ma Hiya al-Qawmiya: Abhath wa Dirasat ala Dhawi al-Ahdath wa al-Nadhariyat (What is nationalism?: enquiries and studies in light of events and theories), p.

content_units.text: though Islam is the religion of the overwhelming majority of the Arab people. In his national formulation, Husri contends that, un­like language and history, religion does not constitute a fundamen­tal element of national formation.57 While he concedes that at times religion has played an important role in fostering national feelings, he says that this is true only of national religions, such as Juda­ism, that serve a particular people. On the other hand, universal religions, such as Islam and Christianity, which are embraced by people of different languages, cultures, and locale, must by de.ni­tion be opposed to nationalism. And in such a competition, Husri is con.dent that human solidarity built around religious af.liation would not stand up to the force of secular cultural nationalism. In this, Husri took on not just the Muslim modernist thinkers of the past, but also (as we shall see in later chapters) in.uential contem­poraries who insisted on the primacy of Muslim solidarity.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管伊斯兰教是绝大多数阿拉伯人民的宗教。在他的民族表述中，胡斯里认为，与语言和历史不同，宗教并不构成国家形成的基本要素。57 虽然他承认宗教有时在培养民族感情方面发挥了重要作用，但他说，这只适用于为特定民族服务的民族宗教，例如犹太教。另一方面，伊斯兰教和基督教等被不同语言、文化和地区的人们所接受的普世宗教必须从本质上反对民族主义。在这样的竞争中，胡斯里认为，围绕宗教信仰建立的人类团结无法抵挡世俗文化民族主义的力量。在这一点上，胡斯里不仅挑战了过去的穆斯林现代主义思想家，而且还挑战了（正如我们将在后面的章节中看到的）坚持穆斯林团结至上的同时代人。

content_units.text: In support of his secular views, Husri would cite historical in­stances. After all, did not the various Balkan groups continue to .ght with each other even though they were all united by their Greek Orthodox faith? Did the unity of religion and sect stop the separation of Hungary from Austria, or Norway from Sweden? Did the eventual unity of Italy not necessitate long and bloody wars with Austria, even though both were Catholic? On the other hand, religious differences were no obstacle for the national uni.cation of Protestant Prussia and Catholic Bavaria, or the fusion of Chris­tians and Muslims in Albania after the latters secession from the Ottoman Empire.58
content_units.azure_translation: 为了支持他的世俗观点，胡斯里会引用历史实例。毕竟，巴尔干的各个群体不是继续相互联系，即使他们都因希腊东正教信仰而团结在一起吗？宗教和教派的统一是否阻止了匈牙利与奥地利的分离，或者挪威与瑞典的分离？意大利最终的统一难道不需要与奥地利进行长期而血腥的战争吗，尽管两国都是天主教徒？另一方面，宗教差异并不是新教普鲁士和天主教巴伐利亚的民族统一的障碍，也不是阿尔巴尼亚在阿尔巴尼亚脱离奥斯曼帝国后基督教徒和穆斯林融合的障碍58。

content_units.text: To emphasize what to Husri is the indisputable primacy of na­tionalist ties over religious attachments, he commits the almost sac­rilegious intellectual infraction of employing the term al-Umma in a secular, nationalist mode.59 As we have seen, al-Umma is a con­cept used by Islamic scholars to denote the community of the faith­fulthose who shared the Islamic faith regardless of the cultural and linguistic distance that separated them. Until then the term usually had been used in its religious context, that of al-Umma al-Islamiya. Husri introduced the concept of al-Umma al-Arabiya, united by language and history, which in his narrative was an in.­nitely more precise designation than the culturally diffuse and at­omized Muslim community.
content_units.azure_translation: 为了强调对胡斯里来说，民族主义联系无可争议地高于宗教依恋，他犯下了近乎亵渎的知识违规行为，即在世俗的民族主义模式下使用“乌玛”一词。59 正如我们所见，“乌玛”是伊斯兰学者用来表示信徒社区，即那些分享伊斯兰信仰的人，无论他们之间的文化和语言距离如何。在此之前，该术语通常用于其宗教背景，即 al-Umma al-Islamiya。胡斯里引入了由语言和历史联合起来的 al-Umma al-Arabiya 的概念，在他的叙述中，这是一个比文化上分散和原子化的穆斯林社区更精确的名称。

To this end, he is at pains to show that Arab and Islamic history are not co-terminus; that Arabs had existed long before the advent of Islam, that indeed the glorious achievements of Islamic history are but a testament to Arab genius, and that if Arabs cease to be Muslims, they would still be Arabs. This formulation is meant to emphasize the secularism of Husris Arab nationalism. It thus allows him to incorporate the Arab Christians under the unifying roof of Arab nationalism. Husri pointedly argues that Christians are as proud of their Arab heritage as their Muslim brothers. This pride is evidenced by the struggle of the Arab Christian Orthodox against Greek control in the patriarchate of Antioch and that of the Eastern Uniates against the encroachment of Latin rites and customs.60 The message is purposely and purposefully stated: a Christian is as Arab as any Muslim.
content_units.azure_translation: 为此，他竭尽全力表明阿拉伯历史和伊斯兰历史不是共同的终点;阿拉伯人早在伊斯兰教出现之前就已经存在了，伊斯兰历史的辉煌成就确实只是阿拉伯天才的证明，如果阿拉伯人不再是穆斯林，他们仍然是阿拉伯人。这种表述旨在强调胡斯里阿拉伯民族主义的世俗主义。因此，它使他能够将阿拉伯基督徒纳入阿拉伯民族主义的统一屋檐下。胡斯里尖锐地认为，基督徒和他们的穆斯林兄弟一样为他们的阿拉伯传统感到自豪。阿拉伯基督教东正教反对希腊人对安提阿宗主教区的控制，以及东方联合教团反对对拉丁礼仪和习俗的侵犯的斗争证明了这种自豪感。60 信息是有意和有目的地陈述的：基督徒和任何穆斯林一样是阿拉伯人。

content_units.text: This liberalism toward the minority Christian population in the Arab world is not re.ected in the rest of Husris Arab national­ist doctrine. The concept of liberal democracy is absent from Husris ideological formulations, and the notion of individual lib­erty is so tangential to his main concerns as to be irrelevant. In this he was merely mirroring the German romantics upon whose ideas his concept of nationalism was based, and to them the word lib­erty did not refer to the rights of the individual, but to the inde­ pendence of the nation from foreign rule, through the unity and power of the group.61 Fichte, for instance, has no qualms about restricting the freedom of the individual for the higher good of the love of the fatherland.62 Husri echoes these sentiments.63 In one of his lectures, he enjoins his audience to understand that
content_units.azure_translation: 这种针对阿拉伯世界少数基督徒人口的自由主义并没有在胡斯里阿拉伯民族主义学说的其余部分中得到体现。胡斯里的意识形态表述中没有自由民主的概念，个人自由的概念与他的主要关注点如此相切，以至于无关紧要。在这一点上，他只是在反映德国浪漫主义者的思想，他的民族主义概念就是基于他们的思想，对他们来说，自由这个词不是指个人的权利，而是指民族通过群体的团结和权力不受外国统治的独立性。61 例如，费希特毫不犹豫地为了爱祖国的更高利益而限制个人的自由。62 胡斯里也赞同这些观点。63 在他的一次演讲中，他呼吁听众明白这一点

content_units.text: Kawakibi at one time used al-Umma in this sense, but in no way in the same consistent and conscious way that Husri used it. Indeed, overall, Kawakibi followed the accepted norm of de.ning al-Umma in its religious context. See Muhamed Ammara, al-Amal al-Kamila li Abd al-Rahman al-Kawakibi (The complete works of Abd al-Rahman al-Kawakibi) (Bei­rut: al-Muasasa al-Arabiya li al-Dirasat wa al Nashr, 1975), p. 198.
Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, p. 315.

Freedom is not an end in itself but a means toward a higher life.... The national interests which could sometime require a man to sacri­.ce his life, must by de.nition require him, in some case, to sacri.ce his freedom.... He who does not sacri.ce his personal freedom for the sake of his nations freedom, when the situation requires, may forfeit his own freedom along with the freedom of his people and his country.... And he who refuses to sublimate (yufni) his individ­ual self into that of the nation, may in some cases, be compelled to expire (yadhtar ila al-.na) in a foreign nation which may one day conquer his fatherland. Because of this, I say unhesitatingly and con­tinuously: patriotism and nationalism above all and before all . . . even above and before freedom.64 (italics added)
content_units.azure_translation: 自由本身不是目的，而是通往更高生活的一种手段......国家利益有时可能要求一个人牺牲自己的生命，在某种情况下，必须要求他牺牲自己的自由......如果不为了国家的自由而牺牲自己的个人自由，在形势需要的时候，他可以丧失自己的自由以及他的人民和国家的自由......而拒绝将个人自我升华（yufni）为民族自我的人，在某些情况下，可能会被迫在有朝一日可能征服他的祖国的异国他乡去世（yadhtar ila al-.na）。正因为如此，我毫不犹豫地、不断地说：爱国主义和民族主义高于一切，高于一切......甚至在自由之上和之前.64（斜体添加）

content_units.text: This illiberal streak translates itself into an attitudinal rigidity toward not just non-Arabs, but also toward those whom Husri considered to be Arabs. As we shall see, a variety of Arabic-speak­ing people in the period between the two world wars were not necessarily eager to join the ranks of Arab nationalism. Indeed, there were many who insisted that they were not Arabs at all, pro­fessing an attachment to an altogether different identity, perhaps Syrian, Pharaohnic, even European. The fact that they spoke Ara­bic was to them no more than an accident of history, of little conse­quence, hardly warranting an association with the despised and uncouth bedouin who to many urbanites constituted the true de.­
content_units.azure_translation: 这种不自由主义的倾向不仅转化为对非阿拉伯人的态度僵化，而且对胡斯里认为是阿拉伯人的人也表现出态度僵化。正如我们将看到的，在两次世界大战之间的时期，各种讲阿拉伯语的人并不一定渴望加入阿拉伯民族主义的行列。事实上，有许多人坚持认为自己根本不是阿拉伯人，声称对完全不同的身份有依恋，也许是叙利亚人、法老人，甚至是欧洲人。他们说阿拉伯语的事实对他们来说只不过是历史的偶然，没有什么影响，几乎没有理由与被鄙视和粗鲁的贝都因人联系在一起，而贝都因人对许多城市人来说是真正的德。

(Arab nationalism and democracy: a critical review), Al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no.228 (Feb­ruary 1998). nition of an Arab. Husris response to such attitudes was predict­ably unbending, even ominous: national identity is predetermined, and has nothing to do with free will. If these people did not under­stand this, then they had to be persuaded, and if necessary, forced into accepting it. In Husris own words:
content_units.azure_translation: （阿拉伯民族主义和民主：批判性评论），Al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi，第 228 期（1998 年 2 月）。阿拉伯人的 nition。胡斯里对这种态度的反应是不屈不挠的，甚至是不祥的：民族认同是预先确定的，与自由意志无关。如果这些人不明白这一点，那么就必须说服他们，必要时强迫他们接受。用胡斯里斯自己的话来说：

content_units.text: Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Safahat min al-Madhi al-Qarib (Pages from recent history) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1984), p. 42. See also Haim, Arab National­ism, p. 44; and Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, pp. 169170.

Every Arabic-speaking people is an Arab people. Every individual belonging to one of these Arabic-speaking peoples is an Arab. And if he does not recognize this, and if he is not proud of his Arabism, then we must look for the reasons that have made him take this stand. It may be an expression of ignorance; in that case we must teach him the truth. It may spring from an indifference or false con­sciousness; in that case we must enlighten him and lead him to the right path. It may result from extreme egoism; in that case we must limit his egoism. But under no circumstances, should we say: As long as he does not wish to be an Arab, and as long as he is dis­dainful of his Arabness, then he is not an Arab. He is an Arab regardless of his own wishes. Whether ignorant, indifferent, unduti­ful, or disloyal, he is an Arab, but an Arab without consciousness or feeling, and perhaps even without conscience.65
content_units.azure_translation: 每个讲阿拉伯语的民族都是阿拉伯民族。属于这些阿拉伯语民族之一的每个人都是阿拉伯人。如果他不认识到这一点，如果他不为自己的阿拉伯主义感到自豪，那么我们就必须寻找使他采取这种立场的原因。这可能是无知的表现;在这种情况下，我们必须教导他真理。它可能源于冷漠或错误的意识;在这种情况下，我们必须启迪他，引导他走上正确的道路。它可能是极端利己主义的结果;在这种情况下，我们必须限制他的利己主义。但在任何情况下，我们都不应该说：只要他不想成为阿拉伯人，只要他蔑视自己的阿拉伯人身份，那么他就不是阿拉伯人。无论他自己的意愿如何，他都是阿拉伯人。无论是无知、冷漠、不尽职还是不忠诚，他都是一个阿拉伯人，但是一个没有意识或感觉的阿拉伯人，甚至可能没有良心65。

content_units.text: In this instance Husri is not just a formulator of ideas; he is an unbending, almost autocratic, missionary, an enforcer of the only correct ideology, a propagator of the truth as he conceived of it. At times he would take this to absurd limits. In his capacity as Iraqs director general of education, he once .red the Iraqi Shiite poet Muhamed Mahdi al-Jawahiri from his teaching job for sing­ing the praises of an Iranian summer resort, an endeavor which Husri considered to be shuubi (anti-Arab). Jawahiri, one of the most celebrated twentieth century Arab poets, writes caustically in his memoirs that he also had written poems praising the resorts of p. 127; and in Martin Kramer, Arab Awakening and Islamic Revival: The Politics of Ideas in the Middle East (London: Transaction Press, 1996), p. 28.
content_units.azure_translation: 在这种情况下，胡斯里不仅仅是一个思想的制定者;他是一个不屈不挠的、近乎专制的传教士，是唯一正确意识形态的执行者，是他所设想的真理的传播者。有时他会把它带到荒谬的极限。作为伊拉克教育总干事，他曾经因歌颂伊朗避暑胜地而将伊拉克什叶派诗人穆罕默德·马赫迪·贾瓦希里（Muhamed Mahdi al-Jawahiri）从教职中解职，胡斯里认为这一努力是 shuubi（反阿拉伯）。贾瓦希里是 20 世纪最著名的阿拉伯诗人之一，他在回忆录中刻薄地写道，他还写过赞美度假胜地的诗，第 127 页;以及马丁·克莱默（Martin Kramer），《阿拉伯觉醒与伊斯兰复兴：中东思想政治》（伦敦：交易出版社，1996年），第28页。

content_units.text: Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya (Selected studies on Arab nationalism), p. 80. Slightly different versions of Dawishas own translation appear in Tibi, Arab Nationalism, p. 163; in Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist,

Lebanon, Syria, and Palestine. Would that qualify as shuubi too?66 The point, however, was that Husri would not tolerate even the slightest possible deviation from the path he had drawn for Iraqi education. He saw himself as the custodian of a sacred mission to implant the seeds of Arab nationalism into the minds and hearts of the people, and to make Arab nationalism supercede other iden­tities and loyalties. He was determined, even at the risk of denying someone his livelihood, to make the people into true Arabs.
content_units.azure_translation: 黎巴嫩、叙利亚和巴勒斯坦。这也算得上是舒比吗？66 然而，关键是胡斯里不会容忍哪怕是丝毫偏离他为伊拉克教育所划定的道路。他将自己视为一项神圣使命的守护者，即将阿拉伯民族主义的种子植入人民的思想和心灵，使阿拉伯民族主义取代其他身份和忠诚。他决心，即使冒着剥夺某人生计的风险，也要让人民成为真正的阿拉伯人。

content_units.text: This is precisely why, throughout his career, his only of.cial posi­tions were in the .eld of education. He would later write that from these positions of authority, he was able to employ every means to strengthen the feelings of nationalism among the sons of Iraq and to spread the belief in the unity of the Arab nation.67 And how is this most pro.tably and propitiously done? The answer for Husri as we have seen is through a directed, carefully engineered, presentation of the past.68 In 1922, he issued the following directive to teachers of history in Iraqi elementary schools:
content_units.azure_translation: 这正是为什么在他的整个职业生涯中，他唯一的职位是在教育领域。他后来写道，从这些权威职位上，他能够利用一切手段加强伊拉克子弟的民族主义情绪，传播阿拉伯民族团结的信念。67 这事怎么做才是最亲切和最有利的呢？正如我们所看到的，胡斯里的答案是通过对过去的有针对性的、精心设计的介绍。68 1922 年，他向伊拉克小学的历史教师发出了以下指令：

content_units.text: The basic goal of historic studies in elementary schools is to teach the history of the fatherland and the past of the nation. The ultimate objective to be derived from this is the strengthening of patriotic and nationalistic feelings in the hearts of the students. Therefore, the history of Iraq and of the Arab nation should be the core of historical studies. As for the history of other countries, it should not be studied in the .rst courses except as it relates to the history of Iraq and of the Arabs.... The ideas of the unity of the Arab nation and the Arabism of Iraq should be brought out clearly from the beginning.69 (italics added)
content_units.azure_translation: 小学历史学的基本目标是教授祖国历史和民族过去。由此得出的最终目标是加强学生心中的爱国主义和民族主义情怀。因此，伊拉克和阿拉伯民族的历史应该是历史研究的核心。至于其他国家的历史，除非与伊拉克和阿拉伯人的历史有关，否则不应在第一门课程中学习。阿拉伯民族统一和伊拉克阿拉伯主义的思想应该从一开始就明确地提出来。69 （斜体后加）

content_units.text: Muhamed Mahdi al-Jawahiri, Dhikrayati (My memoirs) (Damascus: Dar al-Ra.dayn, 1988), p. 163. The Iraqi writer, Selim Mattar implies that Husri .red Jawahiri because the poet happened to be born in the Shiite holy city of Najaf and had praised the Shiite Ulama (clergy). See, Selim Mattar, Al-Dhat al-Jariha: Ishkalat al-Hawiya . al-Iraq wa al-Alam al­Arabi al-Shirqani (Wounded essence: problems of identity in Iraq and the Eastern Arab world) (Beirut: al-Muasasa al-Arabiya li al-Dirasat wa al-Nashr, 1997), p. 121.
Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist,p.62.

See Kazziha, Al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Marhalat ma bein al-Harbayn al-Alami­tayn (Arab nationalism in the period between the two world wars), p. 64. On the choice for Arab historians between history as an objective intellectual exercise and as an ideological tool, see Hazem Zaki Nuseibeh, The Ideas of Arab Nationalism (London: Kennikat Press, 1972), pp. 7082. A more general treatment can be found in Rustow, A World of Nations, pp. 4147.

Herein, fused into each other, lie the nations two pedagogical pillars, history and education: the right kind of history, taught for the speci.c purpose of nourishing and legitimizing (some would argue even creating) the nation. And as long as this history is re­membered and constantly reinforced through directed and pur­poseful education, the nation will live and thrive.
content_units.azure_translation: 在这里，两国相互融合，是历史和教育这两个教学支柱：正确的历史，其教学目的是滋养和合法化（有些人甚至认为是创造）国家。只要这段历史被铭记，并通过有针对性和有目的的教育不断强化，这个国家就会生存和繁荣。

content_units.text: Husris determined and single-minded pursuit of nationalist edu­cational policy undoubtedly smacks of an overbearing and authori­tarian political attitude. He was a man driven by an obsession with a particular belief system, and his various positions of authority afforded him the opportunity to try and infuse the tenets of this belief system into the hearts and minds of successive generations.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里斯坚定而专一地追求民族主义教育政策，无疑带有一种专横和专制的政治态度。他是一个对特定信仰体系的痴迷所驱使的人，他的各种权威地位使他有机会尝试将这种信仰体系的信条注入后代的心灵和思想中。

content_units.text: On the other hand, it is not that dif.cult to understand why Husri and the other custodians of the nationalist narrative would go out of their way to manipulate history, to exaggerate, obfuscate, and even invent historical fact, and then use their of.cial power to im­pose their version of this doctored history on successive genera­tions of people. The reason lies in the many hurdles they had to overcome in propagating the very idea of an Arab national iden­tityhurdles relating to the existence of a host of other identities among the Arabic-speaking peoples, some of which were intrinsi­cally hostile to Arab nationalism. In this critical ideational struggle, Husri and his disciples would argue that their authoritarian and manipulative methods were justi.ed. These efforts would eventu­ally bear fruit. But as we shall see it would not be a smooth journey.
content_units.azure_translation: 另一方面，理解为什么胡斯里和其他民族主义叙事的守护者会不遗余力地纵历史，夸大、混淆甚至捏造历史事实，然后利用他们的权力将他们对这段被篡改的历史的版本强加给后代人，这并不是那么困难。原因在于，他们在传播阿拉伯民族认同理念时必须克服许多障碍，这些障碍与阿拉伯语民族中存在许多其他身份有关，其中一些民族本质上是敌视阿拉伯民族主义的。在这场批判性的意识形态斗争中，胡斯里和他的门徒会争辩说，他们的专制和纵方法是合理的。这些努力最终会结出硕果。但正如我们将看到的，这不会是一帆风顺的旅程。

content_units.text: Quoted in Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, p. 147.

title: ARAB NATIONALISM AND COMPETING LOYALTIES: FROM THE 1920s TO THE ARAB REVOLT IN PALESTINE

content_units.text: the two decades that followed World War I, the custodi-
content_units.azure_translation: 第一次世界大战后的二十年里，保管人

content_units.text: In
content_units.azure_translation: 在

content_units.text: ans of Arab nationalism gave much of themselves to propagate the idea among the Arabic-speaking people of the area. Their ef­forts did indeed bear fruit, for the message was slowly, yet deter­minedly, reaching a growing audience. To be sure, as we shall see later on in this chapter, other identities continued to have a greater hold on peoples psyche. Yet a growing number of voices in the three most important Arab domains of the time, Iraq, Greater Syria, and Egypt, were declaring themselves to be Arabs, some­times in conjunction with, at other times to the exclusion of, other identities.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义的人们付出了很大的努力，在该地区讲阿拉伯语的人民中传播这一思想。他们的努力确实取得了成果，因为信息缓慢但坚定地传达给越来越多的听众。可以肯定的是，正如我们将在本章后面看到的那样，其他身份继续对人们的心理产生更大的影响。然而，在当时最重要的三个阿拉伯领域，即伊拉克、大叙利亚和埃及，越来越多的声音宣布自己是阿拉伯人，有时与其他身份相结合，有时则排除其他身份。

content_units.text: To many Arab nationalists in the 1920s and 1930s, Iraqseemed best equipped to .ll the heroic role played by Prussia in uniting the German-speaking people into one uni.ed German nation-state. Sami Shawkat, a disciple of Sati al-Husri, who was Iraqs director general of education in the 1930s wrote: Prussia sixty years ago used to dream about uniting the German people. What is to prevent Iraqfrom dreaming about uniting the Arab lands now that it has achieved its dream of becoming independent?1 Such hopes of Arab uni.cation seemed to be well invested in Iraq. The national­ists would look back to the past and proudly point to the glittering civilization that .ourished in Baghdad under the Abbasid Dynasty at a time when the West languished in the darkness of its medieval ages. By the middle of the ninth century, scholars working in the immense library of Baghdads Bayt al Hikma (The House of Wis­dom) had translated and commented on the main works of Aris­totle, Plato, Euclid, Ptolemy, Hippocrates, and Galen. Who else could match such a sterling pedigree?
content_units.azure_translation: 对于 1920 年代和 1930 年代的许多阿拉伯民族主义者来说，伊拉克似乎最有能力发挥普鲁士在将德语人民团结成一个统一的德意志民族国家方面所发挥的英雄作用。萨米·肖卡特 （Sami Shawkat） 是 1930 年代伊拉克教育局局长萨蒂·胡斯里 （Sati al-Husri） 的弟子，他写道： 六十年前的普鲁士曾经梦想着团结德国人民。既然伊拉克已经实现了独立的梦想，又有什么能阻止伊拉克梦想统一阿拉伯土地呢？1 阿拉伯统一的这种希望似乎在伊拉克得到了很好的投资。民族主义者会回顾过去，自豪地指出在阿拔斯王朝统治下的巴格达的闪闪发光的文明，当时西方正处于中世纪的黑暗中。到九世纪中叶，在巴格达巨大的图书馆 Bayt al Hikma（智慧之家）工作的学者们翻译和评论了亚里士多德、柏拉图、欧几里得、托勒密、希波克拉底和盖伦的主要著作。还有谁能与如此出色的血统相媲美？

content_units.text: Beyond the claims of historical validity, Iraqin the 1920s and 1930s was, as Shawkat reminded his readers, one of only four countries with a measure of independence, at least in matters of domestic policy. The other three were Yemen, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt. The .rst two, however, were deemed too backward and tribal to lead an Arab renaissance. Egypt, the most advanced Arabic-speaking country, was the natural leader, and should have taken the helm of the Arab nationalist march. But it was not willing to assume that role. While the countrys Arab identity was grow­ing, it still resided squarely in the shadow of the far more dominant Egyptian identity. Furthermore, it was in Iraqthat the intellec­tual headquarters of Arab nationalism resided in the person of Sati al-Husri, whose ideas were eliciting a receptive echo among the countrys political elites.
content_units.azure_translation: 除了声称具有历史有效性之外，正如肖卡特提醒他的读者一样，1920 年代和 1930 年代的伊拉克是仅有的四个拥有一定程度独立的国家之一，至少在国内政策方面是这样。另外三个是也门、沙特阿拉伯和埃及。然而，前两个人被认为过于落后和部落化，无法领导阿拉伯的复兴。埃及是最先进的阿拉伯语国家，是天生的领导者，本应掌舵阿拉伯民族主义游行。但它不愿意承担这个角色。虽然这些国家的阿拉伯身份在增长，但它仍然完全处于更占主导地位的埃及身份的阴影下。此外，正是在伊拉克，阿拉伯民族主义的知识分子总部位于萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri）手中，他的思想在该国政治精英中引起了接受的回响。

content_units.text: Husri and other Arab nationalists, many of whom were his disci­ples, set out to make Iraqthe beacon from which Arab nationalist ideas would spread to the rest of the Arab world. Cognizant of Iraqs societal divisions and the existence of many particularistic identities and loyalties, the nationalists set out to resurrect the idea of Arab nationalism, with the express objective of making it the dominant narrative in the country. Naturally, they focused on the schools, which they hoped would become the breeding ground for future Arab nationalist generations. To this end, Husri made sure to appoint teachers who shared his own vision. Often, these teach­ers were non-Iraqis, a number of them Palestinians, who had re­ceived their education from the American University of Beirut. They taught in the secondary schools of Iraqs main cities, and as such exercised extensive in.uence on the political ideas and pro­clivities of the next generation of Iraqi leaders.2 As we have seen, the main thrust of this educational effort was in the teaching of the right kind of history.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里和其他阿拉伯民族主义者，其中许多人是他的弟子，他们着手将伊拉克打造成阿拉伯民族主义思想传播到阿拉伯世界其他地区的灯塔。民族主义者认识到伊拉克的社会分裂以及许多特殊身份和忠诚的存在，他们着手复兴阿拉伯民族主义的思想，其明确目标是使其成为该国的主导叙事。自然而然地，他们把注意力集中在学校上，他们希望学校能成为未来阿拉伯民族主义世代的温床。为此，胡斯里确保任命与他有共同愿景的教师。这些教师通常是非伊拉克人，其中一些是巴勒斯坦人，他们在贝鲁特美国大学接受教育。他们在伊拉克主要城市的中学任教，因此广泛研究下一代伊拉克领导人的政治思想和倾向。2 正如我们所见，这种教育努力的主要目的是教授正确的历史。

content_units.text: Quoted in Malik Mufti, Sovereign Creations: Pan Arabism and Political Order in Syria and Iraq (Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press, 1996), p. 29.

The organizing framework of the history curriculum had two parametric elements: the idea of the unity of the Arab nation and the Arabism of Iraq.3 The focus would be on the absolute posi­tivegreat Arab achievements, stories of heroism and valor, exam­ples of nobility and generosity, the spirit of sacri.ce, fortitude in the face of adversity, all of which, the student was told, formed the essence of the Arab character. One such textbook written in 1931for the preparatory and secondary schools was titled, Tarikh al-Umma al-Arabiya (The History of the Arab Nation). As the title suggests, the Arab nation is taken for granted, and there is no effort to question, analyze, or even defend the concept. And in the spirit of Husris ordinance, the bulk of the book is a panegyric of the Arabs military and scienti.c achievements, and their contribu­tion to the progress of the world under the Ummayad and Abbasid dynasties. The .ve centuries of Ottoman domination are deemed worthy of no more than eleven pages. This is followed by an equally short section on Europes political and cultural supremacy, emphasizing primarily the per.dy of the colonialists.4 The message here re.ected the mission of the messenger. History was in fact guided ideology, a vehicle for the inculcation and/or resurrection of the idea of an Arab nation, whose roots, students were told, extended deep into the annals of history. The students would fur­ ther be taught that the achievements of their nation were legion, dwar.ng its failures, which in any case resulted not from its own shortcomings, but from the sedition of others.
content_units.azure_translation: 历史课程的组织框架有两个参数要素：阿拉伯民族统一的理念和伊拉克的阿拉伯主义。3 重点将放在绝对积极的阿拉伯伟大成就、英雄主义和英勇的故事、高尚和慷慨的榜样、圣洁精神、逆境中的坚韧、 学生被告知，所有这些都构成了阿拉伯性格的精髓。1931 年为预科和中学编写的一本教科书名为《阿拉伯民族史》。正如标题所暗示的那样，阿拉伯民族被认为是理所当然的，没有努力质疑、分析甚至捍卫这个概念。本着胡斯里斯法令的精神，这本书的大部分内容是阿拉伯人的军事和科学成就，以及他们在乌玛亚德和阿拔斯王朝领导下对世界进步的贡献的赞美。奥斯曼帝国统治的几个世纪被认为不超过十一页。接下来是关于欧洲政治和文化至高无上的同样简短的部分，主要强调殖民主义者的行为。4 这里的信息重申了使者的使命。事实上，历史是引导意识形态的，是灌输和/或复活阿拉伯民族思想的工具，学生们被告知，阿拉伯民族的根源深深地延伸到了历史的编年史中。学生们还会被教导，他们国家的成就 dwar.ng 失败是巨大的，无论如何，这不是由于自己的缺点，而是由于他人的煽动。

content_units.text: Phebe Marr, The Development of a Nationalist Ideology in Iraq, 19201941, The Muslim World, vol. 75, no. 2 (April 1985): 95.

Reeva S. Simon, The Teaching of History in IraqBefore the Rashid Ali Coup of 1941, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 22, no. 1 (January 1986): 43. See also William L. Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist: Ottomanism and Arabism in the Life and Thought of Satial-Husri (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1971), p. 147.
Marr, The Development of a Nationalist Ideology in Iraq, 19201941," pp. 9697.

The most susceptible to the ideas of Arab nationalism in Iraq was the urban Sunni population, who, while a minority, consti­tuted the countrys political elite. In the 1920s and 1930s, the Sunni presence was felt not just throughout Iraqs political establishment, but also throughout the educational system and among the of.cer corps of the countrys armed forces. Because of their minority sta­tus in Iraq, it was natural that the Sunnis would gravitate emotion­ally as well as rationally outward toward the other Arabs, almost all of whom belonged to the Sunni sect of Islam. Even so, while not in similar numbers or with quite the same ease, more of the educated urban non-Sunni Iraqis were also joining the nationalist ranks. In this, there can be little doubt that the educational system instituted by the state was the prime agent in the socialization of Iraqi citizens to Arab nationalist culture.5 The swelling of the ranks was evident in the widespread demonstrations that occurred in Baghdad in response to the Syrian revolt against the French (1925 1927), to the visit to Iraqin 1928 of the British Zionist Sir Alfred Mond, and to the 1929 Arab riots against the Jews in Palestine over what came to be known as the Wailing Wall incident. The nationalists in Iraqsupported any governmental initiative to make the country the center of an organically united Arab entity, or at a minimum an eventual federation of independent Arab states.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克最容易受到阿拉伯民族主义思想影响的是城市逊尼派人口，他们虽然是少数，但却是该国的政治精英。在 1920 年代和 1930 年代，逊尼派的存在不仅在整个伊拉克的政治机构中，而且在整个教育系统和该国武装部队的of.cer军中都存在。由于逊尼派在伊拉克的少数民族地位，逊尼派很自然地会在情感上和理性上向外吸引其他阿拉伯人，他们几乎都属于伊斯兰教的逊尼派。即便如此，虽然数量不相上下，也没有那么容易，但更多受过教育的城市非逊尼派伊拉克人也加入了民族主义的行列。在这方面，毫无疑问，国家建立的教育系统是伊拉克公民社会化阿拉伯民族主义文化的主要推动者。5 队伍的膨胀在巴格达为回应叙利亚反抗法国的起义（1925 年至 1927 年）而发生的广泛示威活动中显而易见，以及英国犹太复国主义者阿尔弗雷德·蒙德爵士 1928 年访问伊拉克， 以及 1929 年阿拉伯人针对巴勒斯坦犹太人的骚乱，后来被称为哭墙事件。伊拉克的民族主义者支持任何政府倡议，使该国成为一个有机统一的阿拉伯实体的中心，或者至少最终成为独立的阿拉伯国家的联邦。

content_units.text: This orientation found intellectual expression in the formation in 1935 of Nadi Muthana, the Muthana Club, whose goals were to provide a forum for the discussion of Pan-Arabism and Pales­tine, to awake nationalist spirit among the youth, and to spread Arab culture, especially knowledge of the history of the Arabs.6 Those invited to speak at the club were not only Iraqi nationalist leaders and thinkers such as Husri, but also Arab nationalists from Palestine, Syria, and Egypt. Additionally, the club took part in launching fund-raising drives for Arab nationalist causes, and fo­menting and supporting popular eruptions, such as the .erce 1939 demonstrations that took place in Baghdad to support Syrias un­successful struggle with Turkey over national rights to the Alexan­dretta (Iskandarun) region.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种取向在 1935 年成立的 Nadi Muthana 俱乐部中得到了知识的体现，其目标是为讨论泛阿拉伯主义和巴勒斯坦提供一个论坛，唤醒年轻人的民族主义精神，并传播阿拉伯文化，特别是阿拉伯人历史知识。6 受邀在俱乐部发言的不仅有胡斯里等伊拉克民族主义领袖和思想家，还有来自巴勒斯坦、叙利亚和埃及的阿拉伯民族主义者。此外，该俱乐部还参与了为阿拉伯民族主义事业发起筹款活动，并煽动和支持民众爆发，例如 1939 年在巴格达举行的示威活动，以支持叙利亚与土耳其就亚历山大（依斯干达伦）地区的民族权利进行的斗争失败。

content_units.text: Israel Gershoni, Rethinking the Formation of Arab Nationalism in the Middle East, 19201945: Old and New Narratives, in Rethinking Nationalism in the Arab Middle East, eds. James Jankowski and Israel Gershoni (New York: Columbia University Press, 1997), p. 18.
Reeva S. Simon, Iraq Between the Two World Wars: The Creation and Implementation of a Nationalist Ideology (New York: Columbia University Press, 1986), pp. 7273.

Nationalism was stirring in Syria too, but not necessarily among the ranks of the traditional political elites. Unlike Iraqand Egypt, both of which had a measure of political independence, Syria dur­ing this period was under French mandate. It is hardly surprising then that Syrias energy was focused overwhelmingly on attaining Syrian independence from the French. Syrias political leadership came from urban notables who had risen to positions of political eminence under the Ottoman Empire. During the mandate period, those leaders formed themselves into the National Bloc. The Blocs nationalism generally was localized, aimed at the mandate power. Concerns with the wider Arab arena were not a priority. And in any case, the notables were moved less by ideological fervor than by their socioeconomic and political interests. The urban lead­ers, Philip Khoury tells us, shaped nationalism into an instru­ment by which to create a more desirable balance between them­selves and the French. And they molded their movement to suit the particular interests of their class. In their hands, nationalism . . . was a means to win French recognition without upsetting the status quo.7 The notables, thus, were too preoccupied with the French, too protective of their own class interests to seriously extend their brand of nationalism beyond the borders of Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 民族主义在叙利亚也在兴起，但不一定在传统政治精英的队伍中。与伊拉克和埃及不同，这两个国家都有一定程度的政治独立性，这一时期的叙利亚处于法国的托管之下。因此，叙利亚的精力压倒性地集中在实现叙利亚从法国手中独立也就不足为奇了。叙利亚的政治领导层来自在奥斯曼帝国统治下晋升为政治显赫职位的城市名人。在任务期间，这些领导人组成了民族集团。集团的民族主义通常是本地化的，针对的是委任权。对更广泛的阿拉伯舞台的关切并不是一个优先事项。无论如何，名人们的感动与其说是意识形态热情，不如说是他们的社会经济和政治利益。菲利普·库里告诉我们，城市领导人将民族主义塑造成一种工具，借此在他们和法国人之间创造更理想的平衡。他们塑造自己的运动以适应他们阶级的特殊兴趣。在他们手中，民族主义......是在不破坏现状的情况下赢得法国认可的一种手段。7 因此，名人们过于关注法国人，过于保护自己的阶级利益，而没有认真地将他们的民族主义品牌扩展到叙利亚边界之外。

content_units.text: It was a relatively younger, more radical generation of national­ists that intellectually endeavored to integrate Syrias .ght for inde­pendence into a much wider regional struggle against colonialism and imperialism. These new nationalists came from an emerging middle class, which was the hallmark of the structural changes that were occurring in Syria. Coming from a different socioeconomic background, their de.nition of nationalism diverged from that of the urban notables. In the standard work on Syria in this period, Philip Khoury describes these consequential changes:
content_units.azure_translation: 是相对年轻、更激进的一代民族主义者，他们在理智上努力将叙利亚争取独立的思想融入到反对殖民主义和帝国主义的更广泛的区域斗争中。这些新民族主义者来自新兴的中产阶级，这是叙利亚正在发生的结构性变化的标志。他们来自不同的社会经济背景，对民族主义的定义与城市名人不同。在这一时期关于叙利亚的标准著作中，菲利普·库里描述了这些随之而来的变化：

content_units.text: Philip S. Khoury, Continuity and Change in Syrian Political Life: The Nineteenth and Twentieth Centuries, The American Historical Review, vol. 96, no. 5 (December 1991): 1389.

During the 1930s, new political movements emerged in Syria in re­sponse to the gradual socio-economic and cultural changes oc­curring beneath the political surface.... More radical than the Na­tional Bloc, they expressed and harnessed . . . political sentiment in a bid to expand the base of political activity in Syria.... These radicalized movements left their mark on the politics of nationalism. They betrayed a strong middle class component.... They wanted a rede.nition of nationalism [which] placed more emphasis on so­cial and economic justice for the masses, on pan-Arab unity . . . than on the old nationalist idioms of constitutionalism, liberal parliamen­tary forms, and personal freedoms.8
content_units.azure_translation: 在 1930 年代，叙利亚出现了新的政治运动，以应对政治表面下发生的逐渐社会经济和文化变化。他们比民族集团更激进，表达并利用......政治情绪，以扩大叙利亚的政治活动基础......这些激进运动在民族主义政治上留下了印记。他们背叛了强大的中产阶级成分......他们想要重新定义民族主义，[它]更加强调群众的社会和经济正义，泛阿拉伯的团结......而不是宪政主义、自由议会形式和个人自由等古老的民族主义习语。

content_units.text: It was members of this nationalist generation that formed Usa­bat al-Amal al-Qawmi (the League of National Action) in 1933. The League and its ideas became popular among primarily young Syrians, a popularity that lasted until World War II.9 The League had two interrelated goals: total Arab sovereignty and comprehen­sive Arab unity. The League vehemently criticized the National Bloc for its accomodationist policies toward the mandatory power, and pledged themselves to carry on the struggle until full independence had been achieved and the greater Arab state had been formed.10 The League later was to give way to other Arab nationalist parties, most notably the Bath Party; it did however play an important role in popularizing and spreading Arab nation­alist ideas.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是这一代民族主义者的成员于 1933 年组建了 Usabat al-Amal al-Qawmi（民族行动联盟）。联盟及其思想主要在叙利亚年轻人中流行起来，这种流行一直持续到第二次世界大战。9 联盟有两个相互关联的目标：阿拉伯的完全主权和阿拉伯的全面统一。联盟强烈批评民族集团对强制性权力的迁就主义政策，并承诺继续斗争，直到实现完全独立并形成更大的阿拉伯国家。10 联盟后来让位于其他阿拉伯民族主义政党，最著名的是巴斯党;然而，它确实在普及和传播阿拉伯民族主义思想方面发挥了重要作用。

content_units.text: Philip S. Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate: The Politics of Arab Nationalism, 19201945 (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1987), pp. 626627.

John F. Devlin, The Bath Party: A History from its Origins to 1966, (Stanford, Califor­nia: Hoover Institution Press), p. 7; also Stephen Hemsley Longrigg, Syria and Lebanon Under French Mandate (London: Oxford University Press, 1958), p. 228.
Yehoshua Porath, In Search of Arab Unity. 19301945 (London: Frank Cass, 1986), p. 161.

The balance of forces among nationalist groups in Palestine mir­rored that of Syria. Members of the emerging urban middle class came to nationalism from a more radical perspective than the one held by the traditional and conservative leadership. In addition to forming a number of Arabist (as well as Islamic) associations, they founded al-Istiqlal Party (the Independence Party), which became the leading Arab nationalist institution of the era. It was members of the middle classteachers, lawyers, doctors, and the like who swelled the ranks of the party.11 Their propagation of Arab nation­alist ideas played a signi.cant role in the political struggle against the mounting threat of Zionism. This was motivated if not wholly, then at least partly, by the enormity of Jewish immigration.
