The Jewish population numbered 175,000 in 1931; four years later it had doubled, and in 1940 it stood at 467,000.12 It was very clear to the Palestinians that support from the rest of the Arabs was needed in order to halt this fundamental demographic shift, which naturally was highly deleterious to the Arab Palestinians.
content_units.azure_translation: 巴勒斯坦民族主义团体之间的力量平衡与叙利亚的平衡如出一辙。新兴的城市中产阶级成员从比传统和保守派领导层所持有的更激进的角度开始民族主义。除了组建许多阿拉伯（以及伊斯兰）协会外，他们还创立了 al-Istiqlal 党（独立党），该党成为那个时代领先的阿拉伯民族主义机构。正是中产阶级教师、律师、医生等成员扩大了党的队伍。11 他们对阿拉伯民族主义思想的传播在对抗犹太复国主义日益增长的威胁的政治斗争中发挥了重要作用。这即使不是完全是出于犹太移民的巨大，也至少部分是出于犹太移民的庞大。1931 年，犹太人口为 175,000 人;四年后，这一数字翻了一番，1940年达到467,000人。12巴勒斯坦人非常清楚，需要其他阿拉伯人的支持才能阻止这种根本性的人口变化，这自然对阿拉伯巴勒斯坦人非常有害。

content_units.text: Arab nationalist sentiment in Egypt also grew during this period even though it came against powerful attitudinal currents engen­dered by singularly Egyptian and Islamic identities. Support for the Arab idea continued to grow so that by the mid-1930s, those who thought of themselves as Egyptian Arabs could feel con.dent enough to at least question the validity of the other prevalent iden­tities. This was encapsulated in a famous public debate that raged for several weeks. It occurred as a result of a comment in a piece written by Egypts leading man of letters, Taha Husayn, in which he identi.ed the Arabs simply as one of the many invaders of Egypt. The Arabist and Arab nationalist writers took this opportunity to launch an attack on all those who believed in Egypts uniqueness and exceptionalism, and who consciously or by implication re­ jected the Arab character of its people.13 They vehemently con­.rmed their countrys Arab identity, insisting that Egyptians were Semitic Arabs, and that Egypt was tied to the rest of the Arab world by bonds of blood and spirit. To Abd al-Rahman Azzam, ac­knowledged as the leading exponent of Egypts Arab character, Egyptians had not only accepted the religion, customs, language, and culture of the Arabs; in addition, most of the blood of [Egypts] people is traceable to Arab veins.14
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的阿拉伯民族主义情绪也在此期间增长，尽管它与埃及和伊斯兰身份的独特身份所产生的强大态度潮流背道而驰。对阿拉伯思想的支持不断增长，以至于到 1930 年代中期，那些认为自己是埃及阿拉伯人的人可以感到足够自在，至少可以质疑其他流行身份的有效性。这在一场持续了数周的著名公开辩论中得到了概括。这是由于埃及文学领袖塔哈·侯赛因 （Taha Husayn） 撰写的一篇文章中的评论而发生的，他在文章中将阿拉伯人简单地认为是埃及的众多入侵者之一。阿拉伯主义和阿拉伯民族主义作家借此机会攻击所有相信埃及独特性和例外主义的人，他们有意或暗示地重新剥夺埃及人民的阿拉伯性格。13 他们强烈地宣扬自己国家的阿拉伯身份，坚持认为埃及人是闪米特阿拉伯人，埃及与阿拉伯世界其他地区有着血缘和精神的纽带。对于被公认为埃及阿拉伯性格的主要代表阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼·阿扎姆来说，埃及人不仅接受了阿拉伯人的宗教、习俗、语言和文化;此外，[埃及]人的大部分血液都可以追溯到阿拉伯人的静脉。14

content_units.text: Yehoshua Porath, The Palestinian Arab National Movement: From Riots to Rebellion (London: Frank Cass, 1977), p. 125; also, Ann Mosely Lesch, Arab Politics in Palestine, 19171939: The Frustration of a National Movement (Ithaca, New York: Cornell Univer­sity Press, 1979), pp. 105106; also, Gershoni, Rethinking the Formation of Arab Nation­alism in the Middle East, p. 20.
Porath, The Palestinian Arab National Movement, p. 129.

These sentiments had suf.cient support among the Egyptian in­telligentsia for Arab nationalist organizations to be formed. In 1930, the Association of Arab Unity came into being, to be fol­lowed three years later by the General Arab Federation.15 As it hap­pened, neither of these organizations lasted beyond the mid-1930s, but their formation and existence suggest, nevertheless, that a na­scent Arab nationalism was making headway in the country.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些情绪在埃及知识分子中得到了充分支持，支持阿拉伯民族主义组织的成立。1930 年，阿拉伯统一协会成立，三年后阿拉伯总联邦紧随其后。15 碰巧的是，这两个组织都没有持续到 1930 年代中期之后，但它们的形成和存在表明，新生的阿拉伯民族主义正在该国取得进展。

content_units.text: This is con.rmed by the way general Egyptian opinion reacted to the Syrian revolt (19251927). Newspapers supported the rights of the Syrians to independence, called on Egyptians to render support to the Syrians, and Egyptian poets composed poems praising the Syrian uprising and lambasting the French for their acts of repres­sion. Fund-raising drives were organized and material support ex­tended to the Syrians. Public sympathy was such that Saad Zagh­loul, Egypts most prominent leader (who at the time did not hold public of.ce) was moved to issue a declaration to the nation,16 supporting Syrias rights to rule itself and condemning French shed­ding of innocent Syrian blood. Public concern for Syria must have been suf.ciently widespread, for Zaghloul, known for his indiffer­ence to the rest of the Arab world, to make such a declaration.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及普遍舆论对叙利亚起义的反应方式就证明了这一点（19251927）。报纸支持叙利亚人的独立权，呼吁埃及人支持叙利亚人，埃及诗人创作诗歌赞美叙利亚起义，抨击法国人的镇压行为。组织了筹款活动，并向叙利亚人提供了物质支持。公众的同情如此之大，以至于埃及最杰出的领导人萨阿德·扎格鲁尔（当时他没有公开）感动向全国发表宣言，16 支持叙利亚的统治权，并谴责法国流无辜叙利亚人的鲜血。公众对叙利亚的担忧一定是非常广泛的，因为扎格鲁尔以对阿拉伯世界其他国家漠不关心而闻名，他会做出这样的声明。

content_units.text: The stinging criticism did not dissuade Husayn from repeating his assertion that Egypt resisted the Arab invaders as much as they did other earlier invaders in his later, immensely in.uential, book, Mustaqbal al-Thaqafa . Misr (The future of culture in Egypt) (Cairo: al­Haya al-Amma li al-Kutab, 1993), p. 19.
Quoted in Israel Gershoni and James P. Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, 19301945 (London: Cambridge University Press, 1995), p. 29.
Porath, In Search for Arab Unity, p. 154.
Israel Gershoni and James P. Jankowski, Egypt, Islam and the Arabs: The Search for Egyptian Nationhood, 19001930 (New York: Oxford University Press, 1986), p. 246; also

There can be little doubt that during the 1920s and 1930s a growing number of citizens and members of various countries and regions of the Arabic-speaking Middle East supported the notion that beyond their immediate locale, they also belonged to a wider Arab fraternity, an all-encompassing Arab nation, based on a foun­dation of common language, culture, and blood ties. Supporters of the idea, the nationalist intellectuals and political activists, agi­tated not just for the wider acceptance of their beliefs, but also for a political program aimed at Arab uni.cation. Whether the end result was an organic Arab unity or some kind of federation of Arab states was not at this time as important to the advocates of Arab nationalism as the conviction that there was no necessary contradiction between belonging to the Arab nation, as well as as­piring for an Arab nation-state, and being a member of one of the nations geographically constituent parts.
content_units.azure_translation: 毫无疑问，在1920年代和1930年代，越来越多的中东阿拉伯语国家和地区的公民和成员支持这样一种观念，即除了他们的直接地区之外，他们还属于一个更广泛的阿拉伯兄弟会，一个包罗万象的阿拉伯国家，以共同语言、文化、 和血缘关系。这一想法的支持者，民族主义知识分子和政治活动家，不仅鼓动了他们的信仰被更广泛地接受，而且还鼓动了旨在阿拉伯统一的政治纲领。对于阿拉伯民族主义的倡导者来说，最终结果是有机的阿拉伯统一还是某种阿拉伯国家的联邦，此时并不重要，重要的是相信属于阿拉伯民族，渴望建立阿拉伯民族国家，以及成为地理上组成的国家之一的成员之间没有必然的矛盾。

content_units.text: That the exponents of the Arab nationalist idea existed within the mainstream of political thought and action, and that they voiced their beliefs forcefully during this period is indisputable. But by the same token their in.uence and effectiveness must not be exaggerated. Arab nationalists still faced many obstacles to the concept of a coherent and uni.ed Arab nation that in fact dwarfed its support. And this is not that surprising. Beyond the particular circumstances of the Arab Middle East, a large national domain in general is intellectually too amorphous to command the kind of loyalty usually given to more immediate traditional and familiar institutions.17 In the Arabic-speaking world during this period there were too many institutions and entities with which people identi.edregion, tribe, sect, etc.to allow the Arab nation to emerge as the .rst and foremost point of peoples loyalty.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义思想的倡导者存在于政治思想和行动的主流中，并且他们在这一时期有力地表达了自己的信仰，这是无可争辩的。但出于同样的原因，它们的实用性和有效性也绝不能被夸大。阿拉伯民族主义者在建立一个连贯和统一的阿拉伯国家的概念方面仍然面临许多障碍，而这些障碍实际上使它的支持相形见绌。这并不奇怪。除了阿拉伯中东的特殊情况之外，一个庞大的国家领域在智力上总体上过于无定形，无法获得通常对更直接的传统和熟悉的机构给予的那种忠诚。17 在这一时期的阿拉伯语世界，有太多的机构和实体，人们认同地区、部落、教派 etc.to 让阿拉伯民族成为人民忠诚的第一个和最重要的点。

content_units.text: From the very outset, Arab nationalism, which itself is a form of supranationalism, in the sense that its appeal, as well as its political agenda, extends beyond the geographic boundaries of the Arab
content_units.azure_translation: 从一开始，阿拉伯民族主义本身就是超民族主义的一种形式，因为它的吸引力及其政治议程超出了阿拉伯的地理界限

content_units.text: Ralph M. Coury, Who Invented Egyptian Arab Nationalism? Part 1, International Jour­nal of Middle East Studies, vol.14, no. 3 (August 1982): 252. states, had to compete with Islam, the other great supranational ideology. Undoubtedly, during this period, when almost every part of the Arabic-speaking Middle East was under some form of colo­nial or imperialist domination, Islamists and Arabists tolerated one another, at times even cooperating with each other. But this was purely tactical, since by de.nition the goals that de.ned the very essence of their identities had to be mutually exclusive. Hassan al-Banna, the founder of Egypts Muslim Brotherhood Organization, depicts Islam as not just a religion and a form of worship, but also, and just as crucially, a creed . . . a homeland, a nationality . . . and a state.18 This unequivocal depiction of what essentially is an Islamic nation-state had to be diametrically opposed to the concept of a secular, and an ethnically and linguistically-based, Arab nation.
content_units.azure_translation: 拉尔夫·库里（Ralph M. Coury），谁发明了埃及阿拉伯民族主义？《国际中东研究杂志》第14卷第3期（1982年8月）：第252页。国家，不得不与伊斯兰教竞争，这是另一种伟大的超国家意识形态。毫无疑问，在这一时期，当阿拉伯语中东几乎每个地区都处于某种形式的殖民或帝国主义统治之下时，伊斯兰主义者和阿拉伯主义者相互容忍，有时甚至相互合作。但这纯粹是战术性的，因为从定义上讲，剥夺他们身份本质的目标必须是相互排斥的。埃及穆斯林兄弟会组织的创始人哈桑·班纳（Hassan al-Banna）将伊斯兰教描述为不仅是一种宗教和一种崇拜形式，而且同样重要的是一种信条......一个祖国，一个民族......和一个州。18 这种对本质上是伊斯兰民族国家的明确描述必须与一个世俗的、基于种族和语言的阿拉伯民族的概念截然相反。

content_units.text: H.G. Koenigsberger, George L. Mosse, and G.Q. Bowler, Europe in the Sixteenth Cen­tury (London: Longman, 1989), p. 267.

It was within the above context that Sheikh Muhamed Mustafa al-Muraghi, rector of al-Azhar, the most respected Islamic institu­tion in the Arab world, would declare to an Egyptian newspaper that he had no views on Arab nationalism; that the concept did not interest him one bit. After all, Islam did not differentiate between the Arab and non-Arab; indeed, the Muslim Umma was a unity in which ethnicity played no part.19 Sati al-Husri was quick to reply: How could someone say that Muslim clerics should endeavor to establish unity amongst the Arab, Iranian, Indian, and Turk, but should not work to unify the Syrian, Egyptian and Hejazi? How can someone hope to effect the unity of Muslim lands speaking different languages, but not the unity of one land, speaking one language, especially the land which speaks the language of the Quran?20 The swiftness and vigor with which Husri responded to the sheikh attests to the potency of the concept of a united Muslim
content_units.azure_translation: 正是在上述背景下，阿拉伯世界最受尊敬的伊斯兰机构爱资哈尔的校长谢赫·穆罕默德·穆斯塔法·穆拉吉（Sheikh Muhamed Mustafa al-Muraghi）向一家埃及报纸宣称，他对阿拉伯民族主义没有看法;这个概念对他一点也不感兴趣。毕竟，伊斯兰教不区分阿拉伯人和非阿拉伯人;事实上，穆斯林乌玛是一个没有种族参与的统一体。19 萨蒂·胡斯里很快回答说：怎么会有人说穆斯林神职人员应该努力在阿拉伯、伊朗、印度和土耳其之间建立团结，而不应该努力统一叙利亚、埃及和希贾兹？怎么能有人希望实现说不同语言的穆斯林土地的统一，而不是一个土地、说一种语言的统一，尤其是讲《古兰经》语言的土地的统一呢？20 胡斯里对酋长的迅速和活力证明了团结穆斯林概念的效力

content_units.text: Quoted in Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation,p.81.

The statement engendered a spirited debate between Muraghi and Sati al-Husri. For Muraghis declaration, see Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Radd ala Tasrihat al-Shaykh al-Muraghi (A response to the declarations of Sheikh al-Muraghi) in his Araa wa Ahadith . al-Wataniya wa al-Qawmiya (views and discussions on patriotism and nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1984), p. 105.
Ibid., p. 106.
Umma, as a powerful competing alternative to the idea of a secular Arab nation.
content_units.azure_translation: 乌玛，作为世俗阿拉伯国家理念的有力竞争替代方案。

content_units.text: Regional particularism was another obstacle in the path of Arab nationalism. Iraqi, Syrian, Egyptian, and other regional identities competed with the larger, all-encompassing Arab identity. As we have seen, it did not take the Syrians long during Faysals brief reign in Syria after World War I to resent the Iraqi of.cers calling them foreigners and usurpers, even though those of.cers were senior .gures in the Arab military force that took part in liber­ating Syria from Ottoman Turkish rule. Indeed, as history was later to show us time and again, even with those who genuinely believed in the Arab ideal, loyalty to the geographic locale in which they lived (al-Watan) always lurked just under the surface, often manifesting itself whenever their Watan became an object of some larger Arab unity plan.
content_units.azure_translation: 区域特殊主义是阿拉伯民族主义道路上的另一个障碍。伊拉克、叙利亚、埃及和其他地区身份与更大的、包罗万象的阿拉伯身份竞争。正如我们所看到的，在第一次世界大战后费萨尔在叙利亚的短暂统治期间，叙利亚人很快就对伊拉克人感到不满，称他们为外国人和篡位者，尽管这些人是阿拉伯军队中的高级人员，参与了将叙利亚从奥斯曼土耳其统治下解放出来。事实上，正如后来历史一次又一次地向我们展示的那样，即使是那些真正相信阿拉伯理想的人，对他们所居住的地理位置（al-Watan）的忠诚也总是潜伏在表面之下，每当他们的瓦坦成为某种更大的阿拉伯统一计划的对象时，就会经常表现出来。

content_units.text: The third, and in a way the most ironic, obstacle to the concept of a coherent Arab nation was linguistic diversity. It is ironic be­cause, according to Husri and other nationalist theoreticians and activists, it is the Arabic language that ultimately de.nes the param­eters of the Arab nation. Of course, the reference here is to standard classical Arabic. But this Arabic was the domain of the literate, who constituted only a small minority of the population. During this period, no less than four out of .ve Arabs depended almost exclusively on the spoken word for communication. And spoken Arabic consisted of a vast array of suf.ciently differentiated dia­lects that in many instances it was dif.cult (sometimes downright impossible) for an Arab from one part of the Arab world to communicate with other Arabs from a different part of the Arab world. Sati al-Husri was fully aware of this problem. At one point he wrote that colloquial dialects constituted a grave dan­ger because they created divisions and weakened national unity.21
content_units.azure_translation: 第三个，在某种程度上，也是最具有讽刺意味的障碍，是连贯的阿拉伯民族概念的障碍是语言多样性。具有讽刺意味的是，根据胡斯里和其他民族主义理论家和活动家的说法，最终决定阿拉伯民族参数的是阿拉伯语。当然，这里指的是标准的古典阿拉伯语。但这种阿拉伯语是识字者的领域，他们只占人口的一小部分。在此期间，不少于四分之四的阿拉伯人几乎完全依赖口语进行交流。阿拉伯语口语由大量差异化的方言组成，在许多情况下，来自阿拉伯世界某一地区的阿拉伯人与来自阿拉伯世界不同地区的其他阿拉伯人交流是困难的（有时是完全不可能的）。萨蒂·胡斯里完全意识到这个问题。他曾一度写道，口语方言构成了严重的危险，因为它们造成了分裂并削弱了民族团结。

content_units.text: Due to the preponderance of illiteracy in the Arab world in this period, the spatial awareness of the majority of Arabs was limited to their speci.c locale. Unable to read, most Arabs were blissfully unaware of events occurring in the world at large, and whatever they happened to learn they came by mainly through word of mouth; hardly the kind of communicative effectiveness that Karl Deutsch says is an essential element of national formation and co­hesion.22 An amusing illustration of this limited consciousness is provided by Peter Gubser in detailing an incident that occurred in the town of al-Karak in Trans-Jordan in the 1930s. A Palestinian teacher attempted to raise his students consciousness about mounting Jewish immigration in Palestine. On the anniversary of the Balfour Declaration, the teacher and some of his students took to the streets shouting Down with Balfour! Having no idea what the Balfour Declaration was, the towns people joined the demon­stration shouting Down with Karkour! On hearing this, Kar­kour, the local shoemaker, was compelled to run into the street and defend his good name.23 With the probable exception of nonurban Palestinian locales,24 this incident could well have occurred in any small town or village along the length and breadth of the Arabic-speaking world.
content_units.azure_translation: 由于这一时期阿拉伯世界的文盲占主导地位，大多数阿拉伯人的空间意识仅限于他们的特定地区。由于无法阅读，大多数阿拉伯人幸福地不知道整个世界上发生的事件，无论他们碰巧得知什么，他们主要是通过口耳相传的;几乎不是卡尔·多伊奇所说的那种沟通效率是国家形成和凝聚力的基本要素。22 彼得·古布瑟 （Peter Gubser） 在详细描述 1930 年代发生在外约旦卡拉克镇的一起事件时，提供了这种有限意识的一个有趣的例证。一位巴勒斯坦教师试图提高他的学生对巴勒斯坦犹太人移民不断增加的认识。在《贝尔福宣言》周年纪念日，老师和他的一些学生走上街头，高喊“打倒贝尔福！由于不知道《贝尔福宣言》是什么，镇上的人们加入了示威游行，高喊“打倒卡库尔！听到这句话，当地鞋匠卡库尔被迫跑到街上捍卫自己的好名声。23 除了巴勒斯坦非城市地区之外，24 这一事件很可能发生在阿拉伯语世界的任何一个小城镇或村庄。

content_units.text: Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, p. 119.

Two further obstacles, sectarianism and tribalism, were rampant in many parts of the Arabic-speaking Middle East. Indeed, they exerted inordinate in.uence on peoples fundamental attitudes in Husris own backyard, the Kingdom of Iraq. As we shall see, the Sunni-Shiite divide undermined efforts at national unity both at the Iraqi and Arab levels. And this was exacerbated by a tribal struc­ture that not only resisted governmental control, but also was a focus of primordial loyalty for the people. Sectarianism was also a problem for Syria with its Sunni-Druze-Alawite divide, and in some Syrian regions, especially Latakiya, Jabal Druze, and Jezzira, entrenched tribal attitudes further impeded national consolidation. Throughout the 1920s and into the 1930s, tribes constituted the main problem facing the nascent administration of Trans-Jordan. Tribes constantly waged war against each other and raided settled communities at will. They rarely paid taxes, and maintained tribal law in de.ance of central authority. It was not until the British commander John Glubb created the Desert Patrol in the early 1930s that tribal con.icts subsided. The genius of the plan resided in Glubbs successful effort to channel the bedouins warlike energy and co-opt their services in defense of the state. Consequently, the Desert Patrol, and indeed the whole Arab Legion (Jordans armed forces), continued throughout the years to consciously manifest strong tribal ties and attitudes. The strength of Jordanian tribal ties is echoed in many other parts of the Arab world. Bassam Tibi writes: Neither in the imperial nor in the territorial state were tribes transformed into a homogenous polity; tribal ties have al­ways been the basic element of group reference, despite the fact that they were suppressed and rhetorically renounced. This hap­pened in the past within the framework of a universal Islamic Umma and in the present with reference to the secular idea of the nation.25 In some cases, tribalism and sectarianism overlapped with one another, thereby reinforcing the anti-national impulse. The Shiite tribal confederations in Iraqare a case in point, so are the Alawite and Druze tribal communities of Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 另外两个障碍，宗派主义和部落主义，在讲阿拉伯语的中东的许多地区猖獗。事实上，他们对胡斯里斯自己的后院伊拉克王国的人民的基本态度施加了过度的干预。正如我们将看到的，逊尼派和什叶派的分歧破坏了伊拉克和阿拉伯两级民族团结的努力。而部落结构不仅抵制政府控制，而且是人民原始忠诚的焦点，加剧了这种情况。宗派主义也是叙利亚的一个问题，因为叙利亚存在逊尼派-德鲁兹派和阿拉维派的分歧，在叙利亚的一些地区，特别是拉塔基亚、贾巴尔德鲁兹和杰齐拉，根深蒂固的部落态度进一步阻碍了国家的巩固。在整个 1920 年代和 1930 年代，部落构成了跨约旦新生政府面临的主要问题。部落之间不断发动战争，随意袭击定居社区。他们很少纳税，并维持部落法律，以管理中央权威。直到英国指挥官约翰·格鲁布 （John Glubb） 在 1930 年代初期创建了沙漠巡逻队，部落冲突才平息下来。该计划的天才在于格鲁布斯成功地引导贝都因人的好战能量并利用他们的服务来保卫国家。因此，沙漠巡逻队，乃至整个阿拉伯军团（约旦武装部队），多年来继续有意识地表现出强烈的部落联系和态度。约旦部落关系的牢固性在阿拉伯世界的许多其他地区也得到了呼应。巴萨姆·提比写道：无论是在帝国还是在领土国家，部落都没有转变为一个同质的政体;部落关系一直是群体参考的基本要素，尽管它们被压制和言辞放弃。这发生在过去，发生在普遍的伊斯兰乌玛的框架内，而现在，则参考了国家的世俗观念。25 在某些情况下，部落主义和宗派主义相互重叠，从而强化了反民族的冲动。伊拉克的什叶派部落联盟就是一个典型的例子，叙利亚的阿拉维派和德鲁兹部落社区也是如此。

content_units.text: Karl W. Deutsch, Nationalism and Social Communication,2nd ed. (Cambridge, Massa­chusetts: MIT Press, 1966).
Peter Gubser, Politics and Change in al-Karak, Jordan: A Study of a Small Arab Town and Its District (London: Oxford University Press, 1973), p. 22.

Rashid Khalidi documents a long history of struggle waged by Palestinian fellahin against Zionist efforts to purchase the lands on which they worked. See Rashid Khalidi, Palestinian Identity: The Construction of Modern National Consciousness (New York: Co­lumbia University Press, 1997), pp. 89117. This direct encounter with the Zionist move­ment gave the Palestinian peasant an intimate knowledge of the Zionist movement that other nonurban, nonliterate, Arabs did not possess.

In this ideational and political clash between Arab national iden­tity and the other competing identities, the most consequential Arab countries/regions in this period were Iraq, Syria, and Egypt. This is not to suggest a lack of nationalist sentiment in other parts of the Arabic-speaking Middle East. But none of the other domains could match up to Iraq, Syria, and Egypt in demographic weight, or in peoples perception of their respective geostrategic position in the Arab world. Saudi Arabia was too remote, overtly tribal, and demographically unsophisticated. Lebanon was a geographically small area with a politically in.uential Christian population that was singularly hostile to any notion of Arab unity. Jordan was perceived throughout the Arab world as an arti.cial and inconse­quential creation by the British to pacify Emir Abdallah. Palestine was a hotbed of national sentiment, and in Haj Amin al-Husayni, Palestinians had a popular nationalist leader whose in.uence ex­tended beyond the con.nes of Palestine. The country, however, was already a contested domain, oscillating precariously between a Jewish and an Arab identity. And in any case, during this period, many Arabs perceived Palestine (as well as Lebanon and Jordan) as an intrinsic part of Greater Syria, Bilad al-Sham. Finally, on the level of political institutions, Iraq, Egypt, and increasingly Syria, were forging rapidly ahead of the other parts of the Arab world. Consequently, the actual and perceived centrality of these three countries in the Arab world of the 1920s and 1930s was such that whatever the outcome of the debates over the various identities, and whatever the direction of the political struggle, the consequent impact was sure to be felt not just locally, but throughout the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 在阿拉伯民族认同与其他相互竞争的身份之间的意识形态和政治冲突中，这一时期影响最大的阿拉伯国家/地区是伊拉克、叙利亚和埃及。这并不是说中东阿拉伯语区其他地区缺乏民族主义情绪。但其他领域在人口比重上，或者在人民对各自在阿拉伯世界的地缘战略地位的看法上，都无法与伊拉克、叙利亚和埃及相提并论。沙特阿拉伯太偏远，明显是部落化，而且人口结构不成熟。黎巴嫩是一个地理上很小的地区，在政治上拥有无意义的基督徒人口，他们对任何阿拉伯统一的概念都抱有敌意。约旦在整个阿拉伯世界都被视为英国人为安抚埃米尔阿卜杜拉而创造的无关紧要的创造。巴勒斯坦是民族情绪的温床，在哈吉·阿明·侯赛尼 （Haj Amin al-Husayni） 中，巴勒斯坦人有一位受欢迎的民族主义领袖，他的影响力超出了巴勒斯坦的范围。然而，这个国家已经是一个有争议的领域，在犹太人和阿拉伯人的身份之间摇摆不定。无论如何，在此期间，许多阿拉伯人将巴勒斯坦（以及黎巴嫩和约旦）视为大叙利亚比拉德沙姆的内在组成部分。最后，在政治制度层面上，伊拉克、埃及和日益增长的叙利亚正在迅速领先于阿拉伯世界的其他地区。因此，这三个国家在1920年代和1930年代阿拉伯世界的实际和感知中心地位是这样的，无论关于各种身份的辩论的结果如何，无论政治斗争的方向如何，随之而来的影响肯定不仅在当地，而且在整个阿拉伯世界。

content_units.text: Bassam Tibi, The Simultaneity of the Unsimultaneous: Old Tribes and Imposed Na-tion-States in the Modern Middle East, in Philip S. Khoury and Joseph Kostiner, Tribes and State Formation in the Middle East (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1980), p. 127.

In detailing the many obstacles to Arab nationalism in the three countries, we might begin with Iraq. The country after all was, during this period, the home of Sati al-Husri. Because they had a considerable measure of authority over domestic matters, Husri and his associates and disciples, as we have seen, actively endeav­ored through the medium of school, as well as public, education to lay a sure foundation not just for the national idea, but also for the national state. These determined nationalists were convinced that they could turn Iraqinto the Prussia of the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 在详细说明这三个国家阻碍阿拉伯民族主义的许多障碍时，我们可以从伊拉克开始。毕竟，在此期间，该国是萨蒂·胡斯里的故乡。正如我们所见，由于胡斯里和他的同事和门徒在国内事务上拥有相当大的权威，他们通过学校和公共教育的媒介积极努力，不仅为民族理念，而且为民族国家奠定坚实的基础。这些坚定的民族主义者坚信，他们可以把伊拉克变成阿拉伯世界的普鲁士。

content_units.text: The problem for the nationalists was that the country they wanted to turn into a nationalist prototype for the rest of the Arab world was itself a severely fragmented society. Iraqwas essentially an arti.cial state, created through an amalgamation of three ex-Ottoman provinces, and bereft of any ethnic or religious rationale. It therefore lacked the essential underpinnings of a national bond. The province of Mosul to the north had substantial Kurdish and Turkoman populations, and had strong ties with Turkey and Syria; Basrah in the south was predominantly Shiite with long-standing and deep bonds to Persia; and Baghdad in the center of the country was dominated by Sunnis, with economically in.uential Jewish and Christian minorities.26 Over half of the population was Shiite, yet the politically dominant group were the Arab Sunnis who consti­tuted barely a third of the population. Nearly one in ten was non-Muslim, and a quarter were non-Arabic speakersmainly Kurds, but also Turkoman, Assyrians, Armenians, and others.27 This social fragmentation was exacerbated by a pervasive tribal structure that posed numerous problems for the king and his government in Baghdad. Hanna Batatu tells us:
content_units.azure_translation: 民族主义者面临的问题是，他们想要成为阿拉伯世界其他国家的民族主义原型的国家本身就是一个严重分裂的社会。伊拉克本质上是一个由三个前奥斯曼帝国省份合并而成的国家，没有任何种族或宗教理由。因此，它缺乏国家纽扣的基本基础。北部的摩苏尔省有大量的库尔德人和土库曼人，与土耳其和叙利亚有着密切的联系;南部的巴士拉主要是什叶派，与波斯有着长期而深厚的联系;而位于该国中部的巴格达则由逊尼派主导，在经济上占有犹太人和基督教少数群体。26 超过一半的人口是什叶派，但在政治上占主导地位的群体是阿拉伯逊尼派，他们仅占人口的三分之一。近十分之一是非穆斯林，四分之一是不讲阿拉伯语的人，主要是库尔德人，但也有土库曼人、亚述人、亚美尼亚人和其他人。27 普遍存在的部落结构加剧了这种社会分裂，这给巴格达的国王及其政府带来了许多问题。汉娜·巴塔图告诉我们：

content_units.text: through the whole period of 19211939 the monarch, centered in Baghdad, had in effect a social meaning diametrically opposed to that of the tribal shaykhs, the then virtual rulers of the countryside. The shaykh represented the principle of the fragmented or multiple community (many tribes), the monarch the ideal of an integrated community (one Iraqi people, one Arab nation). Or to express the relationship differently, the shaykh was the defender of the divisive tribal urf (customs law), the monarch the exponent of the unifying national law.28
content_units.azure_translation: 在整个19211939时期，以巴格达为中心的君主实际上具有与当时农村虚拟统治者部落谢赫的社会意义截然相反的社会意义。谢赫代表了支离破碎或多重社区（许多部落）的原则，君主代表了一个综合社区的理想（一个伊拉克人民，一个阿拉伯国家）。或者换一种方式表达这种关系，谢赫是分裂的部落 urf（海关法）的捍卫者，君主是统一国家法律的倡导者28。

content_units.text: The ethnic and sectarian divisions, laden in many instances with tribal overtones, seriously hampered the governments quest for national unity which would act as the springboard for an Arab identity.29 As we have seen, the Baghdad government continued its efforts to construct a national identity, but the bulk of its energy was focused on confronting the many communal schisms that peri­odically erupted in violent rebellions. For instance, a book was published in 1933 in which the Iraqi Shiite population was equated with the Sassanid Persians, and in which the author accused Shiite teachers in Iraqof being more loyal to Iran than to Iraq. This engen­dered widespread acts of sedition, including attacks on security forces. The disturbances were quelled only after an appeal by the highest Shiite cleric.30 Such events were commonplace through­out the 1930s. In 19351936 alone, the government quelled seven serious tribal uprisings. Even though the government used modern and sophisticated weaponry to brutally put down these and other rebellions, instability, particularly in the south and in the north of the country, persisted throughout this period.31 The bulk of the rebellions occurred in the Shiite south. The Shiite mistrust of the dominant Sunni class was such that Shiites, on a number of occasions, expressed a wish to return to the days of absolute British control [rather] than be under the heel of an entirely Sunni administration.32
content_units.azure_translation: 种族和教派的分歧，在许多情况下带有部落色彩，严重阻碍了政府寻求民族团结的努力，而民族团结将成为阿拉伯身份的跳板。29 正如我们所见，巴格达政府继续努力构建民族身份，但其大部分精力都集中在对抗暴力叛乱中周期性爆发的许多社区分裂。例如，1933 年出版了一本书，其中将伊拉克什叶派人口等同于萨珊波斯人，作者在书中指责伊拉克的什叶派教师对伊朗的忠诚胜过对伊拉克的忠诚。这导致了广泛的煽动行为，包括对安全部队的袭击。直到什叶派最高神职人员呼吁后，骚乱才被平息。30 此类事件在整个 1930 年代司空见惯。仅在19351936年，政府就平息了七起严重的部落起义。尽管政府使用现代和先进的武器残酷镇压了这些叛乱和其他叛乱，但在此期间，不稳定，特别是在该国南部和北部，持续存在。31 大部分叛乱发生在什叶派南部。什叶派对占主导地位的逊尼派阶层的不信任如此之大，以至于什叶派在许多场合表示希望回到英国绝对控制的时代，而不是在完全逊尼派政府的脚下。32

content_units.text: Of the 438 Iraqi members of the 19381939 Baghdad Chamber of Commerce, 255 (58%) were Jews and Christians. See Hanna Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolu­tionary Movements of Iraq: A Study of Iraqs Old Landed and Commercial Classes and of Its Communists, Bathists, and Free Of.cers (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1978), Table 93, p. 245. The Jews were particularly powerful in the economic and .nancial sector. A Lebanese Shiite mujtahid, on a visit to Iraqin 19341935, discovered to his surprise that Shiite merchants paid homage to their religious shrines on Saturdays rather than the usual Fridays. He was told that since Jewish merchants and .nanciers did not work on Saturdays, the Shiites were compelled to take their day off on the same day. See Yitzhak Nakash, The Shiis of Iraq (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1994), p. 233.
Mufti, Sovereign Creations, pp. 2324. 28 Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolutionary Movements of Iraq, pp. 2728.

The eminent Iraqi sociologist Ali al-Wardi relates an incident in the early days of the Iraqi state during one of the annual re­enactments of the martyrdom of Imam Husayn at the hands of the Ummayad army, in which the new Iraqi .ag would only be allowed in the vicinity of those representing the Ummayads, thus becoming a target of the biting denunciations and curses of the Shiite mourn­ ers.33 Such an attitudinal polarity slowed down the states effort to create and expand national institutions, as instanced by the violent reactions of the Shiite (as well as the Yazidi) tribes to Baghdads intention to introduce a bill for universal military conscription. The great dif.culty of assimilating the Shiites into the Iraqi state, naturally undermined the efforts of the countrys political estab­lishment to propagate the ideas of Arab nationalism. And in any case, the Shiites tended to view Arab nationalism as a Sunni project designed to reduce the Shiites to an insigni.cant minority in an expanded Sunni Arab domain.
content_units.azure_translation: 著名的伊拉克社会学家阿里·瓦尔迪（Ali al-Wardi）讲述了伊拉克建国初期发生的一起事件，当时伊玛目侯赛因在乌玛亚德军队手中殉难的年度重演中，新的伊拉克.ag只允许在代表乌玛雅德的人附近，从而成为什叶派哀悼者尖锐谴责和诅咒的目标。33 这种态度两极化放缓了各州努力建立和扩大国家机构，什叶派（以及雅兹迪人）部落对巴格达打算提出一项普遍征兵法案的暴力反应就是例证。将什叶派同化到伊拉克国家中的巨大困难，自然破坏了该国政治建制传播阿拉伯民族主义思想的努力。无论如何，什叶派倾向于将阿拉伯民族主义视为逊尼派的计划，旨在将什叶派沦为扩大的逊尼派阿拉伯领地中的少数民族。

content_units.text: See Adeed Dawisha, The Assembled State: Communal Con.icts and Governmental Control in Iraq, in Ethnic Con.icts and International Politics in the Middle East, ed. Leo­nard Binder (Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 1999), especially pp. 6166.
Abd al-Razzak al-Hasani, Tarikh al-Wizarat al-Iraqiya, al-Jusi al-Thalith, 19301933 (The history of Iraqi cabinets, vol. 3, 19301933) (Baghdad: Dar al-Shuun al-Thaqa.ya al­Amma, 1988), p. 243.

Fadhil al-Barak, Dawr al-Jaysh al-Iraqi . Hukumat al-Difa al-Watani wa al-Harb maa Britania sanat 1941 (The role of the Iraqi army in the national defense government and the war with Britain in 1941) (Baghdad: al-Dar al-Arabiya li al-Tibaa, 1979), pp. 5456.
Quoted in Liona Lukitz, Iraq: The Search for National Identity (London: Frank Cass, 1995), p. 65; see also Yitzhak Nakash, The Shiis of Iraq, pp. 116117.

If the Shiites were dif.cult to assimilate into the Arab nationalist culture, the Kurds in the mountainous north of Iraqwere impossi­ble to bring in under the umbrella of the Arab nation because they considered themselves ethnically distinct from the Arabs. Being non-Semitic and speaking an Indo-European language, the Kurds had little in common with the Arabs of Iraqapart from their Sunni Muslim faith. Fiercely independent, they had vigorously agi­tated for political independence. In fact, the 1920 Treaty of Sevres had provided for an autonomous Kurdish state, but the treaty was never implemented. The Kurds, however, never accepted their in­clusion into Iraq, waging periodic insurrections against the Bagh­dad government. Unlike the Shiites, who spoke Arabic and shared the same ethnic characteristics of the Iraqi Sunnis, the Kurds were only too aware of their ethnic uniqueness in an essentially Arab society. Deep down, therefore, the Kurds continued to desire a state of their own.34 It is in this context that someone such as Bakr Sidqi, a military hero and Iraqs strong man in the mid-1930s, would con.de to the German charge daffaires in Baghdad that, being the son of a Kurdish father, the dream of a Kurdish state would always reside in his heart.35
content_units.azure_translation: 如果什叶派是同化阿拉伯民族主义文化的邪教，那么伊拉克北部山区的库尔德人就不可能被纳入阿拉伯民族的保护伞下，因为他们认为自己在种族上与阿拉伯人不同。库尔德人非闪米特人，讲印欧语系，除了逊尼派穆斯林信仰外，库尔德人与伊拉克的阿拉伯人几乎没有共同之处。他们非常独立，曾大力鼓动政治独立。事实上，1920年的《塞夫尔条约》规定了库尔德自治国的规定，但该条约从未得到实施。然而，库尔德人从未接受他们被纳入伊拉克，定期发动反对巴格达政府的叛乱。与说阿拉伯语并具有伊拉克逊尼派相同种族特征的什叶派不同，库尔德人非常清楚他们在本质上是阿拉伯社会中的种族独特性。因此，库尔德人内心深处继续渴望建立一个自己的国家。34 正是在这种背景下，像 1930 年代中期的军事英雄和伊拉克强人巴克尔·西德奇这样的人会向德国驻巴格达的代办 con.de，作为库尔德父亲的儿子，库尔德国家的梦想将永远存在于他的心中。35

content_units.text: Ali al-Wardi, Lamahat Ijtimaiya min Tarikh al-Iraq al-Hadith, al Jusi al-Sadis, minAm 1920 ila Am 1924 (Sociological aspects of modern Iraqi history, part six, 1920 1924), pp. 128129.
Dawisha, The Assembled State, pp. 6465.
Najdat Fathi Safwat, Al-Iraq . Mudhakarat al-Diblumasiyeen al-Ajanib (Iraqin the memoirs of foreign diplomats) (Baghdad: Maktabat Dar al-Tarbiya, 1984), p. 117.
The ethnic, sectarian, and tribal impediments to the institution of a unifying national ideology in Iraqseemed at times too great to be surmounted. As late as 1933, King Faysal would lament:
content_units.azure_translation: 在伊拉克建立统一的民族意识形态的种族、宗派和部落障碍有时似乎太大而无法克服。直到 1933 年，费萨尔国王才会感叹道：

content_units.text: In Iraqthere is still . . . unimaginable masses of human beings, de­void of any patriotic ideal, imbued with religious traditions and ab­surdities, connected by no common tie, giving ear to evil, prone to anarchy, and perpetually ready to rise against any government whatsoever. Out of these masses we want to fashion a people which we would train, educate and re.ne.... The circumstances being what they are, the immenseness of the efforts needed for this (can only be imagined).36
content_units.azure_translation: 在伊拉克，仍然......难以想象的人类群众，没有任何爱国理想，充满了宗教传统和荒谬，没有共同的联系，听从邪恶，容易陷入无政府状态，并永远准备起来反对任何政府。我们想从这些群众中塑造出一个我们来训练、教育和 re.ne 的民族......情况就是这样，为此需要付出的巨大努力（只能想象）36。

content_units.text: Tribalism, sectarianism, and regionalism were also responsible for slowing down nationalist integration in Syria during this pe­riod. Even though 85 percent of the population was Arabic speak­ing, they nevertheless were divided by a number of sectarian/reli­gious af.liations. While some 60 percent of the population were Sunni Arabs, the rest consisted of Arabic-speaking Alawites, Druzes, Ismailis, and Christians, as well as non-Arab Kurds, Arme­nians, Turkomans, and Circassians. In the case of the Druzes, Alawites, and Kurds, the sectarian and/or ethnic divides were criss­crossed with further tribal segmentation.37 Bassam Tibi, for in­stance, tells us that while Alawites distinguish themselves from other Arabs by embracing a myth of common descent and a com­mon belief, they themselves are subdivided into four tribes and three subsect loyalties.38 The French, cognizant of these divisions and no doubt following the imperial dictum of divide and rule, endeavored to endow the particularistic impulses of the various p. 28. Faysals letter in its entirety, which is rich in its detail of the enormous obstacles fac­ing the king and his government in their effort to integrate the people of Iraq, can be found in Naji Shawkat, Sira wa Dhikrayat thamaneena Aman, 18941974 (Biography and mem­oirs of eighty years, 18941974) (Baghdad: Maktabat al-Yaqdha al-Arabiya, 1990), pp. 622631. communities with political legitimacy. They created independent states in Aleppo, Damascus, and in the Alawite domain, as well as autonomous units in Alexandretta (eventually lost to Turkey), the Jazira, and Jebel Druze.
content_units.azure_translation: 部落主义、宗派主义和地区主义也是这一时期减缓叙利亚民族主义融合的原因。尽管 85% 的人口讲阿拉伯语，但他们仍然被一些宗派/宗教信仰所分裂。虽然大约 60% 的人口是逊尼派阿拉伯人，但其余的包括讲阿拉伯语的阿拉维派、德鲁兹派、伊斯玛仪派和基督徒，以及非阿拉伯库尔德人、亚美尼亚人、土库曼人和切尔克斯人。就德鲁兹人、阿拉维派和库尔德人而言，宗派和/或种族鸿沟纵横交错，部落进一步划分。37 例如，巴萨姆·提比告诉我们，虽然阿拉维派通过接受共同血统和共同信仰的神话而将自己与其他阿拉伯人区分开来，但他们自己被细分为四个部落和三个亚教派忠诚。38 法国人， 认识到这些分裂，并且毫无疑问地遵循了分而治之的帝国格言，努力赋予各种 p. 28 的特殊主义冲动。费萨尔的信全文详细描述了国王及其政府在努力融入伊拉克人民时面临的巨大障碍，可以在 Naji Shawkat， Sira wa Dhikrayat thamaneena Aman， 18941974 （80 年的传记和回忆录，18941974） （巴格达：Maktabat al-Yaqdha al-Arabiya， 1990 年），第 622631 页。具有政治合法性的社区。他们在阿勒颇、大马士革和阿拉维派领地建立了独立国家，并在亚历山大雷塔（最终输给了土耳其）、贾齐拉和杰贝勒德鲁兹建立了自治单位。

content_units.text: Quoted in Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolutionary Movements of Iraq,

Raymond A. Hinnebusch, Authoritarian Power and State Formation in Bathist Syria: Army, Party, and Peasant (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1990), p. 21. 38 Bassam Tibi, The Simultaneity of the Unsimultaneous: Old Tribes and Imposed Na-tion-States in the Modern Middle East, p. 138.

The indigenous divisions, politically and administratively solidi­.ed by the mandate power, and accentuated by primordial ties to family, clan, village, tribe, and /or sect, proved much stronger than the nascent loyalty to nation during this period. Indeed, even though, in Tibis words, the center of nationalism was the town and of separatism the tribal countryside,39 particularistic tenden­cies and narrow loyalties showed themselves among the city leaders and notables as well. Most nationalist leaders came from major cities, such as Damascus, Aleppo, and Hama, and they remained attached to their city base psychologically and politically.40 In this respect, the competition between Damascus and Aleppo was the most intense and most damaging to the national idea. Aleppo had absorbed Turkish culture and language far more readily than Da­mascus. Indeed, many of Aleppos elites had Turkish blood, and marriage to Turks was widespread. Moreover, Aleppos economic well being depended on continued commercial ties with Anatolia as well as with Iraq. As Philip Khoury tells us: Damascus leaders continued to feel more comfortable in Beirut or Jerusalem than in Aleppo . . . while Aleppo leaders looked to Iraq(and even Turkey) as much as they did to Damascus.41 Thus a clear attitudinal divide existed between the Damascene and Aleppine notables. Because of such narrow, town-centric loyalties and competitions, the efforts of the city notables to mobilize the mass population in the name of nationalism and national unity remained tenuous at best.
content_units.azure_translation: 土著分裂在政治和行政上由委任权巩固，并因与家庭、氏族、村庄、部落和/或教派的原始联系而加剧，事实证明，这比这一时期对国家的新生忠诚要强烈得多。事实上，尽管用提比斯的话来说，民族主义的中心是城镇，分离主义的中心是部落乡村，39 特殊主义倾向和狭隘的忠诚也在城市领导人和名人中表现出来。大多数民族主义领导人来自大马士革、阿勒颇和哈马等大城市，他们在心理和政治上仍然依附于自己的城市基础。40 在这方面，大马士革和阿勒颇之间的竞争是最激烈的，对民族理念的破坏性也最大。阿勒颇比大马士革更容易吸收土耳其文化和语言。事实上，许多阿勒颇精英都有土耳其血统，与土耳其人的婚姻很普遍。此外，阿勒颇斯的经济状况取决于与安纳托利亚以及与伊拉克的持续商业联系。正如菲利普·库里（Philip Khoury）告诉我们的那样：大马士革领导人在贝鲁特或耶路撒冷仍然比在阿勒颇感觉更舒服......而阿勒颇领导人则像关注大马士革一样关注伊拉克（甚至土耳其）。41 因此，大马士革和阿勒平名人之间存在明显的态度分歧。由于这种狭隘的、以城镇为中心的忠诚度和竞争，城市名人以民族主义和民族团结的名义动员大众的努力充其量仍然是微不足道的。

content_units.text: Much greater obstacles were felt outside the main cities. The peasantry, distrustful of central government, alienated from the na­tionalist urban leaders, who naturally had diametrically opposed class interests, isolated by geographic compartmentalization, and drawn to powerful primordial ties that took precedence over na­tional and nationalist considerations, were hardly receptive to the concept of nationalism. It is undoubtedly true that peasants formed the bulk of the body mass of the major uprisings against French rule in the 1920s, but on one level, the peasants fought under a tribal-like patriarchical leadership, and on another level, the re­volts took on the character of an Islamic Jihad against the in.­del.42 Generally speaking, particularistic tendencies and loyalties had the effect of producing separatist movements, especially in the rural areas of Jabal Druze, the Alawite territories, and the Jazira, which threatened the very fabric of Syrias quest for national unity, to say nothing of the broader idea of one Arab nation. As Shukri al-Quwatly, the Damascene notable, who was fully attuned to the ideas of Arab nationalism, would remark: as long as the French were still able to convince the Druzes of the bene.ts of indepen­dence from Syria, then it was useless to try to unite Beirut with Basrah and Baghdad with Damascus.43
content_units.azure_translation: 在主要城市之外，人们感受到了更大的障碍。农民对中央政府不信任，与民族主义城市领导人疏远，民族主义城市领导人自然有着截然相反的阶级利益，被地理划分所孤立，并被优先于民族和民族主义考虑的强大原始联系所吸引，他们几乎不接受民族主义的概念。毫无疑问，农民构成了 1920 年代反对法国统治的重大起义的大部分，但一方面，农民在类似部落的父权领导下战斗，而在另一个层面上，起义具有伊斯兰圣战的性质。42 一般来说，特殊主义倾向和忠诚产生了分离主义运动的影响，特别是在贾巴尔·德鲁兹、阿拉维派领土和贾齐拉的农村地区，这威胁到叙利亚寻求民族统一的结构，更不用说一个阿拉伯国家的更广泛概念了。正如完全了解阿拉伯民族主义思想的大马士革名人舒克里·库瓦特利所说的那样：只要法国人仍然能够说服德鲁兹人相信脱离叙利亚独立的bene.ts，那么试图将贝鲁特与巴士拉、巴格达与大马士革统一是没有用的。43

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 148.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 622.
Ibid., p. 622. For a more detailed exposition of the rivalry between Damascus and Aleppo, see ibid., pp. 102104; 440441.

A young school-age Syrian at the end of the twentieth century might be utterly mysti.ed by the reference to the Druze quest for separateness, since it was from Jebel Druze that the idealized and idolized Syrian uprising against the French emerged in 1925. To this day, Syrians cling to a memory of the uprising as a great na­tional revolt, fueled by nationalist goals, and universally supported by all Syrians regardless of sect, creed, or regional af.liation. The facts tell a different story. To begin with, very few people partici­pated in the uprisingno more than ten thousand, half of whom were Druze tribesmen. Some support came from workers in the cities of Damascus and Hama, and from a few Muslim merchants who saw the revolt as a way of undermining their Christian com­petitors, but only a small minority of notables joined in. The upris­ing was by no means the great national movement it was portrayed as by later narrators of the nationalist idea. It was at heart a tradi­tional movement fueled by religion, factional rivalries and ambi­ tions, and hopes of plunder.44 Indeed, had the French been more sensitive to Druze religious practices, the whole tragic episode could have been averted.45
content_units.azure_translation: 20世纪末，一个年轻的学龄叙利亚人可能会因为提到德鲁兹人寻求分离而完全感到困惑，因为1925年，理想化和偶像化的叙利亚反对法国人的起义正是从杰贝勒·德鲁兹那里出现的。直到今天，叙利亚人仍然坚持将起义视为一场伟大的民族起义，由民族主义目标推动，并得到所有叙利亚人的普遍支持，无论教派、信仰或地区派别如何。事实讲述了一个不同的故事。一开始，参加起义的人不超过一万人，其中一半是德鲁兹部落人。一些支持来自大马士革和哈马市的工人，以及一些穆斯林商人，他们认为起义是削弱基督教竞争对手的一种方式，但只有一小部分知名人士加入了。起义绝不是后来民族主义思想的叙述者所描绘的伟大的民族运动。它本质上是一场由宗教、派系竞争和氛围以及掠夺希望推动的传统运动。44 事实上，如果法国人对德鲁兹的宗教习俗更加敏感，整个悲惨事件本可以避免45。

content_units.text: Hinnebusch, Authoritarian Power and State Formation in Bathist Syria,p.43. 43 Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 519.

The Druze community in the 1920s could hardly be portrayed as a bastion of Syrian, let alone Arab, nationalism. The community was very much divided on the question of integration within Syria. As late as 1939, the high commissioner of France believed that two thirds of the Druzes were against union with Syria; the remaining third supported the union, but with a number of conditions, includ­ing a measure of autonomy from Damascus and the demand that only Druze of.cials be appointed to the Druze areas.46 Whatever their tactical objectives, it seems clear that the strategic goals of the uprising that was led by the Druze were local and traditional; in­deed, the Druze were hardly sold on the notion of being an integral part of Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 1920 年代的德鲁兹社区很难被描绘成叙利亚民族主义的堡垒，更不用说阿拉伯民族主义了。社区在叙利亚内部的融合问题上存在很大分歧。直到 1939 年，法国高级专员还认为三分之二的德鲁兹人反对与叙利亚联合;剩下的三分之一支持联邦，但有许多条件，包括从大马士革获得一定程度的自治权，以及要求只任命德鲁兹人到德鲁兹地区。46 无论他们的战术目标是什么，很明显，德鲁兹人领导的起义的战略目标是地方性的和传统的;事实上，德鲁兹人几乎不相信自己是叙利亚不可分割的一部分。

content_units.text: Nor were the Alawites or the inhabitants of the Jazira. As we have seen, the Alawites possessed a vision of themselves that cast them apart from the rest of the Syrians and from other Arabs. The separatist impulse was real and intense, made stronger by the fact that under the long Ottoman rule, much of the Latakia province, where the Alawites lived, was largely autonomous. But on the whole, these separatist sentiments did not translate into wide­spread rebellions. The main reason for this was that the community itself was divided tribally, geographically and by religious sub­sects.47 Their energy was consumed by internal dissension and bick­ering. But still a great majority of Alawis opposed union which appeared to mean the political reinforcement of the economic power of the absentee Sunni landowners who dominated the re­gion.48 This in no way meant that the Alawites were French col­laborators; but neither could they be characterized as Syrian or Arab nationalists. The majority of Alawites, Patrick Seale tells us, wanted only to run their own affairs as they had done for centu­ries.49 A similar picture emerges in the Jazira, with its heteroge­neous population consisting of Syrian and Armenian Christians who inhabited the urban areas, especially Qamishli, and the rural Arab and Kurdish tribes. The area was socioculturally and politi­cally underdeveloped, in which loyalty to traditional patriarchal symbols were paramount among the mixed population. Thus, the notion of Syrian unity (to say nothing of the larger and more ab­stract concept of an Arab nation) was foreign to most of the Jazira inhabitants.50 The center-periphery divide in Syria during this pe­riod, with the peripherys entrenched patriarchal and essentially localized attitudes and tendencies, was too pronounced to allow for the emergence of an imagined national community.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉维派或贾齐拉的居民也没有。正如我们所看到的，阿拉维派拥有一种自我愿景，使他们与其他叙利亚人和其他阿拉伯人区分开来。分离主义的冲动是真实而强烈的，在奥斯曼帝国的长期统治下，阿拉维派居住的拉塔基亚省的大部分地区基本上是自治的，这一事实使这种冲动更加强烈。但总的来说，这些分离主义情绪并没有转化为广泛的叛乱。造成这种情况的主要原因是社区本身在部落、地理和宗教分支上存在分歧。47 他们的精力被内部的纷争和争吵所消耗。但大多数阿拉维人仍然反对联合，这似乎意味着在政治上加强主导该地区的缺席逊尼派地主的经济权力。48 这绝不意味着阿拉维派是法国的合作者;但他们也不能被定性为叙利亚或阿拉伯民族主义者。帕特里克·西尔告诉我们，大多数阿拉维派人只想像几个世纪以来那样管理自己的事务。49 贾齐拉也出现了类似的情况，其异质人口由居住在城市地区的叙利亚和亚美尼亚基督徒组成，尤其是卡米什利，以及农村的阿拉伯和库尔德部落。该地区在社会文化和政治上都不发达，在混合人口中，对传统父权象征的忠诚至关重要。因此，叙利亚统一的概念（更不用说阿拉伯民族这个更大、更抽象的概念了）对大多数贾齐拉居民来说是陌生的。50 这一时期叙利亚的中外围鸿沟，外围根深蒂固的父权制和基本上地方化的态度和倾向，过于明显，无法出现想象中的民族共同体。

content_units.text: M. E. Yapp, The Near East since the First World War: A History to 1995,2nd ed. (London: Longman, 1996), p. 92. While Philip Khoury agrees that the objectives of the Druze leadership may have been old and familiarthe retention or restoration of its power in the Jebel, he contends that at least the tactics they used in actively seeking alliances beyond the Jebel were new. Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 166. Pages 151204 of Khourys book provide a detailed history of the revolt.
Nasim Nasr and Sami Mufrij, Multaqa al-Shuub: aw Mujaz Tarikh Syriya wa Lubnan (The meeting of peoples: an abridged history of Syria and Lebanon) (Damascus: Matbaat al-Jamia, n.d.), pp. 116118.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 519.
Ibid., p. 523.

Yet there were problems even at the supposedly nationalist center. Among Syrias urban notables, the countrys renowned na­tionalist leaders, nationalism was conveniently cast aside if it hap­pened to collide with their other interests, especially their business concerns. Shukri al-Quwatly, for instance, the ardent Arab nation­alist and vigorous defender of Palestinian rights, visited Palestine in October 1935 to win Jewish clients for his Conserves company.51 And this happened at a time of mounting tensions between the Arab Palestinians and the Jews, which was to erupt into the 19361939 Arab revolt in Palestine. Indeed, during the general strike in Pales­tine, which was the initial phase of the Arab revolt, a number of these Syrian notables who had business interests in Palestine were so alarmed by their lack of access to the lucrative Palestinian market that they demanded Syrias political leadership to pressure the Pal­ estinians to end the strike.52 If the peripherys indifferent attitudes to nationalism was a function of particularistic, subnational loyal­ties, the fragility of the centers Arab nationalist credentials was a manifestation of the primacy of economic interests over all other concerns and loyalties. This economic nationalism was one indica­tion of the rise of a speci.cally local Syrian nationalism (wataniya) at the expense of the larger Arab nationalism (qawmiya).
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，即使在所谓的民族主义中心也存在问题。在叙利亚城市名人中，该国著名的民族主义领导人，如果民族主义碰巧与他们的其他利益，尤其是他们的商业利益发生冲突，就会被方便地抛在一边。例如，热心的阿拉伯民族主义者和巴勒斯坦权利的积极捍卫者舒克里·库瓦特利 （Shukri al-Quwatly） 于 1935 年 10 月访问巴勒斯坦，为他的 Conserve 公司赢得犹太客户。51 这发生在阿拉伯巴勒斯坦人和犹太人之间日益紧张的时候，这种紧张局势将爆发为巴勒斯坦19361939阿拉伯起义。事实上，在巴勒斯坦总罢工期间，即阿拉伯起义的初始阶段，一些在巴勒斯坦拥有商业利益的叙利亚名人对他们无法进入利润丰厚的巴勒斯坦市场感到非常震惊，以至于他们要求叙利亚政治领导层向巴勒斯坦人施压，要求结束罢工。52 如果外围对民族主义的冷漠态度是特殊主义的结果， 次国家忠诚度，中心阿拉伯民族主义资历的脆弱性是经济利益高于所有其他关切和忠诚的表现。这种经济民族主义是以牺牲更大的阿拉伯民族主义（qawmiya）为代价而兴起的一种迹象。

content_units.text: Yapp, The Near East Since the First World War,p.95.
Patrick Seale, Asad: The Struggle for the Middle East (Berkeley: University of Califor­nia Press, 1988), p. 18.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 527; see also Yapp, The Near East since the First World War,p.95.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, p. 284.

The rise in popularity of Syrian nationalism was spearheaded by the writings and political agitation of Antun Saada. Born in 1904, in Mount Lebanon into a Greek Orthodox family, Saada emi­grated with his father to the New World in 1919, settling in Brazil after a two-year stay in the United States. In 1930, at the age of twenty-six, he returned to Syria and within two years he founded the Syrian Social Nationalist Party (SSNP). Although outlawed and constantly harassed by the French, the party rapidly gained adher­ents among the urban populations, becoming an important player among the radical underground opposition. Indeed, by the end of World War II, it had a broad popular base, a fact that did not escape the attention of the indigenous leaderships of the newly in­dependent states of Syria and Lebanon. In July 1949, Saada was arrested, and within twenty-four hours summarily tried and exe­cuted. By the time of Saadas death, the SSNP had grown into a major political force, so much so that Sati al-Husri, necessarily an antagonist, was moved to declare in 1948: There is no party in the Arab world which can compete with the SSNP for the quality of its propaganda, which in.uences reason as well as the emotions, and for the strength of its organization, which is as ef.cient on the surface as it is underground.53 The party remained a force well into the 1950s, eventually to be eclipsed by the spectacular ascent of Arab nationalism during that decade.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚民族主义的兴起是由安通·萨达的著作和政治鼓动带头的。萨达 1904 年出生于黎巴嫩山的一个希腊东正教家庭，1919 年随父亲移民到新大陆，在美国逗留两年后定居巴西。1930 年，26 岁的他回到叙利亚，并在两年内创立了叙利亚社会民族主义党 （SSNP）。尽管该党被取缔并不断受到法国人的骚扰，但该党迅速在城市居民中获得了追随者，成为激进地下反对派的重要参与者。事实上，到第二次世界大战结束时，它已经拥有了广泛的民众基础，这一事实并没有逃过叙利亚和黎巴嫩新独立国家的土著领导人的注意。1949 年 7 月，萨达被捕，并在 24 小时内被即决审判并处决。到萨达斯去世时，苏维尼苏格兰民族党已经发展成为一股主要的政治力量，以至于必然是反对派的萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri）在1948年被感动地宣称：阿拉伯世界没有一个政党可以与苏维尼国民党在宣传质量上竞争，因为苏维尼国民党的宣传质量既是理性的，也是情感的。 以及其组织的力量，它在地面和地下一样有效。53 直到 1950 年代，该党仍然是一股力量，最终被阿拉伯民族主义在那十年中的惊人崛起所掩盖。

content_units.text: A foe of Arab nationalism, Saada maintained that the Syrians constituted a unique nation which was de.ned by geography as well as history. The con.uence of land and people was indispens­ able to Saadas de.nition of the Syrian nation.54 The land (which to Saada included contemporary Syria as well as Lebanon, Palestine, Jordan, the Sinai, and even Cyprus) had natural frontiers, and had been inhabited continuously by a mixture of people, Cananites, Caldeans, Hittites, and others who over the long history of Syria fused into one nation.55 Any identi.cation with Arab nationalism, argued Saada, was a surrender of Syrias uniqueness, and an accep­tance by its gifted people of an inferior status.56 It is this unequivocal message of a speci.cally Syrian nationalism that found an echo among the educated urban population, particularly the youth, which accounts for the meteoric rise in the fortunes of the SSNP.
content_units.azure_translation: 作为阿拉伯民族主义的敌人，萨达坚持认为叙利亚人是一个独特的民族，受到地理和历史的影响。土地和人民的结合对于叙利亚民族的萨达斯来说是不可或缺的。54 这片土地（对萨达来说，包括当代叙利亚以及黎巴嫩、巴勒斯坦、约旦、西奈半岛，甚至塞浦路斯）有天然的边界，并且不断居住着各种人，包括迦南人、加尔底亚人、赫梯人和其他人，他们在叙利亚的漫长历史中融合成一个国家。55 任何与阿拉伯民族主义的认同， 萨达认为，这是对叙利亚独特性的放弃，以及其有天赋的人民对低等地位的接受。56 正是这种明确的叙利亚民族主义信息在受过教育的城市人口，尤其是年轻人中引起了回响，这导致了 SSNP 命运的迅速上升。

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 544.
Quoted in Bassam Tibi, Arab Nationalism: A Critical Enquiry (New York: St. Martins Press, 1981), p. 170.

It was primarily in the same such mode of state nationalism (al­wataniya) that Egypt confronted the encroachment of Arab nation­alism. And it was not that dif.cult for Egyptians to intellectually defend this separatist orientation. After all, to most Egyptians there always had been an Egypt which was as ancient as the Nile, and whose sociopolitical roots could be traced all the way back to pharaonic times. This pharaonic orientation (al-Nuza al-.raw­niya) had gathered support with the extensive excavations that took place after Napoleons invasion of Egypt.57 Moreover, during the nineteenth century, Egypt had tread a historical path that was markedly different from the rest of the Arab world. Muhamed Ali and his successors had established an independent dynasty that was attached to the Ottoman Empire in nothing but name. Later on, when the Egyptians fell under the political control of the British, all of Egypts nationalist energy was harnessed in opposition to British control, while most of the rest of the Arabic-speaking world were on the whole still pliant members of the Ottoman Empire.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及主要是在同样的国家民族主义模式（alwataniya）中面对阿拉伯民族主义的侵占。埃及人在理智上捍卫这种分离主义取向并不是那么邪教。毕竟，对于大多数埃及人来说，一直有一个像尼罗河一样古老的埃及，其社会政治根源可以追溯到法老时代。这种法老取向（al-Nuza al-.rawniya）在拿破仑入侵埃及后进行的大规模发掘中得到了支持。57 此外，在 19 世纪，埃及走上了一条与阿拉伯世界其他地区明显不同的历史道路。穆罕默德·阿里和他的继任者建立了一个独立的王朝，除了名义上什么都没有附属于奥斯曼帝国。后来，当埃及人落入英国的政治控制之下时，埃及的所有民族主义能量都被用来反对英国的控制，而阿拉伯语世界的其他大多数国家总体上仍然是奥斯曼帝国的顺从成员。

content_units.text: Haytham A. Kader, The Syrian Social Nationalist Party: Its Ideology and Early History (Beirut: n.p., 1990), pp. 2456.

Selim Mattar, Al-Dhat al-Jariha: Ishkalat al-Hawiya . al-Iraq wa al-Alam al-Arabi al-Shirqani (Wounded essence: problems of identity in Iraqand the Eastern Arab world) (Beirut: Al-Muasasa al-Arabiya li al-Dirasat wa al-Nashr, 1997), pp. 248249.
Majid Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World: The Role of Ideas and Ideals in Politics (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins Press, 1970), p. 189.
Anwar G. Chejne, Egyptian Attitudes Toward Pan-Arabism, Middle East Journal, vol. 11, no. 3 (Summer 1957): 254.

It is hardly surprising that Egypt was a late convert to the idea of an all-encompassing Arab nation, one of whose parts would be Egypt.58 Sati al-Husri himself testi.es to the weakness of Arab nationalist sentiment among the Egyptians in this period. After the collapse of nationalist rule in Syria in 1920, Husri and other mem­bers of the short-lived Arab government made their way to Egypt expecting widespread support. They were to be bitterly disap­pointed. Most [Egyptians] did not care about the events in Syria, recalls Husri. Even the collapse of the Syrian Arab State itself en­gendered among them no amount of regret that is worth noting. And why this indifference? Husris answer is unequivocal: they did not possess an Arab nationalist sentiment; did not accept that Egypt was a part of the Arab lands, and would not acknowledge that the Egyptian people were part of the Arab nation.59 And to Husris chagrin, the Egyptians seemed to keep Arab nationalist concerns at arms length into the 1930s, for he relates in his mem­oirs that in 1931 a group of Egyptian students and their professors were visibly astonished when their Iraqi hosts broached the subject of Arab nationalism.60 Indeed, to most Egyptians, who for centu­ries had been settled cultivators, the word Arab conjured up the image of the contemptuous, indolent nomad.61 Thus, the eminent Arab historian and thinker, Nicola Ziadeh says emphatically, that from the end of the nineteenth century until World War II, national­ism to the Egyptian meant essentially Egyptian nationalism and the nationalist struggle was perceived as exclusively an Egyptian struggle against foreign control.62 In light of this cultural proclivity, any assault on Arab nationalism could be mounted with an impres­ sive array of arguments steeped in the symbolism of a well-devel­oped Egyptian identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及晚期皈依了一个包罗万象的阿拉伯国家的想法，其中一个部分就是埃及，这并不奇怪。58 萨蒂·胡斯里本人也 testi.es 这一时期埃及人中阿拉伯民族主义情绪的薄弱。1920 年叙利亚民族主义统治崩溃后，胡斯里和短命的阿拉伯政府的其他成员前往埃及，期待得到广泛的支持。他们会非常失望。胡斯里回忆说，大多数[埃及人]并不关心叙利亚发生的事件。即使是阿拉伯叙利亚国家本身的崩溃，也没有在他们中引起多少值得注意的遗憾。为什么会如此冷漠？胡斯里斯的回答是明确的：他们没有阿拉伯民族主义情绪;不接受埃及是阿拉伯土地的一部分，也不承认埃及人民是阿拉伯民族的一部分。59 令胡斯里斯懊恼的是，埃及人似乎一直对阿拉伯民族主义的担忧保持一定距离，直到 1930 年代，因为他在回忆录中提到，1931 年，当他们的伊拉克东道主提出阿拉伯民族主义的话题时，一群埃及学生和他们的教授显然感到惊讶。60 事实上，对于大多数几个世纪以来一直定居的埃及人来说， “阿拉伯”这个词让人联想到轻蔑、懒惰的游牧民族的形象。61 因此，著名的阿拉伯历史学家和思想家尼古拉·齐亚德强调说，从十九世纪末到第二次世界大战，民族主义对埃及人来说本质上意味着埃及民族主义，民族主义斗争被认为是埃及人反对外国控制的斗争。62 鉴于这种文化倾向， 任何对阿拉伯民族主义的攻击都可能以一系列充满象征意义的激进的论点来发起，这些论点充满了埃及身份的象征意义。

Porath, In Search of Arab Unity, p. 176.
Sylvia Haim, ed., Arab Nationalism: An Anthology (Berkeley: California University Press, 1962), p. 52.
