It was the intellectuals who took up the challenge. Some of Egypts most prominent literary .gures assailed the Arabs, their inferior culture, and their archaic customs and traditions. Abbas Muhamed al-Aqqad, a literary giant of the period who differenti­ated the cultured Egyptian nation from bedouin nations,63 and who saw Egyptian art as superior to Arabic art,64 wrote of the exis­tence of a wide gulf between the retrogressive mentality of the Arabs and the progressive outlook of twentieth century Egyptians, which was focused on the possibilities of the future rather than on the past. Aqqad accordingly counseled Egyptians to blot out the memory of our past Arab centuries lest we ourselves be asphyxi­ated by the dust of these centuries.65 Salame Musa, another emi­nent Egyptian intellectual of the period, agreed: We do not owe the Arabs any loyalty. Our youth should not spend too much time on Arab culture. We need to get them accustomed to writing ac­cording to modern Egyptian methods than to archaic Arab styles. And they need to know that we are superior to the Arabs.66 And why this purposeful separation? Because, to Musa, Egypts funda­mental connection is not with the Arabs, but with Europe from which Egypt took its contemporary culture and civilization.67 Taha Husayn, the dean of modern Egyptian letters, in perhaps his most in.uential book, Mustaqbal al-Thaqafa . Misr (The Future of Cul­ture in Egypt), likewise distanced Egypt from its Arab past, arguing that Egyptian civilization was older than any other civilization, and that the country had retained a distinctive identity through its pharaonic past. In terms of culture and ways of thinking, Husayn maintains that Egypt had always been a part of Europe,68 and he tellingly minimizes the importance of Arabic as Egypts national language and Islam as its religion, since neither language nor reli­gion is a primary element of nation building.69 To the renowned novelist and philosopher, Taw.qal-Hakim, Egypt and the Arabs were diametrically opposed in spirit and intellect. This is more than evident in his celebrated novel, Awdat al-Ruh (The Return of the Soul), in which he contrasts the basic decency of the Egyptian with the militant bellicosity of the Arab bedouin.70 It is of course true that not all of Egypts intellectuals shared this Egyptian wata­niya orientation. As we have seen, Arab nationalism had its vigor­ous supporters. However, during this particular period, the weight of considered intellectual opinion in Egypt was in favor of a uniquely Egyptian identity at the expense of an all encompassing Arab identity, which was depicted as spiritually bankrupt and intel­lectually backward.
content_units.azure_translation: 是知识分子接受了挑战。一些埃及最著名的文学家攻击阿拉伯人、他们低劣的文化以及他们古老的习俗和传统。阿巴斯·穆罕默德·阿卡德（Abbas Muhamed al-Aqqad）是那个时期的文学巨擘，他将有文化的埃及民族与贝都因民族区分开来，63 并认为埃及艺术优于阿拉伯艺术，64 他写道，阿拉伯人的倒退心态与二十世纪埃及人的进步观之间存在着巨大的鸿沟，后者关注的是未来的可能性，而不是过去。因此，阿卡德建议埃及人抹去我们过去阿拉伯几个世纪的记忆，以免我们自己被这几个世纪的尘埃窒息。65 当时另一位杰出的埃及知识分子萨拉梅·穆萨（Salame Musa）也同意：我们不欠阿拉伯人任何忠诚。我们的年轻人不应该花太多时间在阿拉伯文化上。我们需要让他们习惯于按照现代埃及的方法写作，而不是古老的阿拉伯风格。他们需要知道我们比阿拉伯人优越。66 为什么有目的地分离呢？因为，对穆萨来说，埃及的根本联系不是与阿拉伯人，而是与埃及从那里汲取当代文化和文明的欧洲联系。67 现代埃及文学院长塔哈·侯赛因 （Taha Husayn） 在也许是他最有意义的著作《穆斯塔克巴尔·塔卡法》中。Misr（埃及文化的未来）同样将埃及与阿拉伯的过去拉开距离，认为埃及文明比任何其他文明都古老，并且该国通过其法老的过去保留了独特的身份。在文化和思维方式方面，侯赛因坚持认为埃及一直是欧洲的一部分，68 他明确地低估了阿拉伯语作为埃及国语和伊斯兰教作为其宗教的重要性，因为语言和宗教都不是国家建设的主要要素。69 致著名小说家和哲学家陶·卡尔-哈基姆， 埃及和阿拉伯人在精神和智力上截然相反。这在他的著名小说《灵魂的回归》中表现得非常明显，他在小说中将埃及人的基本体面与阿拉伯贝都因人的好战性进行了对比。70 当然，并非所有埃及知识分子都认同这种埃及的 wataniya 取向，这是事实。正如我们所看到的，阿拉伯民族主义有其强大的支持者。然而，在这个特定时期，埃及经过深思熟虑的知识分子意见的权重倾向于独特的埃及身份，而牺牲了包罗万象的阿拉伯身份，阿拉伯身份被描述为精神上破产和智力落后。

content_units.text: Abbas Mahmud al-Aqqad, Misr wa al-Misriyun (Egypt and the Egyptians) in Aqqad et al., Sawt Misr (The voice of Egypt) (Cairo: al-Haya al-Misriya al-Amma il al-Kutab, 1975), p. 7.
Abbas Mahmoud al-Aqqad, al-Fusul: Majmouat Maqallat Adabiya wa Ijtimaiya (Chapters: a collection of literary and social writings) (Beirut: Dar al-Kitab al-Arabi, 1967), p. 337.
Quoted in Gershoni and Jankowski, Egypt, Islam and the Arabs, p. 109.
Salame Musa, al-Mualafat al-Kamila, al-Mujaled al-Awal: Sanawat al-Takween (Complete works, volume one: years of formation) (Cairo: Salame Musa li al-Nashr wa al-Tawzi, 1998), p. 658.
Salame Musa, al-Yawm wa al-Ghad (Today and tomorrow) (Cairo: Elias Antun Elias, 1928), p. 189.

If there was a supranational ideology that could challenge the dominance of Egyptian wataniya, it was not Arabism but Islam.71 A number of Islamic organizations had been founded in the 1920s which had widespread appeal not only among the poorer classes, but also within the ranks of the educated middle class. The Young Mens Muslim Association was created in 1927, and before the end of the decade it was boasting a membership of 15,000. Another grassroot organization, the Muslim Brotherhood, grew rapidly during the 1930s, with its local branches increasing from four in 1929 to some 500 in 1939. These radical Islamists were not afraid to take on the heavyweights of the Egyptian wataniya orientation. Hasan al-Banna, the charismatic founder and leader of the Muslim Brotherhood, delineated the dividing line between the Islamist and the Egyptian nationalist:
content_units.azure_translation: 如果说有一种超国家意识形态可以挑战埃及瓦塔尼亚的统治地位，那就不是阿拉伯主义，而是伊斯兰教。71 1920年代成立了许多伊斯兰组织，这些组织不仅在较贫穷的阶层中具有广泛的吸引力，而且在受过教育的中产阶级中也具有广泛的吸引力。青年穆斯林协会成立于 1927 年，在本世纪末之前，它拥有 15,000 名会员。另一个草根组织穆斯林兄弟会在 1930 年代迅速发展，其地方分支机构从 1929 年的 4 个增加到 1939 年的约 500 个。这些激进的伊斯兰主义者并不害怕与埃及 wataniya 取向的重量级人物较量。哈桑·班纳（Hasan al-Banna）是穆斯林兄弟会（Muslim Brotherhood）富有魅力的创始人和领袖，他划定了伊斯兰主义者和埃及民族主义者之间的分界线：

content_units.text: Husayn, Mustaqbal al-Thaqafa . Misr (The future of culture in Egypt), pp. 2133.
Ibid., p. 18.

Taw.qal-Hakim, Awdat al-Ruh (The return of the soul) (Beirut: Dar al-Kitab al-Lubnani, 1974), pp. 2128; see also Ghada Telhami, Palestine and Egyptian National Iden­tity (New York: Praeger, 1992), pp. 2021.

See Charles D. Smith,  Cultural Constructs and Other Fantasies: Imagined Narra­tives in Imagined Communities; Surrejoinder to Gershoni and Jankowskis Print Culture, Social Change, and the Process of Rede.ning Imagined Communities in Egypt Interna­tional Journal of Middle East Studies, vol. 31 (February 1999): 97.

The point of contention between us and them is that we de.ne the limits of patriotism in terms of creed, while they de.ne it according to territorial borders and geographical boundaries. For every region in which there is a Muslim who says there is no God but God, and Muhamed is his prophet is a homeland for us .... All Muslims in these geographical regions are one people and one brothers.... The advocates of patriotism alone [al-wataniya faqat] are not like this, since nothing matters to them except the affairs of that speci.c, nar­rowly delimited region of the earth.72
content_units.azure_translation: 我们和他们之间的争论点在于，我们在信条上 de.ne 爱国主义的界限，而他们却根据领土边界和地理边界来 de.ne 爱国主义。因为每个地区都有穆斯林说除了真主之外没有真主，穆罕默德是他的先知，这对我们来说是一个家园......这些地理区域的所有穆斯林都是一个民族，一个兄弟......只有爱国主义的倡导者[al-wataniya faqat]不是这样的，因为除了地球上那个狭隘的地区的事情之外，对他们来说什么都不重要72。

content_units.text: The Islamists accepted that the Muslim Egyptian citizen had cer­tain duties to the place where he lived, but this individual had an even greater duty to the fatherland, the Islamic world, which extends from the farthest east to the farthest west.73 In such a statement, the Islamic identity challenges not just the notion of an Egyptian, but also an Arab, identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊斯兰主义者承认，埃及穆斯林公民对他居住的地方负有一定的责任，但这个人对祖国——伊斯兰世界负有更大的责任，伊斯兰世界从最远的东边延伸到最远的西边。73 在这样的声明中，伊斯兰身份不仅挑战了埃及人的身份，也挑战了阿拉伯人的身份。

content_units.text: It is interesting enough, however, in contrast to of.cial, state-sanctioned Islam, which was hostile to the idea of Arab unity (as discussed earlier in this chapter), these young Islamist activists were not necessarily averse to the tenets of Arab nationalism, including the goal of organic Arab unity. Indeed, they went as far as advocat­ing it. But what separated them from the Arab nationalists was this: To the Arab nationalist, Arab unity was the ultimate goal; to the Islamist, it was simply the means to a higher goal. The unity of the Arabs, Hasan al-Banna explained, is an inevitable condi­tion for . . . the establishment of [a Muslim] state, and the strength­ening of its power.74 In this, the Islamists made great use of the concept of al-Jahilliya, the age of pre-Islamic ignorance, where the Arabs were depicted as lacking cohesion, purpose, and disci­ pline. Only with the advent of Islam, the Islamists argued, did the Arabs become united, moral, and purposeful; traits that allowed them to establish a vast empire and a dazzling civilization. The message here cannot be more clear. Any nationalism, Arab or Egyp­tian, is subordinated to Islamic unity. And the overriding loyalty of the Muslim Egyptian and/or Arab is to the Islamic Umma, the universal community of the faithful which stretches from the far­thest east to the farthest west.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，与敌视阿拉伯统一理念的国家认可的伊斯兰教（如本章前面所讨论的）相比，这些年轻的伊斯兰主义活动家并不一定反对阿拉伯民族主义的信条，包括阿拉伯有机团结的目标，这已经足够有趣了。事实上，他们甚至提倡它。但他们与阿拉伯民族主义者的区别在于：对阿拉伯民族主义者来说，阿拉伯统一是最终目标;对伊斯兰主义者来说，这只是实现更高目标的手段。哈桑·班纳解释说，阿拉伯人的团结是......建立[穆斯林]国家，并加强其权力。74 在这方面，伊斯兰主义者大量利用了 al-Jahilliya 的概念，即前伊斯兰无知的时代，阿拉伯人被描述为缺乏凝聚力、目标和分裂性。伊斯兰主义者认为，只有随着伊斯兰教的出现，阿拉伯人才变得团结、道德和有目的;这些特质使他们能够建立一个庞大的帝国和令人眼花缭乱的文明。这里的信息再清楚不过了。任何民族主义，无论是阿拉伯的还是埃及的，都服从于伊斯兰团结。埃及和/或阿拉伯穆斯林压倒一切的忠诚是对伊斯兰乌玛的忠诚，伊斯兰乌玛是从最远的东端延伸到最远的西端的信徒的普遍社区。

content_units.text: Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation,p.82. 73 Haim, Arab Nationalism: An Anthology,p.48. 74 Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation,p.94.

Squeezed between these two identities, the Egyptian and the Is­lamic, Arab nationalism during this period found in Egypt only limited support. This was re.ected in the attitudes and policies of the ruling elites. In 1925, when the possibilities of Arab unity were brought to him, Saad Zaghloul Pasha, the father of Egyptian independence, responded: If you add one zero to another zero, then you add another zero, what will be the sum?75 This comment seems to re.ect the general attitude of Egypts political elites. The Syrian uprising in 1925, and Frances brutal response galvanized many Egyptians into extending material and verbal support to the heroic Syrians. But even on such a dramatic occasion, the gov­ernment moved slowly and cautiously, almost in spite of itself. There were no of.cial statements regarding the revolt, and there is no record that the government intervened diplomatically in sup­port of the Syrian cause. Moreover, when Zaghloul (who was out of power then) .nally addressed the nation on the subject, he re­ferred to Egyptians and Syrians being linked together as Eastern­ers.76 The concern of the government and the ruling circle with the revolt was short-lived, quickly and almost thankfully dis­carded. This hardly suggests a strong attachment to Arab national­ism, even when British in.uence over Egypts decision-making pro­cess is taken into consideration.
content_units.azure_translation: 在埃及和伊斯兰这两个身份之间，阿拉伯民族主义在这一时期在埃及得到了有限的支持。这反映在统治精英的态度和政策中。1925年，当阿拉伯统一的可能性被带到他面前时，埃及独立之父萨阿德·扎格鲁尔·帕夏（Saad Zaghloul Pasha）回应说：如果你把一个零加到另一个零上，那么你再加一个零，总和会是多少？75 这句话似乎反映了埃及政治精英的普遍态度。1925 年的叙利亚起义和弗朗西斯的残酷反应激励了许多埃及人向英勇的叙利亚人提供物质和口头支持。但即使在如此戏剧性的场合，政府也采取了缓慢而谨慎的行动，几乎不顾一切。没有关于叛乱的正式声明，也没有记录表明政府通过外交干预以支持叙利亚事业。此外，当扎格鲁尔（当时下台）就这个问题向全国发表讲话时，他提到埃及人和叙利亚人被联系在一起，称为东方人。76 政府和统治圈子对叛乱的担忧是短暂的，很快就被抛弃了，几乎是值得庆幸的。这几乎不表明对阿拉伯民族主义的强烈依恋，即使考虑到英国对埃及决策过程的干预。

content_units.text: Chejne, Egyptian Attitudes toward Pan-Arabism, p. 253; Gershoni and Jankowski, Egypt, Islam and the Arabs, pp. 245247; Coury, in Who invented Egyptian Arab Nation­alism?, Part 1, p. 251, argues that Zaghlouls comment did not necessarily mean that the wafdist leader rejected a common Arab identity. However, it is generally accepted that if Zaghloul had any attachment to the idea of Arab nationalism, it was very .imsy indeed.
Gershoni and Jankowski, Egypt, Islam and the Arabs, p. 247; Coury, Who Invented Egyptian Arab Nationalism?, Part 1, p. 252.

To Sati al-Husri, the indifference to Arab nationalism exhibited by Egypts political and intellectual elites was especially injurious. To Husri, Egypts long and distinguished Arab history, which bound Egypt to the other Arabs in language, traditions, culture, and common interests, was a real and tangible thing, dwar.ng in contemporary relevance any other ties Egypt might have had in the present or in the past. And those Egyptians who did not see what, to Husri, was a glaring truth had to be suffering from manipulated consciousness.77 And of all Egyptians suffering from this alleged false consciousness, the most galling to Husri was Taha Husayn, perhaps because Husayn was the most in.uential literary .gure of the time, and/or because of his cavalier dismissal of Egypts linguis­tic and historical ties with the Arabs, and his preference to delve deeper into history to search for a pharaonic identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 对萨蒂·胡斯里来说，埃及政治和知识精英对阿拉伯民族主义的漠不关心尤其有害。对胡斯里来说，埃及悠久而杰出的阿拉伯历史，在语言、传统、文化和共同利益上将埃及与其他阿拉伯人联系在一起，是真实而有形的东西，dwar.ng 在当代的意义上，埃及在现在或过去可能拥有的任何其他联系。而那些没有看到对胡斯里来说是明显真理的埃及人，一定是遭受了纵的意识的折磨。77 在所有遭受这种所谓的错误意识的埃及人中，最让胡斯里感到恼火的是塔哈·侯赛因，也许是因为侯赛因是当时最有文学意义的古尔，和/或因为他轻率地驳斥了埃及与阿拉伯人的语言和历史联系， 以及他更喜欢深入研究历史以寻找法老身份。

content_units.text: Husri therefore takes Husayn to task on this latter point. He asks sarcastically: Is Egypts dean of letters thinking of restoring the pharaonic language? Which made more sense for the Egyptians, to communicate with a mummy, or with Ibn Khaldun, the great fourteenth century Arab philosopher of history? Husri concludes that all the pyramids and all of the pharaonic past could not extin­guish one simple truththat Egyptians spoke today, and for many centuries, the same language as the rest of the Arab countries.78 For Husri, the determined advocate of language-based German cul­tural nationalism, Egypts Arab character was a given, and Egypts intellectual elite should not waste precious time and energy trying to deny it.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，胡斯里让侯赛因在后一点上承担任务。他讽刺地问道：埃及的文学院院长是否正在考虑恢复法老语言？对于埃及人来说，与木乃伊交流和与十四世纪伟大的阿拉伯历史哲学家伊本·哈勒敦交流哪个更有意义？胡斯里的结论是，所有的金字塔和所有法老的过去都无法消除一个简单的真理，即埃及人今天，并且几个世纪以来，与其他阿拉伯国家使用的语言相同。78 对于胡斯里来说，以语言为基础的德国文化民族主义的坚定倡导者，埃及的阿拉伯特征是理所当然的，埃及的知识精英不应该浪费宝贵的时间和精力来试图否认它。

content_units.text: Husris assault on those who denied Egypts Arabism re.ected the centrality and importance he accorded the country itself. In­deed, this is a theme that will recur repeatedly in this book. Husri himself admitted, in an article which appeared in the Iraqi newspa­ per, al-Bilad, in 1936, that he in fact was more interested in Egypt than in Syria or Iraq, since Egypt, through its many attributes, had to be considered the role model that in.uences the entire Arab world. He continues:
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里斯对那些否认埃及阿拉伯主义的人的攻击，重新体现了他赋予埃及本身的中心地位和重要性。事实上，这是一个在本书中反复出现的主题。胡斯里本人在 1936 年发表在伊拉克新闻报《al-Bilad》上的一篇文章中承认，他实际上对埃及比对叙利亚或伊拉克更感兴趣，因为埃及因其许多属性而不得不被视为整个阿拉伯世界的榜样。他继续说：

content_units.text: Tibi, Arab Nationalism: A Critical Enquiry, p. 154; Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, pp. 132133.

Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al Arabiya (Selected studies in Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1985), pp. 168169; see also Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, p. 137; also Haim, Arab Nationalism: An Anthology,p.50.

Nature has endowed Egypt with all the attributes and advantages that makes it imperative for her to assume the leading role in the revival of Arab nationalism. It is situated in the center of the Arab world, between the African and Asian segments. It is also the biggest part [of] the Arab world, [having been exposed] to the civilization of the modern world. So it has become the most important cultural center in the Arab world; it is richer than all the Arab countries combined, and it is the most seasoned in the structures of the modern state.79
content_units.azure_translation: 大自然赋予了埃及所有属性和优势，使她必须在阿拉伯民族主义的复兴中发挥主导作用。它位于阿拉伯世界的中心，介于非洲和亚洲之间。它也是阿拉伯世界最大的部分，[已经]接触到了现代世界的文明。因此，它已成为阿拉伯世界最重要的文化中心;它比所有阿拉伯国家的总和还要富裕，而且是现代国家结构最成熟的国家79。

content_units.text: So powerfully did Egypt loom in Husris consciousness, that he once was moved to write that his foremost aspiration was for Egypt to lead the crusade for Arab unity just as Prussia and Piedmont did for German and Italian unity, respectively.80 This, by the way, was being said at a time when a number of his own disciples in Iraq were trying to fashion that country into the same role.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及在胡斯里斯的意识中如此强烈，以至于他曾经感动地写道，他的首要愿望是埃及领导阿拉伯统一的十字军东征，就像普鲁士和皮埃蒙特分别领导德国和意大利的统一一样。80 顺便说一句，这是在他自己的一些在伊拉克的门徒试图将这个国家塑造成同样的角色的时候说的。

content_units.text: More than two full decades later, Husri was to see Egypt, under a charismatic leader, fully adorn the Arab nationalist identity, and endeavor purposefully to lead the Arabs toward unity. But in the 1920s and most of the 1930s, the Arab nationalist bug had not fully bitten Egypt, or for that matter Syria, Iraq, or the other parts of the Arab world. Powerful competitive identities, such as tribal­ism, sectarianism, regionalism, and state nationalism (wataniya) individually, or in combination with each other, proved to be po­tent obstacles to the spread of an Arab identity. This is not to sug­gest that Arab nationalism did not make gains or acquire new ad­ herents. That it certainly did; indeed, this chapter has fully documented the impressive strides that Arab nationalism made during this period. But the growth in the dissemination of the Arab idea was slowed considerably by the existence of these other potently competitive identities and loyalties that predomi­nated the Arabic-speaking world at the time.
content_units.azure_translation: 整整二十多年后，胡斯里看到埃及在一位富有魅力的领导人领导下，充分装饰阿拉伯民族主义身份，并有目的地努力带领阿拉伯人走向团结。但在 1920 年代和 1930 年代的大部分时间里，阿拉伯民族主义的虫子还没有完全侵袭埃及，或者就此而言，叙利亚、伊拉克或阿拉伯世界的其他地区。强大的竞争身份，如部落主义、宗派主义、地区主义和国家民族主义（wataniya）单独或相互结合，被证明是阿拉伯身份传播的有力障碍。这并不是说阿拉伯民族主义没有取得进展或获得新的基础。它确实做到了;事实上，本章充分记录了阿拉伯民族主义在这一时期取得的令人印象深刻的进步。但是，由于当时主导阿拉伯语世界的其他具有强大竞争力的身份和忠诚度的存在，阿拉伯思想的传播增长大大减缓。

content_units.text: Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Dawr Misr . al-Nahdha al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya, (Egypts role in Arab nationalist renaissance) in al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya, p. 105. The quote appears in a slightly different form in Tibi, Arab Nationalism; A Critical Enquiry, p. 185; see also Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, pp. 134 135; also Haim, Arab Nationalism: An Anthology, pp. 5051.
Cleveland, The Making of an Arab Nationalist, p. 135.

title: THE PATH TO NATIONALIST ASCENT: FROM THE PALESTINIAN REVOLT TO THE EGYPTIAN REVOLUTION

content_units.text: While Arab nationalist concerns did not predominate in the 1930s, neither were they nonexistent. The majority of Syri­ans, wracked by their own divisions, did not see unity with Iraq or Egypt as a priority. But as we have seen, the Syrians were undoubt­edly sensitive to political developments in other Arab countries. The same was true of the other Arabic-speaking regions and coun­tries of the Middle East. We saw how Egypt, the most distant from Arab nationalism, was moved, at least at the popular level, by the Syrian uprising against the French in 19251927; indeed there was enough public clamor that the recalcitrant politicians were com­pelled to make public statements supporting the Syrian revolt. But the one issue that consistently found an echo among the urban, educated Arabic-speaking populations of the Middle East was the increasing danger of Jewish immigration into Palestine. Here was a concern that would unite the Arab nationalist, the Islamist, and the believer in Greater Syria. From their different loyalties and per­spectives, they all would agree on the need to resist the demo­graphic changes that were under way in Palestine. The expansion in educational opportunities, the introduction of the radio, and the proliferation of newspapers in the interwar period made the Pales­tinian issue that more accessible. As early as 1928, the visit to Bagh­dad by a well-known British Zionist, Alfred Mond, was met with widespread street demonstrations.1 But on the whole, popular con­cern was not echoed in of.cial pronouncements and policies. The 19361939 Arab revolt in Palestine changed that.
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然阿拉伯民族主义的担忧在 1930 年代并不占主导地位，但也并非不存在。大多数叙利亚人被自己的分裂所困扰，并不认为与伊拉克或埃及的统一是优先事项。但正如我们所看到的，叙利亚人无疑对其他阿拉伯国家的政治发展很敏感。中东其他阿拉伯语地区和国家也是如此。我们看到埃及这个与阿拉伯民族主义最相去甚远的国家，是如何被19251927年叙利亚反对法国的起义所感动的，至少在民众层面上是这样;事实上，公众的呼声足够大，顽固的政客们被迫发表公开声明支持叙利亚叛乱。但是，在中东受过教育的阿拉伯语城市人口中一直引起共鸣的一个问题是犹太人移民到巴勒斯坦的危险日益增加。这是一个将阿拉伯民族主义者、伊斯兰主义者和大叙利亚的信徒团结在一起的担忧。从他们不同的忠诚和观点来看，他们都同意必须抵制巴勒斯坦正在发生的人口变化。两次世界大战期间教育机会的扩大、广播的引入以及报纸的激增使巴勒斯坦问题更容易理解。早在1928年，著名的英国犹太复国主义者阿尔弗雷德·蒙德（Alfred Mond）访问巴格达时，就遭到了广泛的街头示威。但总的来说，民众的担忧并没有在声明和政策中得到回应。19361939巴勒斯坦的阿拉伯起义改变了这一点。

content_units.text: The contours of historical development are shaped by conse­quential events. Some, such as the American, French, and Russian revolutions, end up having an impact beyond their immediate lo­cale. Others have unintended consequences. Napoleons defeat of Prussia in 1805 accelerated (one is almost tempted to say, created)2 German cultural nationalism, which lay the grounds for the uni.­cation of Germany in 1871. While not of the same magnitude, the Arab revolt in Palestine, which began as a general strike in 1936, then gathered momentum to become a full-.edged revolt that lasted the best part of three years, and claimed the lives of three thousand Arabs, two thousand Jews, and six hundred British,3 brought the con.ict fully into Arab consciousness, making Pales­tine a foremost Arab issue. Popular pressure compelled Arab gov­ernments and political leaderships to come out publicly in support of the Palestinian Arabs, to intervene with the British on the latters plans to partition the country, and .nally to cooperate so as to speak with one of.cial voice in international conferences.
content_units.azure_translation: 历史发展的轮廓是由随之而来的事件塑造的。有些革命，例如美国、法国和俄罗斯革命，最终产生的影响超出了它们的直接地点。其他人则产生意想不到的后果。拿破仑在 1805 年击败普鲁士加速了（人们几乎想说，创造了）2 德国文化民族主义，这为 1871 年德国的统一奠定了基础。虽然规模不同，但巴勒斯坦的阿拉伯起义始于 1936 年的总罢工，然后蓄势待发，成为一场持续了三年大部分时间的全面起义，夺走了三千名阿拉伯人、两千名犹太人和六百名英国人的生命，3 使这场叛乱完全进入了阿拉伯人的意识， 使巴勒斯坦成为首要的阿拉伯问题。民众的压力迫使阿拉伯政府和政治领导人公开支持巴勒斯坦阿拉伯人，就英国瓜分国家的计划与英国进行干预，并进行合作，以便在国际会议上以一种有影响力的声音发表意见。

content_units.text: The 1939 London Conference for Palestinians, Arab govern­ments, and Jews was the .rst such concerted cooperative effort by Arab governments and leaderships, fostering the belief that Arabs, wherever they were, shared similar interests, concerns, and aspira­tions. In the words of one contemporary commentator, the Pales­ tinian revolt joined together and united the hearts of the Arabs in all their regions, and they are now one nation even if their states are many.4 While undoubtedly overstated, this comment does re­.ect the popular reception accorded to the involvement of the Arab governments in the Palestinian question, and the heightened aware­ness by peoples and leaders alike of the possibilities of Arab solidar­ity. And all this was being continuously fueled by a sustained Pales­tinian campaign stressing that the Palestine issue should be the concern of every Arab and Muslim. The defense of the Arab char­acter of Palestine, Yehoshua Porath tells us, became the .rst duty of Arab nationalists everywhere.5 What follows is a description of the popular support for Palestinians in Iraq, Syria, and Egypt, and the consequent policies and pronouncements of the respective governments.
content_units.azure_translation: 1939 年巴勒斯坦人、阿拉伯政府和犹太人伦敦会议是阿拉伯政府和领导人首次进行此类协调合作的努力，培养了阿拉伯人无论身在何处，都有相似利益、关注点和愿望的信念。用一位当代评论家的话来说，帕莱斯天宁起义联合在一起，团结了所有地区的阿拉伯人的心，即使他们的国家很多，他们现在也是一个国家。4 虽然这句话无疑被夸大了，但它确实反映了阿拉伯政府参与巴勒斯坦问题的普遍欢迎，以及各国人民和领导人对阿拉伯团结的可能性的高度认识。而所有这一切都是由巴勒斯坦持续不断的运动推动的，该运动强调巴勒斯坦问题应该是每个阿拉伯人和穆斯林都关心的问题。耶何书亚·波拉斯告诉我们，捍卫巴勒斯坦的阿拉伯特征成为各地阿拉伯民族主义者的首要职责。5 以下是对伊拉克、叙利亚和埃及民众对巴勒斯坦人的支持，以及随之而来的各自政府的政策和声明的描述。

content_units.text: Phebe Marr, The Development of a Nationalist Ideology in Iraq, 19201941, The Muslim World, vol. 75, no. 2 (April 1985): 100.

As Hans Kohn puts it, German nationalism. . .was born in the war against France. . . (italics added), see Hans Kohn, Arendt and the Character of German Nationalism, The American Historical Review, vol. LIV, no. 4 (July 1949): 789.
William L. Cleveland, A History of the Modern Middle East,2nd ed. (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 2000), pp. 252253.

In Iraq, widespread demonstrations erupted in support of the 1936 Palestinian general strike, which became so widespread that the Iraqi government hastened to impose a ban on all demonstra­tions. But the government could do little else. Public meetings in major Iraqi cities continued to be held in which the British were publicly and vehemently denounced, and donations were collected on a wide scale to the extent that Iraq was deemed to be the main .nancial source for the Palestinian revolt, which erupted in the wake of the general strike. Sunni and Shiite clerics issued fetwas (religious edicts) in support of Palestinian rights.6 Two organiza­tions were at the center of the turmoil. The Palestine Defense Com­mittee, which under British pressure had been defunct for some time, was reformed and became responsible for coordinating much of the .nancial assistance. The Muthana Club, an Arab nationalist organization, arranged meetings and lectures in which a number of Palestinian leaders and intellectuals spoke. Most important for Iraqs political future, the Palestinian revolt sharpened Arab na­ tionalist sentiments among army of.cers, legitimizing and institu­tionalizing the entry of the military in Iraqi politics.
content_units.azure_translation: 在伊拉克，爆发了广泛的示威活动，支持1936年的巴勒斯坦大罢工，这种大罢工变得如此普遍，以至于伊拉克政府赶紧禁止所有示威活动。但政府无能为力。伊拉克主要城市继续举行公开集会，公开强烈谴责英国人，并大规模筹集捐款，以至于伊拉克被认为是巴勒斯坦起义的主要资金来源，巴勒斯坦起义在总罢工后爆发。逊尼派和什叶派神职人员颁布了支持巴勒斯坦权利的 fetwas（宗教法令）。6 两个组织处于动荡的中心。巴勒斯坦国防委员会在英国的压力下已经解散了一段时间，但经过改革，负责协调大部分财政援助。阿拉伯民族主义组织穆萨纳俱乐部安排了会议和讲座，一些巴勒斯坦领导人和知识分子在会上发言。对伊拉克的政治未来最重要的是，巴勒斯坦起义激化了军队中的阿拉伯民族主义情绪，使军队进入伊拉克政治合法化和制度化。

content_units.text: Quoted in James Jankowski, The Government of Egypt and the Palestine Question, 19361939, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 17, no. 4 (October 1981): 448.
Yehoshua Porath, In Search of Arab Unity, 19301945 (London: Frank Cass, 1986), p. 165.

Popular support for the Palestinian cause was no less .erce in Syria. Strikes and demonstrations occurred frequently, accompa­nied by violently anti-Zionist and anti-British pamphlets and peti­tions. A vast array of contributions, ranging from money to jewelry was made, and Jewish products were successfully boycotted. Most effectively, arms were smuggled from Syria to Palestine, and many Syrians volunteered into the guerrilla campaigns in Palestine.7 Syr­ian sentiments of solidarity with Palestinians were augmented by a perception held by many Syrians that in addition to their Arab kinship, Palestine also formed the southern tip of Bilad al-Sham (Greater Syria).8 On both of these levels, Arabism and Syrianism, the Syrians were especially susceptible to Palestinian concerns and aspirations.
content_units.azure_translation: 在叙利亚，民众对巴勒斯坦事业的支持同样如此。罢工和示威活动频繁发生，伴随着暴力的反犹太复国主义和反英小册子和请愿书。从金钱到珠宝，人们做出了大量的捐款，犹太产品也被成功抵制。最有效的是，武器从叙利亚走私到巴勒斯坦，许多叙利亚人自愿参加巴勒斯坦的游击队运动。7 许多叙利亚人认为，除了与阿拉伯人有亲属关系外，巴勒斯坦还构成了比拉德沙姆（大叙利亚）的南端，从而增强了叙利亚声援巴勒斯坦人的情绪。8 在这两个层面上， 阿拉伯主义和叙利亚主义，叙利亚人特别容易受到巴勒斯坦人的关切和愿望的影响。

content_units.text: The Syrians also had geostrategic and economic reasons for their support of the Palestinians. The prospect of a Jewish state, consti­tuting a physical barrier, was a legitimate concern for Syria, which unlike Iraq, would be the immediate neighbor of such a state. Eco­nomically, the dramatic growth of the port of Haifa was already posing a real threat to Beirut, and Syrias nascent industrial base was being quickly outpaced by the developing industrial movement in the Jewish sector of the Palestinian economy.9
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚人支持巴勒斯坦人也有地缘战略和经济原因。犹太国家构成物理屏障的前景是叙利亚的合理担忧，与伊拉克不同，叙利亚将是这种国家的直接邻国。在经济上，海法港的急剧增长已经对贝鲁特构成了真正的威胁，叙利亚新生的工业基础正在迅速被巴勒斯坦经济中犹太人部门发展中的工业运动所超越。

content_units.text: In its popular reaction to the Palestinian revolt, Egypt was not different from Iraq or Syria. Patrick Seale does not hesitate to char­acterize the revolt as the decisive factor which swung Egyptian politicians in favor of a pan-Arab policy.10 But the politicians were simply responding to popular opinion. Anti-British sentiment reached a crescendo, and a .erce campaign against British policies in Palestine was spearheaded by the Muslim Brotherhood.11 Highly charged pieces were written about bleeding Palestine or Pales­tine the martyr, and the events there were depicted as constituting a full-.edged revolution. Popular agitation was such that members of Parliament raised the issue several times, demanding swift and meaningful government action, and a group of them embarked on organizing an international conference on the Palestinian problem, which eventually met in October 1938 under the title, World Par­liamentary Congress of Arab and Muslim Countries for the De­fense of Palestine.12 The convening of the Congress in Cairo, and the anti-British undercurrents which it displayed at a time when the British held an unquestionable position of in.uence in the coun­try, is a testimony to the strength of the pro-Palestinian sentiments sweeping Egypt in the wake of the Arab revolt.
content_units.azure_translation: 在民众对巴勒斯坦起义的反应方面，埃及与伊拉克或叙利亚没有什么不同。帕特里克·西尔毫不犹豫地将这场叛乱描述为促使埃及政客支持泛阿拉伯政策的决定性因素。10 但政客们只是在回应民意。反英情绪达到高潮，穆斯林兄弟会带头发起了一场反对英国在巴勒斯坦政策的激烈运动。11 关于流血的巴勒斯坦或殉道者巴勒斯坦的文章被高度激发，那里的事件被描述为构成一场全面的革命。民众的骚动如此之大，以至于议会议员多次提出这个问题，要求政府采取迅速和有意义的行动，他们中的一群人开始组织一次关于巴勒斯坦问题的国际会议，最终于 1938 年 10 月举行会议，标题为“阿拉伯和穆斯林国家保卫巴勒斯坦世界议会大会”。12 在开罗召开的大会，以及在英国人在该国占据无可置疑的地位时所表现出的反英暗流，证明了阿拉伯起义后席卷埃及的亲巴勒斯坦情绪的强烈程度。

content_units.text: Philip S. Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton Uni­versity Press, 1987), pp. 542544.

According to Philip Khoury, this perception seems to have been shared by many Pales­tinians too. See ibid., p. 542. Rashid Khalidi, however, argues that Palestinian identi.cation with the concept of southern Syria peaked during King Faysals government in Damascus, then atrophied after the collapse of that government, allowing for the emergence of a Pales­tinian identity. See Rashid Khalidi, Palestinian Identity: The Construction of Modern Na­tional Consciousness (New York: Columbia University Press, 1997), pp. 162175.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, pp. 541542.
Patrick Seale, The Struggle for Syria: A Study of Post-War Arab Politics, 19451958 (New Haven, Connecticut: Yale University Press, 1986), p. 17.

In addition to the emotional dimension, there were also practical economic and geostrategic dimensions to Egyptian reactions. Busi­nessmen worried that Jewish ascendancy would eventually lead to the establishment of a Jewish state. Such a state could become an economic threat to Egypt by forming a physical barrier that, at a minimum, would hinder the countrys commercial relations with the Near East markets. If Zionism [were to be] established in Pal­estine, wrote one prominent Egyptian businessman, its harm [would] not be limited to Palestine alone. Rather, it [would] imme­diately extend to affect the destiny of all the neighboring countries, to place limits on their economies, industries, trade, wealth and independence.13 Beyond the economic issue, Egyptians had a wider geostrategic concern. It was felt that a Jewish state would be a catalyst for constant tension and crises that would lead to situa­tions of chronic unrest which in turn would invite foreign interven­tions. Moreover, the pressures of continuous immigration would inevitably push the Jewish state to expand into more Arab lands, depriving more Arab people of their homes and their livelihood. Thus the Palestinian question could not and would not be limited to Palestine; it was, and, in the case of the creation of a Jewish state, would always be a problem for the Arab and Muslim worlds. These fears were expressed succinctly by Muhamed Husayn Hay­kal, a leading Egyptian intellectual, who was also an in.uential liberal political .gure. To Haykal, the situation in Palestine, partic­ularly if the British partition plan were to be implemented, would have a deleterious impact on Egypts future which is .rmly linked to the destinies of the lands which neighbor us and are in.uenced by us as we are in.uenced by themin the security of our country, in the sale of our products, in the shaping of our international rela­tions, in the organization of our self-defense, and in the de.nition of our policy in the Mediterranean.14
content_units.azure_translation: 除了情感层面外，埃及的反应还有实际的经济和地缘战略层面。商人担心犹太人的崛起最终会导致犹太国家的建立。这样的国家可能会形成物理屏障，至少会阻碍该国与近东市场的商业关系，从而对埃及构成经济威胁。一位著名的埃及商人写道，如果犹太复国主义在巴勒斯坦建立起来，它的危害将不仅限于巴勒斯坦。相反，它[将]立即影响到所有邻国的命运，限制它们的经济、工业、贸易、财富和独立。13 除了经济问题之外，埃及人还有更广泛的地缘战略问题。人们认为，犹太国家将成为持续紧张和危机的催化剂，这将导致长期动荡局势，进而招致外国干预。此外，持续移民的压力将不可避免地推动犹太国家向更多的阿拉伯土地扩张，剥夺更多阿拉伯人的家园和生计。因此，巴勒斯坦问题不能也不会局限于巴勒斯坦;巴勒斯坦问题不能也不会局限于巴勒斯坦问题。对于阿拉伯和穆斯林世界来说，它曾经是，而且在犹太国家的建立中将永远是一个问题。埃及著名知识分子穆罕默德·侯赛因·海卡尔（Muhamed Husayn Haykal）简洁地表达了这些担忧，他也是一位不屈不挠的自由主义政治家。对海卡尔来说，巴勒斯坦的局势，特别是如果英国的分治计划得以实施，将对埃及的未来产生有害影响，这与我们邻国的土地的命运密切相关，这些土地与我们所拥有的土地的命运密切相关，就像我们受到这些土地的影响一样，在我们国家的安全方面，在我们的产品的销售中， 在塑造我们的国际关系、组织我们的自卫以及制定我们在地中海的政策方面。14

content_units.text: Porath, In Search of Arab Unity, 19301945, p. 170; Seale, The Struggle for Syria,p. 17. 12 Jankowski, The Government of Egypt and the Palestine Question, 19361939, p. 434.

Ralph M. Coury, Who Invented Egyptian Arab Nationalism?, Part 2, International Journal of Middle East Studies, vol. 14, 1982: 463; see also Israel Gershoni and James P. Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, 19301945 (London: Cambridge University Press, 1995), pp. 174176; also Jankowski, The Government of Egypt and the Palestine Question, 19361939, p. 445.

The British plan to partition Palestine, therefore, engendered such huge fears of the possibility of a Jewish state that immediately after its announcement, and its acceptance by Emir Abdallah of Jordan, who saw an opportunity to expand his own domain, plans were set afoot for the convening of a pan-Arab congress. And indeed, two months later, over four hundred nationalists from Iraq, Egypt, Syria, Saudi Arabia, Palestine, and Trans-Jordan converged on the Syrian city of Bludan to begin a conference that produced vehemently anti-Zionist resolutions and an absolute rejection of any partition of Palestine.15 The conference, whose attendees were of.cially sanctioned delegates as well as independent nationalists, was an early instance of the gradual involvement of Arab govern­ ments in Palestinian and Arab affairs. And this was due largely to popular pressure.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，英国瓜分巴勒斯坦的计划引起了人们对犹太国家可能性的巨大担忧，以至于在宣布并被约旦埃米尔阿卜杜拉接受后，他看到了扩大自己领土的机会，立即开始了召开泛阿拉伯大会的计划。事实上，两个月后，来自伊拉克、埃及、叙利亚、沙特阿拉伯、巴勒斯坦和外约旦的四百多名民族主义者聚集在叙利亚城市布鲁丹，开始了一次会议，该会议提出了强烈反犹太复国主义的决议，并绝对反对巴勒斯坦的任何分裂。15 与会者包括受制裁的代表和独立民族主义者， 是阿拉伯政府逐渐介入巴勒斯坦和阿拉伯事务的早期例子。这主要是由于民众的压力。

content_units.text: Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, 19301945, p. 175.

Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, pp. 554555; also Michael N. Barnett, Dia­logues in Arab Politics: Negotiations in Regional Order (New York: Columbia University Press, 1998), p. 72. For a lively analysis of the motives and consequences of the conference, see Elie Kedourie, The Bludan Congress on Palestine, 1937, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 17, no. 1, January 1981: 107125.

It was the overwhelming pro-Palestinian opinion among the Arab populations that ultimately forced a response from the other­wise recalcitrant Arab governments. After all, the governments had to tread a thin line between two con.icting pressures: the weight of public opinion on the one hand, and on the other, the political demands of the British and the French who, by virtue of their physi­cal presence in these countries, exerted an inordinate amount of in.uence on the indigenous governments.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是阿拉伯民众压倒性的亲巴勒斯坦舆论最终迫使原本顽固的阿拉伯政府做出反应。毕竟，政府不得不在两种压力之间徘徊：一方面是公众舆论的分量，另一方面是英国和法国的政治要求，他们凭借在这些国家的实际存在，对土著政府施加了过大的干预。

content_units.text: The Iraqi government found itself in one such situation in the spring of 1936. Fawzi al-Qawuqchi, a Syrian of.cer who was serv­ing in the Iraqi army resigned his commission to lead a group of volunteers into Palestine to .ght alongside their Palestinian breth­ren. Support for Qawuqchis endeavor was widespread not just among the general population, but also, and more important, within the ranks of Iraqs armed forces. After a meeting with an envoy from the Palestinian Higher Arab Committee (the organiza­tion that was leading Palestinian resistance), Iraqs Prime Minister Yasin al-Hashimi agreed to release Qawuqchi and assist in his re­cruitment of men and acquisition of arms. The British were natu­rally incensed; they demanded that the prime minister put an end to the whole enterprise immediately. Hashimi had little choice but to summon Qawuqchi and tell him that, due to British pressure, he had no alternative but to call a halt to this whole initiative. Qawuqchi, however, disobeyed the order and took his men to Pal­estine.16 To appease the displeased British, Hashimi dispatched his foreign minister to London and Jerusalem to try to mediate the con.ict. The novelty about Hashimis move was the attempted mediation not only between the Arabs and the mandatory authori­ties but also between the Arabs and the Zionist leadership.17
content_units.azure_translation: 1936 年春天，伊拉克政府发现自己陷入了这样的境地。在伊拉克军队服役的叙利亚of.cer法齐·卡乌奇 （Fawzi al-Qawuqchi） 辞去了带领一群志愿者进入巴勒斯坦与巴勒斯坦同胞并肩作战的职务。对 Qawuqchis 努力的支持不仅在普通民众中广泛，而且更重要的是，在伊拉克武装部队的队伍中也得到了广泛的支持。在与巴勒斯坦阿拉伯高等委员会（领导巴勒斯坦抵抗运动的组织）的特使会面后，伊拉克总理亚辛·哈希米同意释放卡乌奇并协助他招募人员和获取武器。英国人自然被激怒了;他们要求总理立即结束整个企业。哈希米别无选择，只能召见卡乌奇，告诉他，由于英国的压力，他别无选择，只能停止整个倡议。然而，卡乌奇不服从命令，将他的部下带到了巴勒斯坦。16 为了安抚不满的英国人，哈希米派遣他的外交部长前往伦敦和耶路撒冷，试图调解冲突。哈希米斯举动的新颖之处在于，不仅在阿拉伯人与强制当局之间，而且在阿拉伯人与犹太复国主义领导层之间也试图进行调解。17

content_units.text: Michael Eppel, The Palestine Con.ict in the History of Modern Iraq: The Dynamics of Involvement, 19281948 (London: Frank Cass, 1994), pp. 4142.
Abbas Kelidar, A Quest for Identity, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 33, no. 2 (April 1997): 427.

The government that replaced Hashimis administration had a distinctly different foreign policy orientation. Led by a Kurd, a Tur­koman, and a Shiite, the new government advocated an Iraq .rst policy, which was a veiled attempt to decrease Iraqs involvement in Arab affairs. But the turmoil in Palestine had engendered such intense pro-Palestinian sentiment among the Iraqi population that the government was compelled to follow public opinion.18 In ex­plaining his governments adamant rejection of the British partition plan in Palestine, the Turkoman prime minister, Hikmat Sulayman, told the British ambassador in July 1937 that no Iraqi government will be able to remain in power without giving some degree of satis­faction to the public hatred of the proposals for the partition of Palestine.19 Unfortunately for Sulayman, his statement was a case of too little too late. His government was ousted by Arab national­ist of.cers a month later, and was replaced by an avowedly nation­alist and pro-Palestinian government. Immediately, the new gov­ernment denounced the partition plan for Palestine, a position vigorously supported by a reportedly .fty thousand-strong mass demonstration.20
content_units.azure_translation: 取代哈希米斯政府的政府有着截然不同的外交政策取向。在库尔德人、土库曼人和什叶派的领导下，新政府主张伊拉克政策，这是减少伊拉克参与阿拉伯事务的隐蔽尝试。但巴勒斯坦的动荡在伊拉克民众中激起了如此强烈的亲巴勒斯坦情绪，以至于政府不得不听从公众舆论。18 1937 年 7 月，土库曼总理希克马特·苏莱曼 （Hikmat Sulayman） 在解释他的政府坚决拒绝英国在巴勒斯坦的分治计划时告诉英国大使，如果不对公众对以下提议的仇恨给予一定程度的满足，任何伊拉克政府都无法继续掌权巴勒斯坦的分治。19 对苏莱曼来说不幸的是，他的声明太少太晚了。一个月后，他的政府被阿拉伯民族主义者推翻，取而代之的是一个公开的民族主义和亲巴勒斯坦政府。新政府立即谴责了巴勒斯坦的分治计划，这一立场得到了据称数万人的大规模示威的大力支持。

content_units.text: The entry of Fawzi al-Qawuqchi into Palestine became a catalyst for the involvement of the Syrian authorities under the French man­date in the Palestinian affair. Seven hundred Syrian volunteers, mostly from the poorer classes, but some from notable families in Homs, joined Qawuqchis force. From then on, bands of Syrian volunteers continued to cross into Palestine, with a number of them assuming leadership positions in the rebellion.21 Independently, and through the French authorities, the British sought to persuade the Syrian political leadership to curb the activities of these irregu­lar forces. Like their Iraqi counterparts, the Syrian leaders were forced into a delicate balancing act, which was evidenced in the circumspect way in which it supported the Palestinian revolt and the half-heartedness with which it responded to British and French demands.22 In Syria, however, the leaderships lukewarm support for the revolt also re.ected, as we have seen, the concern by mem­bers of its socioeconomic class of the revolts negative impact on the Syrian economy.
content_units.azure_translation: 法齐·卡乌奇进入巴勒斯坦成为法国托管下的叙利亚当局介入巴勒斯坦事务的催化剂。700 名叙利亚志愿者加入了卡乌奇斯的部队，其中大部分来自较贫穷的阶层，但也有一些来自霍姆斯的显赫家庭。从那时起，叙利亚志愿军继续越境进入巴勒斯坦，其中一些人在叛乱中担任领导职务。21 英国独立地通过法国当局试图说服叙利亚政治领导层遏制这些非正规部队的活动。与伊拉克领导人一样，叙利亚领导人也被迫采取微妙的平衡行为，这体现在它支持巴勒斯坦起义的谨慎方式和对英国和法国要求的半心半意的回应中。22 然而，正如我们所看到的，在叙利亚，领导人对起义的支持不冷不热，也得到了体现， 其社会经济阶层成员对叛乱的负面影响的担忧对叙利亚经济产生了负面影响。

content_units.text: Abd al-Razzak Abd al-Darraji, Jafar Abu al-Timman wa Dawrahu . al-Haraka al-Wataniya . al-Iraq (Jafar Abu al-Timman and his role in the Iraqi national movement) (Baghdad: Wizarat al-Thaqafa wa al-Funoon, 1978), pp. 437438.
Eppel, The Palestine Con.ict in the History of Modern Iraq, p. 64.
Robert Gale Woolbert, Pan-Arabism and the Palestine Problem, Foreign Affairs, vol. 16, no. 2 (January 1938): 317.
Khoury, Syria and the French Mandate, pp. 546547.

A reluctant Egyptian government was also pushed into a proac­tive stance through increasing popular pressures. Members of the government consistently sought to make pro-Palestinian represen­tations with the British, arguing vehemently against any partition of Palestine, prescribing instead a unitary state with mutual toler­ance for all religious communities. The British were reminded, on many occasions, that the position of the Egyptian government as well as their own was being undermined in Egypt by the events in Palestine. Indeed, the government took the occasion of the coun­trys .rst address to the League of Nations to stress the importance of creating a unitary and independent Palestinian state.23 And when an effort was made to replace striking Palestinian workers by Egyp­tians, the government hurriedly intervened to prevent the Egyp­tians from traveling to Palestine.24 The British, of course, thought all this was a work of downright hypocrisy on the part of the Egyp­tian leaders who, the British contended, were trying to divert public attention from rampant domestic ills to an issue about which Egyp­tian leaders cared little. This British perception was rebutted elo­quently by Egypts foreign minister:
content_units.azure_translation: 不情愿的埃及政府也因民众压力的增加而采取了积极主动的立场。政府成员一直试图与英国人进行亲巴勒斯坦的交涉，强烈反对对巴勒斯坦进行任何瓜分，而是规定建立一个对所有宗教团体相互容忍的单一国家。英国人多次被提醒，巴勒斯坦事件正在破坏埃及政府和他们自己的地位。事实上，政府利用该国第一次向国际联盟发表讲话的机会，强调建立一个统一和独立的巴勒斯坦国的重要性。23 当埃及人试图取代罢工的巴勒斯坦工人时，政府匆忙干预，阻止埃及人前往巴勒斯坦。24 当然，英国人， 认为这一切都是埃及领导人彻头彻尾的虚伪行为，英国人认为，他们试图将公众的注意力从猖獗的国内弊病转移到埃及领导人不关心的问题上。埃及外交部长雄辩地驳斥了英国的这种看法：

content_units.text: You may say if you wish (though I think it untrue) that Egyptian politicians do not really care what happens in Palestine, that they raise the question only for demagogic reasons in order to de.ect popular attention from the crying need for internal reformthe same charge that is made against the governing clique in Iraq. But does not the very fact that the cabinet feels obliged to defend the
content_units.azure_translation: 如果你愿意（尽管我认为这是不真实的）埃及政客并不真正关心巴勒斯坦发生的事情，你可以说，他们提出这个问题只是出于煽动性的原因，以便转移公众对迫切需要内部改革的注意力，这与对伊拉克统治集团的指控相同。但内阁觉得有义务捍卫

content_units.text: Jankowski, The Government of Egypt and the Palestine Question, 19361939, pp. 432433.
Coury, Who Invented Egyptian Arab Nationalism? Part 2, p. 255.

Arab case indicate that there must be many Egyptians who do have a lively interest in Arab nationalism? There is no use dragging a red herring across the path unless the cat likes herrings. The politicians may be insecure and their appeal may smack of demagogy, but the fact that they make it shows the inclinations of the electorate.25
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯案例表明一定有很多埃及人对阿拉伯民族主义有浓厚的兴趣？除非猫喜欢鲱鱼，否则拖着红鲱鱼穿过小路是没有用的。政客们可能没有安全感，他们的吸引力可能带有煽动性的味道，但他们这样做的事实表明了选民的倾向25。

content_units.text: Regardless of their true motives, the Arab governments could not but intervene in one way or another in the Palestinian con.ict because of mounting pressure from the populace (or at least from important and vocal segments of that populace). Indeed, the events of 19361939 could be seen as the historical instance in which, for the .rst time, the Arab leaderships were to embark on a coopera­tive effort fueled by a realization of common Arab interests. This was occasioned by the British-sponsored St. Jamess Conference of Arab Palestinians, the Jewish Agency and Representatives from Arab Governments, held in London in 1939. The results of the conference were inconclusive, but in terms of inter-Arab affairs, the decision of the Arab leaders to meet in Cairo prior to the confer­ence was perhaps the most important by-product. In Cairo, they agreed on a common Arab position, and in fact, that position was fully adhered to throughout the duration of the London confer­ence. Nuri al-Said, Iraqs prime minister, later con.rmed that inter-Arab consultation and the agreement on a united front was the most consequential dimension of the endeavor. He expressed his hope that the historic meeting will serve as the foundation stone for the establishment of an Eastern and Arab League.26 Prince Faysal bin Abd al-Aziz, the head of the Saudi delegation, echoed this sentiment: for the .rst time in our history, we witness this clear manifestation of cooperation and solidarity of the Arab coun­tries. For the .rst time we stand united. Let us hope that this confer­ence may serve as a useful precedent for solving other problems and strengthening the foundations of our unity.27
content_units.azure_translation: 无论其真正动机如何，阿拉伯政府都不能不以这样或那样的方式干预巴勒斯坦冲突，因为来自民众（或至少来自该民众中重要和直言不讳的部分）的压力越来越大。事实上，19361939事件可以看作是阿拉伯领导人第一次在实现阿拉伯共同利益的推动下开始合作努力的历史实例。这是由英国赞助的阿拉伯巴勒斯坦人、犹太机构和阿拉伯政府代表于 1939 年举行的圣雅美斯会议引发的。会议的结果尚无定论，但就阿拉伯事务而言，阿拉伯领导人决定在会议之前在开罗举行会议，这也许是最重要的副产品。在开罗，他们商定了阿拉伯的共同立场，事实上，这一立场在整个伦敦会议期间得到充分遵守。伊拉克总理努里·赛义德后来承认，阿拉伯人之间的磋商和统一战线的协议是这一努力中最重要的方面。他表示希望这次历史性会议将成为建立东方和阿拉伯联盟的基石。26 沙特代表团团长费萨尔·本·阿卜杜勒·阿齐兹亲王也表达了同样的观点：这是我们历史上第一次目睹阿拉伯国家合作与团结的明确表现。这是我们第一次团结起来。让我们希望，这次会议能够成为解决其他问题和加强我们团结基础的有益先例。27

content_units.text: Woolbert, Pan-Arabism and the Palestine Problem, p. 319; see also Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, p. 179.
Quoted in Y. Porath, The Palestinian Arab National Movement: From Riots to Rebel­lion, vol. 2, 19291939 (London: Frank Cass, 1977), p. 284.
Porath, In Search of Arab Unity, 19301945, p. 172.

This united front held not only during the conference, but also later on when the inconclusiveness of the London meeting prompted the British government to unilaterally publish a white paper promising Palestinian independence within ten years. On the day after its issuance, Egypts prime minister announced that the Arab governments had decided against recommending the terms of the white paper to the Palestinian Arabs. This concerted and united Arab involvement in the Palestine issue was described by Elie Ke­dourie, a vigorous critic of British policy and of Arab nationalism as a fateful and perhaps fatal move, for it introduced the Arab states into what had been a relatively limited dispute between two groups in a mandated territory.28 Be that as it may, what is rele­vant for our purposes is that the Palestinian events of 19361939 contributed not only to the growth of Arab nationalist sentiment among the Arab people, but also to a nascent solidarity among the Arab governments.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种统一战线不仅在会议期间举行，而且在后来伦敦会议的无结果促使英国政府单方面发表白皮书，承诺在十年内实现巴勒斯坦独立时也举行了这一统一战线。白皮书发布后的第二天，埃及总理宣布，阿拉伯政府已决定不向巴勒斯坦阿拉伯人推荐白皮书的条款。英国政策和阿拉伯民族主义的强烈批评者埃利·凯杜里 （Elie Kedourie） 将阿拉伯人对巴勒斯坦问题的协调和团结的参与描述为一种决定性的、也许是致命的举动，因为它将阿拉伯国家引入了两个群体之间相对有限的争端在托管领土上。28 尽管如此，与我们的目的相关的是，19361939的巴勒斯坦事件不仅促进了阿拉伯人民中阿拉伯民族主义情绪的增长，而且促进了阿拉伯政府之间新生的团结。

content_units.text: Increased manifestations of Arabist proclivities and political ac­tivity continued during the World War II years. This could be dis­cerned on the popular level by the way the 1941 Rashid Ali opera­tion against the British in Iraq was received by other Arabs. Rashid Ali al-Gaylani had been Iraqs prime minister since March 1940, but had increasingly favored a neutral position in the European war and had opened negotiations with the Germans. At a time when Syria had come under the control of Vichy France, Britain could not afford to have an Iraqi prime minister who was not a supporter of British interests and policies. Consequently, the British ambassador demanded Rashid Alis resignation, which was .nally, and under much duress, given on January 31, 1941. This, however, incensed the Arab nationalist army of.cers who, since the ouster of the Hikmat Sulayman government in 1937, had become ascen­dant in the armed forces. Within two months they executed a coup in which Rashid Ali was returned to power and all pro-British elements of the ruling elites, including the regent, Prince Abd al­
content_units.azure_translation: 在第二次世界大战期间，阿拉伯主义倾向和政治活动的表现不断增加。这可以从1941年拉希德·阿里在伊拉克针对英国人的行动被其他阿拉伯人接受的方式看出。拉希德·阿里·盖拉尼自 1940 年 3 月以来一直担任伊拉克总理，但在欧洲战争中越来越倾向于中立立场，并与德国人展开了谈判。在叙利亚落入维希法国控制之下的时候，英国不能让一位不支持英国利益和政策的伊拉克首相。因此，英国大使要求拉希德·阿里斯辞职，这是在 1941 年 1 月 31 日在严厉的胁迫下辞职的。然而，这激怒了阿拉伯民族主义军队，自 1937 年希克马特·苏莱曼政府被推翻以来，他们在武装部队中占据了上风。两个月内，他们发动了一场政变，拉希德·阿里和所有亲英的统治精英分子重新掌权，包括摄政王阿卜杜勒亲王

content_units.text: Elie Kedourie, Arabic Political Memoirs and Other Studies (London: Frank Cass, 1974), p. 220.

Illah, escaped to British positions or to neighboring countries. War with Britain broke out on May 2. Very soon, however, the British forces in Iraq, aided by units of Jordans Arab Legion, defeated the Iraqi army, entering Baghdad on June 1, 1941, along with Prince Abd al-Illah and the others who had .ed the nationalist coup.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉，逃到了英国阵地或邻国。5月2日，与英国的战争爆发。然而，很快，驻伊拉克的英军在约旦阿拉伯军团部队的协助下，击败了伊拉克军队，并于 1941 年 6 月 1 日与阿卜杜勒·伊拉赫亲王和其他发动民族主义政变的人一起进入巴格达。

content_units.text: A short-lived and unsuccessful affair, the events surrounding the Rashid Ali coup and the war with Britain nevertheless .red the imagination of other Arabs, who perceived it as a heroic insurrec­tion by an Arab country against foreign imperial control. There was enthusiastic support for the Iraqis in Syria, where funds were raised and sent to Iraq, and a few of.cers crossed the border to join their Iraqi brethren. The infant Arab nationalist Bath Party took great heart from the events in Iraq and launched a victory in Iraq movement.29 In Egypt, the Rashid Ali coup created unrest which added to the problems of the pro-Allied government of Hu­sayn Sirri Pasha.30 Certainly by now, a broader popular interest in Arab affairs was clearly discernible in Egypt. In 1942, Nadi al-Itihad al-Arabi (the Arab Union Club) was formed, dedicating it­self to fostering closer relations and stronger bonds with other Arabs for the purpose of defending the rights of the Arab countries and regions. The club opened branches in Baghdad, Damascus, Bei­rut, and Jaffa. It became suf.ciently in.uential for the Egyptian Prime Minister Nahas Pasha to endorse the clubs platform, con­.rming that his government took great interest in the affairs of the sister Arab nations, [was] always ready to defend their interests and rights, [and viewed] with great interest the question of Arab unity.31 And these were not idle words. Not only Egypt, but also Iraq was beginning to explore various ideas, plans, and proposals for some form of Arab unity.
content_units.azure_translation: 这是一件短暂而不成功的事情，围绕拉希德·阿里政变和与英国的战争发生的事件却让其他阿拉伯人想象不起，他们认为这是一个阿拉伯国家反抗外国帝国控制的英勇起义。叙利亚的伊拉克人得到了热情的支持，在那里筹集了资金并运往伊拉克，一些人越过边境加入了他们的伊拉克兄弟。新生的阿拉伯民族主义巴斯党从伊拉克事件中汲取了极大的信心，并发起了伊拉克的胜利运动。29 在埃及，拉希德·阿里政变制造了动荡，这加剧了亲盟军的侯赛因·西里帕夏政府的问题。30 当然，到现在为止，埃及对阿拉伯事务的更广泛的民众兴趣是显而易见的。1942年，阿拉伯联盟俱乐部成立，致力于与其他阿拉伯人建立更密切的关系和更牢固的联系，以捍卫阿拉伯国家和地区的权利。该俱乐部在巴格达、大马士革、贝鲁特和雅法开设了分会。埃及总理纳哈斯帕夏支持俱乐部纲领变得非常明智，他认为他的政府对阿拉伯姐妹国家的事务非常感兴趣，随时准备捍卫他们的利益和权利，[并以极大的兴趣看待]阿拉伯统一问题。31 这些话不是空话。不仅是埃及，伊拉克也开始探索某种形式的阿拉伯统一的各种想法、计划和建议。

content_units.text: The process was begun by Iraqs Prime Minister Nuri al-Said, who had been encouraged by a statement made by the British for­
content_units.azure_translation: 这一进程是由伊拉克总理努里·赛义德（Nuri al-Said）发起的，他受到英国发表的声明的鼓舞

.ning the Egyptian Nation, 19301945, p. 198.

content_units.text: eign secretary, Anthony Eden, which af.rmed British support for Arab union initiatives.32 In January 1943, he submitted to the Brit­ish a plan for a Fertile Crescent Union.33 Nuri began his memo­randum by emphasizing that Iraq was not just a neighbor to the other Arab countries of the Fertile Crescent; rather it was symbioti­cally tied to them by fundamental linguistic, national, religious, and economic bonds. Yet, while they all desired some form of Arab unity, Nuri recognized the differences that existed among them.34 He thus proposed a two-stage process for a comprehensive Arab union. In the .rst stage, Syria, Lebanon, Palestine, and Trans-Jor­dan would be united into one state, with some autonomy, guaran­teed by the international community, for the Jews in Palestine as well as acceptable safeguards for the Christians of Lebanon. Once this state of Greater Syria had been formed, it would join Iraq in an Arab League to which other Arab states could later adhere if they so wished. The League would be responsible for defense, foreign affairs, currency, communications, customs, and the pro­tection of minorities.35 The plan was presented as a .rst step in a process that would eventually lead to a union of the Arabic-speak­ing world, the governmental form of which would depend on the preferences and ultimate decisions of the Arab populations.
content_units.azure_translation: 1943 年 1 月，他向英国提交了一份新月沃土联盟计划的计划，该秘书支持英国对阿拉伯联盟倡议的支持。32 1943 年 1 月，他向英国提交了一份新月联盟沃土计划。33 努里在备忘录的开头强调，伊拉克不仅是新月沃土上其他阿拉伯国家的邻国;相反，它通过基本的语言、国家、宗教和经济纽带与他们共生。然而，尽管他们都希望阿拉伯人实现某种形式的统一，但努里承认了他们之间存在的分歧。34 因此，他提出了一个全面阿拉伯联盟的两阶段进程。在第一阶段，叙利亚、黎巴嫩、巴勒斯坦和外约旦将统一为一个国家，为巴勒斯坦的犹太人提供国际社会保障的一定自治权，并为黎巴嫩的基督徒提供可接受的保障。一旦这个大叙利亚国成立，它将与伊拉克一起加入一个阿拉伯联盟，如果其他阿拉伯国家愿意，以后可以加入该联盟。该联盟将负责国防、外交、货币、通信、海关和少数民族的保护。35 该计划被提出为最终导致阿拉伯语世界联盟的进程中的第一步，其政府形式将取决于阿拉伯人民的偏好和最终决定。

content_units.text: On one level, the submission of the plan testi.ed to the recogni­tion by Iraqs political elite of their Arab identity. On another level, the plan had as much to do with Hashemite ambition and Iraqs rivalry with Egypt over Arab leadership as with any consuming attachment to the cause of Arab nationalism. But the two motiva­tions need not be mutually exclusive. After all, Iraqs political es­tablishment was made up mostly of Sunnis, and the Sunni commu­nity had always been the most susceptible to the ideas of Arab nationalism. The elder statesmen of the same establishment were also committed Hashemites, almost all of whom had been Faysals main lieutenants in the Arab revolt against the Ottomans, and then in Faysals Arab administration in Syria. To them, a fusion of Iraq, Syria, and Trans-Jordan under some kind of eventual Hashemite rule was a compelling political and strategic proposition.36 And it was not as though the idea had no support in Syria.37 Nuri had a plan that he believed would serve the Arab nationalist, as well as the Hashemite, cause.
content_units.azure_translation: 在某种程度上，该计划的提交证明了伊拉克政治精英对其阿拉伯身份的承认。在另一个层面上，该计划与哈希姆人的野心和伊拉克与埃及争夺阿拉伯领导权的竞争以及对阿拉伯民族主义事业的任何消耗性依恋有关。但这两种动机不一定是相互排斥的。毕竟，伊拉克的政治建制主要由逊尼派组成，而逊尼派社区一直是最容易受到阿拉伯民族主义思想影响的群体。同一机构的元老政治家也是坚定的哈希姆派，几乎所有人都曾在阿拉伯反抗奥斯曼帝国的起义中担任费萨尔的主要副手，然后在叙利亚的费萨尔阿拉伯政府中担任过主要副手。对他们来说，伊拉克、叙利亚和外约旦在某种最终的哈希姆统治下融合是一个令人信服的政治和战略主张。36 这个想法在叙利亚并非没有支持。37 努里有一个计划，他认为该计划将服务于阿拉伯民族主义者和哈希姆派的事业。

content_units.text: Eppel, The Palestine Con.ict in the History of Modern Iraq, p. 128.

The following description of Nuris plan is taken from Suad Rauf Muhamed, Nuri al­Said wa Dawrahu . al-Siyasa al-Iraqiya, 19321945 (Nuri al-Said and his role in Iraqi politics, 19321945) (Baghdad: Maktabat al-Yaqdha al-Arabiya, 1988), pp. 250262.
Ibid., p. 254.

Muhamed, Nuri al-Said wa Dawrahu . al-Siyasa al-Iraqiya, 19321945 (Nuri al­Said and his role in Iraqi politics, 19321945), pp. 257258; see also Michael N. Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics: Negotiations in Regional Order,p.76.

But the plan also had powerful detractors within Iraq. To the non-Arab Kurds, any unity scheme involving Iraq with other Arab countries and domains was not much short of a nightmare. Consti­tuting a signi.cant 20 percent of Iraqs population, the Kurds would become a tiny and thoroughly inconsequential island in an ocean of Arabic-speaking peoples. The Arab Shiites, too, were hardly thrilled by the Fertile Crescent plan. While they were a sub­stantial majority in Iraq, they would constitute a small minority in a predominantly Sunni Arab world. It was not that the Shiites did not think of themselves as Arabs; it was simply politically disadvan­tageous for them to subsume their Shiite identity into an Arab one. Iraqi Shiites, therefore, perceived such a union as essentially a plan designed to cement Sunni hegemony and further marginalize the Shiites.38 Shiite and Kurdish response was, on the whole, accord­ingly negative, constituting an important factor in the plans ultimate failure.
content_units.azure_translation: 但该计划在伊拉克国内也有强大的批评者。对于非阿拉伯库尔德人来说，任何涉及伊拉克与其他阿拉伯国家和领地的联合计划都无异于一场噩梦。库尔德人占伊拉克人口的20%，将成为阿拉伯语民族海洋中的一个小岛，完全无关紧要。阿拉伯什叶派也对新月沃土计划并不感到兴奋。虽然他们在伊拉克占绝大多数，但在以逊尼派为主的阿拉伯世界中，他们将只占少数。什叶派并不是不认为自己是阿拉伯人;对他们来说，将什叶派身份纳入阿拉伯身份在政治上是不利的。因此，伊拉克什叶派认为这样的联盟本质上是一个旨在巩固逊尼派霸权并进一步边缘化什叶派的计划。38 什叶派和库尔德人的反应总体上是消极的，这是计划最终失败的一个重要因素。

content_units.text: The other signi.cant factor was Egypts resistance to the forma­tion of a Hashemite domain in the eastern part of the Arab world that could challenge Egyptian ascendancy in the area. Had Nuris proposal been made a decade or so earlier, it might not have elicited a response from an Egypt whose Arab nationalist impulse was min­imal. But as we have seen, Egypts involvement in Arab affairs had grown steadily, so that by the 1940s, Egypts leaders had become well attuned to their Arab milieu, and to the centrality of Egypt in that milieu.39 This is not to suggest that Arab nationalism had be­come the dominant ideology in Egypt in the 1940s. Far from it. For most citizens, loyalty to Egypt and Islam was still a more powerful impulse than loyalty to Arab nationalism. But Egypts response to the Palestinian revolt, even though it might have had a strong Is­lamic dimension, underscored Egypts cultural and historic bonds with other Arabs. And the political leaders well understood the political and economic bene.ts associated with an activist stance in the region. It was hardly surprising then that they would be less than sanguine about an Arab unity scheme that would feature Iraq as its central and most in.uential member.40 Political bene.ts, moreover, need not be always national; often they are personal. To Egypts Prime Minister Nahas Pasha, who had been imposed on King Farouk by the British, and who as a consequence had devel­oped an antagonistic relationship with the king,41 asserting Egypts leadership in the Arab world would allow him to score points at the expense of the king. Indeed, the king himself, who had earlier entertained unful.lled hopes of recreating the caliphate in Cairo, came to see an Arab leadership role based in Cairo as an acceptable substitute to a caliphate.42 All of these factors, therefore, necessi­ tated a response from Egypt. In an address to the Egyptian Senate, Nahas Pasha declared:
content_units.azure_translation: 另一个重要因素是埃及抵制在阿拉伯世界东部建立哈希姆领地，这可能会挑战埃及在该地区的优势。如果努里斯的提议早十年左右提出，它可能不会引起阿拉伯民族主义冲动微乎其微的埃及的回应。但正如我们所看到的，埃及对阿拉伯事务的参与稳步增长，因此到 1940 年代，埃及领导人已经很好地适应了他们的阿拉伯环境，以及埃及在这种环境中的中心地位。39 这并不是说阿拉伯民族主义在 1940 年代已成为埃及的主导意识形态。远非如此。对于大多数公民来说，对埃及和伊斯兰教的忠诚仍然比对阿拉伯民族主义的忠诚更强烈的冲动。但埃及对巴勒斯坦起义的反应，尽管它可能具有强烈的伊斯兰色彩，但强调了埃及与其他阿拉伯人的文化和历史联系。政治领导人非常了解与该地区激进主义立场相关的政治和经济bene.ts。因此，他们对以伊拉克为中心和最重要的成员的阿拉伯统一计划不那么乐观也就不足为奇了。40 此外，政治bene.ts不必总是全国性的;它们通常是个人的。埃及首相纳哈斯帕夏被英国强加给法鲁克国王，因此与国王建立了敌对关系，41 声称埃及在阿拉伯世界的领导地位将使他能够以牺牲国王为代价来得分。事实上，国王本人早些时候曾抱有在开罗重建哈里发国的希望，但后来将以开罗为基地的阿拉伯领导角色视为哈里发国的可接受替代品。42 因此，所有这些因素都必须引起埃及的回应。纳哈斯帕夏在埃及参议院发表讲话时宣称：

content_units.text: For the political maneuvering involved in Iraqs unity schemes, see Majid Khadduri, The Scheme of Fertile Crescent Unity: A Study in Inter-Arab Relations, in The Near East and the Great Powers. ed. Richard N. Frye (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1951), pp. 137177.
Malik Mufti, Sovereign Creations: Pan Arabism and Political Order in Syria and Iraq (Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press, 1996), pp. 4652.
Yitzhak Nakash, The Shiis of Iraq (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1994), pp. 133134.

A position that in fact was more than welcomed by the nationalists in the region, who accepted Egypts weight and centrality in the Arab world. See, for instance, Abu Khal­dun Sati al-Husri, Dawr Misr . al-Nahdha al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya, (Egypts role in Arab nationalist renaissance) in his Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya (Selected studies on Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1985), p. 105; see also Ilyas Sahab, Sati al-Husri: al-Mufakir, wa al-Daiya wa al-Numudhaj, (Sati al-Husri: the thinker, the advocate, and the role model), al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no.1 (May 1978): 85.

Jamil Mattar and Ali al-Din Hillal, Al-Nidham al-Iqlimi al-Arabi: Dirasa . al-Ilaqat al-Siyasia al-Arabiya (The Arab regional system: a study in Arab political relations) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1980), p. 63.
See P. J. Vatikiotis, The History of Modern Egypt: From Muhammed Ali to Mubarak, 4th ed. (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1991), pp. 349356.
Elie Kedourie, The Chatham House Version and Other Middle Eastern Studies (Lon­don: Weidenfeld and Nicolson, 1970), p. 206.

When Mr. Eden made his statement, I thought about it and con­cluded that the best way to achieve it is to let the Arab governments themselves take care of it. I thought that the Egyptian government should take an of.cial initiative by consulting other Arab govern­ments, one by one, then Egypt should coordinate these different views as much as possible. Egypt will then invite Arab representa­tives to discuss the issue collectively. If an agreement is reached, Egypt will then convene a meeting in Egypt chaired by the Egyptian prime minister.43
content_units.azure_translation: 当伊登先生发言时，我仔细考虑了一下，得出的结论是，实现这一目标的最好办法是让阿拉伯政府自己来处理它。我认为埃及政府应该采取主动行动，逐一咨询其他阿拉伯国家政府，然后埃及应该尽可能地协调这些不同的观点。埃及随后将邀请阿拉伯代表集体讨论这个问题。如果达成协议，埃及将在埃及召开一次由埃及总理主持的会议43。

content_units.text: Accordingly, the Egyptian prime minister embarked on a series of conversations with the leaders of Iraq, Syria, Trans-Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Lebanon, and Yemen about the prospects and feasi­bility of Arab unity. As these bilateral talks progressed throughout 1943 and well into 1944, emphasizing Egypts determination to etch for itself a leading role, Arab nationalist narrators in Egypt endeavored intellectually to legitimize Egypts political initiative by emphasizing Egypts historical Arab roots. Perhaps the most prominent and committed of these narrators, Abd al-Rahman Azzam, who later became the .rst secretary general of the Arab League in 1945, would write somewhat expansively that Egypt was an Arab country before the time of Christ.44 It is important to note that the effort at legitimation was directed at Egyptians, not at the other Arabs. Regardless of whether they were truly con­vinced that Egypt was genuinely committed to the Arab nationalist cause, nationalists in other Arab countries were nevertheless jubi­lant that Egypt was beginning to consider itself a part of the Arab world.45
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，埃及总理开始与伊拉克、叙利亚、外约旦、沙特阿拉伯、黎巴嫩和也门领导人就阿拉伯统一的前景和可行性进行一系列对话。随着这些双边会谈在整个 1943 年和 1944 年取得进展，强调埃及决心为自己发挥主导作用，埃及的阿拉伯民族主义叙述者在理智上努力通过强调埃及的阿拉伯历史根源来使埃及的政治主动权合法化。也许是这些叙述者中最杰出和最忠诚的，后来在 1945 年成为阿拉伯联盟第一任秘书长的阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼·阿扎姆 （Abd al-Rahman Azzam） 会写得有些宽泛，埃及在基督时代之前是一个阿拉伯国家。44 值得注意的是，合法化的努力是针对埃及人，而不是其他阿拉伯人。无论他们是否真的相信埃及真正致力于阿拉伯民族主义事业，其他阿拉伯国家的民族主义者仍然对埃及开始认为自己是阿拉伯世界的一部分感到高兴。45

content_units.text: Quoted in Ghassan Salame, Inter-Arab Politics: The Return of Geography, in The Middle East: Ten Years After Camp David, ed. William B. Quandt. (Washington, D.C.: The Brookings Institution, 1988), p. 338.
Sylvia Haim, ed., Arab Nationalism: An Anthology (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1962), p. 51.
Seale, The Struggle for Syria,p.21.

Arab popular approval of Egypts move was interestingly enough duplicated at the level of political leaderships, many of whom were less than enthusiastic about the Fertile Crescent Plan with its intimation of eventual Iraqi leadership. The Saudi king, who had ousted the Hashemites from the Hejaz two decades earlier, could not sanction any scheme that would strengthen Ha­shemite Iraq. The powerful Damascene faction within the Syrian government insisted on a republican form of government for Syria, and feared that Nuris plan would become a vehicle for Hashemite irredentism through one of its two branches in Amman or Bagh­dad. And the Lebanese Christians considered the Egyptians more moderate than the Iraqis, hence they expected a less intrusive pro­posal than that of the Baghdad government on the independence of Lebanon.
content_units.azure_translation: 有趣的是，阿拉伯民众对埃及此举的认可在政治领导层层面得到了重复，其中许多人对新月沃土计划并不热衷，因为它暗示了伊拉克最终的领导层。二十年前将哈希姆人赶出汉志的沙特国王无法批准任何加强哈希姆派伊拉克的计划。叙利亚政府内部强大的大马士革派系坚持为叙利亚实行共和政体，并担心努里斯计划会通过其在安曼或巴格达的两个分支之一成为哈希姆不统一主义的工具。黎巴嫩基督徒认为埃及人比伊拉克人更温和，因此他们期望在黎巴嫩独立问题上提出比巴格达政府更不具有侵扰性的建议。

content_units.text: In June 1944, the Egyptian government formally invited the other Arab governments and political leaderships to a conference in Alexandria on the subject of Arab unity and cooperation. The conference lasted from September 25 to October 8, and included representatives of the governments of Egypt, Iraq, Syria, Lebanon, Trans-Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and Yemen, as well as a representative of the Arab Palestinians. At its conclusion, the conference formu­lated the Alexandria Protocol which became the basis for the formal establishment of the Arab League in 1945 to be headquar­tered in Cairo.
content_units.azure_translation: 1944年6月，埃及政府正式邀请其他阿拉伯政府和政治领导人参加在亚历山大港举行的关于阿拉伯团结与合作主题的会议。会议从9月25日持续到10月8日，包括埃及、伊拉克、叙利亚、黎巴嫩、外约旦、沙特阿拉伯和也门政府的代表，以及阿拉伯巴勒斯坦人的代表。会议在会议结束时拟订了《亚历山大议定书》，该议定书成为1945年阿拉伯联盟正式成立总部设在开罗的基础。

content_units.text: While recognizing the many ties that bind the Arabs together, the Arab League Pact was essentially an agreement among sover­eign Arab states. The prologue to the agreement characterized the members as desirous of strengthening the close relations and nu­merous ties which link the Arab states and anxious to support and strengthen these ties upon a basis of respect for the independence and sovereignty of these states.46 In a sense, the League repre­sented for the Arab countries a perfect compromise between Arab identity and their more particularistic, local identities. It was a clear
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然承认将阿拉伯人联系在一起的许多联系，但《阿拉伯联盟公约》本质上是阿拉伯主权国家之间的协议。该协定的序言将成员国描述为希望加强阿拉伯国家之间的密切关系和众多联系，并急于在尊重这些国家的独立和主权的基础上支持和加强这些关系。46 从某种意义上说，国际联盟代表了阿拉伯国家在阿拉伯身份与其更特殊的地方身份之间的完美妥协。这是一个清晰的

content_units.text: For a succinct exposition of the roots and development of the Arab League, see Cecil
A. Hourani, The Arab League in Perspective, Middle East Journal, vol. 1, no. 2 (April 1947): 125136.
content_units.azure_translation: A. Hourani，《阿拉伯联盟透视》，《中东杂志》，第 1 卷，第 2 期（1947 年 4 月）：125136。

content_units.text: af.rmation that these countries and domains were members of a larger Arab system in which all the constituent parts were enjoined to seek closer ties, yet the pact also asserted unequivocally the inde­pendence and sovereignty of the Arab states. To the Arab leader­ships, the creation of the Arab League was a con.rmation that the tension between the two competing identities, local (watani) versus national (qawmi), need not constitute a zero-sum game. That it did not in this particular instance was in fact a function of the goals and interests of the ruling elites. Among the public at large, espe­cially, of course, its urban and educated segments, the League rep­resented a welcome step toward Arab overall cooperation, but also, in stressing political sovereignty, a possible hindrance to fu­ture unity endeavors. While perhaps not immediately apparent, the establishment of the Arab League did indeed create a tension be­tween Arab unity and Arab statehood that would be played out in the turbulent decades of the 1950s and 1960s. On another level, the Arab League would institutionalize Egypts leading role in the Arab world, implanting its presence onto the Arab consciousness, the full force of which would not be felt until a decade later.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些国家和领地是更大的阿拉伯体系的成员，在这个体系中，所有组成部分都被要求寻求更密切的联系，但该条约也明确地主张阿拉伯国家的独立和主权。对阿拉伯领导人来说，阿拉伯联盟的成立是一个结论，即地方（watani）与民族（qawmi）这两个相互竞争的身份之间的紧张关系不必构成零和博弈。在这种特殊情况下，它实际上不是统治精英的目标和利益的函数。在广大公众中，当然，尤其是其城市和受过教育的群体中，联盟代表着朝着阿拉伯全面合作迈出的可喜一步，但在强调政治主权方面，也可能阻碍未来的团结努力。虽然可能不会立即显现出来，但阿拉伯联盟的成立确实在阿拉伯统一和阿拉伯国家地位之间造成了紧张关系，这种紧张关系将在 1950 年代和 1960 年代动荡的几十年中上演。在另一个层面上，阿拉伯联盟将把埃及在阿拉伯世界的领导作用制度化，将其存在植入阿拉伯意识中，直到十年后才能感受到其全部力量。

content_units.text: Little doubt remains that the establishment of the Arab League generally led to the heightening of Arabist sentiment. Increased in­teraction among the elites was bound to have a spillover effect on other societal institutions and activities, such as the media, profes­sional associations, and educational and cultural exchanges and interactions. Even critical views of the League from the qawmi groups who thought the Leagues endorsement of state sovereignty hindered organic Arab unity, or from the watani crowd who con­sidered the League to be an infringement on state sovereignty and a step toward the eventual demise of the various Arab states, were part of a general debate that was to bring the ideas of Arab nation­alism to the forefront of Arab consciousness.
content_units.azure_translation: 毫无疑问，阿拉伯联盟的成立总体上导致了阿拉伯主义情绪的高涨。精英之间互动的增加必然会对其他社会机构和活动产生溢出效应，例如媒体、专业协会以及教育和文化交流和互动。即使是认为联盟对国家主权的认可阻碍了阿拉伯有机团结的卡米团体，或者认为联盟是对国家主权的侵犯，是走向各个阿拉伯国家最终灭亡的一步的瓦塔尼人群对联盟的批评，也是将阿拉伯民族主义思想带到阿拉伯意识最前沿的一般性辩论的一部分。

content_units.text: Perhaps it was not coincidental that the Bath Party, a vehement, almost fanatical, propagator of Arab nationalism and Arab unity, which later was to become a major player in inter-Arab politics, grew rapidly in the second half of the 1940s. The formal founding congress of the party was convened in April 1947 in Damascus, attracting about 250 attendees from various Arab countries and regions,47 most of whom were Sunnis and Orthodox Christians who belonged to the urban middle class or were members of the country gentry.48 The .rst principle of the partys constitution, which was adopted at the congress af.rmed that the Arab world was an indi­visible political and economic unity. Other principles established the Arabs as a cultural unity. Indeed, the Arabs were not just a nation, but a most special nation with an eternal mission.49 Even though it had to operate clandestinely, party branches were opened in Lebanon, Iraq, and Jordan, and recruitment was extended to other parts of the Arab world between 1948 and 1951.50 While not yet a major political force, the Bath Party in the second half of the 1940s rapidly gained enough popular support to establish a pres­ence on the Syrian political landscape. The partys growth was a symptom of the gradual acceptability of Arab nationalist ideas among the Arabs, particularly the educated urban classes.
content_units.azure_translation: 巴斯党是阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯团结的狂热、近乎狂热的传播者，后来成为阿拉伯间政治的主要参与者，在 1940 年代后半期迅速发展，这也许并非巧合。1947年4月，该党的正式成立代表大会在大马士革召开，吸引了来自阿拉伯各个国家和地区的约250名与会者，47其中大多数是逊尼派和东正教基督徒，他们属于城市中产阶级或乡村绅士。48 党章的第一原则是在大会上通过的，阿拉伯世界是一个不可分割的政治和经济统一体。其他原则将阿拉伯人确立为一个文化统一体。事实上，阿拉伯人不仅仅是一个民族，而且是一个最特殊的民族，肩负着永恒的使命。49 尽管它必须秘密运作，但它在黎巴嫩、伊拉克和约旦开设了党支部，并在 1948 年至 1951 年间将招募范围扩大到阿拉伯世界的其他地区。50 虽然巴斯党还不是一支主要的政治力量，但在 1940 年代后半期迅速获得了足够的民众支持，从而在叙利亚政治版图上建立了存在。政党的增长是阿拉伯民族主义思想逐渐被阿拉伯人接受的症状，尤其是受过教育的城市阶层。

content_units.text: Education played a key role in this process. In the 1920s, no more than 2 percent of the population in the Arabic-speaking world could claim to have had some education,51 and much of it was at the primary level provided by private institutions, particu­larly religious establishments. By the 1940s, education had ex­panded considerably. For example, enrollment in Egyptian second­ary schools rose from about 5,000 in 1920 to 120,000 in 1951, and those attending universities increased from 3,000 in 1925 to 32,000 in 1950.52 More to the point, the expansion in education in Egypt produced a new effendiya class (essentially an urban, literate, and professional stratum), which had a less westernized social background. This new class, unlike an earlier generation, was thus oriented less toward Europe and the West and more to­ward Arabism and Islam.53 In Iraq, too, the secondary school popu­lation grew considerably from 229 in 1921 to 13,969 by 1940, an increase paralleled by the growth of the college student population from 99 to 1,218 during the same period.54 An important by-prod­uct of the spread of secular education in Iraq was the gradual reduction of the sectarian divide between Sunnis and Shiites. This happened as secularist and nationalist values, propagated by the states school system, reached the Shiites in increasing numbers.55 Moreover, whereas only .fteen Iraqi students graduated from college in 1921all lawyersthere were 1,091 graduates from nine different colleges in 1951.56 In Syria, which did not become independent until 1945, a rapid expansion in education over the next .ve years doubled the number of primary school students, and quadrupled the number of secondary school students.57 The bulk of the students in the three countries, especially Egypt and Iraq, were receiving their education from state schools. By the 1950s, private schools were a distinct minority, and religious schools tended to be strictly supervised by the state. Consequently, secular and nationalist values on the whole were inculcated into the growing student populations.
content_units.azure_translation: 教育在这个过程中发挥了关键作用。在1920年代，阿拉伯语世界只有不到2%的人口可以声称受过某种教育，51其中大部分是由私立机构，特别是宗教机构提供的初等教育。到 1940 年代，教育已大大扩展。例如，埃及中学的入学人数从 1920 年的约 5,000 人增加到 1951 年的 120,000 人，就读大学的人数从 1925 年的 3,000 人增加到 1950 年的 32,000 人。52 更重要的是，埃及教育的扩张产生了一个新的 effendiya 阶层（本质上是一个城市、有文化的和专业阶层），他们的社会背景不太西化。因此，与前一代人不同，这个新阶层的导向较少于欧洲和西方，而更多地转向阿拉伯主义和伊斯兰教。53 在伊拉克，中学人口也从 1921 年的 229 人大幅增长到 1940 年的 13,969 人，这一增长与同期大学生人数从 99 人增长到 1,218 人同时增加。54 世俗教育在伊拉克传播的一个重要副产品是逊尼派和什叶派之间的教派分歧。55 此外，1921 年只有 15 名伊拉克学生从大学毕业，而所有律师则有 1,091 名毕业生来自九所不同的大学。56 在叙利亚，直到 1945 年才独立，在接下来的几年里，教育的迅速扩张使小学生人数翻了一番。 中学生人数翻了两番。57 这三个国家，特别是埃及和伊拉克的大部分学生都是在公立学校接受教育的。到 1950 年代，私立学校已成为明显的少数，宗教学校往往受到国家的严格监管。因此，世俗和民族主义价值观总体上被灌输到不断增长的学生群体中。

Robert W. Olson, The Bath and Syria, 19471982: The Evolution of Ideology, Party and State (Princeton, New Jersey: Kingston Press, Inc., 1982), p. 21.

The full text of the constitution of the Bath Party can be found in Haim, Arab Nation­alism: An Anthology, pp. 233241. For an absorbing critique of Bathist ideology, see Kanan Makiya, Republic of Fear: The Politics of Modern Iraq, updated ed. (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1998), pp. 201228.
John F. Devlin, The Baath Party: Rise and Metamorphosis, The American Historical Review, vol. 96, no. 5 (December 1991):1399.
M. E. Yapp, The Near East Since the First World War: A History to 1945,2nd ed. (London: Longman, 1996), p. 19.
