The 1940s were years of rapid expansion of Arab nationalist ideas. By the latter part of the decade, the nationalist ideologues and activists had succeeded in planting Arab nationalism into the consciousness of people hitherto unfamiliar with, or resistant to, the tenets of the idea. No longer an upstart, lagging far behind other loyalties and identities, Arab nationalism now could take its place as a legitimate and serious contender for peoples political loyalties. And there is little doubt that the 19361939 Arab revolt in Palestine contributed signi.cantly to the ascent of the idea.
content_units.azure_translation: 1940 年代是阿拉伯民族主义思想迅速扩张的年份。到本世纪后半叶，民族主义理论家和活动家成功地将阿拉伯民族主义植入了迄今为止不熟悉或抵制该思想原则的人们的意识中。阿拉伯民族主义不再是一个暴发户，远远落后于其他忠诚度和身份，现在可以取代它，成为人民政治忠诚的合法和严肃的竞争者。毫无疑问，巴勒斯坦19361939阿拉伯起义对这一思想的兴起做出了重大贡献。

content_units.text: Gershoni and Jankowski, Rede.ning the Egyptian Nation, pp. 216217.

Hanna Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolutionary Movements of Iraq: A Study of Iraqs Old Landed and Commercial Classes and of Its Communists, Bathists, and Free Of.cers (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1978), p. 34. Also, Phebe Marr, The Modern History of Iraq (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1985), pp. 137142.
Marr, The Development of Nationalist Ideology in Iraq, 19201941, p. 100.
Marr, The Modern History of Iraq, p. 139.
Raymond A. Hinnebusch, Authoritarian Power and State Formation in Bathist Syria (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1990), p. 51.

But this ascent, considerable as it was, should not lull us into thinking that by the 1940s Arab nationalism had become the main focus of peoples ideological loyalties. The competing identities, which we have already encountered, were equally potent and in some cases far more entrenched, and consequently continued to lay claim to peoples allegiance. Looking at peoples enduring iden­ti.cation with their immediate locale, clan, tribe, sect, religion, and country, it can only be surmised that, despite its impressive growth, Arab nationalism was in many ways still a minority sentiment.
content_units.azure_translation: 但这种上升，尽管是相当大的，但不应该让我们认为，到 1940 年代，阿拉伯民族主义已成为人们意识形态忠诚的主要焦点。我们已经遇到的相互竞争的身份同样强大，在某些情况下更加根深蒂固，因此继续宣称人民的效忠。纵观人们与其直接地区、氏族、部落、教派、宗教和国家的持久认同，只能推测，尽管阿拉伯民族主义增长令人印象深刻，但在许多方面仍然是一种少数情绪。

content_units.text: In Egypt, Arab nationalism continued to face an uphill struggle in its competition with the Egypt-.rst orientation, represented by a plethora of political parties and organizations,58 as well as with a powerfully ingrained Muslim identity, represented by the one million members of the Muslim Brotherhood Organization. In Syria too, Arab nationalist ideas had to compete not only with other equally populist ideologies, such as Communism and Antun Saadas Syrian nationalism, but also with a host of powerful tradi­tional loyalties and a strong attachment to Bilad al-Sham, the no­tion of Greater Syria. Indeed, the many overlapping references in the wake of Syrian independence in 1946 to Syria as a nation in its own right and as a part of a larger Arab nation revealed an ambiguity of identity, not just a carelessness about language.59
content_units.azure_translation: 在埃及，阿拉伯民族主义继续面临一场艰苦的斗争，与以众多政党和组织为代表的埃及第一取向，58 以及以穆斯林兄弟会组织的 100 万成员为代表的根深蒂固的穆斯林身份。在叙利亚，阿拉伯民族主义思想不仅要与其他同样民粹主义的意识形态竞争，如共产主义和安通·萨达斯叙利亚民族主义，还要与许多强大的传统忠诚和对比拉德·沙姆（Bilad al-Sham）的强烈依恋，即大叙利亚的概念。事实上，在1946年叙利亚独立后，许多重叠的提及叙利亚本身是一个独立的国家，作为一个更大的阿拉伯国家的一部分，揭示了身份的模糊性，而不仅仅是对语言的粗心大意。59

content_units.text: In Iraq as well, Arab nationalism continued to be confronted by other powerful attachments and political orientations. While the platform of the Istiqlal Party and, to a lesser extent during this period, the ideas of the infant Bath Party, attracted increasing numbers of Iraqi youth, other parties and groupings such as the al-Ahali group with its manifestly Iraqi orientation and the Commu­nist Party could claim just as committed, and perhaps a greater number of, supporters. In addition, attachment to, and concern about, tribal and sectarian interests, were so embedded in people that they outweighed Arab nationalist considerations. Abd al-Karim al-Uzri, one of the few Shiite members of the political elite during this period, implies in his memoirs that during the 1941 war with the British, the tribes around Baghdad, a number of whose members were of.cers and soldiers in the Iraqi army, were in fact working in tandem with the British against the Rashid Ali govern­ment and his Arab nationalist of.cers.60
content_units.azure_translation: 在伊拉克，阿拉伯民族主义也继续面临其他强大的依恋和政治取向。虽然伊斯蒂克拉尔党的纲领，以及在此期间较小程度上的新生巴斯党的思想，吸引了越来越多的伊拉克青年，但其他政党和团体，如明显倾向于伊拉克的阿哈利集团和共产党，可以声称同样坚定，也许还有更多的人， 支持者。此外，对部落和宗派利益的依恋和关注根深蒂固，以至于超过了阿拉伯民族主义的考虑。阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·乌兹里（Abd al-Karim al-Uzri）是这一时期为数不多的什叶派政治精英成员之一，他在回忆录中暗示，在1941年与英国的战争期间，巴格达周围的部落（其中一些成员是伊拉克军队的士兵）实际上正在与英国人合作，反对拉希德·阿里政府和他的阿拉伯民族主义者60。

content_units.text: The best study on Egyptian parties and organizations in monarchical Egypt, which clearly shows the primacy of Egyptian" concerns, is Ali al-Din Hillal, Al-Siyasa wa al-Hukum . Misr: al-Ahd al Birlimani, 19231952 (Politics and rule in Egypt: the parliamen­tary era, 19231945) (Cairo: Maktabat Nahdhat al-Sharq, 1977).
Eberhard Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revisited: Interest, Identity, and Policy in Syria and Egypt, International Journal of Middle East Studies, vol. 27, no. 1, (February 1997): 59.

And, in an admittedly somewhat odd and even counterintuitive twist of fate, the .rst Arab-Israeli war, 19481949, which Arab nationalists had hoped would constitute the crowning glory of their creed, in fact ended up, at least in the short-term, reinforcing regional, particularistic, and Islamist orientations at the expense of the Arab connection. In the eyes of the Arabs, the beginning of the war signi.ed Arab unity of purpose, the foundation upon which Arab unity would be built. By the end of the war, the Arab cooperative effort had given way to a milieu of acrimonious accusa­tions and mutual recriminations, and hopes that had shone so brightly had turned into bitter disillusionment with Arab divisions, jealousies, and incompetence.
content_units.azure_translation: 而且，在一个公认的有点奇怪甚至违反直觉的命运转折中，阿拉伯民族主义者希望19481949的第一次阿以战争将构成他们信条的最高荣耀，但实际上，至少在短期内，最终以牺牲阿拉伯联系为代价加强了地区、特殊主义和伊斯兰主义取向。在阿拉伯人眼中，战争的开始标志着阿拉伯人的目标统一，这是阿拉伯统一的基础。到战争结束时，阿拉伯的合作努力已经让位于尖锐的指责和相互指责的环境，原本如此闪耀的希望变成了对阿拉伯分裂、嫉妒和无能的痛苦幻灭。

content_units.text: The immediate roots of the .rst Arab-Israeli war could be traced back to February 1947 when British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin, admitting that Britain, the mandatory power, had lost control over Palestine, referred the matter to the United Nations. On November 29, 1947, the United Nations General Assembly, under heavy pres­sure from the United States, voted to partition Palestine between the Jews and the Arabs. The Arab League declared that it would not recognize a state for the Jews in Palestine, and that members of the League would be encouraged to intervene in Palestine. Imme­ diately on the .nal withdrawal of British soldiers from Palestine on May 14, 1948, David Ben-Gurion and other Jewish leaders pro­claimed the birth of the state of Israel on the territory under their control on that date. In response to Ben-Gurions announcement, units from the armies of Egypt, Syria, Trans-Jordan, Lebanon, and Iraq entered Palestine.
content_units.azure_translation: 第一次阿以战争的直接根源可以追溯到 1947 年 2 月，当时英国外交大臣欧内斯特·贝文承认英国作为强制性强国已经失去了对巴勒斯坦的控制，并将此事提交给联合国。1947年11月29日，联合国大会在美国的重压下，投票决定将巴勒斯坦划分为犹太人和阿拉伯人。阿拉伯联盟宣布，它不会承认巴勒斯坦的犹太人建国，并将鼓励阿拉伯联盟成员干预巴勒斯坦。1948 年 5 月 14 日，英国士兵从巴勒斯坦撤出，大卫·本-古里安 （David Ben-Gurion） 和其他犹太领导人宣布以色列国在当天在他们控制下的领土上诞生。作为对本-古里安斯的声明的回应，埃及、叙利亚、外约旦、黎巴嫩和伊拉克军队的部队进入巴勒斯坦。

content_units.text: Abd al-Karim al-Uzri, Tarikh . Dhikrayat al-Iraq, 19301958 (History in memoirs of Iraq, 19301958) (Beirut: Markaz al-Abjadiya li al-Saf al-Taswiri, 1982), pp. 148150.

The entry of the Arab armies into Palestine af.rmed the very tenets of Arab nationalism. Here were the Arab countries, joined in the Arab League a mere three years earlier, united in their commitment to their Arab brethren in Palestine, dispatching their armies to defeat the upstart Israelis. But the ostensible show of Arab unity hid deep divisions that had little to do with ideological commitment and everything to do with personal ambitions and rivalries. King Abdallah coveted the incorporation of Palestine into his domain, and preferably the creation of a Hashemite Greater Syria. The Syrians, eyeing Abdallahs enormous irreden­tist appetite feared Jordan more than Israel.61 The Iraqis had no objection to a Hashemite takeover so long as they became the se­nior partners; the Egyptians on the other hand were not about to allow the Hashemites to claim the spoils of war; nor would Ibn Saud, whose Saudi Arabia was created only after defeating the Hashemites.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯军队进入巴勒斯坦，这正是阿拉伯民族主义的原则。这里是阿拉伯国家，仅仅三年前才加入阿拉伯联盟，他们团结一致地致力于巴勒斯坦的阿拉伯兄弟，派遣军队击败新贵以色列人。但表面上阿拉伯团结的表现隐藏着深刻的分歧，这些分歧与意识形态承诺无关，而与个人野心和竞争有关。阿卜杜拉国王渴望将巴勒斯坦并入他的领土，最好是建立一个哈希姆大叙利亚。叙利亚人盯着阿卜杜拉巨大的不可逆转的胃口，比起以色列，他们更害怕约旦。61 伊拉克人不反对哈希姆人接管，只要他们成为高级伙伴;另一方面，埃及人不打算允许哈希姆人夺取战利品;伊本·沙特也不会，他的沙特阿拉伯是在击败哈希姆人后才建立的。

content_units.text: The questionable commitment of the Arab leaders to the cause is clearly shown by the inadequate number of soldiers in the Arab armies and the tactics used in the war. At no time did the combined strength of the Arab armies exceed that of the Jewish regulars. After the war, Israel was to systematically propagate the parable of the Jewish David valiantly taking on the Arab Goliath. The truth, however, was starkly different. In mid-May 1948, Avi Shlaim tells us, the total number of Arab troops, both regular and irregular, operating in the Palestine theater was under 25,000, whereas the IDF (Israels Defense Forces) .elded over 35,000 troops. By mid-July the IDF mobilized 65,000 men under arms, and by December its numbers had reached a peak of 96,441.62 In addition to their quantitative inferiority, the Arab armies were as wary of each other as they were of the Israelis, and their military operations were sometimes tailored to keep an eye on each others military positions and intentions. The Israelis were a prime bene.­ciary of such inter-Arab suspicions.63 The result was a political .asco and a military debacle. The Arab populations, told to expect swift victory, waited expectantly for the fruits of the Arabs united action. Instead they were witness to Arab armies and governments competing for their own slice of Palestine, and for the glory that would be accrued by them individually. Their united effort lacked any coordination on the .eld; so much in fact that they went out of their way not to come to the aid of each other, and indeed, in some cases, sabotaged one another.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯军队的士兵人数不足和战争中使用的战术清楚地表明了阿拉伯领导人对这一事业的承诺值得怀疑。阿拉伯军队的总兵力从未超过犹太正规军。战后，以色列要系统地传播犹太人大卫英勇对抗阿拉伯歌利亚的比喻。然而，事实却截然不同。1948 年 5 月中旬，阿维·施莱姆 （Avi Shlaim） 告诉我们，在巴勒斯坦战区作战的阿拉伯军队（包括正规军和非正规军）总数不到 25,000 人，而 IDF（以色列国防军）则有超过 35,000 名士兵。到7月中旬，以色列国防军动员了65 000名武装人员，到12月，其人数已达到96 441人的峰值。62 除了数量上的劣势之外，阿拉伯军队还像对以色列人一样相互警惕，他们的军事行动有时是为了监视对方的军事立场和意图而量身定制的。以色列人是这种阿拉伯间怀疑的主要受益者。63 结果是政治上的 .asco 和军事上的崩溃。阿拉伯民众被告知要期待迅速的胜利，满怀期待地等待着阿拉伯人联合行动的成果。相反，他们见证了阿拉伯军队和政府为争夺自己的巴勒斯坦份额，以及他们个人将获得的荣耀而争夺。他们的团结努力在 .eld 上缺乏任何协调;事实上，他们竭尽全力不互相帮助，事实上，在某些情况下，他们互相破坏。

content_units.text: Joshua Landis, Syria and the Palestine War: Fighting King Abdullahs Greater Syria Plan, in Eugene L. Rogan and Avi Shlaim, The War for Palestine: Rewriting the History of 1948 (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 2001), p. 185.

It was not surprising that in the immediate aftermath of the war, Arab nationalism was dealt a substantial blow. It was not that the idea lost its appeal, rather it was merely the recognition that contemporary political structures in the Arab world were not only incapable, but also, and more dishearteningly, unwilling to realize Arab nationalist aspirations. It was not dif.cult for Arab popula­tions to see that on the whole it was political ambitions and com­petition, not .delity to Arab national interests, that dictated the war effort. And for those who still were willing to give Arab politi­cal leaders the bene.t of the doubt, Emir Abdallah of Trans-Jor­dan was soon to sti.e any lingering optimism. In September 1948, the Egyptians suggested the creation of a Palestinian government on land occupied at the time by the Egyptian and Jordanian ar­mies. Emir Abdallah vehemently rejected any such initiative, and instead engineered the convening of a conference in Jericho which advocated the annexation of the West Bank into Trans-Jordan. This produced a howl of protest in the Arab world. Even the gov­ ernment of Hashemite Iraq, under pressure of public opinion, con­demned the idea, extracting a promise from Abdallah to freeze the proposal for the time being. Abdallah agreed as long as the Arab countries withdrew their support from any notion of a Pales­tinian government.64
content_units.azure_translation: 战争结束后，阿拉伯民族主义立即受到重大打击也就不足为奇了。这并不是说这个想法失去了吸引力，而只是认识到阿拉伯世界的当代政治结构不仅没有能力，而且更令人沮丧的是，不愿意实现阿拉伯民族主义的愿望。对于阿拉伯民众来说，总的来说，是政治野心和竞争，而不是对阿拉伯国家利益的忠诚，决定了战争努力，这并不奇怪。对于那些仍然愿意让阿拉伯政治领导人持怀疑态度的人来说，外约旦的埃米尔·阿卜杜拉很快就会消除任何挥之不去的乐观情绪。1948 年 9 月，埃及人建议在当时被埃及和约旦军队占领的土地上建立巴勒斯坦政府。埃米尔·阿卜杜拉强烈拒绝任何此类倡议，而是策划在杰里科召开一次会议，主张将约旦河西岸并入外约旦河。这在阿拉伯世界引起了抗议的嚎叫。就连伊拉克哈希姆政府在舆论压力下也谴责了这一想法，并从阿卜杜拉那里获得了暂时冻结该提案的承诺。只要阿拉伯国家撤回对巴勒斯坦政府的任何概念的支持，阿卜杜拉就同意了64。

content_units.text: Avi Shlaim, The Iron Wall: Israel and the Arab World (New York: W.W. Norton and Company, 2000), p. 35.
Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics,p.91.

In the meantime, Abdallah conducted secret negotiations with the Israelis on the possibility of a peace agreement that would insti­tutionalize the absorption of the West Bank into Jordan.65 When these negotiations were made public, the Arab League, responding to universal popular distaste of the Jordanian-Israeli negotiations, met in the spring of 1950, and in an undisguised reference to Ab­dallah, prohibited any Arab country from concluding a peace treaty with Israel. Abdallah responded by announcing the absorp­tion of the West Bank into what now became known as the Ha­shemite Kingdom of Jordan. Incensed at the Jordanian action, and fearing a diminution in its perceived centrality in the area, Egypt demanded Jordans expulsion, but Iraq and the Yemen lobbied against Egypts position, and when Britain and the United States supported Abdallahs action, Egypt and the Leagues opposition .zzled out.66 It was probably at this point that the Arab public became skeptical of the Arab League and of unity initiatives em­barked upon by the Arab governments.
content_units.azure_translation: 与此同时，阿卜杜拉与以色列人就达成和平协议的可能性进行了秘密谈判，该协议将使约旦河西岸并入约旦制度化。65 当这些谈判公开时，阿拉伯联盟为了回应民众对约旦-以色列谈判的普遍厌恶，于 1950 年春天举行了会议，并毫不掩饰地提到了阿卜杜拉， 禁止任何阿拉伯国家与以色列缔结和平条约。阿卜杜拉的回应是宣布将约旦河西岸并入现在被称为约旦哈希姆王国的地区。埃及对约旦的行动感到愤怒，并担心其在该地区的中心地位会减弱，因此要求驱逐约旦，但伊拉克和也门游说反对埃及的立场，当英国和美国支持阿卜杜拉的行动时，埃及和联盟的反对派就退出了。66 可能正是在这一点上，阿拉伯公众对阿拉伯联盟和阿拉伯政府发起的团结倡议持怀疑态度。

content_units.text: This wariness about governmental intentions was evident in an initiative for Syrian-Iraqi federation in late 1949. In October, mem­bers of the hierarchy of Syrias ruling Peoples Party, which was traditionally close to the Iraqis, opened negotiations with Baghdad for some form of union between the two countries. While the Syri­ans sought a loose federation that would maintain their republican political order, the Iraqis went for a more organic union. They de­ manded a centralized federal leadership, a common diplomatic corps, .nancial and monetary integration, and the merger of the two armies under a uni.ed command.67 Perceiving it as essentially a union that would bolster the regional power not only of Hashem­ite Iraq, but also of its great-power ally, Britain, the initiative was coolly received among the governments and populations of the Arab world. Even in Iraq, opposition was widespread, not just from the usual suspects, in this case the Kurds and Shiites, the tradi­tional opponents of Arab unity initiatives, but also from an appre­ciable segment of the Sunni population.68 These individuals felt that it was not so much Arab nationalism, but the personal political ambitions of the universally disliked Iraqi regent, Prince Abd al-Illah, that determined Iraqs quest for union and its negotiating position and tactics in the talks. Most consequentially, antagonism to unity with Iraq was prevalent among the ranks of the Syrian army. The Syrian of.cers were determined not to be hoodwinked into a union with monarchical Iraq, and were adamant about pre­serving the independence of Syrias institutions.69 Distrustful of their governments motivations and wary about Hashemite inten­tions, the Syrian army decided to make its move before the talks came to fruition. On December 19, the army executed a successful coup and immediately severed talks with the Iraqis. While the mili­tary coup was not necessarily an anti-qawmi move, it nevertheless exhibited an increasing sense of Syrian wataniya, a tendency to measure the ef.cacy of unity initiatives in light of their costs and bene.ts to Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种对政府意图的警惕在 1949 年底为叙利亚-伊拉克联邦发起的一项倡议中显而易见。10 月，传统上与伊拉克人关系密切的叙利亚执政人民党高层成员与巴格达就两国之间建立某种形式的联盟展开了谈判。当叙利亚人寻求一个松散的联邦来维持他们的共和政治秩序时，伊拉克人则寻求一个更有机的联盟。他们授权中央集权的联邦领导层、共同的外交使团、金融和货币一体化，以及两军在统一指挥下的合并。67 认为它本质上是一个联盟，不仅可以增强哈希姆派伊拉克的地区力量，还可以增强其大国盟友英国的地区力量，因此该倡议受到阿拉伯世界政府和民众的冷淡欢迎。即使在伊拉克，反对声音也很普遍，不仅来自通常的嫌疑人，在这种情况下是阿拉伯团结倡议的传统反对者库尔德人和什叶派，而且还来自逊尼派人口中的相当一部分人。68 这些人认为，与其说是阿拉伯民族主义，不如说是普遍不喜欢的伊拉克摄政王的个人政治野心， 阿卜杜勒·伊拉赫亲王，决定了伊拉克寻求联盟及其在谈判中的谈判立场和策略。最重要的是，叙利亚军队中普遍存在对与伊拉克统一的敌意。叙利亚人决心不被蒙蔽，与君主制的伊拉克结成联盟，并坚持维护叙利亚机构的独立性。69 叙利亚军队不信任政府的动机，对哈希姆人的意图保持警惕，决定在谈判取得成果之前采取行动。12月19日，军队发动政变成功，并立即切断了与伊拉克人的谈判。虽然军事政变不一定是反卡米的举动，但它仍然表现出叙利亚日益增长的瓦塔尼亚意识，一种根据团结倡议的成本和对叙利亚的bene.ts来衡量团结倡议效果的倾向。

content_units.text: Abd al-Razzak al-Hasani, Tarikh al-Wizarat al-Iraqiya, al-Jusi al-Thamin (The his­tory of Iraqi cabinets, vol. 8) (Baghdad: Dar al-Shuun al-Thaqi.ya al-Ama, 1988), pp. 36 38.

The best account of these negotiations and the goals and political maneuvers of King Abdullah is Avi Shlaim, Collusion across the Jordan: King Abdullah, the Zionist Move­ment, and the Partition of Palestine (Oxford, England: Clarendon Press, 1988).
Ismail Ahmad Yaghi, Al-Ilaqat al-Iraqiya al-Urdiniya, 19411958 (Iraqi-Jordanian relations, 19411958) (Cairo: Dar al-Sahwa, 1988), p. 28.

Of all the Arab countries, the one that shifted inward the most was Egypt. In the wake of the debacle of the Palestinian war, there was a renewed af.rmation of Egyptian wataniya. Some went so far as to call for Egypts withdrawal from the Arab League so the coun­ try could focus on its own affairs following the example of Mustafa Kemal Attaturk in Turkey after World War I.70 And when a half-baked Syrian plan for Arab uni.cation was presented to the Arab League in 1951, a prominent Egyptian journalist, recalling the Arab disaster in Palestine, quipped contemptuously that the Arabs resembled a man who had failed to cultivate one half feddan
content_units.azure_translation: 在所有阿拉伯国家中，向内转移最多的是埃及。巴勒斯坦战争失败后，埃及的瓦塔尼亚重新出现了影响。有些人甚至呼吁埃及退出阿拉伯联盟，以便该国可以效仿第一次世界大战后土耳其的穆斯塔法·凯末尔·阿塔图尔克（Mustafa Kemal Attaturk）的榜样，专注于自己的事务。70 1951年，当叙利亚向阿拉伯联盟提交一份半生不熟的阿拉伯统一计划时，一位著名的埃及记者， 回忆起阿拉伯在巴勒斯坦的灾难，轻蔑地打趣说，阿拉伯人就像一个没有培养一半费丹的人

content_units.text: Khadduri, The Scheme of Fertile Crescent Unity, p. 162.
Ahmad Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasba wa Thimar Mura (Harvest: fertile years and bitter fruit) (Beirut: Bisan li al-Nashr wa al-Tawzi, 1994), p. 154.

Khalid al-Azm, Mudhakirat Khalid al-Azm, al-Mujalad al-Thani (The memoirs of Khalid al-Azm, second volume) (Beirut: al-Dar al-Muttahida li al-Nashr, 1972), p. 220; see also Mufti, Sovereign Creations,p.53.

(0.519 acres), and now they impose on him the cultivation of one thousand feddans.71 The response of the Egyptian army was per­haps the most revealing. Its attention was turned fully toward Egypt. It saw the defeat in Palestine as proof of the corruption and incompetence of the monarchical regime and of the debilitating impact British imperialism had on Egyptian society and politics. The armys mission therefore was to cleanse Egypt from these twin evils. There was little effort to see Egypt as part of a more general imperialist phenomenon that at that time was af.icting the entire Arab world. The armys concern was focused exclusively on Egypt,72 and ironically the war in Palestine had to bear at least a measure of the blame for turning Egyptian minds away from the Arab nation.
content_units.azure_translation: （0.519 英亩），现在他们强加给他耕种一千个费丹。71 埃及军队的反应也许是最能说明问题的。它的注意力完全转向埃及。它认为巴勒斯坦的失败证明了君主政权的腐败和无能，以及英帝国主义对埃及社会和政治的破坏性影响。因此，军队的任务是清除埃及的这双重罪恶。几乎没有努力将埃及视为当时影响整个阿拉伯世界的更普遍的帝国主义现象的一部分。军队的担忧完全集中在埃及，72 具有讽刺意味的是，巴勒斯坦战争至少要承担一定程度的责任，因为埃及人的思想远离了阿拉伯国家。

content_units.text: Historical ironies, however, are the staple of human develop­ment. Despite its negative impact on Arab nationalism in the short term, the war in Palestine ended up being a major catalyst for the dramatic resurgence of Arab nationalism in the 1950s. Like so many other events in history, it was the unintended consequences of the war that contributed to the surge in Arabist sentiment less than a decade later. And it happened in Egypt, the least hospitable land to the ideas of Arab nationalism and organic Arab unity. Three years after the armys humiliation in Palestine, embittered young of.cers, blaming the Palestine debacle and the corruption in their own country on their government, executed a military coup that toppled the monarchical regime. The of.cers were led by a young and quiet, yet charismatic, colonel by the name of Gamal Abd al-Nasir. More than any other political .gure or institution, Colonel, and later, President Nasir and his policies would be inexo­rably linked to the rise of Arab nationalism as the dominant ideol­ogy in the area.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，历史讽刺是人类发展的主要内容。尽管巴勒斯坦战争在短期内对阿拉伯民族主义产生了负面影响，但最终成为 1950 年代阿拉伯民族主义急剧复兴的主要催化剂。与历史上的许多其他事件一样，正是战争的意外后果导致了不到十年后阿拉伯主义情绪的高涨。它发生在埃及，这是阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯有机团结思想最不友好的土地。在巴勒斯坦军队遭受羞辱三年后，愤恨的年轻人将巴勒斯坦的崩溃和自己国家的腐败归咎于他们的政府，发动了一场军事政变，推翻了君主政权。这些上校由一位年轻、安静但富有魅力的上校领导，名叫贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔。纳西尔总统和后来的纳西尔总统及其政策比任何其他政治制度或机构都更能与阿拉伯民族主义作为该地区主导意识形态的兴起密不可挡地联系在一起。

content_units.text: Anwar C. Chejne, Egyptian Attitudes Toward Pan-Arabism, Middle East Journal, vol. 11, no. 3, Summer 1957: 259261.
Ibid., p. 262.

Ahmad Hamroush, Fikrat al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya . Thawrat Yuliyu, (Arab nation­alist thought in the July revolution) in Misr wa al-Uruba wa Thwrat Yuliyu (Egypt, Arabism and the July revolution), eds. Saad al-Din Ibrahim, et al. (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1983), pp. 8384.

title: CONSOLIDATING ARAB NATIONALISM: THE EMERGENCE OF ARAB EGYPT

content_units.text: When Gamal Abd al-Nasir returned to Egypt after the .asco of Palestine, his .rst thoughts were not on Arab national­ism; they were focused instead on Egypton the corruption of its political and social order, and on the continued dominance of the British in its political life. Indeed, this paramount concern with Egypts domestic affairs was prevalent in Nasirs thoughts even as he was executing his Arab nationalist duty in Palestine. We were .ghting in Palestine, Nasir would later reminisce, but our dreams were in Egypt. Our bullets were directed at the enemy lurk­ing in the trenches in front of us, but our hearts were hovering round our distant mother country, which was a prey to the wolves that ravaged it.... We spoke of nothing but our country and how to deliver it.1 At one time, when Nasir and his unit were trapped by the Israelis, he saw this predicament as a metaphor for Egypts own entrapment: What is happening to us here is a picture in miniature of what is happening in Egypt.2 Nasir was disgusted with the incompetence of the Egyptian High Command, and sick­ened by the corruption of governmental departments responsible for supplying weapons which were frequently more dangerous to the user than to the enemy.3 Such ideas were hardly unique to Nasir; they were on the minds of many of the Egyptian army of.­cers, who returned to Egypt defeated and humiliated, echoing in their hearts the exhortation of one of their fallen comrades to re­member that the real battle [was] in Egypt.4
content_units.azure_translation: 当贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔在巴勒斯坦战争后返回埃及时，他最初的想法不是阿拉伯民族主义;相反，他们关注的是埃及政治和社会秩序的腐败，以及英国在其政治生活中的持续统治。事实上，这种对埃及内政的首要关注在纳西尔的思想中普遍存在，即使他在巴勒斯坦履行阿拉伯民族主义职责。纳西尔后来回忆说，我们在巴勒斯坦生活，但我们的梦想是在埃及。我们的子弹对准了潜伏在我们面前战壕中的敌人，但我们的心却在遥远的祖国周围盘旋，它是蹂躏它的狼的猎物......我们只谈到了我们的国家以及如何实现它。1 有一次，当纳西尔和他的部队被以色列人困住时，他将这种困境视为埃及自己被困的隐喻：在这里发生在我们身上的事情是埃及正在发生的事情的缩影。2 纳西尔对埃及最高统帅部的无能感到厌恶，并对负责提供武器的政府部门的腐败感到厌恶，这些武器对使用者来说往往比对敌人更危险。3 这种想法并不是纳西尔独有的;许多埃及军队都想着他们，他们带着失败和羞辱回到埃及，在他们心中回应着他们一个阵亡战友的劝告，记住真正的战斗是在埃及。4

content_units.text: Quoted in Patrick Seale, The Struggle for Syria: A Study of Post-War Arab Politics, 19451958 (New Haven, Connecticut: Yale University Press, 1986), p. 192.
Joachim Joesten, Nasser: the Rise to Power (Westport, Connecticut: Greenwood Press Publishers, 1974), p. 81; also Jean Lacouture, Nasser: A Biography (New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1973), pp. 6466.

Nasir, then, was .rst and foremost an Egyptian patriot. When he fretted over the areas social and political ills, he thought essen­tially of Egypt. When he searched for ways of deliverance from British imperialism, his concern was directed primarily at Egypt, even though other Arab countries suffered the same fate. If other Arabs came to mind, it was only in ways to help bring about Egypts salvation.5 One reason for pushing the Arab dimension to the margins of his concerns was the practical consideration that Egypt, with all of its internal problems, could ill-afford to be mired into the turbulence of Arab politics. But there was also another, perhaps more fundamental reason: Nasir was simply echoing the dominant political sentiments of his countrymen. It is true, as we have seen, that the Arab ideological trend had gathered momentum in Egypt, especially after the 19361939 Arab revolt in Palestine; it is equally true, however, that Arab nationalism did not achieve ideological primacy in Egypt. Egyptian, rather than Arab, national­ism continued to be the dominant ideology. Its roots dug so deep into the Egyptian soul that even by the end of the 1950s, the decade that witnessed the greatest triumphs of Arab nationalism under Egypts own leadership, observers would note Egyptian indiffer­ence to the Arab identity. The Syrian Salah al-Din Bitar, who along with Michel A.aq, founded the Arab nationalist Bath Party, and who became a member of the .rst cabinet of the United Arab Re­ public (UAR), which was formed in 1958 through the organic union of Egypt and Syria under Nasirs leadership, stated categori­cally that Nasirs conversion to Arab nationalism only began around 19531954, adding that the Arab idea never went very deep in Egypt.6 Even if Bitars evaluation could be dismissed as an invective by a disillusioned Syrian (which he certainly became by the last years of the union), then the words of Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, Nasirs con.dant and the most in.uential Egyptian jour­nalist of the Nasirist era, are less easy to dismiss. Re.ecting on the eventual failure of the UAR, Haykal wrote candidly:
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，纳西尔首先是一位埃及爱国者。当他为该地区的社会和政治弊病而烦恼时，他基本上想到了埃及。当他寻找从英帝国主义手中解脱出来的方法时，他的关注主要集中在埃及，尽管其他阿拉伯国家也遭受了同样的命运。如果想到其他阿拉伯人，那只是为了帮助埃及实现救赎。5 将阿拉伯层面推到他关注的边缘的一个原因是实际考虑，即埃及及其所有内部问题，无法承受陷入阿拉伯政治动荡的泥潭。但还有另一个也许更根本的原因：纳西尔只是在呼应他的同胞的主导政治情绪。正如我们所看到的，阿拉伯意识形态趋势确实在埃及蓄势待发，特别是在19361939年阿拉伯人在巴勒斯坦起义之后。然而，阿拉伯民族主义在埃及并没有在意识形态上占据主导地位，这同样是事实。埃及民族主义而不是阿拉伯民族主义仍然是主导意识形态。它的根深深植根于埃及人的灵魂中，以至于即使在 1950 年代末，也就是见证了阿拉伯民族主义在埃及自己领导下取得最大胜利的十年，观察家们也会注意到埃及对阿拉伯身份的漠不关心。叙利亚人萨拉赫·丁·比塔尔（Salah al-Din Bitar）与米歇尔·A.aq（Michel ）一起创立了阿拉伯民族主义巴斯党，并成为阿拉伯联合共和国（UAR）第一内阁的成员，该内阁于1958年在纳西尔的领导下通过埃及和叙利亚的有机联盟成立，他明确表示，纳西尔人向阿拉伯民族主义的皈依是在19531954年左右才开始的， 并补充说，阿拉伯的想法从未在埃及深入。6 即使比塔尔的评价可以被幻灭的叙利亚人视为谩骂（在联盟的最后几年他肯定变成了这种谩骂），那么纳西尔党人、纳西尔时代最无耻的埃及记者穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔的话就不容易被驳回了。在谈到 UAR 的最终失败时，海卡尔坦率地写道：

content_units.text: Anthony Nutting, Nasser (London: Constable, 1972), p. 28.
Peter Mans.eld, Nassers Egypt (Harmondsworth, Surrey: Penguin Books, 1965), p. 39.
Robert Stephens, Nasser: A Political Biography (New York: Simon and Schuster, 1971), pp. 8587.

In Egypt, the Arab people had not reached the stage of complete mental readiness for Arab unity. The centuries of Ottoman tyranny had isolated the Arab people to the west of the Sinai (Egypt and North Africa) from the remaining Arab people to the east of the Sinai (the Fertile Crescent and the Arabian Peninsula). After the awakening which occurred during Napoleons rule, Egypt, over­whelmed by this awakening was unable to shift its attention from its own soil so that it can look across the Sinai and discover its Arab position.7
content_units.azure_translation: 在埃及，阿拉伯人民还没有达到对阿拉伯统一的完全心理准备阶段。几个世纪以来，奥斯曼帝国的暴政将西奈半岛以西（埃及和北非）的阿拉伯人民与西奈半岛以东（新月沃土和阿拉伯半岛）的剩余阿拉伯人民隔离开来。在拿破仑统治期间发生的觉醒之后，埃及被这种觉醒所淹没，无法将注意力从自己的土地上转移开，从而可以眺望西奈半岛并发现其阿拉伯地位。

content_units.text: The Egyptians concerted, at times even obsessive, focus on their country was made even more intense by the visible presence of the British in their beloved Egypt. The 1936 Anglo-Egyptian Treaty had stipulated the maintenance of a British military garrison in the Canal Zone to ensure the security of British imperial communica­tions.8 By 1951, the number of British troops had reached 75,000.9 Their military presence was felt in the major urban centers as well, particularly during the World War II years. Indeed, not until 1946 would the British evacuate the most visible historical monument in Cairo dominating the citys skyline, the Great Citadel of Salah al­ ed., (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press,1991), p. 293.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及人齐心协力，有时甚至是痴迷，对自己国家的关注因英国人在他们心爱的埃及的明显存在而变得更加强烈。1936 年的《英埃条约》规定在运河区维持英国军事驻军，以确保英国帝国通讯的安全。8 到 1951 年，英国军队的人数已达到 75,000 人。9 在主要城市中心也感受到了他们的军事存在，特别是在第二次世界大战期间。事实上，直到 1946 年，英国人才撤离开罗最引人注目的主宰城市天际线的历史古迹——萨拉赫大城堡，（巴尔的摩：约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1991 年），第 293 页。

Which Egyptian could forget the humiliating events of February 1941, when the British ambassador surrounded the Royal Palace with British tanks and forced King Farouk to appoint the pro-British Nahas Pasha as prime minister?

content_units.text: To be an Egyptian patriot then was to struggle to cleanse Egypt of the British presence and to safeguard Egypts territorial integrity. It was to achieve these two goals that the army rose against the monarchy in July 1952. The leader of the coup was General Mu­hamed Neguib, but real power rested with an eleven-man commit­tee of junior of.cers, whose acknowledged leader was Colonel Abd al-Nasir. They set out immediately to reform (and eventually transform) Egypts political and economic systems. In this initial period of the revolution, they showed no interest in Arab affairs. But they did have one extraterritorial goal, namely uniting Egypt with its southern neighbor, Sudan. To Arab nationalists, this might have quali.ed as a concern that went beyond the declared paro­chial interests of Egypts new rulers. But to the Egyptians, the inte­gration of Egypt and Sudan was a domestic issue, conceived lo­cally as the unity of the Nile valley.
content_units.azure_translation: 当时，成为埃及爱国者就是要努力清除埃及的英国存在并维护埃及的领土完整。正是为了实现这两个目标，军队于 1952 年 7 月起义反对君主制。政变的领导人是穆罕默德·内吉布将军，但真正的权力掌握在一个由 11 人组成的初级委员会手中，该委员会公认的领导人是阿卜杜勒·纳西尔上校。他们立即着手改革（并最终改造）埃及的政治和经济体系。在革命的最初时期，他们对阿拉伯事务没有表现出兴趣。但他们确实有一个治外法权目标，即将埃及与其南部邻国苏丹统一起来。对于阿拉伯民族主义者来说，这可能是一种超越埃及新统治者所宣称的狭隘利益的担忧。但对埃及人来说，埃及和苏丹的融合是一个国内问题，在当地被认为是尼罗河谷的统一。

content_units.text: Sudan had been of.cially regarded as an indivisible part of Egypt since the early nineteenth century. However, real control of the ter­ritory passed on to Britain after the latters occupation of Egypt in 1882. British political paramountcy in Sudan was later legitimized through the 1899 accord with Egypt, in which the Egyptians recog­nized Britains suzerainty over Sudan. With Britain showing signs of .exibility over the Sudanese issue, Nasir and the new junta set out to in.uence Sudanese public opinion. Large sums of money were spent and intense propaganda used to reorient Sudanese per­ceptions northward toward Egypt. All this effort, however, was to no avail. The Sudanese seemed as hostile to the possibility of Egyp­tian domination as they were to existing British control. And in­deed, they were eventually to opt for complete independence, which to Nasir represented a great personal tragedy.11 With very limited options, the Egyptians accepted the Sudanese decision. Like earlier efforts in the Fertile Crescent, this endeavor to unite two Arabic-speaking countries came to a disappointing end.
content_units.azure_translation: 自 19 世纪初以来，苏丹一直被视为埃及不可分割的一部分。然而，在 1882 年英国占领埃及后，对这片领土的真正控制权移交给了英国。英国在苏丹的政治至高无上地位后来通过 1899 年与埃及的协议合法化，埃及人承认英国对苏丹的宗主权。随着英国在苏丹问题上表现出宽容的迹象，纳西尔和新军政府开始控制苏丹公众舆论。花费了大量资金和激烈的宣传，将苏丹人的看法重新转向了埃及。然而，所有这些努力都无济于事。苏丹人似乎对埃及统治的可能性和对现有英国控制的敌意一样敌视。事实上，他们最终选择了完全独立，这对纳西尔来说代表着一场巨大的个人悲剧。11 埃及人接受了苏丹的决定，但选择非常有限。与早期在新月沃土的努力一样，联合两个阿拉伯语国家的努力也以令人失望的方式结束。

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 581.

With the collapse of the Sudanese initiative, Nasir and his com­rades refocused their energies on ridding Egypt of British political in.uence and military presence. This translated into a vehement campaign against Britain and its Western allies. And it was in this essentially anti-imperialist stance that Arab nationalism found its most vibrant voice. One is almost tempted to say that Nasir slid into Arab nationalism through the back door of anti-imperialism. Nasir had not seriously thought of Arab nationalism as an autono­mous category in the way Sati al-Husri conceived of it. When he thought of it, it was primarily as a means to achieve some other goal or value, and in that period, the primary goal and paramount value was the struggle against British and Western imperialist poli­cies. Re.ecting on his experience in the Palestine war, Nasir wrote that not only Egypt, but the whole region was the object of imperi­alist designs, and in that case, it made great sense to him that the region should have at a minimum a unity of effort and purpose to .ght the imperialist enemies collectively.12 So when in 1953 the idea of a Western alliance threatened to isolate Egypt, Nasir began to shift the ideological and political attention of his political order from Egypt to the wider Arab world. And when he did, he found a ready and receptive audience among the peoples of the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着苏丹倡议的失败，纳西尔和他的同志们重新将精力集中在摆脱埃及的英国政治和军事存在上。这转化为针对英国及其西方盟友的激烈运动。正是在这种本质上反帝国主义的立场中，阿拉伯民族主义找到了最有活力的声音。人们几乎很想说，纳西尔是通过反帝国主义的后门滑入阿拉伯民族主义的。纳西尔并没有认真考虑过阿拉伯民族主义作为萨蒂·胡斯里所设想的自治类别。当他想到它时，它主要是作为实现其他目标或价值的一种手段，而在那个时期，首要目标和最高价值是与英国和西方帝国主义政策的斗争。纳西尔在叙述他在巴勒斯坦战争中的经历时写道，不仅埃及，而且整个地区都是帝国主义阴谋的对象，在这种情况下，对他来说，该地区至少应该有统一的努力和目标，以集体打击帝国主义敌人，这是非常有意义的。12 因此，当 1953 年西方联盟的想法威胁到孤立埃及时， 纳西尔开始将他的政治秩序的意识形态和政治注意力从埃及转移到更广泛的阿拉伯世界。当他这样做时，他在阿拉伯世界人民中找到了一群随时准备并乐于接受的听众。

content_units.text: The Arab world was undergoing major demographic and social changes, some of which were occurring at a bewildering speed. Rapid population growth, changes to traditional economic rela­tions, accelerated migrations from rural to urban areas, and the spread of modern public education had produced a social and intel­lectual milieu that was ready for revolutionary picking. The most consequential of these changes occurred in education. In Egypt, stu­dents in secondary schools increased from 15,000 in 1933 to 41,000 in 1951.13 As late as 19391940, there were only 4,000 pupils in seven Syrian state secondary schools; by 19551956, Syria could boast 258 state secondary schools with an enrollment of 60,000 pupils.14 In Iraq, only 200 students received a secondary education in 1920, yet by 1958, there were 74,000 students in secondary schools.15 In this, the educational bene.ts were not con.ned to the politically dominant Sunni population; they accrued to the Shiites as well.16 This was re.ected in the expansion of higher education, where in 1951, 1,091 students received degrees from nine different colleges.17 True, even these dramatic improvements constituted no more than between 25 and 35 percent of all school-age children, nevertheless, they contributed signi.cantly to the expansion of a literate and politically aware middle class, which actively assumed a leadership role in the propagation of radical nationalism. As we shall see, much of the political turbulence that characterized the 1950s was fomented by countless street demonstrations and riots begun by student populations, and supported, in many cases vigor­ously, by other sectors of the middle class, particularly and most consequentially the of.cer corps of the armed forces. Of course, the process of social change, including the expansion in education, had started in the interwar years, but its consequencessocial tension, political restlessness, and a broader awareness that challenged tradi­tional political ideas and practicespeaked in the 1950s.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯世界正在经历重大的人口和社会变化，其中一些变化正在以令人眼花缭乱的速度发生。人口的快速增长、传统经济关系的变化、从农村地区向城市地区的加速迁移以及现代公共教育的普及，产生了一种可供革命性挑选的社会和知识环境。这些变化中最重要的发生在教育领域。在埃及，中学学生从1933年的15 000人增加到1951年的41 000人。直到19391940年，叙利亚七所公立中学只有4 000名学生;到19551956年，叙利亚可以拥有258所公立中学，招收60,000名学生。14 在伊拉克，1920年只有200名学生接受中等教育，但到1958年，中学学生有74,000人。15 在这方面，教育bene.ts并没有受到政治上占主导地位的逊尼派人口的依赖;什叶派也积累了这些进步。16 这在高等教育的扩张中得到了体现，1951 年，有 1,091 名学生获得了九所不同学院的学位。17 诚然，即使这些显着的进步也只占所有学龄儿童的 25% 到 35%，然而，它们对扩大有文化和政治意识的中产阶级做出了重大贡献， 在传播激进民族主义方面积极发挥领导作用。正如我们将看到的，1950年代的许多政治动荡是由学生群体发起的无数街头示威和骚乱煽动的，并且在许多情况下得到了中产阶级其他部门的大力支持，特别是最重要的是武装部队的of.cer军团。当然，社会变革的过程，包括教育的扩张，始于两次世界大战期间，但其后果社会紧张、政治动荡以及挑战传统政治思想和实践的更广泛意识在1950年代发表。

The students and other members of the middle classthe custo­dians of radical nationalist ideaswere the very people who would become Nasirs nationalist generation, his foot soldiers, ever ready to do his bidding, all in the service of Arab nationalism. Like their hero, however, the primary focus of their rebelliousness in the early part of the 1950s was imperialism18the maddening spectacle of foreign troops and personnel on their soil,19 the fear of continuing colonialist and imperialist hegemony over the area, the perception that many of the indigenous leadership were but puppets in the hands of exploitative foreigners, and the unshakeable belief that Israel was the illegitimate offspring of per.dious imperialist con­spiracies against the Arab world. This almost axiomatic belief in the essential ill will of the West was of course given an added edge by the increasing rigidity of the Cold War. What the West thought of as a security arrangement, educated and politically aware Arabs would interpret as a Western conspiracy. For Nasir, British presence on Egyptian soil made it unthinkable for Egypt to enter into security arrangements with the West. But Egypt could not resist Western pressure on its own. To mount an offensive against Western alli­ances, Egypt would need to tap the burgeoning Arab anti-imperial­ist revolutionary potential. And to do that effectively, Nasir knew that he had to reorient Egypt toward the Arab nationalist path.
content_units.azure_translation: 学生和其他中产阶级成员激进民族主义思想的守护者正是后来成为纳西尔民族主义一代的人，他的步兵，随时准备听从他的命令，所有这些都为阿拉伯民族主义服务。然而，就像他们的英雄一样，他们在 1950 年代初期叛逆的主要焦点是帝国主义 18 外国军队和人员在他们的领土上令人抓狂的景象，19 对殖民主义和帝国主义继续霸权的恐惧，认为许多土著领导人只是剥削外国人手中的傀儡， 以及不可动摇的信念，即以色列是帝国主义反对阿拉伯世界的阴谋的非法后代。这种对西方本质恶意的近乎公理化的信念当然因冷战的日益僵化而增加了优势。西方认为的一种安全安排，受过教育和有政治意识的阿拉伯人会将其解释为西方的阴谋。对纳西尔来说，英国在埃及领土上的存在使埃及与西方达成安全安排变得不可想象。但埃及无法独自抗拒西方的压力。为了对西方联盟发动攻势，埃及需要挖掘阿拉伯人蓬勃发展的反帝国主义革命潜力。为了有效地做到这一点，纳西尔知道他必须将埃及重新定位为阿拉伯民族主义道路。

John Foster Dulles, the U. S. secretary of state, brought the idea of a defense alliance against Soviet ambitions in the region to Cairo in May 1953. But the Americans goals contrasted sharply with those of the Egyptians. Nasir and the other members of the military junta were not in the least concerned about threats from the Soviet Union, which, as Nasir reminded Dulles, was .ve thousand miles away.20 Rather, they tried to impress on Dulles that it was the British occupation of the Suez Canal that in their calculation represented the main threat not just to Egypts stability, but also to the legitimacy and possible survival of the countrys military lead­ers. When Dulles left Cairo, he took with him what was at best a lukewarm Egyptian response to his initiative.
content_units.azure_translation: 1953 年 5 月，美国国务卿约翰·福斯特·杜勒斯 （John Foster Dulles） 将建立防御联盟的想法带到了开罗，以对抗苏联在该地区的野心。但美国人的进球与埃及人的进球形成鲜明对比。纳西尔和军政府的其他成员丝毫不担心来自苏联的威胁，正如纳西尔提醒杜勒斯的那样，苏联距离苏联只有两千英里。20 相反，他们试图给杜勒斯留下深刻的印象，在他们的计算中，英国对苏伊士运河的占领不仅对埃及的稳定，而且对该国军事领导人的合法性和可能的生存构成主要威胁。当杜勒斯离开开罗时，他带走了埃及对他的倡议充其量不冷不热的反应。

In the early 1950s, all of North Africa, Sudan, the Gulf, and South Yemen were colonial possessions; and British troops were stationed in Egypt and Iraq. Only Saudi Arabia, North Yemen, Syria, Lebanon, and Jordan were free of foreign presence, even though the com­mander of the Jordanian armed forces was British.
Nasirs interview with The Sunday Times (London), June 24, 1962.

The Egyptians, however, knew that this would not be the end of the affair. They believed that other states in the region, particularly Iraq, Jordan, and Lebanon, would more than likely join such an alliance, and if they did, Syria would be encircled and perhaps pres­sured into joining as well. This inevitably would lead to the politi­cal and strategic isolation of Egypt from the region. It was obvious to Egypts leadership that rebuf.ng Dulles was not enough; Arab states had to be actively discouraged from entering into such alli­ances. Not surprisingly, an Egyptian campaign to galvanize the citi­zens of other Arab states against Western alliances had to tap the most readily acceptable bond that drew Egyptians and the other Arabs together, that of Arab nationalismthe notion that, politi­cally divided as they were, the Arabs still constituted one indivisible nation, and thus in the words of Egypts radio station Voice of the Arabs, what impacted one part of this nation would by de.­nition impact the other parts.21 If Arab governments were to com­plain that Nasir and the Egyptian leaders were interfering in their countries internal affairs, the bonds of Arab nationalism and membership of the Arab nation would be invoked by the Egyp­tian leaders to justify their policies.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，埃及人知道这不会是这件事的结束。他们认为，该地区的其他国家，特别是伊拉克、约旦和黎巴嫩，很可能会加入这样的联盟，如果他们加入，叙利亚将被包围，甚至可能被迫加入。这将不可避免地导致埃及在政治和战略上与该地区的孤立。埃及领导层显然认为，rebuf.ng 杜勒斯是不够的;必须积极阻止阿拉伯国家结成这种联盟。毫不奇怪，埃及激发其他阿拉伯国家公民反对西方联盟的运动必须利用将埃及人和其他阿拉伯人联系在一起的最容易接受的纽带，即阿拉伯民族主义的观念，即阿拉伯人尽管在政治上分裂，但仍然构成一个不可分割的国家，因此用埃及广播电台阿拉伯人之声的话来说，影响这个国家一部分的东西将最终影响其他部分。21 如果阿拉伯政府抱怨纳西尔和埃及领导人干涉其国内政，埃及领导人就会援引阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯民族成员身份的纽带来为他们的政策辩护。

content_units.text: The phenomenal speed with which Arab nationalism became the predominant radical, on the whole anti-Western, ideology in the region in the 1950s resulted in large measure from Egypts on­slaught against Western alliances. And Egypts undoubted success was aided substantially by two factors: the countrys own capabili­ties, and Nasirs committed leadership and single-minded pursuit of his goals.
content_units.azure_translation: 1950年代，阿拉伯民族主义以惊人的速度成为该地区占主导地位的激进、总体上反西方的意识形态，这在很大程度上导致了埃及对西方联盟的猛攻。毫无疑问，埃及的成功很大程度上得益于两个因素：国家自身的能力，以及纳西尔致力于领导和一心一意地追求他的目标。

content_units.text: Egypt was endowed by nature to be the most important Arab state. Geographically, it constituted a bridge between the eastern and western parts of the Arab world, and unlike other Arab states whose legal status rested on arti.cial boundaries drawn up by old colonial powers, Egypt had been a distinct geographical unit for over four thousand years. Egypt also had the largest population of

In 1958, it constituted 35 percent of the total population of all Arab states.22 Due to the post-Napoleonic renais­sance in Egypt, which opened the country and its population to Western civilization a full century before the rest of the Arab world, Egypt enjoyed a pronounced cultural and intellectual preeminence in the region (see the above table). In 1947, for example, Cairo boasted fourteen daily newspapers and twenty-three weeklies, a number of which were distributed in other Arab countries. Egypt was the only Arab country with a viable .lm industry, and Egyptian movies in the 1940s and 1950s competed vigorously with their Western counterparts in Arab movie theaters. Kemal al-Shenawy was as beloved a heartthrob as Clark Gable or Tyrone Power; Is­mail Yassin was a bigger comedic name than Bob Hope or Danny Kaye, and Fatin Hamama and Layla Murad were far more popular leading ladies than Vivien Leigh or Doris Day. In song and music, Egypt had no rival. Egyptian singers and musicians were household names throughout the region, the most beloved and revered of whom was the majestic Umm Kulthum, an Arab icon, whose leg­endary .ve-hour concerts on the .rst Thursday of the month gath­ered people around their radio sets in Baghdad, Damascus, Casa­blanca, Amman, and other cities throughout the Arab world. Umm Kulthum reigned supreme, the unrivaled queen of Arab song, tran­scending inter-Arab con.icts, until her death on February 3, 1975.
content_units.azure_translation: 所有阿拉伯国家。1958 年，埃及占所有阿拉伯国家总人口的 35%。22 由于埃及的拿破仑后文艺复兴，使该国及其人口比阿拉伯世界其他地区早了整整一个世纪，向西方文明开放，埃及在该地区享有显着的文化和知识优势（见上表）。例如，1947年，开罗拥有14份日报和23份周刊，其中许多在其他阿拉伯国家发行。埃及是唯一拥有可行的 .lm 产业的阿拉伯国家，1940 年代和 1950 年代的埃及电影在阿拉伯电影院与西方电影展开了激烈的竞争。凯末尔·谢纳维 （Kemal al-Shenawy） 与克拉克·盖博 （Clark Gable） 或泰隆·鲍尔 （Tyrone Power） 一样深受喜爱;伊斯梅尔·亚辛 （Ismail Yassin） 是一个比鲍勃·霍普 （Bob Hope） 或丹尼·凯 （Danny Kaye） 更大的喜剧名字，而法廷·哈马马 （Fatin Hamama） 和莱拉·穆拉德 （Layla Murad） 是比费雯·丽 （Vivien Leigh） 或多丽丝·戴 （Doris Day） 更受欢迎的女主角。在歌曲和音乐方面，埃及没有对手。埃及歌手和音乐家是整个地区家喻户晓的名字，其中最受喜爱和尊敬的是雄伟的阿拉伯偶像乌姆·库尔苏姆（Umm Kulthum），他在每月的第一个星期四举行了传奇的每小时音乐会，人们聚集在巴格达、大马士革、卡萨布兰卡、安曼和整个阿拉伯世界其他城市的收音机周围。乌姆·库尔苏姆 （Umm Kulthum） 是阿拉伯歌曲中无与伦比的女王，超越了阿拉伯之间的争论，直到 1975 年 2 月 3 日去世。

content_units.text: A. I. Dawisha, Egypt in the Arab World: The Elements of Foreign Policy (London: Macmillan, 1976), p. 80.

During the two weeks she spent in the hospital before her death, radio stations across the Arab world broadcast periodic bulletins of her condition, and on the news of her death regularly scheduled programs were replaced by Quranic recitals.23 In addition to Umm Kulthum, other Egyptian singers and songwriters, such as Abd al-Halim Ha.z, Nejat al-Saghira, and Muhamed Abd al-Wahab es­tablished renowned reputations and were universally beloved throughout the Arab world. Indeed, non-Egyptian singers, such as the Syrians Farid al-Atrash and Asmahan, the Lebanese Sabah, and the Algerian Warda al-Jazairiya, became household names in the Arab world only after they worked and settled in Egypt.24 These singers, as well as the predominance of Egyptian .lms, made Egyptian the only universal Arabic dialect in the region.
content_units.azure_translation: 在她去世前在医院度过的两周内，阿拉伯世界的广播电台定期播放有关她病情的公告，在她去世的消息传出后，定期安排的节目被古兰经朗诵会所取代。23 除了乌姆·库尔苏姆之外，其他埃及歌手和词曲作者，如阿卜杜勒·哈利姆·哈兹、内贾特·萨吉拉、 穆罕默德·阿卜杜勒·瓦哈卜 （Muhamed Abd al-Wahab） 建立了著名的声誉，并在整个阿拉伯世界受到普遍喜爱。事实上，非埃及歌手，如叙利亚人法里德·阿特拉什和阿斯马汉、黎巴嫩人萨巴赫和阿尔及利亚人瓦尔达·贾扎里亚，只有在埃及工作和定居后才在阿拉伯世界家喻户晓。24 这些歌手，以及埃及 .lms 的主导地位，使埃及语成为该地区唯一通用的阿拉伯方言。

content_units.text: These objective elements of Egypts centrality in the Arab world had, over time, made an imprint on the attitudes of the other Arabs. As we have seen, Sati al-Husri, even though a Syrian, whose intel­lectual output occurred primarily in Iraq, nevertheless accepted un­equivocally Egypts centrality in the Arab world, declaring it to be the only possible leader of Arab nationalism.25 And this perception was prevalent in the Arab world. As one Syrian of.cial put it, The Arabs have always considered Egypt as the headquarters of Arab nationalism due to its geographic, social and cultural position.26 Echoing this sentiment, an Iraqi nationalist leader insisted that Egypt was a strong foundation and a vital and sure base for the Arab nation. He added that Iraq could not act as such a base, because Iraq did not possess the capability to assume this posi­ tion. However, it was well within Egypts capability.27 This en­trenched belief in Egypts dominance and centrality meant that other Arabs would be wary of pursuing any project that would not, at a minimum, receive Egypts blessings. For instance, the Syrian Michel A.aq, who founded the Bath Party, conceded that there could be no Arab unity without Egypt because she could and would successfully oppose any movement toward Arab unity which excluded her.28 In the same vein, Egypts threat to withdraw from the Arab League in August 1962 prompted President Fuad Shihab of Lebanon to appeal to Nasir to change his mind on the grounds that the league will have no value if [Egypt] withdrew from it, since Egypt was the Leagues biggest and strongest mem­ber state.29 Most tellingly, was the admission of King Faysal of Saudi Arabia, who at various times had been the linchpin of the anti-Nasirist forces in the region, to Nasir that his father, King Abd al-Aziz, the founder of Saudi Arabia, had given his children one piece of advice: He told us to pay attention to Egypts role, for without Egypt, the Arabs throughout history would have been without value.30 These attitudes point to the .rm belief held by Arabs that Arab nationalism could only .ourish with Egypts ac­tive involvement. The committed nationalist might have believed that an Arab nation, united in thought and action, was a revolu­tionary juggernaut that would sweep aside all doubters and ene­mies in its victorious march toward independence and progress. But the believer also knew that Iraq, Syria, Jordan, or Saudi Arabia could not be the driving engine of this juggernaut; only Egypt could .ll this role.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着时间的推移，埃及在阿拉伯世界中心地位的这些客观因素在其他阿拉伯人的态度上留下了印记。正如我们所看到的，萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri）尽管是叙利亚人，其知识产出主要发生在伊拉克，但他仍然明确地接受了埃及在阿拉伯世界的中心地位，并宣称埃及是阿拉伯民族主义唯一可能的领导者。25 这种看法在阿拉伯世界很普遍。正如一位叙利亚人所说，由于埃及的地理、社会和文化地位，阿拉伯人一直认为埃及是阿拉伯民族主义的总部。26 一位伊拉克民族主义领导人也赞同这种观点，他坚持认为埃及是阿拉伯民族的坚实基础和重要而稳固的基础。他补充说，伊拉克不能充当这样的基地，因为伊拉克没有能力承担这一立场。然而，这完全在埃及的能力范围内。27 这种对埃及统治地位和中心地位的根深蒂固的信念意味着其他阿拉伯人会对追求任何至少不会得到埃及祝福的项目持谨慎态度。例如，巴斯党的创始人叙利亚人米歇尔·A.aq 承认，没有埃及就不可能有阿拉伯统一，因为她可以而且将成功地反对任何将她排除在外的阿拉伯统一运动。28 同样，埃及在 1962 年 8 月威胁要退出阿拉伯联盟，这促使黎巴嫩总统福阿德·希哈布呼吁纳西尔改变主意，理由是如果 [埃及] 退出阿拉伯联盟，该联盟将毫无价值，因为埃及是阿拉伯联盟最大和最强大的成员国。29 最能说明问题的是，沙特阿拉伯国王费萨尔曾多次成为该地区反纳西尔势力的关键人物，他向纳西尔承认，他的父亲、沙特阿拉伯的创始人阿卜杜勒·阿齐兹国王给了他的孩子们一条建议：他告诉我们要注意埃及的作用， 因为如果没有埃及，阿拉伯人在历史上就毫无价值。30 这些态度表明阿拉伯人.rm相信阿拉伯民族主义只有在埃及的积极参与下才能实现。坚定的民族主义者可能会相信，一个思想和行动团结的阿拉伯国家是一个革命的主宰，将在其走向独立和进步的胜利征程中扫除所有怀疑者和敌人。但信徒也知道，伊拉克、叙利亚、约旦或沙特阿拉伯不可能成为这个主宰的驱动引擎;只有埃及才能扮演这个角色。

content_units.text: For an excellent study of the life and times of Umm Kulthum, see Virginia Danielson, The Voice of Egypt: Umm Kulthum, Arabic Song and Egyptian Society in the Twentieth Century (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1997).

Of course, there were a few singers who established an Arab-wide reputation without having to work in Egypt. The Lebanese folksinger Fayrouz comes readily to mind. But she would be the exception rather than the rule.

Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Dawr Misr . al-Nahdha al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya, (Egypts role in Arab nationalist renaissance) in his Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al­Arabiya (Selected studies in Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Ara­biya, 1985), p. 105.
Al Jumhuriya al-Arabiya al-Muttahida, Mahadhir Jalsat Mubahathat al-Wuhda (Pro­ceedings of the meetings on unity discussions) (Cairo: National Printing and Publishing House, 1963), p. 74.

The problem for the nationalists, as we have seen, was that while Egypt possessed the capabilities to lead the Arab nationalist move­ment, its heart was not really in it. And this was true well into the Nasirist era. The high school history curriculum for the academic year 19531954, which was developed under the auspices of the revolutionary regime to replace the existing curriculum taught under the monarchy, had precious few references to the Arab na­tion or to Arab nationalism. It concentrated instead on Egypts stellar role in world historyits inimitable contribution to the building of world civilization, its historically enshrined identity, and its immense achievements which outdistanced all other na­tions (Umam),31 the implication being that Egypt was itself a full-.edged nation. The Liberation Rally, established in 1953 as the unitary political organization of the postmonarchical political sys­tem, said nothing of Arab unity, but merely called for strengthen­ing ties with the Arab peoples.32 It is instructive to note here the pointed reference to the multiple Arab peoples (al-Shuub al-Ara­biya), at the expense of the expression used by Arab nationalists of one Arab people (al-Shaab al-Arabi). While accepting that they had special and long-standing ties with the other Arabs, Nasir and the new Egyptian leaders continued to feel and express the same sense of cultural individualism and national exceptionalism that characterized the attitudes and policies of the ancien regime.
content_units.azure_translation: 正如我们所看到的，民族主义者面临的问题是，虽然埃及有能力领导阿拉伯民族主义运动，但它的核心并不真正在其中。这一直持续到纳西尔主义时代。19531954学年的高中历史课程是在革命政权的支持下开发的，以取代君主制下教授的现有课程，很少提到阿拉伯民族或阿拉伯民族主义。相反，它集中在埃及在世界历史上的杰出作用，它对世界文明建设的无与伦比的贡献，其历史上被奉为神圣的身份，以及它超越所有其他国家（乌玛目）的巨大成就，31 这意味着埃及本身就是一个全面的国家。解放集会成立于 1953 年，是后君主制政治制度的单一政治组织，它只字未提阿拉伯的团结，而只是呼吁加强与阿拉伯人民的联系。32 这里指出，这里尖锐地提到了多个阿拉伯民族（al-Shuub al-Arabiya），而牺牲了阿拉伯民族主义者对一个阿拉伯民族（al-Shaab al-Arabi）的表述，这是有启发性的。纳西尔和埃及新领导人虽然承认他们与其他阿拉伯人有着特殊而长期的联系，但继续感受到并表达了旧政权态度和政策所特有的文化个人主义和民族例外主义意识。

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 37. 28 Quoted in Seale, The Struggle for Syria, p. 311. 29 Al-Ahram (Cairo), September 9, 1962. 30 Al-Ahram (Cairo), January 10, 1970.

Riad Taha, an in.uential Lebanese journalist who was close to Nasir in the 1950s, relates that the discussions which preceded the promulgation of the 1956 Egyptian constitution were replete with references to the Egyptian nation. Taha claims that only after his own personal appeal to Nasir was an article inserted pro­claiming the Egyptian people to be part of the Arab nation. Yet even then, the article was contradicted by other references in the constitution in which the term nation was attached to Egypt.33 These seemingly entrenched Egyptianist attitudes meant that the abundance of capabilities at Egypts disposal to lead the Arab world were balanced with a pronounced lack of will to undertake a leadership rolethat is until Nasir concluded that the most effec­ tive means to combat the Western powers in their effort to isolate Egypt by enlisting Arab countries into anti-Soviet military alliances was to appeal to the Arab people through the shared agency of Arab nationalism. It was then that Nasir decided to subsume Egypts identity within the overall Arab identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 1950年代与纳西尔关系密切的黎巴嫩记者里亚德·塔哈（Riad Taha）说，1956年埃及宪法颁布之前的讨论中充满了对埃及民族的提及。塔哈声称，只有在他自己向纳西尔提出个人呼吁后，才插入了一篇文章，宣布埃及人民是阿拉伯民族的一部分。然而，即便如此，该条款仍与宪法中将“国家”一词附加到埃及的其他提及相矛盾。33 这些看似根深蒂固的埃及主义态度意味着，埃及领导阿拉伯世界的丰富能力与明显缺乏承担领导作用的意愿相平衡，直到纳西尔得出结论，通过招募阿拉伯国家加入反苏军事联盟来对抗西方列强孤立埃及的最有效手段是通过共同的机构来吸引阿拉伯人民阿拉伯民族主义。就在那时，纳西尔决定将埃及的身份纳入整个阿拉伯身份。

content_units.text: Quoted in Eberhard Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revisited: Interest, Identity, and Pol­icy in Syria and Egypt, International Journal of Middle East Studies, vol. 27, no. 1 (Febru­ary 1995): 63.
Ibid.

Riad Taha, Qissat al-Wuhda wa al-In.sal: Tajribat Insan Arabi Khilal Ahdath 1955 1961 (The story of unity and secession: the experience of an Arab person during the events of 19551961) (Beirut: Dar al-Afaq al-Jadida, 1974), pp. 4041.

This dramatic conversion to the cause of Arab nationalism, in which Nasir was to use Egypts extensive capabilities, particularly its unquestionable cultural dominance, was to be transmitted to the rest of the Arab world through the medium of radio. Like no other Egyptian or Arab leader before him, or among his contempo­raries, Nasir recognized the immense power of radio, a power which, as a dazzling orator, he had used vigorously and effectively. From early in the regimes tenure, Nasir devoted considerable .­nancial resources to the expansion of public broadcasting. The Voice of the Arabs started its radio transmissions to the Arab world in July 1953. The timing is instructive. Less than two months earlier, Nasir had rejected the idea of a Western alliance submitted to him by John Foster Dulles, becoming convinced in the process that the U. S. secretary of state would pursue other, possibly more pliant, Arab countries. The creation of the Voice of the Arabs was thus a function of Nasirs utilitarian approach to Arab politics rather than an af.rmation of his ideological commitment to the Arab idea. The transmission time of the new station was increased threefold in January 1954, and it declared unequivocally that the Voice of the Arabs speaks for the Arabs, struggles for them and expresses their unity.34 On another occasion, the Arabs were re­minded that Egypt was in the service of the Arab nation and its struggle against Western imperialism and its lackeys in the Arab world.35 The language should have warned Arab leaders of things to come. The radio station became Nasirs main vehicle in propa­gating his views, which on many occasions contrasted sharply with the views of other Arab leaders. Egypts domestic service, Radio Cairo, was similarly expanded to cover much of the Arab world, and together with the Voice of the Arabs became primary agents of instability in countries such as Iraq, Jordan, and Lebanon.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种对阿拉伯民族主义事业的戏剧性转变，纳西尔将利用埃及的广泛能力，特别是其无可置疑的文化主导地位，通过广播媒介传播到阿拉伯世界其他地区。与他之前或同时代的埃及或阿拉伯领导人不同，纳西尔认识到无线电的巨大力量，作为一位令人眼花缭乱的演说家，他大力而有效地利用了这种力量。从政权执政初期开始，纳西尔就投入了大量财政资源来扩大公共广播。阿拉伯人之声于 1953 年 7 月开始向阿拉伯世界进行无线电传输。时机很有启发性。不到两个月前，纳西尔拒绝了约翰·福斯特·杜勒斯（John Foster Dulles）向他提出的西方联盟的想法，并在此过程中确信美国国务卿将寻求其他可能更顺从的阿拉伯国家。因此，阿拉伯人之声的创建是纳西尔对阿拉伯政治的功利主义态度的功能，而不是他对阿拉伯思想的意识形态承诺的体现。1954 年 1 月，新电台的传输时间增加了三倍，并明确宣布阿拉伯人之声为阿拉伯人说话，为他们奋斗，表达他们的团结。34 在另一个场合，阿拉伯人被提醒，埃及正在为阿拉伯国家服务，并为阿拉伯国家服务，为阿拉伯世界反对西方帝国主义及其走狗的斗争服务。35 这种语言本应警告阿拉伯领导人即将发生的事情。该广播电台成为纳西尔传播其观点的主要工具，这些观点在许多场合与其他阿拉伯领导人的观点形成鲜明对比。埃及的国内服务开罗广播电台也同样扩大到覆盖阿拉伯世界的大部分地区，并与阿拉伯人之声一起成为伊拉克、约旦和黎巴嫩等国家不稳定的主要推动者。

content_units.text: SWB, January 12, 1954, p. 4. 35 SWB, February 8, 1954, p. 5.

The expansion in Egyptian public broadcasting was large and rapid. The daily transmission of the Voice of the Arabs grew from thirty minutes in 1953 to just short of twenty-four hours in the 1960s.36 In the same period, the domestic program, now broad­casting throughout the Arab world, increased its daily transmission from eleven hours to twenty.37 The countrys radio transmission power which stood at 72 kilowatts in 1952 had risen to 1,624 kilowatts ten years later.38 Indeed, in terms of weekly program out­put, Egypt in 1960 ranked as the sixth largest international broad­caster, preceded only by the United States, the Soviet Union, China, West Germany, and Britain.39 Thus, in the course of a few years, Nasir had transformed Egypts broadcasting system into a potent propaganda weapon, whose considerable success, especially in the 1950s, played a major role in projecting and later cementing Egypts and Nasirs leadership of the Arab nationalist movement.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及公共广播的扩张规模庞大且迅速。阿拉伯人之声的每日播放量从 1953 年的 30 分钟增加到 1960 年代的不到 24 小时。36 在同一时期，现在在整个阿拉伯世界广播的国内节目将其每日播放时间从 11 小时增加到 20 小时。37 该国的无线电发射功率在 1952 年为 72 千瓦，十年后上升到 1,624 千瓦。 就每周节目输出而言，埃及在 1960 年排名第六，仅次于美国、苏联、中国、西德和英国。39 因此，在几年的时间里，纳西尔将埃及的广播系统转变为一种强大的宣传武器，其取得了相当大的成功，尤其是在 1950 年代， 在投射和后来巩固埃及和纳西尔人对阿拉伯民族主义运动的领导地位方面发挥了重要作用。

content_units.text: Three factors contributed to this success. The very fact of Egypts cultural hegemony meant that audiences were naturally drawn to the Egyptian radio station. Nothing that the other Arabs would produce in plays, soap opera, comedic programs, and the arts could even remotely match the sophistication of Egyptian pro­gramming. In music, as we have seen, Cairo was supreme, its con­certs unrivaled, its artists legendary. At various times, these artists rendered songs in praise of Nasir and his ideological message. Umm Kulthum was particularly close to Nasir,40 and sang no less than 31 patriotic songs, a number of them extolling Nasir him­self.41 Similarly, the most renowned Arabic male singer/composer,
