Virginia Danielson, Performance, Political Identity and Memory: Umm Kulthum and Gamal Abd al-Nasir, in Sherifa Zuhur, Images of Enchantment: Visual and Performing

Muhamed Abd al-Wahab, sang a hugely popular ode with the re­frain of ya Gamal, ya Gamal (O Gamal, O Gamal). For the of.­cials, it remained a simple matter of inserting political program­ming in the midst of this rich cultural tapestry.
content_units.azure_translation: 穆罕默德·阿卜杜勒·瓦哈卜 （Muhamed Abd al-Wahab） 演唱了一首广受欢迎的颂歌，副歌是 ya Gamal， ya Gamal（O Gamal，O Gamal）。对于 of.cials 来说，在这幅丰富的文化挂毯中插入政治节目仍然是一个简单的事情。

content_units.text: The second reason for Egyptian primacy in radio propaganda was that other Arab countries were too slow to understand the power of the radio. By the time they embarked on upgrading their own transmissions, they were lagging far behind Egypt. So during the crucial years of the 1950s and 1960s, they simply were not able to match Egypts transmission power. Their own services were so rudimentary that they were unable to lure listeners away from Egyptian programming. Moreover, they had virtually no jamming capability. Even Iraq, which in the mid-1950s was Egypts main competitor in the area, did not have suf.cient transmitter power to cover its own country completely with an Arabic service, much less to reach neighboring Arab countries with a reliable signal.42
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及在广播宣传中占据主导地位的第二个原因是其他阿拉伯国家对无线电力量的理解太慢。当他们开始升级自己的变速箱时，他们已经远远落后于埃及。因此，在 1950 年代和 1960 年代的关键时期，它们根本无法与埃及的输电功率相媲美。他们自己的服务非常简陋，无法吸引听众远离埃及节目。此外，它们几乎没有干扰能力。即使是在 1950 年代中期是埃及在该地区的主要竞争对手的伊拉克，也没有足够的发射功率来用阿拉伯语服务完全覆盖自己的国家，更不用说以可靠的信号到达邻近的阿拉伯国家了。42

content_units.text: Finally, the success of Egypts radio propaganda was also a func­tion of Nasirs own oratorical brilliance. A dazzling public speaker who mesmerized his listeners and kept them in rapt attention throughout the duration of his usually long speeches, Nasir had a knack for creatively manipulating the Arabic language, a linguistic medium ideally suited for arousing emotions, to produce the de­sired response from his audience. He had great command of classi­cal Arabic, but was not afraid to intersperse colloquial Egyptian to imprint into the consciousness of his listeners a folksy image of himself, that of the common man. If one word is associated in the minds of people with Nasirs oratory, a word that was repeated over and over again in his speeches, it was karameh, dignity. For the millions of common folk in Egypt and the rest of the Arab world who for years had suffered untold indignities at the hands of the colonizers, karameh would .nd a sure resonance in their hearts. And when all was said and done, Nasirs message of re­claiming the Arabs glorious past and setting its brilliance against
content_units.azure_translation: 最后，埃及广播宣传的成功也是纳西尔本人演讲才华的功劳。纳西尔是一位令人眼花缭乱的公共演说家，让听众着迷，并在他通常很长的演讲中全神贯注，纳西尔有创造性地纵阿拉伯语的诀窍，阿拉伯语是一种非常适合唤起情绪的语言媒介，以产生听众想要的反应。他精通古典阿拉伯语，但不怕穿插口语化的埃及语，在听众的意识中烙印出他自己、普通人的民间形象。如果说在人们的脑海中有一个词与纳西尔的演说联系在一起，这个词在他的演讲中一遍又一遍地重复，那就是卡拉梅，尊严。对于埃及和阿拉伯世界其他地区的数百万普通民众来说，他们多年来在殖民者手中遭受了难以言喻的屈辱，卡拉梅将在他们的心中产生明确的共鸣。当一切都说完之后，纳西尔传达了夺回阿拉伯人辉煌的过去并使其辉煌与阿拉伯人相抗衡的信息

content_units.text: Arts of the Middle East (Cairo: The American University in Cairo Press, 1998), pp. 121 122. the sorry contemporary conditions of subservience to the foreign­ers was the kind of message that .t right into the turbulent milieu of the times. Nasir used the device that had become the stock-in­trade of all nationalists: he made use of the past in order to sub­vert the present.43 And there were precious few arguments of equal emotional power that supporters of the West could muster in response.
content_units.azure_translation: 《中东艺术》（开罗：开罗美国大学出版社，1998 年），第 121 122 页。令人遗憾的当代屈从外国人的条件是那种直接进入动荡的时代环境的信息。纳西尔使用了已成为所有民族主义者常用的手段：他利用过去来颠覆现在。43 西方的支持者能够召集起来回应同等情感力量的论据很少。

content_units.text: Boyd, Broadcasting in the Arab World, p. 121.

Egypts propaganda claims were accompanied by concrete poli­cies designed to make these claims credible. Nasir and his adminis­tration moved on a number of fronts to enhance Egypts objective capabilities. The new government vigorously undertook to spread education to all sectors of society. At one time it opened new schools at the rate of two every week, so that between 1953 and 1958, the student population rose by a staggering 50 percent, ac­companied by a 57 percent rise in the number of teachers.44 Even though Egypt needed its teachers to service the huge expansion in education, the government continued, indeed increased, the coun­trys traditional export of teachers to schools of other Arab coun­tries. Egyptian teachers were now not just a living testimony to Egypts primacy, but also to Nasirs policies and principles.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的宣传主张伴随着旨在使这些主张可信的具体政策。纳西尔和他的政府在多条战线上采取行动，以增强埃及的客观能力。新政府大力致力于将教育传播到社会各阶层。它曾经以每周两所学校的速度开设新学校，因此在 1953 年至 1958 年间，学生人数增长了惊人的 50%，教师人数也增加了 57%。44 尽管埃及需要其教师来为教育的巨大扩张服务，但政府继续说： 事实上，该国向其他阿拉伯国家学校输出教师的传统有所增加。埃及教师现在不仅是埃及至高无上的活生生的见证，也是纳西尔政策和原则的活生生的见证。

content_units.text: Parallel to the pursuit of cultural supremacy, Nasir made every effort to maintain Egypts military dominance. Cognizant that per­ceptions of military power are crucial to the exercise of political in.uence, Nasir would ensure that other Arabs were aware of the power of the Egyptian army. In 1961, Nasir proudly reminded King Husayn of Jordan that the power of Egypts army was such that it would satisfy the hopes of every Arab, a fact that attested to Egypts determination to undertake [its] responsibility toward the common enemy of the Arab nation.45 And this was no idle boast; for Nasir pumped signi.cant resources into the military. In 1957, Egypts defense expenditure stood at $264 million, while the combined expenditure of Syria, Iraq, and Jordan totaled $156 million.46 It was hardly surprising then that the Algerian leader Ahmed Ben Bella would .rst come to Cairo to seek Nasirs counsel before announcing the Algerian revolution against France.47 In­deed, the .rst communique´ of the Algerian National Liberation Front, announcing the birth of the revolution against France on November 1, 1954, was broadcast on Egypts Voice of the Arabs.48 Ben Bellas initiative, that of traveling to Cairo to seek Nasirs support, was to be repeated time and again by countless Arab leaders in years to come.
content_units.azure_translation: 在追求文化霸权的同时，纳西尔还竭尽全力维护埃及的军事优势。纳西尔认识到对军事力量的看法对于行使政治影响力至关重要，他将确保其他阿拉伯人了解埃及军队的力量。1961年，纳西尔自豪地提醒约旦国王侯赛因，埃及军队的力量足以满足每个阿拉伯人的希望，这一事实证明了埃及决心对阿拉伯民族的共同敌人承担责任。45 这可不是无谓的夸耀;因为纳西尔向军队注入了重要的资源。1957年，埃及的国防开支为2.64亿美元，而叙利亚、伊拉克和约旦的国防开支总计为1.56亿美元。46 当时，阿尔及利亚领导人艾哈迈德·本·贝拉在宣布阿尔及利亚反对法国的革命之前，首先来到开罗征求纳西尔的建议也就不足为奇了。47 事实上，阿尔及利亚民族解放阵线的第一个公报， 1954 年 11 月 1 日宣布反对法国的革命诞生，在埃及阿拉伯人之声播出。48 本·贝拉斯的倡议，即前往开罗寻求纳西尔支持的倡议，在未来的几年里，无数阿拉伯领导人一次又一次地重复。

content_units.text: Elie Kedourie, Nationalism (London: Hutchinson University Library, 1961), p. 75.
United Nations, Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Statistical Yearbook, 1955, p. 570; and Statistical Yearbook, 1960, p. 578.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), March 31, 1961.

The weight and centrality of Nasirs Egypt in the Arab world can be ascertained by an examination of the various unity schemes in the Arab world during Nasirs leadership between 1954 and 1970. Of the eight proposed and/or attempted unity schemes in­volving Egypt, three were initiated by Syria, three by Iraq, and two by Yemen.49 These initiatives were undertaken not necessarily because of the leaders abiding belief in Arab unity (although there certainly was an element of that), but because these unity initiatives tended to have an immediate and signi.cant impact on the legitimation of these leaders in their respective countries. And this should tell us something about the elevated status of Egypt and its charismatic leader in the eyes of the Arabs, leaders and citizens alike.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔埃及在阿拉伯世界的分量和中心地位可以通过对 1954 年至 1970 年纳西尔领导期间阿拉伯世界的各种团结计划的检查来确定。在涉及埃及的八项拟议和/或尝试的统一计划中，三项由叙利亚发起，三项由伊拉克发起，两项由也门发起。49 这些倡议的实施不一定是因为领导人对阿拉伯团结的坚信（尽管肯定有这种因素），而是因为这些团结倡议往往对这些领导人在各自国家的合法性产生直接和重大的影响。这应该告诉我们一些关于埃及在阿拉伯人、领导人和公民眼中及其魅力领袖的崇高地位。

content_units.text: Nasirs Egypt was by no means loved by all; some resented it, others feared it. But loathed or revered, its leadership of revolution­ary Arab nationalism from the mid-1950s until Nasirs death in October 1970 was acknowledged by friend and foe. Muhamed Fadhil al-Jamali, who at various times had been Iraqs prime minis­ter or foreign minister during the 1950s, the period of intense Iraqi­
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔埃及绝不是所有人都爱戴的;有些人对此感到不满，另一些人则害怕它。但令人厌恶或崇敬的是，它从 1950 年代中期到 1970 年 10 月纳西尔去世期间对革命阿拉伯民族主义的领导地位得到了朋友和敌人的承认。穆罕默德·法迪尔·贾马利 （Muhamed Fadhil al-Jamali） 曾在 1950 年代（伊拉克紧张时期）多次担任伊拉克总理或外交部长

content_units.text: United Nations, Statistical Yearbook, 1960, pp. 509535.
Fuad Matar, Bisaraha An Abd al-Nasir: Hiwar maa Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal (Candidly about Abd al-Nasir: a conversation with Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal) (Beirut: Dar al-Qadhaya, 1975), p. 105.

Ahmad Hamroush, Qissat Thawrat 23 Yuliyu, al-Jusi al-Rabi: Abd al-Nasir wa al­Arab (The story of the July 23 revolution, volume 4: Abd al-Nasir and the Arabs) (Cairo: Dar al-Mawqif al-Arabi, 1983), p. 363.
Dawisha, Egypt in the Arab World, p. 134; also Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revis­ited, pp. 5455.

Egyptian enmity, claims to have been the .rst to coin the phrase Nasirism.50 He used it in a major address to the United Nations General Assembly in 1958, in which he accused the Egyptian leader of mounting a campaign to destabilize other Arab states that hap­pened not to see eye to eye with him on certain issues and policies. Jamalis argument rested on a main pillar of international law, that of the inviolability of state sovereignty. Iraq had the unquestioned sovereign right, Jamali asserted, to pursue its national interest with­out the interference of other states. Beyond the strictures of interna­tional law, the Charter of the League of Arab States, a document to which all Arab states were expected to adhere, insisted on total respect for the independence and sovereignty of each Arab state, and its right to pursue its own foreign policy.51 To these accusa­tions, Nasir had a ready and potent retort emanating from, by that point, his wholesale and wholehearted espousal of Arab national­ism.52 Nasirs position, loudly declared and gleefully transmitted over the airwaves, gave revolutionary Arab nationalism the pride of place in determining Egyptian Arab and foreign policy. Arab nationalism, Nasir argued, took precedence over any other consid­eration, even state sovereignty. Since Arab nationalism was the pri­mary ideological and emotional identi.cation of every Arab, then, according to Nasir, Egypt had not just the right, but the duty to intrude into the affairs of other countries that were not conducting themselves in accordance with Arab nationalist principles. Nasirs Egypt then had a dual rolethat of a traditional state and that of the revolutionary entity serving the higher interests of Arab nation­alism. Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, Nasirs con.dant and editor of the in.uential newspaper, al-Ahram, elucidated this Egyptian duality of roles:
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的敌意，声称是纳西尔主义一词的第一个创造者。50 他在 1958 年在联合国大会的一次重要演讲中使用了这个词，在演讲中他指责埃及领导人发起了一场运动来破坏其他阿拉伯国家的稳定，而这些国家恰好在某些问题和政策上与他意见不一致。贾马利斯的论点建立在国际法的一个主要支柱之上，即国家主权的不可侵犯性。贾马利声称，伊拉克拥有无可置疑的主权权利，可以在不受其他国家干涉的情况下追求其国家利益。除了国际法的限制之外，《阿拉伯国家联盟宪章》是所有阿拉伯国家都应遵守的文件，它坚持要充分尊重每个阿拉伯国家的独立和主权，以及其奉行自己外交政策的权利。51 对于这些指控，纳西尔的现成而有力的反驳来自： 到那时，他已经全心全意地拥护阿拉伯民族主义。52 纳西尔的立场，大声宣布并通过电波兴高采烈地传播，使革命的阿拉伯民族主义在决定埃及阿拉伯和外交政策方面占据了重要地位。纳西尔认为，阿拉伯民族主义优先于任何其他考虑因素，甚至是国家主权。由于阿拉伯民族主义是每个阿拉伯人的主要意识形态和情感认同，那么，根据纳西尔的说法，埃及不仅有权利，而且有义务干涉其他不按照阿拉伯民族主义原则行事的国家的事务。纳西尔埃及当时扮演着双重角色，即传统国家和为阿拉伯民族主义的更高利益服务的革命实体。纳西尔党人兼《阿赫拉姆报》的编辑穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔 （Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal） 阐明了埃及人的这种双重角色：

content_units.text: Muhamed Fadhil al-Jamali, Safahat min Tarikhina al-Muasir (Pages from our contem­porary history) (Cairo: Dar Suad al-Sabah, 1993), p. 197.
Michael N. Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics: Negotiations in Regional Order (New York: Columbia University Press, 1998), p. 80.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), March 5, 1958. By the end of the 1950s, Nasir was eulogized by his propaganda machine as the symbol of Arab nationalism [which represented] immediate unity. SWB, April 29, 1960.

We should distinguish between two things: Egypt as a state and as a revolution.... If as a state, Egypt recognizes boundaries in its dealings with governments, Egypt as a revolution should never hesi­tate to halt before these boundaries, but should carry its message beyond the borders in order to initiate its revolutionary mission for a unitary Arab future.... We should do our best to cooperate with governments, but we should refrain from extending such coopera­tion if it were to affect the peoples movements. This policy must be pursued whatever the consequences or the dif.culties may be.53 (ital­ics added)
content_units.azure_translation: 我们应该区分两件事：埃及作为一个国家和作为一个革命......如果作为一个国家，埃及在与政府打交道时承认边界，那么埃及作为一个革命就应该毫不犹豫地在这些边界之前停下来，而是应该将其信息传播到边界之外，以启动其对阿拉伯统一未来的革命使命......我们应尽最大努力与各国政府合作，但如果这种合作影响到人民运动，我们就应该避免扩大这种合作。无论后果或分歧如何，都必须奉行这一政策。53（斜体添加）

content_units.text: In Egyptian perceptions, Arab nationalism by the beginning of the 1960s had moved a long way from its conception a decade earlier. Then it had been merely a topic of argument and dialogue among intellectuals, or a convenient policy goal to which self-inter­ested politicians would pay lip service. Under the now committed leadership of Egypt under Gamal Abd al-Nasir, Arab nationalism became a revolutionary movement which would resonate among the mass of Arab people regardless of the political divisions of the world that these people inhabited. At this point, most Arabs could not conceive of the Arab nationalist movement without the leader­ship of Egypt and its charismatic leader.
content_units.azure_translation: 在埃及人看来，到 1960 年代初，阿拉伯民族主义已经与十年前的构想相去甚远。那时，它只是知识分子之间争论和对话的话题，或者是一个自私的政客口头上表达的方便政策目标。在贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔领导下的埃及现在坚定的领导下，阿拉伯民族主义成为一场革命运动，无论这些人居住的世界政治分裂如何，都会在广大阿拉伯人民中引起共鸣。在这一点上，大多数阿拉伯人无法想象没有埃及及其魅力领袖的领导的阿拉伯民族主义运动。

content_units.text: The immense upsurge in the popularity of Arab nationalism once Nasir put his charisma and Egypts weight behind the concept in the 1950s was bound to have an impact on other radical move­ments and parties. Those who shared Nasirs views would see their fortunes rise, and those who did not would suffer setbacks and reverses and, on occasion, extinction.
content_units.azure_translation: 一旦纳西尔在 1950 年代将他的魅力和埃及的影响力投入到这一概念后，阿拉伯民族主义的受欢迎程度就急剧上升，这必然会对其他激进运动和政党产生影响。那些与纳西尔观点相同的人将看到他们的财富上升，而那些不同意纳西尔观点的人将遭受挫折和逆转，有时甚至灭绝。

content_units.text: Sharing Nasirs views on Arab nationalism was the Bath Party, which as we have seen was formally founded in 1947. The Party was the brainchild of two young Syrian intellectuals, Michel A.aq and Salah al-Din Bitar, who had formed a close friendship while studying in Paris in the 1930s. A.aq, who assumed the role of the Partys philosopher, spent his entire career asserting the validity of the notion of an indivisible Arab nation. This nation, according to A.aq, had been forcibly divided by colonialism and imperialism, a division that had led to a degeneration of the Arab spirit. The major goal of the Bath Party was to reverse this trend and rejuve­nate the Arab will so that it could become the living instrument for the creation of one Arab nation with an eternal mission.54 The Arab nation was in such dire straits that the need for rejuvenation was immediate, and could not be left to a gradual, evolutionary transformation. Hence, as with Nasir, revolution .gured promi­nently in A.aqs ideas.
content_units.azure_translation: 与纳西尔对阿拉伯民族主义持相同看法的是巴斯党，正如我们所看到的，该党于 1947 年正式成立。该党是两位年轻的叙利亚知识分子米歇尔·A.aq 和萨拉赫·丁·比塔尔的心血结算，他们在 1930 年代在巴黎学习期间建立了亲密的友谊。A.aq 担任党哲学家的角色，他的整个职业生涯都在主张不可分割的阿拉伯国家概念的有效性。根据 A.aq 的说法，这个国家被殖民主义和帝国主义强行分裂，这种分裂导致了阿拉伯精神的堕落。巴斯党的主要目标是扭转这一趋势，重振阿拉伯意志，使其成为建立一个具有永恒使命的阿拉伯国家的活工具。54 阿拉伯民族正处于如此严峻的困境中，以至于复兴的需求是迫在眉睫的，不能让它进行渐进的、进化的转变。因此，与纳西尔一样，革命在 A.aqs 思想中占有重要地位。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), December 29, 1961.

This revolutionary bent was intensi.ed in 1953 through the merger of the Bath with the Arab Socialist Party under the leader­ship of Akram Hourani. Houranis political in.uence emanated from a power base centered on the agricultural region around the Syrian city of Hama, where he had organized successful peasant revolts against the large landowning families.55 He had a genius for clandestine organizational activity, and had established extensive contacts inside the armed forces.56 Whereas A.aq thought of revo­lution primarily in theoretical and philosophical terms, Houranis own revolutionary experience gave the concept a more concrete manifestation. After the merger, the Partys name was changed to the Arab Socialist Bath Party. A.aq became its secretary-general, responsible for ideological direction. But Hourani soon established himself as the real leader, around whom gathered professionals, students, and army of.cers who were among some of the most candescent of the generation that grew up in the waning years of the mandate period and the dawning of the independence era.57
content_units.azure_translation: 1953 年，巴斯与阿克兰·胡拉尼 （Akram Hourani） 领导下的阿拉伯社会党合并，这种革命倾向得到了加强。胡拉尼斯的政治思想源于以叙利亚哈马市周围农业地区为中心的权力基础，在那里他成功地组织了反对大地主家庭的农民起义。55 他在秘密组织活动方面具有天才，并在武装部队内部建立了广泛的联系。56 而 A.aq 主要从理论和哲学角度思考革命， 胡拉尼斯自己的革命经历使这个概念得到了更具体的体现。合并后，党名改为阿拉伯社会主义巴斯党。A.aq 成为其秘书长，负责意识形态指导。但胡拉尼很快就确立了自己作为真正领导者的地位，他们周围聚集了专业人士、学生和军队，他们是在托管时期的衰落和独立时代的黎明中成长起来的这一代人中最热心的。57

content_units.text: For a concise exposition of A.aqs ideas, see Leonard Binder, The Ideological Revolu­tion in the Middle East (New York: John Wiley and Sons, Inc., 1964), pp. 154197; for the early history, organization, and rise in political in.uence of the Bath Party, see John Devlin, The Bath Party: A History from its Origins to 1966 (Stanford, California: Hoover Institu­tion Press, 1976); also Kamel Abu Jaber, The Arab Bath Socialist Party: History, Ideology and Organization (Syracuse, New York: Syracuse University Press, 1966).
Patrick Seale, Asad of Syria: The Struggle for the Middle East (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1988), pp. 4143.
Salah Nasr, Abd al-Nasir wa Tajribat al-Wuhda (Abd al-Nasir and the experience of unity) (Beirut: al-Watan al-Arabi, 1976), p. 51.
Ahmad Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Mura (Harvest: fertile years and bitter fruit) (Beirut: Bisan li al-Nashr wa al-Tawzi, 1994), p. 201.

Hourani recruited heavily from among the ranks of the military and educational institutions. By 1954, the Bath had succeeded in establishing a political presence in the country. In that years elec­tion, party members won thirteen seats in the 141-seat National Assembly.58 Even though it could not match the traditional politi­cians who won the lions share of the parliamentary seats, this was still an impressive tally for a party that did not of.cially exist a decade earlier.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡拉尼从军队和教育机构的队伍中大量招募了新兵。到 1954 年，巴斯成功地在该国建立了政治存在。在那一年的选举中，党员在拥有 141 个席位的国民议会中赢得了 13 个席位。58 尽管它无法与赢得议会席位大部分份额的传统政客相提并论，但对于一个十年前还不存在的政党来说，这仍然是一个令人印象深刻的数字。

content_units.text: In the early 1950s, the Party embarked on expanding its activi­ties beyond Syria, concentrating its effort in the neighboring Ha­shemite monarchies of Iraq and Jordan. Working clandestinely (not surprisingly, neither government welcomed the revolutionary philosophy of the Bath), the Party saw a steady, if not spectacular, rise in its membership. Its political fortunes were aided by Nasirs nationalization of the Suez Canal and the subsequent tripartite attack on Egypt. In October 1956, at the height of the Suez crisis, two Jordanian Bathists won parliamentary seats in what was probably the freest election Jordan had yet known. The Bathists could have won more seats had their Arab nationalist program not competed with that of the National Socialist Party under Su­layman Nabulsi, who was perceived in Jordan as a strong admirer of Nasir.59
content_units.azure_translation: 1950 年代初期，该党开始将其活动扩展到叙利亚以外，将精力集中在邻近的伊拉克和约旦哈希姆君主制国家。该党秘密开展工作（毫不奇怪，两个政府都不欢迎巴斯的革命哲学），其党员人数即使不是惊人的，也稳步增长。纳西尔将苏伊士运河国有化以及随后对埃及的三方进攻帮助了它的政治命运。1956 年 10 月，在苏伊士危机最严重的时候，两名约旦巴斯派人士赢得了议会席位，这可能是约旦迄今为止最自由的选举。如果巴斯派的阿拉伯民族主义纲领没有与苏莱曼·纳布尔西领导下的国家社会党的纲领竞争，巴斯派本可以赢得更多席位，苏莱曼·纳布尔西在约旦被认为是纳西尔的强烈崇拜者59。

content_units.text: In Iraq, Bathist clandestine activities began in 1951, but recruit­ment proceeded slowly due to intense governmental repression and the competition provided by a long-established clandestine Com­munist Party. The Partys growth accelerated after 1954, coincid­ing with Nasirs onslaught against the Western alliance system which soon was to be centered in Baghdad. As in Jordan, the Party received its greatest boost after the Suez crisis,60 as its Arab nation­alist principles echoed those of the charismatic Nasir, who by then had become the acknowledged leader of the Arab nationalist move­ment. By the time of the Iraqi revolution in July 1958, the Bathists had become a recognized element of the progressive forces that were instrumental in the demise of the Iraqi monarchy. And indeed, Fuad al-Rikabi, the secretary-general of the regional command (the Iraqi branch) of the party entered the .rst cabinet of the Iraqi Republic.
content_units.azure_translation: 在伊拉克，巴斯派的秘密活动始于 1951 年，但由于政府的强烈镇压和长期成立的秘密共产党提供的竞争，招募进展缓慢。1954 年后，该党的增长加速，恰逢纳西尔对西方联盟体系的猛攻，该体系很快将以巴格达为中心。与在约旦一样，该党在苏伊士危机后得到了最大的推动，60 因为它的阿拉伯民族主义原则与魅力十足的纳西尔的原则相呼应，纳西尔当时已成为阿拉伯民族主义运动的公认领导人。到 1958 年 7 月伊拉克革命时，巴斯派已成为进步力量中公认的组成部分，这些力量在伊拉克君主制的消亡中发挥了重要作用。事实上，该党地区司令部（伊拉克支部）秘书长福阿德·里卡比进入了伊拉克共和国的第一个内阁。

content_units.text: Malik Mufti, Sovereign Creations: Pan-Arabism and Political Order in Syria and Iraq (Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press, 1996), p. 71.
Devlin, The Bath Party, p. 103.
Abu Jaber, The Arab Bath Socialist Party,p.53.

Even more so than the Bath, the Arab Nationalists Movement (ANM), which was formed in 1951 by a number of Palestinian students and professionals under the leadership of the Christian Palestinian, George Habash,61 tied its political fortunes to Nasir, following his lead through much of the 1950s and 1960s. Indeed, unlike the Bath, which at various times in the 1960s broke with Nasir, attacking him and his policies vehemently, and advocating a different Arab nationalist path, the ANM remained on the whole loyal to Nasir and his brand of Arab nationalism right until the disastrous Arab defeat in the June 1967 Six Day War.62 It was as though the ANM saw itself as an arm of Nasirist policies, working at the grassroots level, spreading Arab nationalist doctrine, partic­ularly in Palestine, Iraq, the Gulf, and South Arabia.63 Undoubt­edly, this close, almost symbiotic, association with Nasir was bene­.cial to the ANM; Nasirs triumphs were theirs, and his charisma bene.ted their organization. But this association also had its costs. Nasirs defeats re.ected badly on the ANM. It is hardly coinciden­tal that the organization began to atrophy in the mid-1960s when Nasirs Egypt suffered a number of setbacks in the Arab world. Indeed, the ANM disintegrated as a uni.ed movement in the wake of the Six Day War. Moreover, its close association with Nasir robbed it of a separate identity. What need was there for someone who already identi.ed himself as a Nasirist or Arab nationalist to join the ANM? Perhaps this is why the ANM never achieved the later political prominence of the Bath, which had always been jeal­ous about preserving its own separate political identity. On bal­ance, however, the association with Nasir was ultimately bene.cial to the ANM. It is highly unlikely that the mass base of the organiza­tion would have grown had it not been for Nasirs charismatic propagation of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 1951年，在基督教巴勒斯坦人乔治·哈巴什（George Habash）的领导下，由一些巴勒斯坦学生和专业人士组成的阿拉伯民族主义运动（ANM）61，其政治命运与纳西尔联系在一起，在1950年代和1960年代的大部分时间里，纳西尔都跟随他的领导。事实上，与巴斯不同，巴斯在 1960 年代的不同时期与纳西尔决裂，强烈攻击他和他的政策，并倡导不同的阿拉伯民族主义道路，ANM 总体上仍然忠于纳西尔和他的阿拉伯民族主义品牌，直到 1967 年 6 月的六日战争中阿拉伯人惨败。62 ANM 似乎将自己视为纳西尔主义政策的一个分支， 在基层工作，传播阿拉伯民族主义学说，特别是在巴勒斯坦、伊拉克、海湾和南阿拉伯。63 毫无疑问，与纳西尔的这种密切、几乎共生的联系对 ANM 来说是有益的;纳西尔的胜利是他们的，他的魅力使他们的组织受益。但这种联系也有其代价。纳西尔在 ANM 上惨败。该组织在 1960 年代中期开始萎缩，当时埃及纳西尔在阿拉伯世界遭受了许多挫折，这绝非巧合。事实上，ANM 在六日战争之后作为一个统一的运动解体了。此外，它与纳西尔的密切联系剥夺了它的独立身份。一个已经自认为是纳西尔主义者或阿拉伯民族主义者的人有什么必要加入 ANM？也许这就是为什么 ANM 从未获得巴斯后来的政治地位的原因，巴斯一直嫉妒保留自己独立的政治身份。然而，总的来说，与纳西尔的联系最终对 ANM 有利。如果不是纳西尔对阿拉伯民族主义的魅力传播，该组织的群众基础不太可能增长。

content_units.text: Habash later was to form the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP), which gained international notoriety by masterminding a series of high-pro.le airplane hi­jackings during the 1970s, the most infamous of which occurred in Jordan in September 1970, which led to the Jordanian civil war that became known to Palestinians as Black September." After the 1970 debacle, Habash headquartered the PFLP in Damascus, and remained a nemesis of the Palestinian Liberation Organization leader, Yasir Arafat.

See Abdallah Saloom al-Samarai, Harakat al-Qawmiyeen al-Arab wa Dawruha . al-Wayi al-Qawmi, (The Arab nationalists movement and its role in national conscious­ness), al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi (Beirut), no. 84 (February 1986): 7599.
Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Mura (Harvest: fertile years and bitter fruit), p. 247.

On the opposite end of the political spectrum, the political groups and parties that did not share the ideological proclivities of Egypts leader saw a considerable decline in their political fortune. While the death of Antun Saada was a major blow to the Syrian National Party (SNP), the party itself continued to organize and recruit new members attracted to the idea of Greater Syria. In the .rst half of the 1950s, the SNP was probably the Baths main rival, as both scrambled to clandestinely recruit adherents from the same societal base. As a result, great enmity developed between the two parties. In March 1955, as the Nasir-led Arab nationalist onslaught against Western military alliances gathered momentum, and was beginning to galvanize Arab public opinion, the SNP was implicated in the assassination of Adnan Maliki, a popular Bath­ist of.cer. Rumors were abound that the SNP was working with Western intelligence against the Communist Party and Nasirist and Bathist Arab nationalism in Syria.64 From then on, its activity was severely curtailed by a witch-hunt against party members under­taken by Arab nationalist of.cials that succeeded in ultimately driving the SNP out of Syria.65 But beyond the political persecution, the Partys days were already numbered in Syria; it had been over­taken by the upsurge in pro-Egyptian Arab nationalist sentiment that occurred in the mid-1950s.66
content_units.azure_translation: 在政治光谱的另一端，与埃及领导人意识形态倾向不同、政治团体和政党的政治命运大幅下降。虽然安通·萨达的去世对叙利亚民族党 （SNP） 来说是一个重大打击，但该党本身仍在继续组织和招募被大叙利亚理念所吸引的新成员。在 1950 年代上半叶，苏格兰民族党可能是巴斯的主要竞争对手，因为两者都争先恐后地从同一社会基础秘密招募追随者。于是，双方之间产生了极大的敌意。1955 年 3 月，随着纳西尔领导的阿拉伯民族主义对西方军事联盟的猛攻势头强增，并开始激发阿拉伯舆论，苏格兰民族党卷入了巴斯派of.cer阿德南·马利基 （Adnan Maliki） 的暗杀事件。谣言比比皆是，苏格兰民族党正在与西方情报部门合作，反对叙利亚的共产党以及纳西尔主义和巴斯主义阿拉伯民族主义。64 从那时起，阿拉伯民族主义者对党员进行政治迫害，最终成功地将苏格兰民族党赶出了叙利亚，其活动受到严重限制。65 但除了政治迫害之外， 在叙利亚，党的日子已经屈指可数了;它已被 1950 年代中期发生的亲埃及阿拉伯民族主义情绪的高涨所取代。

content_units.text: Michael C. Hudson, Arab Politics: The Search for Legitimacy (New Haven, Connecti­cut: Yale University Press, 1977), p. 257.
Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Mura (Harvest: fertile years and bitter fruit), p. 245; Nasr, Abd al-Nasir wa Tajribat al-Wuhda (Abd al-Nasir and the experi­ence of unity), p. 68.
Albert Hourani, Arabic Thought in the Liberal Age, 17981939 (London: Oxford Uni­versity Press, 1970), pp. 317318.

Another party that came up against the Nasir-led Arab national­ist movement was the Iraqi Communist Party. Up until the mid­1950s, the party was at the forefront of clandestine activities against the monarchical regime, dwar.ng the Bath and other Arab nationalist and progressive groups. The Communists had been responsible for a number of antigovernment uprisings in various Iraqi towns and cities, including the famed al-Wathba, the most formidable mass insurrection in the history of the monarchy.67 Al-Wathba lasted for eleven days in January 1948, and resulted in between 200 and 300 dead. But it did bring about the abrogation of a major treaty with Britain and the fall of the government re­sponsible for the treaty. Saleh Jaber, the Iraqi prime minister, beat a hasty and unceremonious retreat to his tribal domain and from there escaped to England. As late as 1956, the Communists were able to mount two mass insurrections in the city of Najaf and the town of Hayy. A secret police document con.ded that Communism in Hayy had penetrated among all classes.68 Both insurrections were ultimately suppressed by government forces with great dif.­culty and not inconsiderable loss of life.
content_units.azure_translation: 另一个反对纳西尔领导的阿拉伯民族主义运动的政党是伊拉克共产党。直到 1950 年代中期，该党一直处于反对君主政权的秘密活动的最前沿，dwar.ng 巴斯和其他阿拉伯民族主义和进步团体。共产党人对伊拉克各个城镇的多次反政府起义负有责任，包括著名的瓦斯巴起义，这是君主制历史上最可怕的大规模起义。67 Al-Wathba 在 1948 年 1 月持续了 11 天，导致 200 至 300 人死亡。但它确实导致了与英国的一项重大条约的废除以及负责该条约的政府的垮台。伊拉克总理萨利赫·贾比尔（Saleh Jaber）仓促而毫不客气地撤退到他的部落领地，并从那里逃到了英国。直到 1956 年，共产党才在纳杰夫市和哈伊镇发动了两次大规模起义。一份秘密警察文件表明，哈伊的共产主义已经渗透到所有阶级中。68 两次起义最终都被政府军镇压，造成了巨大的损失，造成了不小的生命损失。

content_units.text: During this period of vigorous underground activity by the Communists, the Bath Party was working merely to establish some presence among the countrys opposition forces. Yet by 1958, at the time of the Iraqi revolution, Bathists and other Arab national­ists could legitimately claim to have balanced the power of the Communists. And even though the Communists seemed to have the upper hand in the .rst two years of the Iraqi Republic, they were soon to be swept aside by the gathering nationalist tide. The Communists, who were then the tolerated allies of Iraqs dictator, Abd al-Karim Qasim, must have seen the writing on the wall, when in 1962, the Iraqi Bath Party, of.cially banned and working underground, was able to organize a huge demonstration in Bagh­ dad to welcome the Algerian leader Ahmad Ben Bella on his .rst visit to Iraq. In de.ance of the government, the thousands of dem­onstrators hoisted banners that carried the slogan:69
content_units.azure_translation: 在共产党人活跃的地下活动期间，巴斯党只是为了在该国的反对派力量中建立一些存在。然而，到了1958年，在伊拉克革命之际，巴斯主义者和其他阿拉伯民族主义者可以合法地声称已经平衡了共产党的权力。尽管共产党人似乎在伊拉克共和国成立的头两年占据了上风，但他们很快就被日益聚集的民族主义浪潮所席卷。共产党人当时是伊拉克独裁者阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·卡西姆 （Abd al-Karim Qasim） 的容忍盟友，他们一定看到了墙上的文字，当时 1962 年，被禁止并在地下工作的伊拉克巴斯党能够在巴格达组织一场大规模示威活动，欢迎阿尔及利亚领导人艾哈迈德·本·贝拉 （Ahmad Ben Bella） 首次访问伊拉克。为了支持政府，数千名示威者举起了标有口号的横幅：69

content_units.text: Hanna Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolutionary Movements of Iraq: A Study of Iraqs Old Landed and Commercial Classes and of its Communists, Bathists, and Free Of.cers (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1978), p. 545. Using secret police and Communist Party documents, Batatu provides a graphic description of this mas­sive insurrection, pp. 545566.
Ibid., p. 756.
Ben Bella ahlan beek Ben Bella welcome to you Hizb al-Bath yehayeek The Bath Party greets you
content_units.azure_translation: Ben Bella ahlan beek Ben Bella 欢迎来到 Hizb al-Bath yehayeek 巴斯派对迎接你

content_units.text: A few months later, the Bath Party, supported by other Arab na­tionalists, was able to mount a successful military coup that spelled the beginning of the end for the Iraqi Communists. And indeed, by the mid-1960s, the once most powerful underground organization in Iraq had been reduced to a mere skeleton of its former selfa sorry collection of old-timers, unable to infuse much needed young blood into the Party, cognizant of the fact that the present held precious few opportunities, and the future fewer still.
content_units.azure_translation: 几个月后，巴斯党在其他阿拉伯民族主义者的支持下，发动了一场成功的军事政变，标志着伊拉克共产党终结的开始。事实上，到了1960年代中期，伊拉克曾经最强大的地下组织已经沦为昔日的骷髅，一个可怜的老前辈，无法为党注入急需的年轻血液，他们认识到现在的机会很少，而未来的机会却更少。

content_units.text: The Iraqi Communist Party, much like other groups and organi­zations that did not partake in the Arab nationalist idea, simply could not withstand the gathering force of the nationalist tide. This tide sprung to life in the early days of 1955, when Gamal Abd al-Nasir decided to take on the propagators and supporters of the Baghdad Pact.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克共产党，就像其他不参与阿拉伯民族主义思想的团体和组织一样，根本无法抵挡民族主义浪潮的聚集力量。这股浪潮在 1955 年初开始活跃起来，当时贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔 （Gamal Abd al-Nasir） 决定与《巴格达条约》的宣传者和支持者较量。

content_units.text: Ali Karim Said, Iraq 8 Shibat 1963: Min Hiwar al-Mafahim ila Hiwar al-Dam; Mura­jaat . Dhakirat Taleb Shabib (Iraq 8 February 1963: from a dialogue over norms to a dialogue of blood; reviews in the memory of Taleb Shabib) (Beirut: Dar al-Kunuz al-Ada­biya, 1999), p. 49.

If speci.c events were to be picked as signposts in the spectacular forward march of Arab nationalism during the 1950s, the three that stand out are the 1955 Baghdad Pact, the 1956 Suez Crisis, and the birth of the United Arab Republic (UAR) in 1958. While Egypts perceived victory in the Suez Crisis and the merger of Egypt and Syria into the UAR constituted perhaps the two singular events that truly galvanized Arab public opinion behind the ideas and symbols of Arab nationalism, it was the Baghdad Pact which was the de.ning event that triggered a chain of political initiatives and responses that ultimately were to mark the period as the nationalist era. It was in this era that large segments of the educated populace, bewitched by the power of the Arab idea and seduced by the cha­risma of Gamal Abd al-Nasir, came to believe passionately, albeit nai¨vely as it turned out, in the unquestionable and inevitable tri­umph of Arab nationalism. And indeed if nothing else, it was the Baghdad Pact that brought Egypt fully, unequivocally, and vigor­ously into the very heart of Arab politics.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果说要将具体事件作为 1950 年代阿拉伯民族主义壮观前进的路标，那么最突出的三个事件是 1955 年的巴格达条约、1956 年的苏伊士危机和 1958 年阿拉伯联合共和国 （UAR） 的诞生。虽然埃及认为苏伊士危机的胜利以及埃及和叙利亚并入阿拉伯联合共和国可能是真正激发阿拉伯民族主义思想和象征背后的阿拉伯公众舆论的两起事件，但正是《巴格达条约》引发了一系列政治倡议和反应，最终将这一时期标记为民族主义时代。正是在这个时代，大部分受过教育的民众被阿拉伯思想的力量所迷惑，被贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔的魅力所诱惑，开始热情地相信阿拉伯民族主义无可置疑的、不可避免的胜利，尽管事实证明是天真无邪的。事实上，如果不出意外的话，正是《巴格达条约》将埃及完全、明确、有力地带入了阿拉伯政治的核心。

content_units.text: It all began innocuously enough in May 1953. John Foster Dul­les, the U. S. secretary of state, paid a visit to Cairo to muster sup­port for a Western defense alliance which would be based on the Middle East and would link with the North Atlantic Treaty Organi­zation (NATO) to its west and a projected Southeast Asian alliance (formed in 1954) to its east. These alliances were part of a grand security design known as the policy of Containment, which was meant to keep the Soviets and other Communists at bay. Nasir and his colleagues, however, were lukewarm to the idea. As he would later say in an interview, Nasir could not take seriously the Ameri­can contention that a threat to the region would emanate from a power whose forces were .ve thousand miles away.1 A more serious objection related to the whole question of the balance of power in such an alliance. Nasir explained to Dulles:
content_units.azure_translation: 这一切都始于 1953 年 5 月，无害无害。美国国务卿约翰·福斯特·杜勒斯访问了开罗，以争取对西方防务联盟的支持，该联盟将以中东为基础，与西边的北大西洋公约组织（NATO）和东边的东南亚联盟（1954年成立）联系在一起。这些联盟是被称为遏制政策的宏伟安全设计的一部分，该政策旨在将苏联和其他共产党拒之门外。然而，纳西尔和他的同事们对这个想法不冷不热。正如他后来在接受采访时所说的那样，纳西尔不能认真对待美国的论点，即对该地区的威胁将来自一个军队远在五千英里之外的大国。1 一个更严重的反对意见涉及这种联盟中权力平衡的整个问题。纳西尔向杜勒斯解释道：

content_units.text: If a small state entered an alliance with a large state, then dominance and leadership will reside with the larger state, and the small state will become nothing but a subservient entity good only for taking orders. We therefore believe that defense of our region should ema­nate from the region itself without the participation of a foreign country.2
content_units.azure_translation: 如果一个小国与一个大国结盟，那么统治权和领导权将掌握在大国手中，小国将只会成为一个只擅长听命的屈从实体。因此，我们认为，我们地区的防御应该从该地区本身开始，而不需要外国的参与。

content_units.text: Dulles left Cairo empty-handed but relations did not seem partic­ularly strained. This, however, soon was to change. Faced with Egypts rejection of the American project, the dogged and intracta­ble American secretary of state shifted his attention to Baghdad, where the virulently pro-Western Iraqi government endeavored ceaselessly to project Iraq as the balancing pole to Egypt in the Arab world. In January 1954, the United States, in response to an Iraqi request for military aid, used language that seemed to tie American approval to Iraqs participation in a regional security arrangement.3 Given the political orientation of Iraqs political elite, particularly of its strongman, Nuri al-Said, it was a forgone conclusion that the Baghdad government would respond favorably to the American proposal.
content_units.azure_translation: 杜勒斯空手而归，但两端关系似乎并不特别紧张。然而，这种情况很快就发生了变化。面对埃及拒绝美国的计划，顽固而顽固的美国国务卿将注意力转移到了巴格达，在那里，恶毒的亲西方伊拉克政府不断努力将伊拉克作为阿拉伯世界埃及的平衡杆。1954 年 1 月，美国在回应伊拉克的军事援助请求时，使用的语言似乎将美国的批准与伊拉克参与地区安全安排联系起来。3 鉴于伊拉克政治精英的政治取向，特别是其强人努里·赛义德的政治取向，巴格达政府将对美国的提议做出积极反应已成定局。

content_units.text: The Sunday Times (London), June 24, 1962.

Quoted in Fikrat Abd al-Fattah, Siyasat al-Iraq al-Kharijiya . al-Mintaqa al-Arabiya, 19531958 (Iraqs foreign policy in the Arab region, 19531958) (Baghdad: Wizarat al-Thaqafa wa al-Ilam, 1981), p. 333.
Elie Podeh, The Quest for Hegemony in the Arab World: The Struggle Over the Bagh­dad Pact (Leiden: E. J. Brill, 1995), p. 64.

From around the fall of 1954, Nuri al-Said began the process that would eventually end in the announcement of the Baghdad Pact. First, he had to ensure domestic compliance. He therefore called an election in September 1954 which was so rigged that no less than 100 of the 135 members of the new parliament were avid Nuri supporters. Indeed, only 23 seats were contested; the rest were won unchallenged.4 Having ensured domestic compliance, Nuri traveled to Cairo to discuss with Nasir security arrangements for the region. The meeting stalemated with Nasir reiterating his posi­tion that regional security should fall on the Arab countries them­selves, and Nuri insisting that only with the help of the Western powers could Iraq and the region prevent Soviet and Communist aggression.5 The problem was that while Nasir emphasized Arab neutrality in the ideological and political struggle between the su­perpowers, Nuri could not conceive of a political path for the Arabs that was divorced from the West. He later wrote that in the meeting, Nasir
content_units.azure_translation: 从 1954 年秋天左右开始，努里·赛义德开始了最终以宣布《巴格达条约》而告终的进程。首先，他必须确保国内遵守规定。因此，他在 1954 年 9 月举行了一次选举，选举纵得如此之多，以至于新议会的 135 名议员中至少有 100 人是努里的狂热支持者。事实上，只有 23 个席位受到竞争;其余的都毫无挑战地赢得了。4 在确保国内遵守后，努里前往开罗与纳西尔讨论该地区的安全安排。会议陷入僵局，纳西尔重申了他的立场，即地区安全应该落在阿拉伯国家自己身上，而努里则坚持认为只有在西方列强的帮助下，伊拉克和该地区才能阻止苏联和共产主义的侵略。5 问题在于，虽然纳西尔强调阿拉伯在超级大国之间的意识形态和政治斗争中保持中立， 努里无法想象阿拉伯人有一条与西方分离的政治道路。他后来写道，在会议上，纳西尔

content_units.text: failed to understand that the West would not tolerate Russian in.u­ence in the Middle East. He failed to understand that the West would not grant the Arabs the luxury of neutralism, that this area is too decisively vital for that sort of foolishness. He failed to under­stand that the Middle East is inextricably tied to the West economi­callythere is no other bigger market for Arab oil, for example. Despite a soldiers background, Nasser overlooked the military real­ity of Russias incapacity to defend the Arabs if they made an enemy of the West.6
content_units.azure_translation: 没有理解西方不会容忍俄罗斯在中东的干预。他不明白西方不会给予阿拉伯人中立的奢侈，这个领域对于这种愚蠢行为来说太重要了。他不明白中东在经济上与西方有着千丝万缕的联系，例如，阿拉伯石油没有其他更大的市场。尽管有军人背景，纳赛尔却忽视了军事现实，即如果阿拉伯人与西方为敌，俄罗斯就无力保卫阿拉伯人6。

content_units.text: K. al-Husri, The Iraqi Revolution of July 14, 1958, Middle East Forum, vol. 41 (1965): p. 27.

Kennet Love, Suez: The Twice Fought War (New York: McGraw Hill, 1969), pp. 195 196; Podeh, The Quest for Hegemony in the Arab World, p. 88; and Abd al-Fattah, Siyasat al-Iraq al-Kharijiya (Iraqs foreign policy in the Arab region), pp. 308311.

Nuri al-Saids article appeared posthumously in Life. This speci.c quote from the arti­cle is taken from Robert Stephens, Nasser: A Political Biography (London: Allen Lane / Penguin Press, 1971), p. 149.

At the end of the meeting, Nasir, probably more in frustration than agreement, told Nuri that he was free to do what he thought was best for Iraq,7 but that he should not rush into any deal with the West. Nuri, on the other hand, believing that he had made his posi­tion clear to Nasir, and that the Egyptian leader would not object too strenuously if Iraq went ahead with its plans, decided that it was time to act.
content_units.azure_translation: 在会谈结束时，纳西尔可能更多的是沮丧而不是同意，他告诉努里，他可以自由地做他认为对伊拉克最好的事情，7但他不应该急于与西方达成任何协议。另一方面，努里认为他已经向纳西尔表明了自己的立场，如果伊拉克继续执行其计划，埃及领导人不会过于强烈反对，因此决定是时候采取行动了。

content_units.text: In early January 1955, during a visit by the Turkish prime minis­ter, Adnan Menderes, an announcement was made that Iraq and Turkey intended to enter into a military alliance soon. This appar­ently came as a great surprise to Nasir and the Egyptian leaders. Nasir had thought that he had extracted a promise from Nuri not to make a signi.cant move in the direction of an alliance with the West without .rst consulting with Cairo.8 In response, Nasir called a meeting of Arab prime ministers in Cairo with the intention of condemning the proposed Iraqi action. But the most that the prime ministers were able to agree on was to dispatch a delegation to Iraq to persuade Nuri to change course or, at a minimum, to postpone the pending treaty. The delegation included Colonel Salah Salem, a senior member of Egypts ruling group. Nuri would not budge, and his parting words to Salem were: I am not a soldier in Abd al-Nasirs army. Please tell him that I will not obey his orders.9 And indeed he did not. On February 25, 1955, Iraq signed a secu­rity treaty with Turkey, which became known as Mithaq Baghdad, the Baghdad Pact. The treaty was designed to be the .rst step of a regional security alliance involving Pakistan and Iran and the possi­ble future membership of the United States and Great Britain. Nuri immediately invited other Arab countries to join. p. 117. Marr got this information from an interview with Najib al-Rawi, the then-Iraqi ambassador to Cairo, who attended the Iraqi-Egyptian meeting. It is, however, important to note that the interview was conducted fourteen years after the meeting, and it is not clear whether al-Rawi had taken notes of the meeting or was speaking from memory.
content_units.azure_translation: 1955 年 1 月初，土耳其总理阿德南·曼德列斯 （Adnan Menderes） 访问期间宣布伊拉克和土耳其打算很快结成军事联盟。这显然让纳西尔和埃及领导人大吃一惊。纳西尔曾认为，他已经从努里那里得到了一个承诺，即在未与开罗协商的情况下，不会朝着与西方结盟的方向迈进。8 作为回应，纳西尔在开罗召集了阿拉伯总理会议，意图谴责伊拉克的拟议行动。但总理们最多能达成一致的是派遣一个代表团前往伊拉克，说服努里改变路线，或者至少推迟悬而未决的条约。代表团成员包括埃及统治集团高级成员萨拉赫·塞勒姆上校。努里不肯让步，他对塞勒姆的临别赠言是：我不是阿卜杜勒·纳西尔军队的士兵。请告诉他，我不会听从他的命令。9 他确实没有。1955 年 2 月 25 日，伊拉克与土耳其签署了一项安全条约，该条约后来被称为《巴格达米萨克条约》。该条约旨在成为涉及巴基斯坦和伊朗以及美国和英国未来可能加入的地区安全联盟的第一步。努里立即邀请其他阿拉伯国家加入。第 117 页。马尔从对时任伊拉克驻开罗大使纳吉布·拉维的采访中获得了这一信息，纳吉布·拉维参加了伊拉克-埃及会议。然而，必须指出的是，这次面谈是在会晤14年后进行的，目前尚不清楚拉维是记下了会面还是凭记忆说话。

content_units.text: Phebe Marr, The Modern History of Iraq (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1985),
Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi, Mudhakarat Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi, al-Jusi al-Awal (Memoirs of Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi, volume one) (Cairo: Al-Maktab al-Musri al-Hadith, 1977), p. 200.
Ahmad Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Murra (Harvest: fertile years, bitter fruit) (Beirut: Bisan li al-Nashr wa al-Tawzi, 1994), p. 271.

Egypts response was expeditious and resolute. On the political level, Cairo moved to secure its own diplomatic position in the region and to isolate Iraq politically. In early March, less than two weeks after the formal announcement of the Baghdad Pact, Egypt formed its own alliance with Syria, which was endorsed by Saudi Arabia, the traditional nemesis of the Hashemites. It was pointedly claimed that the alliance was only the .rst step in the wider integra­tion of the Arab world.10 To prove a point, Nasir dispatched Egyp­tian forces to be stationed on Syrias borders with Iraq and Turkey. These moves were cemented later on in the year when, in the name of Arab nationalism, the Egyptian-Syrian Mutual Defense Pact was signed, to be followed a week later by another pact with Saudi Arabia which Yemen joined. The moves represented Nasirs deter­mined efforts to politically isolate Iraq and to exhibit in a concrete fashion to Arab public opinion that there were Arab alternatives to Western alliances. Yet Nasir knew that this in itself would not be enough to ensure that the balance of forces would continue to be in Egypts favor.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的反应迅速而坚决。在政治层面，开罗采取行动以确保自己在该地区的外交地位，并在政治上孤立伊拉克。3月初，在正式宣布《巴格达条约》后不到两周，埃及与叙利亚结成了自己的联盟，并得到了哈希姆派的传统克星沙特阿拉伯的认可。有人尖锐地声称，该联盟只是阿拉伯世界更广泛一体化的第一步。10 为了证明这一点，纳西尔派遣埃及军队驻扎在叙利亚与伊拉克和土耳其的边界。这些举措在同年晚些时候得到巩固，当时以阿拉伯民族主义的名义签署了《埃及-叙利亚共同防御条约》，一周后又与沙特阿拉伯签署了另一项协议，也门也加入了该条约。这些举动代表了纳西尔在政治上孤立伊拉克的决心努力，并以具体方式向阿拉伯公众舆论表明，除了西方联盟之外，还有阿拉伯人的替代方案。然而，纳西尔知道，这本身不足以确保力量平衡继续对埃及有利。

content_units.text: So in addition to diplomacy, Cairo unleashed an intense propa­ganda campaign against the Baghdad Pact, against those who signed it, and the others who were contemplating signing it. The campaign was waged through the Voice of the Arabs, which, as we have seen, dominated the airwaves of the region. Iraq lacked the capacity to take the war of words to Egypt, and possessed only limited capacity to jam the Egyptian broadcasts in its own back­yard. So unlike Egyptians who heard only one message, that of Nasir, Iraqis were exposed to two: on the one hand, their own lead­ers appealed to them to uphold the status quo and to continue along the old path of relationships and dependence on the protec­tion of the Great Powers; on the other hand, Egypt appealed for self-suf.ciency and for dependence on ones self against the greed and ill will of the foreigner. Regardless of the merits of the two messages, it was a foregone conclusion as to which of the two posi­tions would win the hearts and minds of the Arab populace, or at least of its politically in.uential segment, the rapidly expanding middle classprofessionals, army of.cers, merchants, and, cru­cially in this period, college and high school students, who quickly became Nasirs foot soldiers in their respective countries.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，除了外交之外，开罗还发动了一场针对《巴格达条约》的激烈宣传运动，反对签署该条约的人，以及其他正在考虑签署该条约的人。这场运动是通过阿拉伯人之声发起的，正如我们所看到的，阿拉伯人之声主导了该地区的电波。伊拉克缺乏将口水战带到埃及的能力，也只有有限的能力在自己的后院干扰埃及的广播。因此，与只听到纳西尔信息这一信息的埃及人不同，伊拉克人接触到了两个信息：一方面，他们自己的领导人呼吁他们维持现状，继续沿着关系和依赖大国保护的旧道路前进;另一方面，埃及呼吁自我满足，依靠自己来对抗外国人的贪婪和恶意。无论这两个信息的优点如何，这两个立场中的哪一个能够赢得阿拉伯民众的心，或者至少赢得其政治上参与的部分、迅速扩张的中产阶级专业人士、商人大军、商人，以及至关重要的这一时期的大学生和高中生的心，这已成定局， 他们很快成为各自国家的纳西尔步兵。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), March 10, 1955.

Egypts propaganda was highly incendiary, using the semantic properties of the Arabic language to foment the emotions and to boil the blood11 of its target populations. It was no coincidence that its most susceptible targets were the young, who were open more readily to emotional appeals than to rational argument. At the prompting of Egypts leadership, the Voice of the Arabs launched an onslaught against Iraqs government over the Baghdad Pact and other alleged in.delities to the nationalist cause, and took to calling Nuri al-Said a traitor.12 There was no need for further elaboration: Was it not absolutely clear to the listeners in Baghdad and other Iraqi cities that the characterization simply de.ned Nuris dependence on foreign powers to the detriment of the Arab cause? Moreover, the Voice of the Arabs found Nuris proclivity to the foreigner not at all surprising, for was Nuri himself not of Turkish descent,13 and was he not dispersing Iraqi Arab of.cers and replacing them with Turkoman of.cers to ensure the subjuga­tion of the Iraqi army and to force it to be loyal to imperialist obligations.?14 Such allegations, where the standards for precision are at best nebulous, clearly illustrate the attractiveness of propa­ganda to political leaderships. Take this case of Nuris alleged Turkish descent, which the Voice of the Arabs enunciated as an accepted truth in no need of further elaboration, to say nothing of corroboration. The truth is far more complex. Nuris family traced its ancestry and residence in Baghdad back to over three centuries to an Arab patriarch who married a Turkish woman from Constantinople. For the next three hundred years, the family lived continuously in Iraq and was accepted and respected as Arab. Nuri himself was a prominent commander of the successful 1916 Arab revolt against the Ottoman Turks.15
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的宣传具有高度煽动性，利用阿拉伯语的语义特性来煽动情绪并沸腾其目标人群的血液11。它最容易受到影响的目标是年轻人，这并非巧合，他们更容易接受情感诉求而不是理性争论。在埃及领导层的推动下，阿拉伯人之声就《巴格达条约》和其他涉嫌参与民族主义事业的行为对伊拉克政府发起了猛烈攻击，并开始称努里·赛义德为叛徒。12 没有必要进一步阐述：巴格达和其他伊拉克城市的听众难道不是绝对清楚，这种描述只是贬低了努里斯对外国势力的依赖，从而损害了阿拉伯事业吗？此外，《阿拉伯人之声》认为努里斯对外国人的倾向一点也不奇怪，因为努里本人不是土耳其人后裔，13 他不是驱散伊拉克阿拉伯人，用土库曼人取而代之，以确保征服伊拉克军队并迫使其忠于帝国主义义务。14 这种指控，其中精确的标准充其量是模糊的，但清楚地说明了宣传对政治领导人的吸引力。以努里斯声称有土耳其血统的案例为例，阿拉伯人之声将其阐述为公认的事实，无需进一步阐述，更不用说证实了。事实要复杂得多。努里斯家族在巴格达的祖先和居住地可以追溯到三个多世纪前，一位阿拉伯族长娶了一位来自君士坦丁堡的土耳其妇女。在接下来的三百年里，这个家庭一直生活在伊拉克，并被接受和尊重为阿拉伯人。努里本人是 1916 年阿拉伯反抗奥斯曼土耳其人的成功起义的杰出指挥官。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), February 18, 1957.
Al-Baghdadi, Mudhakarat Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi (Memoirs of Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi), p. 200.
The British Broadcasting Corporation, Summary of World Broadcasts, Part IV: The Arab World, Israel, Greece, Turkey, Iran (hereafter cited as SWB), March 7, 1957, p. 3.

Nuri and the Iraqi government did not remain quiet; they retali­ated, mincing no words. But in this mammoth struggle over the right to de.ne the Arab national interest, Iraq was .ghting a losing battle. It lacked the seductive appeal of Egypts message, it was no match for Cairos airwave capability, and it had no one of Nasirs charisma and mounting prestige in the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 努里和伊拉克政府并没有保持沉默;他们进行了报复，没有拐弯抹角。但在这场争夺阿拉伯国家利益 de.ne 权的巨大斗争中，伊拉克正在进行一场失败的战斗。它缺乏埃及信息的诱人吸引力，无法与开罗的电波能力相提并论，也没有纳西尔的魅力和在阿拉伯世界日益增长的声望。

content_units.text: Nasirs aura was boosted further through the emergence of a world movement of leaders who rejected alliances with either the United States or the Soviet Union, seeking instead a nonaligned position. The movements .rst major meeting took place in the Indonesian city of Bandung in April 1955. In this conference, Nasir joined some of the most prominent Third World leaders of the time, including Marshal Tito of Yugoslavia, Prime Minister Nehru of India, Premier Chou En-Lai of China, and President Sukarno of Indonesia, all of whom endeavored to stake out for their countries a neutralist position between the two seemingly irreconcilable posi­tions of East and West in those highly combustible Cold War years of the 1950s. As an international event, the meeting in Bandung attracted intense world scrutiny. Bandung con.rmed in the minds of Arabs Nasirs contention that Arab leaders can pursue policies that are independent of the West. Even more relevant to our topic, Nasirs words were treated by the other leaders as well as the media as representing not just Egypt, but the Arab world. When he spoke, he spoke with the con.dence and demeanor of someone who knew that he had the Arab populations behind him. He was becoming increasingly comfortable with his new role as the leader of Arab nationalism, and the main propagator of its message which pre­scribed the independence of the Arabs from all foreign interests and ideologies.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔的光环通过世界领导人运动的出现而得到进一步提升，他们拒绝与美国或苏联结盟，而是寻求不结盟立场。运动的第一次主要会议于 1955 年 4 月在印度尼西亚万隆市举行。在这次会议上，纳西尔与当时一些最杰出的第三世界领导人一起，包括南斯拉夫的铁托元帅、印度总理尼赫鲁、中国总理周恩来和印度尼西亚的苏加诺总统，他们都试图在1950年代高度燃烧的冷战年代，在东西方这两个看似不可调和的立场之间为他们的国家争取中立立场。作为一项国际盛会，万隆会议引起了全世界的密切关注。万隆在阿拉伯人心目中弥漫着纳西尔的论点，即阿拉伯领导人可以奉行独立于西方的政策。与我们的主题更相关的是，纳西尔的话被其他领导人和媒体视为不仅代表埃及，而且代表阿拉伯世界。当他讲话时，他以一个知道他有阿拉伯人支持的人的态度和举止说话。他越来越适应自己作为阿拉伯民族主义领袖的新角色，以及阿拉伯民族主义信息的主要传播者，该信息规定阿拉伯人独立于所有外国利益和意识形态。

content_units.text: If some Arabs thought that Nasirs independent position en­tailed a rich glossary of words, but lacked any substance, Nasir was soon to confound them. On September 27, 1955, he signed an arms deal with Czechoslovakia, breaking Western monopoly over the sale of arms in the region. Admittedly, this was not the .rst arms deal with a Soviet bloc country signed by an Arab state. Syria had already received a few arms from the Soviet bloc, which had created some concern in Western capitals. But the announcement of the Czech arms deal involving the most powerful Arab country, signed by a man increasingly perceived as the charismatic leader of the Arab nationalist march, was bound to create severe consterna­tion bordering on panic among the Western powers and their allies in the area.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果一些阿拉伯人认为纳西尔的独立立场需要丰富的词汇表，但缺乏任何实质内容，那么纳西尔很快就会让他们感到困惑。1955年9月27日，他与捷克斯洛伐克签署了一项军火协议，打破了西方对该地区军售的垄断。诚然，这不是阿拉伯国家与苏联集团国家签署的第一笔军火交易。叙利亚已经从苏联集团那里获得了一些武器，这在西方国家首都引起了一些担忧。但是，捷克宣布涉及最强大的阿拉伯国家的军火交易，由一个越来越被认为是阿拉伯民族主义游行的魅力领袖的人签署，势必会在西方列强及其在该地区的盟友中引起近乎恐慌的严重恐慌。

content_units.text: See Waldeman J. Gallman, Iraq Under General Nuri: My Recollections of Nuri al­Said, 19541958 (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1964), pp. 912; also Lord Birdwood, Nuri As-Said: A Study in Arab Leadership (London: Cassell, 1959), pp. 89.

The roots of the Czech arms deal lay primarily in the Arab-Israeli con.ict. It was not just pro-Western Arab leaders who were be­coming wary of Nasirs mounting popularity among their popula­tions. The Israelis also worried about the possible deleterious consequences of the rising tide of militant Arab nationalism under Nasirs leadership on their young country. There were already some in.ltrations into Israel from Egypt carried out by Palestinian and Egyptian commandos calling themselves the fedayyin (mar­tyrs). David Ben-Gurion, the father of the state of Israel, was espe­cially irked. He was convinced that the Israelis had to teach Nasir a lesson, perhaps even remove him from power. It is de.nitely possible to topple him, Ben-Gurion told his cabinet colleagues, and it is even a mitzvah [a sacred obligation] to do so. Who is he anyway, this Nasser-Shmasser?16 One way to undermine the popularity of the Egyptian president among the Arabs was to show him up as militarily impotent. This way he would be cut down to size from the leader of Arab nationalism to a mere Nasser-Shmas­ser. So on February 28, 1955, Israeli forces led by Ariel Sharon (later to be elected Israeli prime minister in February 2001) launched a massive raid on the Egyptian-controlled Gaza Strip, de­stroying its military headquarters, killing thirty-eight soldiers, and wounding thirty-one.
content_units.azure_translation: 捷克军火交易的根源主要在于阿拉伯-以色列的冲突。不仅仅是亲西方的阿拉伯领导人对纳西尔人在其民众中越来越受欢迎感到警惕。以色列人还担心，在纳西尔的领导下，好战的阿拉伯民族主义浪潮可能对他们年轻的国家造成有害后果。已经有一些巴勒斯坦和埃及突击队从埃及进入以色列，自称是 fedayyin（烈士）。以色列国之父大卫·本-古里安（David Ben-Gurion）尤其恼火。他坚信以色列人必须给纳西尔一个教训，甚至可能将他赶下台。本-古里安告诉他的内阁同事，推翻他是绝对有可能的，这样做甚至是一种成人礼（一项神圣的义务）。他到底是谁，这个纳赛尔-什马瑟？16 削弱埃及总统在阿拉伯人中的声望的一个方法是将他展示为军事上无能为力。这样一来，他就会从阿拉伯民族主义的领袖缩小到一个仅仅是纳赛尔-什马瑟的领袖。于是在1955年2月28日，阿里尔·沙龙（后来于2001年2月当选以色列总理）率领的以色列军队对埃及控制的加沙地带发动了大规模的突袭，摧毁了其军事总部，造成38名士兵死亡，31人受伤。

content_units.text: Quoted in Avi Shlaim, The Iron Wall: Israel and the Arab World (New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 2000), pp. 135136.

Nasir was just as aware of the deleterious impact of the raid on his image as the dynamic leader of an ascendant nationalist move­ment. He had indeed tried to buy weapons from the British and the Americans but all he got were a few Centurion tanks which in no way matched the substantial arms deliveries Israel was begin­ning to receive from the French.17 And the Americans .atly refused a $27 million arms request from Nasir on the .imsy grounds that Egypt was unable to pay for them in hard currency.18 So during the Bandung Conference, Nasir approached the Chinese premier, Chou En-Lai, and inquired as to whether China would be prepared to sell Egypt arms. Chou En-Lai declined, citing Chinas own de­pendence on Russian arms, but promised to pass Egypts request to the Soviets, who did not take long to agree.19 The Czech arms deal was basically a deal with the Soviets that used Czechoslovakia as an intermediary.20
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔同样意识到这次突袭对他作为正在兴起的民族主义运动的充满活力的领导人的形象的有害影响。他确实试图从英国和美国人那里购买武器，但他得到的只是几辆百夫长坦克，这与以色列开始从法国获得的大量武器交付完全不相上下。17 美国人拒绝了纳西尔提出的 2700 万美元武器请求，理由是埃及无法用硬通货支付这些武器。18 因此，在万隆会议期间， 纳西尔找到了中国总理周恩来，询问中国是否准备向埃及出售武器。周恩来以中国自己对俄罗斯武器的依赖为由拒绝了，但承诺将埃及的请求转达给苏联，苏联很快就同意了。19 捷克的武器交易基本上是与苏联达成的协议，以捷克斯洛伐克为中间人。

content_units.text: The arms deal allowed for the .rst real penetration by the Soviet Union into Arab and Middle East politics, which was to diametri­cally change the balance of forces in the area. From then on the West lost its monopoly over security (and eventually political) af­fairs of the region, which in Arab eyes became the ultimate vindica­tion of Nasirs argument for Arab independence. Even Jordans King Husayn, hardly a disciple of Nasir, would admit to the wider impact of the arms deal:
content_units.azure_translation: 军火交易使苏联第一次真正渗透到阿拉伯和中东政治中，这将彻底改变该地区的力量平衡。从那时起，西方失去了对该地区安全（并最终是政治）事务的垄断，在阿拉伯人眼中，这成为纳西尔主张阿拉伯独立的论点的最终证明。即使是几乎不是纳西尔门徒的约旦国王侯赛因也会承认军火交易的更广泛影响：

content_units.text: Then the bombshell fell on the Arab world [when] Nasser an­nounced his now historic arms deal with the Soviet bloc. In an in­stant, everything changed. Hundreds of thousands of Jordanians, listening avidly to the propaganda on Cairo Radio, saw in Nasser a mystical sort of savior and . . . their best bet for their future against Israel. [All] they saw was . . . that Nasser was the .rst Arab states­ man really to throw off the shackles of the West. I must admit I sympathized with the point of view to a great extent.21
content_units.azure_translation: 然后，当纳赛尔宣布与苏联集团达成历史性的军火交易时，重磅炸弹落在了阿拉伯世界。瞬间，一切都变了。成千上万的约旦人热切地听着开罗广播电台的宣传，在纳赛尔身上看到了一种神秘的救世主和......他们未来对抗以色列的最佳选择。他们看到的只是......纳赛尔是第一个真正摆脱西方枷锁的阿拉伯国家的人。我必须承认，我在很大程度上同情这种观点。

content_units.text: Stephens, Nasser: A Political Biography, p. 157.
Humphrey Trevelyan, The Middle East in Revolution (London: Macmillan, 1970), pp. 2728.
Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Murra (Harvest: fertile years, bitter fruit), p. 276.
Karen Dawisha, Soviet Foreign Policy Towards Egypt (London: Macmillan, 1979), p. 11.

Indeed Husayns own parliament cabled Nasir a unanimous res­olution, whose language clearly illustrates the image of Nasir held by the Arab populations: The Jordanian Chamber of Deputies congratulates you, the soul of Arabism, and supports you in all your efforts in securing arms without any restrictions or conditions for the defense of the Arab countries.22 Not only was Nasir de­scribed as the soul of Arabism in a country whose king also lay claim to the same designation, but the deputies saw the arms deal as enhancing not necessarily the security of Egypt but the defense of the Arab countries.
content_units.azure_translation: 事实上，侯赛因自己的议会向纳西尔发出了一项一致决议，其语言清楚地说明了阿拉伯人民所持有的纳西尔形象：约旦众议院祝贺你，阿拉伯主义的灵魂，并支持你为确保武器而做出的一切努力，而没有任何限制或条件地保卫阿拉伯国家。22 纳西尔不仅被描述为阿拉伯主义的灵魂，而该国的国王也声称拥有同样的称号，而且代表们认为军火交易不一定加强了埃及的安全，而且加强了阿拉伯国家的防御。

content_units.text: Thus there was much rejoicing in the Arab world. The people who took to the streets in Damascus, Baghdad, Amman, and even the cities of the conservative and less developed Gulf protector­ates,23 saw in the Czech arms deal not just an assertion of Egyptian independence, but an Arab victory over imperialism and its ille­gitimate offspring, Israel. Not one for an understatement, the Voice of the Arabs trumpeted the deal for months afterward as a momentous juncture in the historical march of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，阿拉伯世界充满了欢乐。在大马士革、巴格达、安曼，甚至保守的、欠发达的海湾保护国城市走上街头的人们，23 在捷克的军火交易中不仅看到了埃及独立的主张，而且看到了阿拉伯对帝国主义及其非法后代以色列的胜利。阿拉伯人之声毫不轻描淡写，在几个月后大肆宣扬该协议，认为这是阿拉伯民族主义历史进程中的一个重要时刻。

content_units.text: If by now some Arab leaders still doubted the adulation of Nasir felt by their own citizens, the events surrounding Jordans efforts to join the Baghdad Pact were to erase any such doubts summarily. King Husayn had been cool to the idea of joining the Iraqi-Turkish alliance because he believed that Jordan would get nothing addi­tional out of it except abuse from Egyptian propaganda.24 But frustrated by their inability to draw other Arab countries into the Pact, and fearing that they were losing the battle against Nasir and his propaganda, Iraq, Turkey, and Britain made a concerted effort to bring the pro-Western Hashemite Jordan into their agreement. Iraq promised .nancial aid,25 Turkey hinted at bolstering Jordans defense against Israel and Syria,26 and Britain offered 5.5 million pounds sterling in arms, more aid for industrial and energy devel­opment, and a promise to revise the Anglo-Jordanian treaty.27 Brit­ain dispatched its chief of staff, Sir Gerald Templer, in early Decem­ber 1955 to present the aid package to the Jordanians and to discuss the mechanics of Jordans membership in the pact. Egypt immediately unleashed a violent verbal onslaught against the Tem­pler mission, and the country witnessed a wave of riots, demonstra­tions, and strikes that shook the very foundation of Husayns polit­ical order.28 Interesting enough, the most telling and vivid description of the political crisis in Jordan that followed the Tem­pler mission is told by the king himself:
content_units.azure_translation: 如果说到目前为止，一些阿拉伯领导人仍然怀疑本国公民对纳西尔的崇拜，那么围绕约旦加入巴格达条约的努力的事件将立即消除任何此类疑虑。侯赛因国王对加入伊拉克-土耳其联盟的想法很冷静，因为他相信约旦除了埃及宣传的滥用之外，不会从中得到任何额外的好处。24 但伊拉克、土耳其和英国对他们无法吸引其他阿拉伯国家加入《条约》感到沮丧，并且担心他们在与纳西尔及其宣传的战斗中失败，因此齐心协力将亲西方的哈希姆约旦纳入他们的协议。伊拉克承诺提供财政援助，25 土耳其暗示要加强约旦对以色列和叙利亚的防御，26 英国提供了 550 万英镑的武器，为工业和能源发展提供更多援助，并承诺修改英约条约。27 1955 年 12 月初，英国派遣参谋长杰拉尔德·坦普勒爵士向约旦人提交援助计划，并讨论约旦加入该条约的机制。埃及立即对坦普勒传教团发动了猛烈的口头攻击，该国目睹了一波骚乱、示威和罢工，动摇了侯赛因政治秩序的根基。28 有趣的是，对坦普勒传教团之后约旦政治危机最有说服力和生动的描述是国王亲自讲述的：

Still we might have held on, but on December 19, the Minister of Interior and two others of Majalis government resigned. Majali tried to .nd replacements but in vain. Riots such as we had never seen before . . . disrupted the entire country. This time bands of arsonists started burning gov­ernment of.ces, private houses, foreign properties. I had no alterna­tive but to call out the Legion (army), who with tear gas and determi­nation met force with force. I imposed a ten-day curfew on the country.29
