In addition to calling the Jordanian army to restore order in the streets of the Jordanian cities, the position of the king had become so precarious that he also was compelled to ask for Iraqi troops.30 Indeed, panic had spread to Whitehall. Britains prime minister, Anthony Eden, dispatched two parachute battalions and a battal­ion of Highland Light Infantry to Cyprus. He also ordered the ar­mored regiment at Aqaba to move closer to Amman.31 Finally, yet another hastily appointed prime minister, Samir Rifai, conceded that the Jordanian government no longer contemplated joining the Baghdad Pact. Only then was calm restored, and life returned to normal. Nasir had won, and won big. He had imposed his will on a recalcitrant Arab leader not through military force, but through manipulating the sentiments of that leaders own population. And those sentiments were aroused by Nasirs invocation of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 除了召集约旦军队恢复约旦城市街道的秩序外，国王的地位也变得如此不稳定，以至于他还被迫要求伊拉克军队。30 事实上，恐慌已经蔓延到白厅。英国首相安东尼·伊登向塞浦路斯派遣了两个伞兵营和一个高地轻步兵营。他还命令亚喀巴的装甲团向安曼靠拢。31 最后，另一位仓促任命的总理萨米尔·里法伊承认，约旦政府不再考虑加入《巴格达条约》。这才恢复了平静，生活也恢复了正常。纳西尔赢了，而且大赢。他不是通过军事力量，而是通过纵该领导人本国人民的情绪，将自己的意志强加给一位顽固的阿拉伯领导人。而这些情绪是由纳西尔援引阿拉伯民族主义而激起的。

content_units.text: The Jordanian events not only stopped the Hashemite kingdom from entering the Baghdad Pact, but it also sent a message of dire warning to any other Arab country that might have been contem­plating joining the Western-inspired alliance. And indeed, the
content_units.azure_translation: 约旦事件不仅阻止了哈希姆王国加入《巴格达条约》，而且还向任何其他可能正在考虑加入西方启发的联盟的阿拉伯国家发出了可怕的警告。事实上，

content_units.text: Hussein, Uneasy Lies the Head, pp. 110112. 30 Yaghi, al-Ilaqat al-Iraqiya al-Urdiniya (Iraqi-Jordanian relations), p. 41. 31 Snow, Hussein: A Biography,p.79.

Baghdad Pact never expanded in the Arab world and was .nally put to rest in 1959 when the new republican government of Iraq withdrew its membership. The Pact was to be given another life as the Central Treaty Organization (CENTO), with regional member­ship limited to Turkey, Iran, and Pakistan. However, lacking the involvement of any country from the Arab core, CENTO was a mere shadow of what Dulles and the original planners had hoped to achieve.
content_units.azure_translation: 《巴格达条约》从未在阿拉伯世界扩张，并于 1959 年伊拉克新共和政府退出其成员资格后被搁置。该条约将作为中央条约组织 （CENTO） 获得另一次生命，区域成员仅限于土耳其、伊朗和巴基斯坦。然而，由于缺乏任何阿拉伯核心国家的参与，CENTO 只是杜勒斯和最初规划者希望实现的目标的影子。

content_units.text: Egypts victory had much to do with Nasirs charisma (or his mystique as King Husayn put it in his memoirs) and Egypts over­whelming preponderance in the battle of the airwaves. But success would not have come so readily had it not been for the power of the message. The Jordanian events of December 1955 constituted the .rst actual illustration of the power of Arab nationalism. In­deed a rational assessment of Jordanian national interest supports Husayns position. Britain had pledged to embark upon a quantita­tive and qualitative improvement of the Jordanian armed forces, and along with Iraq, promised Jordan badly needed economic aid. There was also a commitment to revise the Anglo-Jordanian treaty in Jordans favor. But it was not rationality, the national interest, or power politics that drove the Jordanian rioters; it was the emo­tional and mystical power of Arab nationalism, articulated by a charismatic leader, that brought the Jordanians onto the streets. The struggle over the Baghdad Pact ushered in a period in the his­tory of the region in which Arab nationalism became the uncon­tested ideological force among citizens of the countries and areas that called themselves Arab.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的胜利与纳西尔的魅力（或者侯赛因国王在他的回忆录中所说的他的神秘感）和埃及在电波之战中的压倒性优势有很大关系。但如果不是因为信息的力量，成功不会如此容易到来。1955 年 12 月的约旦事件构成了阿拉伯民族主义力量的第一个实际例证。事实上，对约旦国家利益的理性评估支持侯赛恩斯的立场。英国曾承诺着手对约旦武装部队进行数量和质量的改进，并与伊拉克一起承诺约旦急需经济援助。还承诺以有利于约旦的方式修改英约条约。但驱使约旦骚乱者的不是理性、国家利益或强权政治;正是阿拉伯民族主义的情感和神秘力量，由一位魅力十足的领导人阐明，将约旦人带到了街头。围绕《巴格达条约》的斗争开启了该地区历史上的一段时期，在这个时期，阿拉伯民族主义成为自称阿拉伯的国家和地区的公民中无可争议的意识形态力量。

content_units.text: The post Baghdad Pact era brings to mind Benedict Andersons de.nition of a nation as an imagined community:
content_units.azure_translation: 后巴格达条约时代让人想起本尼迪克特·安德森（Benedict Anderson）将一个国家视为一个想象中的社区：

content_units.text: It is imagined because the members of even the smallest nation will never know most of their fellow members, meet them, or even hear of them, yet in the minds of each lives the image of their communion.32
content_units.azure_translation: 之所以被想象，是因为即使是最小的国家的成员也永远不会认识他们的大多数成员，见到他们，甚至听说过他们，但在每个人的脑海中都活着他们共融的形象32。

content_units.text: Benedict Anderson, Imagined Communities: Re.ections on the Origins and Spread of Nationalism (New York: Simon and Schuster, 1993), p. 6.

During the few years that followed the Baghdad Pact, particularly 19551958, which represent the apex of the Arab nationalist tide, an Iraqi lawyer, a Jordanian student, a Bahraini poet, a Syrian doc­tor, and a Moroccan businessman would not have known one an­other by name or profession, but by adhering to the Arab national­ist creed, they were indeed but one fraternity, sharing in convictions and aspirations. Such individuals would not have known of each others existence, and, given the wide regional variations in the dialects of the Arabic language, might not have conversed easily had they met, but in these few and fateful years, they belonged to one another spiritually, for indeed, in the minds of each lived the image of their communion.
content_units.azure_translation: 在《巴格达条约》签署后的几年里，特别是代表阿拉伯民族主义浪潮顶峰的19551958，一名伊拉克律师、一名约旦学生、一名巴林诗人、一名叙利亚医生和一名摩洛哥商人不会在名字或职业上相识，但通过坚持阿拉伯民族主义信条，他们确实只是一个兄弟会， 分享信念和愿望。这些人不会知道彼此的存在，而且考虑到阿拉伯语方言的地区差异很大，如果他们相遇，可能不会轻易交谈，但在这为数不多的、决定性的岁月里，他们在精神上属于彼此，因为事实上，在每个人的脑海中都活着他们交流的形象。

content_units.text: The old world was crumbling: traditional values and customs were questioned, old patterns of authority were coming increas­ingly under attack, and Nasirist Arab nationalism was leading the assault everywhere in the Arab world, even in its remotest areas and most traditional parts. R. Stephen Humphreys relates the expe­rience of a young British scholar:
content_units.azure_translation: 旧世界正在崩溃：传统价值观和习俗受到质疑，旧的权威模式越来越受到攻击，纳西尔主义的阿拉伯民族主义在阿拉伯世界的任何地方都引领着攻击，甚至在最偏远的地区和最传统的地区也是如此。R. Stephen Humphreys 讲述了一位年轻英国学者的经历：

content_units.text: A friend and I were in Seyyum, one of the ancient towns of the great eastern wadi of Hadhramaut (in Yemen), dominated by a highly in.uential clan of sherifs, descendants of the Prophet Muham­mad.... Two young men of that family met us in the street . . . the green band around their turbans . . . signi.ed their holiness and the precedence of their position.... The fullness of sanctity and a ritual­ized sense of gracious order and harmony were added to when a student of mine encountered in the street stooped respectfully to kiss the young sherifs hands as we passed. . . . A day later I met the student, a boy in his late teens like myself. He delivered [a] blow. We kiss their hands now, he said, but just wait till tomorrow. He was a Nasserist . . . he belonged to a cultural club in which most of the young men were sympathizers with the cause of the Egyptian President. The cause was identi.ed as that of all Arabs against impe­rialism and the control of conservative and reactionary forces.33
content_units.azure_translation: 我和一个朋友在塞尤姆，这是哈德拉毛特（也门）东部大河谷的古镇之一，由一个高度重要的谢里夫氏族统治，他们是先知穆罕默德的后裔......那个家庭的两个年轻人在街上遇见了我们......头巾周围的绿色带子......表明他们的圣洁和地位的优先权......当我们在街上遇到的一个学生在我们经过时恭敬地弯腰亲吻年轻警长的手时，神圣的充实和亲切的秩序与和谐的仪式感又增添了。一天后，我遇到了那个学生，一个和我一样十几岁的男孩。他打了一击。他说，我们现在亲吻他们的手，但要等到明天。他是一个纳赛尔主义者......他属于一个文化俱乐部，其中大多数年轻人都同情埃及总统的事业。其事业被认定为所有阿拉伯人反对帝国主义和控制保守和反动势力的事业33。

content_units.text: R. Stephen Humphreys, Between Memory and Desire: The Middle East in a Troubled Age (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1999), pp. 135136.

Arab nationalism was also making inroads into some of the most intractable communal divides. Take the case of the pronounced Sunni-Shiite divide in Iraq. As the country secularized, and the in­.uence of religious schools waned,34 more Shiite Iraqis participated in the body politic. Some worked within the system and rose to positions of political prominence, others joined the underground political opposition. During the 1940s and early 1950s, many of the Shiite youth gravitated away from the Arab nationalist groups and toward the Communist Party.35 One of the reasons for this was Shiite concern that Arab nationalism was essentially a Sunni project aimed at uniting the Arab states, whose populations were predominantly Sunni, thus rendering the Iraqi Shiites (a majority in Iraq) an insigni.cant minority. But if there was one period where this sectarian divide was at its lowest, it was during the 1950s, and particularly in this 19551958 period. It was not as though all Shiites became ardent nationalists, but more of them joined the nationalist ranks, be it as Nasirists, Qawmiyeen Arab (Arab na­tionalists), or Bathists. Indeed, of the seventeen members of Iraqs Bath Party leadership in the 1950s, eight were Shiites, including the secretary-general, Fuad al-Rikabi.36 More signi.cantly, as na­tionalists, especially in the mid-1950s, their identity was increas­ingly de.ned by their nationalism, so that their sectarian af.lia­tions became unimportant, not worth even inquiring about. Taleb Shabib, the .rst foreign minister in the Bathist government that took over power from Abd al-Karim Qasim in February 1963, says that members of the party command never discussed, indeed were unaware of, each others sectarian denominations.37
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义也正在侵入一些最棘手的社区分歧。以伊拉克明显的逊尼派和什叶派分歧为例。随着国家世俗化，宗教学校的兴起逐渐减弱，34 更多的什叶派伊拉克人参与了政治。一些人在体制内工作并晋升到政治显赫职位，另一些人则加入了地下政治反对派。在 1940 年代和 1950 年代初期，许多什叶派青年从阿拉伯民族主义团体转向共产党。35 造成这种情况的原因之一是什叶派担心阿拉伯民族主义本质上是一个逊尼派项目，旨在团结阿拉伯国家，这些国家的人口主要是逊尼派，从而使伊拉克什叶派（伊拉克占多数）成为少数派。但是，如果说有哪个时期这种教派分歧处于最低水平，那就是在 1950 年代，尤其是在这个19551958时期。并不是说所有什叶派都成为了狂热的民族主义者，而是更多的什叶派加入了民族主义的行列，无论是纳西尔主义者、阿拉伯民族主义者还是巴蒂斯特。事实上，在1950年代伊拉克巴斯党领导层的17名成员中，有8名是什叶派，包括秘书长福阿德·里卡比（Fuad al-Rikabi）。36更重要的是，作为民族主义者，特别是在1950年代中期，他们的身份越来越被他们的民族主义所剥夺，因此他们的宗派关系变得不重要，甚至不值得询问。1963年2月从阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·卡西姆手中接过权力的巴斯派政府的第一任外交部长塔勒布·沙比卜（Taleb Shabib）说，党指挥部成员从未讨论过，事实上也不知道彼此的教派教派37。

content_units.text: At the turn of the twentieth century, over 8,000 students attended Shiite madrasas (religious schools) in Iraqs holy Shiite city of Najaf. By 1957, the number had dwindled to 1,954. See Yitzhak Nakash, The Shiis of Iraq (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1994), p. 254
See Liona Lukitz, Iraq: The Search for National Identity (London: Frank Cass, 1995), pp. 151153.

Hanna Batatu, The Old Social Classes and the Revolutionary Movements of Iraq: A Study of Iraqs Old Landed and Commercial Classes and of its Communists, Bathists and Free Of.cers (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1978), pp. 12161218.
See Ali Karim Said, Iraq 8Shibat, 1963: Min Hiwar al-Mafahim ila Hiwar al-Damm, Murajaat . Dhikrayat Taleb Shabib (Iraq of 8 February, 1963: from a dialogue over norms

The next momentous event contributing to the upward march of the Arab nationalist movement was the 1956 Suez CrisisNasirs nationalization of the Anglo-French owned Suez Canal Company and the ensuing invasion of Egypt by Israel, Britain, and France. The crisis could be traced back to the efforts by Nasir and his col­leagues to build the Aswan Dam, which since the .rst year of the Egyptian revolution had been the major development scheme planned by the new regime. The Dam had been constantly trum­peted as the symbol of a new dynamic and industrialized Egypt. As it was conceived, the Dam would extend continuous irrigation to Upper Egypt, enabling over 125 million acres of arid land to be cultivated. The Dam would also provide the necessary electric power to ful.ll the extensive industrialization program that Nasir hoped would give Egypt complete self-suf.ciency and help it catch up to the advanced and industrial West. In December 1955, the United States, Great Britain, and the World Bank offered to assist Egypt in building the Dam. This offer was accompanied, however, by several conditions, including World Bank supervision of Egypts budget and its balance of payments, as well as an Egyptian commit­ment not to seek aid from Communist sources. Nasir balked at such stipulations, which amounted, in his opinion, to foreign con­trol over Egypts economy and foreign policy. The United States and Britain, on the other hand, had decided at the time the offer was made that Nasirs response to the conditions attached to the offer would be an important factor in assessing future prospects for his cooperation with the West.38 As Nasir hesitated and demurred through the early months of 1956, Dulles and Britains prime min­ister, Anthony Eden, the Czech arms deal still fresh in their minds, decided that the Egyptian leader was surreptitiously negotiating a separate deal with the Soviet Union. Then two events occurred that were to .nally deal a deathblow to the Western offer of aid.
content_units.azure_translation: 促进阿拉伯民族主义运动向上发展的下一个重大事件是 1956 年苏伊士危机纳西尔将英法拥有的苏伊士运河公司国有化以及随后以色列、英国和法国入侵埃及。这场危机可以追溯到纳西尔和他的同事们为建造阿斯旺大坝所做的努力，自埃及革命第一年以来，阿斯旺大坝一直是新政权计划的主要发展计划。大坝一直被吹捧为一个充满活力和工业化的新埃及的象征。正如其设想的那样，大坝将持续灌溉延伸至上埃及，使超过 1.25 亿英亩的干旱土地得以耕种。大坝还将提供必要的电力来实现纳西尔希望的广泛工业化计划，这将使埃及完全自给自足，并帮助其赶上先进的工业化西方。1955年12月，美国、英国和世界银行提出协助埃及修建大坝。然而，这一提议伴随着几个条件，包括世界银行对埃及预算及其国际收支的监督，以及埃及承诺不向共产党寻求援助。纳西尔对这些规定犹豫不决，在他看来，这相当于外国对埃及经济和外交政策的控制。另一方面，美国和英国在提出提议时就决定，纳西尔对提议所附条件的反应将是评估他与西方合作的未来前景的一个重要因素。38 当纳西尔在 1956 年初的几个月里犹豫不决时，杜勒斯和英国首相， 安东尼·伊登（Anthony Eden）对捷克的军火交易记忆犹新，他认为埃及领导人正在秘密地与苏联谈判一项单独的协议。然后发生了两件事，对西方的援助提出造成了致命打击。

content_units.text: In March 1956, King Husayn of Jordan dismissed John Glubb, the British commander of the Arab Legion, Jordans armed forces.
content_units.azure_translation: 1956年3月，约旦国王侯赛因解雇了约旦武装部队阿拉伯军团的英国指挥官约翰·格鲁布。

content_units.text: to a dialogue of blood: reviews in the memory of Taleb Shabib) (Beirut: Dar al-Kunuz al­Adabiya, 1999), pp. 307314.
content_units.azure_translation: 血的对话：纪念塔勒布·沙比卜的评论）（贝鲁特：Dar al-Kunuz alAdabiya，1999年），第307314页。

content_units.text: Anthony Eden, Full Circle (London: Cassell, 1960), p. 335.

The king obviously had been stung by Egyptian radio attacks dur­ing the Templer affair, and the radios constant taunting of Husayn for allowing an Englishman to command the army of his Arab country. Was this not the irrefutable proof, Egyptian radio asked repeatedly, that Jordan was nothing more than Britains hand­maid? The king realized that as long as Glubb was his army chief, he would continue to be the punching bag of Egypts propagan­dists. Beyond that, the Sandhurst-trained young monarch, who fancied himself as a military man, became increasingly jealous of Glubb and his ubiquitous control of the Legionhence, Glubbs sudden and unceremonious dismissal.
content_units.azure_translation: 在坦普勒事件期间，国王显然被埃及的无线电攻击所刺痛，无线电不断嘲笑侯赛因允许一个英国人指挥他的阿拉伯国家的军队。埃及广播电台一再问，这难道不是无可辩驳的证据吗，约旦只不过是英国的婢女吗？国王意识到，只要格鲁布是他的陆军首领，他就会继续成为埃及宣传人员的出气筒。除此之外，这位受过桑德赫斯特训练的年轻君主，自诩为军人，越来越嫉妒格鲁布和他对军团无处不在的控制因此，格鲁布斯突然毫不客气地被解雇。

content_units.text: Whatever the reason for Glubbs dismissal, Eden blamed it en­tirely on Nasir.39 From then on, Eden was determined to rid the world of this new menace to British and Western interests. When the minister of state for foreign affairs, Anthony Nutting, sent him a memo citing the possibility of political chaos in Egypt if Nasir were to be removed, and suggesting instead various means for po­litically neutralizing the Egyptian leader, Eden called him on the phone, shouting: [W]hats all this poppycock youve sent me? . . . whats all this nonsense about isolating Nasser, or neutralizing him, as you call it? I want him destroyed, cant you understand? I want him removed.... And I dont give a damn if theres anarchy and chaos in Egypt.40
content_units.azure_translation: 无论格鲁布斯被解雇的原因是什么，伊登都将其完全归咎于纳西尔。39 从那时起，伊登决心让世界摆脱这种对英国和西方利益的新威胁。当外交部国务部长安东尼·纳廷给他发了一份备忘录，提到如果纳西尔被罢免，埃及可能会出现政治混乱，并建议采取各种手段在政治上压制这位埃及领导人时，伊登打电话给他，大喊道：你送给我的这些罂粟花是怎么回事？. . .你所说的孤立纳赛尔或压制他，这有什么废话？我要毁掉他，你难道不明白吗？我希望他被除名......如果埃及出现无政府状态和混乱，我也不在乎。40

content_units.text: If the dismissal of Glubb brought Edens ire upon Nasir, then Egypts recognition of the Peoples Republic of China in May 1956 was to incur the wrath of John Foster Dulles. Abd al-Latif al-Bagh­dadi, a senior member of Egypts political elite, relates that Egypt, having placed itself .rmly in the nonaligned camp, could no longer go along with the American charade of positing the government of the tiny island of Formosa (later to be named Taiwan) as the real and legitimate representative of the Chinese people. Moreover, the Soviet leader, Nikita Khrushchev, had declared his willingness to join the West in an arms control regime in the Middle East. In case this were to happen, Egypt felt that recognition of China would give the Soviets the necessary camou.age to send arms to Egypt through a third channel, namely China.41 Dulles, however, had lit­tle time for such reasoning. He viewed Egypts recognition of China as further proof of Nasirs irreversible tilt toward the Communist world. On July 19, 1956, the offer of assistance to Egypt was of.­cially withdrawn because the ability of Egypt to devote adequate resources to assure the projects success has become more uncertain than at the time the offer was made.42 It was not just a rejection, but a humiliating public slap in the face, implying Egypts lack of credit worthiness.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果说格鲁布的解雇让伊登斯对纳西尔感到愤怒，那么埃及在 1956 年 5 月承认中华人民共和国就会招致约翰·福斯特·杜勒斯的愤怒。埃及政治精英的高级成员阿卜杜勒·拉蒂夫·巴格达迪（Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi）说，埃及已经将自己置于不结盟阵营中，不能再配合美国的骗局，将福尔摩沙小岛（后来命名为台湾）的政府作为中国人民的真正合法代表。此外，苏联领导人尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫（Nikita Khrushchev）已宣布愿意加入西方的行列，建立中东军备控制制度。如果这种情况发生，埃及认为承认中国将使苏联获得必要的伪装，以便通过第三条渠道（即中国）向埃及运送武器。41 然而，杜勒斯几乎没有时间进行这样的推理。他认为埃及对中国的承认进一步证明了纳西尔对共产主义世界的不可逆转的倾向。1956 年 7 月 19 日，对埃及的援助提议被撤回，因为埃及投入足够资源确保项目成功的能力比提出提议时更加不确定。42 这不仅仅是拒绝，而是羞辱性的公开耳光，暗示埃及缺乏信誉。

content_units.text: The announcement of Glubbs dismissal came when the British foreign secretary, Sel­wyn Lloyd, who was in Cairo, was returning from dinner with Nasir. Lloyd thought that Nasir had known about the news from Amman all along and had kept it from him to mock and humiliate him and Britain. Nasir, however, had been as surprised as everyone else by the news of Glubbs removal, which resulted from mounting personal jealousies and antag­onisms between the king and his British army commander. See Stephens, Nasser: A Politi­cal Biography, pp. 179180.
Anthony Nutting, No End of a Lesson (London: Constable, 1967), pp. 3435.

Infuriated, Nasir, in a major speech a week later, declared that since the West was unwilling to help .nance the Aswan Dam, Egypt had no alternative but to raise the money on its own. This could only be achieved by nationalizing the Suez Canal Company. A law nationalizing the Anglo-French company followed, with Nasir pointedly reminding his ecstatic audience that the moment should be cherished not only by Egyptians but by all Arabs for it was an af.rmation of Arab sovereignty, dignity, and pride, and a victory for the Arabs and their triumphant nationalism over the per.dious forces of colonialism and imperialism.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔愤怒地在一周后的一次重要演讲中宣称，由于西方不愿意帮助阿斯旺大坝，埃及别无选择，只能自己筹集资金。这只能通过苏伊士运河公司国有化来实现。随后，英法公司国有化，纳西尔尖锐地提醒他欣喜若狂的听众，不仅埃及人，而且所有阿拉伯人都应该珍惜这一时刻，因为这是阿拉伯主权、尊严和自豪感的体现，也是阿拉伯人及其民族主义战胜殖民主义和帝国主义势力的胜利。

content_units.text: The decision was not as spontaneous as it might have seemed. Nasir had spent the week after Dulless announcement of the with­drawal of the American aid offer for the Dam trying to assess the possible international responses to the nationalization of the Suez Canal Company, and whether these warranted a delay or even an abandonment of the decision.43 He concluded that Dulles, while sharing Edens concerns, was not eager to use military means, but preferred economic and .nancial pressures on Egypt. As for the French, Nasir was con.dent that they were so mired in the escalat­ing violence of the Algerian revolution that they simply would not be able to muster additional forces for a military operation against Egypt. And he never entertained the possibility of an Israeli involve­ment in an attack on Egypt. But that was not his assessment of British responses. Nasir was certain that Eden would contemplate military action; but on analyzing the existing geostrategic situation of Britains military power in the region, he felt that, in light of Egypts dire .nancial needs, the risk was worth taking. In an inter­view six years later, he expounded on his thinking at the time:
content_units.azure_translation: 这个决定并不像看起来那么自发。在杜勒斯宣布撤回美国对大坝的援助提议后的一周里，纳西尔试图评估国际社会对苏伊士运河公司国有化可能做出的反应，以及这些反应是否值得推迟甚至放弃该决定。43 他得出的结论是，杜勒斯虽然与伊甸园有同样的担忧，但并不急于使用军事手段， 而是更愿意对埃及施加经济和金融压力。至于法国人，纳西尔认为他们深陷阿尔及利亚革命不断升级的暴力之中，根本无法召集更多部队对埃及采取军事行动。他从未考虑过以色列参与对埃及的袭击的可能性。但这并不是他对英国反应的评估。纳西尔确信伊甸园会考虑采取军事行动;但在分析英国在该地区军事力量的现有地缘战略形势时，他认为，鉴于埃及迫切的财政需求，冒险是值得的。六年后的一次采访中，他阐述了自己当时的想法：

content_units.text: Al-Baghdadi, Mudhakarat Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi (Memoirs of Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi), pp. 315316.
N. Frankland and V. King, eds., Documents on International Affairs, 1956 (London: Oxford University Press, 1959), pp. 6970.
See Salah Nasr, Abd al-Nasir wa Tajribat al-Wuhda (Abd al-Nasir and the experiment of unity) (Beirut: al-Watan al-Arabi, 1976), pp. 8587.

Basically, [the problem] became a simple one. There could be no question of shelving the plan: the money had to be found; and the only means I had of increasing the national revenue by any marked degree, was by nationalizing the Suez Canal [Company]. I knew that I was taking a calculated risk. I knew of my personal experience of Anthony Eden that he would feel bound to take action to protect British interests; but I was almost certain, too, that Britain did not have enough troops in Kenya, Cyprus or Aden, their nearest bases to carry out an attack. I believed that, in the time needed for him to mobilize suf.cient forces, it would be possible for us to reach a peaceful solution.44
content_units.azure_translation: 基本上，[问题]变得很简单。没有搁置计划的问题：必须找到钱;而我唯一能显着增加国家收入的手段，就是将苏伊士运河[公司]国有化。我知道我正在冒一个经过计算的风险。我知道我对安东尼·伊登的亲身经历，他会觉得有义务采取行动保护英国的利益;但我也几乎可以肯定，英国在肯尼亚、塞浦路斯或亚丁这些最近的基地没有足够的军队来发动攻击。我相信，在他动员强大力量所需的时间里，我们就有可能达成和平解决44。

content_units.text: Nasir miscalculated. Eden responded by colluding with the French (upset over Egypts support for the Algerian revolution) and the Israelis (who sought an end to fedayyin raids into Israel). The purpose of this collusion was to reclaim Western sovereignty over the canal, defeat Egypt militarily, and thus undermine Nasirs pres­tige and leadership of the Arab nationalist movement. The tripar­tite attack began on October 29 with the Israeli invasion of Sinai, followed the next day by a prearranged Anglo-French ultimatum to both parties to stop .ghting within twelve hours and to with­draw their forces ten miles from either side of the Canal, so as to allow Anglo-French forces to move in between the two combat­ants. The ultimatum, which effectively called on the Egyptians to withdraw their forces over 100 miles, allowing the Israelis to ad­vance all the way to the Canal with no resistance, seemed to Nasir so fantastic that he initially believed it to be a bluff.45 But on Octo­ber 31, British and French aircraft began bombing Egyptian air­.elds. The objective was not just to restore Anglo-French owner­ship of the Suez Canal Company, but to topple Nasir. Immediately after the .rst bombing raid, a British radio station in Cyprus ap­pealed to Egyptians to rise against Nasir, who, according to the radio announcer, had gone mad and seized the Suez Canal . . . rejected a fair solution . . . exposed you to Israeli attacks . . . be­trayed Egypt . . . [and] adopted dictatorship.46 Within less than twenty-four hours, the attackers had succeeded in neutralizing Egypts air bases. On November 4, British and French paratroopers landed in Port Said on the Mediterranean end of the Canal, and two days later, after heavy .ghting and Egyptian casualties between 6501,000 dead, the town was in the hands of the invaders. Imme­diately, a British armored column began advancing down the Canal in the direction of Ismailia and Suez, the two other major Canal cities. At that point, the Egyptians became convinced that the Anglo-French forces were set on moving on Cairo. In an emergency meeting, Nasir and his colleagues decided to take poison rather than risk the national humiliation of capture by the invaders. But Abd al-Latif al-Baghdadi, a senior member of the leadership was missing from the meeting, so an emissary was sent to .nd him and bring him to the meeting while another member of the leadership was dispatched to bring back the necessary poison. As Nasir and his colleagues waited for Bahgdadi to make an appearance and for the poison to be brought, news from New York, indicating British and French agreement to halt all hostilities, arrived in Cairo.47
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔失算了。伊甸园的回应是与法国人（对埃及支持阿尔及利亚革命感到不安）和以色列人（寻求结束对以色列的联邦袭击）勾结。这种勾结的目的是夺回西方对运河的主权，在军事上击败埃及，从而破坏纳西尔的威望和阿拉伯民族主义运动的领导地位。三方进攻始于 10 月 29 日以色列入侵西奈半岛，随后第二天，英法双方向双方发出了预先安排的最后通牒，要求双方在 12 小时内停止进攻，并在距离运河两侧 10 英里处撤军，以便英法军队在两个战斗人员之间移动。最后通牒实际上呼吁埃及人将军队撤出 100 多英里，让以色列人毫无抵抗地一路推进到运河，在纳西尔看来是如此奇妙，以至于他最初认为这是虚张声势。45 但在 10 月 31 日，英国和法国飞机开始轰炸埃及的空中。其目标不仅仅是恢复英法对苏伊士运河公司的所有权，而是推翻纳西尔。第一次轰炸袭击发生后，塞浦路斯的一家英国广播电台立即呼吁埃及人起来反对纳西尔，据电台播音员称，纳西尔已经发疯并夺取了苏伊士运河......拒绝了公平的解决方案......让你暴露在以色列的攻击之下......背叛了埃及......[并]采用独裁统治。46 在不到二十四小时内，袭击者成功摧毁了埃及的空军基地。11 月 4 日，英国和法国伞兵在运河地中海一端的塞得港登陆，两天后，在造成 6501,000 人死亡的埃及伤亡惨重之后，该镇落入入侵者手中。随即，一支英国装甲纵队开始沿着运河向伊斯梅利亚和苏伊士这两座运河主要城市前进。那时，埃及人开始确信英法联军已决心向开罗进军。在一次紧急会议上，纳西尔和他的同事们决定服毒，而不是冒着被入侵者俘虏的民族耻辱的风险。但领导层的一名高级成员阿卜杜勒·拉蒂夫·巴格达迪缺席了会议，因此派出一名特使前往他并带他参加会议，同时派出另一名领导层成员带回必要的毒药。当纳西尔和他的同事们等待巴格达迪的出现和毒药的带来时，来自纽约的消息传到了开罗，表明英国和法国同意停止所有敌对行动47。

content_units.text: Sunday Times (London), June 24, 1962.
Sayed Marei, Awraq Siyasiya (Political papers) (Cairo: al-Maktab al-Musri al-Hadith, 1978), p. 357.
Anthony Nutting, Nasser (London: Constable, 1972), p. 174.
As told by Baghdadi, and related in Fathi Radwan, 72 Shahran Maa Abd al-Nasir (72 months with Abd al-Nasir) (Cairo: Dar al-Huriya, 1986), p. 96.

The sudden change of fortune for Nasir and Egypt was naturally trumpeted by Egyptian propaganda as a direct result of Egypts valiant resistance. But in fact it was Washington that played the decisive role. President Eisenhower and Secretary of State Dulles had warned against the use of force, and were furious at not having been consulted by the British and the French; indeed, they felt that they had been deliberately deceived by Eden and the French prime minister, Guy Mollet. Moreover, they were concerned that the crisis in Suez would drag them into a possible nuclear con.ict with the Soviets. The British and French desperately needed American .­nancial help to offset the extra cost of alternative oil supplies after the Egyptians blocked the Suez Canal by sinking ships in it, and the Syrians blew up pipelines carrying British-owned petroleum from the oil .elds of Iraq to the Mediterranean port of Latakiya. The Americans, however, let it be known that any .nancial help was contingent on the cessation of hostilities. The immediate con­sequence was a run on sterling in international .nancial markets, and coupled with a chorus of global condemnation, even from close and long-standing allies, the British and French had little al­ternative but to halt the invasion. Away from public posturing, Nasir conceded Washingtons decisive role. In the .rst ministerial meeting after the collapse of the invasion, Nasir acknowledged the role of the United States and its president in foiling the tripartite conspiracy. He told the assembled ministers that it was Eisen­hower who played the greatest and most decisive role in standing up to Britain, France and Israel, even though the conspiracy took him by surprise in the middle of his election campaign for a second term, in which he was in need of Jewish votes.... But Eisenhower completely disregarded all this, and stood decisively and resolutely by Egypt.48 The lack of American support spelled the beginning of the end for the ill-fated Anglo-French operation, which was eventually to conclude in the ignominious evacuation of all their troops from Egypt by December 22, 1956, without the achieve­ment of any of their objectives.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔和埃及的命运突然变化自然而然地被埃及的宣传大肆宣传，这是埃及英勇抵抗的直接结果。但事实上，华盛顿发挥了决定性的作用。艾森豪威尔总统和国务卿杜勒斯曾警告不要使用武力，并对没有征求英国和法国的意见感到愤怒;事实上，他们觉得自己被伊登和法国总理盖伊·莫莱故意欺骗了。此外，他们担心苏伊士危机会将他们拖入可能与苏联的核冲突中。在埃及人通过击沉苏伊士运河的船只封锁了苏伊士运河，叙利亚人炸毁了从伊拉克油田运往地中海港口拉塔基亚的输送英国石油的管道后，英国和法国迫切需要美国的财政帮助来抵消替代石油供应的额外成本。然而，美国人让人们知道，任何经济援助都取决于敌对行动的停止。直接后果是英镑在国际金融市场上的挤兑，再加上全球的谴责，甚至来自亲密和长期盟友的谴责，英国和法国别无选择，只能阻止入侵。除了公开姿态之外，纳西尔承认华盛顿的决定性作用。在入侵失败后的第一次部长级会议上，纳西尔承认美国及其总统在挫败三方阴谋方面的作用。他告诉与会的部长们，艾森豪威尔在对抗英国、法国和以色列方面发挥了最大和最决定性的作用，尽管这个阴谋让他在竞选连任期间感到意外，他需要犹太人的选票......但艾森豪威尔完全不顾这一切，果断而坚决地站在埃及一边。48 缺乏美国的支持标志着命运多舛的英法行动结束的开始，最终以 1956 年 12 月 22 日从埃及撤离所有军队而告终，但没有实现任何目标。

content_units.text: Marei, Awraq Siyasiya (Political papers), p. 362.

Militarily, Nasirs much trumpeted armed forces had lost the war summarily. But politically in Egypt and in the Arab world Nasir had secured a famous and resounding victory. With the Suez Canal Crisis, writes John Badeau, Nasser suddenly .lled the Middle Eastern horizon, becoming a regional hero. To restless and frustrated Arab nationalists he indeed seemed a second Sa­ladin, turning the table on Western imperialism.49 Indeed, Arabs gave Nasir their overwhelming support throughout the duration of the crisis. Arab cities simply erupted in anti-Western demonstra­tions and riots. People took to the streets shouting the name of Nasir as the symbol of Arab steadfastness against the forces of im­perialism. Petroleum pumps in Iraq, Syria, and Saudi Arabia were sabotaged,50 and there was a grassroots effort to boycott British and French merchandise.51 Governments under this intense popu­lar pressure brought their policies as far as they could behind Egypt. Syria and Saudi Arabia broke relations with Britain and France. Syrian troops moved into Jordan and linked with Jordan­ian units,52 after which the Syrian and Jordanian governments of­fered to send troops to help Egypt, but Nasir declined, at which point Jordans Arab Legion seized some of the British army stores in Amman. The recently elected nationalist government of Sulay­man Nabulsi brought Jordan into a military pact with Syria and Egypt, and in January 1957, the Treaty of Arab Solidarity was concluded among Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and Syria for a pe­riod of ten years.53
content_units.azure_translation: 在军事上，纳西尔大肆宣扬武装部队已经立即输掉了战争。但在埃及和阿拉伯世界的政治上，纳西尔取得了著名的、压倒性的胜利。约翰·巴多写道，随着苏伊士运河危机，纳赛尔突然突破了中东的地平线，成为地区英雄。对于焦躁不安和沮丧的阿拉伯民族主义者来说，他确实似乎是第二个萨拉丁，扭转了西方帝国主义的局面。49 事实上，在整个危机期间，阿拉伯人都给予了纳西尔压倒性的支持。阿拉伯城市只是爆发了反西方的示威和骚乱。人们走上街头，高喊纳西尔的名字，作为阿拉伯人反对帝国主义势力的坚定不移的象征。伊拉克、叙利亚和沙特阿拉伯的石油泵遭到破坏，50 基层努力抵制英国和法国的商品。51 在这种强烈的民众压力下，各国政府的政策尽可能地落后于埃及。叙利亚和沙特阿拉伯与英国和法国断绝关系。叙利亚军队进入约旦并与约旦部队联系，52 之后叙利亚和约旦政府提出派遣军队帮助埃及，但纳西尔拒绝了，此时约旦阿拉伯军团夺取了英国在安曼的一些军队物资。最近当选的苏莱曼·纳布尔西民族主义政府使约旦与叙利亚和埃及签订了军事条约，并于 1957 年 1 月在埃及、约旦、沙特阿拉伯和叙利亚之间签订了为期十年的《阿拉伯团结条约》53。

content_units.text: From John Badeaus introduction to Nasirs book, The Philosophy of the Revolution (Buffalo, New York: Economica Books, 1959), p. 14.

Ahmad Hamroush, Qissat Thawrat 23 Yuliyu , al-Jusi al-Rabii: Abd al-Nasir wa al­Arab (The story of the July 23 revolution, 4th volume: Abd al-Nasir and the Arabs) (Cairo: Dar al-Mawqif al-Arabi, 1983), pp. 2021.
Taha, Qissat al-Wuhda wa al-In.sal (The story of the unity and separation), pp. 4648.
Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa Thimar Murra (Harvest: fertile years, bitter fruit), pp. 340341.

As it turned out, a ten-year treaty was wishful thinking. The Jordanian monarch had been wary of Nasirs immense popularity among the citizens of Jordan, especially the Pales­tinians, and feared the destabilizing impact of Arab nationalism on his own rule. He was right. In April 1957, he managed to foil an attempted coup by Arab nationalist of.cers of the Arab Legion who admired Nasir and thought of their king as too dependent on Britain and the other enemies of Arab nationalism. By the end of 1957, the Saudi monarch, Saud

But the most consequential impact of the Suez Crisis occurred in Iraq. Nuri al-Said, Nasirs main nemesis in the Arab world, had known beforehand of the impending attack on Egypt, and, in a meeting with the British, had in fact advocated it.54 Nuri was so elated with the .rst news of the attack that he instructed the radio station to play a then popular love song entitled, al-postakiya ish­taku min kithrat marasili (The Postmen Complained about the Abundance of My Letters). The song was not a re.ection of Nuris romantic disposition; it was a patronizing and backhanded refer­ence to Nasirs father who had been employed as a lowly post of.ce clerk.55 Nevertheless, realizing the inevitable public anger, Nuri felt obliged to condemn the Anglo-French action as a .agrant collusion with Israel. The Iraqi government made a show of refusing to sit with Britain in a Baghdad Pact meeting, and diplomatic relations with France were severed. Yet this circumspect response hardly pla­cated the seething populace, who took to the streets in huge num­bers.56 Riots erupted in Iraqs three main cities of Baghdad, Basrah, and Mosul, and in the Shiite cities of Kufa, Najaf, and Hillah, where the Communists were particularly strong.57 The situation deteriorated so badly in Najaf that a battalion of special forces from Mosul, all of whose members were Sunnis, was sent to bolster the overmatched police and restore order in the city.58 In Baghdad,
content_units.azure_translation: 但苏伊士危机最严重的影响发生在伊拉克。努里·赛义德是纳西尔在阿拉伯世界的主要克星，他事先就知道埃及即将遭到袭击，并且在与英国人的一次会晤中实际上也主张这样做。54 努里对袭击的第一个消息感到非常高兴，以至于他指示广播电台播放一首当时流行的情歌，名为： al-postakiya ishtaku min kithrat marasili（邮递员抱怨我的信件过多）。这首歌并不是对努里斯浪漫性格的再现;这是对纳西尔父亲的居高临下和反手的提及，纳西尔的父亲曾被聘为卑微的职务。55 然而，努里意识到公众不可避免的愤怒，他觉得有义务谴责英法行动是与以色列的勾结。伊拉克政府在巴格达条约会议上表现拒绝与英国坐在一起，与法国断交。然而，这种谨慎的反应几乎没有安抚沸腾的民众，他们大量走上街头。56 伊拉克的巴格达、巴士拉和摩苏尔三个主要城市以及什叶派城市库法、纳杰夫和希拉爆发了骚乱，这些城市的共产党人特别强大。57 纳杰夫的局势恶化得如此严重，以至于来自摩苏尔的一个特种部队营， 所有成员都是逊尼派，他们被派去加强过度匹配的警察并恢复城市秩序。58 在巴格达，

content_units.text: bin Abd al-Aziz, had become convinced that Nasirs propagated Arab nationalism could not but eventually be a fatal threat to his familys political survival. By 1958, Jordan and Saudi Arabia had joined Iraq in becoming Egypts main enemies. p. 587; see also on the same subject Abd al-Jabbar Abd Mustafa, Tajribat al-Amal al-Jabhawi . al-Iraq Beina 19211958 (The experiment of oppositional work in Iraq between 19211958) (Baghdad: Manshurat Wizarat al-Thaqafa wa al-Funoon, 1978), pp. 245246. in just two days of rioting, 378 demonstrators were arrested.59 The Iraqi government was compelled to impose martial law. Even so, Nuri felt that he could not guarantee Iraqi stability for more than a few days. The British ambassador reported to his government that he had never seen Nuri more deeply discouraged and depressed;60 and in a Baghdad Pact meeting, Turkish prime minister, Adnan Menderes, thought that Iraqs leaders were in a state of near panic.61 Recognizing that the imperatives of this new era necessi­tated unequivocal and public adherence to Arab nationalism, Nuri went on the radio on November 23, 1956, to emphasize to his peo­ple his strong and long-standing Arab nationalist credentials:
content_units.azure_translation: 本·阿卜杜勒·阿齐兹 （bin Abd al-Aziz） 深信，纳西尔宣传的阿拉伯民族主义最终只能对其家族的政治生存构成致命威胁。到 1958 年，约旦和沙特阿拉伯与伊拉克一起成为埃及的主要敌人。第 587 页;另见同一主题 Abd al-Jabbar Abd Mustafa， Tajribat al-Amal al-Jabhawi 。al-Iraq Beina 19211958 （The experiment of oppositional work in Iraq between 19211958） （Baghdad： Manshurat Wizarat al-Thaqafa wa al-Funoon， 1978）， pp. 245246.在骚乱的短短两天内，378 名示威者被捕。59 伊拉克政府被迫实施戒严令。即便如此，努里也觉得自己无法保证伊拉克稳定超过几天。英国大使向他的政府报告说，他从未见过努里如此沮丧和沮丧;60 在巴格达条约会议上，土耳其总理阿德南·门德雷斯认为伊拉克领导人处于近乎恐慌的状态。61 努里认识到这个新时代的当务之急需要明确和公开地坚持阿拉伯民族主义，因此努里于 1956 年 11 月 23 日在广播中向他的人民强调他强大而长期的阿拉伯民族主义资历：

The call to Arab nationalism is not acciden­tal to me, but is my very being. I am proud of it and I strive to promote it and to safeguard it whether I am inside or outside the government.62
content_units.azure_translation: 同胞;你们知道我是一个苦苦挣扎的年轻人，他倡导并致力于阿拉伯人的独立和他们的团结，并努力提高阿拉伯人的威望，而当时阿拉伯人这个词会让演讲者付出代价。当时，那些今天鼓吹民族主义的人正在压迫者和帝国主义者的脚下跪拜，并指责我们叛国和无神论。我不止一次地面临危险，我只追求阿拉伯人的独立、阿拉伯人的荣耀和阿拉伯人的尊严......对阿拉伯民族主义的呼吁对我来说不是偶然的，而是我的存在。我为此感到自豪，无论我在政府内部还是外部，我都努力促进和维护它62。

content_units.text: Along with such nationalist appeals to his own people, Nuri went beyond the borders of Iraq, and tried to promote his point of view at the expense of Nasirs Egypt. He did this by intensifying his governments policy, which had started earlier, of buying off as many Arab newspapers and magazines as he could. For example, one thousand Jordanian dinars were paid to Huza al-Majali to establish the anti-Nasir magazine Sawt al-Urdun (The Voice of Jor­dan). Similarly, in order to confront the Nasirist tide in Syria, the Iraqi consulate in Damascus paid over eleven thousand Syrian lires on a monthly basis to two newspapers and two magazines.63
content_units.azure_translation: 除了对本国人民的这种民族主义呼吁外，努里还走出了伊拉克的边界，并试图以牺牲埃及纳西尔为代价来宣传他的观点。为此，他加强了政府早些时候开始的政策，即尽可能多地收买阿拉伯报纸和杂志。例如，向 Huza al-Majali 支付了 1000 约旦第纳尔，用于创办反纳西尔杂志 Sawt al-Urdun（约旦之声）。同样，为了对抗叙利亚的纳西尔主义浪潮，伊拉克驻大马士革领事馆每月向两家报纸和两家杂志支付超过11,000叙利亚里拉63。

content_units.text: Abd Mustafa, Tajribat al-Amal al-Jabhawi . al-Iraq (The experiment of oppositional work in Iraq), p. 246; Al-Hasani, Tarikh al-Wizarat al-Iraqiya (The history of Iraqi cabi­nets), p. 113.

But to no avail! The Arab nationalist creed by now had become inexorably linked in the minds of the Arab people to the person of Gamal Abd al-Nasir. And this seems to have necessitated some rewriting of history on the part of Egypts political elites, who only three to four years earlier had seen and presented themselves as Egyptian patriots, speaking little of Arab nationalism. In an article in Cairos in.uential al-Ahram in March 1957, Anwar al-Sadat, an original member of the Free Of.cers, later to succeed Nasir to the presidency, declared:
content_units.azure_translation: 但无济于事！阿拉伯民族主义信条在阿拉伯人民的脑海中已经与贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔这个人不可避免地联系在一起。这似乎需要埃及政治精英对历史进行一些改写，他们仅在三四年前才看到并以埃及爱国者的身份出现，很少谈论阿拉伯民族主义。1957 年 3 月，安瓦尔·萨达特 （Anwar al-Sadat） 是 Free Of.cers 的创始成员，后来接替纳西尔担任总统，他在开罗 in.uential al-Ahram 的一篇文章中宣称：

content_units.text: There was nothing behind our coup other than Arab nationalism . . . which awakened a new historical development.... We must nurture this link between the people of the Arab nation . . . for when the revolution occurred in Egypt, it rendered the Arab nation one nation, sharing one history and claiming one destiny.64
content_units.azure_translation: 我们的政变背后除了阿拉伯民族主义之外没有任何东西......唤醒了新的历史发展......我们必须培养阿拉伯民族人民之间的这种联系......因为当埃及发生革命时，它使阿拉伯民族成为一个国家，共享一个历史，拥有一个命运64。

content_units.text: By the end of 1956, in any part of the Arabic-speaking world, Arab nationalism had become the dominant ideology, and Nasir had been anointed as its leader and keeper of its conscience. A poignant illustration of this occurred during the .rst truly free elec­tions in Jordan in late 1956. One Muslim candidate gave a speech to a gathering at the venerated al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem (which until June 1967 was under Jordanian control). At the conclusion of his speech, his audience, all devout Muslims, asked him: Does Nasir support you? He replied that he did not know. The result was the election of a Christian Communist candidate who be­longed to a grouping supported by Nasir.65 There can be little doubt that Nasirs charisma, bolstered by his perceived victory in the Suez
content_units.azure_translation: 到 1956 年底，在阿拉伯语世界的任何地区，阿拉伯民族主义已成为主导意识形态，纳西尔被任命为其领袖和良知的守护者。1956 年底约旦第一次真正自由的选举期间就是一个令人心酸的例证。一位穆斯林候选人在耶路撒冷受人尊敬的阿克萨清真寺（直到 1967 年 6 月才处于约旦控制之下）的一次集会上发表了演讲。在演讲结束时，他的听众（都是虔诚的穆斯林）问他：纳西尔支持你吗？他回答说他不知道。结果是当选了一名基督教共产党候选人，他属于纳西尔支持的团体。65 毫无疑问，纳西尔的魅力因他在苏伊士河上的胜利而得到加强

content_units.text: al-Umma al-Arabiya min al-Muhit al-Atlasi ila alKhalij al­Arabi (the Arab nation from the Atlantic Ocean to the Arabian Gulf) gained increasing currency and was frequently invoked in speeches, articles, and conversations. It was put in poetic form, and very quickly was on the lips of euphoric nationalist crowds throughout the Arab world:
content_units.azure_translation: al-Umma al-Arabiya min al-Muhit al-Atlasi ila alKhalij alArabi（从大西洋到阿拉伯湾的阿拉伯国家）越来越受欢迎，并在演讲、文章和对话中经常被引用。它被以诗意的形式表达出来，并很快被整个阿拉伯世界的欣喜若狂的民族主义人群所津津乐道：

content_units.text: The universal popularity of this poetic slogan was attested to by a group of senior of.cers in Iraqs Royal Air Force who went to Mo­rocco on an of.cial visit in 1957. To Iraqis, Morocco seemed as culturally distant as it was geographically remote. The of.cers, therefore, were truly taken aback when they heard this poetic slo­gan recited by Moroccans from various professions, including army of.cers. The Iraqi of.cers returned to Iraq convinced not only of the eventual victory of Nasir over Nuri al-Said, but also of the inevitable triumph of Arab nationalism in its mission to create a unitary Arab state under Nasirs leadership.66
content_units.azure_translation: 1957 年前往摩洛哥进行临时访问的伊拉克皇家空军的一群高级军官证明了这一诗意口号的普遍流行。对伊拉克人来说，摩洛哥在文化上似乎遥远，在地理上也很遥远。因此，当 of.cers 听到摩洛哥人从各个职业（包括 army of.cers）背诵的这句诗意口号时，他们真的大吃一惊。伊拉克人返回伊拉克时，不仅相信纳西尔最终战胜了努里·赛义德，而且相信阿拉伯民族主义在纳西尔领导下建立一个单一的阿拉伯国家的使命中必然会取得胜利66。

content_units.text: As more people began to believe, romantically perhaps, in the indivisibility of the Arab nation and Nasirs leading role within it, and as the Egyptians themselves began to shed their earlier insu­larity, and state publicly their full adherence to the Arab nationalist creed, Cairo was bound to become the target of other Arabs desir­ing unity. And so it fell on the Syrians, enthusiastic Arabists who happened to be wracked by internal divisions, to demand that Egypt stand by what it had been preaching and join Syria to estab­lish one unitary state.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着越来越多的人开始相信阿拉伯民族的不可分割性和纳西尔在其中的领导作用，以及埃及人自己开始摆脱他们早期的孤立性，并公开表示他们完全遵守阿拉伯民族主义信条，开罗势必会成为其他渴望团结的阿拉伯人的目标。因此，叙利亚人，恰好被内部分裂所蹂躏的热情阿拉伯主义者，要求埃及坚持它所宣扬的，并与叙利亚一起建立一个单一国家。

title: THE APEX OF ARAB NATIONALISM: THE UNITED ARAB REPUBLIC AND THE IRAQI REVOLUTION, JANUARYSEPTEMBER 1958

content_units.text: The United Arab Republic (UAR), formed by the fusion of Egypt and Syria on February 1, 1958, came as a stunning surprise to most Arabs and non-Arabs. No one whose expectations were shaped by rational assessment could think that an organic unity between two Arab states was at all possible in such a short space of time. It was not the actual unity that was so surprising; Arab nationalists fervently believed in the eventual amalgamation of Arab countries. But no one (not even the main participants, as we shall see) was prepared for the breathless pace at which events were to unfold.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯联合共和国 （UAR） 于 1958 年 2 月 1 日由埃及和叙利亚融合而成，让大多数阿拉伯人和非阿拉伯人都感到惊讶。任何一个期望是由理性评估决定的，谁都不会想到两个阿拉伯国家之间在如此短的时间内实现有机统一是可能的。如此令人惊讶的并不是真正的团结;阿拉伯民族主义者热切地相信阿拉伯国家最终会合并。但没有人（甚至包括我们将要看到的主要参与者）为事件将以令人窒息的速度展开做好准备。

content_units.text: The Syrians, who demanded from Gamal Abd al-Nasir, and ended up getting, an organic form of unity in 1958, had made ear­lier proposals for looser forms of union with Egypt. As early as the spring of 1955, ostensibly as a response to the Baghdad Pact, Khalid al-Azm, the then-prime minister of Syria, proposed the in­tegration of the two armies, economic and .nancial cooperation between the two countries, and greater collaboration in foreign affairs.1 The Egyptians, it seems, were not ready to even contem­plate such a proposal.2 Nor were the Egyptians more forthcoming in the summer of 1956 when the Syrians tried again to discuss unity.3 As late as the spring of 1957, Nasir told a Lebanese journal­ist, who was a fervent Arab nationalist, that any unity project among Arab states would be met with vigorous resistance by the British and the Americans, and even the Soviet Union might not be agreeable to such an idea.4 Nasir preached Arab nationalism and was cognizant of its ultimate goal, but obviously was enough of a realist to appreciate the many obstacles to its actual realization. And in any case, the balance of political power in the Arab world was .rmly in favor of Nasir in the wake of the Suez Crisis, a bal­ance of forces that saw Syria, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia allied with Egypt. Nasir had no reason to frighten off the Jordanian and Saudi monarchs by elevating Arab unity from the realm of aspirational rhetoric, where it had until then resided, into the sphere of actual policy making.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚人向贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔提出要求，并最终在 1958 年获得了一种有机形式的统一，他们早些时候曾提出与埃及建立更宽松联盟的建议。早在1955年春天，表面上是作为对《巴格达条约》的回应，时任叙利亚总理哈立德·阿兹姆（Khalid al-Azm）就提议将两军整合，两国之间的经济和金融合作，并在外交事务上加强合作。1 埃及人似乎甚至没有准备好考虑这样的提议。2 1956 年夏天，当叙利亚人再次试图进行讨论时，埃及人也没有更坦率地提出3 直到 1957 年春天，纳西尔还告诉一位热心的阿拉伯民族主义者黎巴嫩记者，阿拉伯国家之间的任何团结计划都会遭到英国和美国的强烈抵制，甚至苏联也可能不同意这种想法。4 纳西尔宣扬阿拉伯民族主义，并认识到其最终目标， 但显然，他是一个现实主义者，足以理解其实际实现的许多障碍。无论如何，在苏伊士危机之后，阿拉伯世界的政治权力平衡基本上有利于纳西尔，这种力量平衡使叙利亚、约旦和沙特阿拉伯与埃及结盟。纳西尔没有理由通过将阿拉伯的团结从迄今为止一直存在的雄心勃勃的言论领域提升到实际政策制定的领域来吓跑约旦和沙特的君主。

content_units.text: The momentum, however, began to change in the summer of 1957, a change brought about as much by external factors as inter­nal ones. As the post-Suez Arab nationalist tide swept through every street, alley, and coffee shop in the Arab countries, and as Nasir appeared to be the sole custodian of the Arab nationalist mantle, using it at will to appeal to Arab mass opinion over the heads of their increasingly beleaguered governments, some of his political allies began to reassess their positions. This was especially p. 108. Riad, who was Egypts ambassador to Damascus, felt that Azms initiative was motivated less by Azms commitment to Arabism and more by personal political ambitions. Ibid., p. 107. true of the Saudi and Jordanian kings. King Saud had allied his country with Egypt against Iraq because of his familys historical enmity to the Hashemites. After all, it was only after the expulsion of the Hashemites from al-Hejaz, that Sauds father was able to establish the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and Saud suspected that the Hashemites had neither forgotten their misfortune, nor relin­quished their claim to his country. Thus his proximity to Nasir was political and strategic, hardly based on a convergence of their belief systems. On the Jordanian front, King Husayn had allowed the nationalist government of Sulayman al-Nabulsi, popularly elected in October 1956, to direct Jordans foreign policy, which predict­ably came to follow the lead of Nasirs Egypt. For a while Husayn did not appear to mind, seemingly enjoying the peaceful respite provided by a friendly Voice of the Arabs. But the honeymoon could not last. The conservative and status quo bases of the two countries were diametrically opposed to the radical and revolution­ary tenets of Arab nationalism. The peace was little more than a truce waiting to be broken.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，势头在 1957 年夏天开始发生变化，这种变化既由外部因素带来，也由内部因素带来。随着苏伊士事件后的阿拉伯民族主义浪潮席卷阿拉伯国家的每一条街道、小巷和咖啡店，纳西尔似乎是阿拉伯民族主义衣钵的唯一守护者，随意利用它来吸引阿拉伯群众舆论，而不是他们日益陷入困境的政府，他的一些政治盟友开始重新评估他们的立场。尤其是第 108 页。曾任埃及驻大马士革大使的里亚德认为，阿兹姆斯倡议的动机与其说是阿兹姆人对阿拉伯主义的承诺，不如说是出于个人政治野心。同上，第107页。沙特和约旦国王也是如此。沙特国王将他的国家与埃及结盟对抗伊拉克，因为他的家族在历史上与哈希姆人有敌意。毕竟，只有在将哈希姆人驱逐出汉志之后，沙特的父亲才得以建立沙特王国，沙特怀疑哈希姆人既没有忘记自己的不幸，也没有放弃对自己国家的主权要求。因此，他与纳西尔的接近是政治和战略性的，几乎不是基于他们信仰体系的趋同。在约旦战线，侯赛因国王允许 1956 年 10 月民选的苏莱曼·纳布尔西民族主义政府指导约旦的外交政策，不出所料，约旦政府将效仿埃及纳西尔的领导。有一段时间，侯赛因似乎并不在意，似乎在享受友好的阿拉伯人之声提供的宁静休息。但蜜月期不能持续下去。两国的保守派和维持现状基础与阿拉伯民族主义的激进和革命信条截然相反。和平只不过是等待被打破的休战协议。

Mahmud Riad, Mudhakarat Mahmud Riad, 19481978, al-Jusial-Thani (The mem­oirs of Mahmud Riad, 19481978, volume two) (Cairo: Dar al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, 1986),

Riad Taha, Qissat al-Wuhda wa al-In.sal: Tajribat Insan Arabi Khilal Ahdath 1955 1961 (The story of the unity and separation: the experience of an Arab person during the events of 19551961) (Beirut: Dar al-Afaq al-Jadida, 1974), p. 73.

The .rst signs of a potential change in Saudi policy occurred in November 1956, when King Saud attended a conference of Arab heads of state in Beirut. Called by the pro-Western Lebanese presi­dent, Camille Chamoun, the conference highlighted the precarious­ness of the monarchies and the status quo republics in the wake of the Suez Crisis and the ascendancy of revolutionary Arab national­ism. Saud also had an opportunity to meet privately with Iraqs King Faysal II, in which both pledged to overcome the traditional Saudi-Hashemite enmities.5 But what was most consequential in radically changing Saudi foreign policy was a sustained U. S. initia­tive, launched in January 1957 by President Eisenhower in his State of the Union address, which was later to become known as the Eisenhower Doctrine. It pledged American assistance, including the dispatch of armed forces, to nations requesting American help against overt aggression from any nation controlled by interna­ tional communism.6 That same month, ARAMCO, the American oil company responsible for Saudi oil productions, arranged for King Saud to visit Washington in the hope that he would be per­suaded to rally the anti-Nasirist forces in the area.7 And they suc­ceeded famously.
content_units.azure_translation: 沙特政策可能发生变化的第一个迹象出现在 1956 年 11 月，当时沙特国王出席了在贝鲁特举行的阿拉伯国家元首会议。这次会议由亲西方的黎巴嫩总统卡米尔·查蒙召集，强调了苏伊士危机和革命性阿拉伯民族主义盛行后君主制和现状共和国的不稳定性。沙特还有机会私下会见了伊拉克国王费萨尔二世，两人都承诺克服沙特与哈希姆派的传统敌意。5 但从根本上改变沙特外交政策最重要的是美国的一项持续倡议，该倡议由艾森豪威尔总统于 1957 年 1 月在国情咨文中发起，该倡议后来被称为艾森豪威尔主义。它承诺向请求美国帮助的国家提供援助，包括派遣武装部队，以对抗任何受国际共产主义控制的国家的公开侵略。6 同月，负责沙特石油生产的美国石油公司 ARAMCO 安排沙特国王访问华盛顿，希望他能被说服在该地区召集反纳西尔主义力量。7 他们取得了著名的成功。

content_units.text: See Abd al-Razzak al-Hasani, Tarikh al-Wizarat al-Iraqiya, al-Jusial-Ashir (The his­tory of Iraqi cabinets, volume ten) (Baghdad: Dar al-Shuun al-Thaqa.ya al-Amma, 1988), p. 106.

The .rst discernible shift in Sauds political orientation occurred in April 1957 when he sent troops to Jordan to help King Husayn against his pro-Nasir prime minister, Sulayman al-Nabulsi. First in his cordial meeting with King Faysal II of Iraq and now in his deci­sion to come to the aid of the Jordanian monarch, Saud had .nally decided (probably also with American prompting) that the long­standing and often bitter rivalry between the Saudis and the Ha­shemites was now superceded by the shared interest of all the status quo leaders in the area in combating the destabilizing impact of the radical and Nasir-propagated Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 沙特政治取向的第一次明显转变发生在 1957 年 4 月，当时他派遣军队前往约旦帮助侯赛因国王对抗亲纳西尔的总理苏莱曼·纳布尔西。首先，在与伊拉克国王费萨尔二世的亲切会晤中，现在在他决定援助约旦君主时，沙特最终决定（可能也是在美国的推动下）沙特人和哈希姆人之间长期存在的、经常激烈的竞争现在被该地区所有维持现状的领导人的共同利益所取代，即对抗激进和纳西尔传播的阿拉伯民族主义的破坏稳定影响。

content_units.text: Sauds change of heart was not entirely motivated by consider­ation of personal interest and political survival. There was also an ideological dimension. The product of a radically different environ­ment from that of Egypt, Sauds understanding of Arab national­ism was bound to be markedly different from that of Nasirs. As one analyst observed:
content_units.azure_translation: 沙特改变主意并不完全是出于个人利益和政治生存的考虑。还有意识形态层面。作为与埃及截然不同的环境的产物，沙特对阿拉伯民族主义的理解必然与纳西尔人明显不同。正如一位分析师所观察到的：

content_units.text: To the Saudi rulers, their Arabness was such a self-evident fact that no theoretical elaboration was needed. Being of tribal stock, they thought of themselves as the real ethnically pure Arabs. While they recognized the special ties among Arab countries, they attributed them as much to religion and proximity as to Arabism. They did not recognize the mystical links emanating from Arab nationalism. If unity was to be the goal, it should be based on Islam, rather than Arabism.8
content_units.azure_translation: 对于沙特统治者来说，他们的阿拉伯性是不言而喻的事实，不需要理论上的阐述。作为部落血统，他们认为自己是真正的种族纯正的阿拉伯人。虽然他们承认阿拉伯国家之间的特殊联系，但他们将其归因于宗教和亲近关系，也归因于阿拉伯主义。他们没有认识到阿拉伯民族主义所产生的神秘联系。如果要以团结为目标，它应该以伊斯兰教为基础，而不是阿拉伯主义8。

content_units.text: Whether resulting from political interest or ideology or a combi­ nation of both, the change in Sauds Arab policy was a major coup for the Eisenhower administration. After all, throughout the con­.ict over the Baghdad Pact, the debate over the Czech arms deal, and the Suez Crisis, Saudi Arabia was Egypts staunchest ally. In­deed, its policies in the region followed that of Egypt so closely that, to one observer, Saudi Arabia seemed to be well on the way of becoming Egypts most valuable colony.9 Washington must have savored Sauds change of heart, which was so extreme that in March 1958, Nasir disclosed that Saud had attempted to assassi­nate him to stop the union between Egypt and Syria.10
content_units.azure_translation: 无论是出于政治利益还是意识形态，还是两者兼而有之，沙特阿拉伯政策的变化对艾森豪威尔政府来说都是一次重大政变。毕竟，在《巴格达条约》的争论、捷克军火交易的辩论和苏伊士危机的整个过程中，沙特阿拉伯一直是埃及最坚定的盟友。事实上，沙特阿拉伯在该地区的政策与埃及的政策非常接近，以至于在一位观察家看来，沙特阿拉伯似乎正在成为埃及最有价值的殖民地。9 华盛顿一定对沙特改变主意感到厌烦，这种改变是如此极端，以至于 1958 年 3 月，纳西尔透露沙特曾试图暗杀他以阻止埃及和叙利亚之间的联盟。

In Jordan, King Husayn had become increasingly wary of the foreign policy direction his popularly elected prime minister was taking. The pro-Nasir Sulayman al-Nabulsi was advocating estab­lishing diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union, accepting for­eign aid from Moscow, and refusing any aid from the United States, due to the latters effort to undermine Arab unity and to isolate Abd al-Nasir.11 These policies, and his frequent pro-Nasir state­ments, won Nabulsi great popularity inside Jordan, but not with the king. On April 10, 1957, Husayn dismissed Nabulsi and promptly requested military help from Iraq and Saudi Arabia. For the next two weeks, massive civil disturbances plagued the country, and Husayn survived two coups against him from pro-Nabulsi / Nasir of.cers in the Jordanian army.12 The rioters were urged on by the Voice of the Arabs and Radio Cairo, which blamed the dismissal of Nabulsi and the consequent deterioration in the security situation on the king and the other agents of imperialism in the Palace.13 In the midst of the chaos, John Foster Dulles, the
content_units.azure_translation: 在约旦，侯赛因国王对他民选总理所采取的外交政策方向越来越警惕。亲纳西尔的苏莱曼·纳布尔西主张与苏联建交，接受莫斯科的外国援助，并拒绝美国的任何援助，因为美国试图破坏阿拉伯的团结并孤立阿卜杜勒·纳西尔。11 这些政策，以及他经常支持纳西尔的言论，为纳布尔西在约旦国内赢得了极大的欢迎，但却没有得到国王的欢迎。1957年4月10日，侯赛因解雇了纳布尔西，并立即向伊拉克和沙特阿拉伯请求军事帮助。在接下来的两周里，大规模的内乱困扰着该国，侯赛因在约旦军队中亲纳布尔西/纳西尔的两次政变中幸存下来。12 阿拉伯人之声和开罗广播电台敦促骚乱者，将纳布尔西的解职以及随之而来的安全局势恶化归咎于国王和宫廷中的其他帝国主义代理人。13 在混乱之中，约翰·福斯特·杜勒斯 （John Foster Dulles）

Immediately, the king called a press conference, where he angrily denounced Nasir, accusing Egypt of being behind the riots and the two abortive coups.14 He then declared martial law and embarked on a mass arrest of Nabulsi elements in the army and in the country. The United States followed this action with military and economic aid worth $70 million. In Washington, a State De­partment spokesman coolly called attention to the obvious connec­tion between Husayns press conference, the Dulles statement, and the Eisenhower Doctrine.15 Nasir retorted by unleashing a propa­ganda campaign so violent in tone and content that it led the belea­guered king to sever diplomatic relations with Egypt in June.
content_units.azure_translation: 美国国务卿，尖锐地邀请侯赛因寻求美国的帮助。国王立即召开记者招待会，愤怒地谴责纳西尔，指责埃及是骚乱和两次失败政变的幕后黑手。14 然后他宣布戒严，并开始大规模逮捕军队和国内的纳布尔西分子。美国紧随其后，提供了价值7000万美元的军事和经济援助。在华盛顿，国务院发言人冷静地呼吁人们注意侯赛因斯的新闻发布会、杜勒斯声明和艾森豪威尔主义之间的明显联系。15 纳西尔反驳说，他发动了一场语气和内容如此暴力的宣传活动，导致陷入困境的国王在 6 月与埃及断绝外交关系。

content_units.text: The Arab balance of political forces in the summer of 1957 was somewhat of a mixed bag for the acknowledged leader of Arab nationalism. On the mass public level, Arab nationalism was su­preme, unrivaled by any other ideology, and consequently no Arab leader could even touch Nasirs universal popularity. But the champion of the Arab nationalist tide was not exactly the .avor of the month with the political leaderships of the Arab countries. His only active political ally was Syria, and in the summer of 1957, Syria was mired in an ominous international crisis. In August, the defense minister, Khalid al-Azm, the patriarch of a prominent landowning family, yet a declared socialist, concluded a major agreement for military and economic aid with Moscow. He fol­lowed this with the appointment of A.f al-Bizri, an of.cer with pronounced Communist sympathies, as the countrys chief of staff. The Americans, af.icted during this intense Cold War era
content_units.azure_translation: 1957 年夏天，阿拉伯政治力量的平衡对于这位公认的阿拉伯民族主义领袖来说有些喜忧参半。在大众层面上，阿拉伯民族主义是至高无上的，是任何其他意识形态都无法比拟的，因此，没有一个阿拉伯领导人能够触及纳西尔的普遍受欢迎程度。但阿拉伯民族主义浪潮的拥护者并不完全是阿拉伯国家政治领导层的月度风云人物。他唯一活跃的政治盟友是叙利亚，1957年夏天，叙利亚陷入了一场不祥的国际危机。8月，国防部长哈立德·阿兹姆（Khalid al-Azm）是一个显赫的地主家族的族长，但却是一名自称社会主义者，他与莫斯科缔结了一项重要的军事和经济援助协议。随后，他任命了对共产党有明显同情心的of.cer A.f al-Bizri 为国家参谋长。美国人，在这个激烈的冷战时代
