Israel does not want Arab unity to be achieved, nor the Arab cause to succeed and be victorious. [Qasim] and the Communists want the same. Israel does not want the UAR to have good relations with the Iraqi Republic or cooperation between them. The Communists and [Qasims] government want the same. All these aims, decisions and accusations are in harmony in the propaganda of Baghdad, the Communists and Israel.14
content_units.azure_translation: 以色列不希望阿拉伯的团结得到实现，也不希望阿拉伯的事业成功并取得胜利。[卡西姆]和共产党人也想要同样的东西。以色列不希望阿拉伯联合共和国与伊拉克共和国建立良好的关系，也不希望他们之间建立良好的合作关系。共产党人和[卡西姆]政府也想要同样的东西。所有这些目标、决定和指控在巴格达、共产党和以色列的宣传中是一致的。

content_units.text: To be accused of doing Israels bidding was the last straw for the Iraqi leadership. Colonel al-Mahdawi, under the full glare of televi­sion lights, declared openly and .rmly that Syria and Egypt . . . must be liberated from Nasserite fascist rule.15 Qasim himself stayed aloof from the mudslinging match, allowing Mahdawi and others to trade below-the-belt punches, until April 1, when he con­trasted his encouragement of democracy with Nasirs mistrust of it, and then pointedly suggested that the statement was particularly relevant to the Syrians.16 And lest people might mistake the state­ment for an April Fools stunt, he renewed his governments interest in the Fertile Crescent plan originally devised by Nuri al-Said. Qasim admitted that he had considered Nuris plan to be reaction­ary, but now that Iraqhad been liberated, the plan would serve the two countries and the region well.17 By now the verbal acrimony had reached a level of personal vindictiveness that greatly surpassed the earlier airwave duels between Nasir and Nuri al-Said.
content_units.azure_translation: 被指控听从以色列的命令是压垮伊拉克领导层的最后一根稻草。马赫达维上校在电视灯光的照耀下，公开宣称叙利亚和埃及......必须从纳赛尔法西斯统治中解放出来。15 卡西姆本人对这场混战保持冷漠，允许马赫达维和其他人进行拳打脚踢，直到 4 月 1 日，他将他对民主的鼓励与纳西尔对民主的不信任进行了对比，然后尖锐地暗示该声明与叙利亚人特别相关。16 以免人们将该声明误认为是愚人节的噱头， 他重申了政府对最初由努里·赛义德设计的新月沃土计划的兴趣。卡西姆承认，他曾认为努里斯的计划是反动的，但现在伊拉克已经解放，该计划将对两国和该地区有好处。17 到现在，口头上的尖刻已经达到了个人报复性的程度，大大超过了纳西尔和努里·赛义德之间早些时候的空波决斗。

content_units.text: What was especially galling to Nasir and the Arab nationalists was Qasims credentials. He was, after all, no easy prey to the na­tionalist assault. Unlike Nuri al-Said of Iraq, Camille Chamoun of Lebanon, King Husayn of Jordan, or King Saud of Saudi Arabia, he was no reactionary, but a revolutionary in his own right, who enjoyed considerable domestic support, particularly among the poor classesthe peasants, workers, slum dwellers. He was an enemy of imperialism, and the friend of Nasirs mentors in the
content_units.azure_translation: 特别让纳西尔和阿拉伯民族主义者感到恼火的是卡西姆的资历。毕竟，他不是民族主义攻击的轻易牺牲品。与伊拉克的努里·赛义德、黎巴嫩的卡米尔·查蒙、约旦国王侯赛因或沙特阿拉伯的沙特国王不同，他不是反动派，而是他本身就是一个革命者，在国内享有相当多的支持，特别是在贫困阶层中农民、工人、贫民窟居民。他是帝国主义的敌人，也是纳西尔导师的朋友

content_units.text: SWB, March 13, 1959, p. 8. 15 SWB, March 18, 1959, p. 9. 16 SWB, April 3, 1959, p. 8; see also Shwadran, Power Struggle in Iraq,p.50. 17 Qasims interview with al-Thawra (Baghdad), November 16, 1959.

Kremlin. All this made him a greater threat to Nasir and Arab na­tionalism than Nuri ever was. After all, the nationalist contention all along had been that Arab unity would occur once the Arab states succeeded in delivering themselves from imperialism. And here was Iraq, salvation at hand, emancipated and liberated, yet steering an independent, even contradictory, course from the Arab nationalist caravan under Nasirs stewardship.
content_units.azure_translation: 克里姆林宫。所有这一切使他对纳西尔和阿拉伯民族主义的威胁比努里任何时候都更大。毕竟，民族主义者一直以来的论点是，一旦阿拉伯国家成功地摆脱帝国主义，阿拉伯的统一就会发生。这就是伊拉克，救赎就在眼前，解放和解放，但却在纳西尔的领导下，从阿拉伯民族主义商队中走出一条独立的、甚至矛盾的道路。

content_units.text: It is thus clear that the struggle between Nasir and Qasim was more than a con.ict between two leaders, or even between two states. It was a confrontation between two ideological paths: al­qawmiya (Arab nationalism) and al-wataniya (nationalism based on state sovereignty). In a sense, here was a reenactment of the nineteenth century philosophical debate between the German and the Anglo-French schools. The German school would stress al­qawmiya, with its emphasis on the oneness of the people (the volk) under a unifying language and a continuous historical experience. Political and geographic divisions that might have separated mem­bers of the nation were arti.cial and therefore irrelevant to the de.nition of al-qawmiya. The Anglo-French school, however, would embrace al-wataniya, the nationalism built (or at a mini­mum, nurtured) through state institutions within a geographically limited space, even if the citizens were to speak different languages and/or profess different ethnicities. In Iraq, those who espoused al-wataniya were the diverse groups that advocated the Iraq.rst policy. And it was these groups, the determined bearers of the wa­taniya banner, that mounted the .rst real challenge to the seem­ingly unstoppable march of Arab nationalism toward comprehen­sive Arab unity.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，很明显，纳西尔和卡西姆之间的斗争不仅仅是两个领导人之间的斗争，甚至是两个国家之间的斗争。这是两条意识形态道路之间的对抗：alqawmiya（阿拉伯民族主义）和al-wataniya（基于国家主权的民族主义）。从某种意义上说，这是对 19 世纪德法学派之间哲学辩论的重演。德国学派强调 alqawmiya，强调人民（人民）在统一的语言和持续的历史经验下的统一性。可能使国家成员分开的政治和地理分歧是偶然的，因此与 al-qawmiya 的定义无关。然而，英法学派将接受 al-wataniya，即在地理有限的空间内通过国家机构建立（或至少培养）的民族主义，即使公民说不同的语言和/或自称不同的种族。在伊拉克，拥护 al-wataniya 的人是倡导伊拉克第一政策的不同群体。正是这些团体，即瓦塔尼亚旗帜的坚定持有者，对阿拉伯民族主义走向全面阿拉伯统一的看似不可阻挡的步伐发起了第一次真正的挑战。

content_units.text: The phrase .rst real challenge is used advisedly. After all, the Nasir-led Arab nationalism had been confronted by state national­isms before the Iraqi revolution. As we have seen, the kingdoms of Iraq, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia vigorously contested Egypts con­ception of an all-engul.ng, purposely irredentist Arab nationalism, advocating instead the inviolability of state sovereignty, while rec­ognizing that they indeed were part of a larger cultural community. These sentiments had been echoed by the newly independent state of Tunisia. Gaining independence in 1956, Tunisias Habib Bour­guiba followed a pro-Western policy at the height of Nasirs anti-Western crusade, and for this infraction he was vili.ed by Egypt. Bourguiba, the tough political activist, was not going to cower to Nasir. Af.rming Tunisias sovereign right to pursue its own na­tional interest, he went on the offensive in 1958, accusing Nasir of bullying the other members of the Arab League, and when Egyp­tian radio responded with the usual savage onslaught, Tunisia sev­ered diplomatic relations with Egypt.
content_units.azure_translation: 建议使用 .rst real challenge 短语。毕竟，纳西尔领导的阿拉伯民族主义在伊拉克革命之前就曾与国家民族主义对抗过。正如我们所见，伊拉克、约旦和沙特阿拉伯王国强烈反对埃及关于 all-engul.ng 的、故意不可逆转的阿拉伯民族主义的概念，而是主张国家主权不可侵犯，同时承认它们确实是一个更大的文化共同体的一部分。新独立的突尼斯国也表达了同样的观点。1956 年获得独立后，突尼斯人哈比卜·布尔吉巴 （Habib Bourguiba） 在纳西尔反西方十字军东征的高峰期奉行亲西方政策，并因此遭到埃及的诽谤。布尔吉巴，这位强硬的政治活动家，不会向纳西尔退缩。1958 年，他剥夺了突尼斯追求自身国家利益的主权，于是发动攻势，指责纳西尔欺负阿拉伯联盟其他成员国，当埃及广播电台以通常的野蛮攻击作为回应时，突尼斯与埃及断绝了外交关系。

content_units.text: Vigorous as it undoubtedly was, this af.rmation of wataniya by Tunisia and the three monarchies was not the real challenge to Nasirs Arab nationalism that was posed by Qasims Iraq. The monarchies were easily dismissed by the Egyptians as puppets of Western imperialism, belittling their wataniya as a reactionary re­sponse undertaken by an isolated and frightened political elite that simply did the bidding of its foreign masters, and that could not and did not represent the true interests and wishes of the Arab people in Iraq, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia. In Tunisia, there was no question as to Bourguibas popularity amongst the people, but Tunisian wataniya hardly represented a real threat to Nasirs Arab nationalism because the North African country was simply too far geographically and too peripheral perceptually from the center of the Arab world. North Africa was marginal to what had always been the core of Arab political and intellectual activity, Egypt and the Fertile Crescent.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管毫无疑问，突尼斯和三个君主制国家对 wataniya 的这种攻击并不是伊拉克卡西姆对纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义构成的真正挑战。埃及人很容易将君主制国家视为西方帝国主义的傀儡，贬低他们的 wataniya 是孤立和恐惧的政治精英的反动反应，他们只是听从其外国主人的命令，不能也不代表伊拉克阿拉伯人民的真正利益和愿望， 约旦和沙特阿拉伯。在突尼斯，布尔吉巴在人民中的受欢迎程度是毋庸置疑的，但突尼斯的瓦塔尼亚几乎不代表对纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义的真正威胁，因为这个北非国家在地理上与阿拉伯世界的中心太远，在感知上也太边缘了。北非与阿拉伯政治和知识活动的核心埃及和新月沃土相比处于边缘地位。

content_units.text: This is precisely why Qasims insistence on Iraqs political inde­pendence, supported by the Iraq.rst constituency, constituted the .rst real challenge to the nationalist (qawmi) hopes for Arab unity. At one time, an actual Arab unity had been but a fantasy clung to by the coffee bar set of nationalist idealists and dreamers, yet, incredulously and some thought miraculously, this fantasy be­came a realizable hope with the creation of the UAR, especially after the demise of the Iraqi monarchy and the staunch anti-Nasi­rite, Nuri al-Said. And now these once euphoric qawmiyeen (na­tionalists) watched, aggrieved and dumbfounded, as the Arab na­tionalist march, seemingly so near to its ultimate goal of Arab unity, came against the roadblock of the Iraq.rst wataniya. This abrupt reversal of fortunes led to a sense of near despair that was echoed by Nasir himself when he described the developing events in Iraqas the end for Arab nationalism.18 That, of course, was too harsh an assessment. In retrospect, it was not the end of Arab na­tionalism; more precisely it was the point at which, after four years of continuous and sometimes spectacular ascent, Arab nationalism began its gradual descent. But the road was still long, and other potholes were still to be encountered in the downhill slide of Arab nationalism. The next serious erosion in the fortunes of Arab na­tionalism occurred some three years later with the secession of Syria from the UAR.
content_units.azure_translation: 这正是为什么卡西姆坚持伊拉克政治独立，得到伊拉克第一选区的支持，是对民族主义者（qawmi）对阿拉伯统一的希望的第一次真正挑战。曾经，真正的阿拉伯统一只是一群民族主义理想主义者和梦想家所坚持的咖啡吧的幻想，然而，令人难以置信，有些人奇迹般地认为，随着 UAR 的成立，这种幻想变成了一个可以实现的希望，尤其是在伊拉克君主制和坚定的反纳西尔派努里·赛义德 （Nuri al-Said） 灭亡之后。而现在，这些曾经欣喜若狂的民族主义者，却眼睁睁地看着阿拉伯民族主义的游行，似乎如此接近阿拉伯团结的最终目标，却撞上了伊拉克的路障。这种命运的突然逆转导致了一种近乎绝望的感觉，纳西尔本人在将伊拉克的发展事件描述为阿拉伯民族主义的终结时也呼应了这种感觉。18 当然，这种评估过于严厉。回想起来，这并不是阿拉伯民族主义的终结;更准确地说，这是阿拉伯民族主义在经历了四年的连续、有时是惊人的上升之后，开始逐渐衰落的时刻。但路还很长，在阿拉伯民族主义的下坡路中还会遇到其他坑洼。阿拉伯民族主义命运的下一次严重侵蚀发生在大约三年后，叙利亚从阿拉伯联合酋长国分离出来。

content_units.text: Given the precipitance with which unity was declared, problems and dif.culties were bound to plague the new state. To start with, Nasir knew little, if anything, about Syria. In 1954, before his con­version to the Arab nationalist cause, he had been attacked vehe­mently by the Syrian Bathists for having told a Syrian of.cial that Syria was free to unite with Iraq, Jordan, or Turkey as long as such a move was approved by the Syrian people. It was galling to the Bathists, as well as to other Arab nationalists, that an Arab leader would commit the cardinal sin of not distinguishing between Arab and Turk.19 And this statement was made a mere four years before he were to become the president of Syria! Indeed, Nasirs con.dant, the journalist Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, con.rms that this igno­rance of Syria had improved but little in the intervening four years.20
content_units.azure_translation: 鉴于宣布统一的迅速程度，问题和分歧必然会困扰着新国家。首先，纳西尔对叙利亚知之甚少，如果有的话。1954 年，在他皈依阿拉伯民族主义事业之前，他曾受到叙利亚巴斯主义者的猛烈攻击，因为他告诉一名叙利亚人，只要此举得到叙利亚人民的批准，叙利亚可以自由地与伊拉克、约旦或土耳其联合。对于巴蒂斯特派和其他阿拉伯民族主义者来说，一个阿拉伯领导人会犯下不区分阿拉伯人和土耳其人的大罪，这让巴蒂斯特和其他阿拉伯民族主义者感到恼火。19 而这句话是在他成为叙利亚总统前四年发表的！事实上，记者穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔（Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal）认为，这种对叙利亚的无知在这四年里有所改善，但几乎没有改善20。

content_units.text: Ahmad Hamroush, Qissat Thawrat 23 Yuliyu, al-Jusi al-Rabi: Abd Al-Nasir wa al­Arab (The story of the 23 July revolution, volume four: Abd al-Nasir and the Arabs) (Cairo: Dar al-Mawqif al-Arabi, 1983), p. 156.

Kamel Abu Jaber, The Arab Bath Socialist Party: History, Ideology and Organization (Syracuse, New York: Syracuse University Press, 1966), p. 35; see also John Devlin, The Bath Party: A History from Its Origins to 1966 (Stanford, California: Hoover Institution, 1976), p. 80.

Fuad Mattar, Bisaraha an Abd al-Nasir: Hiwar maa Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal (Frankly on Abd al-Nasir: a conversation with Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal) (Beirut: Dar al-Qadhaya, 1975), p. 135; also Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, Ma Alathi Jara . Suriya (What happened in Syria) (Cairo: al-Dar al-Qawmiya li al-Tibaa wa al-Nashr, 1962), p. 66.

The Bath, however, became Nasirs major ally at the time of the announcement of the Syrian-Egyptain union. They accepted the dissolution of their party, but believed that Bathist principles would constitute the ideological foundation of the new state. As Michel A.aqput it: We will be of.cially dissolved but we will be present in the new uni.ed party, the National Union. Born of the union of the two countries, this [unitary party] cannot be animated by principles other than those of the Bath.21 The Bath, therefore, saw Nasir as a splendid capture or recruit whose personal prestige would add power to the [Baths] ideas.22 In the opinion of Khalid al-Azm, Syrias defense minister before the Union, the partys .­delity to Nasir in the initial period of the union stemmed from the many powers given to the Bath in Syria by Nasir, which allowed it to become the dominant political group in the country in the .rst year of the union.23 On the other hand, Nasirs reliance on the Bath in that period could have stemmed from a belief, in.ated by Bath­ist leaders, in the partys stature as the backbone of the popular forces supporting unity in Syria.24 But bitter disappointment was soon to come to both Nasir and the Bath.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，在叙利亚-埃及联盟宣布时，巴斯成为纳西尔的主要盟友。他们接受了党的解散，但相信巴斯主义原则将构成新国家的意识形态基础。正如米歇尔·阿奎克所说：我们将被解散，但我们将出现在新的统一政党——国民联盟中。这个[单一政党]诞生于两国的联合，除了巴斯的原则之外，不能被其他原则所激励。21 因此，巴斯将纳西尔视为一个出色的俘虏或新兵，他的个人声望将增加[巴斯]思想的力量。22 在联盟之前的叙利亚国防部长哈立德·阿兹姆 （Khalid al-Azm） 看来，联盟初期对纳西尔的忠诚源于纳西尔赋予叙利亚巴斯的许多权力，这使得它在联盟成立的第一年成为该国的主要政治团体。23 另一方面， 纳西尔在那个时期对巴斯的依赖可能源于巴斯派领导人的信念，即该党是支持叙利亚团结的人民力量的支柱。24 但纳西尔和巴斯很快就感到痛苦的失望。

content_units.text: Bathist hopes of at least sharing power with Nasir had dimin­ished considerably by mid-1959. Salah Bitar was to put the blame for those dashed hopes on Nasir for his failure to accept a neces­sary association of other progressive leaders in the management of the Arab cause and its policies.25 By the same token, the Bath seemed to have a somewhat elasticized notion of the meaning of sharing. For instance, Bathist ministers in the northern region (Syria) embarked on appointing mostly Bathist personnel in their respective ministries, a practice that led to widespread dissension among the large numbers of employees not af.liated with the party. Nasir responded by insisting on a nonpartisan committee that would oversee all appointments to ensure the absence of ideologi­cal bias. This, the Bath took as a sign of Egyptian hostility to the party.26 Bathist resentment began to seep through to the partys adherents within the Syrian army. Such murmurings were bound to reach Nasirs ear, as a result of which forty Syrian of.cers, twenty of whom were Bathists, were transferred to Egypt.27
content_units.azure_translation: 到 1959 年中期，巴斯主义者至少与纳西尔分享权力的希望已大大减弱。萨拉赫·比塔尔将把这些希望破灭的责任归咎于纳西尔，因为他未能接受其他进步领导人在管理阿拉伯事业及其政策方面的必要联合。25 出于同样的原因，巴斯似乎对分享的意义有一种弹性的概念。例如，北部地区（叙利亚）的巴斯派部长开始在各自的部委中任命大部分巴斯派人员，这种做法导致大量不与该党有联系的雇员之间存在广泛的分歧。纳西尔的回应是坚持成立一个无党派委员会来监督所有任命，以确保没有意识形态偏见。巴斯认为这是埃及对该党怀有敌意的标志。26 巴斯派的怨恨开始渗透到叙利亚军队内部的党派追随者身上。这种抱怨必然会传到纳西尔的耳朵里，结果四十名叙利亚人，其中二十人是巴西斯人，被转移到埃及27。

On the level of the political leadership, the .rst ominous sign for the Bath appeared as early as October 1958 with Nasirs an­nouncement of his .rst UAR cabinet. This included only fourteen Syrians among thirty-four members, with all the key posts going to Egyptians. During 1959, the Bathists frequently complained of being decreasingly consulted by the Egyptians, and that an effort was being made to cut them off from their political base in Syria.28 In the elections of the Syrian National Union in July 1959, the Bath Party could only manage 5 percent of the seats, subsequently accusing the Egyptian leadership and its supporters in Syria of rig­ging the elections against them.29 By December, the con.ict be­tween Nasir and the Bath had become irreconcilable. Without con­sulting their Syrian governmental colleagues, leading Bathist cabinet ministers resigned from the central and regional cabinets p. 150; al-Madani, Haula Hakamu Suriya (Those who governed Syria), p. 122. 28 Al-Ahram (Cairo), November 17, 1961. 29 A Bathist supporter, however, argues that the deteriorating economic conditions
content_units.azure_translation: 在政治领导层面，早在 1958 年 10 月，纳西尔宣布成立他的第一个 UAR 内阁，巴斯的第一个不祥迹象就出现了。这包括 34 名成员中只有 14 名叙利亚人，所有关键职位都由埃及人担任。1959 年期间，巴斯党经常抱怨埃及人越来越少地咨询他们，并且正在努力切断他们在叙利亚的政治基础。28 在 1959 年 7 月的叙利亚民族联盟选举中，巴斯党只能获得 5% 的席位，随后指责埃及领导层及其在叙利亚的支持者纵了对他们不利的选举。29 到 12 月， 纳西尔和巴斯之间的关系已经变得不可调和。在没有咨询叙利亚政府同事的情况下，巴斯派主要内阁部长辞去了中央和地区内阁的职务，第 150 页;al-Madani， Haula Hakamu Suriya （那些统治叙利亚的人），第 122 页。28 Al-Ahram（开罗），1961年11月17日。29 然而，一位巴斯派的支持者认为，不断恶化的经济状况

content_units.text: of the UAR.30 During the following two years, the Bath became one of the harshest critics of Nasirs rule in Syria.
content_units.azure_translation: 30 在接下来的两年里，巴斯成为纳西尔人在叙利亚统治的最严厉批评者之一。

content_units.text: The resignation of such Bathist luminaries as Salah Bitar and Akram Hourani was a major blow not just to the UAR, but also to the Arab nationalist movement in the region as a whole. What the UAR had succeeded in doing was to provide a uni.ed goal for the various nationalist groups in the Arab world. The Bathist resignations split the movement between the Bathists on the one hand, and the other nationalist groups, such as the Nasirists, George Habashs group, Harakat al-Qawmiyeen al-Arab (the Arab Nationalists Movement), and a host of unaf.liated national­ists. In fact, it led to some defections from within the Bath Party, most notably the Partys two elder statesmen in Iraqand Jordan, Fuad al-Rikabi and Abdullah al-Rimawi. All this resulted in weak­ening the Arab nationalist movement. Nasir admitted as much. Re­.ecting on the experience of the UAR, Nasir said in 1963: The resignation of the Bathist Cabinet members was a major mistake, and I have the courage to tell you that my precipitant acceptance of these resignations also was a major mistake.31
content_units.azure_translation: 萨拉赫·比塔尔（Salah Bitar）和阿克拉姆·胡拉尼（Akram Hourani）等巴斯派名人的辞职不仅对阿拉伯联合军，而且对整个该地区的阿拉伯民族主义运动都是一个重大打击。UAR 成功地为阿拉伯世界的各个民族主义团体提供了一个统一的目标。巴斯主义者的辞职将运动分裂为巴斯主义者，另一方面是其他民族主义团体，如纳西尔主义者、乔治·哈巴什斯团体、阿拉伯民族主义运动（阿拉伯民族主义者运动）和许多不知情的民族主义者。事实上，它导致了巴斯党内部的一些叛逃，最引人注目的是该党在伊拉克和约旦的两位元老政治家福阿德·里卡比和阿卜杜拉·里马维。所有这些都导致了阿拉伯民族主义运动的削弱。纳西尔也承认了这一点。纳西尔在 1963 年回顾了 UAR 的经验，说： 巴斯派内阁成员的辞职是一个重大错误，我有勇气告诉你们，我仓促接受这些辞职也是一个重大错误。31

content_units.text: Beyond the Bath, more groups and constituencies who had vig­orously supported the Union were having second thoughts. The Syrians had imagined the UAR as a union of equals under the lead­ership of Nasir. The problem was that for all intents and purposes, there could be no equality between a country of twenty-six million people and another of four million people. Syria had little choice but to follow in Egypts shadow, and to do things the way Egyp­tians did them. Especially distressing to the Syrians was the specta­cle of their administrative, legislative, and military systems being gradually absorbed into Egypts.
content_units.azure_translation: 在巴斯之外，更多大力支持联邦的团体和选区正在重新考虑。叙利亚人曾将 UAR 想象成纳西尔领导下的平等联盟。问题在于，无论出于何种意图和目的，一个拥有 2600 万人口的国家和另一个拥有 400 万人口的国家之间不可能实现平等。叙利亚别无选择，只能效仿埃及的影子，像埃及人那样做事。尤其令叙利亚人痛苦的是他们的行政、立法和军事系统逐渐被埃及吸收的景象。

content_units.text: What ultimately was most destabilizing for the UAR was the growing Syrian resentment of the wholesale military changes and transfers directed at the Syrian of.cer corps. One of the most embit­tered was General A.f al-Bizri, who, as Syrias chief of staff, liter­ ally forced the concept of total merger between Egypt and Syria on recalcitrant politicians. Yet shortly after the announcement of the UAR, his objection to Egyptian-inspired command changes in the Syrian army allowed Nasir to remove this leftist army of.cer. Bizri retaliated by sending an urgent message to Iraqs General Qasim urging him not to join the UAR in which the Syrians had lost their independence and their very being.32 Ha.z al-Asad, later to rule Syria for thirty years until his death in 2000, related his own resent­ment when as a young air force of.cer he had just returned from a training stint in Moscow to discover that the Aleppo Air Academy, where he had won his wings, had been transferred to Egypt, to­gether with part of the Homs Military College. Asad found that the Syrian of.cer corps was buzzing with stories of sackings, trans­fers and slights at the hands of the overbearing Egyptians.33
content_units.azure_translation: 最终对 UAR 来说最不稳定的是叙利亚人对针对叙利亚of.cer军团的大规模军事变革和转移越来越不满。其中最痛苦的是 A.f al-Bizri 将军，他作为叙利亚参谋长，实际上将埃及和叙利亚完全合并的概念强加给顽固的政客。然而，在宣布 UAR 后不久，他反对受埃及启发的叙利亚军队指挥权变动，这使得纳西尔得以of.cer罢免这支左翼军队。比兹里通过向伊拉克将军卡西姆发出紧急信息进行报复，敦促他不要加入叙利亚人失去独立和存在的 UAR。32 哈兹·阿萨德（Ha.z al-Asad）后来统治叙利亚三十年，直到2000年去世，他讲述了自己对自己的怨恨，当时他还是一名年轻的空军of.cer刚从莫斯科训练回来，发现他赢得翅膀的阿勒颇空军学院（Aleppo Air Academy）与霍姆斯军事学院的一部分一起被转移到埃及。阿萨德发现，叙利亚of.cer军团充斥着专横的埃及人被解雇、调动和轻视的故事。33

content_units.text: Ahmad Abd al-Karim, Hisad: Sineen Khasiba wa thimar Murra (Harvest: fertile years and bitter fruit) (Beirut: Baysan, 1994), pp. 405407.
Said, Iraq 8 Shibat, 1963 (Iraqof 8 February, 1963), fn. 1, pp. 214215.

As the early euphoria in Syria subsided and the indignation of key elements of Syrian society increased, Nasir responded by de­pending more on a small circle of operatives in his intelligence and security services. By the summer of 1959, Colonel Abd al-Hamid Saraj, the head of the universally feared and detested security appa­ratus, the Duxieme Bureau, had become Syrias most powerful po­litical .gure. Some of Nasirs most ardent and loyal supporters were warning him of Sarajs excesses and sti.ing authoritarianism. Riad Taha, a prominent Lebanese journalist, and sometimes a Nasir con.dant, writes in his memoirs that as early as June 1959, he told Nasir that the UAR was no longer secure, since even those who had supported him were beginning to hold back. Taha point­edly told Nasir: when the Syrians gathered around you, they thought they would no longer live in a police state, yet they are living under Hamid al-Saraj. He then reminded the president that the Syrians had tasted democratic freedoms in the past, and grown accustomed to them.34 But to no avail. Nasirs successes thus far had been built not on political pluralism, but on an author­itarianism centered on one man; his own proclivity then was for a strong and centralizing authoritarian rule. In a later remark to an Iraqi delegation, Nasir dismissed the notion of the separation of powers, calling it a major deception, and declaring that in real­ity it simply could not exist.35 Added to all this was Nasirs convic­tion in the sheer anarchy of Syrian society and politics. Conse­quently, rather than heed the advise of his Syrian supporters, Nasir gave Saraj even more powers, essentially tying the future stability of Syria and the UAR to the savagery of Sarajs iron rule. Ex-President Shukri al-Quwatly, the man who in February 1958 had stood with Nasir basking in the adulation of the Syrian masses, later would remark that the Nasserite system relegated the major­ity of the (Syrian) population to the rank of traitors, governing by terror and trampling on the honor and dignity of citizens.36 Even the Egyptian journalist, Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, Nasirs close friend and con.dant, when enumerating the reasons for the even­tual failure of the UAR, pointed the .nger at the excessively repres­sive police system created by Saraj. In Haykals words, the coercive machinery of Nasirs prote´ge´ and right-hand man in Syria had taken the form of a severe and destructive cancer.37 He could have added however that it was a cancer that his president and friend seemed content to live with.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着叙利亚早期的兴奋情绪消退，叙利亚社会关键分子的愤慨情绪增加，纳西尔的回应是更多地依赖他的情报和安全部门中的一小群特工。到 1959 年夏天，举世闻风和厌恶的安全机构 Duxieme 局的负责人阿卜杜勒·哈米德·萨拉吉上校已成为叙利亚最有权势的政治人物。一些纳西尔最热心和忠诚的支持者警告他萨拉吉的过激行为和煽动威权主义。黎巴嫩著名记者、有时是纳西尔的同伴里亚德·塔哈（Riad Taha）在他的回忆录中写道，早在1959年6月，他就告诉纳西尔，UAR不再安全，因为即使是那些支持他的人也开始退缩。塔哈尖锐地告诉纳西尔：当叙利亚人聚集在你周围时，他们认为他们不会再生活在警察国家中，但他们却生活在哈米德·萨拉吉的统治下。然后他提醒总统，叙利亚人过去尝过民主自由的滋味，并且已经习惯了。34 但无济于事。迄今为止，纳西尔的成功不是建立在政治多元化之上，而是建立在以一个人为中心的专制主义之上的;当时他自己的倾向是强有力的中央集权专制统治。纳西尔后来在对伊拉克代表团发表讲话时驳斥了三权分立的概念，称其为重大欺骗，并宣称它实际上根本不可能存在。35 除此之外，纳西尔对叙利亚社会和政治的纯粹无政府状态深信不疑。因此，纳西尔没有听从叙利亚支持者的建议，而是赋予萨拉吉更多的权力，实质上将叙利亚和阿拉伯联合共和国未来的稳定与萨拉吉铁腕统治的野蛮联系在一起。前总统舒克里·库瓦特利（Shukri al-Quwatly）在1958年2月曾与纳西尔站在一起，沐浴在叙利亚群众的奉承中，他后来评论说，纳赛尔派制度将大多数（叙利亚）人口降级为叛徒，以恐怖统治，践踏公民的荣誉和尊严。36 就连纳西尔的密友兼党人、埃及记者穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔（Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal）在列举UAR最终失败的原因时，也指出了萨拉吉所建立的过度压迫的警察系统。用海卡尔的话说，纳西尔的亲身手和叙利亚的得力助手的胁迫机制已经以严重和破坏性的癌症的形式出现。37 然而，他本可以补充说，这是一种癌症，他的总统和朋友似乎很满足于忍受。

Patrick Seale, Asad ofSyria: The Struggle for the Middle East (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1988), p. 59.
Taha, Qissat al-Wuhda wa al-In.sal (The story of unity and secession), pp. 145146.

On top of all the political maladies, the economic problems were mounting too. Syrias economy had been built on private enterprise with very little intrusion by the state. Three years prior to the Egyp­tian-Syrian merger, a report by the International Bank for Recon­struction and Development (IBRD) concluded that one of the main features of what the Bank described as Syrias rapid economic de­velopment was that it had been almost wholly due to private en­terprise.38 Joining with Egypt in the UAR, however, meant that
content_units.azure_translation: 除了所有的政治弊病之外，经济问题也在不断加剧。叙利亚的经济建立在私营企业之上，几乎没有受到国家的干预。在埃及-叙利亚合并前三年，国际复兴开发银行（IBRD）的一份报告得出结论，该银行所说的叙利亚经济快速发展的主要特征之一是，它几乎完全归功于私营企业。38 然而，与埃及一起加入阿拉伯联合酋长国意味着

Syria would have to conform to the socialist principle of state con­trol of the economy which was practiced by Egypt. But the Syrian business class could not accept Nasirs economic restrictions as readily as its Egyptian counterpart. Moreover, with Cairo becom­ing the UAR capital, Syrian businessmen had to obtain their li­censes and permits in the Egyptian city. As though it was not enough to deal with an already inhospitable environment, the Syri­ans had to travel to the Egyptian capital, and once there, had to navigate through the maze of Egypts bureaucratic conundrum, a far cry from the personal and direct relationship that had existed in pre-union Syria between business and government.39 And be­cause of the cumbersome political structure that Nasir created less for its ef.ciency and more to cater for the sensitivities of both par­ties,40 the Syrian businessmen could not count on the Syrian minis­ters in the Central Cabinet in Cairo to solve their problems.41 Very soon money began to leave Syria for European capitals, which only added to the deterioration of Syrias economic conditions.42 The disaffection of Syrias businessmen mirrored the earlier alienation of the countrys landowning class. The Agrarian Reform Law, promulgated in September 1958 to bring Syria in line with Egypt, was greeted with much resentment by Syrias powerful landown­ers, and the situation was not helped by a succession of bad har­vests that resulted in severe shortages of basic commodities.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚必须遵守埃及实行的国家控制经济的社会主义原则。但叙利亚商界不能像埃及商界那样轻易接受纳西尔的经济限制。此外，随着开罗成为 UAR 首都，叙利亚商人必须在埃及城市获得执照和许可证。似乎还不足以应对本已恶劣的环境，叙利亚人不得不前往埃及首都，一旦到达那里，就必须穿越埃及官僚难题的迷宫，这与联合前叙利亚存在的企业和政府之间的个人和直接关系相去甚远。39 由于纳西尔创造的繁琐政治结构与其说是为了效率，不如说是为了迎合敏感性40 叙利亚商人不能指望开罗中央内阁中的叙利亚部长来解决他们的问题。41 很快，资金开始离开叙利亚流向欧洲首都，这只会加剧叙利亚经济状况的恶化。42 叙利亚商人的不满反映了该国地主阶级早期的疏远。1958 年 9 月颁布的《土地改革法》旨在使叙利亚与埃及看齐，但遭到了叙利亚强大地主的极大不满，而一系列歉收导致基本商品严重短缺也无济于事。

content_units.text: In the midst of these mounting problems in Syria, a regional crisis, involving Nasirs Iraqi nemesis Abd al-Karim Qasim, erupted suddenly. The crisis presented Nasir with some uncomfort­able choices relating to the meaning and intent of Arab nationalism and Arab unity. The affair began auspiciously with the agreement in June 1961 between Britain and the ruler of Kuwait for an end to the status of the small Gulf sheikhdom as a British protectorate. Kuwaiti celebrations were cut short abruptly when a few days after the announcement of the agreement, Qasim in a major speech not only withheld his recognition of the new state, but made it clear that he intended to return Kuwait to its former status under Otto­man rule as an integral part of Iraq.43 Adding insult to injury, Qasim appointed the ruler of the oil-rich sheikhdom mayor of Ku­wait, a position that carried a salary of about $500 a month! Dis­armed by Qasims announcement, the Kuwaiti ruler requested im­mediate British protection, and on July 1, British troops began to pour into Kuwait. Simultaneously, Egypt took the lead to hasten Kuwaiti entry into the Arab League, thus legitimizing Kuwaiti sov­ereignty. The League also sanctioned the dispatch of Arab forces made up of Egyptian, Jordanian, and Saudi troops to replace the British. By September, the crisis had .zzled.44 Any threat of an Iraqi military operation had dissipated,45 and the bulk of the interna­tional community had extended diplomatic recognition to Kuwait.
content_units.azure_translation: 在叙利亚这些日益严重的问题中，一场涉及纳西尔伊拉克宿敌阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·卡西姆的地区危机突然爆发。这场危机给纳西尔带来了一些与阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯团结的意义和意图有关的令人不安的选择。1961 年 6 月，英国与科威特统治者达成协议，结束海湾小酋长国作为英国保护国的地位，这段事情开始了。科威特的庆祝活动突然中断，在协议宣布几天后，卡西姆在一次重要讲话中不仅拒绝承认新国家，而且明确表示他打算将科威特恢复到以前在奥斯曼帝国统治下的地位，成为伊拉克不可分割的一部分。43 雪上加霜， 卡西姆任命了石油资源丰富的酋长国的统治者科威特市长，这个职位的月薪约为 500 美元！科威特统治者被卡西姆的宣布解除了武装，请求英国立即保护，7月1日，英国军队开始涌入科威特。与此同时，埃及带头加速科威特加入阿拉伯联盟，从而使科威特主权合法化。联盟还批准派遣由埃及、约旦和沙特军队组成的阿拉伯军队来取代英国。到9月，危机已经结束了。44 伊拉克军事行动的任何威胁都已经消散，45 国际社会的大部分国家已经向科威特提供了外交承认。

While Nasir could take comfort in his role in what turned out to be a thoroughly humiliating affair for his Iraqi enemy, the Ku­waiti crisis, nevertheless, did present him with some uncomfortable issues. After all, Kuwait was hardly a shining light on the Arab nationalist path. Rich, backward, and ruled by a despotic and feu­dalist order, Kuwait was all that the UAR president professed to detest and struggle against. And Iraq, regardless of Nasirs con­tempt for Qasim, was considered a progressive country. In his declared crusade against Arab reaction, and in his commitment to revolutionary Arab unity, Nasir could have been expected to support the Iraqi position. After all, Egypts behavior in the region rested on the maxim that revolutionary and progressive countries should not be impeded by outdated notions of boundaries and sovereignty in carrying out their revolutionary mission.46 However, deeply hostile to Qasimite rule, the Egyptian leadership declared its support of Kuwaits right to safeguard its independence and self-determination. Later on, Egypt faced a further dilemma in its declared policy goals when the military forces of imperialist Brit­ain landed in Kuwait. This meant that while supporting the Ku­waiti people against Qasims stupidity, [Egypt] also supported the Iraqi people against the British concentrations near them.47 The net result was yet another af.rmation that unity schemes, whether entered freely or through coercion, would succeed only with the participation, or at a minimum the blessings, of Egypt.
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然纳西尔可以对自己在伊拉克敌人来说是彻底羞辱的事情中所扮演的角色感到安慰，但科威特危机确实给他带来了一些令人不安的问题。毕竟，科威特并不是阿拉伯民族主义道路上的一盏明灯。富裕、落后、专制和封建主义秩序统治的科威特是 UAR 总统声称要厌恶和反对的一切。而伊拉克，无论纳西尔如何蔑视卡西姆，都被认为是一个进步的国家。在他宣布的反对阿拉伯反动的十字军东征中，以及他对阿拉伯革命团结的承诺中，纳西尔本可以预期会支持伊拉克的立场。毕竟，埃及在该地区的行为是建立在这样一条格言之上的，即革命和进步国家在执行其革命使命时不应受到过时的边界和主权观念的阻碍。46 然而，埃及领导层对卡西姆派的统治深感敌视，宣称支持科威特维护其独立和自决的权利。后来，当帝国主义英国的军队登陆科威特时，埃及在其宣布的政策目标上面临进一步的困境。这意味着，在支持科威特人民反对卡西姆的愚蠢行为的同时，[埃及]也支持伊拉克人民反对英国在他们附近的集中地。47 最终的结果是，联合计划，无论是自由的还是通过胁迫的，只有在埃及的参与或至少得到祝福的情况下才能成功。

In fact, there never was any military threat. Immediately after Qasims announcement, the commander of the southern military air base at Shuaiba, Air Force Colonel Isam Dawi­sha, .ew to Baghdad to receive what he thought would be orders for some kind of a military operation. He was surprised however to hear the commander-in-chief of the Iraqi air force, Brigadier Jalal al-Awqati, tell him to be very careful not to allow any Iraqi plane to penetrate Kuwaiti air space. When Dawisha cited Qasims speech, al-Awqati replied: Dont take notice of this madman. You think the English would just let us walk into Kuwait? Conver­sation with the authors father, Air Force Colonel Isam Dawisha.

Nasirs victory over Qasim was dimmed by the situation in Syria, in which deteriorating economic conditions were compound­ing a rapidly worsening political situation and adding to mounting political tensions within the Syrian armed forces. Nasir became convinced that the merchants, landowners, and other members of the capitalist classes, abetted by the conservative and pro-West re­gimes of Saudi Arabia and Jordan, were behind all the trouble, purposely undermining the economy in order to weaken the UAR. He decided that efforts at compromise and coexistence were no longer tenable. Nasir thus embarked on a sweeping socialization of the economy. The whole of the cotton trade was taken over, and all import-export .rms were brought under public control. All banks, insurance companies, heavy industry, and most medium-sized and light industries were nationalized. Maximum land own­ership was halved to a hundred feddans (about 104 acres), and no income in any organization was allowed to exceed $14,350. These measures were the straw that broke the camels back for these for­ midable economic interests. The estrangement of Syrian capitalism was now complete.48 The .nancial and landowning classes began to work actively with other disgruntled elements inside Syria as well as with Egypts adversaries abroad.49 It is instructive that an of.cial statement put out on Radio Damascus shortly after Syrias secession declared that a major bone of contention was the Syrian economy [which] had developed through the efforts of individual activity.50 On September 28, the Syrian army made its move.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚局势使纳西尔对卡西姆的胜利黯淡无光，叙利亚局势不断恶化，经济状况恶化，政治局势迅速恶化，叙利亚武装部队内部政治紧张局势加剧。纳西尔开始确信，在沙特阿拉伯和约旦保守和亲西方政权的怂恿下，商人、地主和其他资产阶级成员是所有麻烦的幕后黑手，他们故意破坏经济以削弱 UAR。他认为妥协和共存的努力不再站得住脚。纳西尔因此开始了全面的经济社会化。整个棉花贸易被接管，所有进出口.rms都置于公共控制之下。所有银行、保险公司、重工业和大多数中轻工业都被国有化。最大土地所有权减半至一百联邦（约 104 英亩），任何组织的收入都不得超过 14,350 美元。这些措施是压垮这些中等经济利益的最后一根稻草。叙利亚资本主义的疏远现在已经彻底了。48 金融阶级和地主阶级开始积极地与叙利亚境内其他心怀不满的分子以及埃及在国外的对手合作。49 叙利亚分离后不久，大马士革广播电台发表的一份声明宣称，一个主要的争论焦点是叙利亚经济，[它]是通过个人活动的努力发展起来的。50 9月28日，叙利亚军队采取行动。

Initially, the Syrian secessionist of.cers claimed that they de­manded no more than some reforms within the Syrian armed forces.51 They reiterated their loyalty to the UAR under Nasirs presidency, and they asked for an audience with Marshall Abd al-Hakim Amer, the Egyptian Commander-in-Chief of the UAR armed forces, who was then in Damascus. The negotiations yielded a communique´ which was broadcast on Syrian radio emphasizing that military reforms were going to be enacted as a result of the military move, and that the con.dence of the Syrian army in the leadership of the UAR was unshakeable. Whether this had been a mere ploy,52 or whether the of.cers began to fear an im­pending military response from Egypt,53 Radio Damascus soon broadcast another communique´ negating the earlier one, and effec­tively declaring a military coup against those who humiliated
content_units.azure_translation: 最初，叙利亚分离主义者声称，他们只要求在叙利亚武装部队内部进行一些改革。51 他们重申了对纳西尔担任总统期间的 UAR 的忠诚，并要求会见当时在大马士革的埃及 UAR 武装部队总司令 Marshall Abd al-Hakim Amer。谈判达成了一份公报，并在叙利亚广播电台播出，强调军事改革将因军事行动而实施，叙利亚军队在 UAR 领导层中的一致性是不可动摇的。无论这只是一个策略，52 还是 of.cers 开始担心埃及即将做出的军事反应，53 大马士革广播电台很快又播出了另一份公报，否定了之前的公报，并实际上宣布了对那些羞辱者发动军事政变

content_units.text: Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal argues that the Syrian capitalists supported the establish­ment of the UAR because they sought a strong government that would .ght Communist in.uence in Syria and provide the country with much needed political stability that would be conducive for increased economic activity. Once al-Nasir introduced his socialist measures, Haykal says, the Syrian merchants and businessmen changed their tune arguing that Syria could not survive without a vibrant commercial environment, and that what worked for Egypt would not work for Syria. See Haykal, Ma Alathi Jara . Suriya (What happened in Syria), pp. 6566.

Syria and degraded her army.54 This theme was repeated a number of times in the days following the coup,55 probably because the coup leaders quickly realized that support for the coup fell short of their expectations.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚并贬低了她的军队。54 在政变后的几天里，这个主题被重复了好几次，55 可能是因为政变领导人很快意识到对政变的支持没有达到他们的预期。

content_units.text: Even though the coup was popular among Syrias socioeco­nomic and political elite, it was by no stretch of the imagination a popular revolution. To begin with, a number of military units, especially those in Aleppo and Latakia, continued throughout the day of the rebellion to broadcast their loyalty to the UAR. Only after protracted negotiations with the secessionist of.cers and the realization that much blood would be shed did they agree to join the revolt. Then there were large and widespread demonstrations against the secession in the streets of the main Syrian cities, in which many demonstrators were killed and injured by the seces­sionist army units.56 Quiet returned only after Nasir declared that he would not intervene in Syria. But it was a quiet born not of consent but of sadness and dismay. True, a number of Arab coun­tries were very pleased with Syrias secession. Jordan could not hide its glee, and immediately recognized the new regime, to be followed by equally jubilant Saudi Arabia and Iraq. However, the satisfaction of Husayn, Saud, and Qasim was not shared by the majority of Arabs. Most people in Arab cities and towns listened to the news with aggrieved silence.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管政变在叙利亚社会经济和政治精英中很受欢迎，但它绝不是一场人民革命。首先，一些军事单位，尤其是阿勒颇和拉塔基亚的军事单位，在叛乱的一整天都在继续宣传他们对 UAR 的忠诚。只有在与分离主义者进行旷日持久的谈判并意识到会流很多血之后，他们才同意加入起义。随后，叙利亚主要城市的街道上发生了大规模而广泛的反对分离的示威活动，许多示威者被分离主义军队打死打伤。56 直到纳西尔宣布他不会干预叙利亚后，才恢复了平静。但这是一种安静的，不是出于同意，而是出于悲伤和沮丧。诚然，一些阿拉伯国家对叙利亚的分离感到非常高兴。约旦无法掩饰喜悦之情，并立即承认了新政权，同样欢欣鼓舞的沙特阿拉伯和伊拉克也紧随其后。然而，侯赛因、沙特和卡西姆的满意并没有得到大多数阿拉伯人的认同。阿拉伯城镇的大多数人听着这个消息时都怀着委屈的沉默。

content_units.text: Momentous as it was, the Syrian secession did not mean the end of the Arab nationalist movement. Wounded, the nationalist spirit continued to live on. So ingrained had it become, that whatever their ideological persuasion, Arab leaders as a matter of course, could not but pay lip service to the nationalist goal of uniting the
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚的分离虽然意义重大，但并不意味着阿拉伯民族主义运动的终结。受伤后，民族主义精神继续存在。它已经变得如此根深蒂固，以至于无论他们的意识形态说服如何，阿拉伯领导人理所当然地不得不口头上支持团结

content_units.text: 54Times (London), September 29, 1961. Seemingly believing that this was a winning theme, the new Syrian rulers kept going back to it in the days following the coup.
See, for example, SWB, October 1, 1961, p. 10; SWB, October 4, p. 12; SWB, October 6, p. 9.

For the widespread resistance to the Syrian coup, see Mattar, Bisraha an Abd al-Nasir (Frankly on Abd al-Nasir), pp. 142143; Nasr, Abd al-Nasir wa Tajribat al-Wuhda (Abd al-Nasir and the unity experiment), 261262, 271; Eberhard Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revisited: Interest, Identity and Policy in Syria and Egypt, International Journal ofMiddle East Studies, vol. 27, no. 1 (February 1995): 57.

Arab people and their countries. Soon after seceding from the UAR, the new Syrian prime minister, Mamoun al-Kuzbari, an­nounced his governments plan to pursue an Arab union.57 It might well have been a rhetorical .ourish, but the man was responding to what he knew lay .rmly in his peoples hearts. Similarly, numerous Syrian politicians, including the Bathist leader Akram Hourani, who had lent his name to the secessionist cause, issued a communi­que´ advocating a comprehensive unity based on socialist and dem­ocratic principles.58 It was an effort to publicly cleanse their reputa­tions of past sins, and to try to reclaim their nationalist credentials by reaf.rming their commitment to Arab unity.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯人民及其国家。在脱离阿拉伯联合共和国后不久，叙利亚新总理马蒙·库兹巴里（Mamoun al-Kuzbari）宣布了他的政府计划寻求建立阿拉伯联盟。57 这很可能是一种修辞，但这个人是在回应他所知道的人民心中的东西。同样，许多叙利亚政客，包括巴斯派领导人阿克拉姆·胡拉尼（Akram Hourani），他曾为分离主义事业提供自己的名义，发表了一份公报，倡导在社会主义和民主原则的基础上实现全面统一。58 这是为了公开洗刷他们过去的罪恶，并试图通过重申他们对阿拉伯团结的承诺来夺回他们的民族主义资格。

content_units.text: By no means dead, Arab nationalism still did suffer a very seri­ous setback. If Iraqs refusal to join the UAR was the .rst dent in Arab nationalisms seemingly impregnable armor, the dissolution of the UAR was a signi.cant fracture. Only three years earlier in the summer and fall of 1958, people from around the Arab world had .lled the streets, euphoric in the hope that the actual union of two states and the very real possibility of two, even three, more joining in would become the very foundation upon which compre­hensive Arab unity would be built. Now in the fall of 1961, all they could do was to shake their heads at the debris, and dream of what might have been. Nor could they, as they had become accustomed to, turn to their hero for deliverance, for even the biggest dreamer or the most loyal supporter could not but treat the secession as a major defeat for Nasir and if not a devastating, then a signi.cant, blow to his prestige as the unifying symbol of Arab nationalism and the acknowledged impresario of the Arab nationalist march.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义绝不死，但仍然遭受了非常严重的挫折。如果说伊拉克拒绝加入阿拉伯民族主义是阿拉伯民族主义看似坚不可摧的盔甲的第一个凹痕，那么阿拉伯阿拉伯共和国的解散则是一个明显的裂痕。仅仅三年前的1958年夏秋两季，来自阿拉伯世界的人们就走上街头，欣喜若狂地希望两个国家的实际联合以及两个甚至三个国家加入的现实可能性将成为建立阿拉伯全面统一的基础。现在是 1961 年秋天，他们所能做的就是对着废墟摇摇头，梦想着可能发生的事情。他们也不能像他们已经习惯的那样，向他们的英雄寻求解救，因为即使是最大的梦想家或最忠实的支持者，也不能不将分离视为纳西尔的一次重大失败，即使不是毁灭性的，也是对他作为阿拉伯民族主义统一象征和阿拉伯民族主义游行公认的管理者的威望的重大打击。

content_units.text: Nasir himself well appreciated the extent of the setback. His eyes almost welling with tears, he described Syrias secession as more dangerous an assault on Arab nationalism than the tripartite attack on Egypt during the 1956 Suez Crisis.59 It was not merely the loss of Syria that weighed heavily on his heart; it was the impetus the secession gave to those who had vowed to .ght the rising Arab nationalist tide and to stop it from achieving its ultimate goal of Arab unity. The Arab reactionaries, as Nasir called them, would take heart from the secession and would now go on the offensive against Arab nationalism.60 But he insisted that Arab nationalism would never be defeated, and that the UAR (Nasir had decided not to change the name) would continue to carry the nationalist torch, and carry it vigorously and purposefully. In May 1962, Nasir enun­ciated a new radical National Charter. In it, he declared angrily and, to his adversaries, ominously:
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔本人非常了解挫折的程度。他眼中几乎泛起了泪水，他将叙利亚的分离描述为对阿拉伯民族主义的攻击，比 1956 年苏伊士危机期间对埃及的三方攻击更危险。59 沉重地压在他心上的不仅仅是叙利亚的损失;它是分离给那些发誓要遏制不断上升的阿拉伯民族主义浪潮并阻止其实现阿拉伯统一的最终目标的人的动力。纳西尔称他们为阿拉伯反动派，将从分离中振作起来，现在将对阿拉伯民族主义发起进攻。60 但他坚持认为，阿拉伯民族主义永远不会被打败，阿拉伯民族主义（纳西尔决定不改名）将继续高举民族主义火炬，并大力而有目的地高举它。1962 年 5 月，纳西尔宣布了一项新的激进国家宪章。在信中，他愤怒地对他的对手不祥地宣称：

content_units.text: Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revisited: Interest, Identity and Policy in Syria and Egypt, p. 55.
Ibid.
Speeches, 1961, p. 243; Stephens, Nasser, p. 341; Anthony Nutting, Nasser (London: Constable, 1972), p. 267.

The United Arab Republic, .rmly convinced that she is an integral part of the Arab nation, must propagate her call for unity and the principles it embodies, so that it would be at the disposal of every Arab citizen, without hesitating for one moment before the outworn argument that this would be considered a interference in the affairs of others.61
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯联合共和国深信自己是阿拉伯民族不可分割的一部分，因此必须宣传她对团结的呼吁及其所体现的原则，以便每个阿拉伯公民都能使用团结，而毫不犹豫地提出过时的论点，即这将被视为干涉他国事务61。

content_units.text: The so-called reactionaries, buoyed by the mishaps that befell Nasir, accepted the challenge and mounted their own campaign against Nasirs nationalism, now generally equated with commu­nism and Soviet socialism.62 The Saudis, drawing on their sta­tus as the guardians of al-Kaba, Islams holiest shrine, came up with their own Islamic Charter, which criticized fake national­ism based on atheistic doctrine.63 The Islamic Charter represented not just a blunt denunciation of Nasirs Arab nationalism, but also an invitation to other Arabs and Muslims to consider an alternative ideational path. The Islamic alternative also came with a seductive .nancial-inducement package, in which the Saudis opened their wallets, over.owing with petro-dollars, in order to help open the eyes of the doubters to the true path. By now, the balance of forces at the state, if not the popular level, seemed to favor the foes of the champion of Arab nationalism. This was readily apparent in the Arab League meeting in the Lebanese resort town of Shtoura in August 1962. Once assembled, the Syrians accused the Egyptians of interfering in Syrias internal affairs, a claim readily and vigorously supported by the Saudi, Jordanian, and Iraqi delegations. Civility was thrown to the wall, and the Arab multitude was treated to the spectacle of middle-aged men, many balding and overweight, throwing punches and chairs at one an­other. The unseemly fracas necessitated the intervention of the Leb­anese police. The indignant Egyptians walked out of the meeting, alone and isolated, and the Arab nationalist march walked along­side, dispirited and in disarray.
content_units.azure_translation: 所谓的反动派受到纳西尔遭遇的不幸的鼓舞，接受了挑战，并发起了自己的反对纳西尔民族主义的运动，纳西尔民族主义现在通常等同于共产主义和苏联社会主义。62 沙特人利用他们作为伊斯兰教最神圣圣地卡巴守护者的地位，提出了他们自己的《伊斯兰宪章》，批评基于无神论教义的虚假民族主义。63 《伊斯兰宪章》不仅是对纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义的直言不讳的谴责，也是对其他阿拉伯人和穆斯林的邀请，让他们考虑一条替代的思想道路。伊斯兰的替代方案还附带了一个诱人的金融诱因方案，沙特人打开了他们的钱包，用石油美元欠了太多钱，以帮助怀疑者打开眼睛，让他们看到真正的道路。到目前为止，国家的力量平衡，如果不是民众层面的话，似乎有利于阿拉伯民族主义拥护者的敌人。1962年8月在黎巴嫩度假小镇什图拉举行的阿拉伯联盟会议上，这一点显而易见。集结后，叙利亚人指责埃及人干涉叙利亚内政，这一说法得到了沙特、约旦和伊拉克代表团的强烈支持。礼貌被抛到了墙上，阿拉伯群众看到了中年男子的景象，其中许多人秃顶、超重，互相挥拳打脚踢。这种不体面的争吵需要黎巴嫩警察的干预。愤愤不平的埃及人独自一人、孤立地走出了会议，而阿拉伯民族主义游行队伍则与之并肩而行，气馁而混乱。

content_units.text: See for example, Speeches, 1961, pp. 285286; SWB, October 4, 1961, p. 12; al-Jum­huriya (Cairo), October 30, 1961; Speeches, 1961, pp. 347361.
The United Arab Republic, The Charter,p.79.
See SWB, March 20, 1962, p. 14; SWB, February 16, 1962, p. 8; SWB, July 18, 1962, p. 12.
Tom Little, Modern Egypt (London: Ernest Benn, 1967), p. 199.

To the nationalist generation these were indeed depressing times. The Arab world was bitterly divided, as far from comprehensive unity as it has ever been. The conservative Arab leaders, who had been contemptuously dismissed by the nationalists as reaction­aries ready to be elbowed out into historical oblivion, seemed to be on the ascendancy in the prevailing Arab Cold War.64 What was even more distressing was that this group was backed by the progressive Qasim of Iraqand Bourguiba of Tunisia, who while not perceived by the nationalists as reactionary, nevertheless were ardent upholders of wataniya, of the sanctity of their states against the qawmi force of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 对于民族主义一代来说，这确实是令人沮丧的时代。阿拉伯世界严重分裂，远未达到前所未有的全面统一。保守的阿拉伯领导人曾被民族主义者轻蔑地斥为准备被历史遗忘的反动分子，但在盛行的阿拉伯冷战中似乎占据了上风。64 更令人痛心的是，这个团体得到了伊拉克进步派卡西姆和突尼斯布尔吉巴的支持，他们虽然不被民族主义者视为反动派，但却是瓦塔尼亚的热心拥护者，维护他们国家的神圣性，反对阿拉伯民族主义的卡米势力。

content_units.text: It was in this period of stagnation for Arab nationalism, with hardly a glimmer of a light at the end of the tunnel, that on Septem­ber 26, a group of army of.cers seized power in Yemen, one of the most backward countries in the Arab world, shortly after the death of the absolute ruler, Imam Ahmad, and proclaimed the birth of the Yemeni Republic. The leader of the military putsch, Brigadier Abdallah al-Sallal, immediately cabled Nasir depicting the coup as a social movement against reaction and tyranny, and as a political movement dedicated to the Arab nationalist goal of comprehensive
content_units.azure_translation: 正是在阿拉伯民族主义停滞不前、隧道尽头几乎没有一丝曙光的时期，9月26日，在绝对统治者伊玛目艾哈迈德去世后不久，一群阿拉伯世界最落后的国家之一也门夺取了政权。 并宣布也门共和国的诞生。军事政变的领导人阿卜杜拉·萨拉勒准将立即给纳西尔发电，将政变描述为一场反对反动和暴政的社会运动，以及一场致力于阿拉伯民族主义全面目标的政治运动

content_units.text: The term was coined by Malcolm Kerr.

Arab unity.65 Cairo waited only a couple of days until the Egyptian leadership became convinced that the revolution represented . . . the free Yemeni will,66 before recognizing the infant republic. A nationalist revolution in one of the most backward countries in the Arab world, which also happened to border on Saudi Arabia, consti­tuted a huge shot in the arm for Nasir and radical Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯的团结。65 开罗只等了几天，埃及领导层就确信革命代表了......自由的也门人会，66 在承认这个新生的共和国之前。在阿拉伯世界最落后的国家之一，恰好也与沙特阿拉伯接壤，发生了一场民族主义革命，这对纳西尔和激进的阿拉伯民族主义来说是一剂强心针。

content_units.text: By the same token, however, the Yemeni revolution represented a great danger to the stability of Saudi Arabia. Within twenty-four hours of the revolution, Nasir would later say, it became evident that King Saud would not keep quiet.67 Saudi resolve was strengthened when after an early uncertain period, it transpired that Imam Badr, the son of Ahmad, had escaped to the mountains of Yemen, where he embarked on gathering support from the northern tribes. Saudi Arabia immediately promised money and arms. The leaders of the coup responded by requesting Egyptian help. Nasir, believing that only limited military support was re­quired, decided on September 30 to dispatch trainers, advisers, and military equipment to Sana, Yemens capital. What he did not know at the time was that he had taken the very .rst steps toward embroiling the Egyptian armed forces in a protracted con.ict that would last for over .ve inconclusive years, and which would have a debilitating impact on Egypts morale and economy. Before the end of the year, the number of Egyptian troops had risen from one hundred to eight thousand; and it did not take long for the Egyp­tian General Staff to realize that the main brunt of the war would have to be borne by the Egyptians. In 1963, the number of Egyptian troops in Yemen rose to twenty thousand, then it increased to forty thousand in 1964, and reached a staggering seventy thousand in 1965. Nasir would later admit that his Yemeni venture was a mis­calculation; we never thought that it would lead to what it did.68
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，出于同样的原因，也门革命对沙特阿拉伯的稳定构成了巨大的威胁。纳西尔后来说，在革命后的二十四小时内，沙特国王显然不会保持沉默。67 沙特的决心得到了加强，在经历了一段早期的不确定时期后，艾哈迈德的儿子伊玛目巴德尔逃到了也门的山区，在那里他开始从北部部落那里获得支持。沙特阿拉伯立即承诺提供金钱和武器。政变领导人的回应是请求埃及提供帮助。纳西尔认为只需要有限的军事支持，于是于 9 月 30 日决定向也门首都萨那派遣教练员、顾问和军事装备。他当时不知道的是，他已经采取了第一步，将埃及武装部队卷入一场旷日持久的冲突，这场战争将持续数年多，这将对埃及的士气和经济产生破坏性影响。年底前，埃及军队的人数已经从十人增加到了八千人;没过多久，埃及总参谋部就意识到，战争的主要冲击力必须由埃及人承担。1963年，埃及驻也门军队人数上升到两万人，随后在1964年增加到四万人，1965年达到了惊人的七万人。纳西尔后来承认，他在也门的冒险是一个误判;我们从未想过它会导致它所做的事情。68

content_units.text: What were the bases for this miscalculation? To begin with, Cairo was duped by the early signs of huge popular support for the military move in Sana. Haykal wrote that when it became clear that all the people were with the revolution, the UAR gave it its full support.69 But that betrayed a total misunderstanding of Yemeni demographics and geography.70 The support for the coup came predominantly from the populations of the cities and south­ern plains. But the inhabitants of the northern mountains and the western desert were .ercely loyal to the Imam whom they consid­ered to be their potentate as well as the hallowed Commander of the Faithful. These people were tribal, less open to the world, and warlike. And the mountainous terrain they inhabited made it ex­traordinarily arduous for an adversary to defeat them.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种误判的依据是什么？首先，开罗被民众对萨那军事行动的巨大支持的早期迹象所欺骗。海卡尔写道，当很明显所有人民都支持革命时，UAR 给予了全力支持。69 但这暴露了对也门人口和地理的完全误解。70 对政变的支持主要来自城市和南部平原的居民。但北部山区和西部沙漠的居民对伊玛目非常忠诚，他们认为伊玛目是他们的权力者，也是神圣的信徒指挥官。这些人是部落的，对世界不太开放，而且好战。他们居住的山区地形使敌人要击败他们变得异常艰巨。

content_units.text: SWB, October 1, 1962, p. 4. 66 Al-Ahram (Cairo), October 19, 1962. 67 Speeches, 1962, pp. 258259. 68 Interview with Look, March 4, 1968, reported in Times (London), March 5, 1968.

And then there was the abiding and unwavering conviction among nationalists in the universal appeal of Arab nationalism. Intellectually, the Egyptian leaders, and indeed all those who be­lieved in Arab nationalism, had always separated the people from their rulers, believing fervently that if left to their own devices, the people would indubitably join the nationalist march. The popular response to Egypts Arab nationalist policies over the Baghdad Pact, the Suez Crisis, and the formation of the UAR, as well as the widespread and spontaneous pro-UAR demonstrations that erupted in Syria in the immediate wake of the secessionist coup, con.rmed this leadership-people divide in the minds of the Egyp­tian leaders. Nasir and his colleagues simply refused to accept that people whom they believed had been made by their reactionary leaders to live in thirteenth-century conditions would refuse to join the nationalist march and its modernizing ways.71 That the people of Yemen had not expressed a vociferous and public desire to do so was to the Egyptians no more than a function of the tyrannical rule under which they labored. While that view was perhaps true in the cities and among the swelling ranks of the literate middle classes, it was less true among the people of the countryside, and particularly among groups harboring strong tribal identity and liv­ ing in geographically isolated areas. While Arab nationalism had indeed made impressive inroads into traditional values and belief systems, it was pure wishful thinking to believe that in every corner of the Arab world, minds had been changed and centuries-old out­looks had been transformed. It was far too premature to pronounce the demise of traditional habits and ways, or to declare the victory of modernity; certainly not among the tribes in the northern moun­tains of Yemen. And by the time the Egyptian troops .nally with­drew in December 1967, the debilitating war had alienated many Egyptians from the ideal of Arab nationalism, cementing an isola­tionist impulse not to get mired in the quicksand of Arab politics. To Arab nationalists generally, the disappointment at the unsuc­cessful prosecution of the Yemeni war tarnished further the halo of invincibility that accompanied the Arab nationalist tide during its glory days between 1955 and 1958.
content_units.azure_translation: 然后是民族主义者对阿拉伯民族主义的普遍吸引力的持久和坚定不移的信念。从理智上讲，埃及领导人，以及所有相信阿拉伯民族主义的人，总是将人民与统治者分开，他们热切地相信，如果任由他们自生自灭，人民无疑会加入民族主义游行。对埃及在巴格达条约、苏伊士危机和 UAR 成立方面的阿拉伯民族主义政策的民众反应，以及分离主义政变后立即在叙利亚爆发的广泛而自发的支持 UAR 示威活动，在埃及领导人的脑海中造成了这种领导层与人民的分歧。纳西尔和他的同事们根本拒绝接受他们认为被反动领导人逼迫生活在 13 世纪条件下的人会拒绝加入民族主义游行及其现代化方式。71 也门人民没有大声地公开表达这样做的愿望，对埃及人来说，这只不过是他们所统治的暴政统治的一种功能。虽然这种观点在城市和不断膨胀的识字中产阶级队伍中可能是正确的，但在农村人民中，特别是在具有强烈部落认同感并生活在地理上偏远地区的群体中，情况就不那么正确了。虽然阿拉伯民族主义确实在传统价值观和信仰体系中取得了令人印象深刻的进展，但相信在阿拉伯世界的每个角落，思想都发生了变化，数百年来的观点已经改变，这纯粹是一厢情愿的想法。现在宣布传统习惯和方式的消亡，或宣布现代性的胜利还为时过早;当然不是也门北部山区的部落。到埃及军队于 1967 年 12 月撤离时，这场令人衰弱的战争已经疏远了许多埃及人对阿拉伯民族主义的理想，巩固了一种孤立主义的冲动，即不要陷入阿拉伯政治的流沙泥潭。对于一般的阿拉伯民族主义者来说，对也门战争失败的失望进一步玷污了阿拉伯民族主义浪潮在 1955 年至 1958 年辉煌时期所向披不倚的光环。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), October 19, 1962.
It is interesting to note that the similar misreading of geography and demography led to the American and Soviet debacles in Vietnam and Afghanistan, respectively.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), December 12, 1961.

But that was not yet the pervasive feeling in early 1963. On the contrary, in the few months following Egypts decision to intervene on the side of the Yemeni Republicans, when hopes were still high that the defeat of the reactionaries was at hand, Nasirs prestige as the only true defender of Arab nationalist principles soared, and with that, Arab nationalism seemed to regain some of the momen­tum and aura it had lost with the Syrian secession. A further victory was achieved when four Saudi princes and seven air force pilots, followed by the commander-in-chief of the Jordanian air force and two of his of.cers, defected to Cairo.
content_units.azure_translation: 但这还不是 1963 年初普遍存在的感觉。相反，在埃及决定站在也门共和党一边进行干预后的几个月里，当人们仍然对反动派的失败寄予厚望时，纳西尔作为阿拉伯民族主义原则唯一真正捍卫者的声望飙升，随之而来的是，阿拉伯民族主义似乎恢复了它因叙利亚分离而失去的一些动力和光环。四名沙特王子和七名空军飞行员，随后是约旦空军总司令和他的两名飞行员叛逃到开罗，取得了进一步的胜利。

content_units.text: The process was crowned in February and March of 1963, when military coups in Baghdad and Damascus eradicated two political orders most hostile to Nasirs leadership of Arab nationalism. The two coups brought in Bathist leaderships, who, proclaiming their .delity to the Arab nationalist creed, took the initiative in ap­proaching Nasir to discuss plans for a tripartite unity amongst Egypt, Syria, and Iraq. On March 14, talks on possible unity began in Cairo.
content_units.azure_translation: 这一进程在 1963 年 2 月和 3 月达到顶峰，当时巴格达和大马士革的军事政变消灭了两个对纳西尔领导阿拉伯民族主义最敌视的政治秩序。这两次政变带来了巴斯派领导层，他们宣称他们忠于阿拉伯民族主义信条，主动与纳西尔接洽，讨论埃及、叙利亚和伊拉克三方统一的计划。3月14日，关于可能团结的谈判在开罗开始。

content_units.text: It was evident that the Bathist approach to Nasir was made as much for domestic legitimation and stability as for devotion to Arab nationalism and Arab unity.72 To the new leaders in Damas­cus and Baghdad, unity with Egypt would constitute the biggest political act [they] could take back to their people.73 A member of the Syrian delegation admitted to the overriding motivation of the new rulers in Damascus with surprising veracity: Sir, in all frankness, we . . . wish to exploit your excellencys name. Without a doubt. Thats all there is to it. We are speaking openly.74 Neither coup was on a sure footing. Both had disaffected constituencies back home, thus each needed the endorsement of the still magical name of Nasir.
content_units.azure_translation: 很明显，巴斯派对纳西尔的态度既是为了国内的合法性和稳定，也是为了对阿拉伯民族主义和阿拉伯团结的忠诚。72 对于大马士革和巴格达的新领导人来说，与埃及的统一将构成[他们]可以带回给人民的最大政治行为。73 叙利亚代表团的一名成员以惊人的真实性承认了大马士革新统治者的压倒一切的动机：主席先生，坦率地说，我们......希望利用阁下的名义。毫无疑问。仅此而已。我们正在公开交谈。74 两次政变都没有稳固的基础。两人在国内都有不满的选区，因此每个人都需要纳西尔这个仍然神奇的名字的认可。

content_units.text: The Iraqi and Syrian Bathists sought Nasirs prestige, but dis­dained his political control. They were especially cautious about the form of the proposed unity. Learning from the experience of 1958, they rejected organic amalgamation. The Iraqis appeared burdened by their countrys special condition, with its various eth­nic and sectarian dislocations. Consequently, they advocated the creation of a federal arrangement that would be called the United Arab State.75 The Syrians, cognizant of their experience in the UAR, shared this vision of loose association. After reiterating the obliga­tory Bathist cliche´ of we are one people and one community from the ocean to the Gulf, Salah Bitar tempered it with the admission that the Bathists nevertheless did not negate the existence of re­gions.76 In Bathist tortuous lexicon, regions meant states.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克和叙利亚的巴斯派寻求纳西尔的声望，但不屑于他的政治控制。他们对拟议的统一形式特别谨慎。从 1958 年的经验中吸取教训，他们拒绝有机合并。伊拉克人似乎背负着他们国家的特殊条件，以及各种种族和教派的错位。因此，他们主张建立一种联邦安排，称为阿拉伯联合国。75 叙利亚人认识到他们在阿拉伯联合共和国的经历，也认同这种松散联盟的愿景。在重申了从海洋到海湾的“我们是一个民族和一个社区”的强制性巴斯派陈词滥调之后，萨拉赫·比塔尔承认巴斯派并没有否定地区的存在。76 在巴斯主义曲折的词典中，地区意味着国家。

On their side, the Egyptians approached the talks with the ut­most mistrust, a wariness that dated back to the collective resigna­tion of the Bathist ministers from the UAR cabinet in December 1959; to the endorsement by Salah Bitar and Akram Hourani of Syrias secession; and to alleged Bathist activities in the Egyptian army that were aimed at creating an anti-Nasir movement. Nasir lambasted the Bathist negotiators for facilitating the secession and trying to in.uence the situation in Egypt itself in the delicate period that followed the secession. He considered the behavior of the Bath to be a crime.77 So suspicious was Nasir that he continuously questioned the real motive of the two Bathist delega­tions in seeking a tripartite unity. Was it to place Egypt between the Syrian hammer and the Iraqi anvil?78 In light of this abiding suspicion, and in order to safeguard Egypts central position in any such union, Nasir focused consistently throughout the talks on the anticipated role of the political leadership of the projected union.79 The Bathists endeavored to reassure him by proposing a leadership structure that would include one member of each country indepen­dently of Nasir who would be the chairman. In this way, as one Syrian delegate pointedly put it, the problem of being caught be­tween the hammer and the anvil . . . would not arise.80 But the secessionist experience had left an indelible mark on Nasir. His seemingly endless mistrust of the Syrians became the dominant ob­
content_units.azure_translation: 在他们这边，埃及人以极度的不信任态度对待会谈，这种警惕可以追溯到 1959 年 12 月巴斯派部长集体辞职 UAR 内阁;萨拉赫·比塔尔和阿克拉姆·胡拉尼支持叙利亚分离;以及埃及军队中旨在发起反纳西尔运动的所谓巴斯派活动。纳西尔抨击巴斯派谈判代表在分离后的微妙时期为分离提供便利，并试图调整埃及本身的局势。他认为巴斯的行为是一种犯罪。77 纳西尔非常怀疑，以至于他不断质疑两个巴斯派代表团寻求三方统一的真正动机。难道是将埃及置于叙利亚的锤子和伊拉克的铁砧之间吗？78 鉴于这种持久的怀疑，为了维护埃及在任何此类联盟中的中心地位，纳西尔在整个会谈中始终关注计划中的联盟的政治领导层的预期作用。79 巴斯派试图通过提议一个领导结构来安抚他，该结构将包括每个国家的一名成员，独立于纳西尔，纳西尔将成为主席。这样，正如一位叙利亚代表尖锐地指出的那样，夹在锤子和铁砧之间的问题......不会出现。80 但分离主义的经历给纳西尔留下了不可磨灭的印记。他对叙利亚人看似无休止的不信任成为主导的 ob

Talib Shabib, Iraqs foreign minister and a member of the Iraqi delegation, recounts that the existence of two Bathist votes to one Egyptian weighed heavily on Nasirs calcula­tions throughout the duration of the talks. Nasir initially suggested that Egypt and Syria unite .rst and then as one entity deal with Iraq. When this was rejected, he suggested an Iraqi-Syrian merger into one entity. In 1979, when Iraqand Syria were discussing the possibility of some unity arrangement, Saddam Husayn, addressing a conference of Iraqi ambassadors, said he welcomed unity if we were in control. After all, he added, the country that is bigger and has greater resources and wealth must be in con­trol, and Baghdad should be the capital of the union. See Said, Iraq 8 Shibat, 1963 (Iraq of 8 February, 1963), fn. 1, p. 208.

While this skeletal and rather vacuous arrangement fell far short of nationalist expectations, the announcement of the accord was met with much elation, and crowds swarmed the streets through­out much of the Arab world, shouting, Nasser, Nasser!83 As with every upsurge in nationalist sentiment, the one Arab ruler who took the full brunt of the tripartite unity announcement was Jor­dans Hashemite monarch, who once again had to resort to harsh methods to quell the popular fury which erupted in the streets of his capital.84 Husayns response was predictable, but the Arab lead­ership that ended up being most perturbed by the unity was para­doxically the very one that had sought it. The sight of their streets seething with resurgent adulation for Nasir made the Syrian Bath­ists reevaluate the wisdom of signing the accord. They immediately mounted a concerted media campaign in which non-Bathist na­tionalists and Nasirists were depicted as blind followers of Nasir, and described repeatedly as more royal than the king. The implica­tion was that the pro-Nasir elements were not just doing Nasirs bidding in Syria; they were in fact constantly outbidding him.85 Hardly two weeks had passed before those who were perceived as
content_units.azure_translation: 虽然这种骨架和相当空洞的安排远远没有达到民族主义者的期望，但该协议的宣布却引起了极大的兴高采烈，阿拉伯世界大部分地区的人群涌上街道，高喊着，纳赛尔，纳赛尔！83 与民族主义情绪的每一次高涨一样，首当其冲的阿拉伯统治者是约旦哈希姆君主，他再次不得不诉诸严厉的方法来平息在首都街头爆发的民众愤怒。84 侯赛因的反应是可以预见的，但最终对团结感到最不安的阿拉伯领导层恰恰是寻求团结的领导层。看到他们的街道上重新沸腾着对纳西尔的崇拜，让叙利亚巴斯主义者重新评估了签署协议的明智之举。他们立即发起了一场协调一致的媒体运动，将非巴斯派民族主义者和纳西尔主义者描绘成纳西尔的盲目追随者，并反复描述为比国王更皇室。言下之意是，亲纳西尔分子不仅仅是在叙利亚听纳西尔的命令;事实上，他们一直在出价高于他。85 不到两个星期，那些被认为是

Nasir could take no more. On May 17, exactly one month after the announcement of the accord, Nasirs con.dant (and mouth­piece), the journalist Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal, wrote that coex­istence, let alone cooperation, with the Syrian Bath was no longer possible.87 The break reached a violent climax on July 18, when the Bathists crushed a pro-Nasir coup in Syria, and executed twenty-seven of the plotters. Exasperated and enraged, Nasir, in a major speech on July 22, bitterly denounced Syrias Bathist lead­ers, declaring that no longer would he be bound to the present fascist regime in Syria, and that the Damascus clique were fraudu­lent and treacherous, as well as being inhuman and immoral.88 The break now was total.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔再也受不了了。5 月 17 日，即协议宣布整整一个月后，纳西尔党（兼喉舌）记者穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔 （Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal） 写道，与叙利亚巴斯共存，更不用说合作了。87 7 月 18 日，巴斯派镇压了叙利亚亲纳西尔的政变，并处决了 27 名策划者，决裂达到了暴力的高潮。纳西尔愤怒不已，在7月22日的一次重要演讲中痛斥叙利亚巴斯主义领导人，宣称他将不再受制于叙利亚目前的法西斯政权，大马士革集团是欺诈和奸诈的，以及不人道和不道德的。88 现在彻底的休息了。

content_units.text: With the acrimonious conclusion of this latest chapter of Egyp­tian-Syrian relations, the prospects for comprehensive Arab unity all but disappeared. There was a half-hearted effort to establish some form of union between the two Bathist regimes in Syria and Iraq, but beyond the signing of a cultural agreement, the promise of future military and economic union, and much talk of .delity to the Arab cause, nothing of any substance was achieved.89 This was partly because by then the Iraqi Bathist order was beginning to unravel, and partly because the Iraqi and Syrian leaders had embarked on the venture initially for the primary purpose of seek­ing legitimation through the aura of Nasirs name. Now that Nasir had shunned the whole affair, the tangible bene.ts for giving up sovereignty were no longer readily discernible.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着埃及-叙利亚关系最新篇章的尖锐结束，阿拉伯全面统一的前景几乎消失了。在叙利亚和伊拉克的两个巴斯派政权之间建立某种形式的联盟的努力是三心二意的，但除了签署文化协议、未来军事和经济联盟的承诺以及大量谈论对阿拉伯事业的忠诚之外，没有取得任何实质性成果。89 部分原因是那时伊拉克巴斯派秩序开始瓦解， 部分原因是伊拉克和叙利亚领导人最初开始冒险的主要目的是通过纳西尔的名字光环寻求合法性。现在纳西尔已经回避了整个事件，放弃主权的切实bene.ts已经不那么容易辨认了。

content_units.text: The cause of Arab nationalism was bound to suffer. To the thou­sands who had cheered and danced in the streets, the descent from jubilation to despair was startlingly abrupt. To those who had cele­brated the April 17 accord, Arab nationalism as an ideology and political movement was meaningless if its ultimate goal, the or­ganic unity of all Arabs, was unrealizable. Yet when opportunities presented themselves, narrow political interests triumphed over the Arab idea. And Nasir, with all his charisma and broad political support could not get the bickering and politically precarious Bathists to surrender their state sovereignties for the good and glory of the Arab nation. Nor was there any rush to unity after Abd al-Salam Aref ousted the Iraqi Bathists from power in No­vember 1963. This was the same Aref, who, as one of the two leaders of the Iraqi revolution in 1958, had gone to Damascus and pledged to bring Iraqinto the UAR regardless of Qasims position on the subject. Yet apart from one or two barren gestures in 1964, this time Aref made little serious effort to pursue political unity with his hero, the president of the UAR. Aref by now had been bitten by the infectious bug of political power, and was in no hurry to relinquish the presidency of Iraq. Once, in a cabinet meeting, he dismissed the idea of unity with Egypt, quipping that amongst all the members of the cabinet, he as the president would be the biggest loser in any unity scheme.90 Wataniya, even in its highly combusti­ble form in Syria and Iraq, seemed to emerge victorious yet again.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义的事业必然会受到影响。对于成千上万在街上欢呼跳舞的人来说，从欢呼到绝望的下降是惊人的突然。对于那些庆祝 4 月 17 日协议的人来说，如果阿拉伯民族主义的最终目标——所有阿拉伯人的有机团结——无法实现，那么作为一种意识形态和政治运动的阿拉伯民族主义就毫无意义。然而，当机会出现时，狭隘的政治利益战胜了阿拉伯的思想。而纳西尔，以其所有的魅力和广泛的政治支持，无法让争吵不休、政治上不稳定的巴斯派为了阿拉伯民族的利益和荣耀而放弃他们的国家主权。1963 年 11 月阿卜杜勒·萨拉姆·阿雷夫 （Abd al-Salam Aref） 将伊拉克巴斯派赶下台后，也没有急于团结。这正是阿雷夫，他作为 1958 年伊拉克革命的两位领导人之一，前往大马士革并承诺将伊拉克纳入 UAR，而不管卡西姆在这个问题上的立场如何。然而，除了 1964 年的一两次贫瘠姿态外，这一次阿雷夫几乎没有认真努力与他的英雄、UAR 主席进行政治团结。阿雷夫此时已经被政治权力的传染性虫子咬伤了，并不急于放弃伊拉克总统职位。有一次，在一次内阁会议上，他驳斥了与埃及统一的想法，打趣说，在内阁的所有成员中，他作为总统将是任何统一计划中最大的输家。90 即使在叙利亚和伊拉克，渡谷宫，即使在叙利亚和伊拉克以高度易燃的形式，似乎又取得了胜利。

What happened next was to further af.rm the continuing ascent of wataniya and decline of qawmiya, and the catalyst this time was Israel. Paradoxically, since the Suez Crisis of 1956, the Jewish state had not .gured much in Arab nationalist discourse. The accepted assumption throughout the Arab world was that the illegitimate entity (in the Arab media, the word laqita, meaning illegitimate, more often than not accompanied references to Israel) was behind every ill that befell the Arab world. But beyond this truth, ac­cepted universally whenever people talked politics, it was surpris­ing how the discourse of the Arab Cold War seemed to skirt over
content_units.azure_translation: 接下来发生的事情是进一步af.rm瓦塔尼亚的持续上升和卡米亚的衰落，而这一次的催化剂就是以色列。矛盾的是，自1956年苏伊士危机以来，犹太国家并没有在阿拉伯民族主义话语中发挥太多作用。整个阿拉伯世界公认的假设是，非法实体（在阿拉伯媒体中，“laqita”一词，意思是非法的，通常伴随着对以色列的提及）是阿拉伯世界发生的每一种弊病的幕后黑手。但除了这个每当人们谈论政治时普遍接受的真理之外，令人惊讶的是，阿拉伯冷战的话语似乎如何被回避

content_units.text: Abd al-Karim Farhan, Hisad Thawra: Mudhakarat Tajribat al-Sulta . al-Iraq, 1958 1968 (Harvest of revolution: memoirs of the experience of the political authority in Iraq, 19581968) (Damascus: Dar al-Buraq, 1994), p. 149.
