Israel and Zionism. For instance, in a content analysis of Nasirs speeches between September 1961 and September 1962, Zion­ism with 67 references came a long way behind imperialism (281 references) and reaction (232 references). There were only 17 references to David Ben-Gurion, the then-prime minister of Is­rael, compared to 143 to King Saud and 161 to King Husayn. And while Israel received a healthy dose of references, more than Jordan or Saudi Arabia, this statistical disparity was due to Nasirs ten­dency to treat Israel merely as a child of imperialism. Israel rarely was referred to as an autonomous category, but was generally attached almost ipso facto to imperialism.91 Depending on the particular period in time, the brunt of the nationalist assault was aimed at British, American, and even at times Soviet, imperialism; at the forces of reaction in the area, meaning the kings of Jordan and Saudi Arabia, and the Syrian secessionists; and at the Commu­nists, obstructionists, and fascists, references that targeted Qasim, Bourguiba, and of course the post-1963 Syrian Bathists during times of noncooperation with Nasir. In this enumeration of the enemies of Arab nationalism, Israel was always in the nationalist consciousness, but had not been thrust forward to take pride of place as the direct target of Arab political rhetoric.
content_units.azure_translation: 以色列和犹太复国主义。例如，在对 1961 年 9 月至 1962 年 9 月期间纳西尔演讲的内容分析中，犹太复国主义有 67 次引用，远远落后于帝国主义（281 次引用）和反动主义（232 次引用）。只有 17 次提到时任以色列总理大卫·本-古里安，而沙特国王和侯赛因国王分别有 143 次和 161 次。虽然以色列收到的参考资料数量相当多，比约旦或沙特阿拉伯还要多，但这种统计差异是由于纳西尔倾向于将以色列仅仅视为帝国主义的孩子。以色列很少被称为自治类别，但通常几乎事实上与帝国主义有联系。91 根据特定时期的不同，民族主义进攻的首当其冲是针对英国、美国，甚至有时是苏联帝国主义;该地区的反动力量，即约旦和沙特阿拉伯的国王，以及叙利亚分离主义者;以及共产党人、阻挠主义者和法西斯主义者，这些参考资料针对卡西姆、布尔吉巴，当然还有 1963 年后与纳西尔不合作时期的叙利亚巴斯主义者。在对阿拉伯民族主义敌人的列举中，以色列始终处于民族主义意识中，但并没有被推上前去，成为阿拉伯政治言论的直接目标。

content_units.text: This was to change in the fall of 1963, when Israel approached the completion of its project to divert some 75 percent of the Jor­dan River for irrigation and industrial development inside Israel. Arab leaders had at different times in the past threatened that such a diversion would be regarded as an act of aggression by Israel, and as such would have to be met by force. However, weakened by the dislocations within their ranks, and consumed by the acri­mony and recriminations that pervaded their relations, the Arabs generally could do little to follow their bold words with political or military action. The only ones who did were the Syrians. Brash and brimming with revolutionary fervor, the Bathist leaders, most of whom were still in their early thirties, tried their hand at the military option but were mauled badly by the Israelis, so who bet­ter to take out their frustration than on their Arab brethren, espe­cially Nasir, who had been denouncing them bitterly since the col­lapse of the tripartite talks, and whom they now accused of weakness and cowardice in the face of Israel.
content_units.azure_translation: 1963 年秋天，这种情况发生了变化，当时以色列即将完成其将约旦河约 75% 的河流改道用于以色列境内灌溉和工业发展的项目。阿拉伯领导人过去曾在不同时期威胁说，这种转移将被视为以色列的侵略行为，因此必须以武力应对。然而，由于队伍内部的混乱而削弱，并被充斥在他们关系中的尖刻和指责所吞噬，阿拉伯人通常无能为力地采取政治或军事行动来遵循他们的大胆言论。唯一这样做的是叙利亚人。巴斯派领导人傲慢而充满革命热情，他们中的大多数人还在三十岁出头，他们尝试过军事选择，但遭到了以色列人的严重打击，所以谁能比他们的阿拉伯兄弟，尤其是纳西尔更能发泄他们的沮丧，纳西尔自三方会谈破裂以来就一直严厉谴责他们， 他们现在指责他们在以色列面前软弱和怯懦。

content_units.text: A. I. Dawisha, Perceptions, Decisions, and Consequences in Foreign Policy: The Egyp­tian Intervention in the Yemen, Political Studies, vol. 25, no. 2 (June 1977): 208. The Bath Party showed a similarly tepid concern with Israel, paying consistently greater attention in its literature to the theme of strengthening the Arab nation through unifying it. Devlin, The Bath Party,p.26.

Nasir, however, did not take the bait. He was in no mood to be dragged into a precipitous war with the Israelis, particularly since by then the Egyptian military commitment to the Yemeni Republi­can cause had reached thirty-.ve thousand troops. And there was no end in sight. The royalist tribal forces, supported and abetted by Saudi Arabia, were if anything gaining the upper hand. It was time for a critical ideological, as well as diplomatic, reevaluation. On December 23, 1963, in a major speech, Nasir declared:
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，纳西尔并没有上钩。他没有心情被拖入与以色列人的激烈战争，特别是因为那时埃及对也门共和事业的军事承诺已经达到 thirty-.ve 千人。而且看不到尽头。在沙特阿拉伯的支持和教唆下，保皇党部落势力占据了上风。现在是批判性意识形态和外交重新评估的时候了。1963 年 12 月 23 日，纳西尔在一次重要演讲中宣称：

content_units.text: In order to confront Israel, which challenged us last week when its Chief-of-Staff stood up and said, we shall divert the water against the will of the Arabs, and the Arabs can do what they want, a meeting between Arab Kings and Heads of State must take place as soon as possible, regardless of the con.icts and differences between them. Those with whom we are in con.ict, we are prepared to meet; those with whom we have a quarrel, we are ready, for the sake of Palestine, to sit with.92
content_units.azure_translation: 为了对抗以色列，以色列上周向我们提出挑战，当时其参谋长站起来说，我们将违背阿拉伯人的意愿引水，阿拉伯人可以为所欲为，阿拉伯国王和国家元首之间的会议必须尽快举行，无论他们之间的争论和分歧如何。与我们有联系的人，我们准备会面;那些与我们发生争吵的人，为了巴勒斯坦，我们愿意与之坐在一起92。

content_units.text: It was a foregone conclusion that the Arab leaders would re­spond positively to Nasirs rede.nition of Egypts ideological thrust. How could they not? In his statement, Nasir had effectively eschewed the revolutionary mission of Arab nationalism, and was in fact endorsing the long-held position of his Arab adversaries, who always had emphasized cooperation among the Arab states on the bases of sovereignty and complete equality. Consequently, a parade of Arab leaders arrived in Cairo in January 1964 to attend an Arab summit conference. The scene at the Cairo airport was one for the eye to behold. Bitter enemies only a few days earlier, the Arab kings and presidents embraced and kissed one another on the cheeks as though they were long lost friends. For the next two­and-a-half years, the Arab world was to experience a period of inter-state tranquility not encountered since before the announce­ment of the Baghdad Pact in January 1955. Egyptian-Jordanian diplomatic relations were restored, and the personal relations be­tween the leaders of the two countries became openly cordial to the extent that King Husayn raised no objection to the creation of the independent Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), or to its military wing, the Palestine Liberation Army (PLA). Egypts rela­tions were also markedly improved with Bathist Syria and with the conservative Moroccan king, and in March 1964, Egyptian-Saudi diplomatic relations were resumed.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯领导人将对纳西尔对埃及意识形态主旨的重新定义做出积极回应，这已成定局。他们怎么能不呢？纳西尔在声明中实际上回避了阿拉伯民族主义的革命使命，实际上是在赞同他的阿拉伯对手长期以来的立场，他们一直强调阿拉伯国家之间在主权和完全平等的基础上进行合作。因此，阿拉伯领导人游行队伍于 1964 年 1 月抵达开罗参加阿拉伯首脑会议。开罗机场的场景令人目不暇接。就在几天前，这对宿敌的阿拉伯国王和总统们拥抱在一起，亲吻对方的脸颊，仿佛他们是失散已久的朋友。在接下来的两年半里，阿拉伯世界将经历一段自1955年1月宣布《巴格达条约》之前从未遇到过的国家间和平时期。埃及-约旦恢复了外交关系，两国领导人之间的个人关系变得公开友好，以至于侯赛因国王对建立独立的巴勒斯坦解放组织（巴解组织）或其军事部门巴勒斯坦解放军（解放军）没有提出异议。埃及与巴斯派叙利亚和保守的摩洛哥国王的关系也显着改善，1964 年 3 月，埃及与沙特恢复了外交关系。

content_units.text: Speeches, 1963, p. 311.

Arab nationalists must have found all this diplomatic activity disorienting and not a little disheartening. After all, for almost a decade Arab nationalism, their cherished qawmiya, had meant an unrelenting assault on state sovereignty, a revolutionary cru­sade against arti.cial political boundaries, so that on some glo­rious day, which the nationalist generation had thought would not be too far off, they would witness the realization of Arab national­isms ultimate goal of one uni.ed Arab nation-state. And here was the high priest of this revolutionary nationalism embracing the very symbols of state sovereignty, the scorned, yet clearly resur­gent, wataniya.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义者一定发现所有这些外交活动都令人迷失方向，而且不乏令人沮丧。毕竟，近十年来，阿拉伯民族主义，他们所珍视的“qawmiya”，意味着对国家主权的无情攻击，对政治边界的革命性十字军东征，因此，在民族主义一代人认为不会太遥远的光荣日子，他们将见证阿拉伯民族主义的实现，即一个统一的阿拉伯民族国家的最终目标。这是这种革命民族主义的大祭司，他拥抱了国家主权的象征，即被蔑视但显然复兴的 wataniya。

content_units.text: Nasir was not insensitive to these nationalist concerns. He thus hastened to imbue the ensuing state-to-state diplomacy with ideo­logical meaning. He did this by making Israel, which had not .g­ured much in inter-Arab debates, the culprit for the shift in his policy toward the other Arabs. His argument was that by diverting the water of Jordan River, Israel was not simply confronting Syria and Jordan; it was clearly and arrogantly daring the whole Arab world to do something about it. The cause of Arab nationalism would suffer untold harm if the Arabs, consumed by strife in their midst, were not to respond vigorously. In this new and dangerous circumstance, what needed to be emphasized was not Arab organic unity, but the unity of effort and ranks among the Arab states in order to confront this sworn enemy of Arab nationalism.93 In one sweeping statement, the goal of Arab nationalism was pared down from Arab unity (the fusion of all Arabs into one state) to Arab solidarity (the unity of effort and purpose among sovereign Arab states). And indeed, this new de.nition was enshrined in the re­solutions of the second Arab Summit in September 1964, which convened in the Egyptian city of Alexandria. As a signatory to the resolutions, Egypt pledged to respect the sovereignty of each of the Arab states and their existing regimes in accordance with their constitutions and laws, and to refrain from interfering in their internal affairs.94 To the incredulous Arab nationalist, sover­eignty had become the cornerstone of the new de.nition of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔对这些民族主义担忧并非麻木不仁。因此，他急于为随后的国与国外交注入意识形态意义。他通过让在阿拉伯人间辩论中没有太多参与的以色列成为他转向其他阿拉伯人政策的罪魁祸首来做到这一点。他的论点是，通过引流约旦河的水，以色列不仅仅是在对抗叙利亚和约旦;它显然是傲慢地鼓励整个阿拉伯世界为此做点什么。如果阿拉伯人被他们中间的冲突所吞噬，不做出有力的反应，阿拉伯民族主义的事业将遭受难以估量的伤害。在这种新的危险情况下，需要强调的不是阿拉伯的有机团结，而是阿拉伯国家之间的努力和队伍的团结，以对抗阿拉伯民族主义的死敌。93 在一份笼统的声明中，阿拉伯民族主义的目标从阿拉伯团结（将所有阿拉伯人融合为一个国家）简化为阿拉伯团结（阿拉伯主权国家之间努力和目标的团结）。事实上，这一新决定被载入了1964年9月在埃及亚历山大市召开的第二次阿拉伯首脑会议的决议中。作为这些决议的签署国，埃及承诺根据其宪法和法律尊重每个阿拉伯国家及其现有制度的主权，不干涉其内政。94 对于难以置信的阿拉伯民族主义者来说，主权已成为阿拉伯民族主义新体系的基石。

content_units.text: This is not to imply that this was the .rst time that Nasir had thought of, or talked about, the solidarity of the Arab states as not being necessarily contradictory to the intellectual tenets of Arab nationalism or to the meaning of Arab unity. For instance, in Janu­ary 1958, in his effort to put the brakes on the Syrians insistent demands for immediate unity, he explained that solidarity is a step toward unity. It is the answer if we cannot achieve unity.95 Again in August 1961, he argued that Arab unity extends on an Arab front which begins with Arab solidarity and ends with consti­tutional unity.96 What made his af.rmation for Arab solidarity in 1964 different and more worrisome to nationalists was the way the concept was publicly institutionalized in the resolutions of the September 1964 summit, and in the wide-ranging diplomatic strat­egies and policies that constituted its political acceptance, indeed its approbation. And even though Egypts leaders and nationalist narrators continued to af.rm their belief in Arab unity, the resolu­tions of the 1964 summit bode ill for the cause of Arab national­isms ultimate goal.
content_units.azure_translation: 这并不是说这是纳西尔第一次想到或谈论阿拉伯国家的团结，因为阿拉伯国家的团结不一定与阿拉伯民族主义的思想信条或阿拉伯统一的意义相矛盾。例如，1958 年 1 月，在努力阻止叙利亚人坚持要求立即团结的要求时，他解释说，团结是迈向团结的一步。如果我们不能实现团结，这就是答案。95 1961 年 8 月，他再次认为，阿拉伯的统一延伸到阿拉伯战线，阿拉伯战线始于阿拉伯的团结，终于宪法统一。96 使他在 1964 年对阿拉伯团结的赞同不同，更让民族主义者感到担忧的是，这一概念在 1964 年 9 月首脑会议的决议中公开制度化的方式，以及构成其政治接受和认可的广泛外交战略和政策中。尽管埃及领导人和民族主义叙述者继续af.rm他们对阿拉伯团结的信念，但 1964 年峰会的决议对阿拉伯民族主义事业的最终目标来说是不好的预兆。

content_units.text: Khutab, volume four, p. 447. 94 Quoted in Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 152. 95 Egyptian Gazette (Cairo), January 29, 1958. 96 SWB, August 15, 1961, p. 9.

Nationalist thought and action from Sati al-Husri to Nasir had predicated on the essentialist idea that Arabs constituted a cultural unity which had undergone forcible political dislocation, and that the Arab situation with its many states was an unnatural thing. Arab nationalism was obliged by de.nition, imperatively even determinis­tically, to right the wrongs of Arab division, to unify the segmented entity, and to bring it back to its natural condition. To the commit­ted Arab nationalist, accepting the sovereignty of the Arab states negated the very essence of this axiomatic belief. The necessity of confronting Israels mortal threat might have been a legitimate rationalization for eschewing Arab unity in favor of the solidarity of Arab states, but deep in their hearts the Arab nationalists saw it as yet another setback for qawmiya, accelerating its descent from the dizzying heights it had reached in the summer of 1958. Even if one were to accept the tenet that Arab unity was a dialectical pro­cess, and that its ultimate goal had not been discarded but temporar­ily shelved, there can be little doubt that wataniya received a major and indisputable boost, for Arab solidarity implied an admission that the sovereign Arab states, not the larger nation, bore the main responsibility for the defense of nationalist causes.
content_units.azure_translation: 从萨蒂·胡斯里到纳西尔的民族主义思想和行动都基于本质主义思想，即阿拉伯人构成了一个经历了被迫的政治错位的文化统一体，阿拉伯及其许多国家的处境是不自然的。阿拉伯民族主义有义务通过决议，甚至是决定性的，纠正阿拉伯分裂的错误，统一分裂的实体，并使其恢复到自然状态。对于坚定的阿拉伯民族主义者来说，接受阿拉伯国家的主权否定了这种公理化信念的本质。面对以色列致命威胁的必要性可能是避开阿拉伯团结而支持阿拉伯国家团结的合理理由，但在他们内心深处，阿拉伯民族主义者认为这是卡夫米亚的又一次挫折，加速了它从 1958 年夏天达到的令人眼花缭乱的高度的下降。即使人们接受阿拉伯团结是一个辩证过程的原则，其最终目标并没有被抛弃而是暂时搁置，但毫无疑问，渡谷得到了重大的、无可争议的推动力，因为阿拉伯团结意味着承认主权阿拉伯国家，而不是更大的国家，对捍卫民族主义事业负有主要责任。

content_units.text: The period of inter-state political tranquility came to an end in 1966, when a combination of events ushered in what turned out to be a short-lived radical period. To begin with, King Faysal of Saudi Arabia (who, in a palace coup, had succeeded his brother Saud to the throne) had made highly publicized visits to Iran and Jordan in which he had called for an Islamic summit that would unite the Muslims against ideas alien to Islam.97 The Egyptians took that to be a pointed reference to Egypts espousal of national­ist and socialist doctrines. Particularly worrying to Nasir was the role of Iran, since its shah was a pivotal member of the Western alliance, the Central Treaty Organization, a major supplier of oil to Israel, and an active supporter of the Yemeni royalists. Nasirs response was swift and categorical. We are against the Islamic
content_units.azure_translation: 1966 年，国家间政治安宁时期结束，当时一系列事件的结合迎来了短暂的激进时期。首先，沙特阿拉伯国王费萨尔（在宫廷政变中继承了他的兄弟沙特的王位）对伊朗和约旦进行了广为人知的访问，在访问中他呼吁召开伊斯兰峰会，将穆斯林团结起来反对与伊斯兰教格格不入的思想。97 埃及人认为这是对埃及拥护民族主义和社会主义学说的尖锐指涉。纳西尔特别担心的是伊朗的角色，因为伊朗的国王是西方联盟、中央条约组织的关键成员，是以色列的主要石油供应国，也是也门保皇党的积极支持者。纳西尔的反应迅速而明确。我们反对伊斯兰教

content_units.text: Peter Mans.eld, Nassers Egypt (London: Penguin Books, 1969), p. 76; Times (Lon­don), December 22, 1965.

Conference, he declared in a major speech in February 1966, just like we were against the Baghdad Pact . . . and all other imperialist and reactionary movements.98 Nasir seemed to think that the two-year respite had given the conservatives added strength and resolve to mount a new drive against Egypt and the progressive forces in the Arab world. His alarm, which at the beginning of 1966 cen­tered on political moves in the Middle East region, was elevated to the level of an international conspiracy in the early summer of 1966. In quick succession, the International Monetary Fund re­fused to grant Egypt a loan of $70 million and the United States deferred negotiations on an Egyptian request for $150 million worth of surplus food.99 In both cases, Egypts costly military involvement in Yemen was cited as the reason.100 Meanwhile, the ouster of two of the original founders of the nonaligned movement, presidents Sukarno of Indonesia and Nkrumah of Ghana, by pro-Western forces only served to reinforce the Egyptian perception of a worldwide anti-progressive offensive. It was therefore in such a setting that this era of solidarity and cooperation among the Arab states, regardless of their ideological orientation, came to an end. On July 22, 1966, Nasir virulently denounced the pro-West Arab reactionaries , declaring that cooperation with these elements had become impossible.101
content_units.azure_translation: 会议，他在 1966 年 2 月的一次重要演讲中宣布，就像我们反对《巴格达条约》一样......以及所有其他帝国主义和反动运动。98 纳西尔似乎认为，两年的喘息期给了保守派更多的力量和决心，可以对埃及和阿拉伯世界的进步力量发起新的运动。他的警报在 1966 年初以中东地区的政治动向为中心，但在 1966 年初夏被提升为国际阴谋的级别。国际货币基金组织接连拒绝向埃及提供 7000 万美元的贷款，美国推迟了对埃及要求提供价值 1.5 亿美元剩余粮食的谈判。99 在这两种情况下，埃及在也门的军事参与代价高昂。100 与此同时，不结盟运动的两名最初创始人被赶下台， 印度尼西亚总统苏加诺和加纳总统恩克鲁玛在亲西方势力的推动下，只会强化埃及对全球反进步攻势的看法。因此，正是在这样的环境中，阿拉伯国家之间团结与合作的时代结束了，无论其意识形态取向如何。1966 年 7 月 22 日，纳西尔严厉谴责亲西方阿拉伯反动派，宣称与这些分子的合作已经变得不可能。

content_units.text: In his assault on the reactionaries,  Nasir could not but draw near to the existing progressive forces in the Arab world, even, in some cases, against his better judgment. Such was the case of his accelerating entanglement with Syria. In February 1966, an aggres­ sive Marxist-oriented, neo-Bathist leadership had come to power in a bloody coup intent on carrying out a revolutionary struggle against Israel and the Arab reactionaries. The new Syrian lead­ers, with their Marxism wrapped around Arab nationalism, advo­cated the liberation of Palestine not necessarily as an ultimate goal, but as a step in the process of forging a new uni.ed and pro­gressive Arab social and political order. Given their ideological ori­entation, they talked incessantly about the need for mass struggle on the Vietnam model, which in the late 1960s was all the rage among the angry, idealistic, and disenfranchised groups world­wide. Syrias soul mates were naturally the infant Palestinian guer­rilla groups, who were mounting their own peoples struggle, in the sense that at least then they took orders from no Arab govern­ment. The Syrians thus were bound to actively support the guerril­las, as a result of which, the level of violence on the borders with Israel steadily rose throughout 1966. While Nasir was wary of Syrias provocative ways, lest he might be embroiled in a premature war with Israel, he also felt he needed to support the radical Syrians against the Jewish state and the Arab reactionaries, whom he believed, yet again, to be actively working against all radical and progressive elements in the Arab world. As rumors intensi.ed about impending plots against Syria, Egypt responded emphati­cally that Damascus does not stand alone against imperialist plots.102 Egypt then added an incendiary gesture (how incendiary, it did not appreciate at the time) when it signed a defense alliance with Syria which asserted that aggression against either state would be considered an attack on the other.
content_units.azure_translation: 在对反动派的攻击中，纳西尔不得不接近阿拉伯世界现有的进步力量，甚至在某些情况下，违背了他更好的判断力。他与叙利亚的加速纠葛就是这种情况。1966 年 2 月，一个激进的马克思主义导向的新巴斯主义领导层在一场血腥政变中上台，意图对以色列和阿拉伯反动派进行革命斗争。叙利亚新领导人以他们的马克思主义包裹着阿拉伯民族主义，主张解放巴勒斯坦不一定是最终目标，而是作为建立新的统一和进步的阿拉伯社会和政治秩序进程中的一个步骤。鉴于他们的意识形态取向，他们不断谈论以越南模式进行群众斗争的必要性，这种模式在 1960 年代后期在全世界愤怒、理想主义和被剥夺权利的群体中风靡一时。叙利亚的灵魂伴侣自然是新生的巴勒斯坦游击队，他们正在发动自己的民族斗争，至少在那个时候他们没有听从任何阿拉伯政府的命令。因此，叙利亚人必然会积极支持游击队，因此，整个1966年，与以色列接壤的边境暴力程度稳步上升。虽然纳西尔对叙利亚的挑衅方式持谨慎态度，以免卷入与以色列的过早战争，但他也觉得他需要支持激进的叙利亚人反对犹太国家和阿拉伯反动派，他认为他们再次积极反对阿拉伯世界的所有激进和进步分子。随着关于即将对叙利亚进行阴谋的谣言愈演愈烈，埃及强调说，大马士革并不是唯一反对帝国主义阴谋的国家。102 埃及随后在与叙利亚签署防御联盟时添加了一个煽动性的姿态（当时它并不欣赏这种煽动性），声称对任何一个国家的侵略都将被视为对另一个国家的攻击。

Nasir had felt that a certain rapport had developed between him and President Kennedy. And indeed Egyptian-American relations were comparatively cordial during the Kennedy era. That, however, was to dramatically change when Lyndon Johnson became president. The Egyptians believed that the new president and some of his key advisors, particularly the Rustow brothers, were incurably pro-Israeli, and consequently vehemently anti-Nasir.

The symbolism of this act was not lost on the Arab world. Nasir, after the inactive years of Arab solidarity, rose again to the fore­front of peoples consciousness as the defender of Arab rights and the only viable leader of Arab nationalism. Nasirs prestige un­doubtedly gained an immense boost, but alas it would be short-lived. The defense pact, the very act that brought Nasir back into the very center of Arab politics, also paved the way for the chain of events destined to lead to the disastrous war that in retrospect became Arab nationalisms Waterloo.
content_units.azure_translation: 这一行为的象征意义在阿拉伯世界并没有消失。纳西尔在阿拉伯团结的不活跃岁月之后，作为阿拉伯权利的捍卫者和阿拉伯民族主义唯一可行的领导人，再次站在人们意识的最前沿。纳西尔的声望无疑获得了巨大的提升，但可惜的是，这将是短暂的。保卫条约，正是将纳西尔带回阿拉伯政治中心的行为，也为一系列注定会导致灾难性战争的事件铺平了道路，回想起来，这场战争变成了阿拉伯民族主义滑铁卢。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), August 26, 1966.

In April 1967, in an air battle between Israeli and Syrian jet .ghters over the Golan Heights, the Israelis shot down six Syrian planes, and Damascus was subjected to the indignity of an im­promptu air display by the brash Israelis. Incensed by this public humiliation, yet cognizant of Israels glaring superiority, the Syri­ans requested Egypts military assistance, and lest the Egyptians vacillated, Cairo was reminded of its obligations to Syria under the terms of the recent defense pact. In this highly charged milieu, hemmed in by a military alliance that he signed more for its sym­bolic value than for its strategic utility, and limited by an increas­ingly frenzied public opinion demanding no less than the restora­tion of Arab rights in Palestine, Nasir made the fatal move in the middle of May of sending his army into the Sinai and closing the Straits of Tiran to Israeli shipping. The Arabs went wild at this .rst real challenge to Israeli power and arrogance since 1948. The pressure on other Arab leaders to fall in line was immense. At the end of May, King Husayn arrived in Cairo to sign a defense pact with Egypt and place his forces under Egyptian command. The Iraqis joined the pact soon after, and dispatched an armored divi­sion to help on the Syrian front. Caught in the ensuing frenzy, the Saudis sent a brigade to join their Arab brethren at the front as well. It seemed that almost everyone believed in the inevitability of war and the certainty of defeating the illegitimate entity. At times it was almost surrealistic. For instance, in his farewell address to the mechanized division dispatched to the Syrian front, Iraqi Presi­dent Abd al-Rahman Aref asked his troops to behave properly and with decorum in their forthcoming occupation of Israel!103 Nasir, however, was far more of a realist. He did not share in the universal hysteria, and he was not one to underestimate the mili­tary prowess of Israel. Once his forces moved into Sinai, Nasir tried to de-escalate the con.ict, sending repeated signals to Tel Aviv and
content_units.azure_translation: 1967 年 4 月，在以色列和叙利亚喷气式飞机在戈兰高地上空的一场空战中，以色列人击落了六架叙利亚飞机，大马士革遭受了傲慢的以色列人即兴空中表演的侮辱。叙利亚人对这种公开羞辱感到愤怒，但又意识到以色列的明显优势，请求埃及提供军事援助，以免埃及人动摇，开罗被提醒根据最近的防务条约条款对叙利亚承担的义务。在这种高度紧张的环境中，他签署的军事联盟更多是因为其象征价值而不是战略效用，并且受到日益疯狂的公众舆论的限制，要求恢复巴勒斯坦的阿拉伯权利，纳西尔在 5 月中旬采取了致命的举动，派遣他的军队进入西奈半岛，并关闭蒂朗海峡，禁止以色列航运。阿拉伯人对这是自 1948 年以来对以色列权力和傲慢的第一次真正挑战而疯狂。其他阿拉伯领导人面临的压力是巨大的。5月底，侯赛因国王抵达开罗，与埃及签署防务条约，将他的部队置于埃及的指挥之下。伊拉克人不久后加入了该条约，并派出一个装甲师在叙利亚前线提供帮助。在随后的疯狂中，沙特人也派出了一个旅与他们的阿拉伯兄弟会合。似乎几乎每个人都相信战争的必然性和击败非法实体的确定性。有时这几乎是超现实的。例如，伊拉克总统阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼·阿雷夫（Abd al-Rahman Aref）在向派往叙利亚前线的机械化师的告别演说中，要求他的部队在即将占领以色列时表现得体、有礼貌！103 然而，纳西尔更是一个现实主义者。他没有分享普遍的歇斯底里，也不是低估以色列军事实力的人。一旦他的部队进入西奈半岛，纳西尔就试图缓和局势，多次向特拉维夫和特拉维夫发出信号。

Washington of his preference for a political solution to the crisis. He hoped for an Israeli acquiescence, which would give him a polit­ical victory without the risk of war. But if war was to come he thought he was ready for it.104
content_units.azure_translation: 华盛顿更倾向于政治解决危机。他希望以色列的默许，这将使他在没有战争风险的情况下取得政治胜利。但如果战争来临，他认为自己已经做好了准备104。

content_units.text: Swept by the emotions of those days, the nationalists, not unlike the bulk of the Arab populations, believed that victory was right around the corner, and once achieved, it would infuse new life into Arab nationalism and endow it with new vigor and potency. But it was not to be. What awaited them round the corner was not the anticipated victory but a devastating military and political calam­ity. In six days in early June 1967, Israel defeated all the Arab ar­mies that were ranged against it,105 occupying in the process large chunks of land belonging to the three countries that bordered on it. From the Egyptians, the Israelis seized the Sinai Peninsula, in­cluding the Gaza Strip; from the Syrians, they wrested the Golan Heights, and from the Jordanians they took the entire West Bank of the Jordan River. Most heartbreaking was the loss of East Jerusa­lem. By the end of the sixth day, June 11, 1967, the Israelis, had they so wished, could have marched almost unhindered into Da­mascus, Cairo, and Amman. Such was the extent of Israels military victory.
content_units.azure_translation: 民族主义者被当时的情绪所席卷，与大多数阿拉伯人一样，相信胜利指日可待，一旦取得胜利，就会为阿拉伯民族主义注入新的活力，赋予它新的活力和效力。但事实并非如此。等待他们的不是预期的胜利，而是一场毁灭性的军事和政治灾难。1967 年 6 月初的六天内，以色列击败了所有反对它的阿拉伯军队，105 在此过程中占领了属于与其接壤的三个国家的大片土地。以色列人从埃及人手中夺取了西奈半岛，包括加沙地带;他们从叙利亚人手中夺取了戈兰高地，从约旦人手中夺取了约旦河的整个西岸。最令人心碎的是东耶路撒冷的丧失。到第六天，即 1967 年 6 月 11 日结束时，以色列人如果愿意的话，几乎可以不受阻碍地向大马士革、开罗和安曼进军。这就是以色列军事胜利的程度。

content_units.text: As the Arabs lay in emotional tatters, stunned by the overwhelm­ing reversal of fortunes, for which they had not been psychologi­cally prepared, Arab nationalism, even if people were not fully aware of it then, was reaching the end of its extraordinary journey. Like an old pugilist, whose days of glory were now a thing of the past, Arab nationalism lay on the .oor battered and benumbed waiting for the count to ten to begin. The sun, which had shown so brightly on Arab nationalism, had .nally set.
content_units.azure_translation: 当阿拉伯人情绪破烂不堪，对压倒性的命运逆转感到震惊时，阿拉伯民族主义，即使当时人们还没有完全意识到这一点，也正在走向其非凡旅程的终点。就像一个老拳击手一样，他的辉煌岁月现在已成为过去，阿拉伯民族主义躺在 .oor 上，饱受摧残，麻木地等待着数到十的开始。在阿拉伯民族主义上表现得如此耀眼的太阳已经落山了。

content_units.text: See Efraim and Irani Karsh, Re.ections on Arab Nationalism, in Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 32 no. 4 (October 1996): 383386.

title: 1967 AND AFTER: THE TWILIGHT OF ARAB NATIONALISM

content_units.text: The Six Day War of June 1967 is generally accepted as a seminal event in Arab contemporary history, but some analysts disagree with the contention that it also was Arab nationalisms last stand. They argue that even after June 1967, Arabism still shaped how Arab states were expected to present themselves, represented a source of symbolic capital, subjected them to Arab public opinion, and held them accountable to each other.1 This is of course cor­rect. Arabism was not lost as an identity; it continued to set general parameters Arab regimes would be loath to transgress. And Arab leaders knewthat the policies they devised for their states would be scrutinized and judged beyond the con.nes of their territorial boundaries by a wider Arab public. But what continued to live on was Arabism not Arab nationalism.2 Arabism was merely the remnant of Arab nationalism, what the Arabs were left with after
content_units.azure_translation: 1967 年 6 月的六日战争被普遍认为是阿拉伯当代史上的开创性事件，但一些分析家不同意它也是阿拉伯民族主义的最后一战的论点。他们认为，即使在 1967 年 6 月之后，阿拉伯主义仍然塑造了阿拉伯国家的表现方式，代表了象征性资本的来源，使它们受到阿拉伯公众舆论的约束，并让它们相互负责。1 这当然是正确的。阿拉伯主义作为一种身份并没有消失;它继续设定阿拉伯政权不愿违背的一般参数。阿拉伯领导人知道，他们为自己的国家制定的政策将受到更广泛的阿拉伯公众的审查和评判，超越其领土边界。但继续存在的是阿拉伯主义，而不是阿拉伯民族主义。2 阿拉伯主义只是阿拉伯民族主义的残余，阿拉伯人后来留下了

content_units.text: Arab nationalism hit the deck in June 1967. What the Six Day War did was to irretrievably rob Arab nationalism of the crucial element of uni.cation. While Arabs, in whatever state they lived, continued to recognize their membership in the cultural space called the Arab world, a recognition shared by rulers and subjects alike, they no longer truly believed in the viability of organic political unity. During the years of the nationalist era, the decade prior to the 1967 War, people felt that it was not inconceivable that some form of political unity would occur during their lifetime. Even as the pros­pect grewmore remote with every setback that befell the Arab na­tionalist cause from late 1958 onward, it continued to live in the aspirations of the people, particularly among the ranks of the na­tionalist generation. Bernard Lewis, writing in 1963, observed:
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义于 1967 年 6 月登陆甲板。六日战争所做的是不可挽回地剥夺了阿拉伯民族主义的统一的关键要素。虽然阿拉伯人，无论他们生活在什么州，都继续承认他们在阿拉伯世界的文化空间中的成员身份，这是统治者和臣民所共有的承认，但他们不再真正相信有机政治团结的可行性。在民族主义时代，即 1967 年战争之前的十年，人们认为在他们有生之年会出现某种形式的政治团结并非不可想象。即使从 1958 年底开始，随着阿拉伯民族主义事业的每一次挫折，前景变得越来越渺茫，但它仍然存在于人民的愿望中，特别是在民族主义一代的队伍中。伯纳德·刘易斯 （Bernard Lewis） 在 1963 年撰文指出：

content_units.text: The rulers . . . appear to be guided, in their policies, by the interests of their states and countries rather than those of the pan-Arab cause. But such loyalties and allegiances do not yet correspond to the deeper feelings of the people. [State] patriotism has its claims, but the older rallying cries of faith and kin, nowuttered in the new language of Arab nationalism, are in.nitely more potent.3
content_units.azure_translation: 统治者......在他们的政策中，似乎以本国和国家的利益为指导，而不是泛阿拉伯事业的利益。但这种忠诚和忠诚，还不符合人民的深层感受。[国家]爱国主义有其主张，但现在用阿拉伯民族主义的新语言发出的信仰和亲属的旧口号更为有力。

content_units.text: Arab nationalism and its radical goal of comprehensive Arab unity lived on as long as Gamal Abd al-Nasir and Egypt domi­nated Arab politics. Iraqs unwillingness to join the United Arab Republic (UAR), Syrias secession from the union, the wasteful and inconclusive military operation in Yemen, the collapse of the 1963 unity talks, had bruised Nasir, leading to questions about his ability to unite the Arabs. But such was the seduction of the dream, the longing of people for it, and their belief in the powers of Nasirs charisma to bring it to fruition that it continued to live on. Indeed, hopes were revived by the events immediately preceding the 1967 War, and who could tell what might have happened had Egypt and the Arabs, not Israel, won a famous victory. But Nasir lost, and lost infamously. And unlike the other setbacks, the scope of this defeat was such that even the most ardent utopian now discerned the permanent eclipse of Nasirs charisma. What was left was no more than a sense of cultural proximity, an intellectual recognition of common habits and custom, a belief that something called Ar­abism does indeed exist. Yes, they were Arabs, those people who lived in the various Arabic-speaking countries. Most of them agreed on that. But after 1967, hardly any of them believed in their eventual political unity. It was Arab statism not Arab nationalism that de.ned the post-1967 era, wataniya not qawmiya that deter­mined political relations among the Arab states. And the change began with Nasir himself.
content_units.azure_translation: 只要贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔和埃及主导了阿拉伯政治，阿拉伯民族主义及其阿拉伯全面统一的激进目标就一直存在。伊拉克不愿加入阿拉伯联合共和国（UAR）、叙利亚脱离联盟、在也门的浪费和无结果的军事行动、1963 年团结谈判的破裂，都让纳西尔受到了伤害，导致人们对他团结阿拉伯人的能力产生质疑。但这就是对梦想的诱惑，人们对它的渴望，以及他们对纳西尔魅力的力量的信念，可以实现它，它继续存在。事实上，1967 年战争之前发生的事件重新燃起了希望，谁能说出如果埃及和阿拉伯人而不是以色列赢得一场著名的胜利会发生什么。但纳西尔输了，而且输得臭名昭著。与其他挫折不同的是，这次失败的范围如此之大，以至于即使是最狂热的乌托邦主义者现在也看到了纳西尔魅力的永久黯然失色。剩下的只不过是一种文化上的亲近感，一种对共同习惯和习俗的理智认可，一种相信一种叫做阿拉伯主义的东西确实存在的信念。是的，他们是阿拉伯人，那些生活在各个阿拉伯语国家的人。他们中的大多数人都同意这一点。但在1967年之后，他们中几乎没有人相信他们最终会在政治上团结。是阿拉伯国家主义而不是阿拉伯民族主义决定了 1967 年后的时代，是 wataniya 而不是 qawmiya 决定了阿拉伯国家之间的政治关系。而这种变化，也是从纳西尔本人开始的。

content_units.text: Bernard Lewis, The Middle East and the West (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1964), p. 94.

The Six Day War had cost Egypt dearly in life and material. Egypts human losses were detailed by Nasir himself in a melan­choly speech he delivered a fewmonths after the debacle of the war. Ten thousand soldiers and .fteen hundred of.cers had been killed, and the Israelis captured .ve thousand men and .ve hundred of.cers.4 In terms of equipment, Egyptian losses were estimated at six hundred tanks and three hundred and forty combat aircraft.5 Beyond these horrendous losses, the war was responsible for many domestic and economic maladies. A huge migration to an already overpopulated Cairo from the canal cities of Ismailiya, Suez, Port Said, and others was underway, and Egypts authorities, still in shock over the lightening disaster that had befallen them, had no way to deal with this new and potentially incendiary predicament. The postwar state of Egypts structurally fragile economy was not short of desperate. The Suez Canal, Egypts major export earner, was now closed to international shipping, and the oil .elds of Sinai were under Israeli control. And, of course, on top of all this adver­sity there was the humiliating and potentially destabilizing pres­ence of Israeli troops on Egyptian soil. Not surprisingly, Nasir pos­sessed neither the capabilities nor the compulsion to pursue the radical goals of Arab nationalism. By necessity his sights were turned inward to Egypts plight, to its monstrous postwar prob­lems, many of which verged on the unsolvable.
content_units.azure_translation: 六日战争使埃及付出了沉重的生命和物质代价。纳西尔本人在战争失败几个月后发表的一次忧郁演讲中详细介绍了埃及的人员伤亡。一万名士兵和 100 名士兵被杀，以色列人俘虏了 5000 名士兵和 500 名士兵。4 在装备方面，埃及损失估计为 600 辆坦克和 340 架战斗机。5 除了这些可怕的损失之外，战争还造成了许多国内和经济弊病。从伊斯梅利亚、苏伊士、塞得港等运河城市向已经人口过剩的开罗进行大规模移民，埃及当局仍然对降临在他们身上的闪电灾难感到震惊，没有办法处理这种新的、可能具有煽动性的困境。战后埃及结构脆弱的经济状况不乏绝望。埃及的主要出口收入来源苏伊士运河现在已禁止国际航运，西奈半岛的石油油田处于以色列的控制之下。当然，除了所有这些逆境之外，以色列军队在埃及领土上的存在是羞辱性的，并可能破坏稳定。毫不奇怪，纳西尔既没有能力也没有冲动去追求阿拉伯民族主义的激进目标。出于必要，他的目光转向了埃及的困境，转向了战后可怕的问题，其中许多问题近乎无法解决。

content_units.text: American University of Beirut, al-Wathaiq al-Arabiya al-Siyasiya, 1967 (Arab political documents, 1967) (Beirut: AUB Press, n.d.), p. 718. (Hereafter cited as Wathaiq).
Institute for Strategic Studies, The Military Balance, 19671968 (London: ISS, 1967), p. 50.

Egypts primary objective nowbecame the eradication of the consequences of the defeat,6 and all the countrys activities, in­cluding its involvement in inter-Arab affairs, were made totally de­pendent on the consummation of this overriding objective. Egypts policy rationale became exclusively statist. Our attitude toward any Arab state, explained Nasir, depends on that states attitude toward the battle.7 In fact, Nasir could have used more appropri­ately the plural form of the word, for Egypt had more than one herculean battle on its hands: the battle to rescue the country from the shambles that was its economy; the battle to tackle the immense problems of the mass human exodus from the war zone; the battle to overcome the ensuing alienation of society and to restore to it a sense of self-worth, a semblance of dignity; and, of course, the bat­tle to regain occupied Egyptian land. The focus had to be on Egypt; wataniya was now the name of the game.
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及的首要目标现在变成了消除战败的后果，6 而所有国家的活动，包括它参与阿拉伯间事务，都完全取决于这一压倒一切的目标的完成。埃及的政策理由完全变成了国家主义。纳西尔解释说，我们对任何阿拉伯国家的态度取决于该国家对战斗的态度。7 事实上，纳西尔本可以更恰当地使用这个词的复数形式，因为埃及手头上有不止一场艰巨的战斗：将国家从经济的混乱中拯救出来的战斗;解决大规模人类从战区外流的巨大问题的战斗;克服随之而来的社会疏离并恢复自我价值感和尊严的斗争;当然，还有收复被占领的埃及土地的战斗。重点必须放在埃及;渡谷现在是游戏的名称。

content_units.text: This statist proclivity was cemented at the Summit of Arab Heads of State, which convened in the Sudanese capital, Khar­toum, in August 1967. It was clear even before the convening of the Summit that the meeting would endorse an interpretation of Arabism that was consistent with sovereignty.8 Egypts accep­tance of this principle was made easier when Saudi Arabia, Ku­wait, and monarchical Libya extended an annual grant of $280 million to Egypt to compensate it for the loss of land and revenue. Nasir nowbecame economically beholden to the oil-rich, conser­vative, and pro-Western states, the very states against which his Arab nationalist onslaught was aimed. The prophet of Arab na­tionalism nowseemed ready to abandon any hope for Arab unity, and it was only natural that the .ock would follow the lead and begin to see the state in a more traditional sense, devoid of its revolutionary trappings.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种国家主义倾向在1967年8月在苏丹首都喀土穆召开的阿拉伯国家元首首脑会议上得到了巩固。甚至在首脑会议召开之前，就已经很清楚，会议将赞同一种符合主权的阿拉伯主义解释。8 当沙特阿拉伯、科威特和君主制利比亚每年向埃及提供 2.8 亿美元的赠款以补偿其土地和收入损失时，埃及更容易接受这一原则。纳西尔现在在经济上受制于石油资源丰富、保守和亲西方的国家，而这些国家正是他的阿拉伯民族主义攻击所针对的国家。阿拉伯民族主义的先知现在似乎准备放弃对阿拉伯统一的任何希望，而 .ock 将效仿并开始以更传统意义上看待国家，没有其革命外衣，这是很自然的。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), August 30, 1967. 7 Wathaiq, 1968, p. 378. 8 Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 167.

Attitudes would change so quickly that within a few years the discourse of revolutionary nationalism, au courant in the 1950s and 1960s, would begin to sound peculiarly out of place in the pragmatic and businesslike atmosphere of the 1970s.9 Even the journalist Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal who, as we have seen, had famously characterized Egypt not just as a state, but also as a revo­lution, carrying its mission for a unitary Arab future across state boundaries,10 nowconceded the passing of his theory. In the post­1967 era, Haykal observed, the rise of the statist, oil-rich countries and the growing respect for the political power of money all but made the pre-1967 focus on revolutionary struggle a thing of the past. He encapsulated this dramatic and consequential trans­formation in his celebrated phrase that tharwa (wealth) had taken over from thawra (revolution).11 The Khartoum Summit and the institutionalization of the power of petro-dollars put the seal of legitimacy on wataniya as the basis of inter-Arab politics.
content_units.azure_translation: 态度变化如此之快，以至于在几年内，1950 年代和 1960 年代流行的革命民族主义话语开始在 1970 年代务实和务实的氛围中听起来格格不入。9 甚至记者穆罕默德·哈萨宁·海卡尔（Muhamed Hasaneen Haykal）也曾将埃及描述为一个国家， 而且也是一场革命，跨越国家边界，为单一的阿拉伯未来而使命，10 现在承认他的理论已经过去了。海卡尔观察到，在1967年后时代，国家主义、石油资源丰富的国家的崛起以及对货币政治权力的日益尊重几乎使1967年之前对革命斗争的关注成为过去。他用他著名的短语概括了这种戏剧性的、随之而来的转变，即 tharwa（财富）已经取代了 thawra（革命）。11 喀土穆峰会和石油美元权力的制度化为瓦塔尼亚打上了合法性的印章，成为阿拉伯间政治的基础。

content_units.text: The ascendancy of particularistic, subnational identity was, par­adoxically enough, underscored by a nonstate, revolutionary movement. The Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) did not emerge as an independent movement until 1967, not least because Palestinian nationalism did not emerge from under the all-encom­passing shadowof Arab nationalism until the War of June 1967. In the pre-1967 period, educated and politically aware Palestinians tended to be ardent supporters of Arab nationalism, and much like other Arabs they de.ned the struggle with the Jewish state not as the Palestinian-Israeli con.ict, but as the Arab-Israeli con.ict. And why ever not? Their Arab brethren had resources the Palestinians did not possess: large armies, wealth, and perhaps most crucially, sovereign territories from which they could wage the inevitable war of liberation. When the time came for the torch of the struggle to be lit, the Palestinians would undoubtedly participate in the deliv­ erance of their homeland, but only as a part of the combined Arab effort. After all, even the PLO was established by the Arab states in 1964, and given an army, the Palestine Liberation Army (PLA), which was supposed, when the call came, to partake alongside other Arab armies in the liberation of Arab Palestine.
content_units.azure_translation: 矛盾的是，特殊主义、次国家身份的优势被一场非国家革命运动所强调。巴勒斯坦解放组织 （PLO） 直到 1967 年才作为一个独立运动出现，尤其是因为巴勒斯坦民族主义直到 1967 年 6 月战争才从阿拉伯民族主义的包罗万象的阴影下出现。在 1967 年之前的时期，受过教育且具有政治意识的巴勒斯坦人往往是阿拉伯民族主义的热心支持者，并且像其他阿拉伯人一样，他们将与犹太国家的斗争视为不是巴勒斯坦-以色列的冲突，而是阿拉伯-以色列的冲突。为什么不呢？他们的阿拉伯兄弟拥有巴勒斯坦人所不具备的资源：庞大的军队、财富，也许最重要的是，他们可以发动不可避免的解放战争的主权领土。当斗争的火炬被点燃的时候到了，巴勒斯坦人无疑会参与对他们家园的宣扬，但这只是作为阿拉伯联合努力的一部分。毕竟，即使是巴解组织也是阿拉伯国家在1964年成立的，并赋予了一支军队，即巴勒斯坦解放军（PLA），当号召到来时，它应该与其他阿拉伯军队一起参与阿拉伯巴勒斯坦的解放。

content_units.text: Adeed Dawisha, Jordan in the Middle East: The Art of Survival, in The Shaping of an Arab Statesman: Abd al-Hamid Sharif and the Modern Arab World, ed. Patrick Seale (NewYork: Quartet Books, 1983), p. 69.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), December 29. 1961.
Mohamed Heikal, Sphinx and Commissar: The Rise and Fall of Soviet In.uence in the Arab World (London: Collins, 1978), p. 262.

True, challenges to this vision and the organizational schema that accompanied it began before 1967, when some younger Pales­tinians, dazzled by the heroic triumph of the Algerian war of independence, began to form Resistance groups that charted a revolutionary course of liberation independent of the Arab states.12 By 1967, a fewof these groups had mounted what essen­tially were hit-and-run operations which, if nothing else, proved to be annoyances and irritants to Israel. One of the better known of these groups was al-Fatah, formed by a young, Cairo-educated engineer, Yasir Arafat.13 But until the June 1967 War, the Arabs continued to be the primary custodians of Palestinian aspirations, and the PLO of traditionalists and notables continued to receive the patronage of the Arab system and whatever legitimacy it be­stowed. Even an eloquent and committed advocate of Palestinian nationalism such as the historian Rashid Khalidi, who maintains that a Palestinian identity began to emerge as early as the late Ottoman era, accepts that in the 19551967 period, it was sub­merged by the pervasive force of Arab nationalism. Khalidi con­cedes that for many Palestinians during this period, Arab national­ism retained its appeal both as an idea that had long been popular among Palestinians . . . as well as what appeared to be a practical means to the achievement of their shared goal of the liberation of their country.14
content_units.azure_translation: 诚然，对这一愿景和随之而来的组织图式的挑战始于 1967 年之前，当时一些年轻的巴勒斯坦人被阿尔及利亚独立战争的英勇胜利所迷惑，开始组建抵抗组织，制定独立于阿拉伯国家的革命解放路线。12 到 1967 年，其中一些组织已经发起了本质上是肇事逃逸的行动，这些行动： 如果不出意外的话，事实证明对以色列来说是烦恼和刺激。这些团体中最著名的一个是法塔赫，由一位在开罗受过教育的年轻工程师亚西尔·阿拉法特（Yasir Arafat）组成。13 但直到 1967 年 6 月战争，阿拉伯人仍然是巴勒斯坦愿望的主要守护者，由传统主义者和名人组成的巴解组织继续受到阿拉伯制度及其赋予的任何合法性的赞助。即使是一位雄辩而坚定的巴勒斯坦民族主义倡导者，如历史学家拉希德·哈利迪（Rashid Khalidi），他坚持认为巴勒斯坦身份早在奥斯曼帝国时代晚期就开始出现，他也承认，在19551967时期，它被阿拉伯民族主义的普遍力量淹没了。哈利迪承认，对于这一时期的许多巴勒斯坦人来说，阿拉伯民族主义仍然具有吸引力，因为它是一种长期以来在巴勒斯坦人中流行的思想......以及实现解放国家的共同目标的实际手段。14

content_units.text: The best work on the origins, organization, and development of the Palestinian Resis­tance is Helena Cobban, The Palestinian Liberation Organization: People, Power and Pol­itics (London: Cambridge University Press, 1984).

According to the biographer of Arafat, the origin of al-Fatah dates all the way back to the mid-1950s. Ironically, the .rst underground cell of the organization was formed by its two founders, Arafat and Khalil al-Wazir in Kuwait. Nasirs Egypt had obliged the two Palestinian radicals to seek refuge in the then-British protectorate! See Alan Hart, Arafat: A Political Biography (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1984), p. 121.
Rashid Khalidi, Palestinian Identity: The Construction of Modern National Conscious­ness (NewYork: Columbia University Press, 1997), p. 183. On the same subject, see also

The Arabs spectacular hazima (rout) in the Six Day War changed all that. To the Palestinians, it signaled the impotence of Arab nationalism to help their cause, drawing a lesson of self-reli­ance from the whole ignominious affair. From now on, the struggle against the Israelis would be carried out under the banner of Pales­tinian nationalism. The Palestinians would eschew the tired and discredited old way of classic warfare, employing instead guerrilla tactics made famous by the extraordinary successes of the Algeri­ans and Vietnamese. The Palestinian scenario was simple: the guer­rillas would set up traps and ambush patrols, they would move by night and disappear by day, lightly armed phantoms, hitting the enemy where it least expected it, wreaking havoc and consterna­tion among the people who usurped their land and who basked in the arrogance of their swift and effortless 1967 victory.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯人在六日战争中壮观的 hazima（溃败）改变了这一切。对巴勒斯坦人来说，它表明阿拉伯民族主义无力帮助他们的事业，从整个可耻的事件中吸取了自力更生的教训。从现在开始，反对以色列人的斗争将在巴勒斯坦民族主义的旗帜下进行。巴勒斯坦人将避开陈旧且名誉扫地的经典战争方式，转而采用因阿尔及利亚人和越南人的非凡成功而闻名的游击战术。巴勒斯坦的情景很简单：游击队会设下陷阱和伏击巡逻队，他们会夜间移动，白天消失，轻装的幽灵，击中敌人最意想不到的地方，在篡夺他们土地的人们中造成严重破坏和惊愕，他们沉浸在他们迅速而毫不费力的胜利的傲慢中。

content_units.text: If the Palestinians needed a psychological boost, it was to come in the spring of 1968 at the town of Karameh in Jordan. A rather large Israeli force sent to destroy the guerrilla base inside the town was ambushed by Palestinian commandos and Jordanian army units. The Israelis suffered substantial losses. In military terms, however, the Israeli operation achieved its goal in that it did suc­ceed in destroying the base. But the fact that the Palestinian .ghters stood their ground, fought valiantly, and, along with the Jordani­ans, ended up in.icting casualties on the invincible Israelis, was hailed by Palestinians and Arabs alike as a remarkable victory. Whether by accident or design, the Palestinians chose the right town to .ex their muscles. In Arabic, the towns name, Karameh, meant dignity, and the engagement with the Israelis became rooted in Palestinian and Arab psyche as the battle for dignity,15 a dig­nity that had been lost, some believed irretrievably, in June 1967.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果巴勒斯坦人需要心理上的提振，那就是 1968 年春天在约旦的卡拉梅镇。一支相当庞大的以色列部队被派去摧毁该镇内的游击队基地，遭到巴勒斯坦突击队和约旦军队的伏击。以色列人遭受了重大损失。然而，在军事方面，以色列的行动实现了其目标，因为它确实成功地摧毁了该基地。但巴勒斯坦人坚守阵地，英勇作战，并与约旦人一起，最终伤亡了不可战胜的以色列人，这一事实被巴勒斯坦人和阿拉伯人誉为一场了不起的胜利。无论是偶然还是有意为之，巴勒斯坦人都选择了正确的城镇来锻炼他们的肌肉。在阿拉伯语中，城镇名称“卡拉梅”的意思是尊严，与以色列人的接触植根于巴勒斯坦和阿拉伯人的心理，即为尊严而战，15 这种尊严在 1967 年 6 月已经丧失，有些人认为是无法挽回的。

content_units.text: Karameh had an electrifying impact on the guerrillas recruit­ment efforts. Long lines of young men in various Arab cities waited to be enlisted by guerrilla representatives. Spontaneous fund-rais-
content_units.azure_translation: 卡拉梅对游击队的招募工作产生了令人震惊的影响。在各个阿拉伯城市，年轻人排起了长队，等待游击队代表的招募。自发筹款-

content_units.text: John W. Amos II, Palestinian Resistance: Organization of a Nationalist Movement (New York: Pergamon Press, 1980), pp. 1819. ing activities took place throughout the Arab world. Pro-guerrilla demonstrations .lled Arab streets, and the valor of the guerrillas was extolled in mosques, schools, and other public meetings places. The degradation of the Arab effort in the War of June 196716 and the glori.cation of the Palestinian performance in Karameh in March 1968 accelerated the symbolic shift in Arab consciousness from the national (Arab) to the subnational.
content_units.azure_translation: John W. Amos II， Palestinian Resistance： Organization of a Nationalist Movement （New York： Pergamon Press， 1980）， pp. 1819.活动在整个阿拉伯世界进行。支持游击队的示威游行在阿拉伯街道上蔓延，游击队的英勇在清真寺、学校和其他公共集会场所得到赞扬。阿拉伯在196716年6月战争中的努力的退化和1968年3月巴勒斯坦在卡拉梅的表演的辉煌加速了阿拉伯意识从民族（阿拉伯）到次国家的象征性转变。

content_units.text: See W. AndrewTerrill, The Political Mythology of the Battle of Karameh, in The Middle East Journal, vol. 55, no. 1 (Winter 2001).

This symbolic shift was to gather momentum a couple of years later in yet another military confrontation that involved the Pales­tinian guerrillas. Except this time the Palestinians ended up on the losing side. The spectacular growth in the numbers and the power of the Palestinian guerrilla movement sooner or later was bound to come against state interests, particularly those countries adja­cent to the Jewish state, notably Jordan, within whose borders most of the guerrillas resided and from whose land they struck at Israel. Through an elaborate network of military, social, economic, and administrative institutions, the Palestinian presence in the Ha­shemite Kingdom became almost a state within a state. By 1970, two military and political structures existed in Jordan, largely inde­pendent of each other and increasingly wary of the others inten­tions and motives: the Hashemite monarchy and the PLO. King Husayns resentment of this state of affairs and his efforts to con­.ne the power and activities of the guerrillas led to mounting do­mestic tension. In the summer of 1970, it had become clear that a military confrontation between the two antagonistic sides could be averted only through the authoritative intervention of President Nasir. The wounded leader of Arab nationalism still had enough prestige, and his country still commanded center stage in Arab geo­strategic politics, and because of this, King Husayn and Yasir Ara­ fat (by nowthe leader of the PLO), would go to Nasir and Cairo seeking support for their respective causes.
content_units.azure_translation: 这一象征性的转变在几年后在另一场涉及巴勒斯坦游击队的军事对抗中蓄势待发。只不过这一次巴勒斯坦人最终站在了失败的一方。巴勒斯坦游击队运动人数和力量的惊人增长迟早必然会违背国家利益，特别是那些与犹太国家相邻的国家，特别是约旦，大多数游击队都居住在约旦境内，他们从约旦的土地上袭击以色列。通过精心设计的军事、社会、经济和行政机构网络，巴勒斯坦人在哈希姆王国的存在几乎成为一个国中的国。到 1970 年，约旦存在两个军事和政治结构，它们在很大程度上相互独立，并且对其他方的意图和动机越来越警惕：哈希姆君主制和巴解组织。侯赛因国王对这种状况的不满以及他 con.ne 游击队权力和活动的努力导致国内紧张局势加剧。1970年夏天，很明显，只有通过纳西尔总统的权威干预，才能避免两方之间的军事对抗。受伤的阿拉伯民族主义领袖仍然有足够的威望，他的国家仍然在阿拉伯地缘战略政治中占据中心舞台，正因为如此，侯赛因国王和亚西尔·阿拉胖子（现在是巴解组织的领导人）会去纳西尔和开罗寻求支持他们各自的事业。

content_units.text: Derogatory comments not only about the Arab states and their armies, but also about Arabs generally, were common. The author, who resided in London at the time, remembers an interviewer from BBC Television being told by one young man waiting in a long line to be enlisted that various disasters of the past had almost convinced him that al-Arab jarab, meaning that the Arabs were useless lepers. However, Karameh had restored his faith in at least some of the Arabs. He then went on to describe the Palestinian Resistance in glowing, adoring terms. When asked about the country of his origin, he replied that it was no longer of any consequence, because he was now a Palestinian.

Nasir was torn. He did sympathize with Husayn against the an­archic behavior of the Palestinian guerrillas inside his country. After all, Husayns complaint was based on the concept of sover­eignty, a concept that, since the Khartoum Summit, had constituted the fundamental ideological basis of the post-1967 political order. Furthermore, Nasir was not convinced that Palestinian guerrilla tactics would defeat Israel. The essence of this argument was eluci­dated, prophetically as it turned out, by Haykal in an article that went against the prevalent euphoria in the wake of Karameh. Hay­kal maintained that guerrilla tactics could not be decisive in Israel where the terrain was open, where the oppressors outnumbered the oppressed, and where in contrast to Vietnam or Algeria, the guerrillas could not seek immunity from enemy retaliation and at­tack because Israel possessed the capability to strike anywhere in the Arab world. This made the idea that defeating Israel through guerrilla warfare no more than a myth propagated by ill-informed romantics. The task of defeating Israel, concluded Haykal, could only be accomplished by the entire forces of the Arab world, of which the Palestinian Resistance would constitute an integral part.17 Even so, given his own emotional proclivities and the ac­knowledged popularity of the Palestinian Resistance in Egypt as well as in the rest of the Arab world, Nasir could hardly appear to be abandoning the Palestinian cause. He had, after all, earlier conceded that the emergence of the Palestinian Resistance was playing an important role in reviving the Arab situation after the lows of his own defeat in June 1967.18
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔左右为难。他确实同情侯赛因反对巴勒斯坦游击队在他国内的无政府主义行为。毕竟，侯赛因的控诉是基于主权概念，自喀土穆首脑会议以来，这一概念就构成了1967年后政治秩序的基本意识形态基础。此外，纳西尔并不相信巴勒斯坦游击战术会击败以色列。事实证明，海卡尔在一篇文章中阐明了这一论点的本质，该文章与卡拉梅之后普遍存在的兴奋相反。海卡尔坚持认为，游击战术在以色列无法发挥决定性作用，因为以色列地势开阔，压迫者数量多于被压迫者，而且与越南或阿尔及利亚相比，游击队无法寻求免受敌人报复和攻击的豁免，因为以色列拥有打击阿拉伯世界任何地方的能力。这使得通过游击战击败以色列的想法只不过是消息灵通的浪漫主义者传播的神话。海卡尔总结说，击败以色列的任务只能由阿拉伯世界的整个力量完成，巴勒斯坦抵抗运动将构成其中不可分割的一部分。17 即便如此，鉴于他自己的情感倾向以及巴勒斯坦抵抗运动在埃及和阿拉伯世界其他地区公认的受欢迎程度， 纳西尔似乎不会放弃巴勒斯坦事业。毕竟，他早些时候就承认，巴勒斯坦抵抗运动的出现在1967年6月他自己失败的低谷之后，在重振阿拉伯局势方面发挥了重要作用。

content_units.text: Not only Nasir but other radical leaders suffered the same inner dilemma. Take the case of the Algerian Houari Boumedienne. As the president of a state, he could not but sympathize with Jor­dans determination to safeguard its sovereignty. But as a promi­nent .gure in Algerias long and bloody war of liberation, he de­ clared himself unable to remain indifferent to any action whose aim is to put an end to the Palestinian Resistance.19 It is worth repeating here that this dual concern for Jordan and the Palestin­ians remained at the ruling elite level. At the popular level, the over­whelming support of the Arab public was given unreservedly to the Palestinian Resistance.
content_units.azure_translation: 不仅是纳西尔，其他激进领导人也遭受了同样的内心困境。以阿尔及利亚 Houari Boumedienne 为例。作为一个国家的总统，他不能不同情约旦维护其主权的决心。但作为阿尔及利亚长期血腥解放战争的杰出人物，他宣称自己不能对任何旨在结束巴勒斯坦抵抗运动的行动无动于衷。19 这里值得重申的是，对约旦和巴勒斯坦人的这种双重关切仍然停留在统治精英层面。在民众层面，阿拉伯公众的压倒性支持毫无保留地给予了巴勒斯坦抵抗运动。

content_units.text: Al-Ahram (Cairo), August 16, 1968. 18 Wathaiq, 1967, p. 718.

Nasir, avoiding the attendant emotionalism of the situation, urged both Husayn and Arafat to exercise caution and patience in dealing with each other. The Palestinians, who were becoming wary of Nasirs revolutionary commitment, did not heed his ad­vice. After all, the professed leader of radical Arab nationalism had just agreed to an American initiative sponsored by the United States secretary of state, William Rogers, which included not just a cease­.re on the Egyptian-Israeli front, but also an Egyptian agreement for peace talks with the Israelis through United Nations representa­tives.20 Arafat and the Palestinian Resistance had opposed the Rog­ers plan bitterly and had taken heart from Egypts initial dismissal of the plan and the American secretary of state, who was vili.ed for wanting to buy Arab destiny with empty words21 and for possessing an enormous talent for evading the truth.22 Not sur­prisingly, the Palestinians sawin Nasirs later acceptance of the plan an abandonment of the struggle and an af.rmation of the primacy of Egypts statist interests. To the Palestinians, Nasirs counseling of caution was the advice not of an Arab nationalist leader, but of the president of a state, articulating concerns that were not at all different from those of the Jordanian monarch.23
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔避免了随之而来的情绪化局势，敦促侯赛因和阿拉法特在对待对方时保持谨慎和耐心。巴勒斯坦人对纳西尔的革命承诺越来越警惕，没有听从他的建议。毕竟，这位自称激进阿拉伯民族主义领袖的人刚刚同意了美国国务卿威廉·罗杰斯发起的一项美国倡议，该倡议不仅包括埃及-以色列战线的 cease.re，还包括埃及通过联合国代表与以色列人进行和平谈判的协议。20 阿拉法特和巴勒斯坦抵抗运动强烈反对罗杰斯计划，并从埃及最初驳回该计划和美国国务卿，他因想用空话21 买下阿拉伯的命运而受到诽谤，并拥有逃避真相的巨大才能。22 毫不奇怪，巴勒斯坦人后来接受了纳西尔的计划，放弃了斗争，并放弃了埃及国家主义利益的首要地位。对巴勒斯坦人来说，纳西尔的谨慎建议不是阿拉伯民族主义领导人的建议，而是一个国家总统的建议，表达的担忧与约旦君主的担忧没有任何区别。

content_units.text: Had Arafat and his chief lieutenants accepted Nasirs counsel, they might have saved their organization and people much suffer­ ing and humiliation. But they were riding a tidal wave of popular support so intoxicating that it blinded them to the reality of the balance of forces in Jordan. The Royal Jordanian Army, made up primarily of .ercely loyal bedouin units, was itching for a show­down, which it knew it would decisively win. But rather than tem­pering their activities, the Palestinians increased their challenge to the domestic authority and internal stability of the Jordanian state. By the end of the summer, the situation had become untenable and hopelessly polarized. Anarchy reigned, and it was clear that some­thing had to give. Here is how the king described what was happen­ing in Jordan:
content_units.azure_translation: 如果阿拉法特和他的副官接受纳西尔的建议，他们可能会挽救他们的组织和人民遭受的许多痛苦和羞辱。但他们正乘着民众支持的浪潮，如此令人陶醉，以至于他们对约旦力量平衡的现实视而不见。约旦皇家军队主要由忠诚的贝都因部队组成，他们渴望摊牌，它知道这将决定性地获胜。但巴勒斯坦人非但没有缓和他们的活动，反而加大了对约旦国内权威和内部稳定的挑战。到夏末，局势已经变得难以为继，两极分化得无可救药。无政府状态盛行，很明显必须做出一些让步。国王是这样描述约旦发生的事情的：

content_units.text: Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 179.

See A. I. Dawisha, Egypt in the Arab World: The Elements of Foreign Policy (London: Macmillan, 1976), p. 58. For an Egyptian perspective on the reasons for Egypts acceptance see Muhamed Hasaneen Haykals detailed explanation in al-Abram (Cairo), July 31, 1970.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), March 13, 1970.
Al-Ahram (Cairo), March 20, 1970.

Indeed, at times during the meeting, Arafat was taken aback by the stridency of Nasirs criticism of PLO activity in Jordan. It seems that Nasir even hinted that the Palestinian organization was hurting the interests of Arab nationalism. See Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 179.

We were in the .ght which I believe was a turning point in the life of Jordan. We didnt want it. We tried our very best to avert the deterioration [of the situation]. But the Palestinian resistance gained strength. They had moved from the Jordan valley to the towns.... We had thousands of incidents of Palestinians breaking the law, of attacking people. It was a very unruly state of affairs in the country, and I continued to try to restore order . . . Toward the end I felt I was losing control. The army began to rebel. I had to spend most of my time running from one unit to another.24
content_units.azure_translation: 我们身处 .ght，我相信这是乔丹生活的转折点。我们不想要它。我们尽最大努力避免[局势]恶化。但巴勒斯坦的抵抗力量得到了加强。他们从约旦河谷搬到了城镇......我们发生了数千起巴勒斯坦人违法、袭击人民的事件。这个国家的局势非常不守规矩，我继续努力恢复秩序......接近尾声时，我觉得自己失去了控制。军队开始叛乱。我不得不把大部分时间花在从一个单位跑到另一个单位上24。

content_units.text: By September 1970, clashes between the Jordanian army and the Palestinian guerrillas had escalated in frequency and intensity. After a multiple airplane hijacking operation by the Palestinians, the military skirmishes developed into a bloody, full scale civil war on September 16.
content_units.azure_translation: 到1970年9月，约旦军队与巴勒斯坦游击队之间的冲突频率和强度不断升级。在巴勒斯坦人发动多架飞机劫持行动后，军事冲突于 9 月 16 日发展为一场血腥的全面内战。

content_units.text: Six days later, as the Palestinians were losing the war badly with horrifying loss of life, an emergency summit of the Arab Heads of State convened in Cairo. Husayn was unrepentant, vigorously defending Jordans statist interests: The state will exercise its full sovereignty over everyone present on its territory. All shall respect that sovereignty.25 When, .nally, Husayn was persuaded to sign an agreement to end the war eleven days after it had started, some three thousand Palestinian guerrillas and civilians had perished, and the bulk of the Palestinian guerrillas had been expelled from Jordan. By the end of the following year, when the Jordanian army ruthlessly eliminated a fewremaining PLO pockets in northeast Jordan, the complex institutional structure, the state-within-a-state that the Palestinians had proudly and de.antly built lay in sham­bles, decimated not by Israel but by an Arab army intent on de­fending the sovereignty of its state. The Palestinians .rst excursion into Arab politics, their .rst challenge to the state-based Arab polit­ical order, which had been enshrined in the Khartoum Summit, proved to be a costly and dismal failure. With a zeal that occasion­ally bordered on downright savagery, Jordan had successfully de­fended its state sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 六天后，由于巴勒斯坦人在战争中惨败，造成可怕的生命损失，阿拉伯国家元首紧急首脑会议在开罗召开。侯赛因毫不悔改，大力捍卫约旦的国家主义利益：国家将对其领土上的每个人行使全部主权。所有国家都应尊重这一主权。25 当侯赛因在战争开始 11 天后被说服签署结束战争的协议时，大约三千名巴勒斯坦游击队和平民丧生，大部分巴勒斯坦游击队被驱逐出约旦。到次年年底，当约旦军队无情地消灭了约旦东北部仅存的几个巴解组织小区时，巴勒斯坦人自豪地、坚定地建立起来的复杂的制度结构、国中国陷入了混乱，不是被以色列摧毁，而是被一支意图捍卫其国家主权的阿拉伯军队摧毁。巴勒斯坦人第一次进入阿拉伯政治，第一次挑战喀土穆首脑会议所载的以国家为基础的阿拉伯政治秩序，事实证明是代价高昂且惨淡的失败。约旦以一种偶尔近乎彻头彻尾的野蛮的热情，成功地捍卫了自己的国家主权。

content_units.text: This extract is from an interviewwith King Husayn conducted by Avi Shlaim. See New York Review of Books, July 15, 1999, pp. 1617.
Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 180.

The next assertion of the primacy of statist wataniya came from Egypt, the very country which had, during the 1950s and 1960s, presented itself and had been seen by others as the heart of qaw­miya, the very core of Arab nationalism. Nasir died suddenly right after the conclusion of the Cairo Summit in September 1970. His vice president, Anwar al-Sadat, succeeded him. Cavalierly dis­missed as Bikbashi aywah (Colonel Yes-man), and with no political base, Sadat could do little but promise to followfaithfully on the values and policies of his towering predecessor. In his efforts to legitimize his rule against potential rivals during the .rst year of his presidency, Sadat would often invoke the legacy of Nasir, pro­claiming his undying allegiance to that sacred memory and its prin­ciples.26 Indeed, at times he seemed to be more stridently Nasirist than Nasir had been. In a major speech to the Arab Socialist Union (ASU), the Nasir-created sole political organization in Egypt, Sadat not only reminded his audience that Egyptians belonged to the Arab nation both historically and by common destiny, but also promised that Egypt under his leadership would serve as the van­ guard of the Arab revolutionary march.27 These were words that Nasir himself had abandoned after the Khartoum Summit of 1967. And later events, as we shall see, hardly suggest a commitment by Sadat to these revolutionary and Arab nationalist ideals. Rather, such utterances were simply the manifestations of his own political weakness in the initial phase of his presidency.
content_units.azure_translation: 下一个关于国家主义 wataniya 至高无上的主张来自埃及，正是这个国家在 1950 年代和 1960 年代出现并被其他人视为阿拉伯民族主义核心 qawmiya 的心脏。纳西尔在 1970 年 9 月开罗峰会结束后立即突然去世。他的副总统安瓦尔·萨达特接替了他。萨达特被轻率地斥为“Yes-man上校”，而且没有政治基础，他只能承诺忠实地遵循他高大的前任的价值观和政策。在他担任总统的第一年，萨达特为了使他的统治合法化，以对抗潜在的竞争对手，他经常援引纳西尔的遗产，宣称他对那份神圣记忆及其原则的永恒忠诚。26 事实上，有时他似乎比纳西尔更强烈地成为纳西尔主义者。在对纳西尔创建的埃及唯一政治组织阿拉伯社会主义联盟（ASU）的一次重要演讲中，萨达特不仅提醒听众，埃及人在历史上和命运上都属于阿拉伯民族，而且还承诺，他领导下的埃及将成为阿拉伯革命进军的先锋。27 这是纳西尔本人在1967年喀土穆首脑会议后放弃的话。正如我们将看到的，后来的事件几乎表明萨达特对这些革命和阿拉伯民族主义理想的承诺。相反，这些言论只是他自己在总统任期初期政治软弱的表现。

content_units.text: Typical of Sadats proclamations of loyalty was the following statement: We .nd our­selves without [Nasirs] presence among us, without his mind, organization and leadership, although his thoughts, principles and attitudes remain as an inexhaustible treasure for us forever. British Broadcasting Corporation, Summary of World Broadcasts, Part IV: The Arab World, Israel, Greece, Turkey, Iran (hereafter cited as SWB), November 16, 1970, p. 3.

Thanks to Nasir, this would not last long. Sadat had inherited an organizational structure that Nasir had built speci.cally to maintain the primacy of the presidency over all walks of life in Egypt. Once Sadat was able to root out potential rivals,28 he used the Nasirist political and administrative system to cement his own authority and political control. By 1972, Sadat had fully emerged from the overbearing shadowof his predecessor, and with that, Egypts ideological orientation became progressively more inward-looking, boasting an almost uncontested Egypt .rst orientation. Sadats earlier adherence to Arab unity became fully subordi­nated to the value of Egyptian patriotism, a concept which even though acted upon in the last years of Nasirs rule was, in fact, hardly publicized or publicly celebrated as an autonomous ideolog­ical category. As early as July 1972, less than two years after the death of Nasir, Sadat would make the forthcoming battle with Israel a function .rst and foremost not of Arab nationalism and unity, but of Egyptian patriotism and domestic unity.29 The eminent Egyptian political scientist, Ali Hillal Dessouki, in a study of Egypts foreign policy con.rms the clearly Egyptian watani ori­entation in Sadats foreign policy objectives in the 1970s. Ac­cording to Dessouki, these objectives were: the restoration, prefera­bly through negotiation, of Egyptian territories occupied by Israel since 1967; the termination of the war with Israel, as the economic cost had become unbearable; the improvement of relations with Washington, as the United States was the only country capable of in.uencing Israel; the rejuvenation and modernization of Egypts economy through the import of modern Western technology and private capital; and the modi.cation of Egypts global and re­gional policies in order to better pursue these objectives.30 Stun­ningly absent from these objectives, which were articulated and acted upon by Sadat until his assassination in 1981, was any refer­ence to Arab nationalism, Arab unity, or Arab revolution, terms that were almost the staple diet of Nasirist speeches. Egypt became Sadats single-minded concern, constituting the primary motivation for his two momentous decisions: the October 1973 War, and his trip to Jerusalem and the consequent peace treaty with Israel.
content_units.azure_translation: 多亏了纳西尔，这种情况不会持续太久。萨达特继承了纳西尔专门建立的组织结构，以维持埃及各行各业的总统职位的首要地位。一旦萨达特能够铲除潜在的竞争对手，28 他就利用纳西尔主义的政治和行政制度来巩固自己的权威和政治控制。到1972年，萨达特已经完全摆脱了前任的专横阴影，随之而来的是，埃及的意识形态取向逐渐变得更加内向，拥有几乎无可争议的埃及第一取向。萨达特人早期对阿拉伯统一的坚持完全服从于埃及爱国主义的价值，这一概念尽管在纳西尔统治的最后几年得到了实施，但事实上，几乎没有作为一种自主的意识形态类别被公开或公开庆祝。早在1972年7月，即纳西尔去世后不到两年，萨达特就将即将到来的与以色列的战斗作为一种功能，首先不是阿拉伯民族主义和团结，而是埃及爱国主义和国内团结。29 埃及著名政治学家阿里·希拉尔·德苏基（Ali Hillal Dessouki）在对埃及外交政策的研究中，在1970年代萨达特的外交政策目标中明确指出了埃及的瓦塔尼取向。根据德苏基的说法，这些目标是：恢复（最好是通过谈判）恢复自 1967 年以来被以色列占领的埃及领土;结束与以色列的战争，因为经济代价已经变得难以承受;改善与华盛顿的关系，因为美国是唯一有能力与以色列交往的国家;通过进口现代西方技术和私人资本实现埃及经济的复兴和现代化;以及埃及全球和区域政策的修改，以便更好地实现这些目标。30 令人震惊的是，在萨达特在 1981 年被暗杀之前，这些目标一直被阐明和实施，但这些目标中却没有提到阿拉伯民族主义、阿拉伯团结或阿拉伯革命，这些术语几乎是纳西尔主义演讲的主要内容。埃及成为萨达特人一心一意的关心，构成了他做出两个重大决定的主要动机：1973 年 10 月的战争，以及他的耶路撒冷之行以及随之而来的与以色列的和平条约。

content_units.text: SWB, November 16, 1970, pp. 34.

An informative and interesting, although clearly self-serving, account of the process by which Sadats potential rivals were neutralized can be found in Anwar el-Sadat, In Search of Identity: An Autobiography (NewYork: Harper and Row, Publishers, 1977), pp. 204225.

Even though references to Arab occupied land were initially made, the 1973 War was fought to achieve .rst and foremost speci.cally Egyptian goals. From the very beginning, Sadats tar­get was the Sinai Peninsula, where a successful challenge to the status quo would force the Israelis to rethink their occupation of the region. True, the surprise attack on Israel on October 6, 1973 came simultaneously from the Egyptian and Syrian fronts after months of planning by the military commands of the two Arab countries,31 and the coordinated offensive might have seemed to the Syrians and other Arabs as a concerted Arab action designed to achieve Arab goals, but to the Egyptians, it was undertaken merely to weaken Israels military response by forcing it to .ght on two fronts.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管最初提到了阿拉伯占领的土地，但 1973 年的战争是为了实现第一个，尤其是埃及的目标。从一开始，萨达特的目标就是西奈半岛，在那里成功挑战现状将迫使以色列人重新考虑他们对该地区的占领。诚然，1973 年 10 月 6 日对以色列的突然袭击是经过两个阿拉伯国家军事指挥部数月的策划后，同时从埃及和叙利亚前线发动的，31 在叙利亚人和其他阿拉伯人看来，协同进攻可能是旨在实现阿拉伯目标的协调一致的阿拉伯行动，但在埃及人看来， 它只是为了通过迫使以色列在两条战线上做出军事反应来削弱以色列的军事反应。

content_units.text: Details of the planning for the attack reveal as much deception as coordination. Patrick Seale, relying on the memoirs of General Saad al-Shazly, commander of the Egyptian armed forces at the time, concludes that President Asad of Syria was hoodwinked by Sadat.32 Asad was made to believe that the war would be prose­ cuted until both the Sinai and Golan Heights were liberated, but that was never Sadats intent. The Sinai was the only concern of the Egyptian president. Sadat treated coordination with Syria as completely dependent on his conception of Egyptian interests, and indeed no sooner had coordination begun with the two countries launching their simultaneous offensive, than it ended. Ten days into the war, Egypts conditions for the cessation of the .ghting were outlined by Sadat in a speech to the Egyptian National As­sembly without prior consultation with Asad. The Syrian presi­dent was naturally piqued, reminding his comrade-in-arms that he had the right to knowSadats proposals before hearing them on the radio.33 Then on October 22, Sadat accepted a cease-.re unilat­erally in the face of .erce Syrian protestations. Two days earlier, Asad had sent a letter urging Sadat to stay the course. Sadat did not even bother to reply.34 Consequently, the .rst time the Syrians heard about Egypts decision was at the Security Council when the Egyptian representative announced his governments acceptance of the cease-.re.35
content_units.azure_translation: 袭击计划的细节揭示了欺骗和协调。帕特里克·西尔（Patrick Seale）根据当时的埃及武装部队司令萨阿德·沙兹利（Saad al-Shazly）将军的回忆录得出结论，叙利亚总统阿萨德是被萨达特蒙蔽的。32 阿萨德被迫相信，在西奈半岛和戈兰高地都解放之前，战争会被终止，但这从来都不是萨达特的意图。西奈半岛是埃及总统唯一关心的问题。萨达特认为与叙利亚的协调完全取决于他对埃及利益的看法，事实上，两国同时发动进攻的协调刚开始，就结束了。战争开始十天后，萨达特在没有事先与阿萨德协商的情况下，在埃及国民议会的一次演讲中概述了埃及停止 .ghting 的条件。叙利亚总统自然被激怒了，提醒他的战友，他有权在广播中听到萨达特的提议之前就知道这些提议。33 然后在 10 月 22 日，萨达特面对叙利亚的抗议单方面接受了一项 cease-.re。两天前，阿萨德致信敦促萨达特坚持到底。萨达特甚至懒得回答。34 因此，叙利亚人第一次听到埃及的决定是在安全理事会上，当时埃及代表宣布他的政府接受停工35。

content_units.text: Ali E. Hillal Dessouki, The Primacy of Economics: The Foreign Policy of Egypt, in The Foreign Policies of Arab States, eds., Bahgat Korany and Ali E. Hillal Dessouki. (Boul­der, Colorado: WestviewPress, 1988), p. 128.
For the details of the preparations for the October War, see Saad Shazly, The Crossing of the Suez (San Francisco: American Mideast Research, 1980).
Patrick Seale, Asad: The Struggle for the Middle East (Berkeley: University of Califor­nia Press, 1989), p. 199, see also Shazly, The Crossing of the Suez,p.37.

If the Syrians or anyone else had any doubt about Sadats deter­mination to chart a separate course for himself and his country, these doubts were to be dispelled in 1975 when Sadat signed on to a plan presented by the American secretary of state, Henry Kis­singer, in which the Israelis would pull back from their positions on the Suez Canal in return for an Egyptian renunciation of the use of force against Israel. The arrangement undoubtedly served Egypts interests, for it allowed Egypt to reopen the Canal, and to regain the oil .elds in Abu Rudeis. But it could not have escaped Sadats notice that the plan was not short of a disaster for the Arab cause because it took Egypt out of the Arab-Israeli con.ict, thus not only neutralizing the most powerful Arab country, but also closing the book forever on Israels geostrategic nightmare of .ghting on two fronts. The incensed Syrians berated Sadat, accus­ ing him of abandoning the Arab cause. With not so much as batting an eyelid, Sadat unequivocally asserted that his responsibility was to Egypt.36 By nowit had become painfully obvious, writes Pat­rick Seale, that Egypts pan-Arab phase, which had begun twenty years earlier, was over . . . Sadats ideological somersault was so complete that it seemed a sort of anti-Suez, setting in reverse ev­erything Nasser had stood for.37 Sadats agreement to Kissingers plan manifestly illustrated his espousal of Egyptian wataniya at the expense of Arab qawmiya.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果叙利亚人或其他任何人对萨达特为自己和国家制定单独路线的决心有任何怀疑，那么这些疑虑将在 1975 年被打消，当时萨达特签署了美国国务卿亨利·基辛格提出的一项计划，其中以色列人将从苏伊士运河上的阵地撤出，以换取埃及放弃对以色列使用武力。这一安排无疑符合埃及的利益，因为它允许埃及重新开放运河，并重新获得阿布鲁代斯的石油资源。但它无法逃脱萨达特的注意，该计划对阿拉伯事业来说不乏一场灾难，因为它将埃及从阿拉伯-以色列的冲突中拉了出来，从而不仅压制了最强大的阿拉伯国家，而且永远结束了以色列在两条战线上进行地缘战略噩梦的书。愤怒的叙利亚人斥责萨达特，指责他放弃了阿拉伯事业。萨达特没有眨一下眼皮，就毫不含糊地断言，他的责任是对埃及的。36 帕特里克·西尔写道，到现在为止，埃及的泛阿拉伯阶段已经结束了，二十年前就已经结束了......萨达特的意识形态翻筋斗是如此彻底，以至于它似乎是一种反苏伊士，颠倒了纳赛尔所代表的一切。37 萨达特同意基辛格的计划清楚地表明他以牺牲阿拉伯卡米亚为代价来支持埃及的 wataniya。

content_units.text: Mohamed Heikal, The Road to Ramadan (London: Collins, 1975), p. 231; see also Seale, Asad: The Struggle for the Middle East, pp. 219220.
Seale, Asad: The Struggle for the Middle East, p. 221.
Heikal, The Road to Ramadan, pp. 238240.

Sadat was on a roll, a wataniya roll, so to speak. He nowthought simply and almost exclusively of Egypts interests, especially of al­leviating the considerable social and economic problems that had beset the country through many years of economic stagnation, which he fervently believed were brought about by costly forays into Arab politics and debilitating wars with Israel. Since the Octo­ber War, he had gradually and successfully reoriented Egypts poli­cies and concerns away from the Arab world. He now had to deal with the perennial problem of Israel. He needed to move Egyptian-Israeli relations to a point where peace was realizable, regardless of developments on the wider Arab arena. To do this, he had to break what he called the psychological barrier, the wall of fear and mistrust built on thirty years of wars and con.icts between Arab and Jew. He needed a gesture of peace that would be grand in its scope and climactic in its impact. He thus resolved to take his plea for peace into the very heart of Israel, to Jerusalem no less. If his move were to eventually bring peace to the other Arabs, then that would be a welcome bonus, the icing on the cake. But it was mainly to serve Egypts interests that he undertook his electrify­ingly dramatic trip to Israel in December 1977. As much as that trip delighted Israelis and Westerners, it stunned Arabs into doleful disbelief. And the Arabs general disposition did not improve when the Jerusalem trip was followed by the Camp David Accord in the fall of 1978, and .nally with the Israeli-Egyptian Peace Treaty in the spring of 1979.38 This triggered an immediate diplomatic break with the rest of the Arab countries. And Egypt, once the heart and center of Arab politics nowresided at its extreme periphery.
content_units.azure_translation: 萨达特正在滚动，可以这么说，是一个 wataniya 滚动。他现在只考虑埃及的利益，特别是缓解多年来经济停滞困扰该国的重大社会和经济问题，他热切地认为，这些问题是由代价高昂的阿拉伯政治进军和与以色列的衰弱战争造成的。自十月战争以来，他逐渐成功地将埃及的政策和关切从阿拉伯世界重新定位。他现在必须处理以色列长期存在的问题。他需要将埃及-以色列关系推向一个可以实现和平的地步，而不管更广泛的阿拉伯舞台上的事态发展如何。为此，他必须打破他所谓的心理障碍，即建立在阿拉伯人和犹太人之间三十年战争和冲突之上的恐惧和不信任之墙。他需要一种和平的姿态，这种姿态的范围是宏大的，影响是高潮的。因此，他决心将他对和平的恳求带到以色列的心脏地带，同样带到耶路撒冷。如果他的举动最终能给其他阿拉伯人带来和平，那么那将是一个受欢迎的奖励，锦上添花。但主要是为了服务于埃及的利益，他在 1977 年 12 月进行了令人振奋的戏剧性以色列之行。尽管那次旅行让以色列人和西方人感到高兴，但它却让阿拉伯人感到震惊，难以置信。当耶路撒冷之行之后，1978年秋天达成了戴维营协议，1979年春天又签署了以色列-埃及和平条约，38 这引发了与其他阿拉伯国家的外交决裂，阿拉伯人的总体性格并没有改善。而埃及，曾经是阿拉伯政治的心脏和中心，现在却位于其极端边缘。

content_units.text: Times (London), September 10, 1975. 37 Seale, Asad of Syria, p. 261.

Arab condemnation of Egypts action was universal, both at the popular and elite levels. Almost everyone in the Arab world, it seems, sawthe peace treaty as a betrayal of fundamental Palestin­ian and Arab rights, and Sadats assurance that he had not signed a separate peace treaty, but one that also catered to Palestinian interests, was met with universal Arab derision. In a sense, Arab fury re.ected the growing awareness that what drove Arab politi­cal issues were state interests, and broader Arab concerns tran­scending state boundaries took a backseat, or worse were left be­hind somewhere on the road. What Sadat was able to accomplish, no other Arab leader would have dared to even contemplate a de­cade earlier.39 His action might have been the work of an authori­tarian leader, but there can be little doubt that, in spite of some opposition, there was general support in Egypt for ending the state of belligerency with Israel and redirecting the governments ener­gies to the immense challenges on the home front. He (Sadat) was particularly thick skinned when it came to Arab nationalist causes, writes Michael Barnett in explaining the peace treaty with Israel, and Egyptian society was drifting toward a more Egypt-centered viewof Arab politics and thus was more receptive to his policies.40 And even though the other Arab states condemned Egypts statist policies, arguing for all Arab foreign policies to remain within the general parameters of Arab consensus, the heated debate itself suggested a sensitivity to the concept of wat­aniya among Arab countries. It was not Egypts decision to pursue its national interest that they were angry about, it was Sadats pen­chant to go it alone, not to consult with them, to treat them with an indifference bordering on contempt. Even an understanding Arab leader such as King Husayn would recount the whole episode with more than a passing annoyance:
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯人对埃及行动的谴责是普遍的，无论是在民众层面还是精英层面。阿拉伯世界几乎所有人似乎都认为和平条约是对巴勒斯坦和阿拉伯基本权利的背叛，萨达特保证他没有签署单独的和平条约，但也符合巴勒斯坦利益的和平条约遭到了阿拉伯人的普遍嘲笑。从某种意义上说，阿拉伯人的愤怒重新唤起了人们日益增长的意识，即推动阿拉伯政治问题的是国家利益，而超越国家边界的更广泛的阿拉伯问题却退居二线，或者更糟糕的是，他们被抛在了路上的某个地方。萨达特能够取得的成就，在十年前，其他阿拉伯领导人都不敢考虑。39 他的行动可能是一位独裁领导人所为，但毫无疑问，尽管有一些反对意见，但埃及普遍支持结束与以色列的交战状态，并将政府的精力转移到国内战线的巨大挑战上。迈克尔·巴尼特（Michael Barnett）在解释与以色列的和平条约时写道，他（萨达特）在阿拉伯民族主义事业上脸皮特别厚，埃及社会正在向更加以埃及为中心的阿拉伯政治观点倾斜，因此更容易接受他的政策。40 尽管其他阿拉伯国家谴责埃及的国家主义政策，主张所有阿拉伯外交政策都应保持在阿拉伯共识的一般范围内，但激烈的辩论本身表明阿拉伯国家对 wataniya 概念的敏感性。他们愤怒的不是埃及追求国家利益的决定，而是萨达特人喜欢单打独斗，不与他们协商，以近乎蔑视的冷漠态度对待他们。即使是像侯赛因国王这样善解人意的阿拉伯领导人也会带着一时的恼怒来讲述整个事件：

content_units.text: By far the most authoritative account of the political journey that eventually led to the Egyptian-Israeli peace treaty is William B. Quandt, Camp David: Peacemaking and Politics (Washington, D.C.: The Brookings Institution, 1986).

The exception of course was al-Habib Bourguiba, the popular and populist leader of Tunisia, who suggested in 1965 that Arabs would do well to think about the possibility of negotiations with Israel with a view to concluding a lasting peace. Even though Tunisia was geographically and politically peripheral to central Arab concerns, Bourguibas statements elicited a venomous tirade from Egypts propaganda organs, and Nasir called the Tunisian leader an Arab setback and an agent for imperialism and Zionism. See al-Jumhuriya al-Arabiya al-Muttahida, Majmouat Khutab wa Tasrihat wa Bayanat al-Rayis Gamal Abd al-Nasir (The collection of the speeches, statements and communique´s of President Gamal Abd al-Nasir) (Cairo: Maslahat al-Istilamat, n.d.), p. 368. The result was that Bour­guiba was virtually ostracized from Arab politics until the Six Day War, when Tunisia dis­patched a small .ghting force to Egypt. Bourguiba obviously had learned his lesson because in the Khartoum Summit, he was a signatory to a resolution that bound all Arab states to a policy of no recognition of Israel.

I was very angry. I really was upset about it.... Before [Sadat] went on this venture, we had been working with President Carter on the idea of a summit meeting in Geneva with all the countries concerned together with the Americans and Soviets.... Sadats move shocked me, especially against a background of Nassers [promise not to] move on his own with Israel until he could make up for the damage he caused Jordan in that unrealistic and terrible 1967 War. Sadat was the exact opposite.... Yet I went and saw him. I said .ne. And he went to Washington and I called him there.... And then I was on my way back and as we passed through Spain, the Camp David Accords were signed. So we were never a part of it in Jordan, and the Camp David Accords imposed on us in Jordan a role that we had not been consulted about, of essentially providing security in the West Bank, with joint patrols and this and that and the other but without even having a say in it. And that is where we couldnt take it.41
content_units.azure_translation: 我非常生气。我真的对此感到不安......在[萨达特]开始这项冒险之前，我们一直在与卡特总统合作，讨论在日内瓦与所有有关国家以及美国和苏联举行首脑会议的想法。萨达特的举动让我感到震惊，尤其是在纳赛尔[承诺不]单独与以色列行动的背景下，直到他能够弥补他在 1967 年那场不切实际和可怕的战争中对约旦造成的损害。萨达特恰恰相反......然而我去见了他。我说 .ne。他去了华盛顿，我把他叫到了那里......然后我在回来的路上，当我们经过西班牙时，戴维营协议签署了。因此，我们在约旦从未参与过，戴维营协议在约旦强加给我们一个没有被征求过我们意见的角色，即基本上在约旦河西岸提供安全，进行联合巡逻，这样那样，甚至没有发言权。这就是我们无法接受的地方41。

content_units.text: So the displeasure of Arab rulers and governments was aimed more at Sadats methods and less at Egypts pursuit of its national inter­ests. After all, some of the most ardent of Sadats critics had them­selves pursued, or shortly were about to pursue, policies that smacked more of wataniya than qawmiya.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，阿拉伯统治者和政府的不满更多地针对萨达特的方法，而不是埃及追求其国家利益。毕竟，一些最热心的萨达特批评者自己已经奉行或即将推行的政策，这些政策更像是瓦塔尼亚而不是卡夫米亚的味道。

content_units.text: Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, pp. 197198. 41 King Husayns interviewwith Avi Shlaim in New York Review of Books, July 15, 1999, pp. 1718.

Syrias military intervention in Lebanon in 1976 was a case in point. The essence of Lebanons political system was derived from an understanding reached in 1943 among the countrys various religious sects in which political and administrative posts were dis­tributed in proportion to their numbers in the population.42 This potentially volatile confessional system worked as long as Leba­non was not subject to outside intrusions. But, the growing po­tency of Nasirist Arab nationalism began to strain the fragile com­munal ties inside Lebanon, which reached a breaking point with the radicalization of the Palestinian Resistance after June 1967.
