Palestinian military operations were launched from bases in the south of Lebanon, and after the guerrillas expulsion from Jordan in 19701971, the south of Lebanon became their only military / strategic haven. The majority of Lebanese Muslims felt that Leba­non was duty-bound to extend all possible support to the Palestin­ians, whereas most Christians resented what they perceived to be an inexcusable infringement of Lebanese sovereignty by the Pales­tinians. This attitudinal divide was reinforced by Israels an­nounced policy of instant and punitive retaliation against coun­tries harboring Palestinian guerrillas. Israels shelling of border villages and incursions into Lebanese territory became a regular occurrence, so that over the next fewyears, many villages in South Lebanon were gradually deserted by their inhabitants, most of whom took up residence on the outskirts of Lebanons capital, Beirut, in ghetto-type shantytowns. By 1975, the combination of Israeli attacks on Lebanon, the Palestinian-induced anarchy, and the extensive widespread demographic dislocations left Lebanon sitting on a powder keg waiting to explode. It came as no surprise therefore that a bloody and debilitating civil war would erupt and last for the next decade and a half.
content_units.azure_translation: 1976年叙利亚对黎巴嫩的军事干预就是一个典型的例子。黎巴嫩政治制度的本质源于1943年各国不同宗教教派达成的谅解，其中政治和行政职位按其人口人数比例分配。42 只要黎巴嫩不受外部入侵，这种潜在不稳定的忏悔制度就会发挥作用。但是，纳西尔主义阿拉伯民族主义的日益强大开始使黎巴嫩国内脆弱的社区联系紧张，随着 1967 年 6 月后巴勒斯坦抵抗运动的激进化，黎巴嫩国内的社区联系达到了崩溃点。巴勒斯坦的军事行动是从黎巴嫩南部的基地发起的，在19701971年游击队被驱逐出约旦后，黎巴嫩南部成为他们唯一的军事/战略避风港。大多数黎巴嫩穆斯林认为，黎巴嫩有义务向巴勒斯坦人提供一切可能的支持，而大多数基督徒则对他们认为巴勒斯坦人对黎巴嫩主权的不可原谅的侵犯感到不满。以色列宣布对窝藏巴勒斯坦游击队的国家进行即时惩罚性报复的政策加剧了这种态度分歧。以色列炮击边境村庄和入侵黎巴嫩领土成为常态，因此在接下来的几年里，黎巴嫩南部的许多村庄逐渐被居民遗弃，其中大多数人定居在黎巴嫩首都贝鲁特郊区的贫民窟式棚户区。到 1975 年，以色列对黎巴嫩的袭击、巴勒斯坦引发的无政府状态以及广泛广泛的人口错位相结合，使黎巴嫩坐在等待爆炸的火药桶上。因此，一场血腥和令人衰弱的内战爆发并持续未来十五年也就不足为奇了。

content_units.text: When Syria sent its military forces across the border into Leba­non in 1976, the political leadership in Damascus insisted that the action was motivated by Arab nationalist considerations. The confessional con.ict in Lebanon between Christians and Muslims in which the Palestinians participated was seen in Syria as dividing the Arab nation [and] undermining the principles of Arab national­ism.43 Every effort had to be made to put an end to the sectarian killings for the sake of the Arab cause and the Arab nation.44 And these sentiments were in fact to be expected from a country that characterized itself as the beating heart of Arabism, and that was ruled by the virulently Arab nationalist Bath Party. These themes were touched on by the Syrian president, Ha.z al-Asad, in a major speech delivered after Syrian armor moved into Lebanon. Enumerating the reasons for Syrias military intervention, Asad was unequivocal: The problem in Lebanon concerns the Arab na­tion, so it is in consequence an internal Arab problem. He added that it was on behalf of the Arab nation that Syria had inter­vened, for if the bloodshed among Arabs was to be allowed then it would have led to many negative repercussions within the Arab homeland, repercussions that could affect the Arab national con­sciousness.45 Yet outside of Syria, fewtook Asads reasoning at its face value, inclined to believe instead that the reason for the military intervention had more to do with Syrias national interest and its hegemonic attitude toward Lebanon.
content_units.azure_translation: 1976年，叙利亚派遣军队越过边境进入黎巴嫩时，大马士革的政治领导层坚称，这一行动是出于阿拉伯民族主义的考虑。巴勒斯坦人参与的黎巴嫩基督徒和穆斯林之间的忏悔冲突在叙利亚被视为分裂阿拉伯民族，[并]破坏了阿拉伯民族主义的原则。43 为了阿拉伯事业和阿拉伯民族，必须尽一切努力结束宗派杀戮。44 事实上，这些情绪是从一个自称为阿拉伯主义跳动心脏的国家所预料到的，而且这个国家由恶毒的阿拉伯民族主义巴斯党统治。叙利亚总统哈兹·阿萨德在叙利亚装甲部队进入黎巴嫩后发表的重要讲话中谈到了这些主题。阿萨德列举了叙利亚军事干预的原因，毫不含糊地说：黎巴嫩的问题关系到阿拉伯民族，因此它最终是一个阿拉伯内部问题。他补充说，叙利亚是代表阿拉伯民族进行干预的，因为如果允许阿拉伯人之间的流血事件，那么它将在阿拉伯本土内产生许多负面影响，这些影响可能会影响阿拉伯人的民族意识。45 然而，在叙利亚以外，很少有人相信阿萨德的推理表面价值，而是倾向于相信军事干预的原因更多地与叙利亚的国家利益及其对黎巴嫩的霸权态度有关。

content_units.text: For excellent analyses of the structure of Lebanons political system, see Michael Hud­son, The Precarious Republic: Modernization in Lebanon (NewYork: Random House, 1968) and Leonard Binder, ed., Politics in Lebanon (NewYork: John Wiley, 1966).

And Syria indeed had a problem explaining away the target of its initial military thrust. It was not the supposed anti-Arab na­tionalist Lebanese Christians, who had persistently and vigor­ously defended Lebanese sovereignty against what they perceived as a Muslim-dominated Arab unity; rather, Syrian military might was directed against the Muslim nationalists and their allies the Palestinians. Arab nationalists would understandably wonder aloud howit was that Syria, the beating heart of Arabism, could have joined forces with the Christian isolationists against its Arab nationalist tradition.46 Others were less nuanced. Asads main backers, the Soviet leaders insisted that he end his assault on the Palestinians and the Lebanese Muslims, otherwise the imperialists and their collaborators will be able to bring the Arab people and the areas progressive movements under their control.47 At the op­posite spectrum, the Israeli prime minister, Yitzhaq Rabin, not known for his avid support of Arab nationalism, gleefully gave the Syrians Israels full blessing for killing Palestinian terrorists.48 The Arabs were uniformly dismissive of Syrias claims to have acted on behalf of the Arab nation, demanding the complete with­drawal of Syrias invading forces. Anti-Syrian demonstrations oc­curred in front of Syrian embassies in Arab and other foreign capi­tals. The rival Bathist regime in Baghdad bitterly attacked the fascist ruling clique in Damascus for this hideous crime against the Arab people of Palestine,49 and in a blaze of publicity dispatched troops to the Syrian-Iraqi border to execute their historic duty.50 By nature less shrill than their colleagues north of the border, mem­bers of the Saudi media re.ected their kings displeasure with what was happening in Lebanon.51 Egypt promptly withdrew its diplo­matic mission from Damascus and asked the Syrians to close their embassy in Cairo. To cap it all, the PLO leader, Yasir Arafat, bit­terly denounced Asad, and called for an all-out war against Damas­cus. And generally Arabs agreed, for after all, here was Ha.z al-Asad, the self-proclaimed lion of Arabism . . . slaughtering Arab­isms sacred cow.52 In short, most Arabs believed that far from serving the interests of the Arab nation, the Syrian operation was undertaken at best to achieve Syrias national security inter­ ests, and at worst to realize its irredentist proclivities and hege­monic attitudes.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚确实在解释其最初军事推进的目标方面遇到了问题。不是所谓的反阿拉伯民族主义黎巴嫩基督徒，他们坚持不懈地、大力捍卫黎巴嫩的主权，反对他们认为的穆斯林主导的阿拉伯团结;相反，叙利亚的军事力量是针对穆斯林民族主义者及其盟友巴勒斯坦人的。可以理解的是，阿拉伯民族主义者会大声想知道，叙利亚作为阿拉伯主义的心脏，怎么可能与基督教孤立主义者联手反对其阿拉伯民族主义传统。46 其他人则不那么细致入微。阿萨德的主要支持者，苏联领导人坚持要求他停止对巴勒斯坦人和黎巴嫩穆斯林的攻击，否则帝国主义及其合作者将能够将阿拉伯人民和该地区的进步运动置于他们的控制之下。47 与此相反的是，以色列总理伊扎克·拉宾（Yitzhaq Rabin）并不以狂热支持阿拉伯民族主义而闻名，他兴高采烈地对叙利亚人以色列杀死巴勒斯坦恐怖分子给予了充分的祝福。48 阿拉伯人一致对叙利亚声称代表阿拉伯民族采取行动、要求叙利亚入侵部队完全撤出的说法不屑一顾。反叙利亚示威活动发生在叙利亚驻阿拉伯和其他外国首都的大使馆前。巴格达的敌对巴斯主义政权猛烈抨击了大马士革的法西斯统治集团，因为他们犯下了对巴勒斯坦阿拉伯人民的可怕罪行，49 并在大肆宣传中向叙利亚-伊拉克边境派遣了军队，以履行他们的历史性职责。50 沙特媒体成员的天性不如边境以北的同事尖锐，因此重申了他们的国王对黎巴嫩正在发生的事情的不满。51 埃及立即从大马士革撤出外交使团，并要求叙利亚人关闭他们在开罗的大使馆。最重要的是，巴解组织领导人亚西尔·阿拉法特（Yasir Arafat）严厉谴责了阿萨德，并呼吁对大马士革发动全面战争。阿拉伯人普遍同意，因为毕竟这里是哈兹·阿萨德，自称是阿拉伯主义的狮子......屠宰阿拉伯教的神圣牛。52 简而言之，大多数阿拉伯人认为，叙利亚行动远非为阿拉伯民族的利益服务，充其量是为了实现叙利亚的国家安全，最坏的情况是实现其不可逆转的倾向和霸权态度。

content_units.text: Al-Bath (Damascus), April 1, 1976.
Al-Bath (Damascus), September 23, 1975.

President Ha.z al-Asad, Speech Delivered Before a General Plenum of Local Govern­ment, July 20, 1976 (Damascus: Baath Arab Socialist Party, 1976), pp. 4548, pp. 7576; see also Adeed I. Dawisha, Syria and the Lebanese Crisis (London: Macmillan, 1980), pp. 104105.
This was how Salah Bitar, one of the founders of the Bath Party who lived in exile in Paris, framed the question in a Le Monde article, quoted in Seale, Asad of Syria, pp. 285 286.
Guardian (London), October 3, 1976.
Quoted in Seale, Asad of Syria, p. 285.
Al-Thawra (Baghdad), June 2, 1976; the same venomous tone was reproduced in all Iraqi newspapers, radio, and television, all of which, of course, were government controlled.
Al-Thawra (Baghdad), June 9, 1976.
SWB, June 4, 1976, pp. 89.
Seale, Asad of Syria, p. 285.

If Syrias intervention in Lebanon re.ected the countrys particu­laristic state interests, then perhaps the military operation could best be explained not so much in terms of Syrias imperialist atti­tudes,53 but by the way the leadership de.ned the countrys security interests and its demographic structure. Asad and the Syrian leader­ship believed that the Lebanese civil war would provide Israel with the excuse to intervene in Lebanon allegedly to save the Christians from the Muslim Arabs. Asad further suspected that once in Leb­anon, the Israelis would turn their attention to the real target of their ambition, Syria. It was for this reason that Damascus reiter­ated repeatedly that the security of Syria was inseparable from that of Lebanon.54 And this fear of Israeli per.dy certainly would explain why Syria sent its armed forces to the rescue of Lebanons Chris­tians against its natural allies, the Muslim-Palestinian alliance.
content_units.azure_translation: 如果叙利亚对黎巴嫩的干预重新满足了该国的特殊国家利益，那么也许军事行动最好地解释不是叙利亚帝国主义的态度，53 而是领导层对国家安全利益及其人口结构的重视。阿萨德和叙利亚领导层认为，黎巴嫩内战将为以色列提供干预黎巴嫩的借口，据称是为了从穆斯林阿拉伯人手中拯救基督徒。阿萨德进一步怀疑，一旦进入黎巴嫩，以色列人就会将注意力转向他们野心的真正目标——叙利亚。正是出于这个原因，大马士革一再重申叙利亚的安全与黎巴嫩的安全密不可分。54 这种对以色列人的恐惧当然可以解释为什么叙利亚派遣武装部队去营救黎巴嫩基督徒，对抗其天然盟友穆斯林-巴勒斯坦联盟。

content_units.text: The other likely reason for Syrias haste to intervene in Lebanon was the sectarian structure of its own demographic makeup. Al­though Sunni Muslims formed about 65 percent of the population, the bulk of the ruling elite, including Asad, belonged to the Ala­wite sect, an esoteric offshoot of Shiism. Representing little more than 11 percent of the population, the Alawites were bound to engender deep Sunni resentment of their political dominance. Be­yond this primary .ssure, other smaller, yet politically and econom­ically signi.cant, communities, such as the Druze, Christians, and Kurds, added to the countrys societal heterogeneity.55 Given Leba­nons geographic, historic, and cultural proximity to Syria,56 it was in Syrias interests to put the lid on any confessional eruption in Lebanon, lest it spill over into Syrias own fragile demographic structure. In any case, whether motivated by hegemonic ambitions, or whether induced by fears over security and / or demographic vulnerabilities, the intervention of Syria, the beating heart of Ar­abism, in Lebanon was undertaken to achieve primarily Syrian national interests against the protestations of literally the whole of the Arab world.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚急于干预黎巴嫩的另一个可能原因是其自身人口构成的宗派结构。尽管逊尼派穆斯林约占人口的 65%，但包括阿萨德在内的大部分统治精英都属于什叶派的一个深奥分支阿拉维派。阿拉维派占人口的 11% 多一点，势必会引起逊尼派对其政治统治地位的深深不满。除了这个主要的 .sure 之外，其他规模较小但在政治和经济上具有重要意义的社区，如德鲁兹人、基督徒和库尔德人，也增加了这些国家的社会异质性。55 鉴于黎巴嫩在地理、历史和文化上与叙利亚很近，56 阻止黎巴嫩的任何忏悔爆发符合叙利亚的利益，以免它蔓延到叙利亚脆弱的人口结构中。无论如何，无论是出于霸权野心，还是出于对安全和/或人口脆弱性的担忧，阿拉伯主义跳动的心脏叙利亚对黎巴嫩的干预主要是为了实现叙利亚的国家利益，以对抗整个阿拉伯世界的抗议。

content_units.text: In reviewing the maladies suffered by Syria as a result of its Lebanese operation, Asad bitterly remarked: we did not go into Lebanon to achieve any regional ambitions, nor for any sel.sh or opportunistic motives. On the contrary, it was at the expense of our economy and our daily bread. Events (London), October 1, 1976, p. 20.
For example, SWB, June 28, 1975, p. 7; al-Bath (Damascus), September 23, 1975; Asad, Speech Delivered Before a General Plenum of Local Government, pp. 1416.
See Dawisha, Syria and the Lebanese Crisis,p.59.

Most Syrians believed that Lebanon was part of the historic notion of Greater Syria, and that the political division of the two countries was arti.cially created by the French to serve their own colonial interests. Regardless of the historic validity of this claim, Syrians fervently believe it to be true.

And so by the 1980s, the idea of the sovereignty of the Arab state had become institutionalized not just in the rules of the game that governed political relations within the Arab world, but also, and more crucially, in the very consciousness of the Arab public, rulers and subjects alike. FewArabs in the 1980s and 1990s thought about Arab nationalism in the same way an earlier generation had done in the pre-1967 period. Whereas in those days Arab national­ism was synonymous with Arab political unity, now it had turned into a kind of universalist concept, a cultural Arabism with certain political overtones in the sense that it provided an umbrella under which sovereign territorial states were expected to conduct their business. In the 1980s and 1990s even this modest expectation proved too dif.cult to realize. One reason for this was the lack of popular pressure on leaders to conform to the strict norms of Arab nationalism. People had accepted the resilience of their states, had been co-opted into the body politics, and had become .rst and fore­most citizens of their respective states, even if they happened to harbor little love for the regime. While, as a cultural group, the Arabic-speaking people were aware of the many bonds that brought them together, they nowalso accepted the segmentations within the Arab world,57 demarcations that predicated on notions of citizen­ship, economic interest, territoriality, and increasingly, identity.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，到了1980年代，阿拉伯国家主权的观念不仅在支配阿拉伯世界内部政治关系的游戏规则中制度化，而且更重要的是，在阿拉伯公众、统治者和臣民的意识中也已经制度化。1980 年代和 1990 年代，很少有阿拉伯人以与 1967 年之前的一代人相同的方式思考阿拉伯民族主义。在当时，阿拉伯民族主义是阿拉伯政治统一的代名词，而现在它已经变成了一种普遍主义概念，一种具有某些政治色彩的文化阿拉伯主义，因为它提供了一个保护伞，主权领土国家应该在保护伞下开展业务。在 1980 年代和 1990 年代，即使是这种适度的期望也被证明是太过分了，无法实现。造成这种情况的原因之一是缺乏民众对领导人遵守阿拉伯民族主义严格规范的压力。人们已经接受了他们所在国家的复原力，被纳入了政治机构，并成为各自国家的第一个公民，即使他们碰巧对这个政权没有什么爱。虽然作为一个文化群体，讲阿拉伯语的人们意识到将他们聚集在一起的许多纽带，但他们现在也接受了阿拉伯世界内部的分裂，57 基于公民身份、经济利益、领土和日益增长的身份概念的划界。

content_units.text: It was not that most people no longer considered themselves to be Arab, it was simply that the bonds of Arab nationalism no longer exercised the same hold on the Arab psyche that they did two or three decades earlier. When Israel invaded Lebanon in the summer of 1982, there certainly was great concern in the Arab world, but there was also a stunning paucity of popular eruptions in Arab cities. Compare this with the pervasive demonstrations, riots, and mini-rebellions in various Arab states that accompanied the tripartite attack on Egypt in 1956. Between 1980 and 1988, Arab Iraq fought a debilitating war against Persian Iran, yet few Arabs cared, and some were in fact hostile. Syrias Asad passion­ately detested Iraqs leader Saddam Husayn, and as such supported Iran unreservedly. This was bound to raise eyebrows, as Syria took great pride in projecting itself as the heart of Arabism.
content_units.azure_translation: 这并不是说大多数人不再认为自己是阿拉伯人，而只是阿拉伯民族主义的纽带不再像二三十年前那样对阿拉伯人的心理产生同样的影响。当以色列在 1982 年夏天入侵黎巴嫩时，阿拉伯世界当然引起了极大的担忧，但阿拉伯城市的民众火山喷发也惊人地少。将此与 1956 年三方袭击埃及后，各个阿拉伯国家普遍存在的示威、骚乱和小型叛乱进行比较。1980年至1988年间，阿拉伯伊拉克对波斯伊朗进行了一场令人衰弱的战争，但很少有阿拉伯人关心，有些人实际上是敌对的。叙利亚·阿萨德强烈厌恶伊拉克领导人萨达姆·侯赛因，因此毫无保留地支持伊朗。这必然会引起人们的注意，因为叙利亚以将自己定位为阿拉伯主义的中心而感到自豪。

content_units.text: See Ghassan Salames excellent analysis in Inter-Arab Politics: The Return of Geogra­phy, in The Middle East: Ten Years After Camp David, ed. William B. Quandt (Washing­ton, D.C.: The Brookings Institution, 1988), pp. 319353.

But people did not dwell on Syrias support for Iran too long. After all, Syria was a sovereign state with a right to pursue its inter­ests and de.ne its international relations. Nationalist Libya, too, was hardly a paragon of support for the Iraqis. Depending on the mood of its mercurial leader, Muamer al-Qadha., Libyas political bearing continued to oscillate wildly between the two warring par­ties. From others there were words of support, but precious little else. Iraq did receive money from the oil-rich Gulf states, but that was more to bolster Iraq as a security shield for themselves against the messianic vagaries of the Iranian ayatollahs than to any attach­ment to Arab nationalism. On the popular level, Iraq trumpeted the in.owof Arab volunteers into its armed forces to .ght the Persian common enemy. Most of these volunteers, however, were Egyptians and Sudanese who had arrived in Iraq in large num­bers in the 1970s seeking employment, and were drafted in the army by the Iraqi authorities. In reality, there were probably less real volunteers from Arab countries helping Arab Iraq in its war effort (which at times, particularly 19821983 and 1986 1987, was pretty desperate) than those who participated in non-Arab Afghanistans war against the Soviet Union. Naturally Islam had something to do with this, but that was precisely the measure of the decline of Arab nationalism against other competitive identi­ties. Indeed, the only genuine popular eruption in the Arab world after the 1970s occurred in Palestinian occupied territories in the late 1980s, and it had very little, if anything, to do with Arab na­tionalism. It was wholly Palestinian inspired, built on purely Pales­tinian concerns, and carrying exclusively Palestinian aspirations.
content_units.azure_translation: 但人们并没有纠缠于叙利亚对伊朗的支持太久。毕竟，叙利亚是一个主权国家，有权追求自己的利益，de.ne 自己的国际关系。民族主义的利比亚也很难成为支持伊拉克人的典范。根据其善变的领导人穆阿梅尔·卡扎的情绪，利比亚的政治地位继续在两个交战各方之间剧烈波动。其他人有支持的话，但除此之外就很少了。伊拉克确实从石油资源丰富的海湾国家那里获得了资金，但这更多的是为了支持伊拉克，将其作为自己的安全盾牌，抵御伊朗阿亚图拉的弥赛亚变幻莫测，而不是对阿拉伯民族主义的任何依恋。在民众层面上，伊拉克大肆宣扬大量阿拉伯志愿军加入其武装部队，以打击波斯的共同敌人。然而，这些志愿者大多是埃及人和苏丹人，他们在 1970 年代大量抵达伊拉克寻求工作，并被伊拉克当局征召入伍。实际上，与那些参加非阿拉伯阿富汗对苏联战争的人相比，来自阿拉伯国家帮助阿拉伯伊拉克进行战争的真正志愿者可能更少（有时，特别是19821983和 1986 年至 1987 年，这是相当绝望的）。伊斯兰教自然与此有关，但这恰恰是阿拉伯民族主义相对于其他竞争身份的衰落的衡量标准。事实上，1970年代后阿拉伯世界唯一一次真正的民众爆发发生在1980年代后期的巴勒斯坦被占领土上，它与阿拉伯民族主义几乎没有关系。它完全是受巴勒斯坦人的启发，建立在纯粹的巴勒斯坦关切之上，完全承载着巴勒斯坦人的愿望。

content_units.text: Of course, the status-quo Arab kings and presidents had been leading the charge away from revolutionary Arab nationalism. But even those Arab leaders who had been the most ardent Arab na­tionalists, believing in the inseparability of the Arab homeland, were themselves undergoing an attitudinal transformation. Ha.z al-Asad, the committed Bathist since his teenage years, was now talking about state sovereignty and independence. Referring to Lebanon, the one country that Syrians perceived as the most natu­ral candidate for unity with Syria, Asad con.ded as a matter-of­fact that Syrians and Lebanese may be one people, but we are two states.58 Even a more startling transformation occurred to that other erstwhile Bathist, Iraqs Saddam Husayn.
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，维持现状的阿拉伯国王和总统一直在带头远离革命的阿拉伯民族主义。但即使是那些曾经是最热心的阿拉伯民族主义者，相信阿拉伯家园不可分割的阿拉伯领导人，他们自己也正在经历态度的转变。哈兹·阿萨德 （Ha.z al-Asad） 从十几岁起就一直是虔诚的巴斯主义者，现在他正在谈论国家主权和独立。在谈到黎巴嫩时，叙利亚人认为是与叙利亚统一的最自然候选国，阿萨德认为叙利亚人和黎巴嫩人可能是一个民族，但我们是两个国家。58 更令人震惊的转变发生在另一位昔日的巴斯主义者伊拉克人萨达姆·侯赛因身上。

content_units.text: In the late 1970s and early 1980s Iraq, under brisk presidential prompting, began to actively tap into its long history, exploring the rich heritage that predated the countrys Arab / Islamic identity. This found vigorous expression in literature, arts, and architecture, and had the effect of fostering national pride in the countrys long and distinguished history.59 These conveyors of popular culture would refer to the inhabitants of such ancient civilizations as Baby­lonia, Akkadia, Assyria, and Sumeria as Iraqi men and women, as our grandfathers, and great ancestors.60 The message that was conveyed, with the undoubted blessings, even instigation, of Saddam was this: while partaking in the encompassing Arab cul­ture and political arrangements, Iraq still boasted a unique identity which emerged from an illustrious, multi-civilization history, and which consequently gave the country a sense of distinctiveness from, even superiority over, the other Arabs. The conclusion is ob­vious. The Iraqi state is a legitimate entity, and is simply a manifes­tation of the peoples uniqueness.
content_units.azure_translation: 在 1970 年代末和 1980 年代初，在总统的积极推动下，伊拉克开始积极利用其悠久的历史，探索早于该国阿拉伯/伊斯兰身份的丰富遗产。这在文学、艺术和建筑中得到了有力的表达，并起到了培养对这个国家悠久而杰出历史的民族自豪感的作用。59 这些流行文化的传播者将巴比伦、阿卡迪亚、亚述和苏美尔等古代文明的居民称为伊拉克男人和女人，作为我们的祖父和伟大的祖先。60 在萨达姆毫无疑问的祝福，甚至煽动下，所传达的信息是这样的：伊拉克在参与阿拉伯文化和政治安排的同时，仍然拥有独特的身份，这种身份源于辉煌的多文明历史，因此使该国有一种与众不同的感觉，甚至优于其他阿拉伯人。结论是显而易见的。伊拉克国家是一个合法实体，只是各国人民独特性的体现。

content_units.text: Quoted in Seale, Asad of Syria, p. 350.
See Amatzia Baram, Mesopotamian Identity in Bathi Iraq, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 19, (October 1983).
Ibid., p. 436.

The case for the legitimacy of the Iraqi state did not rest solely on the countrys Mesopotamian heritage. To Saddam Husayn, the long-standing Bathist and Arab unity buff, it was also a func­tion of critical psychological transformations which had occurred among the Arabs as a whole. By the 1980s, Saddam was arguing that comprehensive and organic Arab unity was no longer possible, or indeed even desirable to the newpragmatic Arabs. This newfor­mulation is encapsulated in the following statement which he made in September 1982, and which clearly conceives of Arab unity as a political solidarity among independent and separate Arab states:
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克国家合法性的理由不仅仅取决于该国的美索不达米亚遗产。对于长期的巴斯主义者和阿拉伯团结爱好者萨达姆·侯赛因来说，这也是整个阿拉伯人之间发生的关键心理转变的结果。到了 1980 年代，萨达姆认为，全面和有机的阿拉伯统一不再可能，甚至对新务实的阿拉伯人来说是不可取的。他于1982年9月发表的以下声明中概括了这一新表述，该声明清楚地将阿拉伯统一设想为独立和独立的阿拉伯国家之间的政治团结：

content_units.text: Arab unity can only take place after a clear demarcation of borders between all countries. [It] must not take place through the elimina­tion of the local and national characteristics of any Arab coun­try.... The question of linking unity to the removal of boundaries is no longer acceptable to present Arab mentality. It could have been acceptable ten or twenty years ago. We have to take into consider­ation the change which the Arab mind and psyche have undergone. We must see the world as it is. Any Arab would have wished to see the Arab nation as one state.... But these are sheer dreams. The Arab reality is that the Arabs are now twenty-two states, and we have to behave accordingly.... Unity must give strength to its part­ners, not cancel their national identity.61
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯的统一只有在所有国家之间明确划定边界之后才能实现。[它]绝不能通过消除任何阿拉伯国家的地方和民族特征来实现......将统一与消除边界联系起来的问题不再被目前的阿拉伯心态所接受。十年或二十年前，这是可以接受的。我们必须考虑到阿拉伯人的思想和心理所经历的变化。我们必须看到世界的本来面目。任何阿拉伯人都希望将阿拉伯民族视为一个国家......但这些纯粹是梦想。阿拉伯人的现实是，阿拉伯人现在有二十二个国家，我们必须采取相应的行动......团结必须赋予其伙伴力量，而不是取消他们的民族身份61。

content_units.text: And these twenty-two states were going their own separate ways, each concerned with its own national interest and with formulating policies designed to strengthen its sovereign status and enhance its internal security. If the thought of Arab political arrangements came to mind, it was only as a way of fortifying the states security against the rising challenge of a newrevolutionary movement that had stepped into the void left by the demise of Arab nationalism. In the 1980s and 1990s, radical Islam had become for the Arab regimes what Arab nationalism was in the 1950s and 1960s.
content_units.azure_translation: 这22个国家各走各的路，各自关心自己的国家利益，制定旨在加强其主权地位和加强其内部安全的政策。如果想到阿拉伯政治安排的想法，那只是为了加强国家安全，以应对新革命运动日益严峻的挑战，而新革命运动已经踏入了阿拉伯民族主义消亡留下的空白。在 1980 年代和 1990 年代，激进的伊斯兰教对阿拉伯政权来说已经成为 1950 年代和 1960 年代的阿拉伯民族主义。

content_units.text: These are excerpts from an interviewgiven by Saddam Husayn to chief editors of Ku­waiti newspapers and broadcast on Iraqi radio. This particular quote comes from Christine Moss Helms, Iraq: Eastern Flank of the Arab World (Washington, D.C.: The Brookings Institution, 1984), pp. 114115.

When Arab nationalism reigned supreme, it was able to relegate other ideas and ideologies to peripheral, even inconsequential, sta­tus. However, unlike liberal constitutionalism or Marxism, Islam could never be eradicated from peoples inner concerns; it was em­bedded in the very fabric of Arab Muslim society. On a personal level, Islam continued to constitute a crucial element of identity, but that was where it stayed; overwhelmed by Arab nationalism, it was unable to manifest itself politically. On the fewoccasions when it did, the custodians of the nationalist narrative marshaled the brutal and unforgiving power of the state to keep it at bay.
content_units.azure_translation: 当阿拉伯民族主义占据主导地位时，它能够将其他思想和意识形态降级为边缘地位，甚至无关紧要的地位。然而，与自由宪政主义或马克思主义不同，伊斯兰教永远无法从人们的内心担忧中根除;它根植于阿拉伯穆斯林社会的结构中。在个人层面上，伊斯兰教继续构成身份认同的关键要素，但这就是它停留的地方;由于被阿拉伯民族主义所淹没，它无法在政治上表现出来。在少数情况下，民族主义叙事的守护者会召集国家残酷无情的权力来阻止它。

content_units.text: With the catastrophic defeat of Arab nationalism in June 1967, radical Islamic groups became more active, more adventurous, and consequently more prominent. Their search for recruits greweasier, as people, in their search for an alternative to the increasingly dis­credited secular nationalism, reoriented their vision to the past, to Muslim esprit de corps, to an authenticity untouched by corrupting foreign values. If a spur was needed to .nally shift radical Islam from the wings to the center stage of political activity, it was pro­vided by the Iranian revolution of 19781979. Here was the irrefut­able proof of what Muslims, guided by their faith, could achieve. Here was a live demonstration of the power of Islam to put Islam in power.
content_units.azure_translation: 随着 1967 年 6 月阿拉伯民族主义的灾难性失败，激进的伊斯兰团体变得更加活跃、更具冒险精神，因此也变得更加突出。他们寻找新兵更加贪婪，因为人们在寻找一种替代日益声名狼藉的世俗民族主义的替代方案时，将他们的视野重新定位到过去，转向穆斯林的团队精神，转向不受腐败的外国价值观影响的真实性。如果说需要一种刺激来将激进伊斯兰教从侧翼转移到政治活动的中心舞台，那么19781979年的伊朗革命就提供了它。这是无可辩驳的证据，证明穆斯林在信仰的指导下能够取得什么成就。这是伊斯兰教让伊斯兰教掌权的力量的现场演示。

content_units.text: The Iranian revolution and the establishment of the Islamic Re­public of Iran gave heart to Muslim radicalism in the Arab world. In the 1980s, signi.cant challenges to the Arab states from Islamic fundamentalist movements occurred in Egypt, Syria, Iraq, Lebanon, Algeria, Tunisia, Bahrain, and, to a lesser extent, Saudi Arabia, Jor­dan, and Morocco. These groups mounted their challenge to the established Arab political order in the name of social justice and Muslim unity.62 Carrying their Islamic identity on their sleeves, they were contemptuously dismissive of modernity with its alien ideas of sovereignty and nationalism. They publicly condemned these notions as hulul mustawrada, imported ideas from the anti-Islamic
content_units.azure_translation: 伊朗革命和伊朗伊斯兰共和国的建立使阿拉伯世界的穆斯林激进主义更加振奋。在 1980 年代，伊斯兰原教旨主义运动对阿拉伯国家的重大挑战发生在埃及、叙利亚、伊拉克、黎巴嫩、阿尔及利亚、突尼斯、巴林，以及沙特阿拉伯、约旦和摩洛哥。这些团体以社会正义和穆斯林团结的名义对既定的阿拉伯政治秩序发起挑战。62 他们把他们的伊斯兰身份挂在袖子上，轻蔑地蔑视现代性及其外来的主权和民族主义观念。他们公开谴责这些观念是 hulul mustawrada，是从反伊斯兰派那里引进的思想

content_units.text: For a thorough exposition of the ideas of the Islamic radicals, see Emmanuel Sivan, Radical Islam (NewHaven, Connecticut: Yale University Press, 1991).

West, that should be unceremoniously discarded.63 To the Muslim radicals, al-Islam huwa al-hal, the only solution was Islam, and they could have added, the only permissible identity was Islamic. Arab nationalism was simply a by-product of the new jahiliya,the contemporary age of ignorance resembling that of the pre-Islamic era. The Islamist assault not only undermined further the Arab na­tionalist cause, but it also impelled the Arab state to strengthen its institutions in order to ensure its stability. The net result was an even greater emphasis on state sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 西方，这应该被毫不客气地抛弃。63 对于穆斯林激进分子，al-Islam huwa al-hal，唯一的解决办法是伊斯兰教，他们本可以补充一点，唯一允许的身份是伊斯兰教。阿拉伯民族主义只是新贾希利亚的副产品，即类似于前伊斯兰时代的无知时代。伊斯兰主义的袭击不仅进一步破坏了阿拉伯民族主义事业，而且还促使阿拉伯国家加强其机构以确保其稳定。最终结果是更加强调国家主权。

content_units.text: The primacy of the interests of the state produced a newform of regional political arrangements. Concerned about the regional repercussions of the Iranian Islamic revolution and the Iran-Iraq War, and fearing the radicalizing impact of Irans Islamic model on their populations, the Gulf states of Kuwait, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the Sultanate of Oman, and the United Arab Emirates joined together to form the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) in September 1981. Even though at .rst sight the GCC seemed to represent an intermediate step toward comprehensive Arab unity, it was in fact nothing of the sort. To begin with, it was geography, not national identity, that constituted the real foundation of this political ar­rangement. Secondly, the members of the GCC publicly spurned ideology, emphasizing instead economic and security cooperation among sovereign states. When asked why only the six Gulf states and not others, GCC representatives responded, with not so much as a hint of discomfort or incertitude, that the six GCC states shared certain historical and cultural traits that set them apart from the other Arabs.64 In a similar move, three North African states, Mo­rocco, Algeria, and Tunisia, geographically proximate and seeking economic cooperation formed the Arab Maghrebi Union.
content_units.azure_translation: 国家利益的至高无上产生了一种新的区域政治安排形式。由于担心伊朗伊斯兰革命和两伊战争的地区影响，并担心伊朗伊斯兰模式对其人民的激进影响，科威特、巴林、沙特阿拉伯、卡塔尔、阿曼苏丹国和阿拉伯联合酋长国等海湾国家于 1981 年 9 月联合成立了海湾合作委员会 （GCC）。尽管乍一看，海湾合作委员会似乎代表了朝着阿拉伯全面统一迈出的中间步骤，但实际上它根本不是这样。首先，构成这种政治安排的真正基础是地理，而不是民族认同。其次，海湾合作委员会成员国公开摒弃意识形态，转而强调主权国家之间的经济和安全合作。当被问及为什么只有六个海湾国家而不是其他国家时，海湾合作委员会的代表回答说，海湾合作委员会六个国家具有某些共同的历史和文化特征，使它们有别于其他阿拉伯国家。64 在类似的举动中，三个北非国家摩洛哥、阿尔及利亚和突尼斯， 地理上接近并寻求经济合作，形成了阿拉伯马格里比联盟。

content_units.text: Yusuf al-Qardawi, al-Hulul al-Mustawrada wa Kaifa Janat ala Ummatina (The im­ported solutions and howthey harmed our nation) (Cairo: Maktabat Wahbeh, 1977); see also Shukri B. Abed, Islam and Democracy, in Democracy, War and Peace in the Middle East, eds. David Grantham and Mark Tessler (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1995), pp. 124126.

See Barnett, Dialogues in Arab Politics, p. 201. To the question why Iraq was not invited to join, one GCC member allegedly replied: Do you see Iraqis wearing igal wa cha.ya, (the headdress usually worn by Gulf men).

As the century drewto a close, it also closed the book on Arab nationalism. Those fewold souls who continued to cling obstinately to its revolutionary message seemed strangely out of place in the 1990s. An observer at a conference on Arab nationalism and unity which convened in Beirut in 1994, wrote:
content_units.azure_translation: 随着本世纪接近尾声，它也结束了关于阿拉伯民族主义的书。那些继续顽固地坚持其革命信息的少数灵魂在 1990 年代似乎奇怪地格格不入。1994 年在贝鲁特召开的阿拉伯民族主义和团结会议的一位观察员写道：

content_units.text: [T]he conferees appeared to represent an extinct tribe using strange wordsindeed, a language incomprehensible in our time. Most of them had grey hair and stooping backs. Some needed canes to help them walk. Some had hearing aids and shaking hands that made it dif.cult for them to write, and others had dif.culty getting the words out.65
content_units.azure_translation: 这些会议似乎代表了一个灭绝的部落，使用奇怪的词语，这确实是一种在我们这个时代无法理解的语言。他们中的大多数人头发花白，背部弯腰。有些人需要拐杖来帮助他们走路。有些人戴着助听器和握手，这让他们很难写字，而另一些人则有 dif.culty 把词说出来65。

content_units.text: What was left of Arab nationalism by the end of the twentieth century from what it was in its heyday four decades earlier was a modi.ed version that the political scientist Shibley Telhami calls the NewArabism. Telhami argues that two trends distinguished this newArabism from the Arab nationalism of old. First, the direc­tion of the new Arabism was bottom-up; it was not inspired by state institutions or by charismatic leadership, but by disaffected intellectual elites trying to chart a political course independently from the state. Second, the newArabism was nourished by a new regionally based media, which, because it was driven by pro.t, had to appeal to themes that were unifying in nature.66 Telhami sees this NewArabism as an independent transnational movement in the Arab world.67 But one is hard put to consider this new version of Arabist sentiment as analogous to the Arab nationalism of the 1950s and 1960s, moved as it was by the almost obsessive drive to organic Arab unity. To begin with, the disaffected Arab elites of the 1990s might have had differences with their govern­ments over a whole spectrum of issues, but not over the sovereignty of their respective states. And this was re.ected as well in the re­porting of the newmedia. Apart from the Palestinian cause, which by the way was supported not only by Arabs, but also by non-Arab Muslims and still many others, this media was as sensitive to state-centered concerns as to regionally based issues. Whatever this Arab transnational movement was supposed to do, it certainly could not challenge or even question the legitimacy and sovereignty of the Arab state.68
content_units.azure_translation: 到20世纪末，阿拉伯民族主义与四十年前的鼎盛时期相比，只剩下一种修改版本，政治学家希布利·特尔哈米（Shibley Terhami）称之为“新阿拉伯主义”。泰尔哈米认为，这种新阿拉伯主义与旧的阿拉伯民族主义有两个趋势。首先，新阿拉伯主义的方向是自下而上的;它不是受到国家机构或魅力领导的启发，而是受到心怀不满的知识精英的启发，他们试图制定独立于国家之外的政治路线。其次，新阿拉伯主义是由一种新的区域媒体滋养的，由于它是由 pro.t 驱动的，因此必须诉诸本质上统一的主题。66 Telhami 将这种新阿拉伯主义视为阿拉伯世界的独立跨国运动。67 但人们很难认为这种新版本的阿拉伯主义情绪类似于 1950 年代和 1960 年代的阿拉伯民族主义，因为它被对有机阿拉伯团结的近乎痴迷的驱动力所感动。首先，1990年代心怀不满的阿拉伯精英可能在一系列问题上与政府存在分歧，但在各自国家的主权问题上却没有分歧。这在新媒体的报道中也得到了体现。顺便说一句，除了巴勒斯坦事业之外，巴勒斯坦事业不仅得到了阿拉伯人的支持，也得到了非阿拉伯穆斯林和许多其他人的支持，这些媒体对以国家为中心的关切与地区问题一样敏感。无论这个阿拉伯跨国运动应该做什么，它当然不能挑战甚至质疑阿拉伯国家的合法性和主权68。

content_units.text: The words are those of Fahmi Huwaydi, a well-known Egyptian journalist, who holds moderate Islamist views. His impressions of the conference appeared in al-Ahram (Cairo), May 17, 1994. This particular quote from the article is taken from Martin Kramer, Arab Awakening and Islamic Revival: The Politics of Ideas in the Middle East (London: Transac­tion Press, 1996) p. 3.

Shibley Telhami, Power, Legitimacy, and Peace-Making in Arab Coalitions: The New Arabism, in Ethnic Con.ict and International Politics in the Middle East, ed. Leonard Binder (Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 1999), pp. 5657.
Ibid., p. 56.

So at the qawmiya level, what Arabs were left with at the dawn of the twenty-.rst century was merely a recognition of a cultural proximity that at best set vague general parameters for political action. And the ef.cacy of even this meager role is questionable. Where were these parameters when Arab Syria sided with Persian Iran against Arab Iraq, or when Jordan signed a peace treaty with Israel? In the latter instance, some displeasure was voiced by a few Arab governments (including, hypocritically, that of Egypt), but it amounted to very little, and it soon .zzled out.
content_units.azure_translation: 因此，在 qawmiya 层面上，阿拉伯人在 20 世纪初留下的只是对文化接近性的承认，充其量只是为政治行动设定了模糊的一般参数。即使是这个微不足道的角色的效果也是值得怀疑的。当阿拉伯叙利亚站在波斯伊朗一边对抗阿拉伯伊拉克时，或者当约旦与以色列签署和平条约时，这些参数在哪里？在后一种情况下，少数阿拉伯政府（包括虚伪的埃及政府）表达了一些不满，但数量很少，而且很快就消失了。

content_units.text: It is probably the case that the disaffected intellectual elite of this newArabism would have disapproved strongly of these policies and considered them a disgrace to Arab principles. But sulking away at the tables of sidewalk cafe´s does not measure up to the tumultuous passions engendered by the popular eruptions of the nationalist generation two or three decades earlier. It is not that the Arab states and their citizens no longer considered them­selves to be Arab, or that they did not feel strongly about certain Arabist issues; it was simply that sublimating state interests to such considerations was now a thing of the past, as arcane and archaic as Arab nationalism itself.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种新阿拉伯主义心怀不满的知识精英可能会强烈反对这些政策，并认为它们是阿拉伯原则的耻辱。但是，在路边咖啡馆的桌子上生闷气，并不能与两三十年前民族主义一代的流行爆发所引发的动荡激情相提并论。这并不是说阿拉伯国家及其公民不再认为自己是阿拉伯人，也不是说他们对某些阿拉伯主义问题没有强烈的感觉;只是将国家利益升华为这种考虑现在已成为过去，就像阿拉伯民族主义本身一样晦涩难懂。

content_units.text: In a subsequent article, Telhami expounds on the limitations of this newArabism, one of which is the absence of the goal of Arab unity. See Shibley Telhami and Michael Barnett, eds., Identity and Foreign Policy in the Middle East (Ithaca, NewYork: Cornell University Press, 2002).

title: THE DEMISE OF ARAB NATIONALISM: A POSTMORTEM

content_units.text: It took some time for the light to .nally go out on Arab national­ism, but the power generating it was turned off in June 1967. After the SixDay War, Arab nationalisms slide toward poli­tical marginality became irreversible. And what stamped on it this sense of fatality was the fact that it was Egypt under Gamal Abd al-Nasir that lost. Egypts devastating defeat was Arab na­tionalisms mortal loss, for, as this book has made abundantly clear, the fate of Arab nationalism during the struggles, triumphs, and reversals of the 1950s and 1960s was inexorably linked to Egypt and its charismatic president. Had it just been Syria or Jor­dan, or even both, who lost the war, it would not have been the unmitigated disaster for Arab nationalism that the June war turned out to be. But Arab nationalism could not survive the ab­ject humiliation in.icted on its acknowledged prophet, who, through his shrill and overzealous propaganda machine, had promised a fabled triumph in this al-Maraka al-Masiriya, the bat­tle of destiny. Indeed, The Voice of the Arabs, in a baf.ing act of self-deception, continued to proclaim victory after victory on the Sinai battleground long after the Egyptian army had been sum­marily defeated.1
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义的灯花了一段时间才熄灭，但它的发电于 1967 年 6 月被关闭。六日战争后，阿拉伯民族主义滑向政治边缘化变得不可逆转。而让它留下这种宿命感的事实是，输掉的是贾迈勒·阿卜杜勒·纳西尔领导下的埃及。埃及的毁灭性失败是阿拉伯民族主义的致命损失，因为正如本书所充分表明的那样，阿拉伯民族主义在 1950 年代和 1960 年代的斗争、胜利和逆转中的命运与埃及及其魅力十足的总统密不可分。如果只是叙利亚或约旦，甚至两者都输掉了这场战争，那么六月战争对阿拉伯民族主义来说就不会是彻底的灾难。但阿拉伯民族主义无法在它公认的先知身上遭受的卑鄙羞辱中幸存下来，他通过他尖锐而过度热心的宣传机器，承诺在这场命运之战中取得传说中的胜利。事实上，阿拉伯人之声在埃及军队被即决击败后很久，以一种自欺欺人的行为，继续在西奈战场上宣布一次又一次的胜利。

content_units.text: Intrinsically linked to Egypts defeat was the consequential loss of charisma by Nasir. MaxWeber de.ned charisma as a certain quality of an individual personality by virtue of which he is set apart from ordinary men and treated as though endowed with su­pernatural, superhuman or, at least, speci.cally exceptional quali­ties.2 It was these perceived qualities that allowed Nasir to assume the uncontested leadership of the Arab nationalist march, and that made him the only person capable of uniting the Arabs and de­feating their enemies. The charismatic halo began to fade after the collapse of the United Arab Republic (UAR),3 but it essentially evaporated with the June 1967 rout. The charismatic relationship between [Nasir] and the masses formed during the bright youthful days of Bandung and Suez, Fouad Ajami writes, was shattered with the defeat; another variant born out of despair and a sense of loss, sustained him until his death. He would stay in power not as a con.dent, vibrant hero, but as a tragic .gure, a symbol of better days, an indication of the will to resist.4 Ajami overstates Nasirs weakness, for the Egyptian president was still the most in.uential Arab leader. After all, at the height of the Jordanian civil war in September 1970, where did King Husayn, Arafat, and the other Arab leaders go but to Cairo and to Nasir to resolve the crisis?5 Yet, in.uential as he might have been, this Nasir was not the charis­matic leader that he was a decade earlier. To the .ock, he seemed no longer possessed of the superhuman qualities of old, and among the other Arab leaders, he was now at most .rst among equals. Even his most loyal followers and disciples, now freed from his charismatic hold, began to jump ship. Such was the course of action taken by the Arab Nationalist Movement (ANM), which, since the mid-1950s, had unquestioningly tied its fate to Nasir. After the 1967 debacle, the ANM publicly abandoned Nasirism which they now branded as a bourgeois movement which had been des­tined to fail and espoused instead Marxist-Leninist principles.6 The SixDay War was the culmination of a string of setbacks and reversals suffered by Nasir since Iraqs refusal to join the UAR. De­feat was no longer a word; it had become a culture, chipping away at the charisma of Nasir and the mystique of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 与埃及失败有内在联系的是纳西尔随之而来的魅力丧失。马克斯韦伯将魅力视为个人个性的某种品质，因此他与普通人区分开来，并被视为被赋予了超自然的、超人的，或者至少是特别的特殊品质。2 正是这些感知到的品质使纳西尔能够在阿拉伯民族主义游行中毫无争议地领导，并使他成为唯一能够团结阿拉伯人并击败他们的敌人的人。阿拉伯联合共和国（UAR）解体后，魅力光环开始消退，3但随着1967年6月的溃败，它基本上消失了。福阿德·阿贾米 （Fouad Ajami） 写道，[纳西尔] 与万隆和苏伊士光明青年时期形成的群众之间的魅力关系因失败而破碎;另一种出于绝望和失落感而诞生的变体，一直支撑着他直到去世。他将继续掌权，不是作为一个顽固的、充满活力的英雄，而是作为一个悲剧性的 .gure，一个更美好日子的象征，一个抵抗意志的标志。4 阿贾米夸大了纳西尔的弱点，因为埃及总统仍然是最有影响力的阿拉伯领导人。毕竟，在1970年9月约旦内战最激烈的时候，侯赛因国王、阿拉法特和其他阿拉伯领导人除了去开罗和纳西尔解决危机之外，还去哪里呢？5 然而，尽管他可能是一个无意义的人，但这位纳西尔并不是十年前那个有魅力的领导人。在人们看来，他似乎不再具备过去的超人品质，在其他阿拉伯领导人中，他现在最多只是平等的。就连他最忠实的追随者和门徒，现在已经摆脱了他的魅力，也开始跳槽。这就是阿拉伯民族主义运动 （ANM） 采取的行动方针，自 1950 年代中期以来，该运动毫无疑问地将其命运与纳西尔联系在一起。1967 年崩溃后，ANM 公开放弃了纳西尔主义，他们现在将其称为注定要失败的资产阶级运动，转而拥护马克思列宁主义原则。6 六日战争是纳西尔自伊拉克拒绝加入 UAR 以来遭受的一系列挫折和逆转的高潮。失败不再是一个词;它已经成为一种文化，削弱了纳西尔的魅力和阿拉伯民族主义的神秘感。

One reason for these setbacks was the gradual loss of imperial­ism as the target of Egypts Arab nationalist mission. At the time of the Egyptian revolution, there were very few truly indepen­dent Arab countries. Even those who were allegedly sovereign states with memberships in the United Nations, such as Egypt and Iraq, still had British bases and personnel on their soil. So imperial­ism, which for the Arabs subsumed colonialism under its de.ni­tional umbrella, became the much needed other for Arab nation­alism.7 The anti-imperialist crusade began with Egypts assault on the Baghdad Pact, and from there moved on to all imperialist inter­ests, projects, and alleged agents in the area. Imperialism was a convenient other. The imperialist forces were outsiders, alien to the area, had committed many injustices against the Arab peo­ple, and therefore were deserving of the abuse heaped upon them. And that in a nutshell de.ned much of the .ght against impe­ rialism. It was as much language as it was concrete policies. Hurl­ing insults at the once invincible outsiders was as good as defeating them militarily.8 And Arab nationalism prospered as long as it could ride the verbal anti-imperialist bandwagon.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些挫折的原因之一是帝国主义逐渐失去作为埃及阿拉伯民族主义使命目标的目标。在埃及革命时期，真正独立的阿拉伯国家寥寥无几。即使是那些据称是联合国成员国的主权国家，如埃及和伊拉克，在其领土上仍然有英国的基地和人员。因此，帝国主义对阿拉伯人来说将殖民主义纳入其独立保护伞之下，成为阿拉伯民族主义急需的另一种。7 反帝国主义十字军东征始于埃及对巴格达条约的攻击，从那里发展到该地区的所有帝国主义利益、计划和所谓的代理人。帝国主义是一个方便的他者。帝国主义军队是外来者，与该地区格格不入，对阿拉伯人民犯下了许多不公正的行为，因此应该受到虐待。简而言之，这消除了许多反对 impe rialism 的 .ght。它既是语言，也是具体政策。对曾经不可战胜的局外人进行侮辱，就像在军事上击败他们一样好。8 阿拉伯民族主义只要能顺应口头上的反帝国主义潮流，它就会蓬勃发展。

content_units.text: Abdallah Saloom al-Samarai, Harakat al-Qawmiyeen al-Arab wa Dawruha . al­Wai al-Qawmi (The Arab nationalist movement and its role in nationalist awareness), al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no. 84 (February 1986): 86.

For the importance of the other to the formation of national identity, see Edward Said, Orientalism,2nd ed. (New York: Vintage Books, 1994), pp. 331332. For the primacy of the anti-imperialist struggle in Nasirs perceptions, see A. I. Dawisha, Perceptions, Deci­sions and Consequences in Foreign Policy: The Egyptian Intervention in the Yemen, Politi­cal Studies, vol. 25, no. 2 (June 1977). The struggle against colonialism also constitutes the third fundamental principle of the constitution of the Bath Party. See Sylvia Haim, ed., Arab Nationalism: An Anthology (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1962), p. 234.

By the 1960s, however, imperialism had become less relevant: British presence in Egypt and Iraq was eliminated; the Baghdad Pact was defeated; Jordans British chief of staff, Sir John Glubb, was dismissed; Lebanons pro-Western Camille Chamoun was re­placed by the independent Fuad Shihab; and the Algerians, sacri­.cing a million dead in a heroic struggle, had triumphed over French colonial power. As the custodian of the Arab nationalist narrative, Nasir had to .nd new targets, new others. So Arab nationalist fury was turned against Arab countries that Nasir deemed to be reactionary. But in such a milieu, with Arab pitted against Arab, there were no easy victories to be had. No word or term could match the symbolic power and emotional resonance of anti-imperialism, with its conceptual separation of Arab from non-Arab, of us from them. Iraqs Qasim, Saudi Arabias Fay­sal, or the monarchists in Yemen could not be defeated on symbol­ism alone. By 1967, the loss of the imperialist other had done considerable harm to Nasirs charisma, to his perceived ability to bring the other parts of the Arab world into his Arab nationalist caravan. And there could be little doubt that this symbolic diminu­tion of Nasirs aura was as devastating for Arab nationalism as the June 1967 military defeat of Egypt and the other Arabs.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，到了 1960 年代，帝国主义变得不那么重要了：英国在埃及和伊拉克的存在被消除;《巴格达条约》被否决;约旦英国参谋长约翰·格鲁布爵士被解职;黎巴嫩亲西方的卡米尔·查蒙 （Camille Chamoun） 被独立的福阿德·希哈布 （Fuad Shihab） 取代;阿尔及利亚人在英勇的斗争中牺牲了一百万人，战胜了法国的殖民权力。作为阿拉伯民族主义叙事的守护者，纳西尔不得不寻找新的目标，新的其他目标。因此，阿拉伯民族主义的愤怒转向了纳西尔认为是反动的阿拉伯国家。但在这样的环境中，阿拉伯人与阿拉伯人对立，没有容易取得胜利。没有任何词语或术语能与反帝国主义的象征力量和情感共鸣相提并论，反帝国主义在概念上将阿拉伯人与非阿拉伯人、我们与他们分开。伊拉克卡西姆、沙特阿拉伯费萨尔或也门的君主主义者不能仅凭象征意义来打败。到 1967 年，帝国主义他者的丧失对纳西尔的魅力造成了相当大的伤害，也损害了他将阿拉伯世界其他地区纳入他的阿拉伯民族主义商队的能力。毫无疑问，纳西尔光环的象征性削弱对阿拉伯民族主义的破坏性与 1967 年 6 月埃及和其他阿拉伯人的军事失败一样具有破坏性。

content_units.text: In any case, in the aftermath of June 1967, Nasir faced horren­dous domestic problems that effectively claimed every iota of his energies, and relegated Arab nationalist issues to the outer periph­ery of his concerns. To begin with, there were the hordes of Israeli soldiers camped on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal, a mere three hours away from Cairo, and if their commanders had felt like making the three-hour trek, Nasir knew that he did not have an army to stop them. Then there was the abysmal condition of the structurally fragile economy, made even weaker by the .nancial strains of war and its attendant demographic dislocations. The task of domestic reconstruction was herculean, robbing Nasir of any inclination to look beyond Egypts now contested frontiers.
content_units.azure_translation: 无论如何，在 1967 年 6 月之后，纳西尔面临着可怕的国内问题，这些问题实际上耗尽了他的每一点精力，并将阿拉伯民族主义问题降级到他关注的边缘。首先，成群结队的以色列士兵在苏伊士运河东岸扎营，距离开罗只有三个小时的路程，如果他们的指挥官想长途跋涉三个小时，纳西尔知道他没有军队来阻止他们。然后是结构性脆弱的经济状况，战争的金融压力和随之而来的人口错位使经济状况更加疲软。国内重建的任务是艰巨的，使纳西尔失去了将目光投向埃及现在有争议的边界之外的任何意愿。

content_units.text: See Adeed Dawisha, Anti-Americanism in the Arab World: Memories of the Past in the Attitudes of the Present, in Anti-Americanism in the Third World, eds. Alvin Z. Rubin­stein and Donald E. Smith (New York: Praeger, 1985), pp. 6783.

Moving away from revolutionary Arab nationalism and its es­sential ingredient of comprehensive and organic Arab unity, Nasir was at least partly to blame for the growing prominence of other competing identities and ideologies. Nor did his mounting depen­dence on the .nancial support of status-quo, conservative Arab states, that had vigorously fought Nasirs Arab nationalism bode well for the continued health and vibrancy of the Arab nationalist creed. Pragmatic considerations outweighed ideological .delity in Nasirs decision to seek de´tente with the status-quo forces in the area. He signaled this change of attitude by closing down the Voice of the Arabs radio station, which for so long had been the voice of radical Arab nationalism. By the end of the Khartoum Summit meeting, wataniya had been consecrated as the dominant ideology, regulating inter-Arab relations on the principle of state sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 纳西尔背离了革命性的阿拉伯民族主义及其全面有机的阿拉伯统一的基本要素，至少部分地归咎于其他相互竞争的身份和意识形态的日益突出。他越来越依赖维持现状的保守阿拉伯国家的财政支持，这些国家曾大力反对纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义，这对阿拉伯民族主义信条的持续健康和活力来说也不是好兆头。在纳西尔决定寻求与该地区维持现状的势力缓和关系时，务实的考虑超过了意识形态的谨慎。他通过关闭阿拉伯人之声广播电台来表明这种态度的转变，该电台长期以来一直是激进阿拉伯民族主义的代言人。到喀土穆首脑会议结束时，瓦塔尼亚已成为主导意识形态，根据国家主权原则规范阿拉伯间关系。

content_units.text: Of course, as we have seen, this was no sudden revelation. The qawmiya-wataniya debate had been an ongoing battle for some time. Even in its heyday, Arab nationalism had to contend with statist sentiments. Sati al-Husri voiced the frustrations of Arab na­tionalists in an introduction to a book published in the 1950s. Writ­ten in the form of an elegy, the introduction was entitled, How Strange:

content_units.text: Part of the reason for this lament was that the interests of Arab political and economic elites in most cases had become contingent on the survival of their particular state. It was hardly surprising that these elites were loath to put their interests at risk for the sake of Arab unity.10 Consequently, those who espoused wataniya ar­gued that Arab nationalism was used as a license to threaten and coerce recalcitrant domestic elites, thus making irredentism the order of the day.11 Beyond economic interests, the wataniya advo­cates relied on geopolitical and cultural arguments in making their case. They insisted that Arab nationalists had to understand that while various Arab states might accept an overarching Arab iden­tity, geographic and even cultural separation were real and potent enough to preclude an organic unity. And indeed, the decline of Arab nationalism from 1958 onward testi.es to the potency of this argument.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种哀叹的部分原因是，在大多数情况下，阿拉伯政治和经济精英的利益已经取决于他们特定国家的生存。10 因此，那些拥护瓦塔尼亚的人认为，阿拉伯民族主义被用作威胁和胁迫顽固的国内精英的许可证，从而使不统一主义成为当今的秩序。11 除了经济利益之外，瓦塔尼亚的倡导者还依靠地缘政治和文化论据来证明他们的观点。他们坚持认为，阿拉伯民族主义者必须明白，虽然各个阿拉伯国家可能接受阿拉伯人的总体身份，但地理甚至文化上的分离是真实而有力的，足以排除有机的统一。事实上，1958 年以来阿拉伯民族主义的衰落 testi.es 这一论点的效力。

content_units.text: Iraq was a case in point. Many Iraqi nationalists who had sup­ported Nasir in his feud with the pro-British Nuri al-Said were nevertheless wary about such phrases as the Arab people of Iraq,12 that were used incessantly by Nasirists and Bathists, and which did not acknowledge the existence of a non-Arab Kurdish community that represented around 20 percent of the Iraqi popula­tion. Nor were many Arab Shiites sold on Arab unity, which they perceived as a primarily Sunni project. It was this communal mo­saic which was Iraq that afforded Qasim the opportunity to fend off efforts to join Iraq into the UAR at a time when Arab national­ism seemed triumphantly unstoppable. Qasim promoted an Iraq First identity, emphasizing the countrys historical status as the cradle of great pre-Arab civilizations. He pointedly added the Ak­kadian eight-point star of Ishtar to the national .ag, as well as incorporating the insignia of the sun god Shamash to Iraqs na­tional emblem.13 The prestige of Arab nationalism suffered much, as Iraq, throughout the .ve years of Qasims rule, pursued policies that were vehemently anti-unionist, promoting vigorously Iraqs sovereignty and its own national (watani) interests.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克就是一个典型的例子。然而，许多在纳西尔与亲英的努里·赛义德（Nuri al-Said）不和时支持纳西尔的伊拉克民族主义者对“伊拉克的阿拉伯人民”12 等短语持谨慎态度，这些短语被纳西尔主义者和浴帝不断使用，并且不承认存在代表伊拉克人口约20%的非阿拉伯库尔德社区。许多阿拉伯什叶派也没有相信阿拉伯团结，他们认为阿拉伯团结主要是逊尼派的计划。正是伊拉克的这种社区马赛克让卡西姆有机会在阿拉伯民族主义似乎不可阻挡的时候抵御伊拉克加入阿拉伯联合共和国的努力。卡西姆提倡伊拉克优先的身份，强调该国作为伟大前阿拉伯文明摇篮的历史地位。他尖锐地将阿卡德的八点星伊什塔尔添加到国家 .ag 中，并将太阳神沙马什的徽章纳入伊拉克的国徽中。13 阿拉伯民族主义的声望受到了很大影响，因为在卡西姆统治的两年里，伊拉克奉行强烈反工会主义的政策，大力促进伊拉克的主权和自己的国家（watani）利益。

content_units.text: . . . there were de.ciencies and mistakes in the understanding and de.nition of the dialectical connection between the local (watani) tasks with which the party [was] confronted . . . and [the Arab na­tionalist] tasks.... The party was pushed into the [Arab nationalist] arena. . .in a way that largely exceeded its capability [before] many tasks were accomplished on the local Iraqi level . . . such as stabiliz­ing the regime...and [fully] solving the Kurdish problem.14
content_units.azure_translation: . . .在对党所面临的地方（渡谷）任务之间的辩证联系的理解和理解方面存在着差异和错误......和[阿拉伯民族主义者]的任务......该党被推入了[阿拉伯民族主义]舞台......以一种在伊拉克当地完成许多任务之前在很大程度上超出其能力的方式......比如稳定政权......以及[完全]解决库尔德问题。

content_units.text: It was not that the Iraqi Bathist regime had abandoned its commit­ment to qawmiya, rather they felt that focusing on the country achieving some form of political harmony, reviving its economy, building its infrastructure, and especially solving its ethnic and sec­tarian problemswas a more pressing need than a full-.edged charge toward Arab unity. In instructing an educational commit­tee, Saddam Husayn said: When we talk of the [Arab] nation we should not forget to talk about the Iraqi people.... When we talk about the Arab homeland we should not neglect to educate the Iraqi to take pride in the piece of land in which he lives . . . [Iraqis] consist of Arabs and non-Arabs, [so] when we talk of the great [Arab] homeland, we must not push the non-Arabs to look for a country outside Iraq.15 Could there be a clearer expression of the effort to reorient the ideological compass of party loyalists, indeed to subvert their lifelong Bathist beliefs? Qawmiya was certainly not discarded, but it was wataniya, which was the immediate focus of concern. Saddam was essentially preaching political realities, for, aspirations aside, it was the internal condition of Iraq that was the stuff of politics.
content_units.azure_translation: 这并不是说伊拉克巴斯主义政权放弃了对卡米亚的承诺，而是他们认为，专注于实现某种形式的政治和谐，恢复经济，建设基础设施，特别是解决种族和宗派问题，比全力推动阿拉伯团结更紧迫。萨达姆·侯赛因在指示教育委员会时说：当我们谈论[阿拉伯]民族时，我们不应该忘记谈论伊拉克人民......当我们谈论阿拉伯家园时，我们不应忽视教育伊拉克人为他所居住的这片土地感到自豪......[伊拉克人]由阿拉伯人和非阿拉伯人组成，因此，当我们谈论伟大的[阿拉伯]家园时，我们绝不能强迫非阿拉伯人寻找伊拉克以外的国家。15 是否可以更清楚地表达重新定位党的忠诚者的意识形态指南针，实际上颠覆他们终生的巴斯主义信仰的努力？Qawmiya 当然没有被丢弃，但 wataniya 是直接关注的焦点。萨达姆本质上是在宣扬政治现实，因为抛开愿望不谈，伊拉克的内部状况才是政治的要素。

content_units.text: Amatzia Baram, Mesopotamian Identity in Bathi Iraq, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 19, (October 1983): 427.
Quoted in Amatzia Baram, Qawmiyya and Wataniyya in Bathi Iraq: The Search for a New Balance, Middle Eastern Studies, vol. 19 (April 1983): 193.

The Syrian Bathists were no less centered on Syria. When they scrambled to Cairo after the Bathist coup of March 1963 to talk unity with Nasir, their motives were more local than regional. Arab nationalism was the publicly articulated goal, but the more press­ing motive was their own legitimation inside Syria. We need to exploit your excellencys name, a member of the Syrian delegation told Nasir, thats all there is to it.16 And in the talks the Syrian Bathists, the stalwart propagators of comprehensive Arab unity, insisted on such measures of autonomy that would render any union a loose, almost inconsequential, federal arrangement. And in any case, the talks simply afforded the Syrian Bathists the breathing space they needed to neutralize all opposition to their rule in Syria, including pro-Nasir unionist elements.
content_units.azure_translation: 叙利亚巴斯派同样以叙利亚为中心。1963 年 3 月巴斯派政变后，当他们争先恐后地前往开罗与纳西尔谈论团结时，他们的动机更多的是地方性的，而不是区域性的。阿拉伯民族主义是公开表达的目标，但更紧迫的动机是他们自己在叙利亚境内的合法性。我们需要利用阁下的名字，叙利亚代表团的一名成员告诉纳西尔，仅此而已。16 在会谈中，叙利亚巴蒂斯派是阿拉伯全面团结的坚定宣传者，他们坚持采取这种自治措施，使任何联盟都成为一种松散的、几乎无关紧要的联邦安排。无论如何，会谈只是为叙利亚巴斯主义者提供了他们所需的喘息空间，以压制所有反对他们在叙利亚统治的势力，包括亲纳西尔的工会主义分子。

content_units.text: Cynical as their maneuvering might have been, the Syrian Bath­ists were in fact re.ecting an ideological duality that was ingrained in Syrias sociopolitical fabric between qawmiya and wataniya, be­tween perceiving itself as the beating heart of Arabism on the one hand, and the center of bilad al-Sham (Greater Syria) on the other hand. The latter concept was given intellectual coherence by
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管他们的策略可能很愤世嫉俗，但叙利亚巴斯主义者实际上是在重建一种意识形态二元性，这种二元性根深蒂固于叙利亚社会政治结构中，在卡夫米亚和瓦塔尼亚之间，一方面将自己视为阿拉伯主义跳动的心脏，另一方面将自己视为大叙利亚的中心。后一个概念被赋予了智力上的连贯性

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 196.
Quoted in Malik Mufti, Sovereign Creations: Pan-Arabism and Political Order in Syria and Iraq (Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press, 1996), p. 150.

Antun Saada as early as the 1930s,17 and even though Saada was executed in 1949, his party outlawed shortly thereafter, and his program swept aside in the 1950s by a triumphant Arab national­ism, his ideas of a certain Syrian uniqueness and excellence would still .nd an echo in Syrian sensibility. If this sense of separateness was dormant during the 1950s, the Arab nationalist decade, then Syrias experience under the UAR might have moved it to the fore­front of Syrian consciousness.18 Regardless of the grandiose rheto­ric about Arab unity, successive Syrian leaders have always catered .rst and foremost to Syrias interests. And President Ha.z al-Asad, who ruled Syria from 1970 to 2000, was no exception. While beat­ing the drums of Arab nationalism at every opportunity, Asad was a pragmatic, even Machiavellian, politician whose regional and in­ternational policies were made with Syrias and his own interests in mind.19
content_units.azure_translation: 早在 1930 年代，17 安通·萨达 （Antun Saada） 就被处决了，尽管萨达于 1949 年被处决，此后不久他的政党就被取缔了，他的纲领在 1950 年代被胜利的阿拉伯民族主义所扫地而去，但他关于叙利亚独特性和卓越的思想仍然会在叙利亚的情感中引起回响。如果这种分离感在 1950 年代，即阿拉伯民族主义十年期间处于休眠状态，那么叙利亚在阿拉伯联合军统治下的经历可能会将其推向叙利亚意识的最前沿。18 尽管阿拉伯团结的言辞如何宏大，叙利亚历任领导人始终首先迎合叙利亚的利益。1970年至2000年统治叙利亚的总统哈兹·阿萨德也不例外。阿萨德在抓住一切机会敲响阿拉伯民族主义的鼓点的同时，他是一位务实的、甚至是马基雅维利式的政治家，他的地区和国际政策是在考虑叙利亚和他自己的利益的情况下制定的。

content_units.text: And then in Egypt, in Nasirs own backyard, with all the means utilized by the authoritarian state to implant qawmiya into the Egyptian psyche, Egyptian wataniya could not be elbowed out. As late as 1963, after almost a decade of concerted Arab nationalist campaign, Nasir would voice his misgivings about the depth of the Arab orientations of his countrymen.20 Given the inherent strength of this feeling of Egyptianism, it was hardly surprising that Na­sirs successor, Anwar al-Sadat, would use it in order to get out from under the overbearing memory of his towering predecessor.
content_units.azure_translation: 然后在埃及，在纳西尔自己的后院，专制国家利用一切手段将 qawmiya 植入埃及人的心灵，埃及的 wataniya 无法被肘击出局。直到1963年，在经历了近十年的阿拉伯民族主义运动之后，纳西尔才表达了他对同胞阿拉伯取向深度的担忧。20 鉴于这种埃及主义情感的内在力量，纳西尔的继任者安瓦尔·萨达特（Anwar al-Sadat）利用它来摆脱对他巍峨前任的霸道记忆也就不足为奇了。

content_units.text: Sadat began by changing the name of the state from the United Arab Republic to the Arab Republic of Egypt, where Arab is only the adjective and Egypt is the noun.21 And as we have seen, Sadats policies, especially after the October 1973 war, which cul­minated in the 1979 Egyptian-Israeli peace treaty, were motivated solely by considerations of Egypts interests. These policies were undertaken without regard to the rest of the Arabs; indeed, they were perceived universally in the Arab world to be against the Arab will. Simultaneously, Sadat embarked on a policy of cultural reori­entation toward Egypt. This was evident in subtle changes in school curricula, highlighting Egypts long history, cultural promi­nence, and unique personality,22 and in the emphasis in the govern­ment-controlled media on Egyptian domestic affairs and on foreign policy items that spotlighted Egypts prestige and status in interna­tional affairs. By the end of the 1970s, wataniya had won the day in Egypt.
content_units.azure_translation: 萨达特首先将国家名称从阿拉伯联合共和国改为阿拉伯埃及共和国，其中阿拉伯语只是形容词，埃及是名词。21 正如我们所看到的，萨达特的政策，特别是在1973年10月战争之后，最终导致了1979年的埃及-以色列和平条约，完全是出于对埃及利益的考虑。这些政策是在不考虑其他阿拉伯人的情况下实施的;事实上，在阿拉伯世界，人们普遍认为它们违背了阿拉伯的意愿。与此同时，萨达特开始了对埃及进行文化重新定位的政策。这在学校课程的微妙变化中显而易见，突出了埃及悠久的历史、文化突出和独特的个性，22 以及政府控制的媒体对埃及内政和外交政策项目的强调，这些项目突出了埃及在国际事务中的声望和地位。到 1970 年代末，wataniya 在埃及赢得了胜利。

content_units.text: For a concise exposition of Saadas ideas, see Majid Khadduri, Political Trends in the Arab World: The Role of Ideas and Ideals in Politics (Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1970), pp. 186194.
Itamar Rabinovich, Syria Under the Bath, 19631966: The Army Party Symbiosis (Jerusalem: Israel Universities Press, 1972), p. 20.
See R. Stephen Humphreys, Between Memory and Desire: The Middle East in a Trou­bled Age (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1999), pp. 7374.

Al-Jumhuriya al-Arabiya al-Muttahida, Mahadhir Jalsat Mubahathat al-Wuhda (The proceedings of the meetings on unity discussions) (Cairo: National Printing and Publishing House, 1963), p. 94. The centuries of Ottoman tyranny, writes Muhamed Hasaneen Hay­kal, isolated [Egypt] from the [rest of the Arabs]. Egypt . . . was unable to shift its attention from its own soil so that it can look across the Sinai and discover its Arab position. Al-Ahram (Cairo), November 3, 1961.

It was not only the state, but also sub-state identities that com­peted with Arab nationalism for peoples allegiance. In a number of Arab states, tribe, religion, and sect continued to be major, even primordial, foci of citizens loyalties. This was, as we have seen, a considerable obstacle to the growth of Arab nationalism before World War II. In the Arab nationalist lexicon, terms such as shuu­biya (loosely depicting ethnic and sectarian particularism) or al­asabiya al-qabaliya (tribal solidarity) were steeped in disparaging and derisive undertone. So with the spectacular rise of Arab nation­alism in the 1950s, it became decidedly unfashionable to profess a tribal or sectarian identity. But that did not mean that these identi­ties were expelled from peoples consciousness; rather, they were just not readily or vociferously advertised.
content_units.azure_translation: 不仅是国家，而且是次国家身份与阿拉伯民族主义争夺人民的忠诚。在许多阿拉伯国家，部落、宗教和教派仍然是公民忠诚度的主要，甚至是原始的焦点。正如我们所看到的，这是二战前阿拉伯民族主义发展的一个相当大的障碍。在阿拉伯民族主义词典中，诸如 shuubiya（松散地描述种族和宗派特殊主义）或 alasabiya al-qabaliya（部落团结）等术语充满了贬低和嘲讽的意味。因此，随着 1950 年代阿拉伯民族主义的惊人兴起，宣称部落或宗派身份显然变得不合时宜。但这并不意味着这些身份被驱逐出人们的意识;相反，它们只是没有轻易或大声地做广告。

content_units.text: In some states of course, tribal af.liations were the backbone of popular support that shielded local leaderships from the advancing tide of revolutionary Arab nationalism. That was certainly the case with Saudi Arabia, where the tribally based demographic structure contributed signi.cantly to the stability of the political order. In the process of transferring the loyalty of the bedouin from tribe to state, successive Saudi monarchs made sure to act, and be per­ceived, simply as tribal overlords. An example of this endeavor was the Majlis, which was institutionalized in 1952 by a royal decree, granting every subject, in true tribal fashion, the right of access to the royal family. In these gatherings, the ruler was expected to settle disputes, take note of complaints, acknowledge proclamations of loyalty, listen to poetic renderings, or simply take part in general conversation. Such efforts to continue and maintain tribal identity allowed the Saudi rulers to withstand Nasirs Arab nationalist on­slaught for over a decade between 1957 and 1967. But the Saudis did not stop there. They also created a military force, the National Guard, which was independent of the regular armed forces, and which was entrusted with safeguarding the monarchy even if Nasir­ist elements succeeded in in.ltrating the regular armed forces. The novelty about the National Guard was that it was composed al­most exclusively of bedouins from tribes inhabiting the Nejd prov­ince of Saudi Arabia, from which the House of Saud originated.
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，在一些州，部落支持是民众支持的支柱，保护地方领导人免受阿拉伯民族主义革命浪潮的影响。沙特阿拉伯的情况确实如此，以部落为基础的人口结构对政治秩序的稳定做出了重大贡献。在贝都因人的忠诚从部落转移到国家的过程中，历任沙特君主确保行事，并被视为部落霸主。这一努力的一个例子是议会，它于 1952 年通过一项皇家法令制度化，以真正的部落方式授予每个臣民进入王室的权利。在这些聚会中，统治者被期望解决争端、记录投诉、承认忠诚宣言、聆听诗意的表达，或者只是参加一般对话。这种继续和维持部落身份的努力使沙特统治者能够在 1957 年至 1967 年间的十多年里抵御纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义者的猛攻。但沙特并没有就此止步。他们还创建了一支独立于正规武装部队的国民警卫队，即使纳西尔主义分子成功地控制了正规武装部队，它也负责维护君主制。国民警卫队的新颖之处在于，它几乎完全由居住在沙特阿拉伯内志省部落的贝都因人组成，沙特家族的起源就是该省。

content_units.text: Eberhard Kienle, Arab Unity Schemes Revisited: Interest, Identity, and Policy in Syria and Egypt, International Journal of Middle East Studies, vol. 27 (February 1995): 66.
Ibid.

Bedouin military personnel were also singularly responsible for the survival of King Husayn of Jordan, at times in the face of seem­ingly impossible odds. Jordans Arab Legion was initially formed to combat bedouin anarchy in the newly created country. In a stroke of genius, the Legions founder, the British of.cer John Glubb, de­cided to harness the warlike quality of the bedouins by recruiting them into the army. Very quickly, the Arab Legion became the Arab worlds most disciplined .ghting force. But one thing that Glubb did not change was tribal solidarity, which was nurtured every step of the way to make the Legion the bedouin prop of the Hashemite polity.23 This certainly saved Husayns throne during an attempted coup by Nasirist of.cers in 1957. The following description of events gives a .avor of the tribal connection:
content_units.azure_translation: 贝都因军事人员也对约旦国王侯赛因的生存负有唯一的责任，有时面对看似不可能的困难。约旦阿拉伯军团最初是为了打击这个新成立的国家的贝都因无政府状态而成立的。军团创始人、英国of.cer约翰·格鲁布 （John Glubb） 出奇地决定利用贝都因人的好战品质，招募他们参军。很快，阿拉伯军团就成为阿拉伯世界纪律最严明的部队。但格鲁布没有改变的一件事是部落团结，这种团结在每一步都得到了培养，使军团成为哈希姆政体的贝都因人支柱。23 这无疑在 1957 年纳西尔主义者发动未遂政变期间挽救了侯赛因的王位。以下事件描述给出了部落联系的 .avor：

content_units.text: In the evening of 13 April, Hussein received a visit from his uncle . . . accompanied by beduin of.cers who had just arrived from Zerqa. They brought sensational reports. At that very moment, ha­ dari (non-beduin)24 of.cers were inciting certain regiments to march on Amman and save the country by arresting or even assassinat­ing the king. [Hussein] confronted Abu Nawar (the suspected leader of the coup) who professed amazement. Hussein then took Abu Nawar with him to Zerqa. . . to investigate. In the meantime, excite­ment in Zerqa had risen to fever pitch. Bloody brawls broke out between beduin and hadari units. In some cases, beduin soldiers assaulted and locked up [Anti-King] of.cers. Other beduin soldiers poured out onto the Amman road, cheering [the King] and vowing death to Abu-Nawar. Hussein addressed them, embraced them, and swore brotherhood.25
content_units.azure_translation: 4 月 13 日晚上，侯赛因接待了他叔叔的来访......陪同的还有刚从泽尔卡赶来的塞尔斯的贝杜因。他们带来了耸人听闻的报道。就在那一刻，ha dari（non-beduin）24 的 cers 正在煽动某些军团向安曼进军，通过逮捕甚至暗杀国王来拯救国家。[侯赛因]与阿布·纳瓦尔（政变的嫌疑领导人）对峙，后者表示惊讶。侯赛因随后带着阿布·纳瓦尔前往泽尔卡。调查。与此同时，泽尔卡的兴奋情绪已经达到了白热化的程度。贝杜因和哈达里部队之间爆发了血腥斗殴。在某些情况下，贝杜因士兵袭击并关押了 [反国王] 的 [反国王]。其他贝都因士兵涌向安曼公路，为[国王]欢呼，并发誓要向阿布-纳瓦尔致死。侯赛因向他们讲话，拥抱他们，并宣誓兄弟情谊。

content_units.text: Uriel Dann, Studies in the History of Transjordan, 19201949: The Making of a State (Boulder, Colorado: Westview Press, 1984), p. 11.

In contrast to Husayns conscious solicitation of the tribal con­nection, successive Iraqi governments endeavored through educa­tion and the coercive powers of the state to quell the tribal spirit and submerge tribal identity into that of the Iraqi state. And then in the 1950s came the Arab nationalist offensive and its contemptu­ous belittling of tribalism as reactionary, unable to address the Arabs contemporary concerns. The nationalists employed a pow­erful argument in Iraq: The Arabs were once a great people, but then they embarked on a seemingly endless journey into oblivion, and when they .nally stirred from their deep slumber around the turn of the twentieth century, they arose into a world that was no longer theirs; a Western world; a world of technology, science, and cultural advancements associated with modern ways. To catch up with the West, the Arabs had to absorb Western ideas, to leave behind the old ways, turn the corner and take the route of moder­nity. And tribalism was decidedly not the stuff of modernity. Given the dominance and political power of this argument in the ideologi­cal and political discourse of the 1950s and 1960s, one would think that tribalism and tribal values would recede into downright irrele­ vance. Yet the eminent Iraqi sociologist Ali al-Wardi, writing about Iraq in the late 1960s, tells us that even in the cities modern­ization was super.cial, that in their essence many of the city folk were bedouin, and that the trappings of modernity, such as Western clothing, simply camou.aged deeply ingrained tribal values.26 As late as 1982, a leading member of Iraqs Bath Party would lament that, along with sectarianism, tribalism was tearing the unity of society to pieces.27 And indeed, in the wake of the Gulf War, in a concerted effort to shore up his waning support in Iraq, that erst­while Arab nationalist and lifelong member of the Bath Party, Sad­dam Husayn, would draw on this enduring reservoir of tribal val­ues, and elevate tribalism to the forefront of Iraqs political and ideological concerns.28
content_units.azure_translation: 与侯赛因有意识地征求部落联系相反，伊拉克历届政府努力通过教育和国家强制权力来平息部落精神，并将部落身份融入伊拉克国家的意识中。然后在 1950 年代出现了阿拉伯民族主义攻势，并轻蔑地贬低部落主义是反动的，无法解决阿拉伯人当代的担忧。民族主义者在伊拉克采用了一个强有力的论据：阿拉伯人曾经是一个伟大的民族，但后来他们踏上了看似无休止的被遗忘之旅，当他们在二十世纪之交从沉睡中醒来时，他们进入了一个不再属于他们的世界;西方世界;一个与现代方式相关的技术、科学和文化进步的世界。为了赶上西方，阿拉伯人不得不吸收西方思想，抛开旧路，转过弯来走现代化的路线。部落主义显然不是现代性的东西。鉴于这一论点在 1950 年代和 1960 年代的意识形态和政治话语中的主导地位和政治力量，人们会认为部落主义和部落价值观将退居彻尾的无关紧要。然而，著名的伊拉克社会学家阿里·瓦尔迪（Ali al-Wardi）在1960年代后期撰写了关于伊拉克的文章，告诉我们，即使在城市中，现代化也是超凡的，从本质上讲，许多城市居民都是贝都因人，而现代性的装饰，如西方服装，只是伪装了根深蒂固的部落价值观。26 直到1982年，伊拉克巴斯党的一位主要成员还会感叹， 与宗派主义一起，部落主义正在将社会的统一撕成碎片。27 事实上，在海湾战争之后，为了巩固他在伊拉克日益衰落的支持，这位曾经的阿拉伯民族主义者和巴斯党的终身成员萨达姆·侯赛因（Saddam Husayn）将利用这种持久的部落价值观，将部落主义提升到伊拉克政治和意识形态关注的最前沿。

content_units.text: Hadar had historically denoted settled communities, and in Jordan it symbolically sep­arated the cities, especially the capital Amman, from the rest of the country. The implication here was that the urbanites were particularly susceptible to Arab nationalism, especially as the Palestinian community was almost entirely urban.
Uriel Dann, King Hussein and the Challenge of Arab Radicalism: Jordan, 19551967 (London: Oxford University Press, 1989), p. 59.

Iraqs sectarian divisions were another hurdle in the Arab na­tionalist march. The countrys Shiite majority never overcame its suspicion of Arab nationalism as an essentially Sunni project. Shiite grievances against the Sunnis were primarily political, pertaining to Sunni dominance over Iraqs political order. The Shiites would point to the paucity of their numbers among the decision-making elite and in the ranks of the administrative and military institu­tions.29 Iraqi leaders, such as Abd al-Salam Aref, who carried Arab nationalism on his sleeves, but was well known for his anti-Shiite prejudices, only added to this sectarian tension.30 Conse­ quently, Shiite enthusiasm for Arab unity projects were tempered by the fear that they would render the Shiites a minority in an Arab Sunni world.31
content_units.azure_translation: 伊拉克的宗派分裂是阿拉伯民族主义进军的另一个障碍。什叶派占多数的国家从未克服对阿拉伯民族主义本质上是逊尼派项目的怀疑。什叶派对逊尼派的不满主要是政治性的，与逊尼派对伊拉克政治秩序的统治有关。什叶派会指出，在决策精英以及行政和军事机构的队伍中，什叶派的人数很少。29 伊拉克领导人，如阿卜杜勒·萨拉姆·阿雷夫（Abd al-Salam Aref），他将阿拉伯民族主义挂在袖子上，但以其反什叶派偏见而闻名，这只会加剧这种宗派紧张局势。30 因此，什叶派对阿拉伯团结项目的热情因担心它们会使什叶派成为少数派而减弱阿拉伯逊尼派世界31

It is not that the Shiites did not believe in Arab nationalism, or that they did not consider themselves to be Arabs. Some of the marvels of Arabic writings were penned by Shiite men of learning.32 And as we have seen, Iraqis of all religions and denominations .ocked to the Arab nationalist cause under Nasirs leadership in the 1950s and 1960s. But that did not mean that tribalism or sec­tarianism were wiped out, for they were too deeply ingrained to disappear; they simply retreated into the recesses of peoples con­sciousness. So, once Arab nationalism began to suffer reverses and setbacks, and Nasirs ability to work his magic came to be ques­tioned, all the particularistic, anti-national, tendencies were to re­emerge and come to the forefront again.
content_units.azure_translation: 什叶派并不是不相信阿拉伯民族主义，也不是他们不认为自己是阿拉伯人。阿拉伯语著作中的一些奇迹是由什叶派学者撰写的。32 正如我们所看到的，在 1950 年代和 1960 年代，所有宗教和教派的伊拉克人都加入了纳西尔领导下的阿拉伯民族主义事业。但这并不意味着部落主义或宗派主义被消灭了，因为它们根深蒂固，无法消失;他们只是退缩到人们意识的深处。因此，一旦阿拉伯民族主义开始遭受逆转和挫折，纳西尔施展魔法的能力受到质疑，所有特殊主义、反民族的倾向都会重新出现并再次成为最前沿。

content_units.text: Another competitor with Arab nationalism for peoples loyalty was radical Islam. In one sense, this competition is surprising be­cause there are elements of each in both. The vast majority of Arabs are Muslims, and the most glorious periods of Arab history oc­curred during the dazzling medieval Islamic empires. Similarly, all Muslims, moderate or radicals, could not but admit to the central role of the Arabs in their religion. After all, Islam was born in the Arabian Peninsula, the Prophet Muhamed was Arab, and Gods message was revealed in Arabic. One would think that the two social movements would share a cooperative relationship. In­stead, it was downright hostile. Arab nationalists, from Husri to Nasir and A.aq, accepted the special place that Islam occupied
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义争夺人民忠诚度的另一个竞争对手是激进的伊斯兰教。从某种意义上说，这场竞争令人惊讶，因为两者都有各自的元素。绝大多数阿拉伯人都是穆斯林，阿拉伯历史上最辉煌的时期发生在令人眼花缭乱的中世纪伊斯兰帝国时期。同样，所有穆斯林，无论是温和派还是激进派，都不得不承认阿拉伯人在其宗教中的核心作用。毕竟，伊斯兰教诞生于阿拉伯半岛，先知穆罕默德是阿拉伯人，上帝的信息是用阿拉伯语启示的。人们会认为这两个社会运动将共享一种合作关系。相反，它是彻头彻尾的敌对。从胡斯里到纳西尔和 A.aq 的阿拉伯民族主义者都接受了伊斯兰教所占据的特殊地位

content_units.text: Habash) to lead the youth of Muhamed. See Said, Iraq 8 Shibat, 1963 (Iraq of 8 Febru­ary, 1963), p. 308. within the Arab nationalist movement,33 but stressed only those aspects of Islam that were moral and spiritual in nature. They reso­lutely rejected Islams political and constitutional implications, and insisted on its complete subordination to Arab nationalism. The nationalists vehemently argued that it was not religious, but lin­guistic and historical, ties that would knit the Arab nation into a cohesive whole.
content_units.azure_translation: 哈巴什）来领导穆罕默德的青年。见Said， Iraq 8 Shibat， 1963 （Iraq of 8 February， 1963）， p. 308.在阿拉伯民族主义运动中，33 但只强调伊斯兰教的那些道德和精神方面。他们坚决拒绝伊斯兰教的政治和宪法影响，并坚持使其完全服从于阿拉伯民族主义。民族主义者强烈争辩说，将阿拉伯民族编织成一个有凝聚力的整体的不是宗教联系，而是语言和历史联系。

See Mir Basri, Alam al-Adab . al-Iraq al-Hadith (Eminent men of letters in modern Iraq), two volumes, (London: Dar al-Hikma, 1994). It is instructive to see how many Shiites .gure in Basris comprehensive list of Iraqi men of letters.

This of course was sheer blasphemy to the radical Muslim groups, and nationalists became the target of these groups jihad. The concept of jihad, holy struggle, was central to the lexicon of Islamic militancy. Jihad was to be waged against the perceived ene­mies of Islam, those who would try to infuse Muslim society with alien and blasphemous ideas, imported primarily from the West. And to the Muslim radicals, the secular nationalists, who propa­gated ethnicity at the expense of religion and advocated the separa­tion of Islam from politics, were perhaps the greatest offenders.
content_units.azure_translation: 这当然是对激进穆斯林团体的纯粹亵渎，民族主义者成为这些团体圣战的目标。圣战，即神圣斗争的概念，是伊斯兰激进主义词汇的核心。圣战将针对被认为是伊斯兰教的敌人，这些人试图向穆斯林社会注入主要从西方进口的外来和亵渎思想。对于穆斯林激进分子来说，以牺牲宗教为代价传播种族并主张将伊斯兰教与政治分离的世俗民族主义者可能是最大的罪魁祸首。

content_units.text: Islamic militancy made little headway among an Arab popula­tion .red by the premises and promises of secular Arab national­ism, but as the sun set on nationalism, it rose on Islamic militancy. This does not mean that there had been no manifest Islamic op­position in the 1950s and 1960s. Indeed there was. But its po­tency, both objectively and in the eyes of those whom it challenged, took a mammoth qualitative leap as nationalism nursed its fatal wounds after 1967. In the last three decades of the twentieth cen­tury, radical Islam became the main opposition force to Arab leaders, many of whom professed nationalist credentials. The Is­lamiyoun (as the Islamic radicals called themselves) mounted chal­lenges to Arab governments throughout the Middle East, the most notable of which were against the Bathist government in Iraq in the late 1970s, the other Bathists in Syria in the 1980s, Algerian secular leaderships in the 1990s, and successive Egyptian govern­ments during all of the three decades. The rejuvenation of Islam as a radical political alternative robbed nationalism of whatever chance of recovery it might have entertained after 1967. Arab na­tionalism found itself squeezed out from the political arena by the dominance of wataniya at the of.cial state level and radical Islam at the popular level.
content_units.azure_translation: 伊斯兰激进主义在阿拉伯民众中几乎没有取得任何进展，因为世俗阿拉伯民族主义的前提和承诺而红了，但随着民族主义的日落，它因伊斯兰激进主义而兴起。这并不意味着在1950年代和1960年代没有明显的伊斯兰反对派。确实有。但随着民族主义在 1967 年之后的致命伤的创伤，无论是客观上还是在它所挑战的人眼中，它的力量都发生了巨大的质的飞跃。在20世纪的最后三十年里，激进的伊斯兰教成为阿拉伯领导人的主要反对力量，其中许多人自称是民族主义的资历。伊斯兰激进分子自称的伊斯兰教徒（伊斯兰激进分子自称）向整个中东的阿拉伯政府发起挑战，其中最引人注目的是 1970 年代后期针对伊拉克的巴斯派政府、1980 年代针对叙利亚的其他巴斯派政府、1990 年代的阿尔及利亚世俗领导层以及整整三十年来历届埃及政府。伊斯兰教作为激进政治替代方案的复兴剥夺了民族主义在 1967 年之后可能拥有的任何复苏机会。阿拉伯民族主义发现自己被 wataniya 在国家层面的统治地位和激进伊斯兰教在民众层面的统治地位挤出了政治舞台。

content_units.text: See Walid Khadduri, al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya wa al-Dimuqratiya: Murajaa Naq­diya, (Arab nationalism and democracy: a critical review) al-Mustaqbal al-Arabi, no. 228 (February 1998): 45.

But why did Arab nationalism fall prey so easily to these other emerging political forces? How could an ideology, once so mighty, collapse and disintegrate because of a few setbacks? Did Arab na­tionalism, while projecting an image of invincibility, actually lack inner strength and vitality? These questions were asked many times, and many answers were given. R. Stephen Humphreys hints at perhaps the most compelling answer:
content_units.azure_translation: 但为什么阿拉伯民族主义如此容易成为这些其他新兴政治力量的牺牲品呢？一个曾经如此强大的意识形态，怎么会因为一些挫折而崩溃和瓦解？阿拉伯民族主义在投射出不可战胜的形象的同时，实际上是否缺乏内在的力量和活力？这些问题被问了很多次，也给出了许多答案。R. Stephen Humphreys 暗示了也许最令人信服的答案：

content_units.text: Arab nationalist thinkers . . . had looked at the crucial problem con­fronting them and their people as one of identity rather than as one of institutions. The question was, who is an Arab, not how can the Arabs build a common political life and effective institutions of gov­ernment? . . . Very few writers asked seriously how [the projected Arab] state would be constituted, how the relationships among its many disparate regions were to be de.ned, and how different social groups would be represented within the political system.34
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义思想家......将他们及其人民面临的关键问题视为身份问题而不是制度问题。问题是，谁是阿拉伯人，而不是阿拉伯人如何建立共同的政治生活和有效的政府机构？. . .很少有作家认真地问过[计划中的阿拉伯]国家将如何组成，其许多不同地区之间的关系将如何确定，以及不同的社会群体将如何在政治体系中得到代表34。

content_units.text: Although Humphreys does not spell it out, what is implied here is that the inability of Arab nationalism to survive political setbacks was at least partly due to the disinterest of its custodians in creating workable democratic institutions.35 In a democracy, chief execu­tives derive their authority from the constitutional legitimacy of the political system, yet authoritarian systems elevate their political leaders to positions of dominance over the legal-institutional struc­ture, thus making the legitimacy of the political system and its val­ues dependent solely on the leaders credibility. In other words, when an authoritarian leader falls, the systems ideology and values become singularly vulnerable, since they are not underpinned by constitutional arrangements independent of the leader. On the other hand, democratic systems and their values transcend the per­sonality, policies, and / or survival of their political leaders. The old European dictum the King is dead, long live the King denoted if not necessarily constitutional, then at least procedural, legitimacy. Later with the spread of popular democracy, the dictum would ac­quire constitutional substance by signifying the continued legiti­macy of the political institutions regardless of its leader.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管汉弗莱斯没有详细说明，但这里暗示的是，阿拉伯民族主义无法在政治挫折中幸存下来，至少部分是由于其守护者对创建可行的民主制度不感兴趣。35 在民主国家，行政长官的权力来自政治制度的宪法合法性，但专制制度将其政治领导人提升到对法律制度结构的主导地位， 因此，政治制度及其价值观的合法性完全取决于领导人的信誉。换句话说，当独裁领导人倒台时，制度意识形态和价值观就会变得非常脆弱，因为它们没有独立于领导人的宪法安排的支撑。另一方面，民主制度及其价值观超越了政治领导人的个性、政策和/或生存。古老的欧洲格言“国王已经死了，国王万岁”所表示的即使不一定是宪法的，那么至少是程序上的合法性。后来随着大众民主的传播，该格言将通过表示政治机构的持续合法性而获得宪法实质，无论其领导人如何。
