Saad al-Din Ibrahim, et al. (Beirut, Lebanon: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1983), p. 13.

Nationalism operated throughout its glory days in a sea of au­thoritarianism, and this happened not because of some unfortunate circumstance. Indeed, it was the way Arab nationalism was de.ned and developed which was to blame, if not wholly then at least partially, for the absence of democracy. And when nationalism was to .nally collapse, there were precious few institutions to come to its rescue.
content_units.azure_translation: 民族主义在其辉煌时期一直在专制主义的海洋中运作，而这并不是因为某种不幸的情况而发生的。事实上，正是阿拉伯民族主义的衰落和发展方式是缺乏民主的罪魁祸首，即使不是完全的，也至少是部分的。当民族主义即将崩溃时，很少有机构可以拯救它。

content_units.text: We have seen that the tenets of Arab nationalism, as formulated by Sati al-Husri, re.ected the ideas of nineteenth-century German cultural nationalism. To German nationalist thinkers, unifying the nation was the supreme goal and a sacred act, which necessitated subsuming individual will into the national will.36 Notions of lib­erty or freedom were distractions, and when they contradicted the national will, they had to be repressed. How else would the emi­nent German historian, Heinrich von Trietschke justify the annex­ation in 1871 of the German-speaking population of Alsace, the majority of whom wanted to remain politically within France. We desire, Trietschke says in a chilling tone, even against their will, to restore them to themselves.37
content_units.azure_translation: 我们已经看到，萨蒂·胡斯里（Sati al-Husri）提出的阿拉伯民族主义信条重新连接了19世纪德国文化民族主义的思想。对于德国民族主义思想家来说，统一国家是最高目标和神圣行为，它必须将个人意志纳入国家意志。36 自由或自由的概念会分散注意力，当它们与国家意志相矛盾时，它们就必须被压制。否则，著名的德国历史学家海因里希·冯·特里奇克 （Heinrich von Trietschke） 如何证明 1871 年吞并阿尔萨斯德语人口是合理的，其中大多数人希望在政治上留在法国境内。特里奇克用一种令人不寒而栗的语气说，即使违背他们的意愿，我们也希望让他们恢复原状。37

content_units.text: This authoritarian and coercive streak in the tenets of German cultural nationalism was reinforced in the wake of the Prussian defeat at the hands of Napoleon at Jenna in 1806. The word liberty was indeed resurrected, but it was endowed with a meaning quite different from the one used by the English and French. English and French nationalisms were the ideological responses to indigenous efforts to liberalize the absolutist state and create a liberal and vir­tuous society. German nationalism, on the other hand, peaked in the aftermath of the war with France. Its goals were not to
content_units.azure_translation: 1806 年普鲁士在珍娜战败于拿破仑之手后，德国文化民族主义信条中的这种专制和胁迫倾向得到了加强。自由这个词确实复活了，但它被赋予了与英国和法国人使用的含义截然不同的含义。英国和法国的民族主义是对土著人为使专制国家自由化和创造一个自由和有道德的社会所做的努力的意识形态回应。另一方面，德国民族主义在与法国的战争后达到顶峰。它的目标不是

content_units.text: Elie Kedourie, Nationalism (London: Hutchinson University Library, 1960), p. 47.
Hans Kohn, The Ideas of Nationalism: A Study in its Origins and Background (New York: Macmillan, 1944), p. 582.

. . . secure better government, individual liberty, and due process of law, but . . . to drive out a foreign ruler and to secure national independence. The word liberty did not mean primarily, as it did for the western peoples the assertion of the rights of the individual against his government, but of the independence of the nation against foreign rule.... When the western peoples strove for regen­eration, they were primarily concerned with individual liberty; in central and eastern Europe the demand for regeneration often cen­tered on the unity and power of the group.38
content_units.azure_translation: . . .确保更好的政府、个人自由和正当法律程序，但是......赶走外国统治者并确保国家独立。自由这个词的主要意思不是像西方人民那样主张个人反对政府的权利，而是国家独立反对外国统治......当西方民族为重生而奋斗时，他们主要关心的是个人自由;在中欧和东欧，对复兴的需求往往集中在群体的团结和权力上38。

content_units.text: This was the intellectual legacy upon which Husri was to build his theory of the Arab nation. Arab nationalism, until its .nal de­cline late in the twentieth century, continued to re.ect the tenets of German cultural nationalism. Arab nationalists would advocate the rejuvenation of the Arab nation, its political unity, its secular­ism, and its sovereignty. Yet, re.ecting the illiberal connotations of cultural nationalism, Arab nationalists would have little to say about personal liberty and freedom. Husri once said that the form of government was of no great interest to him . . . public attention should focus on the problem of unity: it [was] the national duty of every Arab to support the leader who is capable of achieving Arab unity.39 On the rare occasions when advocates of Arab national­ism spoke of personal liberty, they were quick to emphasize that the priority of the committed Arab nationalist cannot be his personal liberty, but his nations well being. In the words of Husri himself: patriotism and nationalism before and above all . . . even above and before freedom.40 As we have seen, this illiberal streak in Husris political ideas were aimed especially at those Arabic-speak­ ing people who did not share his views, and who might have been less than ablaze with exuberance at the prospect of being called Arabs. Husris response is uncompromising: under no circum­stances should we say: as long as [an Arab] does not wish to be an Arab, and as long as he is disdainful of his Arabism, then he is not an Arab. He is an Arab whether he wishes to be one or not. Whether ignorant, indifferent, undutiful, or disloyal, he is an Arab, but an Arab without feelings or consciousness, and perhaps even without conscience.41
content_units.azure_translation: 这是胡斯里建立阿拉伯民族理论的知识遗产。阿拉伯民族主义，直到20世纪末逐渐衰落，继续重申德国文化民族主义的信条。阿拉伯民族主义者会主张阿拉伯民族的复兴、政治统一、世俗主义和主权。然而，考虑到文化民族主义的非自由内涵，阿拉伯民族主义者对个人自由和自由几乎没有什么可说的。胡斯里曾经说过，政府的形式对他来说并不感兴趣......公众的注意力应该集中在团结问题上：支持有能力实现阿拉伯团结的领导人是每个阿拉伯人的国家责任。39 在阿拉伯民族主义的倡导者在极少数情况下谈到个人自由时，他们很快强调，坚定的阿拉伯民族主义者的首要任务不是他的个人自由，而是他的国家的福祉。用胡斯里本人的话来说：爱国主义和民族主义首先是......甚至高于自由之前。40 正如我们所见，胡斯里政治思想中的这种不自由主义倾向特别针对那些讲阿拉伯语的人，他们不同意他的观点，他们可能对被称为阿拉伯人的前景没有那么兴奋。胡斯里斯的回应是毫不妥协的：在任何情况下，我们都不应该说：只要[阿拉伯人]不想成为阿拉伯人，只要他蔑视他的阿拉伯主义，那么他就不是阿拉伯人。无论他是否愿意成为阿拉伯人，他都是阿拉伯人。无论是无知的、冷漠的、不尽职的还是不忠诚的，他都是一个阿拉伯人，但是一个没有感情或意识的阿拉伯人，甚至可能没有良知。41

Husri did not offer remedies, speci.c methods by which Arabs without conscience would be, in Trietschkes words, restored to themselves. Michel A.aq was not so coy. A.aq, founder and philosopher of the Bath Party, whose writings bear the unmistak­able in.uence of Husris ideas, candidly identi.ed cruelty as the most reliable instrument to affect the desired transformation: When we are cruel to others, we know that our cruelty is in order to bring them back to their true selves, of which they are igno­rant.42 Indeed, A.aq de.ned cruelty in this context as prescribed by the nationalists love for his people.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里没有提供补救措施，用特里奇克斯的话说，没有良心的阿拉伯人可以通过这些方法恢复自我。米歇尔·A.aq 就没那么腼腆了。A.aq 是巴斯党的创始人和哲学家，他的著作明确无误地带有胡斯里斯思想的意义，他坦率地认为残忍是影响所需转变的最可靠工具：当我们对他人残忍时，我们知道我们的残忍是为了让他们回到他们所不知道的真实自我。42 事实上，在这种情况下，A.aq 民族主义者对他的人民的爱所规定的残忍行为。

content_units.text: Husris nationalist beliefs were of course carried into the 1950s and 1960s, becoming the clarion call for the nationalist avalanche of those two decades. By then, Arab cultural nationalism had emerged triumphant over other competing ideologies and identi­ties, capturing the hearts and minds of that quintessentially nation­alist generation, a generation that fervently believed in Arab na­tionalism as the vehicle by which a glittering past would be transformed into a distinguished future. But that was easier said than done. The task ahead was fraught with untold dif.culties and obstacles: there were the foreign powers still in control of much Arab land; there was the Arabs own lethargy and lack of purpose; there were the political divisions, arti.cially created, so nationalists believed, but clearly gaining acceptance and legitimacy with the passage of time; and there were all those regional, sectarian and tribal identities, which to the Arab nationalists were products of false consciousness encouraged and perpetuated by the colonial­ists and imperialists. This was to be a titanic struggle, and as the nationalists embarked upon it, they naturally had little patience for words such as liberty, freedom, and democracy.43 What need was there to listen to another point of view, to argue a contrary perspec­tive? Would it not be a distraction, a diversion from the course of the struggle? Were all Arabs not united in their one sacred endeavor to effect an organic unity of their lands and their peoples, and to free them of Western domination? How could there be a contrary position to that?
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里民族主义信仰当然被延续到 1950 年代和 1960 年代，成为这二十年民族主义雪崩的号角。到那时，阿拉伯文化民族主义已经战胜了其他相互竞争的意识形态和身份，俘获了典型的民族主义一代人的心，这一代人热切地相信阿拉伯民族主义是将辉煌的过去转变为杰出未来的工具。但这说起来容易做起来难。未来的任务充满了难以言喻的困难和障碍：外国势力仍然控制着许多阿拉伯土地;阿拉伯人本身就昏昏欲睡，缺乏目标;民族主义者认为，存在着人为制造的政治分歧，但随着时间的推移显然获得了接受和合法性;还有所有这些地区、宗派和部落的身份，对阿拉伯民族主义者来说，这些都是殖民主义者和帝国主义者鼓励和延续的错误意识的产物。这将是一场巨大的斗争，当民族主义者开始斗争时，他们自然对自由、自由和民主等词语缺乏耐心。43 有什么必要听取另一种观点，争论相反的观点呢？这难道不是一种分散注意力，偏离了斗争的进程吗？难道所有阿拉伯人不是团结起来，共同努力实现他们的土地和人民的有机统一，并将他们从西方的统治中解放出来吗？怎么会有相反的立场呢？

content_units.text: Abu Khaldun Sati al-Husri, Abhath Mukhtara . al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya (Selected studies on Arab nationalism) (Beirut: Markaz Dirasat al-Wuhda al-Arabiya, 1985), p. 80.

Michel A.aq, Fi Sabil al Bath (For the sake of resurrection) (Beirut: Dar al-Taliah, 1963), pp. 161162; also Kanan Makiya, Republic of Fear: The Politics of Modern Iraq (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1998), p. 206.

Not only had Husris intellectual tradition sunk well into the nationalist psyche, but it was af.rmed and accentuated by the po­litical circumstances of the era. The nationalist generation of the 1950s and 1960s came to believe fervently that the West would purposely and effectively block the goals of Arab nationalism, that it would see the nationalist vision of an independent and assertive Arab nation as a perilous move against Western economic and po­litical interests in the area. The nationalist struggle, therefore, be­came essentially a struggle against the West.
content_units.azure_translation: 胡斯里斯的知识传统不仅深深地融入了民族主义的心理，而且还被那个时代的政治环境所影响和加剧。1950年代和1960年代的民族主义一代开始热切地相信，西方将有目的地有效地阻止阿拉伯民族主义的目标，它将把一个独立和自信的阿拉伯民族的民族主义愿景视为违背西方在该地区的经济和政治利益的危险举动。因此，民族主义斗争本质上变成了反对西方的斗争。

content_units.text: In the midst of this nationalist ferment emerged the charismatic Nasir. And he would vilify the West as the uncommonly per.dious other, the undying nemesis of the Arabs, the determined obstacle to their progress. In .ery speeches, Nasir would remind Arabs con­tinuously of their glorious history and of their military and intellec­tual superiority over the West. All the catch phrases of Husris cul­tural nationalism were there: The glory of the Arabs heritage, the excellence and originality of their forefathers, the overwhelming power of the Arabs when they were united, their ensuing weakness as they quarreled and dissolved into many small entities, and the necessity to unite now in order to be free and strong again.
content_units.azure_translation: 在这种民族主义的发酵中，出现了富有魅力的纳西尔。他会诋毁西方，认为西方是异常顽固的他者，是阿拉伯人不朽的克星，是他们进步的坚定障碍。在演讲中，纳西尔会不断提醒阿拉伯人他们辉煌的历史以及他们相对于西方的军事和智力优势。胡斯里文化民族主义的所有口号都在那里：阿拉伯人遗产的荣耀，他们祖先的卓越和独创性，阿拉伯人团结时的压倒性力量，他们随之而来的弱点，因为他们争吵并分解成许多小实体，以及现在团结起来才能再次自由和强大。

content_units.text: Khadduri, al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya wa al-Dimuqratiya (Arab nationalism and de­mocracy), p. 42.

In promising the Arabs freedom, Nasir echoed Husris concep­tion; it was not personal freedom and liberty, rather, it was freedom from Western domination. Liberal democracy had no place in this new order.44 Nasir did not offer it; he disdained it. The separation of powers, he once said, is nothing but a big deception, because there really is no such thing as the separation of powers.45 But neither did the nationalist multitude in those heady days ask for democracy, let alone demand it. The illiberal intellectual tradition of cultural nationalism, combined with the anti-Western struggle, which had reached a crescendo in the 1950s and 1960s, necessitat­ing in the minds of most Arabs the centralization of power, contrib­uted to the emergence of Nasirs popular and populist, yet singu­larly authoritarian, rule.
content_units.azure_translation: 在向阿拉伯人承诺自由时，纳西尔呼应了胡斯里斯的构想;这不是个人自由和自由，而是摆脱西方统治的自由。自由民主在这个新秩序中没有立足之地。44 纳西尔没有提供它;他不屑一顾。他曾经说过，三权分立只不过是一个很大的骗局，因为真的没有三权分立这样的东西。45 但是，在那些令人陶醉的日子里，民族主义的群众也没有要求民主，更不用说要求民主了。文化民族主义的非自由主义知识传统，加上在1950年代和1960年代达到高潮的反西方斗争，在大多数阿拉伯人的思想中需要权力集中，促成了纳西尔的出现，这种流行和民粹主义，但却是独裁的统治。

content_units.text: The Bath Party, the other leader of the Arab nationalist march, followed a parallel route. The custodians of Bathist ideology fo­cused their intellectual energies on Arab unity and the anti­imperialist struggle, but said little about democratic institutions. While the constitution of the Bath Party did assert the principle of the peoples sovereignty and Bathist support for a constitutional elective system, it also gave the Party and the ensuing Bathist state the central role in determining the scope and extent of political freedoms. From the very beginning, A.aqs ideas were endowed with a strong statist strain [in which] individual self-realization [would] derive from participation in the general will of the commu­nity.46 From then on, freedom on the whole would be associ­ated with the struggle against imperialism rather than with individ­ ual liberty.47 This illiberal orientation would be reinforced during the Partys .irtation with political power in the 1950s and early 1960s, so that in the Partys Sixth National Congress held in 1963, the Bath would reject unequivocally the notion of liberal parlia­mentarianism, espousing instead the Soviet concept of democratic centralism linked to the Partys role as the vanguard political institution in the state.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义游行的另一位领导人巴斯党也走了一条平行路线。巴斯主义意识形态的守护者将他们的知识精力集中在阿拉伯团结和反帝国主义斗争上，但对民主制度却很少提及。虽然巴斯党的宪法确实维护了人民主权的原则和巴斯派对宪法选举制度的支持，但它也赋予了该党和随后的巴斯派国家在确定政治自由的范围和程度方面的核心作用。从一开始，A.aqs 的思想就被赋予了强烈的国家主义压力，其中个人的自我实现将源于参与社区的普遍意志。46 从那时起，自由总体上将与反对帝国主义的斗争联系在一起，而不是与个人的自由联系在一起。47 这种非自由主义倾向在 1950 年代和 1960 年代初的政党掌握政治权力期间得到加强，因此，在 1963 年举行的党的第六次全国代表大会上，巴斯将明确拒绝自由议会制的概念， 相反，拥护苏联的民主集中制概念，该概念与党作为国家先锋政治机构的作用有关。

The misfortunes of liberal democracy in the Arab world were compounded by its association with the pro-Western forces in the area. To the nationalist, it was not only Israel which was the pup­pet of the West, but also, and perhaps more galling to the nation­alist cause, the status-quo, traditional Arab elites. The nationalists charged that these elites, in Saudi Arabia, Lebanon, Jordan, and in pre-republican Egypt and Iraq, were totally dependent on the Western powers for their survival. And in return for Western pa­tronage and protection, the traditional elites were doing the Wests bidding in the area. The central and most repeated element of Na­sirs assault against the enemies of Arab nationalism was this perceived association with Western imperialism. And his extensive and ever-hungry propaganda machine quickly took the hint. They mounted a relentless and on the whole vicious campaign against the Arab friends of the West, labeling them all as the lackeys of imperialism. The leaders of monarchical Iraq had no right to speak on the affairs of their own country, because they spoke on behalf of Western imperialism.48 The Christian president of Leba­non had no right to speak on behalf of Arab Christians because he was an underling of the West.49 As for King Husayn of Jordan, a favorite target of Egyptian propaganda, he was reminded of the assassination of his grandfather by a Palestinian, then allowed omi­

The problem for democracy was that this antipathy to Western imperialism translated into a hostility not only to the policies of the West, but also to its institutions. A number of pro-Western Arab countries had adopted parliamentary systems which were modeled on the British or French political systems. Egypt, Iraq, and Jordan had parliaments and legislative councils since the 1920s, and Syria and Lebanon immediately after they gained their independence in the wake of World War II. By the second half of the 1940s and early 1950s, all of these countries had experimented with various forms of multiparty politics. Admittedly, theirs were by no means true liberal democracies when judged by Western standards. There were, of course, cases of rigged elections, harassment of opposition parties, institution of emergency laws, and the like. But, when all was said and done, these systems still were far more open and far more civil than those subsequently instituted by the nationalist gen­eration. Take the case of the press in Egypt and in Iraq. In pre­revolutionary Egypt, Cairo boasted fourteen dailies and twenty-three weeklies, and Alexandria, Egypts second largest city, had fourteen dailies and seven weeklies. All were either privately owned or belonged to political parties, which made for a vibrant and free­wheeling press. In monarchical Iraq, one year before the 1958 mili­tary coup which toppled the monarchy and created a nationalist government, fourteen nongovernment newspapers were published in Baghdad, .ve in Mosul, and four in Basrah. While the govern­ment would occasionally ban a newspaper for a particularly viru­lent attack, the ban typically would last for a short period and the paper would duly reappear. After the Egyptian and Iraqi nationalist revolutions, the press came under strict government control, and in both countries a handful of state-owned dailies were published, distinguished from each other only by the title on the front page.
content_units.azure_translation: 民主的问题在于，这种对西方帝国主义的反感不仅转化为对西方政策的敌意，而且转化为对西方制度的敌意。一些亲西方的阿拉伯国家采用了仿照英国或法国政治制度的议会制度。埃及、伊拉克和约旦自 1920 年代以来就有了议会和立法委员会，叙利亚和黎巴嫩在二战后立即获得独立后就有了议会和立法委员会。到 1940 年代后半期和 1950 年代初，所有这些国家都尝试了各种形式的多党政治。诚然，以西方标准衡量，他们的国家绝不是真正的自由民主国家。当然，也有纵选举、骚扰反对党、制定紧急状态法等案件。但是，总而言之，这些制度仍然比民族主义一代后来建立的制度更加开放和文明。以埃及和伊拉克的新闻界为例。在革命前的埃及，开罗拥有 14 份日报和 23 份周刊，埃及第二大城市亚历山大港拥有 14 份日报和 7 份周刊。所有这些都要么是私人拥有的，要么属于政党，这使得新闻界充满活力和随心所欲。在君主制的伊拉克，在1958年推翻君主制并建立民族主义政府的军事政变前一年，巴格达出版了14份非政府报纸，摩苏尔出版了4份非政府报纸，巴士拉出版了4份。虽然政府偶尔会因为特别恶毒的攻击而禁止报纸，但禁令通常会持续很短的时间，报纸会及时重新出现。埃及和伊拉克民族主义革命后，新闻界受到政府的严格控制，两国都出版了少数国有日报，仅通过头版的标题来区分彼此。

Similarly, while in the pre-Nasirist era, the concept of competi­tive political parties was admittedly neither universally nor uni­formly applicable, the nationalist generation in the 1950s and 1960s endeavored to de-legitimize the very concept itself. For in­stance, one of the favorite slogans shouted by rioters and demon­strators in celebration of the demise of Iraqs monarchy in July 1958 was al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya tufny al-Ahzab al Gharbiya (Arab nationalism exterminates the Western political parties). It was not just that there was no need for different parties with differ­ent visions, since all Arabs supposedly adhered to one unifying vi­sion, namely, the nationalist creed. It was more pernicious: political parties would undermine the nationalist march; they would sow divisions in Arab ranks; they would become .fth columns for greedy outside powers. Nasir argued that these parties would not subordinate their own interests to the general good,51 particularly in the underdeveloped world, still suffering from social cleavages and foreign domination.52 Hence, if political parties were allowed in Egypt, Nasir charged, they would act merely as agents for the intelligence services of the various imperialist powers.53 Bathist writers and activists echoed this sentiment in their development of the Partys ideology and political orientations, both of which exhibited mounting disdain for a Western-inspired multiparty sys­tem. In a sense, the position of Nasir and the Bath was essentially a fusion of the existential element of anti-Westernism with the intel­lectual legacy of cultural nationalism. The result was the elimina­tion of multiparty systems, and their replacement with unitary po­litical institutions, whose function was purely to mobilize.
content_units.azure_translation: 同样，虽然在纳西尔主义之前的时代，竞争性政党的概念诚然既不普遍也不统一适用，但 1950 年代和 1960 年代的民族主义一代试图使这一概念本身失去合法性。例如，1958 年 7 月，骚乱者和示威者为庆祝伊拉克君主制的消亡而喊出的最受欢迎的口号之一是 al-Qawmiya al-Arabiya tufny al-Ahzab al Gharbiya（阿拉伯民族主义消灭西方政党）。这不仅仅是因为不需要具有不同愿景的不同政党，因为所有阿拉伯人都应该坚持一个统一的愿景，即民族主义信条。它更有害：政党会破坏民族主义游行;他们会在阿拉伯队伍中挑拨分裂;它们将成为贪婪的外部势力的第 .fth 列。纳西尔认为，这些政党不会将自己的利益服从于公共利益，51 特别是在仍然遭受社会分裂和外国统治的欠发达国家。52 因此，纳西尔指控说，如果埃及允许政党成立，它们将只是充当各个帝国主义列强情报部门的代理人。53 巴斯派作家和活动家在发展党的意识形态和政治取向时也呼应了这种观点， 两者都对受西方启发的多党制表现出越来越大的蔑视。从某种意义上说，纳西尔和巴斯的立场本质上是反西方主义的存在主义元素与文化民族主义的知识遗产的融合。其结果是取消了多党制，取而代之的是单一政治机构，其功能纯粹是动员。

Most damaging was the loss of Nasirs charisma, which not only had cemented Arab nationalism, but also contributed to the legitimation of its authoritarian character and institutions. After 1967, Arab nationalism needed more than the practices and policies of old to sustain it. Political representation and participa­tion, freedom of expression and the rule of law, all of them woefully absent, could have provided the essential and much needed nour­ishment to resuscitate the ailing ideology. But the post-1967 Arab leaders, most of whom had come to prominence armed with the premises of Arab nationalism, shared Nasirs hunger for absolute power, but lacked his charismatic hold on the people. Under them, authoritarianism became ever harsher and more brutal. The unfor­giving totalitarianism of these nationalist leaders would further alienate the people from Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: ti.ed 它。最具破坏性的是纳西尔魅力的丧失，这不仅巩固了阿拉伯民族主义，而且还促进了其专制性质和制度的合法化。1967年之后，阿拉伯民族主义需要的不仅仅是旧的做法和政策来维持它。政治代表权和参与、言论自由和法治，所有这些都令人遗憾地缺失，但本可以提供必要和急需的营养，以复兴这种病态的意识形态。但 1967 年后的阿拉伯领导人，其中大多数人都是以阿拉伯民族主义为前提而声名鹊起的，他们与纳西尔一样渴望绝对权力，但缺乏他对人民的魅力。在他们的领导下，威权主义变得更加严酷和残酷。这些民族主义领导人的无情极权主义将进一步疏远人民对阿拉伯民族主义。

content_units.text: Spurning the democratic route, some of the authoritarian Arab rulers did indeed endeavor, rather inadvertently, to help the cause of Arab nationalism. They did this through the threat and use of physical violence, something that came naturally to them. At vari­ous times during the second half of the twentieth century, a number of Arab countries either threatened, or embarked on, military oper­ations against other Arab countries. Invariably, these ventures were undertaken for reasons that had little to do with Arab nationalism, but they might have led to the emergence of a dominant power that could forcibly unite the Arab world. The intervention of regional and international forces doomed these ventures to certain failure. Had they been successful, however, they could have become the stepping stones for the achievement of Arab unity, the ultimate goal of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 一些独裁的阿拉伯统治者摒弃了民主路线，确实在无意中试图帮助阿拉伯民族主义事业。他们通过威胁和使用身体暴力来做到这一点，这对他们来说是自然而然的。在20世纪下半叶的不同时期，一些阿拉伯国家要么威胁要对其他阿拉伯国家采取军事行动，要么开始对其他阿拉伯国家采取军事行动。这些冒险总是出于与阿拉伯民族主义无关的原因而进行的，但它们可能导致一个可以强行团结阿拉伯世界的主导力量的出现。地区和国际力量的干预注定了这些冒险的失败。然而，如果它们成功了，它们本可以成为实现阿拉伯统一的垫脚石，这是阿拉伯民族主义的最终目标。

content_units.text: This is the essence of an intriguingly original argument advanced by Ian Lustick54 that rests on a simple question: what explains the absence of an Arab great power? The answer, Lustick maintains, lies in a comparison of the Arab situation with that of Europe be­ tween the thirteenth and nineteenth centuries. That period of Euro­pean history saw the consolidation of states at the expense of smaller entities, so that between 1500 and 1900, the number of independent polities had shrunk by a factor of twenty! And this came about not because of natural atrophy or peoples desire for amalgamation, but as a result of war. Losers disappeared; winners became larger and stronger, and sought further conquests.55 Lustick describes this violence-based integrative process as it occurred in a few of the more obvious cases:
content_units.azure_translation: 这就是伊恩·卢斯蒂克（Ian Lustick）54提出的一个有趣的原创论点的本质，该论点基于一个简单的问题：是什么解释了阿拉伯大国的缺席？卢斯蒂克认为，答案在于将阿拉伯的情况与十三世纪和十九世纪的欧洲情况进行比较。欧洲历史的那段时期见证了国家的合并，而牺牲了较小的实体，因此在 1500 年至 1900 年间，独立政体的数量缩减了 20 倍！而这并不是因为自然萎缩或人们渴望合并，而是战争的结果。失败者消失了;胜利者变得更大、更强大，并寻求进一步的征服。55 卢斯蒂克描述了这种基于暴力的整合过程，因为它发生在一些更明显的案例中：

content_units.text: Ian S. Lustick, The Absence of Middle Eastern Great Powers: Political Backward­ness in Historical Perspective, International Organization, vol. 51, no. 4 (Autumn 1997): 653683.

In Britain the wars of Alfred the Great and of the Plantagenet and Tudor monarchs [created] the United Kingdom. In France, wars con­ducted by Capetian and Valois kings from the Ile de France pro­duced, over centuries, the great state we know as France. In Russia the czars fought wars of expansion and repression to join Slavic terri­tories west of the Urals and vast expanses of Asia east of the Urals to the domain ruled from Muscovy. Using Prussia as a base, Bis­marckian diplomacy and a series of wars against Austria, France and others produced Germany. In Italy, Piedmont fought wars against Austria, sponsored Garibaldis landing in Sicily, and marched its army down the Italian peninsula to destroy the old Bourbon monar­chy, thereby eliminating the jealous rivalries among separate princi­palities and city-states that had for so long divided Italians.56
content_units.azure_translation: 在英国，阿尔弗雷德大帝、金雀花王朝和都铎王朝的战争[创建]了英国。在法国，几个世纪以来，来自法兰西岛的卡佩王朝和瓦卢瓦国王发动的战争产生了我们所熟知的伟大国家。在俄国，沙皇们进行了扩张和镇压战争，以将乌拉尔以西的斯拉夫领土和乌拉尔以东的广大亚洲领土与莫斯科统治的领地联系起来。以普鲁士为基地，俾斯麦外交和一系列针对奥地利、法国等国的战争造就了德国。在意大利，皮埃蒙特与奥地利发动战争，支持加里波第登陆西西里岛，并率军沿着意大利半岛进军，摧毁旧的波旁王朝君主制，从而消除了长期以来分裂意大利人的独立公国和城邦之间的嫉妒竞争56。

content_units.text: What made these forcible absorptions possible, Lustick contends, was the absence of actual or potential interference by outside pow­ers.57 By way of contrast, in the Middle East, the effect of great power intervention and enforcement of international norms has been . . . to prevent potential regional hegemons from exercising their relative capacities by conquering or otherwise coercively in­tegrating their neighbors.58
content_units.azure_translation: 卢斯蒂克认为，使这些强行吸收成为可能的原因在于没有外部势力的实际或潜在干预。57 相比之下，在中东，大国干预和执行国际准则的影响是......防止潜在的地区霸权通过征服或以其他方式强制整合邻国来行使其相对能力。58

content_units.text: How accurate is Lusticks contention! A case in point can be surmised from the events that occurred in the aftermath of the July
content_units.azure_translation: 卢斯蒂克的论点是多么准确！从 7 月之后发生的事件可以推测出一个恰当的例子

content_units.text: Iraqi revolution. Iraq had rid itself of the anti-Nasir, Hashem­ite mantle and was expected to immediately join Nasirs United Arab Republic (UAR). In those heady days of nationalist frenzy, the pro-Western, reactionary governments of Jordan and Lebanon were considered doomed by nationalists and others. No one doubted the imminent absorption of these two weak states into the UAR.59 Indeed, such was their predicament, that Nasir would not have needed to use military force. But those who waited for the inevitable to occur had not reckoned on the Wests determination to come up with a vigorous response to avert the complete elim­ination of Western in.uence in the Middle East.60 The day after the Iraqi revolution, American troops landed in Lebanon, to be followed two days later by British troops arriving in Jordan. And indeed, it is very dif.cult to see how these two regimes would have survived absorption into the UAR had it not been for the military intervention of the two outside powers.

Another relevant example was Egypts intervention in Yemen, which began in 1962. A successful intervention would not have amalgamated Yemen into Egypt; that never was Egypts goal. But it would have con.rmed Egypts role as the hegemon of the area; and by so doing, would have rekindled the nationalist spirit, allowing it to challenge Western interests more vigorously. And it could have been done on the cheap, or so Nasir thought at the beginning of the affair. Initially, the news could not have been more encouraging. A group of nationalist of.cers executed a military coup against an archaic and absolutist monarchy. The monarch had been killed and the of.cers seemed in control of the country. They asked Egypt for a symbolic military contribution, which they felt would deliver the coup de grace to any remaining monarchist sentiment. It would also demonstrate to one and all Egypts cen­trality and unrivaled prestige in the Arab world, and could under­mine the stability of Saudi Arabia and the other pro-Western re­gimes of the Arabian Peninsula.61 Nasir dispatched a battalion, which was expected to make no more than a courtesy call. He then sat back awaiting the glory that came with his painless gesture. Five years later he would withdraw a huge Egyptian army from Yemen, which at its peak had amounted to almost half of Egypts armed forces. Nasir would later lament: I sent a battalion, but I had to support it with seventy thousand soldiers!62 The symbolic gesture turned out to be Nasirs Vietnam.
content_units.azure_translation: 另一个相关例子是埃及对也门的干预，始于 1962 年。成功的干预不会将也门并入埃及;这从来都不是埃及的目标。但这将使埃及成为该地区的霸主;这样做会重新点燃民族主义精神，使其能够更积极地挑战西方利益。而且这本可以以便宜的价格完成，至少纳西尔在婚外情开始时是这么想的。最初，这个消息再令人鼓舞不过了。一群民族主义者发动了一场军事政变，反对一个古老的专制君主制。君主被杀了，of.cers 似乎控制了这个国家。他们要求埃及提供象征性的军事贡献，他们认为这将为任何剩余的君主主义情绪带来政变。它还将向所有埃及展示阿拉伯世界的中心地位和无与伦比的威望，并可能破坏沙特阿拉伯和阿拉伯半岛其他亲西方政权的稳定。61 纳西尔派出了一个营，预计该营只会进行礼节性拜访。然后他坐下来等待他无痛的姿态带来的荣耀。五年后，他将一支庞大的埃及军队从也门撤出，在鼎盛时期，这支军队几乎占埃及武装部队的一半。纳西尔后来感叹道：我派了一个营，却要用七万士兵来支援！62 这个象征性的手势原来是纳西尔越南。

How did that happen? Admittedly, there were purely local rea­sons that had little to do with outside interference: the support ac­corded to the coup in the cities was not reciprocated among the warlike northern tribes, and contrary to Republican claims, Imam Badr, Yemens monarch had not been killed. The Imam was able to escape and made his way to the .ercely loyal tribes. But crucially, the monarchist forces were able to receive, throughout the .ve years of Egyptian involvement, consistent and substantial logistical, mili­tary, and material support from Saudi Arabia and its Western back­ers. Huge arms deals with Britain and the United States bolstered Saudi Arabias army and air force,63 and as a signal to the Egyp­tians, British pilots even .ew the newly acquired combat aircrafts for a while.64 All this allowed the Saudis to dispatch planeloads of arms to the monarchists, and as a result the Egyptian army became bogged down in an unwinnable war that cost Egypt thousands of lives and millions of dollars.65 There can be little doubt that the failure of Egypts venture in Yemen was due in no small measure to the commitment of outside powers not to afford Nasir the oppor­ tunity to expand his power, and possibly his domain, at the expense of such local actors as Yemen and Saudi Arabia.
content_units.azure_translation: 这是怎么发生的？诚然，纯粹是当地原因，与外部干预无关：好战的北方部落对城市政变的支持没有得到回报，与共和党的说法相反，也门君主伊玛目巴德尔没有被杀。伊玛目得以逃脱并前往忠诚的部落。但至关重要的是，在埃及参与的两年里，君主制军队能够从沙特阿拉伯及其西方支持者那里获得持续而实质性的后勤、军事和物质支持。与英国和美国的巨额军火交易增强了沙特阿拉伯的陆军和空军，63 作为向埃及人的信号，英国飞行员甚至暂时使用新购买的战斗机。64 所有这些都使沙特人能够向君主主义者派遣大量武器，结果埃及军队陷入了一场无法获胜的战争中，埃及损失了数千人的生命和数百万美元。65 毫无疑问，埃及在也门冒险的失败在很大程度上是由于外部势力承诺不给纳西尔机会扩大他的权力，甚至可能扩大他的领土，而牺牲也门和沙特阿拉伯等当地行为体的利益。

content_units.text: Lustick, The Absence of Middle Eastern Great Powers, p. 670.

This Western commitment was not aimed at Nasir alone. Other irredentist Arab leaders received the same treatment. In 1961, when Kuwait gained its independence from the British, Iraqs leader Abd al-Karim Qasim laid claim to it, asserting that Kuwait had always been a part of Iraq. And for good measure, he put the Iraqi army on alert. Whatever Qasims true intentions were, for he indeed was a most mercurial man, any opportunity for action disappeared when .ve days after his announcement, British troops entered Kuwait, remaining there until a joint Arab force replaced them. Almost thirty years later, another Iraqi leader was able to go a step further, occupy Kuwait, and amalgamate it into Iraq. Sad­dam Husayns victory, however, was short-lived, and he and his long-suffering people were soon to experience the full and fero­cious force of Western displeasure.
content_units.azure_translation: 西方的这一承诺不仅仅针对纳西尔。其他不屈不挠的阿拉伯领导人也受到了同样的待遇。1961年，当科威特从英国手中获得独立时，伊拉克领导人阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·卡西姆声称拥有科威特，声称科威特一直是伊拉克的一部分。为了更好地衡量，他让伊拉克军队处于戒备状态。无论卡西姆的真实意图是什么，因为他确实是一个最善变的人，当他宣布这一消息几天后，英国军队进入科威特，并一直留在那里，直到一支阿拉伯联合部队取代他们，任何行动的机会都消失了。将近三十年后，另一位伊拉克领导人更进一步，占领了科威特，并将其并入伊拉克。然而，萨达姆·侯赛因的胜利是短暂的，他和他长期受苦受难的人民很快就会经历西方不满的充分而凶猛的力量。

content_units.text: One more example might suf.ce. In the bloody September 1970 civil war in Jordan, the king had to contend not only with the Pales­tinian guerrillas, but also with the machinations of his northern neighbor, the .ercely nationalist Bathist regime in Syria. Damascus was intensifying its saber rattling, vilifying the pro-Western king and swearing its undying commitment to the Arab Palestinian cause. As the Palestinian military situation worsened, the Syrians decided to take on the Jordanians. On September 18, Syrian troops crossed into Jordan, taking the town of Irbid the following day. It was not clear what Syrias objectives were. Later on, President Asad would tell Patrick Seale that he did not intend to overthrow the king, but simply wanted to protect the Palestinians from a sure massacre.66 On the other hand, King Husayn and the United States were convinced that the Syrians sought the overthrow of Jordans government, thereby making Jordan a client of Syria, very much in the same vein as Lebanon. Whatever Syrias true intentions were, the Americans decided to act quickly to save the king and preserve the status quo. But this time, and with Husayns approval, they solicited the help of Israel. The rapidly unfolding situation is vividly described by Patrick Seale:
content_units.azure_translation: 再举一个例子可能是 suf.ce。在 1970 年 9 月约旦血腥的内战中，国王不仅要与巴勒斯坦游击队抗衡，还要与他的北部邻国叙利亚民族主义的巴斯主义政权的阴谋作斗争。大马士革正在加紧挥舞军刀，诽谤亲西方的国王，并宣誓其对阿拉伯巴勒斯坦事业的永恒承诺。随着巴勒斯坦军事局势的恶化，叙利亚人决定与约旦人较量。9 月 18 日，叙利亚军队越境进入约旦，并于第二天占领了伊尔比德镇。目前尚不清楚叙利亚的目标是什么。后来，阿萨德总统告诉帕特里克·西尔，他并不打算推翻国王，而只是想保护巴勒斯坦人免受必然的屠杀。66 另一方面，侯赛因国王和美国确信叙利亚人试图推翻约旦政府，从而使约旦成为叙利亚的附庸， 与黎巴嫩非常相似。无论叙利亚的真实意图是什么，美国人决定迅速采取行动来拯救国王并维持现状。但这一次，在侯赛因的批准下，他们请求以色列的帮助。帕特里克·西尔生动地描述了迅速展开的局势：

content_units.text: Patrick Seale, Asad: The Struggle for the Middle East (Berkeley: University of Califor­nia Press, 1988), p. 158.

On 21 September, on the morrow of Husayns cry for help, Henry Kissinger and Yitzhak Rabin, Israels ambassador in Washington agreed a plan for Israel to launch air and armoured strikes against Syrian forces the next day. The plan was then approved by Nixon and Husayn. And in preparation for the strikes Israel made much publicized military deployments in the direction of Jordan. Wash­ington also put airborne troops on the alert and an American ar­mada headed for the Eastern Mediterranean. Emboldened by these preparations, Husayns own armour and air force then engaged the Syrians on 22 September.... Asad took the heavy hint. He had no intention of committing himself to unequal combat with Israel, let alone with the United States....So on22 September, before Israel attacked, he withdrew to his side of the border.67
content_units.azure_translation: 9 月 21 日，在侯赛因呼救的第二天，亨利·基辛格和以色列驻华盛顿大使伊扎克·拉宾商定了一项计划，让以色列在第二天对叙利亚军队发动空袭和装甲打击。该计划随后得到了尼克松和侯赛因的批准。为了准备袭击，以色列在约旦方向大肆宣传的军事部署。华盛顿还让空降部队处于戒备状态，一支美国舰队前往东地中海。在这些准备的鼓舞下，侯赛因斯自己的装甲和空军随后于 9 月 22 日与叙利亚人交战......阿萨德接受了沉重的暗示。他无意与以色列进行不平等的战斗，更不用说与美国了......因此，在9月22日，在以色列发动进攻之前，他撤退到边境的一侧67。

content_units.text: These are some of the instances in which the West, by exercising its imperious and overwhelming power, prevented local states from effecting substantial change in the number, size, or internal re­gimes of states.68 Consequently, unlike pre-twentieth century Eu­rope in which local rulers expanded their domain, then consoli­dated the realm through war and coercion, no Arab state was allowed to accumulate power and territory, and by so doing create the possibility for one uni.ed Arab state, the ultimate goal of Arab nationalism. Western powers were not about to allow the emer­gence in the Arab world of a Prussia, a Piedmont, or an Ile de France. And certainly they did not.
content_units.azure_translation: 这些是西方通过行使其专横和压倒性的权力，阻止地方国家对国家的数量、规模或内部制度进行实质性改变的一些例子。68 因此，与20世纪前的欧洲不同，在欧洲，地方统治者扩大了他们的领土，然后通过战争和胁迫巩固了领土，任何阿拉伯国家都不允许积累权力和领土，从而创造了一个统一的阿拉伯国家的可能性，这是阿拉伯民族主义的最终目标。西方列强不打算允许在阿拉伯世界出现普鲁士、皮埃蒙特或法兰西岛。当然，他们没有。

content_units.text: Political ideas, Fouad Ajami notes, make their own realities. Often in de.ance of logic, they hold men and are in turn held by them, creating a world in their own image, only to play themselves out in the end, shackled by routine problems not foreseen by those who spun the myth, or living past their prime and ceasing to move people suf.ciently.69 And so it was with Arab nationalism. Many factors mitigated against its continued success. Some of these were internal to the region, others were external to it. Some were inher­ent in the very ideology of nationalism, others emerged as unfore­seen consequences of historical development. In the end, as an idea and an ideology, Arab nationalism ran its course, eventually failing because it could not deliver on its promise to bring about the unity of the Arab people.
content_units.azure_translation: 福阿德·阿贾米指出，政治理念创造了自己的现实。通常，在逻辑上，他们抓住了人，反过来又被他们抓住了，按照他们自己的形象创造了一个世界，但最终却被那些编造神话的人没有预见到的日常问题所束缚，或者活过了他们的巅峰时期，不再有意识地感动人们。69 阿拉伯民族主义也是如此。许多因素阻碍了它的持续成功。其中一些是该地区内部的，另一些是该地区外部的。有些是民族主义意识形态所固有的，另一些则是历史发展的不可预见的后果。最终，作为一种思想和意识形态，阿拉伯民族主义走下坡路，最终失败了，因为它无法兑现实现阿拉伯人民团结的承诺。

content_units.text: Ibid., p. 160. 68 Lustick, The Absence of Middle Eastern Great Powers, p. 657.

By the end of the twentieth century, when Arab nationalism had lost its vibrancy and political direction, when people no longer be­lieved in the viability, even in a remotely aspirational form, of a politically comprehensive Arab unity, and when as a result Arab nationalism had been overtaken by other forces and ideologies, such as state wataniya and radical Islam, people tended to forget the majesty that Arab nationalism once was. Of all the ideolo­gies, writes R. Stephen Humphreys, that have played on the Mid­dle Eastern stage in this centurybourgeois liberalism, Marxism, Islamismnone has had a greater impact both within the region and throughout the world, none excited more hope and anxiety, than Arab nationalism.70
content_units.azure_translation: 到20世纪末，当阿拉伯民族主义失去了活力和政治方向时，当人们不再相信政治上全面的阿拉伯统一的可行性，甚至以一种遥远的理想形式，当阿拉伯民族主义因此被其他力量和意识形态所取代时，例如国家和激进伊斯兰教， 人们往往会忘记阿拉伯民族主义曾经的威严。R. Stephen Humphreys 写道，在本世纪在中东舞台上发挥作用的所有意识形态中，资产阶级自由主义、马克思主义、伊斯兰主义在该地区和全世界都产生了更大的影响，没有一个比阿拉伯民族主义更能激发希望和焦虑。70

content_units.text: The English explorer, Freya Stark, traveling in Iraq in the 1930s, recalls one semi-literate Arab telling her: What do we live for, if not the words that are spoken of us when we die?71 Not unlike all people, ideas, whether dead or still alive, should be judged not by their prevailing status or health, but by what they accomplished in their days of vibrancy. Arab nationalism, in its heyday, bestowed many gifts on its children: independence from the outsider; pur­poseful strides onto the road to social and economic modernity; a sense of dignity after the long years of colonization; a set of words and phrases that allowed the Arabs to narrate their own history; an abiding belief in their own ability to sweep aside all doubters and naysayers who blocked the way to progress. For too long, the Arabs had languished under foreign control, suffering the sense of unremitting inferiority so typical of people who were not the mas­ters of their own house. And naturally, they looked for remedies to even the odds. Not until the Arab nationalist tide of the 1950s and 1960s would the Arabs acquire the con.dence in their own prow­ess to believe that they could stand up to the mighty colonizers. The Arabs had become accustomed to turning the other cheek, not out of generosity but out of submission and inferiority; now, during the nationalist decades, they could stand up, be counted, and slap back. In a sense it was this regeneration of Arab self-con.dence, this revitalization of the Arab spirit that was Arab nationalisms greatest gift and most enduring accomplishment.
content_units.azure_translation: 英国探险家弗雷亚·斯塔克 （Freya Stark） 在 1930 年代在伊拉克旅行时回忆起一位半文盲的阿拉伯人告诉她：如果不是我们死后对我们说的话，我们活着是为了什么？71 与所有人不同，思想，无论死了还是还活着，都不应根据其普遍地位或健康状况来评判，而应根据他们在充满活力的日子中取得的成就来评判。阿拉伯民族主义在其鼎盛时期赋予了它的孩子们许多礼物：独立于外来者;有目的地迈向社会和经济现代化的道路;在漫长的殖民岁月之后的尊严感;一组让阿拉伯人能够叙述他们自己历史的单词和短语;坚信自己有能力将所有阻碍进步道路的怀疑者和反对者扫到一边。长期以来，阿拉伯人一直在外国的控制下苦苦挣扎，遭受着无休止的自卑感，这是那些不是自己家主人的人所典型的。自然而然地，他们寻找补救措施来平衡胜算。直到 1950 年代和 1960 年代的阿拉伯民族主义浪潮，阿拉伯人才凭借自己的实力获得了相信自己能够对抗强大的殖民者的能力的信念。阿拉伯人已经习惯了转过另一边的脸颊，不是出于慷慨，而是出于顺从和自卑;现在，在民族主义的几十年里，他们可以站起来，被算计，然后打耳光。从某种意义上说，正是阿拉伯自我的复兴，阿拉伯精神的复兴，才是阿拉伯民族主义最大的礼物和最持久的成就。

But like a great dynasty that falls on hard times, bringing ruin onto its realm, and is eventually remembered more for its short­comings than its achievements, Arab nationalism, by the end of the century, was remembered mostly for the debacle of the 1967 war, for Arab divisions that led to weakness, for its inability to come to the aid of its Palestinian children, for its big, resonant, and mean­ingless words, and for actions that were distinguished only by their meagerness. By the end of the twentieth century, many Arabs saw Arab nationalism not as the mirror that had allowed them to delve into their glorious past and glean from it future possibilities, but as the mirror that their political leaders had turned on their own people, blinding them with empty rhetoric and preventing them from seeing the true, mostly abysmal, state of affairs.
content_units.azure_translation: 但是，就像一个陷入困境的伟大王朝，给其领土带来毁灭，最终更多的是因为它的缺点而不是成就而被人们铭记一样，到本世纪末，阿拉伯民族主义主要因为1967年战争的失败，因为阿拉伯分裂导致了软弱，因为它无法帮助其巴勒斯坦儿童， 因为它的宏大、引起共鸣和毫无意义的话语，以及仅以其微不足道而著称的行动。到20世纪末，许多阿拉伯人不再将阿拉伯民族主义视为使他们能够深入了解辉煌过去并从中汲取未来可能性的镜子，而是将阿拉伯民族主义视为他们的政治领导人对着他们自己的人民的镜子，用空洞的言辞蒙蔽了他们的双眼，阻止他们看到真相， 大多数情况都很糟糕。

content_units.text: And much of this is indeed justi.ed, for in a sense, the nationalist assurance of Arab salvation, of international power and domi­nance, predicated on the realization of what the nationalists be­lieved to be the inevitable consecration of the uni.ed state. But that did not come to pass. The inability of the Arabs to achieve Arab unity signaled the demise of Arab nationalism, and with that sank the hopes and the expectations of the nationalist generation. And by the end of the twentieth century, there was little that was left of nationalisms goal of Arab unity but the debris of broken promises and shattered hopes.
content_units.azure_translation: 其中大部分确实是有道理的，因为从某种意义上说，民族主义者对阿拉伯救赎、国际权力和统治地位的保证，是建立在民族主义者认为是统一国家不可避免的奉献的实现之上的。但这并没有实现。阿拉伯人无法实现阿拉伯统一标志着阿拉伯民族主义的消亡，随之而来的是民族主义一代的希望和期望。到20世纪末，民族主义的阿拉伯统一目标所剩无几，只剩下违背承诺和破灭希望的碎片。

content_units.text: thousand years ago, lamented the Economist in July 2014, the various Arab caliphates were dynamic superpowers beacons of learning, tolerance and trade. Yet today the Arabs are in a wretched state.1 Surveying the region, the writers were struck by the pervasive chaos in parts of the Arab world and the mount­ing tyranny in other parts, with very little in between. Wracked by various competing identities, states that in the twentieth century were functioning entities had disintegrated by the second decade of the twenty-first century into a morass of warring groups, each controlling parcels of land and each possessing the kind of coer­cive power that in many cases surpassed that of the pitiful state itself. Other countries and their rulers, cognizant of collapsing states around them, responded by introducing draconian security measures with contemptuous disregard for even the most basic elements of human rights. Collapse or tyrannythat seemed to be the defining feature of the Arab world in the first two decades of the twenty-first century.
content_units.azure_translation: 《经济学人》在2014年7月感叹道，一千年前，各个阿拉伯哈里发国是充满活力的超级大国，是学习、宽容和贸易的灯塔。然而今天，阿拉伯人却处于一种悲惨的境地。1 在调查该地区时，作者们对阿拉伯世界部分地区普遍存在的混乱和其他地区日益严重的暴政感到震惊，而这中间几乎没有什么。在各种相互竞争的身份的困扰下，在20世纪运作的实体，到21世纪的第二个十年，国家已经瓦解成交战集团的泥沼，每个集团都控制着大块土地，每个集团都拥有在许多情况下超过可怜国家本身的强制力。其他国家及其统治者意识到周围国家正在崩溃，采取严厉的安全措施作为回应，甚至蔑视人权的最基本要素。崩溃或暴政这似乎是二十一世纪前二十年阿拉伯世界的决定性特征。

content_units.text: Economic failures are considered by political scientists to be sig­nificant elements in increasing political and social instability. And notwithstanding the oil-rich countries of the Arabian Peninsula, the Arab world has suffered from chronic economic maladies, such as high unemployment and low income levels, all triggered by incompetent management and pervasive corruption through­out governmental agencies and institutions. But that on its own is not enough to trigger the kind of bedlam that has afflicted the Arab world. After all, other regions of the world have had similar economic problems. But when irreparably fractured national iden­tities and an uncompromisingly militant doctrine are added to the mix, it becomes easy to understand what makes the Arab world so vulnerable to societal and political disintegration. The highly respected Economist Intelligence Unit measured the risk of social unrest in 150 countries. Nineteen were placed in the highest risk category. Of these, no less than eight were Arab countries.2
content_units.azure_translation: 政治学家认为经济失败是加剧政治和社会不稳定的重要因素。尽管阿拉伯半岛石油资源丰富，但阿拉伯世界一直遭受着长期的经济弊病，如高失业率和低收入水平，所有这些都是由管理不称职和整个政府机构和机构普遍存在的腐败引发的。但这本身并不足以引发困扰阿拉伯世界的那种诽谤。毕竟，世界其他地区也存在类似的经济问题。但是，当不可挽回的破碎民族认同和毫不妥协的激进学说加入其中时，就很容易理解是什么让阿拉伯世界如此容易受到社会和政治解体的影响。备受尊敬的经济学人智库测量了 150 个国家的社会动荡风险。19 人被归入最高风险类别。其中，不少于8个是阿拉伯国家。

In order to stop social unrest from creeping into their countries, leaders of other Arab states emphasized stability at the expense of all other considerations, which in effect turned out to mean the suffocation of society, denying it basic freedoms, and severely abusing the fundamental rights of citizens. It is undeniable that, since the 1950s, political representation has not been a prominent feature of the politics of Arab states. But while other regions in the Third World have taken steps during the ensuing period toward liberalizing their political systems, the Arab world if anything has moved in the opposite direction. In 2015, Freedom House, an organization that measures the progress of democracy globally, rated the Middle East region as the worst in the world. Of the 410 million people living in the area, Freedom House concluded that only five percent could be considered free,3 and those five percent included citizens of non-Arab Middle Eastern countries!
content_units.azure_translation: 为了阻止社会动荡蔓延到他们的国家，其他阿拉伯国家的领导人以牺牲所有其他考虑为代价来强调稳定，这实际上意味着社会的窒息，剥夺社会的基本自由，严重滥用公民的基本权利。不可否认，自1950年代以来，政治代表性并不是阿拉伯国家政治的一个突出特征。但是，尽管第三世界的其他地区在随后的时期内采取了自由化政治制度的步骤，但阿拉伯世界却朝着相反的方向发展。2015年，衡量全球民主进展的组织自由之家将中东地区评为世界上最差的地区。在居住在该地区的 4.1 亿人中，自由之家得出的结论是，只有 5% 的人可以被视为自由，3 而这 5% 包括非阿拉伯中东国家的公民！

content_units.text: The confrontation between the autocrats on the one hand and the equally dreadful insurrectionists on the other was inevitable. Indeed, states would band together in combating what they had always referred to as terrorism. In 2015, Egypt and several oth­er Arab countries joined a coalition led by Sunni Saudi Arabia in combating Shiite rebels who had unseated the Sunni president of Yemen and taken over the capital of Sanaa. Egypt feared not only the Shiite Houthi tribes in Yemen, but also the hidden hand of Shiite Iran. A further motivation of Egypts president, Abd-al-Fattah Sisi, was the preservation of his own po­litical order, for which Saudi financial aid was critical, particularly in the face of a gathering Islamist rebellion. And when Egypt and Saudi Arabia convened an Arab League meeting for the purpose of forming a joint Arab military force, it was, in Sisis words, an effort to combat security threats against the Arab state emanating from terrorist organizations.4
content_units.azure_translation: 埃及害怕的不仅是也门的什叶派胡塞部落，还有什叶派伊朗的暗手。埃及总统阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西的另一个动机是维护他自己的政治秩序，沙特的财政援助对此至关重要，尤其是在伊斯兰叛乱日益猖獗的情况下。当埃及和沙特阿拉伯为组建一支阿拉伯联合军事力量而召开阿拉伯联盟会议时，用茜茜的话说，这是为了打击恐怖组织对阿拉伯国家的安全威胁。4

content_units.text: One is moved to contrast the purpose of Egypts operation in Yemen with the one that occurred over half a century earlier dur­ing the heyday of Arab nationalism. Then, in 1962, Egypt sent troops to Yemen to support a fledgling and uncertain military coup that was advertised by its propagators as following in the footsteps of Nasirs Arab nationalist crusade against reactionary forces in the area. And Nasir responded within the parameters of the nationalist discourse of the time: We felt that we were doing a duty imposed upon us by the principles which we have upheld for the sake of the unity of the Arab struggle.5 How strange do these words sound in the contemporary political and ideological environment? Political leaders battling, in some cases desperately, an array of well-armed and determined non-state groups and out­fits had no use for an Arabist discourse in defining or executing their struggle.
content_units.azure_translation: 人们感动地将埃及在也门行动的目的与半个多世纪前阿拉伯民族主义鼎盛时期的目的进行了对比。然后，在 1962 年，埃及派遣军队前往也门，支持一场刚刚起步且不确定的军事政变，其宣传者宣传该政变追随纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义讨伐该地区反动势力的脚步。纳西尔在当时民族主义话语的范围内做出了回应：我们觉得我们正在履行我们为了阿拉伯斗争的团结而坚持的原则强加给我们的义务。5 这些话在当代的政治和意识形态环境中听起来有多奇怪？政治领导人在某些情况下与一系列装备精良、意志坚定的非国家团体和团体拼命作斗争，在定义或执行他们的斗争时没有阿拉伯主义话语的用处。

content_units.text: Long gone are the days when an eminent historian would gush that of all the ideologies that have played on the Middle Eastern stage in [the twentieth century]bourgeois liberalism, Marxism, Islamismnone has had a greater impact both within the region and throughout the worldthan Arab nationalism.6 As the book aptly chronicles, in those days, every policy, every political act, had to be justified in Arab nationalist terminology; even though in reality, as was the case in a number of instances, it was pursued to
