But after the catastrophic 1967 defeat, the ideology that had dominated the political landscape began a steady and irreversible decline, so that by the twenty-first century it simply did not figure in the goals or planning of Arab governments.
content_units.azure_translation: 为国家或其保管人的利益服务。但在1967年灾难性的失败之后，主导政治格局的意识形态开始稳步且不可逆转地衰落，以至于到了21世纪，它根本没有出现在阿拉伯政府的目标或规划中。

content_units.text: And the general masses were equally immune to, indeed dis­missive of, Arabist or Arab nationalist concerns. Instead, they sought an authentic ideational alternative (Arab nationalism was a European concept, lest we forget) and began to flock to political Islam. Radical Islamic groups became more active and more ad­venturous. Their determined search for recruits expanded and was to become easier as the people discarded the discredited secular ideology, reorienting their vision to the past, to an Islamic identity untouched by toxic Western values. By the first decade of the twen­ty-first century that shift had become clearly palpable. In opinion polls conducted by the Gallup World Polls in 20072008, between half and three-quarters of respondents from nine Arab countries thought that Islamic law, al-Sharia, should be the only source of legislation, with many favoring the death sentence for people who leave Islam.7 Such thinking provided more than a friendly environ­ment for radical Islamists. Central to Islamic militancy was the concept of jihad, holy struggle, to be waged against the enemies of Islam, namely the West, with its corrupting influence and irreden­tist ambitions, and against the secular nationalists, be they rulers, political elites, or intellectuals, who if anything were deemed the greatest offenders.
content_units.azure_translation: 而普通群众同样不受阿拉伯主义或阿拉伯民族主义的担忧的影响，甚至对它们不屑一顾。相反，他们寻求一种真正的意识形态替代方案（阿拉伯民族主义是欧洲的一个概念，以免我们忘记），并开始涌向政治伊斯兰教。激进的伊斯兰团体变得更加活跃和冒险。随着人们摒弃信誉不佳的世俗意识形态，将他们的视野重新定位到过去，转向不受有毒西方价值观影响的伊斯兰身份，他们坚定地寻找新兵变得更加容易。到了二十一世纪的头十年，这种转变已经变得明显。在盖洛普世界民意调查（Gallup World Polls）于20072008年进行的民意调查中，来自九个阿拉伯国家的一半到四分之三的受访者认为伊斯兰教法（al-Sharia）应该是立法的唯一来源，许多人赞成对离开伊斯兰教的人判处死刑。7 这种想法为激进的伊斯兰主义者提供了一个友好的环境。伊斯兰好战的核心是圣战的概念，即神圣的斗争，要对伊斯兰教的敌人，即西方，其腐败的影响力和不可逆转的野心，以及世俗民族主义者，无论他们是统治者、政治精英还是知识分子，如果有的话，他们被认为是最大的罪犯。

content_units.text: This irrelevance of secular nationalism to the concerns of the twenty-first century paved the way for increasingly violent com­petition between the state and political Islam for the loyalty, as well as for the hearts and minds of the Arab citizen. In the result­ing tumultuous years, blood was shed cheaply, and states, which thirty years or so earlier were riding high, were no longer able to count on their citizens fidelity to the concept of state legitimacy. The sovereignty of the Arab state was eroding under the weight of regionalism, sectarianism, and tribalism. And if that was not enough, those same years, particularly the second decade of the twenty-first century, witnessed the increasingly lethal threat of the gathering Islamic militancy, which was uncompromising in its out­look and savage in its ways.
content_units.azure_translation: 世俗民族主义与二十一世纪的关切无关，为国家和政治伊斯兰之间日益激烈的竞争铺平了道路，争夺阿拉伯公民的忠诚和心灵。在由此产生的动荡岁月里，流血是廉价的，三十年前高歌猛进的国家不再能够指望其公民忠于国家合法性概念。阿拉伯国家的主权在地区主义、宗派主义和部落主义的重压下正在受到侵蚀。如果这还不够，那么在同一年，特别是二十一世纪的第二个十年，见证了伊斯兰激进分子日益致命的威胁，这些激进分子的前景毫不妥协，其方式野蛮。

content_units.text: Kenneth Krause, Religion, Violence, and Terrorism: An Empirical Evolutionary Study, Skeptic magazine, vol.20, no. 1 (2015): p. 55.
The Hollowing of the State
content_units.azure_translation: 国家的空心化

content_units.text: A survey focusing on the political health of the Arab state in 2015 would quickly show that a significant number of these states were torn by debilitating internal strife. As stated above, the state and its institutions were under a relentless and purposeful assault by a variety of intrastate groups, some committed to a regional or tribal identity that superseded their loyalty to their respective states; oth­ers marched under the banner of jihad, determined to replace the state with an Islamic caliphatea hankering back to the pris­tine days of the early Islamic period under the four rightly guided caliphs. The result was that some states simply collapsed, others were so weakened that policies and services associated with state institutions no longer functioned, while still others tried to fight back with ever harsher methods that exhibited little or no regard for human decency, yet even so were unable to insulate the state and its institutions from its enemies. And it has to be said that in all this, Arab nationalism was never invoked by the states repre­sentatives and spokesmen or by those determined to cast the state aside and install a new political order. In this new historical era, Arab nationalism did not have an advocate, or even an apologist.
content_units.azure_translation: 2015年一项关注阿拉伯国家政治健康的调查很快就会显示，其中相当多的国家因日益衰弱的内部冲突而四分五裂。如上所述，国家及其机构受到各种州内团体的无情和有目的的攻击，其中一些致力于地区或部落身份，取代了他们对各自国家的忠诚;其他人则打着圣战的旗帜游行，决心用伊斯兰哈里发取代国家，渴望回到伊斯兰早期四位正确引导的哈里发统治下的原始时代。结果是，一些国家干脆崩溃了，另一些国家则被削弱得如此之大，以至于与国家机构相关的政策和服务不再发挥作用，而还有一些国家试图以更严厉的方法进行反击，这些方法很少或根本不考虑人类的体面，但即便如此，也无法将国家及其机构与敌人隔离开来。不得不说，在这一切中，阿拉伯民族主义从未被国家代表和发言人或那些决心抛弃国家并建立新政治秩序的人援引。在这个新的历史时代，阿拉伯民族主义没有倡导者，甚至没有辩护者。

content_units.text: Nor did Arab nationalism figure at all in the most significant political event so far in the twenty-first century. The peoples re­volt in a number of Arab countries that began at the end of 2010 and gathered momentum during the first half of 2011, which was popularly known as the Arab Spring, ignited rapid yet momen­tous changes in Arab countries that have proved to be hardly transient. In this popular and massive political eruption, the de­mand for instantaneous and drastic change was invoked through a number of lofty values and ideals. Yet the observer is hard put to find Arab nationalism among them.8 The demands of the colliding humanity in the city squares and streets of Tunis, Cairo, Damas­cus, Sanaa, and others, and the ideas and ideals that underpinned the peoples demands, were directed at a fundamental reform of the institutions, policies, and values of the state. People sought the restructuring of the states socio-economic institutions, insisting on the elimination of corruption and improving the condition of the under classes. They also insisted on the abolishment of ram­pant authoritarianism and the installation of true representative political institutions.9 Ironically and sadly, these demands, which should have strengthened the Arab state, in fact resulted inadver­tently and rather counterintuitively in what the Economist called the wretched condition of the contemporary Arab state. This oc­curred either because the revolution was hijacked by forces hardly enamored with the democratic idea and seemingly wholeheart­edly committed to violence, verging on savagery, or because the custodians of the state, with seemingly little regard for the lives, let alone the well-being, of their citizens, resorted to the coercive power of the state to make sure that their interests and privileges were protected and maintained.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义也根本没有出现在二十一世纪迄今为止最重要的政治事件中。一些阿拉伯国家的人民起义始于 2010 年底，并在 2011 年上半年蓄势待发，这通常被称为“阿拉伯之春”，在阿拉伯国家引发了快速而重大的变化，事实证明这些变化几乎不是短暂的。在这场流行和大规模的政治爆发中，通过一些崇高的价值观和理想唤起了对即时和剧烈变革的需求。然而，观察者很难在其中找到阿拉伯民族主义。8 突尼斯、开罗、大马士革、萨那等地的城市广场和街道上相互冲突的人性诉求，以及支撑人民诉求的思想和理想，都是针对国家制度、政策和价值观的根本性改革。人们寻求国家社会经济机构的重组，坚持消除腐败和改善下层阶级的状况。他们还坚持废除猖獗的专制主义，建立真正的代议制政治机构。9 具有讽刺意味和可悲的是，这些本应加强阿拉伯国家的要求，实际上却无意中、相当违反直觉地导致了《经济学人》所说的当代阿拉伯国家的悲惨状况。发生这种情况要么是因为革命被几乎不迷恋民主理念、似乎全心全意致力于暴力、近乎野蛮的势力劫持，要么是因为国家的守护者似乎很少考虑公民的生命，更不用说福祉了，诉诸国家的强制权力来确保他们的利益和特权得到保护和维持。

content_units.text: The author did an extensive search of newspapers and Internet outlets reporting on

For the remaining few who are still ardent believers in Arab nationalism, the fact that the ideology they continue to cling to had no role to play in, and therefore could not be blamed for, the pitiful condition of the Arabic speaking world in the wake of the Arab Spring should provide no comfort. After all, there was hard­ly any redeeming feature in the Arab reality as it existed during the second decade of the twenty-first century: citizens lustily killing one another, cities of long and distinguished history lying in ruin, and millions and millions of refugees living in squalid conditions, knowing they had no homes to return to. Instead, in the spring and summer of 2015, hundreds of thousands of these refugees, children in their arms and worldly possessions on their backs, be­gan a long and harrowing trek in the direction of a bewildered and overwhelmed Europe. The chaos and violence that has pervaded
content_units.azure_translation: 对于其余少数仍然热心信奉阿拉伯民族主义的人来说，他们继续坚持的意识形态在阿拉伯之春之后阿拉伯语世界的可怜状况中没有发挥任何作用，因此不能归咎于此这一事实不应该提供任何安慰。毕竟，阿拉伯现实中几乎没有任何可取之处，就像它在 21 世纪第二个十年中存在的那样：公民们贪婪地互相残杀，历史悠久而杰出的城市被废弃，数以百万计的难民生活在肮脏的条件下，他们知道他们没有家可归。相反，在2015年春夏，数十万这些难民，怀里抱着孩子，背着世俗的财产，开始了漫长而痛苦的跋涉，前往一个困惑和不堪重负的欧洲。弥漫的混乱和暴力

content_units.text: the demonstrations and demonstrators demands at the time, and found no reference to Arab nationalism. If indeed there were any, these would be so few as to render them neg­ligible. the Arab world since the days of promise and optimism in the spring of 2011 are at a level never experienced before.
content_units.azure_translation: 当时的示威和示威者要求，没有发现任何提及阿拉伯民族主义的内容。如果真的有的话，这些也很少，可以忽略不计。自2011年春天充满希望和乐观的日子以来，阿拉伯世界正处于前所未有的水平。

content_units.text: See Adeed Dawisha, The Second Arab Awakening: Revolution, Democracy, and the Is­lamist Challenge from Tunis to Damascus (New York: W. W. Norton and Company, 2013).

The forces that have been eroding the sanctity of the Arab state proclaim fidelity to creeds and identities that are anathema to the ideas of Arab nationalism. In the 1950s and 1960s, it was Arab na­tionalism with its inclusive, unifying message that threatened the Arab state. President Nasir, the High Priest of Arab nationalism, would turn in his grave at the turn of events in the twenty-first cen­tury, where politics were dominated and defined by such identities as regionalism, tribalism, sectarianism, and Islamism, all of which had been vilified by twentieth-century nationalists as retrogres­sive and reactionary. Of all these loyalties, radical political Islam has utilized methods, epitomized by an unapologetic viciousness, which the nationalists of the past simply did not have the stomach for.
content_units.azure_translation: 那些一直在侵蚀阿拉伯国家神圣性的势力宣称忠于与阿拉伯民族主义思想相悖的信条和身份。在 1950 年代和 1960 年代，威胁阿拉伯国家的是阿拉伯民族主义及其包容性、统一的信息。纳西尔总统是阿拉伯民族主义的大祭司，在21世纪的事态转折点上，政治被地区主义、部落主义、宗派主义和伊斯兰主义等身份所主导和定义，所有这些都被20世纪的民族主义者诋毁为倒退和反动。在所有这些忠诚中，激进的政治伊斯兰教使用了以毫无歉意的恶毒为代表的方法，而过去的民族主义者根本没有胃口。

content_units.text: Regionalism and tribalism have reduced two Arab states into empty shells devoid of legitimacy and functionality. In Libya, a bloody civil war, ignited by Arab Spring demonstrations, succeed­ed with the help of Western fire power to end the uninterrupted forty-six-year rule of the countrys despot, Muamer al-Qadhafi. Even before the celebrations for the countrys liberation had sub­sided, the country was descending into an even bloodier civil war fought by and among various regional and tribal factions.
content_units.azure_translation: 区域主义和部落主义使两个阿拉伯国家沦为没有合法性和功能的空壳。在利比亚，一场由阿拉伯之春示威引发的血腥内战，在西方火力的帮助下成功结束了该国暴君穆阿梅尔·卡扎菲 （Muamer al-Qadhafi） 长达 46 年的不间断统治。甚至在国家解放的庆祝活动平息之前，该国就陷入了一场由各个地区和部落派别之间进行的更加血腥的内战。

content_units.text: By 2015, Libya had no government. Instead, the country had two governments and two parliaments, each with its own coterie of region- or city-based militia. Libyas post-Arab Spring parlia­ment, the General National Congress (GNC), which was dominat­ed by Islamists and situated in Tripoli, the capital, lost the election in June 2014 to an alliance of mostly secular politicians, a number of whom had been associated with the Qadhafi regime. But the GNC refused to accept the results of the election, instead instigat­ing affiliated militia forces, mainly Islamist, to attack Tripoli and hound the newly elected parliamentarians out of the city. The lat­ter group promptly established their own competing government and parliament in the eastern city of Tobruk. Added to this confu­sion, independent militia took advantage of the power vacuum, imposing political control over cities and regions outside the reach of the two governments. The net result was that by the middle of 2015, warring factions dominated the political landscape, each faction claiming hegemony over the country. But in reality, the state as a unified unit had ceased to exist.
content_units.azure_translation: 到 2015 年，利比亚没有政府。相反，该国有两个政府和两个议会，每个议会都有自己的地区或城市民兵小圈子。阿拉伯之春后的利比亚议会，由伊斯兰主义者主导、位于首都的黎波里的国民大会（GNC）在2014年6月的选举中输给了一个主要由世俗政客组成的联盟，其中许多人与卡扎菲政权有联系。但 GNC 拒绝接受选举结果，而是煽动以伊斯兰主义为主的附属民兵部队袭击的黎波里，并将新当选的议员赶出该市。后者立即在东部城市托布鲁克建立了自己的竞争政府和议会。雪上加霜的是，独立民兵利用权力真空，对两国政府无法触及的城市和地区实施政治控制。最终结果是，到 2015 年年中，交战派系主导了政治格局，每个派系都声称对国家拥有霸权。但实际上，国家作为一个统一的单位已经不复存在。

content_units.text: We have already seen that another debilitating civil war had erupted in Yemen. This conflict had regional as well as sectarian roots. For long periods in Yemeni history, the northern tribes had been subject to only nominal governmental control. This regional distance was cemented by a pronounced sectarian divide that sep­arated the center and the south, which was inhabited by a mainly Sunni population belonging to the Shafei creed, and the northern­ers, known as Houthis, belonging to the Shiite Zaydi sect. While the ensuing tension had intermittently erupted into violence, the Arab Spring uprising in the capital Sanaa and other Yemeni cities weakened successive governments enough to allow the northern Houthis to seize the moment and sweep down from their moun­tainous domain in the Saadah province, capturing Sanaa in Sep­tember 2014. Four months later, the president was forced to flee the country.
content_units.azure_translation: 我们已经看到，也门爆发了另一场令人衰弱的内战。这场冲突既有地区性，也有宗派性的根源。在也门历史上的很长一段时间里，北部部落只受到名义上的政府控制。这种地区距离因明显的宗派分歧而巩固，这种分歧将中部和南部分开，南部主要居住着属于沙非信条的逊尼派人口，以及属于什叶派扎伊迪教派的北方人，即胡塞武装。虽然随之而来的紧张局势间歇性爆发为暴力，但首都萨那和其他也门城市的阿拉伯之春起义削弱了历届政府的实力，使北部胡塞武装抓住时机，从萨达省的山区领土横扫而下，于 2014 年 9 月占领了萨那。四个月后，总统被迫逃离该国。

content_units.text: The sectarian character of the conflict sucked in a number of outside players, which threatened to expand the fight beyond the borders of Yemen. Since the Houthis reside on Saudi Arabias bor­der, the fiercely Sunni kingdom was averse to having a Shiite threat nearby, particularly as the Saudis became convinced that Shiite Iran was the hidden hand behind the Houthi advance. After the capture of Sanaa, the Houthis advanced south toward Aden and by March 2015 had encircled it. This time, however, they came under heavy aerial attacks from the Saudis, which continued un­abated throughout the summer. In July, the Houthis were forced to retreat from Aden, suffering significant casualties. The ground fighting involved not just Yemeni anti-Houthi forces, but also, critically perhaps, special forces from Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.10 By mid-summer 2015, as the conflict continued, the United Nations reported that about one million people had
content_units.azure_translation: 冲突的宗派性质吸引了许多外部参与者，这有可能将战斗扩大到也门境外。由于胡塞武装居住在沙特阿拉伯边境，这个凶猛的逊尼派王国不愿在附近有什叶派威胁，特别是当沙特人确信什叶派伊朗是胡塞武装推进背后的隐藏之手时。占领萨那后，胡塞武装向南推进到亚丁，并于 2015 年 3 月包围了它。然而，这一次，他们遭到了沙特人的猛烈空袭，整个夏天都有增无减。7月，胡塞武装被迫从亚丁撤退，伤亡惨重。地面战斗不仅涉及也门反胡塞武装，而且至关重要的是，来自沙特阿拉伯和阿拉伯联合酋长国的特种部队也参与其中。10 到 2015 年仲夏，随着冲突的持续，联合国报告称，大约有 100 万人

content_units.text: http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/07/23/us-yemen-security-aden-idUSKCNOPX­

been displaced from their homes, and shortages of food, water, and medicine impacted about 80 percent of the population.11 Regardless of the eventual outcome of the civil war, and even if a semblance of a Yemeni state could be rebuilt, creating a Yemeni national identity (let alone an Arab identity), bereft of pronounced tribal and sectarian impulses, is at best a remote possibility.
content_units.azure_translation: 流离失所，食物、水和药品的短缺影响了大约 80% 的人口。11 无论内战的最终结果如何，即使可以重建一个也门国家的表象，创造一个也门民族认同（更不用说阿拉伯认同了），没有明显的部落和宗派冲动， 充其量是一种遥远的可能性。

content_units.text: The Hallowing of Violence
content_units.azure_translation: 暴力的神圣化

content_units.text: Incredulous as it may seem, the violence associated with the civil wars in Libya and Yemen was in fact pretty tame when compared with the indiscriminate atrocities that typified the conflicts in Syria and Iraq. The eruptions of the Arab Spring had spread to Syria, but while the governments of the autocrats in Libya and Yemen had begun to flounder, Syrias despot, Bashar al-Asad, showed no signs of panic. It was not because, in contrast to the other dicta­tors, he had established a strong connection with the citizens of Syria; it was because he felt no discomfort about butchering his own people. This indeed had been the legacy of the Asad family which had ruled Syria (or in the case of Bashar, what remains of Syria) for over forty-five years.
content_units.azure_translation: 尽管看起来令人难以置信，但与叙利亚和伊拉克冲突典型的不分青红皂白的暴行相比，与利比亚和也门内战相关的暴力实际上相当温和。阿拉伯之春的爆发已经蔓延到叙利亚，但当利比亚和也门的独裁政府开始挣扎时，叙利亚暴君巴沙尔·阿萨德却没有表现出恐慌的迹象。这并不是因为与其他独裁者相比，他与叙利亚公民建立了牢固的联系;这是因为他对屠杀自己的人民没有感到不适。这确实是阿萨德家族的遗产，他们统治了叙利亚（或者就巴沙尔而言，叙利亚的残余部分）超过四十五年。

content_units.text: By the summer of 2011, it had become apparent that the heart of the insurrection against Asad lay in the Sunni community. Much of the demands of the insurrection were aimed at the procrustean dictatorship that the Asad family had built; but the fact that some 80 percent of the population of Syria was Sunni and happened to be ruled by the Asad familywhich belonged to a privileged Shiite sect called the Alawites that constituted just over 11 per­cent of the Syrian populationcontributed in no small measure to the pent up frustrations of the majority. Demonstrators filled the streets day after day, first demanding reform, then radical change, including the resignation of Asad. Asads response was to use the army and security forces to shoot into the unarmed crowds. Scores were being killed on a daily basis.12 Howls of anger at the regimes s-civil treatment of its population were made by the Arab leaders, who, while themselves seasoned and merciless autocrats, happened to share Sunni affinity with the majority Syrians. No such protest would emanate from the Shiite rulers of Iraq or the leader of the Lebanese Shiite Hezbollah organization. Indeed, it is no exaggera­tion to say that by 2015 Asads survival owed much to the entry of Hezbollah into the Syrian civil war. And non-Arab, but Shiite, Iran was involved early on through the extension of military and economic support to their increasingly beleaguered coreligionist.
content_units.azure_translation: 到 2011 年夏天，反对阿萨德的起义的核心显然在于逊尼派社区。起义的大部分要求都是针对阿萨德家族建立的普罗克鲁斯特独裁统治;但事实上，叙利亚约 80% 的人口是逊尼派，并且恰好由阿萨德家族统治，该家族属于一个名为阿拉维派的特权什叶派教派，该教派占叙利亚人口的 11% 多一点，这在很大程度上加剧了大多数人被压抑的挫败感。示威者日复一日地挤满街头，首先要求改革，然后要求彻底变革，包括阿萨德辞职。阿萨德的回应是动用军队和安全部队向手无寸铁的人群开枪。每天都有数十人被杀害。12 阿拉伯领导人对政权对其人民的公民待遇发出愤怒的嚎叫，他们虽然自己是经验丰富且无情的独裁者，但恰好与大多数叙利亚人有逊尼派的亲和力。伊拉克什叶派统治者或黎巴嫩什叶派真主党组织领导人不会发出这种抗议。事实上，毫不夸张地说，到 2015 年，阿萨德的生存很大程度上归功于真主党加入叙利亚内战。伊朗不是阿拉伯人，而是什叶派，很早就参与其中，向他们日益陷入困境的同宗教者提供军事和经济支持。

content_units.text: http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Security-Watch/Backchannels/2015/0707Yemen­
See The Economist, July 9, 2011, p. 45; The Economist, August 10, 2011, p. 44; and The New York Times, September 1, 2011, p. A10.

Asad, of course, continued to shell cities with rockets and mor­tar, surround them with tanks and heavy armor, bomb them from the air by dropping barrel bombsoil barrels, fuel tanks, or gas cylinders packed with metal fragmentsand even use chemical weapons against unarmed civilians. Amnesty International ac­cused the Asad regime of deliberately targeting civilians. It added, Such a systematic attack on the civilian population, when car­ried out as part of government policy [constituted] a crime against humanity.13 It was thus inevitable that armed resistance would grow, become equally violent, and gradually replace the largely peaceful demonstrators. Initially, in the fall of 2011 and winter of 2012, the resistance was made up of defectors from Asads army. Sunni on the whole, these officers and soldiers in fact espoused and advocated a secular and Syrian nationalist outlook. But what­ever hopes there were in replacing Asad with a nationalist and democratic alternative would not last for too long. By the middle of 2012, the character of the war against Asad and his murderous regime began to change when the equally murderous Islamist radi­cals entered into the fray.
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，阿萨德继续用火箭弹和迫击炮炮击城市，用坦克和重型装甲包围它们，通过投掷桶装有金属碎片的土桶、燃料罐或气瓶从空中轰炸它们，甚至对手无寸铁的平民使用化学武器。国际特赦组织指责阿萨德政权故意以平民为目标。它补充说，这种对平民的系统性攻击，如果作为政府政策的一部分进行，[构成]危害人类罪。13 因此，武装抵抗不可避免地会增长，变得同样暴力，并逐渐取代基本上和平的示威者。最初，在 2011 年秋季和 2012 年冬季，抵抗运动由阿萨德军队的叛逃者组成。总的来说，这些军官和士兵是逊尼派，实际上拥护并倡导世俗和叙利亚民族主义观点。但是，无论用民族主义和民主的替代方案取代阿萨德的希望都不会持续太久。到 2012 年年中，当同样凶残的伊斯兰激进分子加入战斗时，针对阿萨德及其凶残政权的战争的性质开始发生变化。

content_units.text: The most notorious of the array of groups fighting the Asad regime has been the Islamic State (IS). Made up of some 30,000 fighters, many of them jihadists from the Middle East, Russia, and the West, IS burst on the scene in March 2013 when it captured the city of Reqaa in northwest Syria, the first provincial city to fall to the rebels. The city was anointed the capital of the Islamic State. From there it spread in a spectacular fashion, so that within eighteen months it had carved for itself an area not just in Syria but also, and perhaps more significantly, in Iraq (to be discussed later) of some 81,000 square miles. Relentless bombing by Ameri­can aircraft and attacks by other rebel groups had, by the summer of 2015, reduced the organizations territorial holdings by a quar­ter, but most of the losses occurred in Iraq; in Syria, IS remained on the whole intact.14 Such was the strength and seeming resilience of the group that it was able to fight, in most cases successfully, on a number of fronts that included the U.S., Turkey, the Kurds, other rebel groups, and the Asad regime.
content_units.azure_translation: 在与阿萨德政权作战的众多组织中，最臭名昭著的是伊斯兰国（IS）。伊斯兰国由大约 30,000 名战士组成，其中许多是来自中东、俄罗斯和西方的圣战分子，于 2013 年 3 月占领了叙利亚西北部的雷卡市，这是第一个落入叛军手中的省级城市。这座城市被任命为伊斯兰国的首都。从那里开始，它以惊人的方式传播开来，以至于在 18 个月内，它不仅在叙利亚，而且在伊拉克（也许更重要的是，在伊拉克（稍后讨论）为自己开辟了大约 81,000 平方英里的地区。到 2015 年夏天，美国飞机的无情轰炸和其他叛乱组织的袭击已使该组织的领土控制权减少了四分之一，但大部分损失发生在伊拉克;在叙利亚，IS总体上完好无损。14 该组织的力量和看似的韧性，以至于在大多数情况下，它能够在包括美国、土耳其、库尔德人、其他叛乱组织和阿萨德政权在内的多条战线上成功作战。

content_units.text: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-32581007

When it came to brutality, Asad certainly found a match in the leaders of IS. Determined to establish a caliphate, they used ultra-radical interpretations of Islamic doctrine to justify such atroci­ties as mass killings, public beheadings, and enforced slavery of non-Sunni women. What is truly bewildering is that such behavior does not seem to have reflected negatively on the organizations continued success in recruiting jihadists to the cause. Perhaps the promise of a caliphate, a powerful and dominant state, living ac­cording to the dictates of al-Sharia and strong enough to stand up to the West and its reviled ways, is such a seductive goal that achieving it justifies any and all means.
content_units.azure_translation: 说到残暴，阿萨德当然在伊斯兰国领导人身上找到了匹配。他们决心建立哈里发国，利用对伊斯兰教义的极端激进解释来为大规模杀戮、公开斩首和强迫奴役非逊尼派妇女等暴行辩护。真正令人困惑的是，这种行为似乎并没有对这些组织在招募圣战分子加入这项事业方面取得的持续成功产生负面影响。也许哈里发国的承诺，一个强大而占主导地位的国家，按照伊斯兰教法的命令生活，并强大到足以对抗西方及其受人诟病的方式，这是一个如此诱人的目标，以至于实现它证明不择手段是合理的。

content_units.text: Of course, the Islamic State was not the only rebel organization fighting the Asad regime. While IS continued to solidify its rule in the East, other groupsradical Islamists, such as Jabhat al-Nusra, and a variety of moderate Muslim and secular outfitswere fight­ing their way into the northwest and the south of the country. And the Kurds appeared determined to establish and protect a semi-autonomous area in the northeast. For Asad, what was left was a stretch of territory from Damascus to the Alawite ancestral home in Latakia, constituting perhaps no more than a fifth of Syrias in­ternationally recognized territory. Meanwhile, by the summer of 2015, some quarter of a million people, most of them civilians, had perished, and more than four million were refugees, the majority of them in the neighboring countries of Jordan, Lebanon, and Turkey.
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，伊斯兰国并不是唯一一个与阿萨德政权作战的叛乱组织。当伊斯兰国继续巩固其在东部的统治时，其他激进伊斯兰主义者，如努斯拉阵线，以及各种温和的穆斯林和世俗团体正在向该国西北部和南部发起战斗。库尔德人似乎决心在东北部建立和保护一个半自治区。对阿萨德来说，剩下的是从大马士革到拉塔基亚阿拉维派祖居地的一片领土，可能只占叙利亚国际公认领土的五分之一。与此同时，到2015年夏天，大约有25万人丧生，其中大多数是平民，超过400万人是难民，其中大多数在约旦、黎巴嫩和土耳其等邻国。

content_units.text: As stated earlier, however, the exploits of the Islamic State were not confined to Syria. In fact, its most spectacular successes oc­curred in Iraq, where the organization, determined to wipe out all apostates and infidels from the area, unloaded its venom against the Shiite government. De jure, Iraq presented itself as a unified state and was recognized as such by the international community; de facto, however, the country was divided along ethnic and sec­tarian lineswith the north under the political control of a Kurd­ish government, the south inhabited by Shiites, and the middle part of the country, from just north of Baghdad and all the way toward the Kurdish area, by Sunnis. It was this Sunni heartland that IS targeted.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，如前所述，伊斯兰国的功绩并不局限于叙利亚。事实上，它最引人注目的成功发生在伊拉克，该组织决心消灭该地区的所有叛教者和异教徒，并向什叶派政府释放了毒液。从法律上讲，伊拉克将自己定位为一个统一的国家，并得到国际社会的承认。然而，事实上，这个国家是按照种族和教派界限划分的，北部由库尔德政府政治控制，南部由什叶派居住，而该国的中部则由逊尼派从巴格达以北一直到库尔德地区。伊斯兰国的目标正是这个逊尼派中心地带。

content_units.text: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-29052144

Brazenly sectarian policies by the Shiite government in Baghdad in the years following the departure of American troops at the end of 2011, led to mounting anger and frustration among the minori­ty Sunni population. Demonstrations and riots in Sunni cities were increasing in frequency and ferociousness, and that prompted an ever harsher response from the mainly Shiite security forces. By 2013 a mini-insurrection was brewing in a number of Sunni cit­ies, and that provided a window of opportunity for IS. Sure of the support of the local population, IS fighters attacked Iraqi security forces in Fallujah, the most rebellious of Sunni cities, capturing it in January 2014. If that was considered a memorable feat, it paled in comparison to what happened six months later when the Islamists captured Mosul, the second largest city in Iraq, where minority communities of Christians and Yezidis had lived peace­fully among the Sunni Muslim majority.
content_units.azure_translation: 2011年底美军撤离后的几年里，巴格达什叶派政府公然采取的宗派政策导致少数逊尼派民众的愤怒和沮丧情绪与日俱增。逊尼派城市的示威和骚乱越来越频繁，而且越来越凶猛，这促使以什叶派为主的安全部队做出了越来越严厉的反应。到 2013 年，一些逊尼派城市正在酝酿一场小型叛乱，这为 IS 提供了机会之窗。2014 年 1 月，伊斯兰国战士确信当地居民的支持，袭击了逊尼派最叛乱城市费卢杰的伊拉克安全部队，并占领了该城市。如果这被认为是一项令人难忘的壮举，那么与六个月后伊斯兰主义者占领伊拉克第二大城市摩苏尔时发生的事情相比，它就相形见绌了，那里的基督徒和雅兹迪少数民族社区在逊尼派穆斯林占多数的人群中和平地生活着。

content_units.text: Along with the military successes came the usual atrocities as­sociated with the IS, this time directed against the non-Muslim minorities, particularly Yezidis, many of whose young men were summarily executed after their capture. The fate of the women was no better, as they were literally distributed to IS fighters. Human Rights Watch, in a 2015 report, unequivocally stated that the IS forces have committed organized rape, sexual assault, and other horrific crimes against Yezidi women and girls.15 A number of the girls in question were pre-pubescent. In October 2014, some ten months in control of Mosul, IS confirmed in its own publica­tion, Dabiq, that these women were given to IS fighters as spoils of war, and claimed that Islam permits sex with non-Muslim slaves, as well as beating and selling them.16
content_units.azure_translation: 随着军事上的成功，与伊斯兰国相关的常见暴行也随之而来，这一次是针对非穆斯林少数民族的，特别是雅兹迪人，他们的许多年轻人在被捕后被即决处决。这些妇女的命运也好不到哪里去，因为她们实际上被分发给了伊斯兰国战士。人权观察在2015年的一份报告中明确指出，IS部队对雅兹迪妇女和女孩犯下了有组织的强奸、性侵犯和其他可怕的罪行。15 一些涉案女孩是青春期前的。2014年10月，在摩苏尔的控制权约10个月后，伊斯兰国在其自己的出版物《达比克》中证实，这些妇女被作为战利品送给伊斯兰国战士，并声称伊斯兰教允许与非穆斯林奴隶发生性关系，以及殴打和贩卖她们。

content_units.text: http://www.hrw.org/news/2015/04/14/iraq-isis-escapees-describe-systematic-rape 16 Ibid.

This orgy of violence would continue as Iraqi forces, time and time again, found it difficult to deliver on their oft proclaimed promise of liberation. Beyond the obvious security deficien­cies, it could also be that the Iraqis themselves have implicitly internalized the division of their country. Officials, politicians, and bureaucrats continue to extol Iraqs unity and national identity, but with the passage of time such exhortations sound increasingly hollow. With every passing day, ethno-sectarianism embeds itself that much further into the political culture and social fabric of so­ciety. When Iraq readied itself in late May 2015 to drive IS out of the Sunni areas in Iraq, the force was dominated by Shiite militia, a fact that did nothing to placate Sunni sensibilities, especially when the commanders proudly proclaimed that the operation would be called Labayk ya Husayn (At your service, Husayn)17a refer­ence to the grandson of the prophet, a most hallowed figure in Shiite Islam.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种暴力狂欢将继续下去，因为伊拉克军队一次又一次地发现难以兑现他们经常宣称的解放承诺。除了明显的安全缺陷之外，伊拉克人自己也可能已经隐含地将国家的分裂内化了。官员、政客和官僚继续歌颂伊拉克的团结和民族认同，但随着时间的推移，这种劝告听起来越来越空洞。随着时间的流逝，种族宗派主义进一步融入社会的政治文化和社会结构。2015 年 5 月下旬，当伊拉克准备将伊斯兰国赶出伊拉克逊尼派地区时，这支部队由什叶派民兵主导，这一事实无助于安抚逊尼派的情感，尤其是当指挥官们自豪地宣布这次行动将被称为 Labayk ya Husayn（为你服务，侯赛因）17 指的是先知的孙子， 什叶派伊斯兰教中最神圣的人物。

content_units.text: The Sad State of the Arab Condition
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯状况的悲惨状况

content_units.text: Analysts would describe the four cases we have looked at, Libya, Yemen, Syria, and Iraq as failed states. In fact, they are more than thatthey are broken countries. They have no institutions to speak of, their populations are divided, and their identities are frac­tured. Other Arab countries may not be broken, some of them are projecting an image of stability and coherence, but in many cases, this is only a façade that masks real brittleness that would not augur well for the future of these states. Take Tunisia, the supposed major success of the Arab Spring. Free elections in 2011 brought to power an Islamist party that for decades had been hounded and perse­cuted. Yet, the leaders of Ennahdha showed a healthy regard for the democratic idea, entering into a governing coalition with secular parties, and later, as they endured the ups and downs of political fortunes, they remained faithful to the rules of democracy.
content_units.azure_translation: 分析人士会将我们研究过的四个案例，利比亚、也门、叙利亚和伊拉克描述为失败的国家。事实上，他们不止于此他们是破碎的国家。他们没有机构可言，他们的人口是分裂的，他们的身份是支离破碎的。其他阿拉伯国家可能没有被打破，其中一些国家正在投射出稳定和连贯的形象，但在许多情况下，这只是一个假象，掩盖了真正的脆弱，这对这些国家的未来来说并不是一个好兆头。以突尼斯为例，阿拉伯之春被认为是重大成功的国家。2011年的自由选举使一个几十年来一直受到追捕和迫害的伊斯兰政党上台。然而，恩纳赫达的领导人对民主理念表现出了健康的尊重，与世俗政党结成执政联盟，后来，在经历政治命运的起起落落时，他们仍然忠于民主规则。

content_units.text: But the moderate disposition of Ennahdha was not shared by the other Islamist radical groups that have attacked political and economic institutions, highlighting the fragility of the state and its apparatus and becoming a major source of anxiety for Tuni­sian authorities. Tunisia, ever proud to advertise to the world its secular character, its social liberalism, and its success in building representative political institutions, is in fact the largest exporter of jihadists to the ranks of the Islamic State in Syria and Iraq. And within Tunisia, attacks on security and political institutions continued to increase throughout 2013 and 2014, constituting a low-level, yet persistent, insurrection.18 In the first half of 2015, in addition to many acts of sedition, Islamist radicals mounted two high-profile attacks aimed at the countrys tourist industry, a ma­jor source of income for Tunisia. In March, gunmen opened fire on tourists in the Bardo National Museum in the capital, Tunis, kill­ing 24 people, and in June, an attack on a seaside resort in the city of Sousse resulted in the death of 38 tourists. Those attacks high­lighted the flimsiness of the state, a fact that the countrys presi­dent himself acknowledged: If another attack like Sousse occurs, the state will collapse.19
content_units.azure_translation: 但恩纳赫达的温和性格与其他攻击政治和经济机构的伊斯兰激进团体并不认同，这凸显了国家及其机器的脆弱性，并成为突尼斯当局焦虑的主要来源。突尼斯一直自豪地向世界宣传其世俗性质、社会自由主义和在建立代议制政治机构方面的成功，事实上，突尼斯是叙利亚和伊拉克伊斯兰国队伍中圣战分子的最大输出国。在突尼斯境内，2013 年和 2014 年期间，对安全和政治机构的袭击持续增加，构成了一场低级但持续的叛乱。18 2015 年上半年，除了许多煽动叛乱行为外，伊斯兰激进分子还针对该国旅游业发动了两次备受瞩目的袭击，而该国是突尼斯的主要收入来源。3月，枪手在首都突尼斯的巴尔多国家博物馆向游客开枪，造成24人死亡，6月，苏塞市的一个海滨度假胜地遭到袭击，导致38名游客死亡。这些袭击凸显了国家的脆弱，该国总统本人也承认了这一事实：如果再次发生像苏塞这样的袭击，国家将崩溃。19

content_units.text: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-32882540

Egypt, however, does not seem to be on the verge of collapse. Perceiving itself and seen by other Arabs as the pivotal state in the Arab world, the fate of Egypt is much more relevant to the Arab condition than, say, that of Tunisia. That is why the grassroots popular insurrection that swept throughout the country during the Arab Spring days of 2011 was perhaps the most consequen­tial amongst the other mass rebellions. But since those heady days of democratic promise, Egypt went through turbulent times, and eventually it was left with neither guaranteed stability nor (as in the case of Tunisia) a liberal political disposition.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，埃及似乎并没有处于崩溃的边缘。埃及将自己视为阿拉伯世界的关键国家，埃及的命运与阿拉伯的状况比突尼斯的命运更相关。这就是为什么在2011年阿拉伯之春期间席卷全国的草根民众起义可能是其他大规模叛乱中影响最大的一次。但自从那些令人陶醉的民主承诺时代以来，埃及经历了动荡时期，最终它既没有保证的稳定，也没有（如突尼斯的情况）自由主义政治倾向。

content_units.text: The toppling in 2011 of Hosni Mubarak, Egypts long stand­ing dictator, allowed for elections to be held later that year. Free and fair, the election put in power the Muslim Brotherhood, an Islamist outfit that for some time had eschewed violence. With an impressive overall majority, the Brotherhood found it unnecessary to emulate the more malleable policies of its Tunisian counterpart. The emerging inflexibility was cemented in June 2012 by the elec­ tremists tion of President Mohammad Morsi, a leader of the Brotherhood. The combination seemed to seal the fate of any possibility at com­promise with other non-Islamist forces in Egypt.
content_units.azure_translation: 2011 年，埃及长期独裁者胡斯尼·穆巴拉克 （Hosni Mubarak） 被推翻，允许在当年晚些时候举行选举。自由和公平的选举使穆斯林兄弟会掌权，这是一个在一段时间内避免暴力的伊斯兰组织。由于穆兄会拥有令人印象深刻的总体多数，他们认为没有必要效仿突尼斯同行更具可塑性的政策。2012 年 6 月，穆兄会领导人穆罕默德·穆尔西总统的极端主义加剧了这种新出现的僵化。这种结合似乎决定了与埃及其他非伊斯兰势力妥协的任何可能性的命运。

content_units.text: http://www.al-monito.com/pulse/originals/2015/05/tunisia-government-counter-ex­
http://www.tunisia-live.net/2015/07/04/tunisia-state-of-emergency/

Morsi and the Brotherhood were to last for only one year. Op­position to the Islamist rule grew so that by the summer of 2013, huge anti-government demonstrations filled the streets of Cairo and other cities in Egypt. These were matched by equally large demonstrations organized by the Brotherhood. The paralysis in political life allowed the military, under the leadership of General Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi, to execute a military coup and remove Mor­si from power in July. New presidential elections were organized for May 2014, and Sisi won with over 96 percent of the vote, which brought back memories of Mubaraks resounding victories at the polls during his thirty-year rule.
content_units.azure_translation: 穆尔西和穆兄会只维持了一年。对伊斯兰统治的反对日益高涨，以至于到 2013 年夏天，大规模的反政府示威活动充斥着开罗和埃及其他城市的街道。与此相匹配的是兄弟会组织的同样大规模的示威活动。政治生活的瘫痪使得军方在阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西将军的领导下，于7月发动了军事政变，将穆尔西赶下台。2014年5月举行了新一届总统选举，塞西以超过96%的得票率获胜，这让人回想起穆巴拉克在30年执政期间在民意调查中大获全胜的情景。

content_units.text: In his first year, Sisi embarked on a witch hunt against members of the Brotherhood. Under the guise of fighting Islamist terror­ism, thousands were imprisoned and tortured, and many disap­peared. According to Human Rights Watch, in the ten months spanning Sisis usurpation of power in July 2013 and his election as president in May 2014, Egypts authorities had detained, charged, or sentenced at least 41,000 people. And in one day alone, the security forces killed more than 900 protestors in Cairo.20 These abuses, perpetrated by the countrys security forces, which seem to have been given near immunity by the government as well as the judicial system, continued unabated well into 2015.
content_units.azure_translation: 在上任的第一年，塞西开始对兄弟会成员进行政治迫害。在打击伊斯兰恐怖主义的幌子下，数千人被监禁和酷刑，许多人失踪。据人权观察称，在塞西斯2013年7月篡权和2014年5月当选总统的10个月里，埃及当局至少拘留、起诉或判刑了41,000人。仅一天之内，安全部队就在开罗杀害了 900 多名抗议者。20 这些由该国安全部队实施的侵权行为似乎得到了政府和司法系统的近乎豁免权，直到 2015 年才有增无减。

content_units.text: Accompanying the oppression was a draconian set of laws that restricted the freedom of association and expression. In May 2015, a ruling by the Supreme Administrative Court outlawed la­bor strikes and set forcible retirements as punishment. Ironically, by labeling strikes a crime, the court based its decision on Is­lamic law. Going on strike, the judges argued, was against the Islamic teachings and the purposes of Sharia law.21 Even more disturbing was the relentless assault on the freedom of expression, which included a draft law in April 2015 tackling Internet crime, including, of course, crimes against the state and stipulating a labor-movement
content_units.azure_translation: 伴随着压迫的是一套限制结社和言论自由的严厉法律。2015年5月，最高行政法院裁定罢工为非法，并将强制退休作为惩罚。具有讽刺意味的是，法院将罢工定为犯罪，其裁决是基于伊斯兰法。法官们认为，罢工违背了伊斯兰教义和伊斯兰教法的宗旨。21 更令人不安的是对言论自由的无情攻击，其中包括 2015 年 4 月的一项法律草案，该法律草案旨在打击互联网犯罪，当然包括危害国家的犯罪和规定劳工运动

variety of punishments for the dissemination of rumors and the promotion of extremist thoughts on social networks.22 Naturally, it was left to Egypts authorities to determine what constituted extremist thought! In July 2015 another law targeted the press. The law set a minimum of two years imprisonment for reporters who challenge official statements when covering counterterrorism activities.23 But faced with local and international condemnation, the authorities were forced to replace the jail sentences with back­breaking fines.24
content_units.azure_translation: 对在社交网络上传播谣言和宣扬极端主义思想的各种惩罚。22 自然，埃及当局要决定什么构成极端主义思想！2015 年 7 月，另一项针对媒体的法律。该法规定，在报道反恐活动时对官方声明提出质疑的记者至少可判处两年监禁。23 但面对当地和国际社会的谴责，当局被迫以高额罚款取代监禁刑罚24。

content_units.text: Such indiscriminate killings and wholesale detentions, as well as the unabashed suffocation of individual freedoms, moved a former member of parliament, a widely respected defender of de­mocracy, to declare: We are faced with a state of pure tyranny, which thrives in a republic of fear and hides behind the banner of patriotism, all the while exploiting crimes of terrorism, which are used to justify further oppression, subjection, and disregard of rights and freedoms.25 These sentiments were confirmed by Human Rights Watch in a report that strongly condemned the repressive policies of Egypts government and its seemingly uni­tary leader. A spokesman of the organization told reporters that the al-Sisi government [was] acting as though to restore stability Egypt needed a dose of repression the likes of which it hasnt seen for decades, but its treatment [was] killing the patient.26 And if the Sisi government at first had manufactured phantom terrorists in order to justify its oppression, it soon would come face to face with real ones. Seeking revenge for what they considered to be the unlawful ouster of Morsi and the ensuing onslaught against the Muslim Brothers, radical Islamists took up the fight and began to carry out armed attacks against Egypts security forces in northern Sinai. By the summer of 2015, a wholesale insurgency was raging in the province, led by jihadists who had associated themselves alters-controversial-antiterror-bill.aspx with the Islamic State in Syria and Iraq. Armed clashes with police and army personnel led to the death of hundreds of security forc­es, and Sisi could not avoid acknowledging the growing threat, instituting in October 2014 a state of emergency in northern Si­nai. Still, by 2014 and after, the militant group had broadened its operations beyond Sinai, attacking not only security forces in a number of Egyptian cities, but also tourists and diplomatic venues. While by no means a broken country, by 2015 Egypt, once im­pregnable and immune to outside incendiary forces, had become yet another target of the jihadists relentless assault on the sover­eignty and legitimacy of the Arab state.
content_units.azure_translation: 这种不分青红皂白的杀戮和大规模拘留，以及毫不掩饰地扼杀个人自由，使一位广受尊敬的民主捍卫者、前议员宣布：我们面对的是一个纯粹的暴政国家，它在一个充满恐惧的共和国中茁壮成长，躲在爱国主义的旗帜后面，同时一直利用恐怖主义罪行， 这些被用来为进一步的压迫、服从和无视权利和自由辩护。25 人权观察在一份报告中证实了这些观点，该报告强烈谴责埃及政府及其看似单一的领导人的镇压政策。该组织的一位发言人告诉记者，塞西政府的行为似乎是为了恢复稳定，埃及需要几十年来从未见过的镇压，但它的治疗却杀死了病人。26 如果塞西政府一开始制造了幽灵恐怖分子来为其压迫辩护，那么它很快就会与真正的恐怖分子面对面。为了报复他们认为是非法推翻穆尔西以及随后对穆斯林兄弟会的攻击，激进伊斯兰主义者开始战斗，并开始对西奈半岛北部的埃及安全部队发动武装袭击。到 2015 年夏天，一场大规模的叛乱在该省肆虐，其领导人是与叙利亚和伊拉克的伊斯兰国有alters-controversial-antiterror-bill.aspx联系的圣战分子。与警察和军队人员的武装冲突导致数百名安全部队死亡，塞西无法避免承认日益增长的威胁，并于 2014 年 10 月在西奈半岛北部宣布紧急状态。尽管如此，到 2014 年及之后，该激进组织已将其行动范围扩大到西奈半岛以外，不仅袭击了埃及多个城市的安全部队，还袭击了游客和外交场所。虽然绝不是一个破碎的国家，但到 2015 年，曾经坚不可摧、不受外部煽动力量影响的埃及已成为圣战分子对阿拉伯国家主权和合法性进行无情攻击的又一个目标。

So What of Arab Nationalism?
content_units.azure_translation: 那么阿拉伯民族主义呢？

content_units.text: It is the mammoth struggle between the state on the one hand and radical political Islam and intrastate fissiparous forces on the oth­er hand that defined Arab politics in the first two decades of the twenty-first century. And as we have seen, Arab nationalism had no role, not even a peripheral one, in this struggle. What signals the complete irrelevance of Arab nationalism is the total absence of any voices putting it forward as the cure for state disintegra­tion, or as an alternative idea to the militant creed of the jihadists.
content_units.azure_translation: 正是国家与激进的政治伊斯兰教和国家内部分裂势力之间的巨大斗争定义了 21 世纪前二十年的阿拉伯政治。正如我们所看到的，阿拉伯民族主义在这场斗争中没有发挥任何作用，甚至没有发挥外围作用。阿拉伯民族主义完全无关紧要的标志是，完全没有任何声音将其作为国家解体的良药，或将其作为圣战分子激进信条的替代思想。

content_units.text: Of course the rot had started much earlier, after the 1967 war had emasculated the prophets and heroes of Arab nationalism and triggered the gradual asphyxiation of the once mighty idea. By the end of the twentieth century, those who obstinately continued to be believers seemed strangely out of place. In the first edition of this book I quote an observation by an attendee of a conference on Arab nationalism held in 1994. It is worth repeating:
content_units.azure_translation: 当然，腐烂开始得更早，在1967年的战争阉割了阿拉伯民族主义的先知和英雄，并引发了曾经强大的思想的逐渐窒息之后。到了二十世纪末，那些顽固地继续信徒的人似乎奇怪地格格不入。在本书的第一版中，我引用了 1994 年举行的阿拉伯民族主义会议的一位与会者的观察。值得重复的是：

content_units.text: The conferees appeared to represent an extinct tribe using strange wordsindeed, a language incomprehensible in our time. Most of them had grey hair and stooping backs. Some needed canes to help them walk. Some had hearing aids and shaking hands that made it difficult for them to write, and oth­ers had difficulty getting the words out.27
content_units.azure_translation: 这些会议似乎代表了一个灭绝的部落，使用奇怪的词语确实，这是一种在我们这个时代无法理解的语言。他们中的大多数人头发花白，背部弯腰。有些人需要拐杖来帮助他们走路。有些人戴着助听器和握手，使他们难以写字，而另一些人则很难说出单词27。

In May 2015, Amr Moussa, a seasoned Egyptian diplomat whose formative years were situated in the heyday of Nasirs Arab na­tionalism in the 1950s, thundered in a conference in Dubai about the hegemony of Israel, Turkey, and Iran in the area, which had turned Arabs into a laughingstock. He would then add to a reporter that Irans brazen intrusion in several Arab capitals, like Baghdad, Damascus, and Sanaa, had enraged many of us leaving Arabs humiliated that any power would dare say such a thing28fine words indeed, except to a twenty-first-century ear they hardly reflected the existential circumstance, residing instead in a much different time, a past era. The truth is that it is truly challenging to pinpoint humiliated Arabs in the con­flicts that raged in Baghdad, Damascus, and Sanaa, as the Arab identity was certainly not carried on anybodys sleeves in these conflicts. These wars were fought on sectarian grounds, pitting Sunnis against Shiites, with the latter hardly feeling enraged by Irans interference.
content_units.azure_translation: 2015 年 5 月，经验丰富的埃及外交官阿姆鲁·穆萨 （Amr Moussa） 的成长岁月正值 1950 年代纳西尔阿拉伯民族主义的鼎盛时期，他在迪拜举行的一次会议上大肆宣扬以色列、土耳其和伊朗在该地区的霸权，这使阿拉伯人沦为笑柄。然后他会向记者补充说，伊朗对巴格达、大马士革和萨那等几个阿拉伯首都的厚颜无耻的入侵激怒了我们中的许多人，让阿拉伯人感到羞辱，任何国家都敢说这样的话28确实是好话，除了在二十一世纪的耳朵里，它们几乎没有反映生存环境，而是生活在一个截然不同的时代， 一个过去的时代。事实是，在巴格达、大马士革和萨那肆虐的冲突中查明受辱的阿拉伯人确实具有挑战性，因为在这些冲突中，阿拉伯人的身份肯定没有被任何人带走。这些战争是在宗派原因上进行的，逊尼派与什叶派对立，什叶派几乎不会对伊朗的干涉感到愤怒。

content_units.text: Yet it is difficult not to lament the passing of Arab nationalism, particularly when bringing contemporary Arab maladies under scrutiny. With all of its faults and shortcomings (amply analyzed in the book), the many achievements of Arab nationalism were unde­niable: It led the struggle for independence from the outsider. Under its umbrella, Arab states took determined steps toward social and economic modernity. It bestowed on the Arabs a sense of dignity after years of colonial humiliation. And it endowed the nationalist generation of the era with an abiding belief in an inevitable future of progress and success. That was the legacy of Arab nationalism.
content_units.azure_translation: 然而，很难不为阿拉伯民族主义的消逝感到遗憾，尤其是在对当代阿拉伯弊病进行审查时。尽管阿拉伯民族主义有种种缺点和缺点（在书中进行了充分分析），但阿拉伯民族主义的许多成就是不可否认的：它领导了从外来者手中独立的斗争。在其保护伞下，阿拉伯国家采取了坚定的步骤，迈向社会和经济现代化。它赋予了阿拉伯人在经历多年殖民屈辱后的尊严感。它赋予了那个时代的民族主义一代对进步和成功不可避免的未来的持久信念。这就是阿拉伯民族主义的遗产。

content_units.text: Two decades into the twenty-first century, one is hard put to extract any accomplishments from the ideational currents defining the Arab condition.Indeed,ideationalis too glorious a phrase to describe the undercurrents that have motivated politics in the area. Sectarianism, tribalism, and regionalism, all gnawing at the state from within, have sown the seeds of division, even disintegration, in a number of Arab countries, and in some cases have contributed to a palpable loss of sovereignty.
content_units.azure_translation: 进入二十一世纪二十年，人们很难从定义阿拉伯状况的意识形态潮流中提取出任何成就。事实上，意识形态是一个太光荣的词，无法描述推动该地区政治的暗流。宗派主义、部落主义和地区主义都从内部蚕食着国家，在一些阿拉伯国家播下了分裂甚至解体的种子，在某些情况下还导致了明显的主权丧失。

Perhaps even more devastating has been the role that radical Is­lam has played in the politics of the area. For a long time (certainly since the 1980s), Islam was seen as the all-encompassing trans­national ideology that had successfully challenged Arab national­isms hold on the loyalty of the people of the area. Echoing the same discourse used by Arab nationalism, political Islam preached bringing all Muslims together into one political entity, under the just and equitable tenets of Islamic doctrine.29
content_units.azure_translation: 也许更具破坏性的是激进伊斯兰教在该地区政治中所扮演的角色。很长一段时间以来（当然是自 1980 年代以来），伊斯兰教被视为包罗万象的跨国意识形态，成功地挑战了阿拉伯民族主义，抓住了该地区人民的忠诚度。与阿拉伯民族主义使用的相同话语相呼应，政治伊斯兰教宣扬在伊斯兰教义的公正和公平原则下，将所有穆斯林聚集为一个政治实体29。

content_units.text: By 2015, there indeed was an Islamic state, created on lands previously held by Syria and Iraq, which purported to be the springboard for a universal Islamic state. But justice and equity was not part of the policies, behavior, or discourse of this bar­baric and blood drenched caliphate. Hope, of course, springs eternal, and moderate Muslims, such as those who had engaged the nationalists in vibrant debate in the twentieth century, could still reclaim the doctrine that has been hijacked by the militants. But that is becoming an increasingly forlorn hope, for in truth, so far in the twenty-first century, it is the militants enshrining violence, not the moderates preaching conciliation, who seem to have won the day.
content_units.azure_translation: 到 2015 年，确实出现了一个伊斯兰国家，在叙利亚和伊拉克以前拥有的土地上建立，据称是建立一个普遍伊斯兰国家的跳板。但正义和公平并不是这个野蛮而血腥的哈里发的政策、行为或话语的一部分。当然，希望是永恒的，温和的穆斯林，比如那些在20世纪与民族主义者进行激烈辩论的人，仍然可以夺回被激进分子劫持的教义。但这正成为一种越来越渺茫的希望，因为事实上，在二十一世纪到目前为止，似乎赢得胜利的是武装分子在崇尚暴力，而不是宣扬和解的温和派。

content_units.text: Arab nationalism was hardly free of blame when it came to in­stigating conflict. The so called Arab Cold War of the 1950s and 1960s was in many ways the result of the Nasir-led Arab national­ist assault on recalcitrant, status-quo Arab states.30 But the Cold War then could hardly be compared with the Arab condition of the twenty-first century, characterized as it has been by disintegrat­ing states, wholesale human rights abuses, seemingly irreparable fissures in the fabric of society, and pervasive unbridled barbarism.
content_units.azure_translation: 阿拉伯民族主义在煽动冲突方面几乎不能无罪。1950年代和1960年代的所谓阿拉伯冷战在许多方面是纳西尔领导的阿拉伯民族主义者对顽固的、维持现状的阿拉伯国家进行攻击的结果。30但当时的冷战很难与21世纪的阿拉伯状况相提并论，其特点是国家解体、大规模侵犯人权、 社会结构中看似无法弥补的裂痕，以及无处不在的肆无忌惮的野蛮行为。

content_units.text: The idea of an all-encompassing Muslim entity has been a recurrent theme in Islamic political thought. The notion of one Muslim community, al-Umma al-Islamiya, supersed­ing ethnic and/or linguistic loyalties is accepted by moderate as well as militant Muslims, and as this book shows had been a major point of contention with the Arab nationalists. See Dawisha, Arab Nationalism in the Twentieth Century, pp. 8485; 101103.
